Note: Inky purple. Very aromatic. Jammy black fruit. Still young for without exotic nose. Moderate acidity and grainy tannin. Good wine but not yet great.
Intense, powerful and gentle together, based on Nero d'Avola with Syrah and Petit Verdot, needs to be stored some more years, black berries

Milky smooth tannins, fantastic body (like a good Burgundy) and aromas of dark fruits. 
Quit vegetal and earthy. Probably the best Nero d’Avola I had.
Leather and oak, pepper on the nose. Spicy and dry but well balanced tannins, earthy and rich at start and blueberry in the finish and smooth. Great wine you chew while you drink
Rich tobacco notes from this Nero D'Avelo blend. Tannins are firm from French Oak aging   Long finish courtesy of excellent wine making. The black pepper spice wasn't bad either
Intense tobacco and leather notes. Lovely on the palate. Exceptional lingering complex flavors. Oak comes through like a kind old uncle. Then the heat fondles you seductively. Lovely.

Italian masterpiece. Rich and smooth, silky and deep. Plays a while in your mouth leaving a lovely aftertaste. Hints of cherry, black pepper and prunes. Medium body and tannins, moderate acidity, fantastic balance. One of the best reds from Italy I have ever tried and definitely the best from Sicily. Must try.

Powerful and intense, dark ruby. Lovely nose of cherry, tobacco, blackberry.

Intense on the palate, balsamic, dark cherry, vanilla, earthy notes. Long finish, powerful

Careful, should be decanted, has quite some sediments

A beauty and I am no big fan of Nero d Avola, but this one is top

This wine starts with an inviting and intense bouquet of caramelized cassis, mocha and underbrush aromas.
The dense palate doles out stewed prune, chocolate truffle, licorice and sweet pipe tobacco scents alongside velvety tannins.
Graceful , long lasting finale and overall balance.
This is what separates excellent from good wines!

What a treat! Dark ruby red with purple rim. Amazing aromas of raspberries. Burst of black cherry, ripe raspberry and some licorice. Full bodied and bold. Medium to soft silky tannins. Leather and a loooooong long lasting taste... woah thats long! Worth every penny and amazing how its not  a DOC but an IGT wine. This wine is a serious competitor with blue chip premier wine costing over the €100 mark
A unique Italian blend.  Notes of dark berries, anise, leather, tobacco and spices.  Tannins are very smooth for the age of this wine.

Appearance: medium ruby red colour

Bouquet: very attractive and pleasant nose showing aromas of red and black fruits, liquorice 

Palate: full bodied , velvety mouthfeel ; moderate acidity and tannins , rich notes of prunes, black raspberries,
Blackberries and liquorice . Long finish

2012 Donnafugata Mille e una Notte iconic red wine, mainly Nero d'Avola with some Petit Verdot and Syrah, does not disappoint... if anything it still blows me a way with its silky elegance and overall regal presence. The tannins are shockingly already completely integrated (2012 is a great vintage) with an intermix of winter truffles, ripe blueberries and touch of chicory... only had to let it decant for 1/2 hour and once I checked on it the wine was already singing.
Only reason it wasn’t a five stare is because they didn’t finish building the mansion on the label! A truly special wine!
91 pts. Deep crimson red. Very elegant black cherry blueberry and some herbs. Full body subtle tannins and very long finish
Absolutely amazing. Fruity, complex with a red Berry bouquet
Smooth, berries, with a hint of spice...good nero.  Never disappoints...
Really nice Nero D’Avola! Really enjoyable! Dark cherries, blueberry and hints of chocolate.
Well rounded excellent with steak Rossini
Sicily!! Tiered of barolo,brunelo chianti try this woow!!
Tar, black cherry, black pepper, asphalt, spices, 90-91
Outstanding and elegant nose
New house, what a better occasion to open a wonderful bottle like this one...
Fantastic. Eyes, nose, balance, finish
Dark berries, earth and ashes, leather. Smooth structure. Loooong finish.
Terrific balance of mild tannins and velvety, smooth consistency. Enjoyed with basil-based appetizer; tasted hints of cranberry and plum fruits.
Yes! Now er are talking! Very rich and full bodied wine! By far the best one in Sicilia so far. I very much recomend this wine! You need some good food with this one.
A beast of a wine
4,5 excellent
Smooth Criminal
Medium to full body. Blue and red berries, hint of cocoa on the nose. Hint of chalk, dark red berries. A bit simple. Had at da marco ($150)
Wonderful Nero d’Avola. Big expression of ripe fruit. Intense and full-bodied, round and well integrated tannins. Lingering finish.
Deep colour. Heaps of black fruit and oak. Spicy (black pepper) finish. Excellent wine that probably needs a few more years to integrate the oak
Oak aging served well for this wine. Made it round but not dominating. Heavy wine with floral notes which makes it interesting. Very round and full bodied finish.
Stewed red berries on the nose that continue to the palate.  Stronger tannins mellow as the wine opens.  Recommend decanting at least 45 minutes before serving.
Smooth at first, then the acid comes. Full body with a lot of flavor. I had it at LaGriglia in Houston
Development  is good, still looking the balance, but very good and honest product
Profound, black fruit, tobacco, super velvety
Magnifique! Full body. Great structure. Intense in flavor of blueberry. Smooth but powerful.
One of the best Sicilians

A perfectly balanced wine that transports you to the Apennine peninsula. If there is a wine out there that tastes more "Italian" I would love to taste it. I can't fault it on anything, but I did get tired of it. Almost undrinkable on its own and amazingly suboptimal pairings. Its merits are obvious, but I wouldn't buy again at this price.

Deep purple colour. Strong aroma of new oak, toasted cedar, dark berries. Medium acid, full body, fruit driven style. Modern international style. Very new world. Not the best representation of Nero d’Avola.

If vivinoers are right, I’m in for a treat! Don’t drink much Sicilian but the rating caught my eye! Very nice nose of cherry, cocoa, blackcurrent and leather. On the palate, southern Italy delivers! High acidity, smooth but bold tannins, cocoa flavor, medium length! Extremely nice at 4.2 🌟. Well done team Vivino!

Beautiful wine. Hints of licorice and mint entwined with sweet spices. Black cherries, ripe blackcurrant and sweet blueberries all shown off with a great balance and a beautiful elegance on the mouth and I can ensure it's a wine that gives more emotions on the palate rather than on the nose which is still nice and ample.

A great red, cassis, oak and leather. Super bold and tannic even after breathing for an hour prior to decanting. The body is consistent and velvety. There’s also some mint ant liquorice on the nose. A rather complex and interesting sensory experience
Probably not the best vintage here but still a great choice. Plummy even if slightly too tannic and woody.
Old. Nose: nuts, veg., coffee. Mouth: prune, veg., nice prunny after. Balance is tannic, med acc, med+ body.
Superb !!!! 🔝👏
Super!!!

Fruity aroma on the nose. Dark and matured color in the glass. Light and unsweetened taste from the first sip. It took a few sips to really get the depth of it and then you won’t stop drinking. Stable and memorable taste.
Overrated in my opinion
Big wine! Do this!
Mistlurar Nero Davola grape . Fullbodied and balanced.
My rating is 4.2.
92 red fruits, supple, round, mouth filling, tanic.
medium tannins, good vanilla, good finish.
Compared to the Tancredi im not super impressed. A bit lacking in complexity
Deep, rich and extremely enjoyable. My favorite Sicilian wine.
Quite delightful. Strangely enough, tastes like Estonian blueberry wine, without the bite.
Delicious wine, dark, chewy, super fruity. Brooding but beautiful.
With the twins, in honor of Feb. 1. They charged us $175 for it at Strip House but it worked.
Good one, medium body, red to black fruits, acidic enough.
typical nero d‘avola. nice sweet taste. needed air, but then very nice!
Beautiful wine, a dream
Inky black! Very good quality. Wish I kept it 10 more years.
Probably the closest THK g to a Bordeaux from Sicilia ! This wine is huge and needs time!

High acid, good rosso. It would be great pairing with italian food.
very nice!! nice cherry and deep flavour
Wonderfully tasting Sicilian red.  A little pricey but a favorite at our tasting of 23 different Sicilian wines.
The Lady owner of the winery and creator is a nice persona! So this wine is what characterizes her best!
Absolutely wondeful, rich aroma, rounded full taste, plenty of fine nuances... real pleasure to enjoy
To start, very refreshing and juicy, ending on almost bitter (but not bitter) blackberries and earth (but not farmy like some southern Rhône wines). Delicious and ending with an edgy twist.
Absolutely amazing red wine ! Proud of my Bella Sicily

One of the best siciliano wines. Oak notes.

Very flavourful.  Probably one of the best Sicilian wines.

Carbone March 2018. Excellent wine

Thousand and one night, the iconic red of this great estate. This needs aging like truly great Bordeaux and is made with no less ambition.

A blend of Nero d’Avola, PV and Syrah. Very complex nose with scents of leather, cloves, cigar box and various red fruit tones. 

Med+ tannic and acids. Already very nice, balanced and very elegant, very decent 13,5% abv. Long finish. 18 pts @ Francoise. Keep 5 years.

Interesting wine - on one end it is extremely well made and an outstanding wine. The thing that bothers us is that the flavors are a bit vanilla to us. 

Iconic Nero d'Avola from Sicily.

Full of black cherry, plum, Med herb, sweet cedar, with a touch of perfume and pepper. Fine grained tannins and an intense, long finish. Lots of polish and some international flair from the touch of Syrah and Petit Verdot

This is oustanding wine technically, but it tastes like it could have been constructed anywhere

Nero d'Avola like you would have never expected. This is a brilliant bottle of wine. Nearly black, very dense, dominating plums and very long.
Red ruby wine, with strong intensity of berries aromas. Robust body but balanced tannins. Feelings of chocolate with basilicum and cherry.

An exquisite and refined Nero d'Avola deep red with new leather on the nose and ripe plums with a hint of spice on the plate. Tannins ever so soft. Remarkable
Top of the wines at Donnafugata. Intense and rich with blackberry and chocolate character with hints of hazelnuts. Silky integrated tannins. Classy and polished wine.
Green notes green pepper dirt soil earth mint green veg dry fruit.  Dry med acid green stems gripping tannins dry dry dry med complexity funky very interesting.
It's been a while I had this last time... this time it is ready, complex, big, but delicate, with earthy and leather aromas, cedar, smoked wood, black currant and dusty plums. Beautiful wine

Full bodied yet elegant. Flavours of  plum and dark fruit. Complex yet accessible.

If u can this well discounted sub 40chf a bottle it is ver good value for money. But even if not u still buying a phenominal wine. Rich. Powerful. Yet still well balanced
Divine! Deep ruby colour. Soft and supple but with a backbone. Perfume on the nose with raspberries, and plums. Plum jam comes through on the finish with a bit of cherry-like acidity.
I have to admit: this southern Italy red is incredibly good. Dense and with loads of darf fruit, but not overdonne or overripe. Good structure, even enough acidity and velvety tannins.

After a year again tried again. Has not changed. Furthermore, a really big South Italian with all its power is nevertheless very elegant. Perfect for stub chicks with fresh pasta.

4.3* still very young. Dark fruit, tobacco, spices. Grippy tannins, medium+ acidity, very concentrated. Promising future ahead 👌🤩 cheers🍷
My first Nero d'avola. Wild and strong, full of fur, animal and earthy tones, yet well balanced acidity with medium to long dry pleasant finish.
4.3 Nero d’avola. Blackberries, plums, mocha, chocolate and spicy peppery note, lavish oak. Tannins are there but play a side note. Delicious
4.5 - very smooth full bodied Sicilian red. Luscious & soft. Blackcurrant & plum. Easy drinking but not overly complex. Dark red to the rim.

Bought this bottle at the Idealwine auction, this wine was in my Wishlist for a long time. Intensive fruity aroma - black currant, blackberry, black cherry, prune, chocolate, dried rose, earthy baking spice, vanilla and cola. On the palate, the wine is concentrated with pleasant tannins, present acidity, light sweetness, black cherry, plum and prune, long aftertaste of prune, cassis, and chocolate. A well made wine, but no surprises - my expectations were higher. 4.3-4.4🌟, Vivino is just right!

92/100 Outstanding! 
Impenetrable crimson color. Rich cassis and dark fruit and oak internationally packaged. Massive puckering tannins and high acidity. Good balance and length. Do not hurry up to drink!

Very intense inky ruby red colour. A blend of Nero d'Avola, Petit Verdot, Syrah and some other indignious varietals. Strong black fruits nose, cigar box, and violets. Dry,  very high acidity, velvety tannins, high alcohol, prune, black plums, blackberry and dark cherry and spices on the palate. Complex and long finish.

Served blind. Blueberry, plum, blackberry, cedar, crushed pepper, grippy tannins... It felt like a syrah with tannins structure of a CS.
Couldn't believe it was a N'd'avola from Sicily. Very well made with many more years left.

(4,3) What a dark, inky colour! Concentrated smell of ink, flowers, black cherries, leather and tobacco. Thick, but with nice freshness. Concentrated flavours of smoke, tobacco, leather, ashes, rosemary, plums, cherries, coffee, chocolate. @Hosman Freres, Vlaardingen tasting
Next tasting one year later. Still fresh and fruity. Right after the opening lots of oak that disappears over the time. Some more years to be stored in the cellar.

A blend of mostly Nero d'Avola adding some Petit Verdot, Syrah and a few other grapes. Deep Ruby with aromas of dark berry fruits, sweet notes and spicy scents. On the palate flavors of blackberry and black cherry, currant like, with notes of cacao, licorice and sweet spice, well balanced with acidity. Fine tannins, long finish, ending with fruit, tobacco and sweet earthy character. Very nice!

My wife gifted me this stunning wine on our first anniversary and immediately after we enjoyed it, I knew I had to get a half case of the 08 to see how it developed over the next decade. I'm pleased to report that nearly 3 years on, it has evolved considerably.

An evocative and intense bouquet of black cherry, tobacco, cocoa and aniseed is mirrored on the palate with ripe cherry, baked raspberry and menthol spice. Medium plus body and acidity, unbelievable structure and complexity. Finessed and nuanced.

Leather, tobacco, Forrest floor with dusty mushroom tones on the nose. 
Medium body with chocolate, plum and blueberry. 
Dry and fruity finish.
Second wine opened at volcanic Kim's first time as the wineclub host. Tastes of blackberry, leather and pepper. A robust yet elegant drink.
I tasted again and I’m happy to share with you that I found it more silky and in the proper moment for tasting. Enjoy it!
Just wonderful!!   Some mild plum and dark fruits with a hint of tobacco.   Well done and complex.
In the nose:Oaky, black fruit, jammy  on palate: mid + tannin, mid - acid, good structure,fruity, long finish, round, lil'bit too oaky
4.3. At Trinacria with Jacob & Lizzie. Oak, cigar, leather, salt licorice, rubber, asphalt. Smoke, ash. Dark fruit. Tannic. Blackcurrant. Very interesting! Pencil shavings
This is very good, deep and dark, rich with blackberries and chocolate tobacco with hints of plum and oak. Yet smoother than expected, elegant and refined. Just wow.
Good
Very good wine.
One of the best sicilian bold oak blackberry 2015 4.4
Sicilian Nero D’Avola at its best... tannins prominently present, leather and blueberries. Medium finish. Excellent acidity, bold and elegant.
Excellent, excellent, excellent. Ripe cherry, cinnamon and black pepper. Intense aroma!

Medium tannins, fruity
Perfect for Valentines, for a passion like in 1001 nights
Once again great wine from The home land!

Dry, dark, blackcurrant.
Vanilla, oak, plum, can’t wait to try this with meat

Black cherries, plums, coffee.
Great nose of a big wine but surprisingly easy drinking. Loved it.
Well worth the rating.
Still young but delightful. Bright fruit tannins strong tangy acidity. Superb with pasta. A great vintage of a perennial fave.
Great wine - best value and all about richness and fruit with long finish
Expand minds! Rich and full body.
Tannins still a little harsh but clear this is a quality wine and one to definitely look to cellar for future consumption. Plenty of promise.
Wonderful very full bodied.
4,4 - just lovely Cicilian wine…

Opaque purple with light ocher tint  in disk 
Nose: vanilla, fried meat, citrus notes, after licorice and may be violet 
Taste: clearly prune and plum jam with pip bitterness and sun dried viburnum in finish 
Hi acidity and alcohol, powerful smooth tannins 
5 more years potential. 
Hedonistic level medium plus 8)

dd12 clean deep red dark friuts spices touch of herbs nice secondary leather woods mushroom smoke cold herbs ham flavour and nice sweet friuts chocolate ending good length delicious
very good with oxtail.

Incredibly complex masculine red! Smokey nose, rich of leather, red berries and some violet hints. Soft tannins, balsamic and full body, coffee and dark chocolate in mouth, dried figs and a bit spicy. Very long finish but not impressive aftertaste. The best interpretation of nero d'avola that I've ever tasted.

Back To Black (Amy Winehouse) At least once a year I grab a bottle of this deep, intense ruby red, 100% Nero d’Avola. And this one I decanted it for roughly one hour. In the glass, it released a rich bouquet of chocolate, eucalyptus, and dark berries and blackberry jam. In the mouth, this 2005 Mille e Una Notte was smooth and warm, with deep balsamic herbs, licorice, almonds and more berries backed by friendly tannins. A very voluptuous, full-bodied wine with a persistently long finish.

Fantastic!! 
One of the best reds I had on sicily. 
Even though I am not the biggest fan of the grape (since it tends to be very opulent and just a tick too sweet for me), thisone was just perfect. A great mix of herbal sweetness, oak and dark fruit (plum and black cherry). 
Amazing drinking flow.. 
hope to find a bottle here in austria

4.5⭐️
Fantastic south Italy wine. Pride of Sicily. Black cherry color. Very intense. Excellent balance. 14% and high density but easy drinkable and I can call it tasty. Black cherry, plum, leather, blackberries, earthy, vanilla. Nice long finish. No felt acidity. 🍷🍷🍷🍷👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Colour :Deep ruby red colour.
Personality: Remarkable.
Structure:Very complex.
On nose : Aroma from Eiden garden flowers.
On palate: Magic berries,tobacco and plum.
Aftertaste: Endless fruity taste.
My advice: Try as soon as possible.
Cheers.
A name to remember. This rivals Northen and central Italian heavyweights terms of cost performance but still relatively less known around the world.
Pleasantly surprised by the quality, excellent nose with liquorice, coffee, vanilla and plum, lush and medium length. Good value.
Best wine of the trip. To drink at an amazing restaurant overlooking Ragusa captures the ambience of the town in the wine. Yum!
Jewel from Sicilia, this Nero d'Avola is noble and complex symphony of spices, chocolate, soft tannins and black berries. Absolute pleasure.
A wine that still has potential for aging. Deep red, with full nose, black cherries, blackberries, dark chocolate, pepper and leather. In taste ripe, blackberry jam, pepper, leather and tobacco.

This dark, enticing red sports layers of kirsch and cassis, with moderate grip. This remains fresh, though, as juicy acidity pumps out layers of fruit, underbrush and ash on the long finish. Drink now.
In the mouth it is full, enveloping, warm and tannic, with spicy and fruity notes at the end.
Etna's most adorable nero d'avola with medium hight acidity and intensity with flower notes and cloves. Stewed blackberries and earthy notes like forest floor.
I absolutely loved this wine, incredible Nero, lots of dark ripe fruits, leather, cocoa, blackberries, cherry, Smoke, earth, just all around an incredible wine!

blind tasting 
this is my favorite kind of wine, full of cherry, spicy feel on the nose, 
blackthorn, bramble, spices on the palate, grape rachis in the aftertaste
Very bold, blackberry, blueberry strong notes on the nose and mouth. Also leather, oak, pepper. Some tannins, but not a lot. All in all, very good wine.
Very nice Sicilian red. Ready to drink now, full bodied but not overpowering, nice plum aromas dominate for a pleasant drink. No imperfections, it’s well balanced.
Nice, fruity
heavy complex
Very Nice!!

Very high quality wine. Very rich, with dominant ripe grapes. In the nose these are combined with woody flavors, vanilla and cinnamon. The taste follows up with this, it is very deep and long, the rich grapes caress your mouth with their velvety texture.

4.3/5. Jammy dark cherries, graphite (dusty gravel?), violet, cassis, cocoa, vanilla, sweet spices, hints of bay leaves

Full body, rich and punchy. Medium acidity. Fine dusty chewy tannins. 

Decant in bottle for about 45 mins

Deep colour, almost black. Aromas of smoke, blackberries, burnt coffee beans, hint of vanilla. On the palate, medium + acidity, full body and medium+ alcohol, tannins are strong but smooth, long finish. This is delightful and one of my favourite wines. Not many people know the varieties of nerello capuccio and negroamaro (from sicily) but this is both elegant and concentrated, the balance is great.

Appearance: deep purple, clear. 
Nose: developing, medium (+) intens, clean condition. Aromas of black fruit, bramble, liquorice, tobacco, hint of fig, earthy minerality, sweet spices, black pepper. 
Palate: dry, medium (+) acidity, medium (+) tannins, fully bodied, medium (+) finish. Added aromas to nose of tar, vanilla and cinnamon. 
Assessment: outstanding wine. Potential for aging. Rich voluptuous wine. Nicely balanced. Well layered.
Strong taste, complex structure, soft tanine. I like - but not overhelmed yet....glad I have others left to get used to it:-)

Appearance: Deep intensity and color Purple. At the nose, the intensity is Pronounced. Primary aromas of Ripe fruit, Red fruit (Strawberry, Cherry), Herbal (Eucalyptus), Spice (Licorice), secondary aromas of Vanilla, Wood, Smoke, and tertiary aromas of Meaty, Leather. At the palate is Dry, High acidity, High tannin, Medium alcohol, Full body. Flavor intensity is Pronounced and can be found Red fruit, Vanilla with a Long finish. Overall, the wine can be considered as Very good +. Need to age some more years.

🇮🇹 About we good as Nero d’Avola gets!

👁 Deep Ruby

👃 Impressively and deeply aromatic with notes of balsamic, leather, chocolate, sweet tobacco and dark fruits including blueberry and blackberry. Fresh and ripe.

👄 Rounded yet powerful yet sleek. Big structure with silky tannins and good acidity. Full bodied and luscious. Lots of crunchy dark fruits and touch of vanilla on the palate. Deep and long finish. Probably the best Nero d’Avola anywhere. Big love.

Pure black currant, than slowly herbs come up, Rosmarin, basilic. Smooth, elegant, pure currant and then the smoked tannins, which are going to require a certain time.  Overall a balanced beautiful fruity wine. I m a fan

Text book Nero D'avola whith a drop of Petit Verdot & Syrah, from Sicily. The ageing takes place for 14 months. Comes with a great structure and complexity, notes dominated by tipical ripe fruit aromas, prunes, cocoa, leather, balsamic and floral notes. Feels great in the mouth, alcohol perfectly hidden by those finely polished tannin, great balance, good acidity and long afterlaste. This is a wine to revisit.
Greatness starts from the nose! Full plum and red cherry. Great tannins and long long finish. Dark ruby and herbs and licorice. A big A+ for sure. All worth it's money!
Crafted mainly with Nero d’Avola with a splash of Syrah and Petit Verdot, this is an amazing red that drinks and looks like a posh Pinot Noir. JS96.
Super intense fruit on the nose and palate. Lots of black fruit and an amazingly long finish. Bought in Donna Fugata in 2015.

Earthy tertiary notes for this mature nero d'avola. Soft tannins. Woody tones, chocolate, ripe dark berries. Alcohol and acidity in good balance. Elegant.

Full bodied, high acidity cooked strawberry, plum, sweet spices, black pepper.

Powerful, tannic and heavy wine with lots of oak, dried fruit, black fruit, balsamic notes and tobacco.

Beautiful wine that unfortunately I drank way too young.
Great concentration without any sweetness. Becoming savoury. Lots  of lovely balsamic notes underpinned by lively acidity. Best Nero D'avola that's passed my lips...
On the nose fresh ripe berries, light hints of oak, lovely cherry. On the palate, explosion of fruits, hints of Vanilla, Roasted bell peppers. Full body, grippy tannins. Wonderful wine!

I tasted this in Eataly in Milan in August last year. It was magnificent, a dark deep red ruby colour and a complex and intriguing aromatic style. A remarkably perfumed nose, good dark fruits and structure and a long finish. Very enjoyable.

The countdown to  Southern Italy Red Ambassador continues with this Nero d'Avola led blend from Sicily which sees some ageing in oak barriques. Petit Verdot, Syrah & "other grapes" complete the mix. Uncorked 2 hours in advance as suggested on the Donnafugata website. What a beauty of a wine this is.👀 Deep dark cherry red with purple rim.👃cigar box, leather, earthy cherry & berry fruits with layers of violets, liquorice & menthol.👅dry, med+ acidity & body with a hefty 14% abv & silky tannins. Deep ruby, intense nose with blackberry, plum, cassis, vanilla, cloves, caramel, leather, smoke. Off dry, mid acidity, full body, intense palate with blackberry, blueberry, vanilla, balsamic notes, kakao, licorice. Long finish.

Incredibly smooth and velvet, without being too heavy, tannic, or having high alcohol. M+ body, M smooth tannins, M acidity, dry. 
🎯 4,8

Aroma👃🏼 black berries, black fruits, black plum, chocolate, vanilla, balsamic, black cherry, cocoa, prune.

Cheers 🍷

Heard that this wine is one of the best Nero d'Avola from Sicily... (believe or not 🙄 just a sommelier's opinion.)

Strong pepper and tobacco at the top nose, and following leather, minerals and juicy blackberries and cherry notes.

Color is deep red. Alcohol is regular which has regular viscosity, and has low tannins. Body is medium-low, acidity is high. 

Nice juicy & earthy & spicy balance. Liked the structure.

Happy White ...ooh, wait a second Red Wine Wednesday! Thanks @[1|14868566|Steve Standbridge] for inviting us to join Zoom session devoted to Red Sicilian wines with other Vivino-ers.

Deep ruby colour. Nose is full of herbal notes, mint, eucalyptus, earthy touch, liquorice, violet with bramble, black cherry, blackberry. Yummy! 

Palate has a much more intense blackberry with black plum. Dry, med+ acidity, grippy medium+ but pleasant tannins, high alcohol and med+ body. Long finish! Very lovely stuff that is!

Well, it's saturday and DWTHYWD (right @[1|947778|Mike Benson]?)

Seems to be nero d'Avola ,syrah, petite verdot "and others". Full bodied. Nicely structured

Not my go-to region or style but this one from Donnafugata is terrific. Drinks well but will be develop great over time. 4,2-4,3⭐

This absolutely one of the best red I have tasted from Siciliano. I still remember this from one of our trips to this beautiful island, but not that this is a so high class red.
Color: deeep brown red
Nose: really pleasant and intense notes of blackberry and raisins 
Taste :Full-bodied, soft and juicy with rounded tannins and notes of black berries, licorice and cocoa.

Great Nero d'Avola from Sicily. Deep ruby red in color. Dark fruit, licorice, chocolate and tobacco notes on the nose. Full-medium bodied, silky tannins, balanced acidity, complex on the palate with long persistent finish.

Bright ruby color with the scent of red licorice, eucalyptus, and brushy herbs. Lean and tightly wound on the palate, with a body of raw cranberries and crushed anise seed and ample drying tannins. Exquisite with veal-eggplant Parmigiana, which married beautifully with the wine’s taut acidity and anisette bitterness. Excellent now but likely outstanding in 3 to 5 years. Nero d’Avola and other varieties | 13% abv | $89 (sample)

👀 deep ruby color

👃 notes of mulberry, blackberry, earth, tobacco 🚬 , dark chocolate 🍫 and leather, hints of spices, smoke and cocoa

👅 the taste is dry and balanced, with hints of blackberry, black cherry 🍒, black currant, prunes,
cocoa, leather, oak 🌳 and tobacco 🚬, with nuances of spices and earth, acidity above average, silky tannins, long aftertaste

Dark ruby turning to garnet with the age. This interesting wine with an interesting name has a good nose of dry or preserved apricot, dark fruit, tobacco, liquorice and balsamic notes. On the palate, plum, cherry along with leather and star anise spice notes. Good acidity and medium plus body. Tannins are medium plus, bit on the chewy side. Long and savory finish with a hint of Caramel lingering at the end. Should be great with food but good as is.

Great zoom chat with a lovely group; thanks to @[1|14868566|Steve Standbridge] for organising. The theme was Sicilian reds. Our choice was a top quality wine from the highly esteemed Donnafugata.

👁 deep ruby. 👃 black cherry, lots of earthy and herbal notes, then blackberry, bramble, leather, violet and licorice.

Dry. Med+ body & acidity. High, but smooth, alcohol. Stunningly beautiful, velvety but slightly grippy tannins. 👅 lots of intense black cherry, plum, black pepper & tobacco. Long spicy finish.👍🇮🇹🍷

4.5 Donnafugata is a very important winery in my wine-life. So you can imagine why I was so eager to taste this iconic wine. For a long time I was refusing to buy it, partially because of the fear to be disappointed in this pre-Etna wine. But we must face our fears, so I took a bottle with depicted Queen Maria Carolina refugee place and... enjoyed it :) >>>
Amazing wine for the money, cherries, dark fruit, and soft tannins that last, experience the bouquet and taste together is really a great wine for the money.
Blackberries, dried fruit, green pepper, pepper, balsamic, tobacco, menthol. Good and well balanced Nerro d’Avola, tannins not ripe yet, but needs to be aged a bit.

Vanilla, berries, spices and mushrooms notes, mild and velvety tannins, berries and vanilla in taste.

Great nose of dark fruit and pepper. Enjoyed immensely.
This is really an amazing wine. What a. Experience. It is great to see how the south of italy produces such greatness!
Bold and balanced. Oak, plum and dominated by secondary notes. Just makes a 4.5.

Donnafugata Tasting #5 Mille e Una Notte Contessa Entellina, their flagship red! Blend of Nero d’Avola, Petit Verdot, Syrah, 14m in new French oak 👁 Deep purple 🎸 👃 Alluring bouquet of violet, blackberry, bramble, black plum, earth, mushroom, liquorice, vanilla, chocolate, mint, black pepper 👅 Dry, high acidity, 13%ABV, v high fine tannin, blackberry, bramble, black plum, vanilla, chocolate, mint on mid-palate, v long black pepper & liquorice finish! Outstanding now 4.6 ⭐️ & will age gracefully for decades!

Colour ruby intense.
Nose: intensity strong, primary aromas characteristics black plums, cassis, black cherry, violet, secondary fumé, chocolate, cedar, tertiary mushrooms, tobacco, earth, wet leafs.

It’s an excellent wine, suitable for bottle ageing.

high rating not because it was such an outstanding wine. it is. The alcohol & tannins could've been more integrated.  But the high rating is more about how I was captivated by the singular experience

Very good wine. A lot of tobacco, and earthy notes at the beginning in the palate. Then you start to feel beriies like blackberries, blackcurrant with addition of balsamic notrs. In the noose, it smells like wet earth. Velvet tannins, which become stronger to the end. Middle acidity in the end.

Donnafugata’s iconic red wine delivers! At an outstanding tour and tasting at their cellars in Marsala, this is Mille e una Notte, a blend of mostly Nero D’Avola with a bit of petit Verdot and Syrah added. Grapes from the Contessa Entellina area. 
Enticing nose of ripe blackberry, black cherry, and licorice. 
The palate adds balsamic and tobacco with a med-full, nearly high-acid structure. Tannins are sexy and developing. Creamy texture. 
Long finish. 
Bought a bottle to hopefully leave for a decade.
🇮🇹👌🍷😎

Pale ruby, lots of legs and staining

Nose is clean with medium plus aromas of cherry dark fruit eucalyptus fennel smoke smoked meats vanilla cedar

Palate is dry high tannin high acid medium alcohol medium body. Medium plus flavors of cherry vanilla and fennel

Finish is long. Very balanced and will obviously hold up to age

If I was tasting this blind I would have sworn the nose was straight from Bordeaux’s right bank. Cassis, raspberry, graphite, leather and just a little vanilla. Ripe black fruit is massive on the palate and the very slightly dusty tannins are smooth and resolved. Spiced finish of molasses and a ghostly hint of violet. Absolutely delicious, if I hadn’t known I’d have said this was the best Pomerol I’d had in ages 😅 92-93

Garnet, black color. Noses of herbs, dry grass, wood, citrus, burnt sugar, cellar wood. Medium body, strong acidity, dry with limited length. Drank September 2016. Need another 4-5 years of cellaring. Good promise

Top class Nero d'Avola! Pronounced, concentrated aromas of black cherry, blackcurrant dried fruits, balsamic notes, vanilla, chocolate, graphite. High acidity, high tannins, high alcohol, bold body. Long, pleasant finish. You can drink it now, but is should be even better in some years.

Superb Nero D'AVOLA. Intense and complex aroma of red berries and black berries. Spicy notes, eucalyptus and balsamic. Color is also very intense and brilliant. Taste is very strong and concentrated yet balanced by its juicy acids. Tannines are already fine and integrated but clearly still present. It's very drinkable at the moment but can aged for another 3 to 5 years. Highly recommended. Had this one with a nice pork ragu at restaurant Majore in Sicily. They have an impressive wine list. Food traditional.

93/100, this 2005 Mille e una Notte needs more time. After 2 hrs decanting it started to open up but I would recommend another 5 years in the bottle. You can however already feel and taste its complexity and finesse. This undoubtedly is a wine with great future potential.

Blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Nero di Avola and Syrah.
Medium ruby color.

13.5%

A blend of Nero d'Avola, Petit Verdot, Syrah and other grapes. Ruby red coloured, the Donnafugata Mille e Una Notte has an ample and enveloping bouquet characterized by fruity notes of mulberry and blackberry, and balsamic and spicy scents (nutmeg). In the mouth, it is soft and full-bodied and amazes with the great finesse of its tannins. Extraordinary persistence on the finish.

In the glass the wine is charming you with an intense pomegranate colour. The aroma is rich and complex comprising oak, chocolate,  cherry and coffee. The wine is bold and fruity with cherry, raisin, honey and berry jam on the palate. Acidity is pleasant and the tannins are strong and quite soft at the same time. An intriguing experience.

My very first Sicilian red - amazing! 
Deep ruby Color
Distinctive on the nose, from the moment it pours in to glass. Cherry jam, oak, plum, vanilla, prune, followed by flower bouquet, perfume, then it flow to menthol, mint, pepper, bay leaf, and hint of earthy & forest floor notes 
Super balanced & concentrated on the palate,mineral, savoury on the beginning but turns into fruity while it opens up. Dusty tannin, holds it well 
Def worth a high 4 rating👏👏👏

Wow, what a wine I just had. I discovered it by luck and yes curiosity sometimes pays you of. I have just ordered another two bottles before even posting this comment. Mmm, what I just had..a solid 4.4 red wine from Sicily with intense ruby red colour. Smells like a fresh bouquet of flowers with fruity notes of blackberry, tobacco, oak, chocolate, balsamic (liquorice) and spicy scents. The palate is soft and embracing with extraordinary silky smooth tannins and a remarkable aftertaste. Should I write more?

Beautiful new discovery! Notes of tobacco, leather and oak on the nose. Very intense! The palet is more fruity, with notes of plum and cassis. Very bold wine with high tannins and yet very smooth. To be repeated!

Well structured, elegant and tremendously pleasant Nero D'Avola with fairy name Mille e Una Notte. Medium + body, medium - acidity and extraordinary silky tannins. Notes of dark fruit, blackberry, oak, coffee, tobacco, vanilla, balsamic, spicy, clove, black pepper. Long and lovely finish. 
Decanting for about 30-40 minutes is highly reccomended.
Paired well with juicy rib-eye steak.
My rate 4.4!

3.8 Once this wine was a pretender for Sicily's #1, but thanks to new wave of  winemakers and discovery of Etna Rosso I suppose Donnafugata  wouldn't reach  top 10 nowadays. I'm new to drinking Italian reds, but I agree with the opinion of our company that this wine is still far from its mature age. Aroma of spices, forest black berries. This explosive, all-embracing taste I have not seen before (Priorat is difficult). Powerful immature tannins are accompanied by black berries, black chocolate, spices and something like a confectionery, as finish. long aftertaste. Some imbalance, I think because of age. about the greatest interpretation i've tasted when it comes to using nero d'avola. donnafugata does use some sicily-original varieties next to the nd'a, but less than 15% in the mix. ripe red fruits, cedarwood, cigarres, figs and cinnamon in a very harmonious combination. good now, but a five-star potential when you leave it for 3-5 years in the cellar.

A real quality wine from Sicily with exceptional structure and remarkable personality. Ruby red in the glass, with a tempting sweet aroma and fine balsamic undertone. The palate shows fine floral notes of violets and rounded with a touch of tobacco the lingering finish off. Great wine.

Very interesting wine, exclusive and attractive label. The smell is rich in aromas, the first sip is very tanninish but even through that you'd feel quality and ashberry. Needs decanting. In 30 minutes

This is amongst my favourite labels and arguably a wine that I picked for special moments and that now reminds me of those moments every time I drink it. The wine has matured well since the last tasting and has kept all the red fruits in its opening while a broad set of secondary and tertiary aromas like vanilla, oak, liquorice, leather, tobacco. Tannins are soft and well integrated. No signs of decay and surely good for a few more years.

Had two bottles of the 2012. Treated right, this offers absolute Magic on your tongue. I would say not even the finest Bordeaux and Burgundy I've had match it for complexity, and it's right up there with La Tâche for harmony. I would have given this five stars if I had found the bouquet as good as the mouth. Should easily last 20 years; right now decanting is essential. The best treatment would be to decant 2 hours before drinking; it will still show astonishing development through the course of a meal.

The first glass of Wine in 2021 dedicated to the Donnafugatta vineyard’s Mille una Notte, one of their top class red. Deep Ruby colour, a complex structured Wine with incredible oak nose. Nose of balsamic, letter and oat, every mouthful was like licking the barrel, extremely well balance, spice, dark chocolate, red pepper, dark berries oriented. Lingering with a bouquet of floral and oat in mid palate in finishing. A Supreme wine to start the year!!

Revisiting a couple of years later now worth the extra star. Has developed into an exceptional wine at its price point.

Donnafugata tasting 4/5. Nero d’avola based with 100% new oak aging for 13 month and another 36 months in bottle. Dark and deep on the nose with blackberry, black currant, oak, peppercorn, charcoal. 4.1

Enjoyable but not as iconic on the palate as the price point and this wine’s reputation lead you to expect.  90% Nero d’Avola blended with Petit Verdot and Syrah.  Tasted alongside the 2009 vintage at Donnafugata’s cellar in Marsala.  Greener on the palate as you’d expect but I thought that the structure was good and suggests better ageing potential than the 2009.

This '07 Mille e una notte rocks the cradle! It is an explosive red, loaded with cherry fruit, new leather, eucalyptus, liqorice and violets. On the palate it's voluptuous, deep and rich. Complex and creamy finish. One of Sicily's very best Nero d'Avola's for sure. 16/20
This wine brings back memories of our trip to Sicily. This wine is blackberry, plum, tobacco and cedar. This wine is going, going, gone! 😂
Beautiful. Blackberry, ripe plum, liquorice. Nice length and powerful structure. Excellent super-Sicilian (reminiscent of the super-Tuscans)
Well, this one merits a special mention. Very ele ell equilibrated, balsamic and violet notes , well structured and soft tanins. Great wood .
Outstanding!
Deep dark purple- absolutely beautiful! Smooth oak and leather on the nose. Cherry and raisin as well as wet stone, earthy Forrest floor. Smooth tannins. Big bold dry flavor. Absolutely outstanding.
Aromas of leather, dark ripe fruits(especially plum) tobacco and cocoa ! Pepper,vanilla and sweet spices in the palette! Nice acciditty, velvet tannins! A great wine from Sicily!
I was expecting more for that price. I must admit a good wine, after 10 years still deep black red color, extremely dry aftermouth, but something is missing to be considered great.

4.2pts..a southern Italian blending..

Dark red color with violet toungue. Bouquet from dark berries, tobaco, smoked wood and peppermint. Very nice balanced and smooth longlasting tannins. This will get better!

An outstanding red blend of Nero, Syrah and Petit Verdot that put Sicily on the world map of wine. Also, Donnafugata's red icon. Dark red, cassis, prune, dark cherry, leather, cigar box, oak, vanilla hints, smoky, spicy. Structured. Balanced. Round tannins, M+ alcohol and acidity. Long finish.

Marvelous dark ruby red after 13 years of aging. Basis of blackberry in the mouth capped off with an acidic flavor of balsamic. Not superbly elegant, but considering the winery itself and its general price point, this is indeed a hidden gem in the region from Italy. The nose, after aging and decanting slightly for an hour, is impressive, to say the least. Feels like a double layering of perfume between a floral violet one and a smoky tobacco one. Extremely complex, elegant, balanced, and sophisticated nose
Stewed plum, baked fig, brown molasses, cinnamon, blood oranges, roasted nuts and ripe tomato. Sassafras.  Med+ tann med acid. Fabulous!

Thank you Olivier, sommelier at the very great restaurant Montanari in Stockholm, for this fantastic recommendation. First time I drink a super Sicilian. Cab Franc, Syrah and Nero di Avola. Great wine, tannins, heavy but light, some berries but NOT too much. Eye opener

So far tasted the 2011, 2012 and now the -15 from this wine - and this 2015 must say to be my favorite so far. Round with soft tannins. Tobacco, chocolate and plum with balsamic and spicy scent. Dry and fruity finish. Mainly made of Nero d’Avola.

Big and bold, aromas of black fruits and cedar and menthol tones. Palate: layers of blackberry, dark chocolate, licorice and black pepper. Soft, opulent and full-bodied, a super-Lux Nero d’Avola. Long finish and beautiful, but still quite youthful, needs laying down for a decade to take it to the next level.

More cherries. Seems to be the story of my life these days. Bold and dark ruby; good ol’ Nero rarely lets you down. A tiny touch of (unusual) spice with a hint of cherries. Let me be clear: this is dusty and musty and savoury and chocolatey (?). But it has that unmistakable arid Sicilian vibe. Oh my! It’s only 8:15pm.

amazingly rich dark black red.  really strong dark cherry on the nose. super meaty.  not great with food.  best by itself.  I opened the bottle in the evening and had half the bottle and saved the rest for day 2.  better on day two.

A very interesting wine that was recommend by the waiter . Fully body powerful wine , maybe it’s way to o young ? Intense tannin & spice are the most distinctive flavours , and the spice is different from normal oak spice - something more like natural spice , not as amazing as the waiter described but it may just need decent longer ?

4.2pt. Peppery and intense fruits nose with green nose from pyrazine. Smoky hint due to oak influence. Strong attack with well ripe black fruits flavor and ripe but much tannin.  Developing Nero d'Avola and other varieties blends from Sicilia. Tasted in October 2019. Deep ruby color. Aroma of red cherry, black cherry, black berry, black pepper, green pepper, flint, clove, hint of blood and tobacco. Medium+ acidity, high tannin and medium alcohol. Full body. Pronounced flavor intensity. Medium+ finish.
I really loved this wine the second time I tried it. It’s strong and bold full of cherry and tobacco notes
Killer. Bold wine, red fruit, oak, leather, vanilla, balsamic.  Big and earthy and still so smooth.

Beautiful deep ruby color, plenty of spices on the nose and the palate is superb. Notes of blackberry, star anise, pepper, dark forest fruit, chocolate, and more. What a delight, 2016 is medium-full bodied, balanced and ready to drink, but 5 years stable ageing would make this an absolute bomb.

2015 vintage was immense. After a two hour decant, this was lovely and rich, with complexity, the right amount of acidity and black fruit. Paired beautifully with a tomato, sausage and aubergine lasagne. Will definitely be buying more of these and I suggest anyone who’s not tried it to do so!
A very good wine with a little bit of disappoint. The price is wild. tobacco oak blackberry leather plum chocolate vanilla pepper balsamic
Its been awhile since I tasted this. Fully lived up to my expectations. Unsure if it will develop to an even better wine. It's already great !!
Chocolaty, tannic, lip-smackingly good. This is built for the long haul. Keep for 5+ years more. In the same category as Giorgio Primo.
👍 ES92 RP95+ JS92 AD94. Mostly Nero d’Avola with Petit Verdot, Syrah and other grapes. 14m oak new French oak and 36m in bottle before release. 13.5% alcohol. 40,000 bottles made. World Wine 10/2020
Blackberry, plum, vanilla flavors. I like this but it’s not a great value personally. I absolutely love Sicilian wines and was very exited to try. Not really getting the hype.
Certainly towards the full-bodied end of the spectrum, with notes of dark berries, plum, chocolate, balsamic and pepper. Bold with grippy tannins and a long persistent finish. Probably too young.
Blackberry, licorice, incense,clove, and a final of strawberry. Perfect with pistachio encrusted lamb racks! Good wine, but i was expecting something more  given the price

This is a premium Nera D'Avola with a cool name. The first sip is absolutely divine and then it all crushes to earth a bit once the wine gets some air. Five star Nera D'Avola was a mirage.
Excellent vintage. Smooth and pleasantly dry.

Quite aromatic, like violet, tobacco, earthy, blackberry with fully minerality nuance, full body, dry, soft touch with elegant tannin, blueberry, cherry, chocolate and vanilla sense is fully filled. Very complex, soft and delicate but not so easy, very well-made, well-balanced, great quality. Clean finish with raspberry feeling and bit of acidity. Bit later, it gives chocolate and fig emotion as well. Very surprisingly well-made Sicilian red wine. My best sicilian until now.

Smoke, cedar, black coffee, dark chocolate, blueberry, blackberry, mulberry nose with a surprising bit of dried cherry. Big on mulberry on the palate with more smoke, cedar, coffee and dark chocolate. Some cassis, plum and black cherry a little later. Quite lovely.

Good to try some other Donnafugata beyond their wonderful sweet wine. Blend of Nero d’avola with Syrah and petit Verdot. Deep, dark, succulent blackberries and blackcurrants, smoke, meaty and leathery hints from the Syrah. Structure quite grippy and youthful. Improved with air.

+1/4. Do you like Italian wine? Then, you will like this one. We continue to expand our palette to European wines and this was a new varietal for us. Color, nose and taster are in line with Italian grapes, which we are learning to like and appreciate more. Had w/CarbNada and Trop Storm.

Decent bold dark red. Smooth tannins, good body, dry. Somehow, there is room for improvement. We tried this at a tasting and really liked it. At home, we have been underwhelmed. Expensive for what you get.

Wonderful top shelf blend from iconic Sicilian maker, dominant Nero d’avola grapes, still a bit tight and acidic, but underpinnings of dark fruit, vanilla, blueberry jam, violets, tangy tannins on the finish

Nice oaky blackberry Sicilian from Donnafugata. Give it a bit of time, so the acidity can dial down a bit — unfortunately, also some fruit will disappear in the nose. On the palate it‘s still full of blackberries with an oaky dryness and maybe some minerals and hints of cassis..? It‘s a quite beautiful wine, but not as intense or bold as others have put it, in my opinion. Maybe it should age a bit more to take some acidity while holding onto the beautiful fruitiness.

Very dark in colour, almost black. There is not much of a nose, but there are notes of dark chocolate and something I can’t identify. Overall a light red from Sicily, which is soft an the palate and easy to drink. Very good mouthfeel and a lovely finish. Goes well with Parmigiano!Got it at Zibaldone.

91/100 - The flagship wine of Donnafugata. There are medium(+) intense aromas of cherry, blackberry, raspberry, plum, blackcurrant, elderberry, liquorice, fir, tomato leaves, coffee beans, smoke, tobacco and geranium. Very distinct wooden notes, for my taste they are too exposed. The balance is just right and the tannins are well integrated. Complex and elegant. However I can't get rid of the feeling that the wine is a bit overpriced.

Blackcurrant, plum, oak,  vanilla, pepper, violet, tobacco. 
Strong tannins, good acidity. 
Awesome wine for meditation or for pairing with grilled meat and aged cheeses. 
2016 vintage to young, good aging potential. 
4.1

Returning to this wine after 18 months is a different experience. After breathing for 5 hours the wine still has not uncovered all its potential. Aroma filled with chocolate vanilla red fruits and black fruits plus oak, the wine consists of decent acidity with most type of flavours you get on the nose. Still like this winery a lot #nerodavola #sicilia #donnafugata #millenotte

Intense ruby red colored, w ample bouquet of black fruits, spice and cocoa made from Nero d’Avola, petit Verdot, Syrah and other grapes. High but silky tannins and acidity 
2017 just released 2 months ago aged in French Oak barriques and then 20 months at least in the bottle. Meditation wine, also can be paired w roast, braised meat and first courses ragout, and rack of lamb.

Cherry so much cherry. And some pepper punch. Doesn’t smell overly strong but the flavours certainly pack a punch. Nice deep red colour. Sicily once again provides us with an amazing tipple. A thousand and one nights is a good name considering I could drink this for close to 3 years straight.

Donnafugata is a winery that was established in 1983 based on a high-class wine company that has a history of 150 years.

Great name for a wine and our first visit to a restaurant in 3 months.
Certainly still too young and with a lack of balance. Definitely more potential in the coming years, today 4,1⭐️.
Intense nose with notes of blackberries, dark currants, dark cherries, oak and leather.
Complex and with a lot of character, the palate shows notes of coffee, dark chocolate, oak, tobacco, spices, wet forest floor and licorice.
Nice finish with red cherries, a touch of —>>

Close to full body, noticeable tannins, med+ acidity - this wine will improve with time. Red fruit, ripe cherry, plum, nice minerality, ash and hints of salt under there. Well integrated oak. Good example of its terroir, ok length.

4.2 - Red wine from Sicily, Italy. 
Grapes are Nero d’Avola, Petit Verdot, Syrah and other, aged 13-14 months in new french oak and in bottle for at least 24 months. 
Color: Deep ruby. 
Aroma: Ripe dark cherry, blackberry, ripe plum, fig jam, violet, a hints of spicy and pepper. 
Palate: Ripe red and black berries with spicy notes. Medium+ body, medium tannins and soft acidity. 
Pleasant mix of ripe south character and spicy nuances

Why imitate the dry, boring and fruitless old fashioned stiff upper lip Bordeaux style if you can be a top notch Nero de Avola from Donnafugata ? This is a wine of great quality, but I prefer a Donnafugata that tastes like ... a Donnafugata. 
Show that fruit, display that Sicilian sun, down with those everlasting hard and immature tannins !

Excellent wine full of sour cherry, some dark chocolate, a bit oaky with a sniff of tobacco. It was served slightly chilled, at about 16*C which was perfect on this hot summery day, slowly revealing the complex nose and palate as the wine was warming up.

Deep inly purple, despite its age.  A little brick at the edges.  Heady, quite intense nose, with hints of violet, and currants not red and black - but more red.  Still very youthful.  A touch of cedar and vanilla, but very subtle.  Smooth, integrated tannins, but still has some grip to it.  Has a while in it yet.  Very nice.

Lazio south Italy tasting. Didnt perform amoung the best in this qualified tasting but surely quality red. 

Blackberries and dark cherries, balsamico and herbs on nose. Racy acidity and bold tannins on palate.  Medium plus bodied and medium fruity finish. Ok structure and balance but nothing memorable. I am not the biggest sisily red fan.

95RP/ a complex and intense Nerod’Avola blend with PV, Syrah and other grapes is full of plums and fresh blackberries and blackcurrant, balsamic liquorice with hints of black chocolate 🍫, earthy notes and sweet tobacco🍂
Earthy notes like the smell of soil after rain (in a nice way). Worth it for the sub 100sgd pricing paid. Opens up after around one hour with a tint of vanilla aftertaste
Just too many memories locked up in this wine. My first tasting of this wine about 15 years ago is one of my wine moments and opened my eyes to Siscilian wine.  Simply wonderful.
interesting nero d’avola-dominant blend, lots of dark fruit and toast, cocoa, coconut, hint of residual sugar, hefty tannins

A brilliant nose of dark fruit, rich mocha, and a dash of smoke. On the palate, this is completely approachable—no doubt the six-plus years of aging have been beneficial. In fact, this is more than approachable, this is lovely. Alone or paired with just about any protein, this wine continues to evolve, causing more than its fair share of introspection. Outstanding. 92-94 Points. thedrunkencyclist.com

Ultra concentrated, plump, overripe monster. Big, jammy (plums and blackberry), juicy, thick. An impressive wine, very well done and objectively memorable. But this extreme style is not one I like, as it lacks subtlety, acidity and vibrancy. Still, one of the best of its kind.

A bit below the expectations, seemingly even behind the peak, somehow disbalanced: still lively acidity, tannins almost not present, dried overripe cherries and prunes, leather, medicinal notes, like star anise, bitter woody note, very short aftertaste. Remaining curiosity, still would like to try another bottle, perhaps another vintage

Donnafugata tasting w. West London Wine School, 5/6. V youthful now, needs time. One to revisit. 90% Nero d'Avola, remainder PV, Syrah & others. 14m in new 🇨🇵 oak, 20m in bottle prior to release.

N: med+ intensity, mint & dried herbs lifting the blueberry & blackberry fruit core. Smoke & new leather.

P: big complexity: black cherry, blackberry & plum, tobacco, coffee & cocoa. Spices & fresh tree bark build a solid full body. Grippy tannins, med(+) acid, long finish. V good quality, outstanding potential

Wine whose olfactory comfort embraces us with fruity, sweet and ripe, fragrant and floral notes. It shows great taste and remarkable personality and force structure. Mixtures of alcohol in soft tannins in a convincing balance.

A 4.3, really, being waiting to open this with a friend for quite a while a it didn’t disappoint. Medium to full Nero d’avola with some pericone and nerello capuccio. Quite tannic and dry, red berries, balsamic, earthy, liquorice,hints of sweetness and bitterness, herby, chocolate, there’s also some funk in there from the volcanic terroir, very decent long finish. Super….!!a

Nero d’avola as predominant variety plus petit verdot, syrah. Medium aroma of brandied cherry, white pepper. 
Medium but still sharp tannins, med acidity.
Matured 13-14 months in new french barrels + 2 years in a bottle. 
Have a good storage potential.

3.7 at best hugely overrated. Liquid inside does not live up to the price tag. Astringent. Can remember a woody Spanish tempranillo when breathing. Blend of Nero d’Avola, Petit Verdot, Syrah and other undisclosed grape. Black fruits and liquorice. Tanins quite present.

Flagship Nero d'Avola with some 7% Syrah and a wee bit of Petit Verdot. 12 months of French Barrique. Dark purple black, beautifully complex full nose with dark berries, tobacco, pencil shavings, tar. Palate a bit overwhelmed by bod tannins that slowly disappeared. Guess it needed more air than the tasting at the winery allowed. Still remains to be seen how good it can be.

Unexpected PN start with cherry and  forest floor but it is followed by pencil shavings and spices like cloves. Pleasant but lacks intensity or maybe I had too high expectations. Still it is a good wine from respected producer.

Actually a solid 4.2. Although an amazing wine but does not reach just a little to my 4.5 rate. Complex, structured, a bit floral at the beginning, but after a while it burst into dark fruit, tobacco, leather and spice. Very well balanced and gives a good feeling of a special elegance.

Needed its decanting to liberate from powerful (but later well-structured) tannins. This prince of the Nero d'Avola grape first bursts with red fruit in a vaulted ceiling of taste explosion; aromatic top notes & a leathery butchness, with a pleasing length

Very interesting Sicilian red blend made from Nero d’Avola 🍇 with some Petit Verdot and Syrah.
13-14 months aging in new French oak barriques with further bottle aging for at least 2 years.
Multi componental and still be fresh despite intensive aging (new oak). Dark fruit / berries notes along with tertiary components like dark honey, sweetened wood.

Buono! 90% Nero d 'Avola/10% Cabernet Sauvignon aged in French oak, following the rules of Giacomo Tachis, the godfather of Super Tuscan wines. It took a while to open up for this great red but it was worth to waiting for. Definitely on its prime, it has an explosive nose of dried aromatic herbs, licorice, plum, redcurrant and leather. Very smooth and dry on the palate with a good compromise between tannins and acidity. Salute!

Top nero d'avola. Clean concentrated fruityness. Dark berries, blueberries, cherries, raspberries. Balsamic with vanilla notes. Velvety in the mouth. Long aftertaste. Still quite strong acidity indicates cellar potential. Alco a little too evident. Anyway, a true pleasure to enjoy this Sicilian!
Powerfull Sicilian wine. Heavy on the taste of tart mature berries such as plum, raisin, black berry, together with oak, leather, sweet tobacco

Enzo Brezza took over. He's an intense guy. 7pm, he sent the staff home, and the 1:1 tasting felt at times like an interview, at times like a pre-dinner drink with a friend keen to open the next bottle. A good wine but needs several more years in the cellar to evolve (drank 2017) Nose is quite restrained, with faint red berry and woody, herbaceous aromas on the nose. A bit darker in colour than some Barolos, more opaque garnet than rust. The palate is tense, with firm, grippy tannins. The wine opens up in the palate, offering a wider array of flavours than the nose suggests.

This will evolve and hopefully be worth the wait in say 2021!

From MGA Castellero in Barolo.  Nebbiolo Lampia biotype with 52 y old rootstocks.
Appearance: clear pale garnet red with orange reflections and tawny rim. 
Nose: still slightly developing. Pronounced aromas of bloodoranges, metaloxide, weathered rose petals, saline minerality, tobacco, mushroom, ripe strawberry.
Palate: dry, medium (+) acidity, pronounced intensity, well integrated velvety tannins, medium (+) body, long lingering finish. Added aromas to nose of undergrowth, marzipan and cinnamon. 
... ➡️..

Ruby red with nail grenade. It has a classic and pleasant olfactory profile, marked by floral scents of lavender and violet, and embellished by an endless series of tertiary tones reminiscent of sweet tobacco, white pepper, clove, rhubarb and china. The mouth is energetic and austere in tannins, fresh, dynamic and structured. Lingering finish.

Fruity, Mellow, Powerful Barolo 
On the nose, fruity, with intense aromas of blackcurrant marmalade.
On the palate, smooth, with flavors of plum, blackcurrant and some extract sweetness. Rich, mellow tannins and a decent acidity form a medium to full body. The finish is very long lasting. A beautiful Barolo, great to drink now, but with a lot of potential for further aging.

Excellent bargain from Lidl. Beautiful aromas of tobacco, heavy baked dark fruits, leather and just a whiff of vanilla. The mouthfeel is wonderful and silky, yet a distinctive residue is left behind from firm, ripe tannins. On the palate, there is a distinct vegetative taste, almost slightly herbal, that works well with the bold, sweet fruits. There is a lingering finish where a snappy bite of acidity rounds off a very pleasant experience.
