Med+ acidity, rounded med tannins. Spicy, mouthfilling, nicely integrated flavors in line with the nose. A bit drying mouthfeel. Nice lingering finish. A very good combi with boeuf Bourguignonne. Yum. 17 pts @ own cellar.

Thanks Robin for arranging this wonderful Riedel glass - I decided to use this as decanter on this 2010 Saint Seurin de Cadourne wine near StEsthephe. So a tannic wine for sure with long crllaring required. Nine years seems adequate.

55% CS, 40% M and 5% CF - vines 30 years old.  Soil: argilo calcaire. Great structure good length a class wine. Bordeaux is one of those regions that stays a reference. @Carrefour, BE

Vivino Far East Tasting February 2019
Starring: Masaki/Thor/Fiona & friend 

A big-boned B’dx brought by Thor

Tasted blind; decanted 60+mins ahead; Rhône tumbler used; classy graphite earth with cedar smoke + cream de cassis & camphor spices
Roundly ripe with stylish mouthfeel & grippy tannins finish

Guessed 00’ Pauillac classed growth

This 06’ btl is not conservative at all

12.5%AbV

Cassis, dark cherries, plum, tobacco, black pepper, leather. A sensorial feast of perfectly integrated complexity. Hard structures dominant with vibrant acidity and biting tannins, this wonderful specimen of fermented grape juice will age with elegance for 5-10 years.

First day I drank it after 3 hours in decanter and was a bit disappointed. Very closed with a dry and sandy finish. Day two was a different story: lots of nice black currant on the nose combined woth steel and earth. Well structured and very lean on the palate. Medium to full body. A very nice wine but if uou drink it now I recommend 6-7 hours air first.
Beautiful wine. tremendously poplar with connoisseurs in France. Having both elegance and strength.  leather tobacco oak vanilla cassis blackcurrant blackberry cedar
I found this in my cellar.   I’ve no idea where I got it but it really some lovely complex flavours.  I like it!  Pity I don’t have more!
I just love Sociando. The concentration, the balance, the longevity and the PRICE. Glorious Left bank wine, but so young still. Powerfull, sexy, balanced. I looove it. Long life ahead
Power and complexity, this very solid haut medoc provides intense flavours of dark fruit and a touch of smoke. Nice balance and texture. Great now and likely still a few years to come.

🥂Color:
dark red
👃🏻Nose:
Dark berries, earth and pepper.
👅Mouth:
Soft and round with soft tannins, cherries and blackberries with a long mineral aftertaste with oak notes and black pepper.
Well aged and well balanced, so typical Bordeaux red wine in very positive way. 9 years of aging brought this wine to right level.  Enjoyed with my friend during trip to Yamanashi and Nagano.
Smooth only
Very closed. Probably need to open it way before consumtion if it bring anything...
A bit too dry for me

N: bit 咸。bit chocolate.  
P: bit non smooth. Dark cherry.  Dropping a bit fm first. salty. Dark Chocolate
Tannins softening so approachable even though quite youthful! Lots of fruit. It should evolve nicely over the next few years
Earthy, full body, licorice, dark berries, tobacco and a nice smooth finish. Still a good portion of tannins, but it adds to its character.
89/100 very pleasant. Harmonic soft dark fruit, currant, raspberries and cherry, well integrated oak. Smooth and nice mouthfeel.
Smells to basement.  Taste is first very sauer but gets better. Some cherry maybe some cocoa. Nice deepntaste but not very long.
Dark red. Plenty of fruit, dark berries, some liquorice, tobacco. Balanced, dampened tannins but still structure! Long finish.
Very fair priced bordeaux. Nice nose of vanilla and black fruits. Classified as cru bourgeois but in taste easily a grand cru

Deep red rose petal texture filled with ripe raspberry, tobacco, vanilla, leather, cedar notes. Wonderfully easy to sip with a pleasant feel on the smooth edges. Excellent value and definitely a repeat!

3.8*

🍇: 55% CS, 40% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc.

👃: Expressive aromas with bouquet of dark berries, cassis, earth, forest floor, leaf mold, cedar wood, spices and hint of leather are on the nose.

👄: Round and well-balanced, and moderately dry spicy. Tannins have nicely integrated to the wine and become soft already. Spicy black fruit flavor with undertones of earth note on the palate are enough enjoyable, however the intensity of scent of the wine was decreased earlier than my expectation.

Deep Garnet with purple hue

 Sweetcurrant,Blackberry,Blackcherry,Pencilshave,Cedar,Wetbark,Tobacco,Leather,Nutmeg,Bluecheese.

Mediumbodied.Well matured.Succlent ,slightly watery compares to GV.Medium acidity.Med(+) tannin.Serving carefully due to the sediments.Unluckily,this bottle is not in good condition .Subtle of  corked nuance I found.

However, it was still drinkable.And good with Bluecheese 😂Quite much complexity and tertiary notes .

After all, it's still Sociando Mallet .

4.4, What one would hope for from a Bordeaux, whether your first crack at it wondering what all the fuss is about or next in a long line of successes. Smooth, wonderful bouquet, long finish, ever-evolving, luscious - c’est terrifique!

Nice smooth tannic backbone. Only got to decant for about half an hour. Needs a couple of hours of air. Exotic spice. Melinda says it is very smooth. Black fruit. Made in the modern style. Had with Elk tenderloin and beef filet. A great match.

If you’re looking for a first-class Haut-Médoc, Sociando-Mallet is always a good idea. 
This matured 2007 of Gautreau offers abundant, layered notes of leather, sandalwood, undergrowth, tobacco leaf, a whiff of red bell pepper, licorice, anise, charcoal and brambly black fruit.
Full-bodied with an attack of juicy dark fruit. Broad-shouldered yet creamy in texture with herbal edges of bay leaf and dried mint on the palate. Bold freshness, drying tannins with some tobacco and pungent pepper in the end. 4.0

It may not have been a memorable year but this château never fails to produce a decent first wine. Smoke on the nose. Full bodied, dry and packed with dark fruit. Notes of cassis and plum with a kick of oak and cedar. Don’t decant for too long to enjoy the full flavour of this vintage.

2007. Was told this wasn't the strongest vintage but regardless, drinking very well now. Nose of ripe blackberries and beautifully toasty. Mellow palate with just enough tannins for an overall impression of a robust bordeaux.

Chassis, oak, black currants, brie, dried plums, licorice, game, grass, forest floor, olives, cloves, figs, jam, bergamot, raisins, pink peppercorns, yellow peppercorns, dried herbs, excellent length. Excellent woody nose, and an excellent Bordeaux. Fungus at the end, very nicely balanced.

I have left this bottle a while in my cellar. Airing was needed as it was quite closed after being opened. Two hours later, I was met with an elegant nose where leather and fresh, unburned cigar notes dominated. A nice mouth with powerful tannins, it withstanded peppered red meat without problem. My wife found it a little bit too harsh for her taste though so choose your company wisely ;)

Look: clear, ruby red colored, medium intensity.                                                   Smell: clean, pronounced , red cherry, black currant, spices, oaky, floral- violet, berries, mineral.                                                              Palate: dry, medium acidity, high tannin, full body, plum, black fruit, red cherry, spicy, significant oaky edge with earth and tobacco hints, medium - long finish

Blind tasting of non-classified Bordeaux. Lesson learned:  there are a lot of very fine wines in the Medoc. Three vintages of Sociando in this flight of six and they were everyone’s top three.  This was my and the group’s number three. The nose was rather restrained and this will clearly improve with age and last at least another decade.  This has the depth and complexity of the big boys in Bdx.

Medium ruby purple, a bit hazy, love the nose, farmyard, mineral and leather, drying on the palate, fruit acidity, not much fruit, light but enjoyable. Love to try the non good vintages. After 1h it opened a lot, way better. 2h after, ink, herbs (sage), black fruit on the palate. Impressive how it changed. Still light, but way richer aroma-flavor profile. 2007 doesn‘t let down and rewards patience

Opened from the cellar. Striking nose of freshly chopped cedar wood, French cafe, dark chocolate truffles, and cherry cheesecake. Dominant in structure, confident tannins, strong texture. Dark, with supple blackberries and boysenberry jam. Graphite and dark chocolate undertones. Great length. Sociando Mallet is a personal favorite. At this point, I’ve developed a formative image of 2009 Bordeaux-early spring hike, rain, and chocolate.

ReAlly good haut medoc
The nose is very expressive with lots of ripe dark fruits like cassis, bramble and black cherries
Round and full bodied on the palate, elegant finishing with gentle notes of oak
Classy and very good
Fantastic wine, great flavours and a delight to consume. Highly recommend!
Full bodied - powerful - spicy - smooth
Excellent Bordeaux with a fair price value. The wine is now very much balanced and has no tanins anymore. Can drink to everything but would enjoy it without a heavy meal
Spiced and already meaty, red fruits, dusty. Med bodied, balanced, dusty tannins give a certain hardness, would wait a bit. Classic but a bit hard a this time.
Blackberry and cassis with leather, licorice old velvet and cedar earthy notes. Plenty of life left, smooth tannins and fresh acidity. Should be a grand cru classé.
Aromas of chocolate, black pepper and vanilla.  Aged beautifully for 10 years and could age many more.  We decanted it for 2 hours before tasting.  Soft and bold.
Love it

Deep dark garnet in hue. Ripe, mature red fruits and hint of soil on the nose. Delicate and silky smooth entrance. Full red fruits (mainly plums) on the palate. Tannins give away the youth of the wine. Although 12 years old, this will continue to improve with time. Recommended.
Wow. Super pungent. It smells of age and history. Big vanilla aroma and flavor. Ginormous tannins. So good.
Super wine, but, this bottle was not as good as the 2009, the sour comes through. Still, great wine.
Nice bouquet straight from the bottle. Super value Haut-Medoc that really delivers when allowed to age. Thick in the mouth. Needs food!
92/100. Dammed so velvet! Deep garnet. Seductive nose of dark fruits; Blue plum, cassis, Blackberries and dark cherries. Fullbodied. Balanced. Long.
Deep leather smell. Colour still implies this is a much younger wine than it actually is. Very round taste. This wine never ends. Amazing
Pungent cedar and cassis aroma with hints of chocolate and leather. May need more aging. 55% CS, 40% merlot, 5% Franc.
Really nice. Leather and tobacco dominate. Have 3 more bottles and going to hold for another 3-5 years. Think this will get even better.
Very nice Bourdaux medium to full bodied,  well balanced, the 2011 had nice round tannins, nice wine will not be my last one.
Dark red. Forest floor aromas.  Nicely balanced dry and bold flavor.  Give it lots of time to breathe.  It really opens up.  Smooth finish.
A beautifully matured Bordeaux from a mediocre vintage, it sports a good deal of Cassis, leather, blackcurrant leaves, and some graphite notes.

Vineyard visit and tasting at Château Sociando-Mallet in Haut-Medoc. 

wip
Damn this is good, dark earthy, refined, like earthy brunello, deep, elegant, not super complex but very good length. Funnily wouldnt have guessed bordeaux (served blind), but is a great pleasure

Intensity: high
👃🏻/👅: toast, meat, eucalyptus, cherry, cranberry, coffee, tobacco, ink 
Sweetness: dry
Acidity: high
Tannine: high 
Alcohol: medium 
Body: full
Length: medium
For the price this consistently outperforms. A delightful Bordeaux from a difficult year. Decent and drink. It doesn’t need much more than that. High rating as it is a good value Bordeaux.
Excellent wine that is worth much more. Oak nose with with currants plums and fairly strong that announces flavorful tannic body which also has just a little spiceness and tannins.
Great Bdx from excellent year, for a fair price. What else can one ask for? Powerful, dark fruit and balanced, a classic Bordeaux that will reward if you lose a case in your cellar for a few years.
Leather and tobacco on a black fruit monster: cassis, plum, blackberry. A super classic haute-medoc from 2006, delivering all you expect from it. Can't go wrong with a classic bordeaux!

Cassis, blue fruit, blackberry, black cherry, black plum and black currant. Some red fruit hiding as well.
Oaky tones, vanilla and leather, some pencil shavings and minerals.
89-90
Beautiful! Dark ripe fruits and berries. Very smooth and complex. Leather, cloves... Very long finish.
Clearly too young yet already smooth and delicate. Needs a lot of air before drinking still. Next try of it in 5 years just to check it out :)
Le nez is fresh red fruits, cassis, woodland, river moss. The palate is beautifully balanced, replicating the nose, higher acidity than expected .. but it works.
Bouquet of star anise, nutmeg laced with dried sweetened Chinese olives. Medium bodied with smoothened tannins, and nice lenghthy finish. Another QPR!
A strong core of ripe red fruit and cellar must and tannic backbone gives this wine a firm yet elegant profile. Probably not worth the price tag though.
Woah
Delicious!
Super
Excellent
Stunning wine.
Excellent
Ok

Expressive and well-built.Good vintage.
Cabernet dominated and now full mature.
Generous wine
1 nose: pepper, cranberries; 2 nose: blackberry. Medium tannins, rich taste and long aftertaste
leather cassis blackcurrant tobacco oak leather earthy smoke
Similar to 2010 but 2010 is said to be better because of the perfect weather of 2010 in Bordeaux.
Tobacco, oak nose. Really brilliant. Dark fruit.
Rich, full and a great nose. Pretty impressed.
Baita vinho a 40 euros. Need to say more?
Powerful and elegant
Starting to dry out, but still acceptable
Wonderful aroma, nice heavy body. Would recommend with any meat and other well rounded dinner
Exactly as the previous reviewer stated.
Very nice nose like rosy leaves. Dark fruits full body with a gentle finish. This is a great wine.
Tannic structure, dark berries, and pepper...Excellent!
Smooth red with plenty black fruit and classic leather and tobacco notes with lively balance and touches of mild pepper and blackcurrants
Dark red hue. Nose of berries and licroice. Mod tannins, fruit. Still young.
4stars on taste, 1/2 more on value
Fantastic Haut-Medoc!  Bit of a sour after taste.
Surprisingly good coming from an off vintage!
Deep, dark fruits combined with lots of tannins makes this an ausome wine. Very high quality, it will remain good for another 10 years.
Deep, straight and well balanced with sweetish aftertaste
Still drinking quite well
A rich, ripe nose of plum, leather and cedar. Fruity and ripe, quite grippy, probably drinking from now for a good few years.
Very classy Claret. As in former times

4+  Delicious Haut-Medoc in a beautiful form. Med+ intensity aromas of black currant, cassis, blueberry, mulberry, pencil shavings, chocolate. Medium bodied, M+ tannins, Medium acidity. Beautiful finish.

2000 sociodo mallet

Developed nose of poopy leather, barnyard. Dense strewed plum and sour ume. Very mushroomy with just a bit of smashed blackberry.

Very intense and open nose. It's ready. 

Smooth with minor tannin carrying the texture of velvety pillow. 
Great intensity of the flavor. With a dying short plus finish. 

It's dying already sadly but its a wonderful funeral in my mouth. 

94 pts at peak. Now its like 91 pts. Drink now don't wait. Would have loved to meet it 5-10 years younger
93tanzer
91WS

Very good classic Bordeaux, just maturing nicely with fruit and tannins well balanced and integrated. Savoury blackcurrant with mild dusty dark chocolate and hints of mint. Medium bodied, drinking well but certainly can go further. No hints of leather just yet, still primary if savoury fruit.

Bright ruby red in color, displaying a lifted bouquet of earthy blackcurrant, licorice, minty dark cherries and a smoky and mineral element.
The palate is medium in body, with fine tannins and a pleasant acid backdrop.
The lasting aftertaste presents a certain peppery drive combined with a delicate freshness!

Aromatic nose of violets and berries. Full bodied taste of berries, cinnamon and spices. Medium creamy finish with a hint of white chocolates. Luscious Bordeaux. I bought this as a mistake somehow, but it is a keeper!

4.2pts

Nice freshness of blackberry, prune & sweet figs. Short time of 15mins open up the secondary aromas of liquorice, mint, cedary oak, with layers of chocolate, tobacco & touch of muddy note.

Palate is surprisingly refreshing as I would taught it to be jammy but due to the lingers crisp acidity and grippy tannin that somewhat balance with it's fruits gives minty, peppery & toasty long finished. Good structure, lasted 1.5hrs. 

Paying RM250 for a bottle that is 14yrs old is superb value. Drink NOW!

Really tasty Left Bank from last night that was too young but showed much promise! Shared by Angela and enjoyed around the table. Grippy tannins & dark berries, with some dried herbs 🌿, toasted oak & menthol on the finish. Would love to see this in 15 years!

Takes a few hours to open up, only then the wine shows its true, ancient identity. Not the best 2006 i had this year but certainly not the worst. Pair this well balanced ol' school Bordeaux with a meaty dish

3.9 Earthy, not overly showing and at the same time rather uncomplex left bank Bordeaux. Lots of graphite noticeable after some while, together with blackberry and earthy tones. Medium plus finish. This came unaccompanied by food.

Beautiful garnet red with a purple rim.

A stunning nose of blackcurrants, cigar and pine. A truly comforting feel that oozed confidence.

The palate continued in the same vein. It was more powerful than I anticipated but appreciable. Great fruit and lots going on. The palate whizzing with sensation and stimulus. But not discordant. Plenty of legs in the wine and no doubt will give great joy and increasing complexity.

Deep garnet. Cassis, dark cherry, plum, blackcurrant, blackberry with cedar, pepper spices, cigar and leather showing through. Rigidly structured, showing the typically dry mid-palate element of Haut-Medoc wines with vibrant biting acidity. Tannins are still there but started to mellow. A wine that will surely do better with some more age but was nonetheless extremely complex and (forgive me) showed Bordeaux’s more ‘masculine’ characters. 17.

Fresh bramble and cherry aromas complemented by cedar, pencil shavings, vanilla, tobacco and roasted notes from the oak. A structured wine with medium(+) but ripe tannins and balanced acidity. Dark fruit and a hint of chocolate are coming back in the aftertaste that is medium-long. This is drinking very well already but certainly has a few more years of runway.

Mystere 2000 Claret 5 of 9

Powerful nose of cedar branch, cigar box and cassis 

So neatly knitted together. Big hit of blackberry, pencil sharpening.

Precise and classic. It's been said many times but Sociando is the greatest non-classed Left Bank.

If tonight gets better than this I'll be a very happy man!

(came second on the evening to Angelus. Beating and underperforming Las Cases)

Zoom Tasting with the Van Crew, Wine #2 - my contribution to last night’s Cabernet Sauvignon blind tasting. Again, this understated Soc-Mallet from 2000 punched above its Haut-Medoc weight class. A proper, mature claret: herbaceous aroma-flavours surround its preserved black fruits with damp earth, truffles, mushrooms, coffee beans, old leather. Mature, sweet tannins, impressive acidity, lovely texture. My last bottle was enjoyed by all and among the stars of the night, voted as 2nd WOTN!

17.5/20: in 1999 the Grand Jury in Merano voted this no 1 in a blind tasting with 132 (!) top bordeauxs. Now I understand why: barnyard, cedar wood, bright fruit and mouthwatering acidity and freshness with a gripping finale. Bonus 0.5 stars because of the spectacular value (around 50 euro in Europe).

To celebrate my eldest son's 18th birthday this hidden gem from his birth year... the hot vintage. 🌞😎

🍇 Cabernet Sauvignon 55%, Merlot 40%,
      Cabernet Franc 5%.
👁  Dark with a ruby rim.
🍇  Intense ripe, dark fruit, smoke,
       tobacco leaves, graphite,
       cedar and pencil shavings.
👅 Wow... 
      This is a great wine and one of my favourites 
      for many years.
      Med+/full bodied, nicely balanced.
      Cassis, black cherry, blackberry,
      tobacco, cedar and pencil.
🎓 Score:4,5⭐

Micro offline gathering to welcome Masaki San
HK gang: Rolf, Thor and A T.
Brought by Thor for blind tasting.
Decanted nearly 2 hrs. Still slightly tannic nose with plummy and earthy notes.
I struggled between St Julien and Pauillac.😝 Wrong are both!!
On mouth, cassis, cedar, vanilla, bell pepper, fir...
Smooth with good length of finishing.

Robe is still young with some amber on the edge
Typical bouquet of black fruit, earth, mint and smoke
Palate is not huge but with a nice fresh touch and fine tanins
Finished with a nicce salinity
Not overly complex but as usual a sure QPR for a Haut Medoc (above the appellation)

👀 Deep ruby👃 Medium intensity with aromas are of blackberry, blackcurrant, green bell pepper, licorice, vanilla, and earth 👅 The wine is dry with medium(+) acidity, medium(+) tannin, medium alcohol, and medium(+) body. Medium flavor intensity and a medium finish. The flavors are of blackcurrant, licorice, vanilla, and earth 🧠 The wine is very good. Suitable for further bottle aging.

3.9@Vivino offline Hong Kong with blind. Quiet clear left bank and gave me remiscent of premium Bordeaux. Nicely aged, well-balanced. It exhibited aroma of blackberry, plum, oak, cassis, tabacco, leather, greenpepper. Decent oak flavour, medium+ tannin, medium+ acidity, dry. Long fenale lingering spices & oak. Beautiful balance 🤗🤗🤗

My friends paid a lot less for this than the average on this app!! The aging made for smooooooth tannins, and it started with dense blackberry in the flavor, with a long finish that started there, and then evolved to ripe raspberry with subtle spice and black licorice. Wow! I wish I had some in my collection!

a Cru Bourgeois not to miss. violets, blackcurrant, blackberry primary notes with secondary pencil shavings, vanilla, cedar notes & tertiary tobacco, forest floor, leather notes to complete.

clear deep ruby. clean medium+ intensity developing aromatics. dry m+ acid, m+ tannin, m alcohol, m+ body, m+ intensity & m+ finish. very good. drink now & potential for further ageing.

verdict: #evokesemotions #dowrs

This wine is getting ready to peak at 10 years old, I wouldn't keep it more than 2-3 years more if you have some. Good blend of Cab and Merlot with both qualities coming out well, red fruit and venison, rich and suave. Very nice wine.
Great Sociando - getting ready to drink after 15 years. Typical spicy Sociando still in its youth. Give it another 3 years !
I gave 4 ⭐️ yesterday, ... same bottle 24 hours later. Now it reached 4,5, the tanines are gone, the balance is perfect. Amazing this can happen!
Really different flavour to this. A pleasant touch of bitterness - goes very well with food. Very interesting - would recommend!
Dusty and dry with a growing power and complexity that defies its poor vintage status. Improved with time but still ended up a little one dimensional. Highly enjoyable for the money
Rich dark cherries & smoky notes. Very firm tannins & dry. Some residue in the glass but long aftertaste and aromatic cedar/vanilla? finish. A complex wine well suited to red meats.
Ok Yep sensational wine consistent with the vintage. Dark black fruit with strong regional character. So distinctive as Bordeaux. Such a privilege to drink this. So well balanced and deep.
Tobacco,  cedar, oak and vanilla. This producer is new to me, but despite the reasonable expensive pricetag it was worth it. It aged beautifully and was ready to drink, so i'm glad I did 😁😋😇
Sep 20 - Opened at a friend house. Good fruit and tertiary notes - very gravel, left bank Bordeaux like. Good value for what this is. Really enjoyed it. However, faded after 2 hours.
Excellent. Some scaling, minor sediment. Needed to open a bit to breathe.. Some collapse towards the end. Question if this could cellar longer as some claimed.
Chocolate, dark ruby colour..will go well with strong cheese and meat dishes especially lamb. Lingering taste in your mouth..makes you just want to eat food!
Weirdly enough the second bottle was very different from the first and not nearly as good. But the first bottle was wonderful and seemed to be just right on age.
Deep dark ruby. Elegant and soft nose of blueberries and cassis. Well balanced and med bodied, dark fruits, pine cones, leather, charcoal, long dry finish
Great fruity wine with hints of vanilla. Lots of black fruit. Smokey wine! Still plenty tannins left. Put it away for a few years and it will be even better!
Decanted. Classic blackcurrant aromas and a touch of spice. The flavours are delciously ripe and soft too, with plum and raspberry characters. Delicious on its own.
Deep cassis with a strong vanilla wood. Entry is tasty, savoury. Nice profile through the mid-mouth. Baked fruit and nice acidity and tannins on the finish.
Explosive nose. Very complex and Classic with black currant Cassis, licorice, melted asphalt and earthy forest floor. spicy with great length and concentration

4.5

Had it first during a dinner. Exhibits freshness of black berries, dried grapes. Well rounded tannins. Medium finish.
Nice pert red fruit, relaxed, but with really lovely tobacco and smoke accents. Quite a lot of structure left, too.
sage, earth, pencil shavings, tobacco, and dried cranberries with super silky tannins and a pretty, round mouthfeel.
We were fortunately enough to open this bottle now, a classic Medoc at its peak. Paired really well with our CNY dinner
A very masuline Haut Medoc with cassis dominating, strong tannins. Still not on its peak but was great with todays Steak!
Excellent, super tanin
Top!
Elegant, fresh fruit. Fine dry tannins
I love my Sociando Mallet
Excellent
Delicious smooth velvet
Great nose

Crimson colour. Leather, bing cherry, camphor, and cedar nose. Very well balanced palate following the nose with the tertiary flavours starting to take over. Dry smooth tannins on the finish. Still plenty of life left. Very nice.

Deep red color. Well structured and concentrated. Ripe red fruit, touch of vanilla, round and fresh. Soft tannines with a long finish. A complex wine and for me an example of a very good glass of Bordeaux from a great vintage.

16/08/18 4.2 gorgeous wine. Ready to drink but surely has still many years ahead. This wine has a great balance and matches very well with steak.

Quintessential Bdx. Dry. RP91. Sociando Mallet is among the best of the unclassified growth. Dense purple w/ cassis,  blackberry. Crushed rock minerality & spring flowers violet.  Earthy leather. Ranked on par w/ Musar as the 2nd most savoury wine @Oct20 RCQ savoury wine

This is sociando: you open it and it's immediately perfect . Great plummy ripe fruit flavors . Silky and balanced with several layers to evolve . Well done blending the traditional bordeaux left bank grape varieties to perfection.

Our second Médoc this Sunday is from one of the most consistent Cru Bourgeois, Sociando-Mallet
This 05 took ages to open up but once it got there, what a treat
Deep purple with crushed rocks, blueberr, eucalyptus & cassis
Beautiful structure with half-ripe cassis, blueberry & blackberry with still vibrant but well managed acidity 
Fine grained tannins, earthy tones, pencil shavings, cedar, long finish 
Delicious already, fab in 3-5 yrs & more
4.25
Happy Bordeaux Sunday 🥰 👍🏿 🍷

👃 intense, roasted aromas, cloves, black fruit 

👄 very deep on a meaty body, fine grained tannins and well integrated acid structure 
cassis, blueberries, black olives chocolate, cedar with fine minerals 

🎯 powerful, slightly bitter long finish 

📝 once again absolutely impressive, even in a modest vintage, bravo 👏 After two hours of aeration in beautiful drinking maturity 

Happy Bordeaux Sunday part 1/2 dear friends, santé 🍷🇫🇷

This Sociando - Mallet had to be drank in SDG airport. Our suitcases was full of Burgogne so every gramm of laggage weight was counted. We have too take glasses and corkscrew in hands. I was ready to throw corkscrew at control in the airport but they occasionly and luckily have passed it being busy with more dangerous terrorist :)
Wine is good. This is one of non classified but perfect Bordeaux. I know it and like it. It worth 3.8 Will add some for strange occasion to drink it in the airport:)

Dark and red color. On the nose subtle smokiness with dark fruit and crushed spices. Medium body/ acidity with silky tannin. On the palate ripped plum, cherry and some peppery notes. Good and persistent finishing with good balance of dark berry and spiciness

A very good vintage. An expressive nose of dark fruit. It has really mellowed over time - the tannins are very soft. Ripe dark fruit and tobacco. As always, perfect with steak (also reacted well to the anchovis-capers sauce). Fades quite quickly, so better to finish the stock.

Good Mèdoc with a dark purple color in the aroma and taste, mainly dark fruit in the background red fruit noticeable dried fig notes of oak earthy spice vegetal yeasty.  Bordeaux is well-balanced with a pleasant tannin. Dry, expressive with a long fruity finish. Good wine with ripening cheeses.  🍇🍷🍷👍🏻😃👌🏻

Deep ruby. 
Medium intensity, black cherry, black plum, blackberry, charred wood, tobacco, mint, green bell pepper, marmalade, tomato, cedar, leather, vanilla. Developing. 
Dry, medium+ acidity, medium+ tannin, medium alcohol, medium body, pronounced intensity, cigar, tobacco, earthy, mushrooms. 
Long aftertaste. 
Quality very good. 
Can drink now, but has potential for ageing.

Medium to deep ruby robe with distinct fading to garnet on the rim. Medium intensity nose, full of dried figs, cassis, vanilla, cedar and tobacco. Full bodied, dry with medium finely grained tannins and high acidity. Intense savoury palate with baked cherry, blackcurrant, fig, tart black cherry, tobacco, spice, cedar and pepper. A little more primary fruit than the nose but we'll developed overall. Very long finish of dried cherry, tobacco and cedar. Intense, complex, well balanced. V good to excellent. 4.3

Very dry and tannin driven fruitbomb that needs to open up. Purple colour. Red fruit and graphite on the nose. Some leather too. Returns on the palate together with cigar box aromas. High on acids, medium finish.

Great bang for your buck! Lovely dark and earthy notes.
Cherry and stewed plum with blackcurrants and hints of red fruit. Background of oak and earthiness and mushrooms with hints of liquorice and air cured tobacco.
Good flavour profile and amplitude - berries and cherries with woodiness and earthiness coming through on the palate with decent finish.
Dry, medium + body, med acidity and firm tannins.
Overall, lovely wine with plenty of character at price point and will only improve.

This is a true Bordeaux that is dark in colour. The nose gives off peppers, cigar smoke, leather topped off with a floral scent. 

The flavours were just as complex with the oak and leather being complimented by deep ripe fruits and sweetness of currants. 

This vintage is drinking well now.

No mistake to make! Twice this wine (2bottles) this weekend!

This S-M 2005 is really peaking! 

I had this one before and it keeps being very seductive even addicitve! It is for me one of the very best Haut-medoc winegrowers! 

Great nose, top taste! Palate of ripe fruits (blackberries, plum, currant, cassis, red berries, cherry), fine wood, top spices (pepper, mint), earthy, leather, cacao, velvet and super balanced. 
A wine that keeps on being at its peak now for years to come! 
Rate 4,4⭐️

Youthful wine with intense aromas of sweet currants, paprika, smoke and graphite. Full and supple mouth feel, there is still a firm grip but the tannins are smooth and refreshing. It opens up in layers of flavors, and it has a charming Haut-Medoc austerity. Med+ to long finish with dark chocolate and currants. Lovely.

Lively and sweet (in a nice way) bouquet, very alluring, I didn’t want to stop inhaling. 

Equally lively and vibrant on the palate, well structured and balanced. Enjoyable now, uncertain cellaring potential though.

4.1
A well-developed nose with very slight vegetative nuances and cherry. Palate is thoroughly balanced with an intensive, longish contact, smooth, earthy tones, and a lovely after taste of  freshly picked apricot.

Deep garnet colour. Classic nose of blackcurrant and blackberry fruit, spicy vanilla oak - “cigar box” notes. The palate is dry, high dry tannins, medium acidity, medium alcohol (13%), medium to full bodied, black fruit, vanilla oak, classic left bank Bordeaux. Very good.

Appearance: ruby red, clear, medium intens. 
Nose: developing, clean condition, medium intens. Aromas of mint, herbal character, capsicum.  Greenish character. 
Palate: dry, medium (+) acidity, medium body, medium (+) finish. 
Assessment: very good. Potential for aging.

91 points. Vintage 2011 in magnum bottle opened in 2022.
👀The color is medium ruby.
👃The nose is offering chocolate, leather, cherry and black currant.
👅The palate is offering black currant, cocoa, green herbs, chocolate and cigar box.
Medium plus tannins and medium plus acid.

really liked this wine after three days in the bottle. black tea and graphite on the nose,  quite austere but revealed lovely fruit and perfume notes later on.  the tannins are quite stiff at the moment and perhaps lacks a bit of elegance but really lovely effort.  I enjoyed this wine a lot.

Dark red colour. Notes of cherries, black berries, licorice, a bit of cacao and leather and metal. On the palate strong astringency. Tannins predominant, but combine nicely with the wild character of the wine. Elegance however is lacking behind its powerful, somewhat rampant character. Long finish with bitter metalish notes. A very unusual Haut Medoc who has its own character and style. Definitely worth a try. Re-buy: yes. Good value for money (paid approx. 30€).

I know it'll be a big wine, thus I did not hesitate to decant it. True enough, a nose and all I got was like entering a CAPSICUM PLATATION. Every note was green vegetal. A while later, the oaks took over, looks like this wine was heavily oaked. The palette was, eh, good balanced fruits but totally unbalanced tannins. I still felt the tannins after an hour after I have finished the wine. I have no doubt this is a 50 year old wine, but I prefer lesser tannins or oaks. This is way way way over-doing.

Tasted blind: Sociando strike again with a knockout 2005. I love what these guys produce on good and off vintages. This has a nice spicy and smoky touch. Oakiness is and allows some nice dark berries to come through. This had me fooled as a high end Saint emilion with its high amount of merlot which i think is why this properties portion levels makes it enjoyable to many palates. Drinking now but depending on your wine style preference it will improve through to 2040.
typical bordeaux that i really enjoyed. Saltier than fruity and slightly musky nose,  oaky and a bit of spice but rounded and grippy on the palate . @Nicolas
Great Sociando, the 2010 is a great wine, maybe a little young now, but already nice to drink, will probably develope more
Deep, dense, and dark Bordeaux, tasting of prunes and black cherry.   This wine is very dark and very strong.  It is an excellent Bordeaux, but perhaps not worth its high price.
Fruity, woody, delicious.

Very perfume nose of black current, licorice, and sweet red fruits.
Palate of ripe and firm tannins, black berry, plum, chocolate. Balanced and well made wine! Sweet fruity ending!
8.7 points; ripe wine, layors of dark ripe fruit, medium alcohol and soft ripe tanins. Lacks some acidity, drink it now. Good balance despite lack of acidity, Verry good wine 😎😎👍👍👌😘🐂🥈🥈🍷🍷
Fantastic Medoc. Very good out of the bottle and exceptional after aerating for 20 min. At La Grenouille. Excellent accompaniment to our meal of Dover sole and wagyu filet mignon
Takes long time to open but after that its good
Very well rounded, smooth and drinking very well now. Good structure and length. Currents and black fruit. Woody. Good value.
Cassis,leather, vanilla , tobacco and white pepper . Silky smooth delivery . Perfect wine to celebrate a friend’s 40th on a T1 night in Honkie town
Third wine in La Cuisine Rademacher with main course. A classic! Very fine Bordeaux with structure. Paired very well with Wagyu. 4.5
25 years old and in perfect balance. Nice acidity, tannins resolved, amazing mix of savoury and fruity flavours. Great complexity. 4.6/5
Old leather, oak, cedar, licorice and tobacco. Powerful, big and bold wine, Concentrated wine with high tannins and a very long finish. Long finish.
€26 auction; very pleasant wine, cassis, cuberdon, 13% alcohol, fresh, open in 1,5 years and it will be much better. Good work
Deep red color and rich full nose. Nice smooth tannins up front with a long lingering finish. Rich and robust. An excellent Haut-Medoc.
Beautiful from nice to finish. Very-well balanced, it has aged nicely with earthy and leathery notes but remains very vibrant.
Vertical tasting. Another good one, fresh, alive, smoothy tannins, balanced and complex taste. Earthy notes, leather, cedar and ripe plum.
Deep ruby color, black currant, black cherry, blackberry, medium to medium plus aftertaste with hint of vanilla and cedar.Nice tannin structure. 4.1.
Still plenty happening with this wine after 35 years. Smoke, leather and tobacco with a refined blackcurrant and cassis notes. Excellent wine.
Notes of cedar, chocolate and black cherry on the nose. Tasted nutmeg and vanilla on the palate, easy to drink and highly recommended.

dark fruit cherry cassis leather earthy tobacco eucalyptus

like the balance and tannic structure 
got some unique noses

4.0
Still holding up beautifully. Dark fruits, licorice, tobacco and old leather. Tertiary flavors are coming. It could age even longer.
Great stuff. Had this with steak au frites (what else?). Big and bold. Peppery with leather, tobacco, and some dark black fruit.

[Boxing Day 2/4]
Since we were heavily anticipating two iconic, non French Bordeaux blends, it seemed fitting to set our baseline with this very solid Médoc from the top vintage 2005.
Nose with smoke, pepper, plum and dirty undergrowth followed by a palate with fine acidity, very dry tannines, licorice, pepper and more black than red fruit. With air acidity and tannines even out and the finish becomes quite beautiful. Baseline set! 4.2
Very nice, smooth. Berries and black currant. Round and reasonably long finish. Tannins there but very subtle, didn’t need long opening.
Beautiful wine. Subtle and balanced. Earthy, lovely minerality, doesn’t have a “wow” factor but in a way that feels subtle and like a “breed standard” rather than boring.
Still 4.5 stars. Excellent Bordeaux. Dark berries in the nose. Cassis, leather, touch of pepper on the palate. Dry. Not the longest finish and not the thickest body but complex flavor profile.
Stunning. Creme de cassis and blueberries, concentrated blue and black fruits with hint of minerality. Sweet tannins completely mellowed after letting the wine open.   RP 93+
1985 >lafite
A decent drinkable red, quite dry
That's the kind of haut-médoc that I truly like it!
A classic Bordeaux red. Nice fruit but not jammy. A bit dry. Perfect to duck or game.
Good mature Bordeaux. Still juicy. Well balanced. Long finish.
Ever reliable Bordeaux. Nicely aged and in the window.
Took some time to open up, but beautiful classic Bordeaux. Some green cab franc aromas on the nose. Nice mouth feel, dark fruits and long finish.
Smooth, leather and some fruits softening well. A lovely wine
Heavy plum and currant notes on the nose. Forward tannins and dry, earthy flavours of pencil lead, tobacco, moss, and spice box.
I am starting to really enjoy this Sociando Mallet. A delicate wine.
Leathery and red fruit aroma, tannic taste and short aftertaste.
Tasted at the Decanter Fine Wine Encounter Bordeaux 2019
Red fruits, cherry, spices, wood, tobacco. Balanced acidity, velvet tannins.
Good Bordeaux! 88 Parker points
Great! Very balanced, smooth and elegant.
Earthy, some leather but nicely aged tannis...so quite a smooth wine.
Woody cherries. Yummy drinkable
Fine aroma and good balance
Bright. Quite good actually.
Really good deal - impressive taste, nicely ripened.
Lovely stuff Chamonix
ready to drink! blackberry with the greenish taste mid mouth but the fruit takes over aftertaste. it is not bad but not crazy.
Not sure what this is, but it certainly is tasty, thanks to Leora at Pearl!
Ripe and full, light sweetness
That's some damn smooth red goodness.

Breath 5 hours


leather, spice, mint
Medium tannin, silky

Great wine and a great price.  


May 21
Tobacco and oaky tones lovely
Loved it, full and ripe with earth and smoke.
Ripe cherry, licorice, supple tanins. Excellent.

Blackberry oak and silver.
High acidity, tannic and dry.
88 p
Ruby, light oaked nose, high tanning, medium acidity, medium body, medium finish

Magnum!! At.Tiffin Box Hythe

Outstandingy wine.
Smooth, little fruity, good for beef.
Vanilla, strawberry, and maybe a hint of mushroom or forest floor. High acid. Tannins have some grip. Long finish. Well balanced and quite elegant.
16yo juice and still not at its peak. Cassis, plum, prune, leather, raisins, cherry, oak, very astringent and mouth drying finish
Liquorice, oak and ripe apricot at nose. Red pepper, raspberries red plums with hints of cloves at taste. Long finish, soft elegant tannins.
Last magnum, drank for my birthday last sunday the 25th. Smooth Bdx, just as I like 'm. Drank it with my family and best friends. Cheers!

Opaque Purple, blueberry, black raspberry and licorice on the nose.
Deep full body and smooth finish.
Delicious , it's a must try.
Thick and chewy, like getting punched with a ball of oak. After an hour of double decanting, blackcurrant and some mint evolves. Long trailing notes

Well balanced taste and full body red wine which I love to drink.
It has good cost performance.
I want to buy it again.
Blood and raw meat. Consistentouth with a closing toward vanilla. Not much tannin but a strong body. Peaking?
Lota flavors! Yeasty saltiness on the end of tongue, very smooth full bodied and balanced wine. Blackberry color

Cassis, green tone, 
Dark fruits (sloan?) rounded tannins, dark chocolate, slightly bitter, balanced long aftertaste.
Damp cellar, oak, leather, plum, cheese, blackberry on the nose. Oak, leather, cassis, vanilla, plum to taste.
Leftovers-evening, no tasting notes.
4.4 for the 2000, magnificent wine

⭐️ Classic Haut- Medoc red Bordeaux / near St. Estephe with 55% CS, 40% M, 5% CF
👁Black, next to opaque. Very compact depot, violet tinge 
👃Shouting „Grand cru Bordeaux“ at the top of its voice: Cassis, black and red berries, tobacco and smoky liquorice, perhaps a little perfume of blueberry and violets
👅Very voluminous, intense warmth. currant mix complemented by berry mix and sour cherries. medium minus dry, crisp acidity and velvety tannins 

Ultra- long barrique and berries finish 

Great classic indeed

Clear Garnet with orange rim, some slow moving legs.  Perfum on nose,  black fruit,  cassis,  plum,  smoke,  tobacco, mushroom,  wet forest floor.  Med+ body,  balanced acidity,  a lot of integrated fine tannin,  earthy,  graphite,  licorice,  chocolate,  sweet spice with asian herb. Aftertaste is mid+,  earthy and minerals,  deep and broad.  A very few wonderful made 2007.

Fine full on Bordeaux nose with musty mould, wet straw and slight tobacco. Palate can't keep up with promise of nose. I get citric fruit and some dark fruits as well on palate. Fine finish w medium lenght.

Purplish red colour, fruity forward aroma with secondary vanilla and smoke, notes of  blackcurrant, leather, tobacco, oak, cedar, cherry. Classic left bank Bordeaux with cab sav based full body and moderate tanins nicely balanced out by the age.

Great producer in an awesome vintage. Blackcurrant and damson, with a little liquorice and tobacco. This is drinking really well now , with a promise of more to come . I can't wait to open it again next year.

Very nice Haut-Medoc but expensive. Dark berry on the nose with licorice and cooked sugar. Nice mouth feel with great tannin proportions. Went well with steak. Fruit retreated with decanting giving way to the tannins, very savory. Cabernet Sauvignon 55%, Merlot 40%, Cabernet Franc 5%.

Tasted again in 2021. Slight browning at the edges but still very ruby red through the wine. Nose shows age just rounding over and red fruit and forest floor. On the palate, just so beautifully formed and holds its own with a little acidity and softness at the finish. A little over the hill, drink now.

The 09 Sociando Malet is gorgeous and, in my view, currently much more advanced than the excellent 2010.
Lovely cassis, strawberry and raspberry fruit, a touch of smoke and clear, precise tannins. This is ready to drink, but, knowing Sociando Malet, this will keep giving enjoyment for at least another 3 decades.

Showing development and has entered its drinking window.
Distinct ripe black and blue fruit, some flavours from oak (cloves, charred wood), notes of earth, tobacco, wet leaves), those give complexity to the wine.
Pleasant powdery ripe tannins.
M+ finish.

The complex nose delivers a sorrowful mood of dry earth, dried leaves, rose petals, black chocolate, and blackberries. In the mouth the tannins are still quite dry, but the alcohol and freshness are spot-on. Very nice cherry and prune aromas appear during the attack and burst to vapors in the middle. too bad the finish is a bit weak. This wine is only starting to be drinkable, wait a few years before drinking it.

Clay limestone soil. 55% Cab Sauv, 40% Merlot, 5% Cab Franc.

Impenetrably dark garnet. Very fragrant bouquet of black fruits and violets. Very spicy in the front palate, velvety texture, developing in its mid-palate blackcurrants, blackberries, blueberries, boysenberries, grape skin tannins, quite structured though well buffered by the fruits, very long, grippy aftertaste that takes away some of the lushness earlier

Chateau Sociando Mallet 2009
Bold, masculinity bouquet of fine cassis, underpin with ripe tannins, unraveling to secondaries of cigar and licorice harmoniously intertwined to present an brawny but balance bouquet. Smooth entry, layered of fine cassis riding on core of tannins being its most definitive character leaving a long grippy finish. A wine for the discerning Oenophilic.
Great wine with lots of fruit

3.9 - 30 min decant. Deep garnet color. Boysenberry, date, black cherry, eggplant and subtle mint on the surprisingly fruit forward nose. Smooth, dry palate, with good acidity. Firm, but low intensity tannins on the medium long finish. 55% CS, 40% M, 5% CF

A great producer. A great wine. Still far too young. We drank it too fast. Better would have decanted for hours. Already a wonderful Bordeaux-nose shows cassis and earthy notes. Full bodied. Currently not very accessible on the palate. High tannins! Everything still needs to find its way... But great potential. Would love to try in a couple of years.

After a very strenuous day in the office at 37 celsius. This is another sample of the excellent year 2009. 
Black currant, blackberry, raspberries .... berries! A „complete“ wine. It feels as if you bite on fresh fruit 😀.
Med+ acidity, soft tannins.
Will gain through further maturing. 
If you have a couple of bottles in your cellar, open one. If not wait another 3 years.
A fantastic value for money Bordeaux !
Great Sociando-Mallet in this sleeper vintage! Very approachable right now. Must be decanted two hours before tasting. At 30 euros it worth the price. Rebuy? Yes.
Very straight and standard Bordeaux mid body.  Great fit for nice cheese plate and olives.   Really enjoyed this at wonderful wine bar in Hamamatsu city.
Sensational. Red fruit still oh so alive. Smoke, earthy, tad of leather but mostly auch alive fruit. Prune, plum, blackberries, cassis and some vanilla. Adore it.
Christmas Eve. Blackberry, bramble, cassis, oak, vanilla and leather. Wonderfull wine. Decanted 3 h. Smooth tannins. Personal note 4.1
Very dark color, almost black. In the nose lots of fruit with cassis and blackberry. On the palette Marmelade and blueberry with cinnamon and juniper berries.
Another wine that I really wanted like but was very tight. Definitely opened up in the glass but over an hour - dark fruits, good structure, needs time.
Another of the wines we had at Noble Rot. Too many to remember what this one was like but it must have been great as they all were!
Third wine of the old wine night dinner. This being 10 years younger than the other wines it was indeed darker and richer, but still elegant with a near silky texture.
The nose tilts towards the richer side. There is good flavor, a bit citric, and electric acidity. It sports good weight, an attractive sweaty note, and will clearly age.

Nose: cassis cherry mint herbal eucalyptus
High tannins 
High acidity 
Medium body 
Palate: cassis raspberry oak  leather 
Long finish, very light  hazelnut
Really good. Classic Bordeaux taste but with loads to it. Had a glass of Waitrose rich and intense after which I usually like but tasted so poor after this 😂
To me, it is a perfect representation of a goulash soup: all tastes of pepper from green paprika, red paprika and then red and black pepper. And I love this soup :)
Very smooth, well balanced, great structure. Elegant. Mid-bodied. Dark cherry, black currant, licorice, subtle leather. Very soft tannins & long finish.
Unclassified wine which was said to be as good as grand cru classes. Noted the bitter finish at the end. Oak dominating with blackcurrant underneath.

Wine tasting night @[1|18526862|Arthur Arthur] first bottle.

Decent Medoc. This one I call a typical one. Actually grew on me from first sip onwards. 

4.0

Wow, what a pleasure!!!
A mouthful of fruit. Strawberries,  raspberries and blueberries. 
Wonderful bouquet. 
A youthful wine for its age.
Very, very nice!
This was beautiful. Rich dark red colour. All the good Bordeaux flavours, really smooth, intricacies of the wine are fully developed and just amazing long finish
Cheapy price cheapy taste

Very good indeed. Silky tannins up front, quite full in the mouth and an interesting blend of the tobacco and dried fruit you would expect, together with a fascinating hint of a “rhubarb and custard” sweetness. Length is medium but fulfilling.

A beauty! 
At the top of it’s drinking window, doesn’t need decanting. 
Solid structure, volume and length. Nice complexity with dark berries, none too overpowering. All in all more on the mild side for a Bordeaux. 
Went well with steak, structure being powerful enough.

Dense colour, striklingly pure Cabernet cassis nose, richness of fruit and firmness of ripe tannins, a wine of real class and as usual one of the very best Haut-Medocs.' – Steven Spurrier, has real power to it classic finesse and structure.  This will age beautifully.

Beautiful ruby color with a deep nose of white flowers,plums and leather.  The mouth feel is smooth and velvety with a rough but pleasant finish on the tongue. The plum and flint on the palate.  Just lovely to drink

Deep ruby colour with some garnet rim variation. Medium (+) intensity on the nose, with notes of blackberry, bramble, black currant, leather, tomato leaf, nettle, baking spice, and forest floor. The wine is developing.
The palate is dry, with medium (+) acidity, medium alcohol, high, coarse tannin, medium (+) flavour intensity, and a medium (+) body. The palate mirrors the nose. The finish is medium (+).
Very good quality: can drink now, but suitable for further ageing.

Chateau Sociando Mallet. Haut Medoc 2012 vintage. SGD71 from Eve’s Good Spirits. 

Color: Medium Ruby 

Nose: Medium + intensity. Developing. oak tobacco cassis blackcurrant earthy

Palate: Dry. Medium tannins. Medium acidity and alcohol. Medium bodied with medium + finish. Flavour intensity is medium +. black fruit dark fruit coffee

Quality is Very Good 

Drink now. Potential for aging.

A 2012 Bordeaux from the left bank of the Gironde estuary in Haut-Medoc. Blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot, and 5% Cabernet Franc. Black currant, black cherry, anise, sage, charcoal, asphalt, olive brine. It's earthy, rocky, salty. Really grippy and gritty tannins.

Nose immediately on bacon and savoury notes, with blueberries and blackberries in the background. Sift tannins, still medium. Medium acidity, medium alcohol, medium body with pronounced flavour intensity. Very long finish, on chocolate, cedar, ripe berries and meat characteristics. An outstanding wine

Tannic, tough and tight, this powerful, classically styled, cassis and herb dominated, tannic, austere, Bordeaux will require a long time to develop and become civilized. Let this sleep for 5-10 years and the experience should be better.

Hmmm. A good wine but there some ripening notes and the wine is still very astringent. Probably in a bad phase?
3.7 stars after a short aeration what is necessary.🙌🏻🍷
55% CS, 40% Merlot & 5% CF.

A deep ruby red with many legs.

Medium+ nose of plums, currants, sweet spices, licorice, dry soil, eucalyptus and pencil shavings.

The red has a medium acidity, high astringent and grainy tannins.

It’s medium bodied with 12.5%.

Medium intense flavors of plums, currants, earth, bitter herbs, tobacco, spices

Surprising smooth, but the character isn't that strong. The taste of berries are contained even after 40 mins. Perhaps need to wait longer?
Dry, medium tannins, black fruit, cassis, blackberry, cherry, cedar wood, smoke and minerality. Medium+ finish. A good (promising) wine, which could easily be aged.
Must be missing something. This was way too tannin heavy for my liking. Overpowering and dominant. Possibly a good wine hiding in there but it was lost on me
God fruit and balance excelent
Not quite as nice as the 2009, but still a great wine. Has developed the lovely warm cigar box and spicy aromas while still drinking fruity and smooth.
Good wine. A little acidic at the beginning - definitely needs time to breathe. Delightful on the nose. I would wait another 10 years before trying this again.
Red and dark berries fruits, oaky notes of vanilla, medium bodied with plums, tobacco, spice, still a lot of tannins, need more cellering to integrate, slighty dissapointing at this moment.88 DSP

97/100 extraordinary

Lovely robust and rich bordeaux, with nice complexity and intensity! 2004 bordeaux opens up and provides some lovely wines (from what is considered one of cheapest vintages of the new millennium).
The wine has an intense red bordeaux color, a multi laired nose, with a fin mix of black current, black cherry, figs, licorice and earthy nots complemented by dry coffee, body is full with firm tannins, very rich, intense and robust, with balancing acidity and a long lasting finish, my score 91, drink 2013-2020

deep ruby color, strong red fruit favour on palate, vanilla, cedar, eucalyptus, acacia, lavander included. m to m+ body, m+ tannin, m+ finishing

Opaque garnet, full bodied, lush dark plums and undertones of graphite and spice box. Nice acidity and soft tannins. Mature.
Great .As usual .Too young IMHO, it will improve.Class nose ,delicate fruit all over, very gentle. Wood not overdone, fantastic balance.Soft palate ,promising a lot  , be patient.A keeper
4.2, 2018 was a warm vintage and it provides a fuller and rounder body. Tannins are present, but not too overbearing. Still elegant and drinkable now. Preferred compared to the 2014.
Quite full, still some tannin, a bit more age in there yet
Dark grenade with orange rim, nose earthy, forest, hints of black currents, taste dark berries, oak completely integrated and less present, soft tannins, silky, medium length on the palate

Apparent green pepper and a nice base of oak. Only 5% cab Franc, would have guessed more. Very nuanced and long, although not so fruity anymore. Standing up so well after 28 years, wow!
Dark fruit nose, freshness, tannin
Fantastic 2005 vintage. This Sociando was very elegant, sophisticated. Just a velvet
Deep ruby, medium plus intensity on the nose, dark fruit, plum, blueberry, cherry, oak, medium acidity, medium plus finish, medium plus tannin, medium body, very good quality on this one
