Possibly the best Soc Mallet in last 3 decades, it’s still Rock n roll. Sweet ripe black currants, cedar and smoky meats best describe this gentle giant of haut medoc. 94pts drink now - 2030
A very blackberry taste. Medium  power, not full body and well balanced is a smooth transition to finished a drink with men not boys … after a couple of bottles ( all from France )
Smooth and velvety in the mouth. Full bodied and complex, yet also quite delicate on the palate, a very intriguing floral note on the finish. Beautiful mature Bordeaux. (Rated in March of 2012)
Warm. Slight tannin and jammy. Cranberry fruit
Excellent wine. Pity I had to share it :(
Special cuvée and well worth the wait. Dark fruit and some cigar box on the nose. Still fresh well balanced. Soft sweet tannins. Med plus body and super length. Drink it if you get the chance!
Seductive black fruit nose...which continues onto the well-structured palate. Lashings of crisp blackcurrant, leafiness; tannins are still a little chewy. Dry, slightly cedar finish.
You have a blender. Put one scoop of blackberry, blueberry, little bit of earth, one mushroom and a mint tea. Add lots of grapes and oak strips. Put it on for 30 seconds. Voila~
The 2017 Sociando Mallet is another delicious wine from this notorious Medoc winery. Plum, blueberry, smoke and barnyard. A bit tight in youth, Sociando always does better with age. A fine example!
Lovely wine, classic nose. ReADY to DRINK!
leather tobacco blackcurrant
Chef's table dinner at Imperfecto in Washington DC. Deep ruby color, very earthy and leathery. Blackberry and blackcurrant notes are secondary. It paired perfectly with the A5 wagu beef.
Nice stuff , beautiful wine, smoth as silk
This is a superb bottle of wine. Lots of black fruit socially cassis and blackberry. Leather and tobacco too, with vanilla and cola. Well worth the money. Highly recommend.
Very woody vanilla in the smell with dark fruits such as blackberry and black currant. After a while, it started smelling like chocolate. The palate was filled with very chewy fruits. Love this wine!

Red bold with intense velvety tannin 
Aromas ; leather tobacco oak cassis blackcurrant earthy cedar blackberry & a bit spicy

Dark garnet with orange tints.
Aromas of black berries, roses, cinnamon and tobacco.
Firm tannins and a slightly strong acidity. Still has potential for aging. 13% alcohol by volume
leather tobacco cassis blackcurrant cedar Bell pepper
Concentrated cassis and blackberries fruity noses, which suggest still young and developing, but also gentle bouquets are felt. Very complex, smooth texture with good balance and structure.
Dark ruby colored. Earthy nose, black fruit, licorice. To the taste, dark cherries, black berries, menthol. Medium to strong tannins, long finish. Rich, robust, powerful
Deep ruby, black plum, black currant and pungent spice, chocolate. Firm tannins medium acidity. Medium + finish
Quite wonderful - developed, silky fruit like late night mist. Great wine.
Red fruit and oak notes. Great wine
PNP. Black currant, dark fruit and a little olive. Earthy tobacco and graphite. Tannic bit not obtrusive. Lean, but not too green. Young, but offering pleasure. Lovely classic Bordeaux.
11y old smooth haut medoc with joyful nose and smooth palate. Lots of fruits well integrated with leathery tannins.
Part of Grand Old House’s Cabernet Sauvignon flight - mid to high intensity, blackberry, black currant, oak, forest floor and some herbaceous notes.
Nice bouquet of sweet black fruit, tobacco, cedar, and touch of leather. Lovely black fruit on palate with nice tannin. Att still black fruit and tobacco. Very lovely wine from Haut Medoc.
Lovely balance of acidity and flavours, plenty of tertiary fruit - blackberry with leather and cedar notes. Delicious!
Despite of 29 years of aging, it is still firm. Balckberries, casis, and bell pepper especially is pronounced. Pleasure moment of encounting ~30 year old Bordeaux in a good bottle condition.
Fruity complex, medium body, beautiful tannins - highly recommended
From magnum. Still dark ruby color. Sweet aromas of dark cherries, plums, cedar, licorice, old leather. Medium bodied, elegant and balanced with silky tannins and medium acidity. Very youthfull.
Huge emanation of expressive red fruit
Exceptional Graves. Great depth of taste. A wonderful wine
Very good dry tasty
With ludo ; in France ; must wait a little

4.3  med+ intensity with black cherry , blackberry, leather, forest floor , silky tannin 
Med+ body & alcohol , med acid, med+ length 
Great bouquet, with a clean fruit in this warm vintage 
👍😁
Great body and all you expect from Bordeaux are in place, but not 5 star
Good balance of dark fruits and tannins. Soft and accessible..Good value too
Very nice red. Bold and balanced.
Soft tannins, well balanced, Nice acidity but not so fruity as other vintages of this great domaine
I’m amazed at how vibrant this wine is. Fresh and rich. A stunning nose this is THE TIME TO DRINK! Dark fruits. Still lovely tannins. Freshness but not due to alcohol. Brilliant.
cassis blackcurrant leather tobacco oak
4.1 solid, classic, can have at least 15y.

Well made. Soft yet balanced and complex.
5.12*.16*.7=91
Cassis mint and cedar. More black fruits in the mouth and spice and cinnamon . A bit too you d but will be amazing.
Very balanced and a bit more acidic than I thought, full of red berries and cherry, oak and didn’t take much to open up. After 2 hrs, tannis remain but still very smooth
Nice not to heavy
Trying Bordeaux, a bit more tough and earthy, still full and round. Wining & dining @[1|937288|Mark van Delft]
Fantastic!
Wish list!
Nice
I
A
Delicious
Excellent!
Intense and balanced: ripe fruit (blackberry) and wooded. Slightly balsamic. Long taste and pleasant melted tannins

Very nice Medoc from the upper tier of the scale. Fruity and nicely balanced, smooth and silky finish. 
Pure class!
Drinking very well 10 years in. Integrated body with notes or cigar box, cedar boughs, vanilla and tobacco.

Dark crimson coloured core with Violet meniscus.

On the nose dark fruit and spices.

On the palate medium bodied with soft rubbery tannins. This needs time to settle, but drinks well - patience!
Dried Mediterranean aromas hints. Herbaceous like oregano some flowers. Spices predominant like black pepper. Mouth filling rounded tannins but seems aged like not properly.
Good though a bit disappointed. Too green, vegetal, lacking complexity. Believe it needs a few more years although drank it after eight years already. Needs another try later.
3,8 Smooth, equilibrated Haut Medoc that already drinks fine now. Fine soft tannins. Not of a great complexity but definitely will grow even better. Very promissing.The best SM had so far
Classic claret, polished, intense dark fruit, pepper, hint of game and powdery tannins. Can keep further but super pleasurable to drink right now
Beautiful wine from a top vintage, everything you expect from a good haut- médoc, body, tannins, the only deception will be the length and the acidity. Otherwise great wine by Jean Gautreau

3,25. Bordeaux will certainly never be my cup of tea, even when smooth and elegant like this one that offers dark fruit, leather, cedar wood, tobacco and herbal. The overall has no default without being specially exciting to my palate.

Chateau Sociando Mallet is known for their good value wines and the distinctive green character. 

This 2011 vintage is very open, generous blackcurrant and smoke on the nose, lovely concentration and powerful oak spices. Extremely young and it should have a long way to go before reaching maturity. There are some astringent tannins but nothing hash and unforgiving, a weaker vintage but shows fair depth and hints of complexity.

54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 45% Merlot, and 1% Cabernet Franc and petit Verdot.

A full bodied rich wine that is perfect to accompany a cheese and meat. Dry with  tannins and a perfect mixture of cabernet Sauvignon and merlot with a minimal addition Cabernet franc. 
A bit on the expensive side with a bottle costing $120 retail.
Big floral nose soft plums chocolate tobacco dry cranberries nice tannins and structure. Smooth round earthy and acidic. Good length. Very enjoyable. Great value.
Strong leather, barbecue on the nose with a hint of cedar. After a sip i find myself wondering why this wine was rated 91 points. It is delicious but not outstanding.
quite a bit of fruit! velvety mulberry & vanilla aromas, spicy blackberry & currants, hints of asparagus, ripe cherry, dry mouthfeel, a beautiful lunch wine for everyday
Deep ruby color. Great bouquet of dark fruit on nose with cassis notes at the forefront. Very structured and full on palate with a good finish. Nice tannins, too.
What can I say? That’s the point I suppose. Brilliant claret. 4 hours in decanter. Graphite and cedar compete on nose. Savoury balanced cassis and leather on palate. Mint and tomato leaf. 4.7
Full body , rich, dark ruby, typical Bordeaux . Long after taste. Balance fruit n alcohol . High in tanin. Should be able to go week for the next 5 years
4.7 deep ruby, dry, med+ alcohol high tannings high acidity full body but great balance between them, ripe red fruit and cherry,  leather smoke tobacco oak long finish

2000 is known to be a sleeper vintage for most of Bordeaux wines so I’ve decided to bottle ox for 7hrs before resting in decanter for 1hr. Bright dark ruby with no signs of a 22yo wine. Notes of black tea, cedar, black fruits, bacon, cigar box, and minerals on the nose, simply beautiful. Palate is silky smooth and soft with more layers of fruits like plum and blueberries lingering at the end of d long finish. Very well balanced. Loves the nose as if I’m in a cigar room. Gonna buy a few more to keep! #2/4 at Keyaki.

Wow wow! This is heavenly!
Opens up to abit of earthy leather and tinge of barnyard funk, but really well. Great integrated oaks, vanilla rounded palate and exuding blackberry, cigar and going into an elegant long finish that goes on minutes
This is beautiful and drink oh so well.....

4.3⭐ This came later in the wine dinner evening.
I had to stop taking notes since no one else was.
We all discussed how old we were when this was made 😁🍷
Good, light wine that is getting barnyard aromas but it still is holding some red fruits. Drink up🍷

In stunning condition. Pure and balanced ripeness with earthy tones, pencil shavings, with fruit layers on the nose, bright medium red, medium viscosity, and a smooth yet finely structured palate with perfectly integrated tannins. Public tasting notes say drink now, but this would easily drink well over the next 5 years

Deep ruby colour, rim a bit garnet. Aromas of cigar box, oak, vanilla, graphite, ripe blackberry, spice (nutmeg?), hint of blackcurrant
Mostly tertiary aromas after 25 yeas, but still feels fresh and balanced. Palate is medium acidity, medium body and alcohol, silky tannins, great balance, long finish. A great classic, stands the test of time, delicious.

2014 Chateau Sociando-Mallet Haut Medoc. My one of best favorite winery in Haut-Medoc AOC. Deep and rich blackcurrant, cherries, berries and plum. Rich and heavy style like a napa cab from recent vintages. It was good for me but others loved it or hated it. Tasted in 2019 Sep.

Excellent mature Bordeaux 
48% Cabernet Sauvignon 
47% Merlot 
5% Cabernet Frsnc
a pale garnet color 
Aromas of black currant, vanilla, dark fruit, tea leaves, tobacco, cigar, cigar box, cedar. 
Wine still fresh, juicy with great potential, nice acidity, round tannins, extract and structure, finish elegant and very long.

Amazingly still bright, and a lot of life left In it.    Earthiness and tannic structure of Cabernet Sauvignon, yer balanced out as a blend.   I am impressed with the wine, and surprised at the age and quality.    A winner.

I had the pleasure to drink for dinner a very good Haut-Medoc wine.
With 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot. This is Wine!Wonderful smell in the nose with ripe fruits of cherries. It's a long time ago that I drink such a good red wine. Just perfect. A wonderful finish. I'm just astonished.

Firmly into secondary character flavours; lots of leather but still dark fruit. Very smooth and excellent with a pigeon pie. Residual tannins still there although acidity waning . 2-3 yrs drinking left (NB served from half bottle)

Had to try another bottle after last time. AMAZING! Powerful, fresh, strong body, amazing red fruits (cherry, blackberry, black current) with a beautiful finish in a touch of leather and musc with a spicy finish. Strong sweet tannin that should give this wine another 5 years to develop. Amazing value for money

Colour is between ruby and garnet, can't imagine this ex-chateau 82 is still that young! Medium acidity, body and medium plus intensity.
Opened around 2hrs, red fruits, very nice spice, tobacco and minerals. 
On palette: rich fruit, spice and tobacco.
Soft tannin with a long finish!
The fruit and tannin can support the wine to age for at least 10 more years.

Medium purple. 

Very fresh, albeit closed, nose. 

Evolving on the palate. Chocolate-y and coffee notes dominate. Mixed in with earth and gravel notes. Under all is a hint of dark fruits. 

Finely grained tannins. Complex and rich body.

Deep purplish ruby.  Surprisingly, a pronounced nose of violet blossom, blackberry, cassis, herbs and cedar.  M+ acidity, medium tannin, medium to M+ body.  M+ finish, iodine, blackberry, new oak.  Marginal 4 stars.  2 July 2020.

Vast, impressive cedar and cassis on the nose. Some tertiary notes. Palate of exhuberant crushed cassis shoots, giving an herbaceous dimension to the experience. Very elegant levity. Remarkably long. Class. Exceptional value.

Smokey! Full of tar and Coco. Chard jalapeño skin, roasted green pepper, very spicy knows. Luscious and much more rich and powerful on the pallet. Full, developed Cocoa and truffles with cherry Liqueur.

Following the  Saint-Julien tasting of Lagrange and Léoville-Poyferré   yesterday, I continue  the 2002 Bordeaux session with Sociando-Mallet in Haut-Médoc. The color is still dark. Open nose of black current, cedar, graphite. Full and long on the palate with superb balance. This is a very racy wine with fine tannins. Superb effort in this vintage, more complete than  the 2 Saint-Julien. Either I have to downgrade them of a 1/2  star either I give 4 1/2 to Sociando.
Choice is done !

This is now likely to be past its summit.
Tasting note for '90 from 09/2005. Tasted more than 11 yrs ago, this was drinking perfectly, being very ripe, with smooth tannins.
My rating refers to the tasting notes from 2005 so expect this to have decreased considerably in stars.
What struck me then, were its texture &mouthfeel which was rough& grainy. Apart from that, pure pleasure, w plenty of dark chocolate, prunes, mocca & toasted wood. This felt extremely powerful with lots of captured sun (back in 2005)!

No significant notes taken. Young but very approachable at pop and pour. Time in the glass improved things. Full bodied but quite taut. Great typicality. Probably better in a couple of years but won’t need much more than that.

Had the 2000 Vintage. Opened at 6 on a Tuesday, because, why not? Initial impressions: aromas of earth and fruit. Hit of black fruit, black cherry, blackberries, plum. Then the earthy notes; Forest floor, mushrooms. Finally a touch of dried herbs. Edit: entering into the third hour and this wine is really starting to open up.

Deep ruby colour with an intense nose and an abundance of earthy tones: farm yard, cigar box, forest floor, and black currant leaf. Aromas of cedar, black currant, and dried blackberries. High acid, medium alcohol, and very smooth tannins, yet still clearly present. Long, lingering finish. Great now but definitely has the potential for further aging.

The wine starts with fragrant nose showing notes of black fruit, rose, cedar, sweet vanilla and black pepper with inky tone. The palate brings more of the same as the nose with rich texture yet delivers freshness. The dense finish shows structure and blueberry flavor with graphite accent. This is quintessential example of Left Bank with firm tannins backbone that promises great potentiality in future.

Happy Médoc Bordeaux Sunday! This ‘16 from the Northern Medoc is ripe and ready to enjoy! Actually doesn’t need to be decanted! 🤭
👁 Deep ruby purple 
👃 Cassis, blackberry, black cherries 🍒 and plum with subtle cigar box, and savory herbs 🌿 
👅 Opulent compote of black and blue fruits, thyme, tobacco, orange 🍊 and chocolate 🍫. Full bodied with M+ balanced acidity, structured supple fruit-wrapped tannins, velvety mouthfeel 👄 M+ complexity and finish. 50% M/47% CS/3% CF, 95% saw 12 mos in NFO, 5% in stainless.

Stop paying ultra high premium for those Bordeaux 1855 wines when you can have the same (if not better) quality from less commercial producer. Extremely smooth tannins, balanced red fruits, dark berries and plum. It opens up perfectly after 45 mins right from the bottle. It feels like a 2000 second growth wine.

When first opened little nose and mildly acidic background.After 60 mins a delightful concert of light fruit,pleasant mineral and aromatic woods appeared in nose and attack.  Mid palate perfectly integrated, no one feature being pronounced but everything delicious on the tongue. Finish was very long not because it was powerful but because it was soft yet intense. Like the cello's last soft solo note in a string concerto that u feel more than hear and seems to go on forever . Drink other bttls w/in 2 years

4.2/5.0
Medium garnet  color. 
Medium + intensity aromas of faded dry berries, balsamic, leather, licorice, eucalyptus, mint, tobacco, cigar box.
Palate: dry, med acidity, med.smooth tannins,  med+ body. Med.+ finish.
Resume: well balanced and structure. Aged wine. Drink now. Very good to outstanding. 
Weinacademie, WSET4 Dip session,  10.2019

Colour wise much younger then 31 years on the label. Also 1986 the vintage with the tannins that never? will soften. Black plums is predominantly in this cool vintage. I recommend to decant this wine for some softness. Interesting.

On the nose cassis, loads of black fruit, red fruit, chocolate, and vanilla. Oak spice notes definitely predominant here.

On the palate juicy dark fruit and chocolate, along with dusty tannins and a nice kick of acidity on the finish. 

While better with more age, this is sitting in a pretty drinkable spot dominated by primary fruit notes. A nice Bordeaux that seems to be punching above its weight! A good glimpse into what the higher ceiling of Bordeaux can offer, while still being reasonably priced.

I recently met with an 82-year-old vigneron from Margaux who said he would sell his soul to have a vintage like 2014, every year. With a wine like this Sociando-M, you can see what he meant. It’s classic Bordeaux - the fresh, cedary, minty aromatics, with complex fruit underneath - but the palate is supple even if the tannins are clearly present. 
Before global warming top wines like this needed 20 years to soften. TO RECEIVE MY NEWSLETTER, CLICK HERE: http://www.theotherbordeaux.com.au/contact_us .

A bit too young at this point, but has lots of aging potential. Black currant, cassis, green peppercorn, and black licorice on nose and palate. Finish has lots of cigar, cedar, and gravel. Oak has not yet integrated with the wine. Acid and tannin is in balance.

Wonderful wine, with such a clearly defined expression. Dense, yet fine and delicate black fruits body dominated by cassis and - to a lesser extend - prunes. Perfectly melted notes of oak. Far away notes of mint and chocolate.

This is truly a master work!

for this young vintage, the smoky and cigar-like quality is a surprise. glad to see it has opened up this much already. medium+ body. delicious and a great value in Bordeaux. not enough intensity and length to put this at 4.5, but I'm very happy about this multiple bottle purchase. 4.25. 
next bottle in 2024.

94
there‘s a lot going on here
smoky oak aromatics - coffee, bitter chocolate, cocoa; somewhat floral. pronounced dried fruit aromatics - plum, amarena. black pepper too. 
tannins and structure is still going strong - not showing too much ageing. powerful; earthy & spicy, pepper and humus; cocoapowder, leather, graphite. 
powerful with a long finish, rich & complex with even more potential

Wonderful dark garnet dress with microscopic mahogany reflections. Very inviting bouquet releasing aromas of black fruits, woody notes and slightly carmaelised. Bountiful flavor intensity with still robust tannins and an incredibel complexity. Lingering finish. A great 31 years old wine of the region of Haut Médoc. I can just suggest it (4,3 points)

Bordeaux and Barbecue! Few things beat a bit of clarat to wash down a Jersey Beef steak.

Château Sociando-Mallet 1997
👀 Classic Bordeaux ruby red with garnet rim
👃Fresh medoc ripened by the age, cassis, vanilla and leathery notes. Left in the decanter for over an hour and came to life in an anticing way! 
👅 Mellow tannins and a lovely long oaky finish

88/100

Blackcurrent, cassis and some tobacco on nose. Palate complex with a stunning mouthfeel. Lots of current with a lovely cigar box, tobacco and mineral mid palate. Finish complex with a bit of black pepper. Nice subtle but elegant and present tannin.

3.8
Red fruit, a ton of oak character; tobacco, cigar box, tar, cedar, pencil shavings, a hint of sour, wet wool.
Medium++ body
Concentrated, dry, spicy mouthfeel with punchy acidity and seriously grippy tannins.

Perfect brillant red, vanilla on the noise at the beginning and directly supplanted by oak and cassis. Wonderful experience for an under-rated vintage (2013). For me one of the best Q/P in Bordeaux !!!!

Beautiful colour with blackberry and smoke heavily on the nose. Intense palate with more berries and oak. Medium+ body with surprisingly sweet tannins for this classic. This one needs time to open up properly.

The 2014 edition of the Sociando Mallet consists of 37% CS, 60% Merlot and 3% CF. This wine with its red currant colour has Still some potential to reach the equilibrium. Nice hints of cassis, tobacco, oak, chocolate, pepper, tyme and licorice are really making this wine into a beaty. Still some years ahead

Medium to deep ruby in color. Tobacco, vanilla, oak, cherry, black cherry and raspberries on the nose. The palate is smooth with well rounded tannins which follow its aroma. The wine has a quite short aftertaste but overall is very smooth and enjoyable. 4.3

Give this an hour’s decant and it will sing! Ripe nose of strawberry, vanilla and tobacco. Intense leather. Medium bodied and well structured. Initially acidic, red currant and earthy, giving way to smoother cassis and black currant. Some herbal secondary notes. Good depth, long cigar box finish. This is the real deal and in a great place right now.

Deep ruby in color with aromas of gravel, blackberry, sandstone, newly tanned leather and earthy. Dry, heavy tannins, medium acidity, medium body, medium alcohol with flavours of black currant, blackberry, vanilla, earthy and lite tobacco. Long finish. Very good.

I opened this in the new year gathering to celebrate 30 years since 1990. Cork was not in good shape, but after I managed to remove (cannot say open) it, bouquet from the bottle was excellent with frity snd flowery scent. Then I tasted it to find slightly disappointing taste despite the aroma. I thought it gone by now. Nevertheless, I decantered the wine, and left it for an hour or so. What a mysteriously good taste it was. It of course needed breathing after 30 years sleep. An excellent experience!

Medium to deep ruby. Refined grippy tannins, beautiful  aromas but still a bit retrained, tobacco, plum, black cherry and cedar. Definitely representative of the higher end grand cru classes and a value if you consider it's big bros on the left bank. Excellent vintage, age worthy and will only get more expensive soo... 94-95pts

Opened in 2020. This wine is in full maturity now, throwing off moderate sediment. Must be decanted. Browning around the edge, nose closed at first but opened beautifully after 30 minutes. Great drinking now, but doubt it would last past 5 years.

My very first well-known sociando-mallet, so satisfied! 😍😋🍷
Ripe cassis, blackcurrant jam, cherry, spice, licorice, oak and tobacco. 
Mouth is super round, balanced, juicy, polished and lingering. A quite decent left bank Bordeaux! 👍

2000 - nice freshness of blackberry and dark cherry extenuated by a smokey spearmint and eucalyptus note. Cigar soaked leather on the tertiary. Elegant and soft through the mid with a nice balance and finish. 93pts

92/100. 2014 in Jan 2021
Deep ruby red, no sign of ageing 

Nose: Tobacco, cedar, plum, cassis, pencil lead, dust, perfume

Palate: Med-full body, fresh med tannin, med acidity. Spicy. Med finish. Dry.

Decant 2+hrs.

Archetypal Médoc! It immediately smells of bordeaux. For those who love bashing bdx, this is also terroir.
It's cherry-cassis-cedarwood! Some evolutionary shiitake, some saddlebags. Perfectly melted tannins.

After decanting for an hour this bottle showed great balanced taste, like the power with coffee and chocolate and still smooth enough to drink it without food. Would love to try it again, good value for the price.

Smoke and plum, plums and leather in smell... it was magnum, so taste can be quite unique. At first was stunned by tannins and acidic - but then it starts to flourish and invites to dig into the glass with nose and all receptors. Asks for a meat! Reminds me of good Spanish wines, but it’s good by its own, with character who you would like to invite on your table. Like this wine!

Visually, a dense, dark purple wine with hints of age.  Aromas of cedar, tobacco leaf, dark fruits, herbs. Grippy tannins and medium acidity.  With time in the glass, earthy and peppery flavors emerged.  This is a gorgeous wine  and I was so happy to share it with great friends.

Vintage 2015: stunningly rich odors of perfectly ripe red and black fruits, metuciously well balanced. In its taste the tabacco, toast, oak and  earthy tones persuasingly carrying the fruits as their younger family. A few more years and these fruits will stand their own ground, surprising their carriers with an adolescent energy

A magnificent wine. Lovely deep and dark red colour. Despite its age, it has a young, fresh and fruity taste immediately after opening. Good balance between alcohols and tannins. Lively red fruit and cherries on the palate and a warm velvety feel. Good length with added complexity. Al in all a pleasure to drink.

Oh man! Saved this for a while and happy i did. 2000 was a good year and this wine proves how long lasting they can be. This is super dense, dark / purple. Herbs, cassis, blackberries and so on. No sediment. Low acidity. Nice finish. A bit green. Super classic Bordeaux. And I love it. It is still young. This is not a wine for faint hearted. It's big and rough. Perfect to a steak like ribeye. 90p and can lay in the cellar 10 more years with more complexity to come I think.

Dark mahogany, opaque, with dark orange rim. On the nose fresh breadcrust, rye bread, coffee, dark berries, nutmeg, a hint of stewed red cabbage. Pine resin, mon cheri chocolate, coffee, cherry on the palate, long chocolate/blackberry finish. Medium + body, excellent fruit ripeness, tannins with optimum grain, great acidity. 12,5 % abv but feels a bit more than that. 55 % CS, 40 % Merlot, 5 % CF. Remarkable balance. Heartwarming experience.

👁 deep garnet
👃🏻 medium intensity green capsicum, farmyard, leather, mushroom, pencil shavings, cedar, cassis, and blackberry. Developing
👅 medium+ body, medium+ acidity, dry, medium alcohol, high coarse tannin that settled down to medium with aeration in the glass. Plenty of black fruit still with some cedar. A long finish
🎯 very good quality but still drinking young, needed to decant at the rate we were drinking it! Come back to it in another few years. Paired very well with rabbit leg!

Dark garnet-red color with purple reflections in the glass! On the nose scents of black and red currants, some plum, cedar and vanilla! On the palate medium to full body with plenty of ripe tannin with a long finish! Cheers!

Third bottle and all are fine. I prefer this 97 to 01 and 03. It takes almost 2 hours in decanter to get open. And then you get classic Medoc bouquet of cassis, cigar, blackberry, leather, coffee and much more. Solid structure, mellowed tannins, good freshness and fine taste. If only it would have some more body and ripeness in the taste, it would be perfect.

M+ Ruby. M nose, earthy, spice, dark cherry and blackberry. M+ body, intensity, tannins. M acidity and long finish. Blackberries, spice, cherries, cassis earthy. Elegant and Excellent, true experience, another couple of decades to go!

More Photos: of this bottle: https://www.instagram.com/grapesandrice/

Dark Ruby core with brick red hue. Nice elegant nose along with blackcurrant, blueberries and plum intermixed with earth, subtle tobacco, cedar oak, hints of violet and some rusticness.
Good robust entry, exhibits blackcurrant and blackberry on palate. Nice youthful notes with lively acidity and structure. Very enjoyable and a pleasant surprise. Best Sociando I ever tasted. Very good and show well against other Cru classed Bordeaux tonight.

8/20: This bottle from ‘90 was in excellent shape, cork as well. Opened 4h before drinking, not decanted. This wine was just great, certainly did not taste that old! Tannines almost melted, lots of fruit and kept on evolving over the evening. Fruit mainly plums, you need to like it. It was not a monotonous wine, it is far too complex for that, but the fruit was too focused.
Although old, it can go easily for many more years in it’s drinking window.
Have also ‘04. Curious to taste soon and compare...
Cheers!

Ruby colour, some clear rim, hint browning. Dark broody fruit, spicy with some blackcurrant. Light medium body. Lovely dry black fruit. Nice hint of pepper and very well integrated tannins and lovely length. Nice complexity

Dried blackberry, cloves, dried plum, dusty, even forest floor. Lovely aroma especially for the relatively young vintage.

Taste is much fresher, full of rich blackberry, cloves, vanilla and cedar. Tannins are rounded, acidity on a good level. 

Good bottle, will enjoy it after 2-4 years more. 92/100

Young, energetic I would say as it is 16 years old, at least 5 to 10 years to go, strong feel of tanning but smooth, dark violet in colour, a lot of forest berries, enjoyable together with the grilled spring chicken today.

Opened in August 2018. Initially closed, it opened up very well after 10 minutes in the glass. Loads of fruit still, even after all these years. Blueberry and blackberry are vivid, with dark chocolate and leather bringing in the rear. This will probably last another 10 to 15 years.

Brutally tannic when first opened. Tasted every 20 minutes for the next couple of hours and got better each time. On the second day was completely mellowed and balanced. Fruit comes forward, tannins soften, really great bottle. Needs some real time to decant.

Dark red with purple on edges. 
Nose: blackberries, pencil shaves, forrest fruits, wood.
Taste: medium + tannins, medium acidity, forrest fruits, medium finish.
For me, this is like a benchmark Bordeaux, howeber still young, green tannins, more years to develop more complexity. It will become 4.5 stars wine.

Opaque dark red to black.
Nose: dark fruits, green herbs, minerals, cassis, liquorice, green pepper, graphite and dry floral, white flowers. 
Medium bodied, dry with moderate acidity. Tannins are subtle and velvet. Good finish of dry herbs, dry florals which lasts over 10 seconds.
A great North Medoc expression.

Medium + intensity on the nose and on the palate. Nose: ripe red fruits,  blackcurrant, tomato leaf, plum, smoke. Palate: blackcurrant, plum, vanilla, caramel, smoke. Medium + finish. Med+ finish. Still has potential.

Dark ruby red with slight brown reflexes.
On the nose, cherries, cassis and raspberries. On the palate, dry, dark cherries, black currants, light bitter almonds notes, tobacco notes, wet autumnal forest soil, well-integrated tannins, medium alcohol and long finish. Still youthful!

Nose of dark fruit and antique wood furniture.  

The palate features dark fruit -cassis/ black currant, floral notes- violet/ roses in the mid palate. Mahogany, perfume, and cocoa with a touch of barnyard/ saddle leather, on the full and long finish.  

First night I thought this was probably a little past peak, but it kept building all night and after trying the last glass on day 2, I don’t think it is going to fade anytime soon. 

Give this a good amount of air.

Excellent Haut medoc. Despite its age the wine is perfect and still has a few years to go. It starts with beautiful black fruit, plum, blackberry, followed by pepper and soft oak. Once the wine opens up red cherry appear. The nose has plenty of wood combined with leather.

Happy Bordeaux Sunday 👍🇫🇷🍷!

I guess this qualifies as part deux! Saw @[1|8254419|Hangi] drink this from 2009 so when I saw this available, had to try! Estate founded in 1633. Estate was bought by Jean Gautreau in 1969 who grew it from 7ha to 85ha today ! Now operated by daughter Sophie. Blend of 50 Merlot, 45 CS, 5 CF!👃of cocoa, cigar box, blueberry, . 👅is med + acidity, tannins gritty, long length, blackberry, blueberry, dark chocolate & graphite flavours. Lovely: 4.1🌟 but not that ready to drink!

fruity sweet nose of black currant, 2003 is beginning to open up, ripe and good now, but can be stored for another 10-15 years, tast of cassis and blackcurrant, aftertaste of graphite and mushroom, leather and tobacco. 
A Classic Bordeaux, and value for money, 90-92p

Great wine. Neede lots of air. Double decanted in the morning and truly only opened up 12hrs laters. Typical CabSav nose but started a little thin and stalky on the palate. Changed over time to black and blue fruit, pencil shavings and rusty nails. Really delicious tannins and a long finish.

Happy Bordeaux Sunday part-dieu from one of the better VFM châteaux. Heard it could rub shoulders with or best some of the 4th or 5th growth estates.

Nose of black currant, menthol tobacco, toasted oak, dried herbs, leather.

Palate open and ripe, grippy tannins have started to soften but still youthful punch, lots of dark fruit, more methol tobacco (reminds of my misbegotten youth smoking methols), oak present but well integrated.

Really great, went up against a Malescot-Exupery and held its own!

Very special representative of the Haut-Medoc. Excellent bouquet of ripe prunes and leathery notes. Perfect balance of fruit, sharp acidity and velvety tannins. Could be pleasurable for more several years. In one word, Delightful!

Elegant Bordeaux blend, despite of its age it has a dark garnet color (bit of brown rim), moderate aroma and smooth velvety flavor. Aromas intensify with breathing: dried black fruit like cherry or cranberry, cedar, vanilla and it has some magical earthiness in it. Very smooth and pleasant spicy, ripen blueberry flavor, subtle oak, long finish.

👀 dark opaque ruby
👃🏻 earthy leather and smoke only hints of blueberry cassis maybe
👅 dry, good balance, smooth, suprisingly short
Young, tannic, fresh fruit, will develop well. The Merlot is very present. Seriously opened and improved with time and air. Worked well with tacos.

Blind Tasting, Bordeaux and Rhone Blends + Red Herrings #4

Tired wine that comes from a crap wholesaler would can't store wines properly.

med ruby, m+ intensity of nose, earthy, BlackBerry,blkcurrant, red plum, savory. 
m acidity, m+ body, med body, tannin n finish
Bordeaux 2010 #6. Classic style Bordeaux offering 13.5% alcohol, medium body, a lot of blackberries, black currants and some licorice.
Very fruity, cherry taste.
Deep, smooth leather and vanilla notes
Sweet, fruity, mid to full body.. One of the best Haut-Medoc I ever had..
Big fan of Bordeaux wines.

This is surprisingly good 

Drank with Harmeet / Rajeev
Strong aroma, fruity well bodied wine. Strong after taste
A great Bordeaux. Oak ash tobacco and a great balance of tannins
Soft tannins, dark fruit, tar, pepper, wet leaves.
Cedar in the nose and on the palate. A bit tannic. But smoothen out over time
Blackberry and back cherry notes. Typical Left bank Bordeaux blend.
cherry cough syrup cherry syrup cherry cola cherry bing cherry
Lovely nose violets on palate soft tannins
Smooth and went back for more 🍷
Milk chocolate, butter, and yogurt
Just bought 2 magnums and will leave a comment once opened.. But looking forward to it...
Beautiful wine fruity and harmonious
Very nice.  Enjoying this with the team in Kindli restaurant in Zurich!
Very good smooth
Kind of heavy oak, otherwise a nice wine.
Have been longing for a good Bordeaux...
Dark fruits, tobacco, less acidity, Medium body, cassis
Earthy, fruity, high tannins. Full flavour
Perfect wine with a t bone ! Nose very tipical, round, tannins just smooth and so long in mouth...
Fantastic, buy again
Full bodied, smooth and balanced. Cherry and tobacco. Young still but well structured.
Was a good full bodied wine ... Quite nice with a nice smooth finish

How can you not like a
2005 Bordeaux wine :) 👏🏻👋🍷
Wow beautiful smooth elegant and tastefully magnificent
Superb time to drink
No tastingnote yet!
Black berry nose and taste, good in Valentine's day.
cherry, leather, not very expressive nose. Nice balance in the palate, fine tannins, good fruit.

Blackberry, prune, tobacco, oriental spices, some herbs, leather and cedar in the inviting nose with mostly secondary and tertiary notes. Fruit‘s gone almost completely. Med body, round tannins. Lacks some power on the palate, somewhat watery texture. Instead there’s elegance and good drinkability. Good to open now without too much potential anymore. (Served by glass)

Savoury and stinky on the nose. Dried dark cherry and blackcurrant. Orange peel. Dark roast coffee. Roasted coconut. Horse sweat. Dusty on the palate. and mouthfeel is a bit viscous. I think there is both brettanomyces and oxidation, but it is a nice wine if you like the style.

LPV Lyon 2, Feb 2019: menthol, tobacco, cigarette ash, lots of green pepper, touch of red fruit. On the day, rather strict palate, firm tannin and acid spine, not giving tonnes of pleasure and we were surprised by the vintage. However, on day 2, this relaxed and a pleasing cassis character came fourth. Nice to try this

Tannin bomb! After decanting for ten hours  first signs of pleasure. Intense nose with flavors of dark berries, raspberries, lavender, bacon, cinnamon, black truffle and toasted white bread. Subdued brett. Creamy mouthfeel but still dominating tannins and noticeable acidity. Medium-long finish with nice echoes of honey and blood orange. Too young at the moment, but a safe bet for the future.

Had the 2012 vintage. Recommended to let it breathe for an hour or so. Oaky, tobacco notes stand out followed by blackcurrant and plums. Paired it with roasted meats and buffalo wings, followed by nacho cheese tortilla chips and Lays Roasted fish flavor.

Intens ruby red color. Vanilla, black fruit, brettanomyces, pepper, paprika, cherries on the nose. Quite nice, but also dirty with the Brett. In the mouth, this evolves to cedar wood, thyme, black ripe cherries. Very long finish. Fatiguing wine though, not my favourite.

Really liked this wine. Elegant nose. Wasn't in you face, was round; full. Middle rolled around and around in the mouth. Not had a huge amount of Bordeaux, started on a journey this year. Great starting reference point.

2009. Deep ruby blood color. On nose grass, fragrance bouquet of linden/acacia, with fresh dark fruit, slight oak at the background. Medium body, soothing though thin in flavors on palate, low acidity, some chewy tannin,  medium length. Wine of a famous but unclassified haut medoc chateau.

This 2009 Sociando Mallet is drinking well and just starting to evolve, combining primary and secondary notes.  Notes of blueberries and ripe blackberries with some tobacco, toast and a hint of minerality.  Medium body with silky palate and some warmth on the finish too. Quite classic and austere but very pleasant

Sociando-Mallet have produced a really decent wine in 2003.  It is now a fairly mature, meaty and satisfying Haut-Médoc.  A roughly 50/50 blend of CS and Merlot with 5% Cab Franc.  Blackberry, blackcurrant and plum fruit.  It is the tertiary development that defines the wine, with forest floor, tobacco and game on a softly textured palate.  Savoury, slightly earth.  I'd drink over the next 5 years, although some will enjoy it for longer.  Good wine 🍷👍

Vivino meet up with Yariv. Theme: New & Old World Bordeaux Blends. First red of the night. Served blind. I guessed Bordeaux, but I have too little expertise to go further than that. It was interesting to hear the Bordeaux experts guessing and discussing the vintage.

Barnyard notes. Dry and smooth. Slight note of carbon. Mostly dark fruit and hint of earthiness.

Beautiful wine. Thanks for sharing See Wee!

A difficult one to rate, this high-profile Haut-Médoc. When tasting it blind, it was a 4-star wine. But then seeing which one it is, you can't help expecting more. This is a Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated blend with 40% Merlot and 5% Cab Franc, but if I'd had to guess, I would have gone with Loire CF. In spite of its 13 years, it had little evolution, with just the onset of tertiary notes under a layer of cherries and blueberries, and a distinct green, savoury character of green beans, herbs and tomato sauce.

Tasting the 2010 in 2021. 
4.0⭐️
A friend of a dear friend opened his ‘cave’ and allowed me to choose - and this I selected 🙏🏼
This wine is lovely, and just entering its drinking window. 
Bordeaux blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon ; 40% merlot ; 5% Cabernet franc. A Saint-Estèphe-like return with less invested capital up front ! 
Suede and lavender on the nose. 
Blackberry compote; smoke; cedar on the palate. 
Paired handsomely with 3 year comté and walnut and oat biscuits. 
Santé !! 🙏🏼🍷🇫🇷🔥

Very Good 4.0

I clearly do not drink Bordeaux as often as I used to but this kind of bottle reminds you why it is so famous.

Dark great robe with purple hinge. Nose of black berries (black currant, blackberry), cigar box and oak. The mouth is lush and ripe with the same fruity aromas. There is also a spicy and woody tone of mellow liquorice, sandalwood, cocoa. The tannins bring a nice structure and elegance to the wine without any dryness, they balance the ripeness and alcohol perfectly. Very elegant.

I have been buying this non classified chateau for many years now and all via en primeur so happy to open a 2010 after nearly 10 years. On the nose, blueberry and black raspberry fruit, a hint of cassis, some licorice and notes of graphite. Deep, full-bodied and almost excruciatingly tannic, shows still long way to go for cellaring. Love the evolution, and the integration between fruits and smoke. Stunning wine and happy with my choice.

Medium power in this smooth red. Good tannins but without being harsh. Good dark fruit in nose although not much present in palate. Pleasantly oaky and a tad smoky. It might be better after a bit more cellaring. Good aftertaste.

Very enjoyable Haut-Medoc ( just next to St Estephe).
Color is deep ruby with a rust rim.
Nose - blackberry, plum, tobacco.
Taste - dark fruit and dark chocolate with grainy tannins.  Maybe not as complex as it can be. Well integrated oak. Finish is long with tannic and round acidity notes.

Delightful rich claret from this excellent producer. Dark ruby. Lots of blackcurrant fruit and a touch of cedar smoke on the nose. In the mouth great balance of acidity, blackcurrant and smooth tannins. Finish is long balancing acidity and tannin. Very enjoyable.

👀 dark ruby color
👃🏻 Plum and black currant aromas with secondary herbal eucalyptus notes and tertiary leather and game bouquet
👅 Dry wine with high tannins and acidity, high intensity, and medium finish

Deep ruby red in colour, similar to a claret. Red berries in the background with a nose of Violets and sherbet, under tones of tabac leaf. In the mouth a smokiness of mild strawberry jam and maybe (believe it or not) the saltiness of grilled streaky bacon !

Dark red coloured blend of 55% CS, 40% Merlot and 5% CF. The first impression is very earthy, leather, tobacco and strong espresso. Good structure, fine balance but the earthy tones make it a little bit disapointing to me personally. I found no indication of the vintage on the labels. 89 pts.

This wine is still alive and rich on the nose: slight herbal undertones, unctuous black and purple fruit, black currant, blackberry, hints of leather, and anise. the On the palate it’s pure plum, baking spice, medium plus body, grippy tannins. Well balanced, delicious, 10 years old, excellent condition. I wish I could buy a case. Cheers.

Enticing nose of dark fruit, graphite, wet stone, cedar, smoky aromas and undergrowth, soft mouthfeel with satiny texture, excellent structure and remarkable concentration, heaps of aromas of blackcurrant, black cherry, wild herbs, licorice and pepper richly laced with earthy undertones , well-knit acidity and dissolved tannins leading to a long, salty finish. This is a very well made wine with composed elegance, restrained power and surprising freshness, its sturdy frame shrouded in lively energy.
⭐⭐⭐⭐,5👌

3rd wine from our 10th wedding anniversary. Dark purple. Like it was made yesterday. Plenty of fruit:  cassis, blackberry and dark fruit. Tobacco and oak with strong tannins. Will continue to develop in the bottle.

Oyé Oyé my Vaillants Vivino's Knights! ⚜️
Sir Michael Le Grand has the honor & courtesy to welcome Lord Sociando-Mallet! ⚔️:)
As I have a few on 2010, I wanted to see after 6 years what he has in the stomach..
Ho wow! Jean Gautreau confirms his talent for his "no classified" ashievement! A beauty of elegance enhanced by his own natural strength! Firm tannins, opaque, spectacular festival of fresh berries, graphite touch, sensual & dense, finishing on royal caudalies! 😋
Santé Valorous Knights! ⚜️:)🍷
4+++++

Blind tasted 7 left bank Bordeaux red blends from Medoc.  We interspersed them with 3 releases of a WA Margaux style red blend for comparison.  The Washington NV reds stood up extremely well.  This Wine from Haut-Medoc was my #4 of the French wines.
Classy and classic Bordeaux red - lots of soft but black berries and leathery, tobacco notes. Good structure with real quality
Wonderful. As some others have said, can age even more, but lovely berry palate and deep tannins. The quality is in the after taste.... 💃🏻
Green bell pepper notes? Yeah, in spades! But also a fantastic, balanced, delicious wine. Lucky for me, I love Chinon, and I love this.
Ruby color, on nose dark fruit, in taste taste cigars, oak, black currant. Perfect balanced full body, nice tannins, long finish
Predominantly cab Sauvignon and merlot. Great nose and deep ruby colour.  Unclassified growth but at least Cru borgeois standard.
Good value wine. Faint berries, woody on the nose. Spicy, slightly tannic but smooth. A mouth full without being overly powerful. Very nice
Great Haut Médoc. Balanced and complex, distinct notes of cigar box, chocolate sweetness. Drooling tannic acidity. Pretty long aftertaste (30'')
Very pleasant, definitely classed growth quality. Plum, earth and coffee.
Cassis, leather, tobacco leaf
88 pt
Chateau tasting.
Good
Wonderful bordeaux wine !
genial
Tobacco, cedar, nice balance
Excellent
Nice vintage. Full body. Great tannins. Tobacco and fruits
90 pts
Still too young, green and tannic. Drank this 2009 as a reference to the 1999 and its no match yet. Needs a lot more time to develop properly.

Stunning. Fantastic balance and complexity. 
Massive dark fruit - cherry and blackcurrant.
Round, intense, bit short in the mouth, strong tanins
With fallow deer at Gordon Ramsay *** in London. Very good!
Wip
Nice Evolution for the bad vintage!
Great value

Delightful Haut-Médoc
55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc
Excellent! Slight oak but very well finished.
Bordeaux clasico
Gorgeous!!!!!!!
Red fruit, tobacco, and nice full body, great balance and texture, medium length. 13 year old and still in good shape even though I don’t believe it will last forevermore...
Great wine with a good blend of berries, oak and metal scent

One that really "aged like fine wine". Smooth tannins, leathery, tobacco, with a bit of spice. Dark berries like cassis and blackcurrant. 

Overall good drinking by itself
Big Bordeaux nose of violets and underbrush, wild black berries, cranberry. Palate is full, structured with grainy tannins, polished medium finish..needs 7-10 years to mature to its potential.
I like it!
Nose of herbal points and green peppers, dark fruit front with restraint, soft lovely middle, tannic back end with surprisingly sharp acidity. Beautiful.
Firm tannins, thoughtful but deliberate. Black fruit, tobacco and leather
Still Deep and purple in colour.Fully bodied with a lot of dark berries. Will keep.
Slightly young though this will be an even more awesome wine in a few years.
A lot of personality, and still focused on the fruit and balsamic notes of mint. Long and persistent
Vegetal in character. Capsicum, bell pepper, spices, backed by cherries. Well aged and enjoyable now.
the thrill of meeting a teenage love again, later in life. wisdom and introspection replace fire and urgency.
Beautiful to drink, balanced and round. Very elegant old style Bordeaux. Probably at its peak but no rush.
Great future potential, but way too young when I tasted it here in DC. BlackBerry, cassis and even some lavender for me.
Really good quality wine. Good tannins, ripe fruit with lots of cherry, short finish. Bought at Santis
Worth the price, now over 10 years old. Big, robust fruit. Very little acid. Rich and meaty. Perfect with any cheese.
Magnificent magnum accompanying our leg of lamb in Maple Knoll. The peppery finish - the complexity of taste - I'm still in awe!
It told its age with a dull fruit but with a smoothness that belied it. A great accompaniment for meat.
Aged perfectly. Cassis fruits very expressive on the palate with a perfectly balanced tannic structure.
Great wine with a coupe of friends! Nice fruit that come to age. Balanced with good acidity and tannins.
Shy nose with a hint of sandalwood, intense red body. Perfect tannin balance, smooth with a body rich in smoke and cassis.
Difficult year but very easy to drink! Very elegant classic left bank. Drinking perfectly right now. Great value!
Decent enough Bordeaux. Pencil shavings, graphite and plum. The balance is almost there. Medium body with firm tannins.
Wine of the night: this will hold for more than 10 years further. It was good from the get go and got even better.
This wine gets better every time I drink it! Wonderful earthy aroma and dry tart dark fruit taste. Excellent
Simply outstanding. The epithome of good Bordeaux. Refined and bold simultaneously. And simply indefinite aftertaste.
Green herbaceous notes. Wood and spic but Superbly balance with optimal level of acidity. Young and vibrant - very enjoyable
Yummy. Deep and intense: a blackberry, a plum, a tobacco and leather with high acidity, medium tannins. Old and kicking.
Rich dark coffee and blackberry aromas carry through to the palate. Tannins are nicely supported by dense fruit
Classical Bordeaux aromas: tobacco box, smoke, pencil, blackcurrant. Intense, very smooth and good length. Very nice!
Notes of coffee, dark chocolat and underwood followed by savoury dark wood cherries. Tannins still present, very pleasant.
Aroma of green pepper and licorice that opened into soft velvety dark cherry, charcoal earthiness with a wisp of fruit.

With my usual suspicion with young Bordeaux, I had very low expectations with this SM....
Well I was wrong!
Deep nose on dark ripe fruits, blackberries. Loads of ripe tannins mixing with broody spicy squashed  berries and some delicious bitterness. Topped with a long and distinctive finish. I would love to retaste this in 5 years.
Rebuy: yes

- powerfull red wine
- sense of wood, forest, autumn in general
- taste of dark red fruit
- high acids
- long finish
- high tannines

tobacco leather oak 
2007 vintage
brick-like color with deep flavor
well balanced. Lovely.
Great nose masses of fruit smooth doesn't go that we'll with curry chips
Great Haut Medoc, expected flavors nice bodied, mild profile.

Nose of cedar and earthiness. Hint of classic cigar box character (stronger later after a bit of breathing). Tomato leaf. Red berries, cassis. Palate well integrated, cassis flavour beautifully balanced with oak and acid. Soft tannins. Clove spice. Drinks well now.

Lots of dark fruits on both the nose and the palate.  In addition, there are flavors of leather, smoke, tar.  oak.  A bold and a great wine.
 blackcurrant blackberry
Classic Medoc, strong Cabernet Sauvignon in beginning but it gets smoother in mouth and starts to play, lovely wine, very good brand, always a good deal.

Wow! 10 years young. Plenty left in the "tank."

Definite tobacco leather and smoke. All in an approachable glass. Tannins are well balanced at this point.
Nicely structured, firm tannins. Dark fruit and earthy nose with a tinge of fig up close. Leathery, cherry taste with a tinge of sweetness. Long finish .
Very strong vanilla on opening, mellows after 20-30 mins. Pleasant enough. Parker says aggressive tannins but these have mellowed now. Finish quite abrupt
Smooth, accomplished and deeply unexciting. Yet another 'classy' and very pricey French wine that disappoints. What does one have to do, decant for three weeks? Tsk.
nov 2020. aflp dinner. another o/s vintage from sc. full of vanilla, lots more aging to do to develop.

Started off overextracted, massive in style. 
 it may be 4 stars but i sense the fruit may not balance out the boatloads of tannins
Beautiful red fruit aroma with smooth tannin !  High on CS hence can still taste the green pepper (ibmp)at ending- bitter and dry!
Very pretty nose. Still tight but softening. Feels like more than 5% cab Franc, especially on the nose.

Time to be open 
Wonderful red noise and taste 
Lite leather difficult to describe 
Sorry
Fantastic blend,  really enjoyed this light cabernet with Merlot with taste of berries and earthy from the terroir of Bordeaux.
88/💯 - all in place for a left bank Bordeaux (blackberry dominance with some cassis), quite short finish and lean body
Beautiful rich dark cherry red color.   Earthy  with dark berries and chocolate notes. Great finish to this one
Great wine, damsons leather licorice and black fruits. Dry with long finish. Cut through a fatty shoulder of lamb
Deep blackberry and rounded superb fruit in balance with acid backbone and soft milky vanillin finish
Gym socks on the nose. Green pepper and Indian spices. Earth and tobacco notes with a clean, tannic finish.
Light nose, pepper, leather and charcoal. Slightly tannic and alcohol forward. Fig jam and meat juice. Very nice, could age another 3-5 years.
Initial close  cocoa cold notes need a while to get balance casis tobacco mushroom overall bit tight
Really good 2021 . Hour decant still a big wine , heavy tannin but good dark fruit . Probably even better next day .
Excellent

@ Shanghai Italian with J
Magnum

Just bought 12 bottles at auction and now tasted one. Fantastic. This humble cru bourgeois can compete with many of the grand crus. Excellent wine, thanks god I have 11 left in my cellar....I will definitely not sell this beauty.

Sociando Mallet provides best value for money from the haut-Medoc region. I’ve had different vintages (2010,14,15&16) and what they all have in common is character and elegance. Some are ready to drink now (2010 and 2015) but others must age a bit more such as 2014 and 16.

This vintage (2009) and this Chateau have made an incredible wine.  It has aged enough at this point that the earth minerals are coming true.  The fruit taste are are now also fairly mature, dark berries (cherry, black raspberry, etc) in combination with the earthy tones.  I really enjoy the slight chalky aftertaste and the fact that my mouth taste this wine at least 30minutes after drinking.

Mushroom, forest floor, cigar box, damp oak, leather, incense, some cherry, plum, black currant and cassis on the nose. Black currant, plum, cassis, cherry, oak, leather, cigar smoke and blue cheese on the palate. 4.25

Delicious wine; blackcurrants; texture;
Good length

I’m starting to like Bordeaux wines more and more and this one is special as well. 

Nose: Dark berries, black currant. Secondary notes of pepper, forest floor, oak and leather. Powerful nose. 
Palate: From a 2005 vintage this has medium-high tannins and elegant acidity that shows a great potential for keeping many years ahead. 

Score: 4.2

A remarkable sigarbox opened, next to pencil minerality and a touch of classic kirsch velvet, lots of summer ripe black fruit, jam and freshness, eastern spiced cranberries and a small horse. Dry but juicy, firm, full and fresh and a grand finale.

Aroma: Blackcurrant, black fruit, and plums. Secondary notes of tobacco, pencil, cedar wood, green pepper. 

Palate: Very vibrant. Good tannins and acidity. A good testamony to the power of the 2005 vintage. Very nice longevity. 

Verdict: It drinks very well now, but think it can improve further with a few more years of cellaring. Overall i was very pleased, and though it was very complex and multilayers. Furthermore, it taste really good! :)

This is drinking very well now, from the blockbuster 2005 vintage, this left bank wine is firing on all cylinders, deep purple burgundy color, a bit of funkiness with the forest floor and barnyard, roasted chestnut, licorice, cacao, cedar, then emerged dark plum, cassis and black currant, full body with balanced acidity and balsamic glaze like sweet soft tannin, tastes of licorice, root beer, cassis, blackberry, blackcurrant, black cherry, tar and dark chocolate, smooth gold finish with licorice lingering.

Nose has lots of fresh red fruit, cranberry, strawberry, pencil leaf, wet forest floor, cat pee, and old leather. Even after being open for 24 hours the palate is still rippin. High acidity, high tannin and lots of juicy fruit. Delicious wine.

This was served after a long evening and lighter wines - a  big presence- leather and cigar box , deep and pungent- many years since, I had drunk this Wine frequently - and not for a lot of money either but this seems to have gone up trough the gears and was at 13 years a real heavy hitter . I would to broach again .

Full bodied Haut Medoc. Dark red fruits and mild tannin make it perfectly labeled "Bordeaux"red in my opinion. Long, smooth finish. Spicy herbal note. Drinking 2011, aging worthy wine but I would decant it enough to fully appreciate the flavor. 55% Cab Sauv. 40% Merlot.5% Cab Franc.

This one needed time to open up and balance the dry red fruit with the early secondary earthiness and cigar box flavors. Slightly drying tannins not quite in balance and not enough on the back palate. Much better the next day.

Un deux trois quatre cinq.... Nombre is what I learnt today in basic class. I was counting in French while I wait for the unyielding oak masking the bouquet of this wine to evolve into something more in the decanter. The palate is dense black fruits and figs with sharp tannins. I opened this bottle too early, should have kept it for another decade. All I ever wish for from learning French is to understand what Edith Piaf is singing in La Vie en rosé....

Good full medium red-ruby. Complex nose offers black raspberry, licorice, minerals and a whiff of leather. Brooding, ripe and deep, with terrific volume for Sociando. The black raspberry, licorice and dark chocolate flavors are full and rich but remain this side of exotic. In fact, this boasts superb balance even if it''s youthfully backward today. Expands impressively on the back half, finishing with big, broad tannins and an impression of real power.

Deep Ruby
Pronounced aromas and flavors intensity of ripe dark forest leather tobacco oak blackcurrant earthy cedar vanilla pepper dark fruit  fruits, oak-vanilla,  spices,  earth,  
Developed
Excellent rich full body Priorat. 
Drink now.

Dark colour, no bricking.  Blackberry more than blackcurrants on the nose.  Interesting on the palate - licorice, and coffee secondary flavours.  Not showing its age at all.  
Loved it.  
Great match with the lamb sweetbreads.

We had this wine to wake up our tasting buds. This Haut-Médoc is a good reference of what a Bordeaux blend is about. It shows off with black fruit, a little wood and a whiff of rubber bands from pickle jars...
On the palate, this still contains lots of fruit combined with liquorice and something toasted...
Still some acidity and tannin. All this comes with a soft feed and generous round mouthfeel.
Definitely a 4⭐️

Excellent semi aged Médoc!
Dark red massive colour.
Lovely bouquet; wood, dark fruit, tobacco, grilled bell pepper, star anise and a whiff of stable. 
Texture of velvet softness in good balance with vivid fruit and mature tannins. 
Was perfect paired with a Osso Buco slow food cooked meal. 
Will probably evolve well with age, but very drinkable now.
Very nice, soft yet balanced.

Oh this one was just too easy to drink, so soft and smooth.  Kind of lacking depth but that's ok.  This would be a great stunner of a wine with your friends for lunch.  Served a little cool and pair it with food and this wine would really blow their socks off.
Black fruit and green bell pepper.
Another great wine tasting at Domaine Wine Storage and Shipping in St Louis.
Medium ruby red with aromas of black currant leaf and cedar. Dry with medium balanced tannin and acidity with blackcurrant flavour.medium finish. Good with roast beef not dry on its own.
Disappointed by this vintage. I still believe the lack of intensity is a fault in a wine of this price range. Nevertheless, the wine has good structure and no nastiness.
Bordeaux, blend of 3 grapes, from 2006. Good color, and good nose: red fruits, coffee, chocolate, earthy  and a mushroom too. In the mouth it lacked structure, was too tannic and too acidic. 76/100
92. Truly balanced wine with great QPR. Lead pencil shavings, horse cage, cedar, minerals and tobacco. This is Bdx picked at just the right age. Lovely and medium plus long finish.
Needs time to open. Probably would have been much better a couple of years ago. However still shows a faint hints of fruit, overpowered by earthiness and hints of oxidation
Smooth as silk. Dark as wood and a brilliant finish.
Very, very good wine. That’s all..
Dark fruit and earthy full bodied high alcohol and tannins
Elsass
4,3 very good
Very good, no decanter. Lovely. Dry.
Beautiful wine! Enjoyed in les Eugénie-les-Bains lunch restaurant. No decanter needed. Sublime
Dark velvety tannins.  Blackberry delicious w chris and lauren at cipriani
Good to drink, just not as smooth but good structure.
Fresh and young with lot of pirasin. Not as elegant as the previous but one of the most effective Bordeaux wines for the money.
Nice to the lamb stew
The real deal. Full on cabernet, elegant, structured, powerful.
really attractive nose and compelling fruit.  very enjoyable with heavier french meals

Classic left bank nose of black currant, dried red fruits, green belllpepper, cedar and graphite. At first tannins are pretty green and austere but improve a lot after a few hours of decanting. Pretty clean for a Bordeaux. Well structured with refreshing acidity. However, for me it lacks some density. Tasty wine but expected a little more from a 2010 at this price level.

Deep garnet colour. Clean and bright. Strong cocoa (think +90% chocolate), tar, leather and background hints of capsicum. Definitely a ‘masculine’ wine. Tannins are fine and grippy. Along with moderate acidity, there’s a solid structure without being heavy on the mouth. The palate is long but the finish is WAY longer. Probably should have let this one lay down for a lot longer (a minimum of five years and more like ten) to benefit from the development of more secondary characters.

Médoc Bordeaux blend (55% CS, 40% Merlot 5% CF), I am not totally familiar with this region. Fully old world style: opaque Ruby, the nose is (too) shy and takes time to open - a decanter will help - but is pleasant with notes of black berries, wood and cassis. Balanced and smooth body; could be more structured. Gift and recommendation from my friend and boss Dirk Steinmueller.

Spicy, black ripe cherry, black currant, wood, vanilla, boullion, red berries, forest floor and soy sauce. 

Ripe forest berry, tart cherry stone, wood, vanilla, forest flooor, blackberry, tobacco, blueberry. Very succulent. Nice extract level.
Medium tannin, medium acidity. Long densely fruity finish with exellent freshness and fruit. Wonderful!
92

Sociando-Mallet vs. Du Tertre. Sociando-Mallet was first in our taste-test of two 2010 reasonably-priced Bordeauxs. This was full bodied and needed some time to open. Complex but just a tad too strong and chalky for my taste. Bumped it down from 4 to 3.5*. Still an excellent value. But did it beat the 2010 Du Terte?...

First glass seems impressive this is definitely ready to go now - well balanced and a great mouth feel on this. However each subsequent  glass is not improving and finish is shorter than you would expect from a wine of this price. Its ok. I would avoid however as far better alternatives.

Very serious winery from the Haut-Medoc. SM 2010 features aromas of blueberries, black currants, cassis and graphite. Full body and concentrated yet i had the feeling that this wine hasn’t achieved his full potential yet and has still many years of sleep ahead.

Had the opportunity to have a magnum of this one and was really happy because it deserve a long ling tasting...
The aromas are simple, good balance between blueberries and grappes.
Exellent in its category and a must have if you have a cave.

Chateau Sociando Mallet 2000 offers effusive nose of green pepper, leather, woodbox and animal note. Wine full of energy and concentration, high acidity and attractive peppery flavors through the palate.

Let it breathe for an hour. Great tannins, first pour is strong (a good way), after it opens, much smoother. Dark fruit, leather, bit pepper (could be the cab franc). Color is beautiful deep plum. Legs that run down the sides of the glass.

3.7

Middle intensity aroma of sandy soily milky red/dark berries, wood and spices.
Dry, high svidity, tannins are strong enough, medium body, good stable frame of taste with ripe cherry in the palate, drinkable, mid long final.

Served blind. Explosive cigar box, dark chocolate, leather and cedar nose. Good tannins, fruit sweetness, nice amount of acidity still. Present fruit, mainly blackcurrant but some black cherries and boysenberry as well. Gravel/clay pot, tomato leaf, vanilla and plum join in later. 86 or 90 St-Julien or Margaux? Perhaps Talbot?

Opened this wine relatively quickly. 
Colour was still surprisingly vibrant with garnet rim. Powerful and complex nose from the start; beautiful vanilla and toast, slight herbaceous note proceeding with smoke. The fruit was mellow and delicate (strawberry, blueberry, plum). Coffee and a fresh earthiness / minerality dominated the end. The palate is still firm with velvety tannins and expected high acidity. Herbaceous notes follow here and fresh fruit is not showing well. Compexity is lacking is short finish
Great wine. Good value.
Very well balanced Bordeaux, deep red colored, long finish

This was my WOTN, group 3. It really stood out as a Bordeaux with all of the classic notes and plenty of grippy tannins. In a very good place at the moment.
Dark fresh fruity nose with hints of wood. In the mouth strong tannines, a nice body and acidity. Great aging potential or to be drank with a good piece of meat.
Smooth and unforgettable
Purple color. Nose is expressive with black fruit, coffee, herbs. Palette is great. Well structured, full of nice fruits and spiciness. Flavorful finish
Overt vanilla notes suggesting new oak, masses of fruit, big, bold, structured, terrific potential. Opulent and flattering biw but perhaps two to three decades of stuffing left in this wine.
Super drinkable red, smooth like all-get-out.  Subtle nose like damp cellar with a hint of volatiles.  Would be a daily go-to if it wasn't so expensive.  Wish I could withhold the 80% tax!
: not complex but pretty pleasant drink .. nose had decent black fruit, slightly green .. hint of spice and coffee, medium tannins, medium acid on palate .. pretty good drink for the price.
After a couple of hours of air it developed well, nose was a bit too much mushroom or ageing notes, while drinking it was very elegant, mild oak, light earthy notes, a bit of cassis.
A good and medium to full bodied wine. I had expected more from this wine, which seemed a bit closed at this time in its development. But altogether a good, but a bit overpriced wine.
Ruby red, slightly smoky nose on, slightly vegetal (cabbages) but not a fault really. Quite evolved for a 10 years old. Mouth is kind of fresh, mineral notes, and red fruits. Too acidic

Clear, deep ruby. Clean, medium intensity, primary aromas of blueberry, blackcurrant, black plum and pepper, tertiary of cedar. Dry, medium (+) acidity, medium fine-grained tannin, medium alcohol, medium (+) body, medium (+) finish. Great balance in fruit, acidity, alcohol and tannin. Good intensity, long and complex.

Ripe fruit notes are settling down to allow graphite, pencil shavings, and dried rose petals to share the sensory spotlight. Deceiving tannins, gentle as they grasp the palate, strong and firm while they refuse to relinquish grip for a moment. Classic left bank recipe, 55/40/5 Cabernet Sauvignon/Merlot/Cabernet Franc. Aged beautifully to this point, built to last. Enjoy now through 2027+ with grilled, roasted, or braised red meat dishes.

Burgundy trip bottle #3 , on the road to Puligny we decided to cheat with this Bordeaux bottle. 

A bold red wine , a blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot, and 5% Cabernet Franc. 

Deep dark crimson color.
Aromas of cassis and black currant. 
Bold full bodied on the palate, notes of cassis, mushrooms, leather, raspberry, vanilla. 
Pretty Long finale !! 

12.5% ABV.

Dark berries, flowers, forest floor, mushroom and minerals on the nose. Rich, fruity and elegant taste, which is starting to open well. Structured and balanced wine, with a very long taste. This will be even better in 5-7 years time.

Pour direct from bottle..."looking relatively young" despite being a 10 year bottle..dark fruits on the nose yet not overbearing....nice balance of fruits n some cigars notes w good structure...medium finish good VFM for this price

Nice lively color. Nose is wet earth and a bit of funk. Palate is light on fruit but has hints of cherries. I get mostly cigar, cedar, and vanilla. A hint of Band-Aid on the finish. This is restrained and is built for food. If you want fruity and jammy, go elsewhere. I’m gonna light up a cigar! Cheers.

4.2 for me. Magnificent Bordeaux wine. Deep red colour, full body, dry and complex. Nose of blackcurrant and blackberry and leather and tobacco with a hint of dark chocolate.
A really good wine.
Cheers to a great Saturday night 🍷

Took 4 hours decanting to open up and show some of its real character, notes of anything prior is useless, thin, weak, tight….
Leading up to it being ready, some vegetal greenness like kale or spinach followed by dense fruit and a heavier body. Lovely wine with a medium long finish

90, First wine of Sociando Mallet from a not too great year. The 10 yrs of aging have made this Sociando into a well balanced wine. Lots of dark fruit, some prunes and black currant. Some tobacco,coffee and chocolate.Good one.

Blackcurrant, cassis, cloves, hint of blackberry leaves. Medium mouthfeel with integrated tannins offering mostly breadth and some depth of flavours over the palate. Elegant and refined, showing off the qualities of the 2012 vintage.

Fresh, aromatic and good strong floral notes. Strong berries black berries raspberries, tobacco and pencil shavings not much oak. Length of body impressive 
Medium tennis well preserved. Best drank chilled. Tends to taper as it gets to room temperature

This wine has a deep ruby colour with a significant amount of intensity on the nose and palate. The wine exhibits notes of Red Cherry, Black Cherry, Red Plum, Black Currant, Cedar, Smoke, Tobacco and Leather. The tannins are ripe and supple which gives a nice rounded feel on the mouth and is balanced with a vibrant acidity. This shows that this wine can still age for many years in bottle. The complexities of this wine really makes it enjoyable and definitely something to be enjoyed on many occasions.

Bouquet somewhat funky but letting it breathe will release fruit and Bdx-leather and oak. Palate with good deep black fruit (cassis, black currant) with refined oak and tobacco. Would also enjoy a couple of more years to let those tannins settle somewhat more and develop more refined profile

24.12.2014:The notes of red fruits are dominanted from the tannins. I like the Château since the 80tes because of the good Balanced Bordeaux Style. Probably a Bad bottle. For my exklusive diner for christmas it was a Great disappointment!
07.02.2015: the Second bottle. No comparison with the other bottle: Dark cherries in the nose. Red Fruits and well balanced Tannins in the  moth. Hints of Little pepper. Long finish.

A structured wine, concentrated, beginning to show mature notes like leather, but still young. Can age for many years. Good intensity on its flavors and aromas, with cassis, cedar, vanilla and mineral hints.

Deep ruby, developing pronounced nose, black currant, blueberry, plum, dark raisin, mint, eucalyptus, green bell pepper, oregano, liquorice, pepper, fennel, oak, vanilla, leather. Mouth dry, high acidity + tannins, med body, med+ intensity, long finish. Excellent Haut Medoc at a great price.

On the battle France versus Australia, the wine gods were on the French side. While an epic encounter, the charm and elegance of Sociando-Mallet - almost out of the picture - got the Blues ahead. 

Last tried in 14, this vino has come together marveouslly with a bouquet of blueberries, damp cellar, cassis and leather. The palate is round and precise with good fruit and acidity left to provide further development and enjoyment. +8/10

Gotta say, the Genesis came very close. 

Bring the next game on!

The non-classified darling of the Haut-Medoc delivering its classic 55% Cab Sauv, 40% Merlot, 5% Cab franc blend.  Don’t think the price is right but this was a bottle a friend brought by from my backlog drank in 2018.

M+ aroma intensity, pronounced flavour intensity. Developing, has another 8-10 years in it but drinking well already.

Dry, m acid, m+ body, tannin & finish. 

Nose: Cigar, plum, blackberry, black raspberry, toast, smoke, graphite, leather.

Palate: Black fruit, red fruit, minerality, oak.

The appearance is clear dark ruby.

The nose is youthfull and has a powerful aroma intensity of pencil shavings, red fruit, berry fruit and bread.

The palate is dry, full bodied, smooth acidity, high and dry tannins, good balance, powerful flavours of red fruit, pencil shavings, berry fruit. Very firm. Very long finish. France.

The last wine we had at the French restaurant that was only serving French wines, finishing off nicely! Tertiary aromas starting to show with primary and secondary aromas very well integrated!

Cigar box, cassis, plum, clove, violet and cheese on the nose. Leather, toast, prune, mint, blackcurrant, cedar and minerality on the palate. Medium+ finish. Very good.

Another nice wine that survived the slow summer boat ride across the Atlantic. A good sign for the others still hiding in the cellar. Garnet in the glass and opaque. Nose is a bit of forest floor, cellar, and balsamic. Pretty shut on the nose really. Medium plus body with medium plus acidity. Blackberry and black cherry on the palate. Tannins pretty well integrated. Very classic in terms of elegant VS overpowered concentration. Still thinner mouthfeel than I prefer for this style. Solid from an OK year. 4.0

2004 Sociando-Mallet. Was served this nice Bordeaux by my neighbor during dinner. I didn’t think much of it at first other than it being a nice Bordeaux with smooth tannins. dark fruit and graphite. Touch of cedar. Tannins completely integrated. by the last glass it was quite interesting with nice soy sauce notes coming into the mix of. Med acidity. Med to med+ body and finish. Seems like this is in it’s peak drinking window. HBS!

WMK's.
Thought to be neither too bold for LB, nor quite mellow of RB. But the aromas are a little tight today opening up later, with dark berries esp. chocolatey plum with a tinge of sweetness. Cedar and smoke round up the smooth tannins of this elegant if not upfront endearing. Some green leafy tea notes undergirth this.

4.0☆ still it's a great textured HautMedoc Bordeaux. Haven't tasted many before, so hmmm...

Wine get together @ Farm to plate restaurant, with WMK SKT LMC Andrew Winfred. 15.02.2020

‘12 vintage. Revisited a year on. Exceptional dark inky core with garnet rims. Menthol, cinnamon fig and spice on the nose, fairly muted. This expanded as the night went on. Dark cassis, blackberry melded well with a svelte and velvet-like tannin structure. Poised with vegetal and herbaceous notes, this displayed the aromas of a CS with mint, leather, tobacco and pencil shavings. On the 2nd day, brettanomyces gave a barnyard funk, which soon resolved. Med body and softer acidity, this was excellent. 4.1

intense blackberry and briary scented nose, touches of black plum and a hint of fruitcake. The palate is immediate enjoyable: very well balanced, finer tannins than I was expecting, delineated and focused with some lovely black, tar/cedar fruit towards the finish. Good length and precision. With nick in darthmouth

10/15 for color, 18/25 for aroma, 18/25 for body and complexity, 7/10 for finish, 18/25 for quality and VFM. Total Score 71. Should be better in 5 years time.
Crisp red, sweet and tart fruits, firm tannins and an austere personality with a cassis and cranberry finish that reminds me of what some tasters would call classic.
Ripe cherries, touch of vanilla and seamlessly integrated wood. In the mouth tannins clearly start to ripen and give the wine a velvety feeling. 91-92
Nice affordable Bordeaux that is drinking well now. Dry with good wait and notes of herbs and pencil. Had at Gabriel Kreuther Restaurant, NYC in 2018.
Dark berries,  meat on the nose,  oak,  cassis,  tobacco,  forest soil on the palate, medium body,  easy tannins
Medium to medium  intensity of blackcurrant, herbaceous capsicum. Representative of a good Bordeaux style !
