Liquid Mon Cherie. Great old cherries mixed with dark chocolate.
First bottle of the 2005 Sociando. Perfect vintage. Ripe and velvety. Perfect to drink now.
Good not expensive
We seem to have overpayed for this wine but the aroma and bold taste were great. Would buy this bottle for $40-$50 and stock it.
smooth grassy fruity bubblegum medoc
Very spicy with nice flavor of black cherry
Lovely Bordeaux wine, need probably 5-10 years more in the cellar!!
Lots of tannins still. Black currents and oaky flavours - tobacco, cigar box. Excellent
Very Very nice wine!!! Long taste, good flavour and nice tanine
20140419 camping with friends.
Powerful bouquet of tobacco, strong fruit, long aftertaste with flavours of mild olives. Excellent wine, well worth its price.
Perfect to drink now, will not hold many years anymore
Wonderful medium body. Aged but superfine.
Very good, has character.
Rich, full, well balanced and spicy. Pretty impressive!
Cassis and tobacco. Medium tannins.  Pairs well with filet mignon and mushrooms/onions.
Really liked it, especially on the second day.
Nice full bodied bordeaux
Need to drink it quick, it breath fast.
A very fruity wine, string berry taste.
Intense flavor, dark fruit, spicy, crisp, firm.
Balanced and vanilla
I had this with inoshishi.
Very good. Corkscrew €70.
Very nice. Medium body
Opportunity in carrefour 20€
Vivid LaRocca's  review nailed it!
Good combination of grapes. Exceeds perception.
Let's come back in 15 years. Outstanding wine! And it will be even better

Barnyard playfellows
Dregs gamboling amongst fruit’s
Precarious legs
Full body, strong notes
Aromas of dried flowers and leather. Earthy palate tertiary notes. Big tannins
Impressive! achieving a near-perfect equilibrium.
Very nice 2005 Bordeaux perfect with the duck
Sophisticated bouquet, nice colour, scent of black berries
Light, fresh with a slightly fruitily taste.
Good, affordable Bordeaux. At under $80 and a great vintage, cannot go wrong.
Beautiful left bank.  Enjoyed at Table 1
Amazing, dry, aromatic
Pleasant surprise with this Bordeaux throwing off a good amount of fruit and earth with tannins that tamp it all down.  It’s drinkable alone and with food.  Would buy again.
We continue our 2000 evening with this ever reliable high level haut médoc; very nice nose of red bel pepper ( paprika), mineral, straightforward; perfect on the palate, really a beautiful Bordeaux.
Very open and concentrated nose of bramble, prunes and cassis. Holds lots of forest floor notes, soft licorice and cedar wood. Nicely balanced and dense in structure. Overperformer for the vintage.
It confirms how 2001 is a real great “off” vintage. Beautiful wine, tertiary noze, tobacco box, graphite, a hint of leather. Pleasure
Pure elegance and depth describe this wine. The nose shows a forest like aromas, earthy after a rainy day, red berries, eucalyptus, Juicy, round tannins, Persistent finish.
91 pts Tasted blind. Mature and drinking beautifully. This was called left bank straight up. Would love to try this in a line up against some of the classed growths. Thanks Alex.
At the peak now and really lovely. Nose of licorice leather stable raw meat. A full bodied wine w sweet licorice, graphite, sweet cherries and a bit bitter. Long aftertaste.
Earthy, charcoal and soft tannins - drinking very well for a rare bottle
Great Haut-Medoc, good resistance, can almost chew on it, comes in perfectly with a good meal. Not the best vintage but quality/price rather OK. Paid 25 euros 16 years ago
Superb! Great balance, long finish, still some black fruit and soft tannins. Drink it now.

Great matured Sociando-Mallet.

Black currant, bramble, roasted coffee beans and violets.
Earthy, smoky and spicy. Tobacco, forest floor and leather.

Happy Bordeaux Sunday.

Danke @Andreas Naunin 🙌
Plum yum on the nose! The legs on this are mind-boggling. Needs to open up, so be patient! A great pairing with smoked duck and marmalade jam by my in-house Chef Marco Fossati!
Benefited from some decanting. Nose of leather and black fruit. Medium body leads to a finish that still has plenty of tannins along notes of sandalwood and blackberries.
A gift which was enjoyable. The wine meets all standards and overcoming some, however I would be not buying again as it does not bring anything special for the higher price
Red berries with scents of cedar and wild forest in the nose. Leather, tobacco and mushrooms in the mouth. Solid tannins and good acidity. Great bottle from Bordeaux still with potential to evolve.
God
ok
Hammer
Great Bordeaux!
(4.2 points)
Perfect
Great nose
Top
Thd score 91
Boutique hotel
Classic
leather

24.9.19.  Good nose with a tinge of Flora hues. Decent palate with balanced tannins &;acidity.  There were notes of dark fruits seemingly with ripe plum nuances  with underlying vegetal-earthy hints. Finish was rather good.

Guessed this to be a modern producer from Pessac or Graves which spoke volumes about the vintage - apparently Sociando handled 2003 better than 2005. I guessed that this was not a classified growth as the tannins were a little more rustic than the Duhart-Milon that came before. Lots of blackcurrant fruit, alcohol was showing a little too much, especially compared to the more classic 2001 that I had last week. Also explains why the 2005 Cuvee Jean Gautreau was an absolute monster when I tried it last year.

Pretty dark colour for an 11-year-old wine with notes of tobacco clove pencil shavings and some cedar on the nose. The palette was very well integrated, seamless and velvety, with very well integrated tannins with more dark fruit on a rather vibrant acidic base. Medium long finish. Will last but it's so good right now. Why wait?

Jean Gautreau's Chateau Sociando Mallet 2011 out of Gironde, France. Was rated high amongst folks in France but I have to kinda disagree. Real dark purple color/ smelled amazing on the nose, lotta heat, lotta smoke Taste was quite the opposite. Off in balance. Decent structure. Real smoky out the bottle, aired it out- little better.  Lots of smoke , tobacco and cedar on the palate. Definitely air it out and encourage aging- might make it better. Good w/ cheddar. I rate this one a 3.2 out of 5. 13% Vol.

We bought this in a grocery store in Beaune (Leclerc I think) for a very low price but it might have cooked a bit on the shelf which probably hurt the quality of this typically amazing wine. This particular bottle was quite bland with little palate nor nose which was disappointing for a Sociando Mallet.
The bouquet is not as rich as the mouth, which comes in layers, adding complexity to the wine. Lovely!
Rather oaky; pretty strong tannin; espresso; dark chocolate; somewhat bitter after taste. A bit thin over all
Great Haut-Medoc. Dark fruits, bitter chocolate with powerful tannic structure and  delicious long finish!
Perhaps not the best year but still a beautiful wine. Elegant and smooth. Remarkable low in alcohol. Only 12,5%. Drink now.
Concentrated dark ripe fruit. Tar and spice, lots of tannins. Young, will probably be even better in 5-10 years.

Super integrated and refined tannins still good fruit if light. Drinking perfect. earthy cherry 
Celebration of my lucy
Very fun to approach this wine in its youth, but if I had bottles in the cellar I would probably hang on to them for a bit.
Classic Bordeaux, tannins are nice and in line at 10 years old. After 30 min it started to get even smoother.
Had this at Contraste - new restaurant in Paris. Really good wine. Wine from France is cheaper in France - go figure!
Fruity, smooth tannins, strong aroma smell,  well balance,  great depth of everything in the grapes and long finishing (Good feeling after taste).
Cooked fruit, vanilla and smoke in the nose. Tannic and green flavours with a lot of vanilla in the palate.
Great
Very smooth

Blackcurrant, leather mocha,
Cedar wood, licorice. 
Great wine from a lesser vintage. Already advanced in maturity. Drink now 2-3 years
Delicious red from Haut-Medoc. Very earthy, black berries, oak and tobacco. Not too bad and more than 3,5⭐️. More open than the 2000 vintage.
Showing well. Drink now if you have a bottle. It still has body and tannin but the older flavors are starting to come out vs the bright young fruit
Leather, earth and cherries on the nose. Pepper and cherries with stone on the palate.  Strong, strong tannins that are smooth.  Long dry finish.
Big wine, really représentative of this estate. Quite mature at the nose, thé palate still fresh and powerfull, with tannins who begin to be rounder.
Good for cold and rainy winter evening. Good characters of old-vintage Bordeaux. Moss, flint, tobacco, leather, oak, cedar. A bit pricy.
One of the best SM's ever made from an excellent vintage. The fruit is starting to fade but still holding on with plum and boysenberry.
Nice red colour and maybe blueberries in the palate, but defenently dark berries. Satisfying long aftertaste with tones of black plum.
Great deep purple color. Needed some time to open after being decanted. Fruit still holding up. Good finish. Plenty of life left.

A complex aroma that is as dark as ink and has cassis, black currant, and roasted herbs.
Feel the thick nuances of smoke, licorice, and minerals.
Black fruit, coal & violet nose. Still young (@ 2020). Dry, almost dusty (but in a good way). Strong tannins, intense fruit. Great balance. Long finish.
Deep ruby still. Powerful and restrained. Muted, dark, wild berry fruit and smoke on the nose. Palate is lean and still tightly wound. Earthy, almost charcoal flavour! More time needed...
As already described in former TN, 2009 and 2010 are disappointing vintages for Sociando. Typical Médoc cassis CS nose, tannins present, but missing depth and aftertaste.
Quite a nice bottle - benefited from a short decant - ready to drink now but no big hurry - should hold nicely for another 5-7 years. Good value for the money.
Best aged red I’ve ever had. Changes with food or without - with venison, had notes of pepper and leather; without, fruit forward with raspberry. Vintage was 1990.
Wow drinking like a champ.  Some schlump-roast guy brought it to a wine tasting party with a bottle of yellowtail unknowing that it was a fine bottle.  I drank most of it
Beautifully balanced and very drinkable. High tannins and black fruit flavors , hints of smoke . Really a spectacular drink

A very well balanced wine. Will age more as there are still tannins present. Still a vibrant deep red color. Blackberry, raspberry, a hint of coffee. Nice. This one got selected today after inspecting the corks. Glad I caught this one before I lost it. A nice surprise. 

Had again on 1/28/19. Still deep red. Still blackberry, raspberry and coffee. Tannins still there. Wish I had more to age! Paired with prime NY strip steaks and scallops. Awesome meal on a Monday night.

2002 might not be the best year for Bordeaux yet this Chateau Sociando Mallet, 17 years in, is holding up very well. The color is just turning tawny, complex nose of cassis, blackberry, mint, tobacco, graphite which develops slowly as the wine breathes. On the palate it is slightly unbalanced towards acidity, as you would expect for the vintage, nonetheless it has an impressive structure and the tannins have become rounder. Long finish

Dark red/purple color. Discreet nose with some hints of berries, power and you can even feel the tannin! Dry, powerful and tannic wine. Metal, black currant and oak. Youthful in deed and should preferably be cellared for 15-20 years.

An unclassified Château which tastes like a first growth... Excellent value! 

Inky ruby-amber colour. A great nose with a lot of tobacco, cigar box, spices on the front and blackcurrant, blackcherrys at the back. 
Pretty muscular on the palate with again this beautiful complexity of aromas enveloping the high lovely grippy tannins. Great structure. Long lasting finish very "Bordeaux left bank" 

Very good to drink now but can still benefits from further ageing. 
 
92/100

Superb expression of a Médoc style wine drank at the right time. Although 2003 was deemed a small vintage, this 2003 from famed Sociando-Mallet is in a perfect condition and can definitely last a few more years, If not decades.

Father’s Day wine!  Still dark purple in the glass with a rim that shows it age. Nose is everything you expect from an aged bordeaux of this quality; lots of cedar, raisins, plum, and some dried leaves. Palate is dark plum and raisin fruit with nice acidity still with a good tannin that is smooth and carries a medium finish with nice mineral stone flavours with toffee, light leather, and dried herbs.  This would have been best around 5 years ago I expect but offers a great experience. If you have it open it

Yes, a very much intact and correct wine. Indeed, this bad boy definitely delivers on its promise. A fine wine indeed.

On the nose: hints of black currants, coffee, leather, some hints of a cigar box and a last whiff of cherries jubilee. On the palate: very gentle, yet with sufficient development of tannins, and a spicy finish (some black pepper).

A fine wine indeed. Cheers, @Winefields.

Heaps of colour, crimson with brick edge starting to show. Rich nose with lots of dark fruit and blackcurrant, roast beef, liquorice and mushroom. Palate is fresh with dusty tannins, mushroom and sous bois, blackcurrant, velvet texture. Long and rich finish. Drinking perfectly but easily another five years life ahead. 19/20. 95/100

Tested from the Magnum. Very nice classic Bordeaux that wants to accompany a meal. Formerly the star of the cru bourgeois. Today has a lot more competitors for this title.
A great wine for 2002.
91/100

1995 on it's top now. Bought for 45 euroes at auction. Classic bordeaux nose, dirt, terroir and dark red fruits. Full bodied taste with dark berries and coffee. Aftertaste medium length with medium tannin.

A really good wine at a great price point. If you want to try what an aged Bordeaux tastes like without breaking the bank, this is the wine to go for. I paid USD100, so + half star for value.

The wine looked younger than its 20+ years of age with a deep ruby opaque colour with a slight tinge of rusty red. On the nose, it’s totally in the business even from first pour. Very left bank with dark red fruit and lots of tobacco / tar like a St Estephe. Taste great too with great mellowed tannins.

after straight 24 hours of work.. i needed a good wine and 15yo Sociando didnt disappoint--pungent manure and plummy blackberries leaps forth and with some swirling, capsicum and oak emerge on the backdrop of a full and leathery palate albeit with a short finish lacking in complexity. Tannins giving structure. Flowers & mulberries more pronounced as the wine integrates after 45min with sweet cassis & coconut blooming after an hour.. at this price point it brings light to my world.. a firm favourite!

What a wonderful surprise. The nose on the 2002 is very shy but as this wine breathes it grows in stature.. beautifully integrated soft tannins and delightful on the mid-palate. I expect this has several years to go yet .. like getting lucky when you were expecting an early night

Second and last of these bottles. A better experience than last time. Fully mature. Almost a bit dusty in the mouth, but still with a elegant and smooth finish. Dark almost overripe plums. Very good match with beef wellington.

96 Bordeaux tasting 3/8.

Brick red in colour showing some age at the edge but not really on the nose. Very perfumed nose, with some marzipan. 

Great concentration of red fruit (Redcurrants?) with refreshing acidity and great concentration, coupled with slightly lower tannin make this a very approachable wine. 

Easiest drinker of the night. 

4.25

Medium garnet with brown edges. French oak dominates the nose with very subtle hints of dark berries. The palate resonates again with oak, cassis, tobacco, coffee, roast meat. Medium bodied. At 33 years old, this baby shows its silky tannins very well. I wish it is still available.

Beautiful & complex on the nose inc old leather, briny black olive, cassis, wood smoke and also a creamy brie like note .
Deep concentrated flavours to taste and a long finish. 
Great with out smokey caciota cheese 🧀

Elegant blackberry & coriander. This 2000 is in a nice place right now (mature & won’t get any better). Great ullage. Vinturied & decantered an hour.  A penetrating mature blackberry bouquet, with a green quality that is very pleasant. Strong, briary, blackberry fruit with time, & herbal (coriander). Pure, rather than complex. Velvety. Delicious, rather than cerebral. With leg of lamb, jasmine rice & French beans. 4.2 woofs is correct.
New Year’s Eve #8.

4.1 stars
Really well made, drank in 2021, it's now fully developed and close to the end of its drinking window
Lots of high quality and well integrated oak alongside cassis, blackberry, as well as some very fine tertiaries such as tar, leather, forest floor.

This bottle was slightly corked but still drinkable. The must blew off and gave way to tremendous depth on the nose. Rich leather and forest floor, mushroom. Old books on the palate and sadly lacked body. A little thin but still had structure from fine tannins.

4.2 pts. First experience with Sociando Mallet wine and what a nice experience. This 1996 has been very well preserved and looked only 10 years old. Nose was very expressive and aromatic. Mouth was pleasant as well with medium finish.

Not a great year in general , but superb for this estate. Big boned wine to lay down for years. On a gray Sunday afternoon, this wine enlightens you completely. Prunes, tobacco, slight cow shed odour, hay & heather, a walk after a rain shower, peppery tannins, typical haut medoc earthiness, wonderful acidity. After 16 years of cellaring, you start contemplating on life at auto pilot. Hope I'll grace with age too ...uh, someday ;-) Where's the other bottle for heaven's sake ??

Peak now. 1/2 decant and the note open up. Cedar, pencil shaving and dark berries at coming up at once with cedar the most prominent before clearing up and reveal the fruity freshness. Mid Tannins with high acidity show that it’s very much alive with more years to go. Long finish.

One of the very best value wines from Haut-Médoc. Although its 10+ years of age still crimson black colour palate. Very young appearance with pencil shavings, dark berry fruit (blackberry, blueberry, black currants), violets, cedar wood and some earthy tones. Matured and well knitted wine with again dominance of black fruits in the taste together with coffee flavours. Tannins start to kick in after a few seconds. At its peak now with potential for further cellaring. Love it.

👁 Deep Garnet

👃🏼 Concentrated spicy nose of cedar, leather, forest floor, tobacco, graphite, pencil shavings, espresso, eucalyptus, cinnamon, bay leaf, rosemary, cigar box, clove, baking spices, black pepper, licorice and raisin.  

👅 Still fresh on the palate with notes of red currant, sour cherry and blackberry. Rounded yet powerful tannins are well integrated and backed by medium acidity. 

✍🏼 Pretty good in shape for a 28-years old but just not very exciting. 

Cheers🍷

Beautiful Bordeaux! On the nose the wine shows hints of cassis, a bit of savory herbs and just the lightest touch of floral. Medium plus body on the palate with notes of dark fruit and cedar. Smooth tannins and chocolate notes on the finish.

Medium bodied friendly Bordeaux. Absolutely satisfied with the quality for this price range even rather than Crus Classes du Medoc. Condensed juicy fruitiness is brilliant and rich. Tannins and acidity are properly there, but this wine is totally easy to drink from just after corking out. It would be paired well with any foods. Plum, blackberry, vanilla and leather. Bought at Aeon de Wine.

This wines needs to be decantered at least 1.5 hours before the wine open ups. The first 45mins, the wine was very closed, light and short finish. After 1.30mins later, it starts to show its muscle of a medoc. blackberry and cedar scents on the nose, full body berries on the palate...long finish. I am glad I didnt write this wine off.
Deep, cherries, like a dark roast. Amazing after taste.

Wow! When I first opened the bottle I was afraid it was corked by smelling at it, I left the bottle to open up for 30-40 minutes. In the glass it’s dark ruby, caused by the Merlot. Incredible smells of oak, cassis and blackberry, but also earthy notes like leather and smoke.  The taste… Wow, great tannins. Bold, but not in a harshly way. You get the leather and cassis from the smell. It opens up in the mouth, and stays for a long time. Amazingly smooth in the mouth, one of my favourites so far.

Simply put, one of the best wines I have ever tried. Gamey, leather, mint, fresh white pepper, almonds, dried cherries, beautiful grippy tannins, wet vegetation, unsweetened chocolate, cocoa nibs, green pepper, jalapeño, fresh flowers, lilac, fresh earth, charcoal and tar. Rich subtle tobacco tones. Mellow and mature, but nice and round fruit. There is so much going on in this wine and it is all working in harmony. Absolutely gorgeous. Perfectly balanced and enticing while still being approachable.

Sunny blackcurrant,
Green grass (meant tobacco),
Serious moonlight,
Suggest a big decant.

The #67fromhome Pauillac deep dive hasn’t event started yet but I couldn’t wait! Cracking starter for ten!
(Not Pauillac 😆)

There's always a concern deciding whether or not to pop up the cork of young Bordeaux. I'm glad I did!
The wine displayed everything you may expect from this Haut-Médoc
producer located north of Paulliac
🍷👁Dark, deeply colored
🍷👃🏻Complex,dominated by black fruit, mineral and beautiful oak 
🍷👅 Rich ripe fruit, fat and opulent, velvety tannins and an incredible mid-palate.
Cassis, cedar box, graphite, picking tobacco, and savoriness on the long layered finish.
✍️🏻Classic Bordeaux in style 
🎯4.0⭐️
Drink now!

Bright ruby red brownish appearance.  Forest floor earthy nose . Oak fruit balance. Tannins are still there.  Intense but so fresh. Seems alot younger than almost 19 years.  Tannic coffee is wonderful  Worth the price? A personal decision.  I like this alot but it is not perfect

In the words of Ron Burgundy this was like ‘an old old wooden ship from the Civil War era’. You could tell it’s age and it has mellowed into a little blackberried bundle of joy with some background woodiness. For newcomers to wine this age let it breathe and give it a chance, it will taste different. 🐺 score 7.5/10.

Had the pleasure to drink this again from a double mag this time, and happy to report, as great as I remembered.

The wine shows a rich texture with well integrated tannins that showcase the ripeness of this vintage. The frame of the wine is filled with blackberry, and red currants, lifted with cedar and clove, with a dash of roasted coffee. Lovely acids still exist that propel this wine to a long and savoury, velvety finish.

This wine is hitting its stride for sure.

Our last wine for the night, and a good one. Signature SM nose - a tinge of "green"/herbaceous, tobacco leaves, pencil-shavings, ink. Good palate weight (concentrated, but not overly heavy), very smooth. Still very young. Can easily keep for another decade. Unfortunately my last bottle. Good that this is not chased by collectors so should still be easy to backfill, to try again later down the road...

Always a pleasure to taste this wine. It is examples such as these that even at a time when this house wasn’t known for the quality they’re today; there are loads of value in good vintages. Cedar, cigar box, a touch of vanilla, cassis, and graphite all combine to make this wine a true expression of the left bank.

If one day something strikes in my head and I`ll decide to compose a wine guide-book, I would comment this wine the following way: deep magnificent violet-purple color.
The complex diversity of nose includes mineral notes of graphite, smoke, vanilla cream and blackberries. Brim-full, nicely balanced wine with bright tannines and good acidity.
In the exquisite bouquet you can feel the charming interlasing of black-currant, cream liqueur, smoke, spices and mild hints of minerals...

Begins with lilacs on the initial nose with fresh earth. ..cigar box middle with sweet dark cherries. ..exposure to air makes it taste like it is going to last forever. ..nice strong yet classy left bank  finish...great value and at 14 years of age it has at least another 6 or 7 more years left....
High quality! Really good nose. Ready to go now with 2h decant.

4.3 *** Blessed to sample this Left Bank Médoc that had held up well in color, depth and character. Overnight decant, was amazing.

Deep garnet color throughout with thin sudsy legs.

Nose of red fruit, tobacco and dry earth.

Opening of red fruit favoring plums with fresh rain, red licorice and hazelnuts and oak finish.

Medium bodied and low acidity with mellow hints of a 'tannin-of-old' that emerge and fade gracefully.

Just awesome!
Peace and cheers!

Tried in 04/2022. Clear, deep ruby color. Medium tears that fall slowly and have medium + pigmentation. One the nose: plum, blueberry, clove, forest floor. Stone, vanilla, pomegranate, on the palate. Medium powdery tannins. Long finish. Medium acidity. This is a lovely left bank wine that just gets better as it opens.

Deep ruby. Oaky in the nose. Blackberry, blackcurrant, chocolate, vanilla, molasse, wet earth, plum. Bold on the palate. Med plus tannin, dry, high acidity. Med finish. Good wine but the finish is too short and stops quite sudden. At peak and will downgrade shortly.

2000 vintage. Drank in 2022. Ruby colored, restrained on the nose, very minimal hints of oak. Red fruit notes are mellow, residual hints of dark fruit, Good balanced acidity. Tannins well integrated. Developed well over a 2.5hr session. Hints of minerality and untanned leather. Paired well with steak and tomato cream based pasta

Still good, after all these years. Yesterday I had a Cos d’Estournel 1997, same year. The Cos d’E had not resisted as well to age! It was flat. This Sociando Mallet is still going strong ! Beautiful !

Beautiful Bordeaux! Sociando-Mallet is not a Classed Growth wine but it easily compares to many perceived superior chateaux. This 01 (my offering to our London Vivino meet-up last week) ranked #1 among the 100 best Crus Bourgeois in the Revue du Vin de France in 2004.

Deep and dark in colour, inky blue. Profound and intense nose of blackberry and blackcurrant followed by pencil shavings, cedar and earth. Full-bodied with rich and chewy tannins. 

This wine still felt virile, but getting close to its peak.

Most will say not to open this too young... but how do you know what’s too young for you?  I can say 2014 vintage in 2020 works perfectly for me.  (Though I may stash a couple for later!, especially now that I finally found a wine shop near me that carries it.).  Dark, bold, yet easy tannins, structured.  Never disappoints!

Oh well it is a big a suprise. Minerality , some toasted wood with coffee and tabacco. Plums, cherries, raspberries, cassis and more.  Love the zinc style of the minerality. Medium body, light tannins they a bit drying, juicy, great acidity, a light sweetness. One of the best wines i tasted lately. Well made, nice compexity. Love it a lot, a friend opened it and I couldn't be happier.

What a challenging Bordeaux. Deep inky colour with some earthy characters. At 14% ABV this classic Bordeaux with black cherry, plum, chocolate, spice and leather overtones. Agood blend of cabernet merlot and cabernet sauvignon.

Earth, dust, coffee and mint flavour; black currant, green pepper, cherry, tobacco and cedar taste. Medium acidity, velvety tannins, smooth, complex, round. The blend is 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc.

Deep ruby , almost impenetrable.  Perfect rim with only a hint of beginning maturity. Heavy viscosity.

Big nose. Dust. Forest floor. Lead pencil. Cranberry. Bilberry. 

Smooth attack. Medium full body. Stems and young vines. No tannin left. Logical if not particularly exciting development to a rather short finish.

Improved with aeration. Gained weight, grew longer, acidity became more pronounced; simply became better.

At its peak.

Pretty good, not bad. I can’t complain. But actually everything is just about the same - John Prine. Just about everything that you can ask for in a Medoc 🇫🇷 at this price point. Plum, black cherry, leather, tobacco, oak, earthy, spice, and green bell pepper.

Theme: Bordeaux blends.

This had a bit of green to it, leading me to think more right bank. Not quite there but a cooler year (off year I guess?). Showing very well, dark fruits, just a bit of tertiary notes. Good to try this at this point in the curve....

Drinking a little past it's year for me but still really expressive and complex. Upfront notes of blackcurrant, blackberry, cassis, with under tones of tomato stew, leather, white pepper, tobacco. Smooth velvet feel in the mouth with a decent length.

Stunning '98 drinking in '21. Medium ruby, the rim belies it's age. Pronounced aromas of dark fruit - dark plum, cassis, blackberries, blackcurrant, some vanilla, cedar, nutmeg, and a persistent cracked leather , forest floor, herbaceous including heather and bell peppers, cut grass. All of the above and a real meatiness on the palate. Med+ acidity, beautifully integrated tannins and a dry, yet pleasing, intensely long finish. Savouring this
Fabulous
Mixed well of choco , berry , mushroom and stone, mild and dry
Excellent and fidedigno exemplar from Bordeaux! Kudos... #rebuy
Needa breath for a bit. 30mins?
cassis blackcurrant not so strong in aroma a bit closed feels light wasn’t my favourite vintage
Full body wine
nice but too expensive
Still very closed and heavy tannins
Nose full of cherries, tobacco, charcoal, leather, eucalyptus. Full-bodied, medium finish.

Well balanced 
Long in mouth
Dark cherry, hint of mocha, strawberry in a slither. Wonderful wine at The George and Dragon, Clifton, Cumbria
Already quite pleasant for its age, remarkable potential.
Tobacco, vanilla and liquor flavours added to red berries. Great with steak

30dec2020.  
Rustic, peppery, smoked spicies with blackcurrant, hint of fruits purfume.  Tannin elegantly soft for a 20years old bottle.  Med finish.  Decanted an hour.
Good concentration, fruit. Paid 27 euros at intermarche
Full body and not too dry ! Fruity with late rush with taste ! Have it with prime ribs and it really bring out the taste !!
A little more tannic than expected. Dry with more earthy tones. Might benefit from a few more years in the cellar.
A nice haut Médoc. Smooth tannin, blackcurrant, tobacco, medium aftertaste. Not much depth but good structure.
Leather and stewed plums in the nose. Smoke and green pepper on the pallet. May need aging, definitely needs airing.

This is quite a lovely wine given its age and the fact that this wine Is just a simple haut medoc. Now almost 16 years old I think that the wine will not further improve. The colour is still strong with little to no sign of oxidation. The nose is clearly on the black current side and the palate is happy with the harmony between tannins and the fruit. This was my last bottle of this vintage and I do not regret to have opened it now.

Bordeaux: red wines show firm, structured tannins and high acidity. Wines from the right bank usually have less Cabernet and are softer and richer. candy and cotton floss, licorice and synthetic and salty mineral like, good grip and very tannic, good black berry and opening up with truffle and forest floor, nose is 1.5/5 and 3.5/5 on palate, after 90 mins really opened up, became fruit forward albeit with limited tertiary notes, still had ripe cranberry with Blackberry, oak and vanilla with some bell peppers and excellent balance of acidity and tannins 3.2/5

3.7/5 ⭐️ Opulent and spicy with notes of green hower a bit robust and lacking complexity compared to other Bdx 

🍇 54CS 45Me 1CF/PV. CB. 74 ha, avg +30 yrs, 50hl/ha

🍷 Appearance: clear; medium ruby

👃🏻Nose: clean; pronounced intensity; opulent aromas of spices, red fruit (wild raspberry), black fruit, oak (horse stable); developing

👅 Palate: dry; medium acidity; medium+ tannin; medium alcohol ( %); medium+ body; pronounced flavour intensity; flavours of oak spices, black fruit, red fruit; long finish

Okay, this is really good value, at less than HK$500 for a Bordeaux which have already been cellared for nearly 2 decades. What's more, it's probably peaking right now, store this > 2 years at your own risk!
Great minty woody nose, generous fruit on the palate, a long finish. Only criticism, lack depth of flavor, no tannin whatsoever (drank straight after uncorking) to balance the fruity acidic and simple finish. However, at this asking price, you're unlikely to find a better bordeaux.

Clear wine with ruby and intense colour. Shows some legs in the glass. 

Develops aromas of charred wood, vanilla but also black fruits, a bit of raisin or plum. After agitating the glass, you can also smell an aroma of crushed banana which is nice for its type of wine.

Dry wine with some acidity, good level of alcohol and present tannins that are smooth though. This gives a good balance. It’s a medium-bodied wine.

Medium finish with dominant of tannins in the mouth. Seems too young to drink now though.

Has a petroleum and mushroom nose on first open. This fades to a nice earthy and forest floor scent after about 30 mins decanting. It still has some tannins but I think this wine needs to be drunk now- Wine must be drunk now. I think if it goes longer their will be No fruit left in it and the other characteristics will be over bearing. Tons of tobacco, cedar and lead pencil, it also seems to have a wet stone minerality, and blackberry. No bright fruit. Finish does have some licorice. Very nice Bordeaux.

3.7 not bad but I wouldn’t rebuy it. The smell is promising, intense, dark fruits, oak, tabacco. The taste is not really matching. Strong and austere at the beginning, it gets softer as it opens. Silky velvet notes. Drank way better with same price.

My friend the wine expert said it was "complex". I thought it was quite good; tannic even after decanting for at least an hour. But very nice with our spinach and ricotta ravioli with pancetta and Chanterelles.

Saturday drinks at 7DP.
🍷
Nose: Leather, tobacco and oak
Palate: Full bodied with Blackberry, licorice with ripe cherries
Finish: Charcoal notes with medium acidity and grippy tannins

Bottle probably too young and needs to be put to sleep a bit more.

This 1986 Sociando Mallet is still amazingly young after 33 years. While the tannins have softened, it is still fairly closed upon opening and needs some time to open up. For fellow lovers of unctuous, decadent clarets, you will still very much enjoy this long-term, great value for strong Bordeaux reds. ❤️🍷

A very nice rendition of haut médoc. Nose is powerful with cassis, cigar box, and cedar. Medium+ bodied, bone dry with medium acidity and ripe tannins, it has concentrated flavors of blackberries as pencil shavings. Finishes with cocoa, earthiness and some black pepper.

Pleasant nose of flowers and earth.  While the fruit is mostly gone there are enough herbs mixed with earth, minerals and some  savory notes to be interesting.  Just not in the league of the 1995 Cos a couple of nights before!

Classic Bordeaux color. Slightly watery rim, but other than that very little sign of aging from the color. Nose is relatively simple but with traditional tertiary earthy notes beginning to shine through. Still a little dark fruit left on the palate which is otherwise dominated by tobacco and leather. Very fine tannins. Relatively short finish with a little bit of oak. It needs more complexity and longer finish to get higher scores, but always pleasant to drink older Bordeaux with @Jesper Brodersen

Great 1990 Bordeaux tasting 2 of 6. While Chateau Sociando Mallet is unclassified it’s quite famous. Red color with youthful hues, almost bluish. Initially subtle notes of stable but dominating by black currant, coffee, shaved pencil, grass, cooked fruit and leather. Later notes of underbrush appeared. Great acidity, grip in the tannins, great stability and cleanliness. Long austere finish.

A gift from Aaron Palileo, a wedding year vintage for me. It's not easy finding '92 Bdx; even more difficult to find well-stored ones. Dark red fruit, black cherry, cassis, bit of raspberry and anise, cedar, slight underlying earthiness. A notch or so over medium-bodied. Dry and savory. Healthy acidity - which lent much-needed cut for my dinner of luxuriously fatty, rare A5 Saga & Kagoshima Wagyu Striploins.

Oxidised a bit. Not stable, could give great notes and imprecise ones at the same time. No fruit aromas, more about pepper notes, animal flavours and rancid notes. 
I would say passed, but it was a good training.

Surprised that this was quite accessible for a 2000 and a Sociando. But more primarily attractive. Cedar. A hint of a greenish streak. But very nice fruit on the palate. Medium bodied and very good balance. Tannins well integrated, far more than many other Bordeaux 2000s i have tried. This will improve with age.

17 points - Best of "Big Bottle Party" 4/9 (from Imperial) - fruity nose combined with  wet underwood, leather and tabak. On the palate shy fruit with a bit dominated acidity. In this big bottle format better than a single bottle i had a few years ago, but in general a bit over it's peak.
A little lacklustre and dull for me these wines, dry and tannic and one I’ve never found to really enjoy however good with cheese and smoked meats.
Excellent
At age 29, still strong and concentrated aroma of fruits. Quite dense and ripe tannins. Short aftertaste and (very)short life remaining.
Leather on nose, cassis initially with dry blackberry tannins
Too young but a sting potential. Will try it again in 3 to 5 years.

Barrel sample tasting, Bordeaux 2020 en primeur. Merlot based blend with deep purple colour, black fruit aroma with earthy forest floor background, hints of delicate oak integration. Palate is ‘green’ and undeveloped, firm tannic structure and juicy acidity looks promising for years to come. However at the moment it is quite tangy snd austere with shy black fruits in the background.

(barrel sample tasted May 2021 - ****)
Classic in style. Structured with emphasis on structured tannins and well-built freshness. Violets. Brambles, blackcurrant. Bayleaf. Hazelnut. Mineral freshness.

Absolutely exquisite. Amongst the best wine I have ever tasted. We opened it let it breathe for a few hours and drunk it over two. It was still improving at the end of the bottle probably could use with another hour or two breathing. So complex.

Matured. Nose: subtle hint of black fruit (cassis) and oak. Palate: Gorgeous, balanced and well structured. Ample acidity with notes of ripe plum, prunes and tobacco. Tannins fully integrated; fine and luscious. One thing to note, bricking in 750ml bottle is evident and length is regretfully shorter than expected. Overall: well matured bordeaux, performing better if not as well as many 1855 classified. However, imo, 750ml is almost in it's decline, so drink up.

Excellent wine, with an unusual "old fashioned" palate, expressing complex ripe red fruits. A must in today's flat offer from Bordeaux woody wines. 2011 is not the best year though. Prefer 2010 and 2009 in the recent years.

This enchanting '91 is a true marvel. The Merdoc's wisdom and deep flavors are truly one of a kind. The aromas tell a tale of true joy, but deep sadness as well. Not too often does a wine come along with such magnificent depth, alas I've found it amongst family tonight.

A heavy wine, but I love that in a red to drink on its own (not with a meal). All kinds of fruits and woods to match that of far more expensive wines. At this price level, this wine is a bargain at twice the price.

Even when I prefer full bodied with meat this highly recommened choice was up to ezpectation. The tannins and slightly fruity taste matched perfectly with the menu. We had 2 bottles and would have had 3 if budget allowed.

This wine opened with aromas of leather tobacco and earthy cedar. It’s fruit is currant cherry and plum with a sprinkle of pepper. It’s flavor forward but it’s finish was a bit to be desired. It was well appreciated for a 26 year old wine!

Black pepper and salt in the smell. Just spices, no traces of fruit at all in the nose, like a steak with plenty of salt and pepper on top. Just perfect. As for the palate, same flavour in the mouth as the smell!! Toasted and peppery. Balanced tannins, smells rich but flavour is soft, it doesn't burn in your mouth. Not intense but very long finish (minutes). Best thing I've ever drank.

Fruit is definitely fading here. Secondary aromas coming much more into play. Classic leather tabbacco cedar aromas. Very nice balance, tannins almost velvety.

Black cherries, pepper, blackberries, leather, bacon and liquorice in the nose. High acidity, well balanced with tannins. Excellent quality.

Extremely well made rhone blend that already seems so ready to drink. Intense dark fruit and lots of vanilla/tobacco. Smells of US oak... Very tasty and well balanced wine.

Happy New Years Rhône Tuesday 🎆🎇🎉😁!

Drinking more Cornas is a resolution 😉! Tardieu-Laurent founded only in 1993! In Lourmarin, Provence. Coteaux 🍇 from 3 vineyards: Savaux, Chaillots, Patou all on bottom of little hills (Coteaux). 12 mths in 100% new oak barrels! 6 mths in foudre, 60-100 yr old vines! 👃of violet, black currents, cocoa, pepper. 👅is high acidity, relatively smooth tannins, medium peppery length. Very good but the Barcillants was better. 4.1🌟!

Cheers and happy new year Vivino friends🎆🎇🎉!
Cassis, pepper, black beery, cherries, chocolate and coffee in the nose and on the palate. Intensive. High tannin, medium acidity. Long finish.
Very good wine for a great price. Similar tasting notes as my last rating.
Earthy tones, taste of smoke light leather. Very nice wine!

89 Points, drink now until 2022. Deep ruby coloured with minimal rims. Fleshy nose of ripe black berries and cherry, smoke and speck, thyme and pepper. Balanced and smooth on the palate, full bodied and complex, this good effort is finishing medium, a bit alcoholic.

4.0-4.1

Tardieu Laurent  is solid Negociant of South France.I've tried most of wines from them, they all outgoing and good.I normally consume their CnDP and Rasteau for table.And I think it's very suitable for casual gathering of wine lovers.

Actually, this Cornas is V.V. Blending 60 years and 100 years grapes from Le Chaillot,Patou and les eygats.

Deep Purple Ruby

Plum,Fig,Blackberry,Rasberry,Lavender,Subtle of Garrigue,Peppers,Darkchocolate,Bloodsausage.

Purple in color. In the nose, ripe dark fruit, pepper and herbs, paired with distinct barrique notes: smoke, wood, leather. Medium body, present acidity and tannins. Well-done, typical and powerful Syrah from Northern Rhône!

Very elegant style of Syrah, with wonderful palate which keeps changing and offering taste. Complex nose of blueberry, violet, leather, tobacco and spices (clove). Dry, Medium acidity, M+tannin, M alcohol level, M+body.  Blueberry, Bramble, Vanilla, Black pepper. Smooth and silky tannin, with a long finish of black fruits lingering. Very good quality.
This time in pristine condition... fresh and vibrant, packed with red fruit and bright acidity. Lovely northern Rhône Syrah attributes. Well done
Starting to come into its own...nose is a bit shy but just so good on the palate, very showy and confident wine.  Serious Wine
Fantastic Rhone blend with a complex nose of dark fruits and liquorice. On the palate it shows good complexity and length. Tannins are already well integrated all though still a little too young.
Very appealing and highly complex. Splendid production and no signs of overriped grapes.
Toasted coffee bean, radish & crab apple on the nose. Slightly vegetal & earthy on the palate with sour cherry, balsamic vinegar & cranberry.
Daniels Northern Rhone tasting at the hotel. Rich and pure with flowing fruit and refined texture.
Yum!  Quality producer creating another tasty wine from Cornas.  Plenty of dark fruit, tar and a back end of metal.  Delicious!
As for all Tardieu Laurent's 2007,  this does not taste like a hot vintage wine.  It's not too alcoholic,  nor too tannic.  Juicy,  full,  long and tasty.  Nice wine!
93/100, top Cornas from Tardieu - 2007 being a solid year. Slight hints of white pepper and spices. Silky in the mouth and beautiful length.  Great wine.

Rich and dense Cornas from old vines.  Syrah produces meaty juice. Blueberry, cassis, black olive, herbal.  Aged for two years in half new and half old barrels.  13.5 abv.  Supple with grippy tannins at the moment.

4.3. Dark violet/purple, unfiltered. Blackberries, bacon fat, lavender and baking soda on the nose. Flavors of black fruits with soft, integrated tannins and low acids on the medium length finish. 

Recommend one hour decant minimum or cellar another 5-6 years. Truly excellent wine and right on target for the price.
Deep ruby red with purple hint, pronounced nose of oak, vanilla, black fruits, mocha. Medium acidity palate, medium + tannins,  full body and medium finish.
Beautiful Syrah, full of dark chocolate, cinnamon, dark berries and smoky oak. Balanced tannins and a long finish.

Intense and expresive aromas of black fruits, prunes, violet involved with fresh aromas of oak, vanilla, pepper, licorice and wild flowers. Well integrated tannins, pleasant acidity, good structure and medium long finish

3.6 From yesterday's Zoom meeting with the theme "What's your favorite grape and why". Sadly, a bit of a let down but enjoyed with good company. Much lighter than expected, mid-bodied and could pass like a PN looking at the glass. Starts with smoked bacon but the gamey-meaty notes fade away to just a mild scent. Feels bit alcoholic feel (13.5%) and tannins are a tad green right now. Great acidity, wild strawberries and tart red berries mixed with white pepper and mild garrigue notes. Way off Cornas I think.

Cornas, one of my favourite Syrah appellations. Top producer.  Dark Ruby. Savory! Black pepper, black olives, tapenade, dark fruit, violet, oak, outstanding acidity, Earthy, tar, rustic, bold, complex. Well integrated tannins, M+ acidity, M+ alcohol, M tannins.

Initial sour cherry that overwhelmed the nose, picking up light chocolate & coffee note. Palate was grips tannin & high acidity. 

Then decanted for 2 hrs,  It's sour cherry turn into ripe black cherry with plum, not dense or jammy but soft fresh fruits couple with mint, chocolate, coffee &  with hints of mud & vanilla oak. 

Palate: Soft & refresh fruits mouthfeel with tannins & acidity that liven up the palate.

Good finishing with mint, spice & gd red cherry notes.
17h ripe red dark friuts plum preserved friuts liquorice peppery spicy dry spices cedar mocha mushrooms powdery tannins muscular meaty good texture.
Great wine. Full body at its best.
Olive, graphite, honeysuckle florals, red stewed fruits, spice. Very powdery cocoa tannins, sweet oak dominates finish. Slightly bitter at the end, bit syrupy.
Had it with rib eye steak. Very powerful nose of vanilla, leather and smoke. Very nice length. A bit high on the acidity side of things but went well with the steak

We had this wine at the beautiful emerald lake lodge in BC. A fabulous paring with their game meat focused menu. It is a great expression of northern Rhone Syrah. It is rich, dense, coating and perfectly blended. 

An abundance of sweet tobacco, slight black pepper, and a smoked meat note. It’s drinking in its prime. There’s still loads of black fruit showing. Only thing costing this a half star is that it was a bit cloudy.
Very intense fruit, good acidity keeps it drinkable
Wonderful!  Drunk at Quo Vadis and with this bottle age it was absolutely belting.
leather oak pepper blackberry smoke
Not as bold as the 2010.  But very enjoyable.

A Cornas with a lot of potential, sadly not all of it is realised. A nice, and type-right, implementation. Dark berries, violet flowers, and pepper. Rich, but not impressively complex. Structured with a rather short finish. Nice, but expected more at this price level.

Nice QPR for Cornas with decent bottle age (2005).  I needed to find my vino true north after lately having some disappointing high alcohol bombs  (see Alto Moncayo & Yacochuya) So I went with Northern Rhone. Steady Freddy.  This vino was all about secondary notes- barnyard, garrigue, moist wood, green tobacco and loads of leather. A literal leather slap down.  Very modest tart blackberries for fruit, with very present yet pleasing dry tannins.  Better with food, but I was happy to consume this without.
Lovely jubbly
Super Fruits, Plumps and Spices. Good acid but not too much. Nice smooth tannins. Very nice.
4.25. Dark fruit, dried herbs, leather, and black pepper. The palate is much more intense than the nose, with an explosion of dark fruit and savory notes. Intense but elegant, smooth round tannins.

Very interesting CdR from North of Rhone.
Earthy smell and taste. Bit dry.

Medium purple, closed initially opens up with intense minerality, spices, animal, leafs and oaky notes. Intense on the palate, quite rich and medium to full body, vanilla, black fruits, a bit jam, nice balance on tannins and acidity, long finish!

Dark and aged colour, both dark and light red fruits on the nose with a bit of the yeast coming through too. Lots of spicy black pepper also.
Slightly creamy taste with hints of oak, butterscotch  and balsamic finish. A tad past it's prime, wouldn't hold much longer.

3.75 really. Very northern rhone. Meaty peppery note and a full and savoury palette. I struggle with Cornas a bit as I always judge things on what they’re like to drink on their own. This would be odd, but with the pork belly we had for lunch? Perfect. Thought it was really rather good.
Loads of black pepper on the nose, dark fruits, chocolate and coffee. Probably at the peak now, if even toward the latter half of it.

I was stunned at where this wine was at. The first word that popped into my mind was “feral” It smelled so primal, smoke, thyme, rosemary, pepper, juniper, game meat. But it also had a beautiful side with wild strawberry, raspberry, and even some red plum. The structure was as if the wine was still in its baby phase, tannin and acidity were lively. This wine has plenty of time ahead of it. We also popped and poured, and it just started ascending as we drank the last of it.

I found this wine a real disappointment. Unsubtle, syrupy, bitter, uninteresting, with scent of banana (no kidding). Muscular, luxurious and full bodied. First impression comes across and savory, cassis, earthy, tobacco, oak , orange peel in that order. Give it a swirl and the black fruits make their appearance. A superb and complex wine that probably doesn’t get the recognition it deserves. Deep garnet coloured. Interesting aromas of cigar box, oak, cured meat and blackcurrant. Full bodied, medium acidity, and medium silky tannins with cassis, leather and forest floor notes.
Nose went from candied cherry to cigar box after an hour of breathing. Medium body, gripping tannins, medium acidity, leather, chocolate and tobacco on the finish. Great wine.
Fruity, dry, tobacco
Tobacco leather black fruit

Pushing a 3.5, it's for me disappointing from a pauillac. It has the promise of a good Bordeaux and what you'd expect to the nose, oaky yet with depth, which then just doesn't transpire to the taste. Lackluster when you're looking at the price bracket I'd expect a lot more complexity and depth to the palate. I'll leave it overnight and see if the rest opens up, though it's not at all unpleasant, it really isn't, it just isn't anything I'd write home about and isn't worth the price.

A lot of earthy, leathery, tobacco, notes up front. Quite dry and quite tannic which makes it not everyone’s wine. I enjoyed it but it’s very bold and 9 years in a lot of the fruit has fallen off. Some dark berry fruit remains.

A dry, medium bodied Pauillac wine from left bank of Bordeaux. Deep ruby colour with rich fruity aroma of blackberries, black currants and scent of oak and spices. Well balance palate of red fruits flavour, rich oak, nice spiciness, medium acidity, medium tannins and medium alcohol. The finishing is long, spicy and oaky. There is subtle bitterness aftertaste. Quite a good wine from a 5th growth.

Clear deep purple color. Medium aromatic intensity, leather, black fruit, vanilla and earthy. Balanced, dry, Medium+ bodied, high acidity, medium tannin and finishing with sweet spices. Good pairing with aged cheese, beef and lamb.

Very mineral driver nose but the Palate feel very thin upon opening it was not until the second day with massive amount of air it then decide to wake up and show its quintessential pauillac charm of blackcurrant and all so well balanced acidity.

Chateau Croizet-Bages 2012
Dense plummy currants on the bouquet, underpinning a graphite and iron core, tapering to a grippy saccharine note. Supple entry, peaking to an austere core ripe chalky tannins, leaving a lingering sweet grippy note

Nose: secondary and tertiary, earthy, spices, minerals, oaky, black currant, marinated vegetables. 

Taste: fruity, medium acidity, medium intensity, long finishing, strong tanning at the beginning and left strong bitter taste after 1.5hr. Secondary to tertiary taste. 

Quality: good wine.
Garnet with purple hue. Earthy and cedar on nose. Black fruits, acidic and full body with a peppery finish

Deep ruby, mid-full body. Smell Cassis, very slight hint of sweet orange. 
Cedar, cigar box, black pepper, slight hint of coconut, continue drinking on the 2nd night, stored vaccum in normal fridge. 
Quite sweet palate on initial sips, follow with good acidic, little oaky, grippy but rounded and not very demanding tannin, finishing with some spiciness n good, just enough acidity. 
Wine with good structure, recommended, 
*Drinking 2012 in Oct 2021, for 2 nights in humid Singapore, slightly cooling night.
3.75/5. Quite a spicy palate. Maybe it's still too young. Normal nose. Short finish.

2011 vintage after the 2016 of this fine Pauillac of Croizet Bages! Often seen as a lesser vintage 2011 but I like it these days since it is already peaking!

Brown and burgundy colour, red fruit scents such as pinot-noir, too light compare to other Pauillac Grand cru classe wine. But oak, cedar, leather, blackberry tastes, Medium to long length finish for the first 2 hours after uncorked were made me pleasant. appropriate sweetness, slightly high acidity. Price is 42-45 US dollars (57,900 Korean won).

I drank it over two days. It became more strong tannins, less scents. chocolate and cedar tastes were so nice on second day.

At 9 years old it looks a bit tired already. But drinking all well.
👀: Deep garnet
👃🏻: Pronounced intensity of complex aromas: leather, earthy, cedar, tobacco, coffee beans, cassis. Fully developed.
👅: High acidity and tannin. Medium alcohol and body. Pronounced intensity of flavours: cedar, smoke, coffee beans, black fruits. Long finish.
Ages quickly from a rather rainy year. Drink now before it's too late.

3.7 tried it in the morning and it had mid tannin and acidity. The body was also not as high thus thought it would have more merlot than usual blend. The structure is a not that complex with short finish. 

Tried again later today and it was much more smooth than earlier. However, it did lost some more complexity. 

There seems to be shortage in some parts and this maybe characteristics of off vintage.
