This time I had it with picanha and it brought out more. Plum, leather and tobacco that lingered on the palate and nose 👃 to match. Decant 6 hours and made the difference.
(4,2) (2018) powerhouse
Delicate floral nose. Citruses, black currant, pepper, sea water on palate.
oak blackberry cassis leather cedar Floral tannin smooth
Soft tannins and full of fruits. For a 2011 IT is superb
Nice berries. Need to decant one hour
Not a good vintage, but still quite good. Oaky and earthy. 👍

So full tannin full body and perfect balance acidity
 oak leather blackberry cedar cassis tobacco blackcurrant 

Very impress!
Cedar, Blackberry, Nice finish

Cream, Oak, Dark fruit, Pepper

3.6 is too harsh in ny opinion
Medium bodied high on complexity quintessential French red wine.
For birthday of name
oak leather vanilla leather graphite blackberry

Evening with friends and this aged Bordeaux was sublime in its elegance and balance with food!

Nose of restrained red fruit on the cassis side with leather, herbs and tobacco.

Thin body, fresh steely acidity, mature thin tannins on the dark herb side, soft cherry and cassis with a delicious dark bitter chocolate backbone.

Long finish of soft herbs and a dash of red fruit in remote coffee chocolate. 

A beauty in elegance.

4,25 stars.

I have exactly the same opinion of the others Vivino users: 3,9 stars for this rare Cinquième Grand Cru Classé en 1855 from Pauillac!
Quite serious and classic Pauillac that shows its better face in the aftertaste. We feel the smell and taste of the second used French oak barrels in a pronounced way. And then, dark plums, black currants and earthy notes (gravels). The tannins are quite wild yet. Full bodied but  with a pleasant mouthfeel. Long, savory and elegant aftertaste.

Beauty quality wine, good scores on all fronts! Vintage matters so much! On the nose, clear black current, signature cassis, cedar and very refined mineral notes. I was expecting powerful tannic taste — it didn’t disappoint, but at the same time, the fruit is very obvious too! Elegant and balance. High tannin but I can drink a whole bottle without food by myself. Long long finish with minerals. And it’s getting better and better with air. Got residuals but no impact to the taste.

Saw in 2021 with a couple of bottles of this over a couple of days. Initially very bright with lots of blackberries and black currant but then opened out with tobacco, cedar and a lot of minerals. Beautifully structured and will age further. Groovalisimo

4.0 Tasting this fifth growth for the first time and what a nose! Really remarkable nose but a bit weaker in the mouth. Cedar, coffee, leather, black currants, cassis and tobacco. Still harsh tannins but a wine that needs to rest for some years in the cellar. Despite its youth, enjoyed it a lot. Big decanting needed if you open this now.

Happy Bordeaux Sunday : 
Ok, ok I know this is perhaps too young but as an experiment cracked this to see if the fruit of youth would work against the level of tannin I would expect. This is nearly 50:50 Cab S and Merlot - there’s 2% Pt V in here too. 5eme GCC

Deep purple
Med nose: graphite, leather, bramble, cassis, eucalyptus 
Dry, med acidity, med+ tannin, med body, med flavour: bramble, cassis, black cherry, leather, black pepper, liquorice.
Long finish / very good

A decent HBS wine 
🕺🏼🤠😎🤠🕺🏼

Dark ruby red fading to brick, brick rim. Moderately intense nose dominated by cedar, wood, sweet spice with some cassis, bramble, and fig. Full bodied, dry, high acidity,  medium plus well grained tannin. Plenty of primary fruit on the palate - blackcurrant, black cherry, bramble - with raisin, date and fig. Woody notes, tobacco and cedar and some vanillin spice. Intensely flavoured and well balanced. Long finish of luscious black cherry and cassis with black pepper. Excellent and a good 5-10 yrs to go.

Happy Bordeaux Sunday! A little bird🐦told me Pauillac & I just happen to have one😁. Purchased for $17 on an EOB sale, makes it taste even betta😋. 10 min 🌀& he's singing🎶. Deep ruby robe, mainly herbaceous👃of violets, eucalyptus🍃, bay leaf & mint🌱mixing w/restrained, austere red & black fruit w/a licorice🎶. Dry, full body💪, med acidity & dry, tongue👅coating tannins;🏋. Fairly expressive👅of black currant, black cherry🍒& cassis w/a smooth, sexy mid👅of bikini👙leather, anise; persistent pepper 🏁.

Paired with cheese and Shepard pie. Not sure if it’s me but coming from 2014 vintage, it’s not a bad wine. The liquid combined with the cheese and beef cut away the oiliness of the food making it very delish
Nice Paulliac. Cassis, forest fruits, mint, licorice, earthy and tobacco. Med+ body, high acidity and tannins. Definitely needs time to develop.
I was served for Japanese Summer traditional dish "grilled eel with thick soy sauce", by my fav sommelier. Great wine, great quality eel!

Caveman: Deep ruby
Strawberry cherry mint 
Vanilla
Dry, high acid, medium tannin, medium alcohol; medium body
Pronounced flavours 
Long finish

Very good wine
A very nice classic Pauillac - ripe fruits with musty leather and notes of tobacco - nice long finish
Never disappointing!

Proper Pauillac but unfortunately should have waited, just not ready for us yet. Nice dark red bold wine, nose of fresh blackberry, cassis, blackcurrant, and plum, half integrated tannins (that is why I said I should have waited), cedar, oak, earthy, mushroom or leather, a bit vanilla and hints of smoke, pepper and dark chocola. Great finish. Fine wine, but wait 4 more years?

Lovely classic Pauillac. Still plenty of dark berries and floral petals after more than 10 years. Literally bursting in the mouth with hint of pepper and liquorice. Dry medium finish with good structured tannins and acidity. Great with steak or cheese snack.

It has deep ruby red colour with very long wine legs. Nose is filled with eucalyptus, barnyard & sour cherry. It’s a full bodied wine with med + acidity & strong tannins. Tasted red cherry, lots of licorice & have a long & dry finish.
Full body w good complexity
Good silky wine that still holds its balance. Garnet color. Still good nose. Thank you for opening this bottle, dear my friend.
Brown colour shows its matureness. Hints of toffee, caramel, cinnamon and oak in the nose. Very soft taste and perfectly balanced.
Could say that this was ”surprisingly good”. Lots of berry taste left, although a decent amount of old Bordeaux leather etc too.
From 6 L. Good fruit still present, moderately bricked well balanced spice and woody leather. A fantastic recent purchase for only $200!
Chalky deep tannins and complex fruit that is full of apricot, blackberry and tar. This wine needs time to open up and time to mature.
Very fruity first nose of blackberry still … while it is 18 years old wine. Soft and gentle. Paired with chicken filet 13” alco.

🩸🩸🩸 so powerful and I feel that it is so young....but turns out its a vintage 2000 just wow 🩸🩸🩸

Muddy, mud, blood, iron, capsicum, หอยแครง...
Getting to end, still developed aroma but is not getting to the downfall. Easy nose, light and wild. On taste, is good but short
Natured Pauillac with tobacco, cedar and mushrooms. sweetened tannins and a hint of acidity left, marvelous wine for the price of 25 euro 🍷
Well aged, elegant not too full bodied classic Bordeaux from a fantastic year, nice equilibrium , secondary fruits, very good with veal
Worth waiting 14 years for. Loads of red fruit, not much tannins but had a bite. Unfortunately slightly TCA. Good with dry aged Tomahawk.

£30 Wine Society. 
Lovely dry pauillac. Absolutely bloody lovely.
Very good wine.
91 points. Vintage 2014 opened in 2022. Tasted at the weekend des Grands Cru in Bordeaux.
3.8. Autumn nose, forest after rain with wet leaves and a little fog. Cherries and pepper in taste. Easy to drink, without too many words to say...
Another great Pauillac! Will buy more in future.
Perfect example of smooth and stylish Pauillac - really light on its feet yet full of depth
Amazing wine. Balanced and full of taste.
Beautiful...very strong still...deserves more aging or decanting
Very good for the price. Typically Pauillic, fine.
Smoky, peppery, delicious drop. And my wife loved it. Thanks McShez.
What a beautiful wine. Clear. Deep intensity. At the nose : succh a broad diversity of flavours. At the palate : Great balance.

Wow! What a surprise! This Croizet-Bages 2010 outperformed Chateau Pontet-Canet 04 & Duhart-Milon 04 in a blind tasting. Why / how? 

It's just such pleasure to drink this smooth, but dense wine which is for me also a perfect example of a classic Pauillac. 

Nose: Cassis, black berries, herbs, pencil shavings and a tasty sweetness at the end. 

Palate: The palate shows minerality, nice grip, smooth tannins, sweetness, dark choc.

For me 95 points. Don't know if this gets better as it already shows so well.

Masterclass Conseil des vins du Medoc. #8
Appearance: ruby red, medium intens, clear. 
Nose: developing, clean condition, medium intens. Aromas of mandarine, violet, spices, vanilla, chocolate.
Palate: dry, compact tannins, medium body, medium (+) finish. 
Assessment: outstanding wine. Potential for aging.
Unsweetened Chocolate and cherry. A little cigar on the nose. A wonderful complex blend.
Easy to drink pauillac in a quite bad vintage
Lovely soft cherry and elegant long finish. Still substantially tannic but will have oak and vanilla to round it out. My first pauillac un a long long time.
Dark fruit minerals oak hint of vanilla on the nose medium body soft tannins medium acidity dark fruit leather oak tobacco mineral on the palate medium finish
Classic Pauillac notes. Drinking well now. Cassis, plum, leather, cedar. From a top vintage, still a bit concentrated but drinks well with some aeration.

Grand Cru 2016 tasting in Amsterdam. On to the Pauillacs. Another bottle I user to find in my fathers celler in my wine novice days.

Cassis and chocolate nose. Medium acidity, red fruit, medium bodied and slender, firm tanines, very drying.

Rather elegant and sturdy in one.

A sweeter aroma and tastes that match with cherry, raspberry and strawberry sugary notes. Mild tannins. A decent wine, but over priced. Tasted at the Union des Grand Cru de Bordeaux in Chicago. 91 points.  (How my star rating works... 5 STARS = 100-96 points, 4.5 = 95-93, 4 = 92-90, 3.5 = 89-87, 3 = 86-84 etc)

A lot of meaty and earthy correctors on this wine, beef jerky, sliced red meat, smoky, wet forest floors, slight red currant and plum note, kind of flat on palate, some wet dirt, med acidity, med- body

Amazing taste. Chateau Croizet Bages Pauillac Bordeaux Grand Cru Classic. 2016
Very deep red color.
High in tannins.
13.5% Alcohol.
Deep dark red fruit, limestone, tabacco, wood. 
Beautiful long aftertaste

With my “wine Parliament”, this time Bordeaux blends, #2 of 7.
Powerful , tasty , Pauillac.
Dark fruit 
Black pepper 
Leather , smoke , barnyard 
Quite far from its peak
Nicely developed, dark red color, nose is not very intense, rather subtle, red fruit, leather. Palate balanced, some acidity, blueberries, cherries, liquorice. Long finish.
I think now Aug 2020 this wine is getting to be end of life. Taste has a hint of basement. But the taste has absolutely no issues. It is still very good. Taste of some rhubarb and thyme.
Intense colour with crimson shades. Fairly profound nose of red fruits (raspberry), oak and gingerbread. Supple attack flowing into a firmer mid-palate and finish with quite dry tannins.
dark ruby color.  a bit close down, black fruits. Big structure, still need some time. Should be better after 2-30years, high acidity at this moment.
Tarry black fruit. Sure to mature well
At its peak, it's accessible right out of the bottle, sporting red fruit, dark fruit, tar, and leather. Pleasantly grippy tannins on the finish.
Quite dry and tannic. Should have been decanted.  Some iron notes mixed in with floral aromas. Savory. Dried herbs. Not bad at all.
Youthful garnet colour. Soft nose of cassis dried herbs, tea leaves and raspberries. Good structure with depth of flavour and fine tannins. Honest wine that reflects the good 2000 vintage
Good wine.
Dark fruits, blackberries, blackcurrants, pepper, leather, sweet spices, velvet tannins, long finale, very good
Bordeaux En Primeurs 2014 tastings. Rather thin wine, some fruit, but not overwhelimng, some light acidity
Well, it might have seen better days. Lack of character/taste and also too light. This 2013 vintage has perhaps past its peak. The color is dark red and the smell is super nice.
Deep dark red colour. Cedar aroma. A rich and throughly enjoyable. Dry tobacco yet smooth with cedar, oak and leather flavours. This dtyness is followed by a red cherry flavour.

Pauillac remains a slightly disappointing region overall in 2015. Not the juiciest fruits for long term cellaring. The perfumed oak smoke stands out, smokey, vanilla, with some elegant fruits of black fruits and cassis in the background. Suggest avoid weaker Pauillac wines from 2015.

88/100

Another Grand Cru Classé ticked off ✅. I WILL taste every classed Left Bank.

Haven't tasted 15 since launch. So also good to taste for that reason. 

It's got a velour plushness and welcoming personality. More ready to go than expected.

Cassis, plum skin, tobacco leaf, roasted chestnut.

High acid. Med+ tannin. Full body. 13.5%. 

Loses points for its length. There's not much beyond mid palate. The finish is whispering tobacco

Pronounce aroma of black currant, oak, liqorice. 
High acidity, medium+ bodied and medium+ level of grainy tannin. Medium+ finish. Try in 2020, need further integration.
Had for Xmas with beef tenderloin.  Really special.
3.8 - forgettable but perfectly enjoyable 5CC. Dark ruby, med/full body, dry & quite acidic. Weak nose some blackcurrant later. Med tannins. Iso2 w/ T-bone steak ~ 40.

Medium-bodied and we’ll balanced.
Ready to drink now. Restrained nose for a Pauillac with well-balanced fruit on the palate and structured finish with hint of blackberry

Almost salty feel. Soft tannins mid acidity, slight bitterness??? meh. Not a fan. 3 stars.

Edit* - After letting it breathe for an hour-
Rich complex aromas- beautiful! Sweet finish. Full bodied, still that hint of saltiness. Bitterness has disappeared. Not a vibrant fruitiness- more of a subdued dark fruit.

Colour was ruby garnet.
Intensity of the nose was pronounced. Took like 1.5-2hrs to decant. Abit too young for drinking now. Consist of black fruits, (blueberry, blackberry and plum), strong mint and eucalyptus with abit of leathery, smoke, slight vanilla & chocolate touches to it. Overall high tannin, medium alcohol, full body and long finish. There is complexity but not powerful enough as it’s abit too young now.

Dark garnet-red color in the glass! On the nose with strong aromas of blackcurrants, blackberries, blueberries and slightly cheeky tobacco leaves! On the palate medium to full-bodied with austere, elegant tannins and a long finish! Cheers!

Blackberry, cassis, oak, cedar, leather, tobacco, pepper, and violet. Beautiful floral and smoky aromas for a Pauillac at this price point. The 2013 vintage was extremely disappointing, but you shouldn’t shy away from later vintages like this one!

Everything I would hope for in an aged Pauillac showing notes of tobacco, cigar box, cedar boughs. Chalky and dusty tannins and very integrated already. Quite powerful out of the bottle and needed some time to open up a bit. Should be drinking just fine in another 5 years from now.

I paid 15 usd at release for this wine! It has all the characteristics of good Pauillac.  Fantastic price quality ratio. Will it gain further? - no
Can ladt fo another 3-4 years. Only one bottle left😐

Ruby, quite light. Hint of beginning maturity. Impressive tears.

Nose reserved, you have to coax the bouquet out of the glass. Archetypical Pauillac: dust, lead pencil, black currants. Finess.

Powerful attack. Lots of taste. Good tannin. Perfect acidity balance. Soft and  supple but has backbone. Dynamical middle: a lot is happening. Long. Lovely aftertaste.

Will keep for at least ten more years but do good now that one csn as well drink it now. Better than many Mouton.

After two-three hours in decanter it showet off. Brick red color with brown-orange rim.  oak cedar blackberry cassis on the nose. Palate follows up. Fully matured. Integrated and silky tannins. Light acidity with a dry finish.

4.2* Very much satisfying. Maybe not outstanding, but quite complex and well matured Pauillac in the first half of its drinking window.
Dark cherry, plum, cedar, wet leaves, forest floor, prune, fig. Velvety tannins and rounded yet clearly outlined acidity.
Very Pauillac. Enjoyable.

Very clean and balanced paulliac. The glass is so pretty, you cant see this is from 2005. 
On the nose, firework, Oak, black Currant, black currant, smoke, vanilla. 
On the palate, Oak, plum, blackv Berry, black currant, leather. 
Still got a good bite on the tannins, acidity. Good experince.

Still ruby color wine with medium intensity aromas of red fruit, black fruit, eucalyptus, white pepper, oak and tobacco. Medium plus tannins and medium acidity. Flavors of oak , blackcurrant, black cherry, raspberries, leather, coffee and tobacco. Medium plus aftertaste.

88-89/100, 3,8*
Nose of medium intensity with hints of dark berries, blackberry, oak, cedar, bark, herbs, a lot of spices, black pepper, licorice, smoke, undergrowth.
Dry taste of medium intensity with good balance, medium acidity, silky medium tannins, medium body, bark, cedar, herbs, bitterness of licorice, medium+ complexity, medium+ length.

👁 Med ruby. 👃 Blackberry, blackcurrant, plum, mushroom 🍄 leather, tobacco, graphite & vanilla. Dry, high acidity, med tannin, med alcohol (12.5%), full body, pronounced flavours of blackberry, blackcurrant, plum, mushroom 🍄 & vanilla & a lovely long finish. Outstanding & drinking at it’s peak, not suitable for further ageing. A classic Pauillac from a great vintage. Came 2nd in our side by side tasting with Peter Michael Les Pavots 2007.

Carried to Shanghai @ 亞洲烤肉公司

Absolutely fantastic value for money. It went well with japs BBQ.  Ripe black fruit, smoke, cedar on the nose; concentrate; full bodied. Notable tannin yet within the comfortable range. Acidity slightly stood out at first but balanced out after a while. 

I would definitely try other older vintage.

Deep brick red. Nose is with sweet ripe cherries, prunes, and dried herbs in the background. Palate is smooth, medium to full bodied, similar profile to the 1976 but bolder and more intense. Elegantly integrated oak. Good.

Was dribling this in 2014, and i will say that it's over the date. It regardless of that, a fine wine, not as powerful as I hoped. Have a good texture and balance. Can't tell the price since I hade since 2009. Back then I got it for 149 dkk.

This must be the crème de la crème.  And it is! GCC 5e. Strong presence of cassis in the smell.  And after the first taste round but dry with some tannines. Also some acids and chemic with spices.  So I think this wine is still too young. Aftertaste long but still dry. Within a few years 5 stars?

4.0-4.1, stays substantive rather than nominal. Garnet with tawny hues in color, minimal sediment. Absolutely needs decanting + 30 min to breathe. At room temperature, it then emerges as a mature yet classy Bordeaux: plum & cherry, hints of raspberry, cinnamon, pepper, traces of forest floor and cedar on the aroma. Black fruit & cherry, just a bit of nutmeg, lots of wet leather on the palate. Long and somewhat spicy finish. A great choice for a formal dinner built around wagyu roast beef. Recommended👍

Juicy, medium body, graphite, tobacco, a hint of oak and dried herbs 🌿, fruity flavours of black cherries 🍒, blueberries 🫐 and cassis, licorice, chocolate 🍫, spicy, pleasant acidity, grippy tannins, med.(+) finish.

Delicious Pauillac in its peak. Very nice round tannins and great fruit and vibrancy. It made everyone very happy. oak leather blackberry cedar cassis tobacco blackcurrant earthy black fruit I recommend.

Clean clear wine with a deep Ruby red almost purple core. Feint watery rim with medium+ viscosity. Nose of black fruit and chocolate, a heady aromatic mix that draws you in. Palate is dry with medium acidity and medium+ tannins. The tannins are a little overwhelming and distort the balance slightly but overall the length is supreme and the finish is great. I like tannic reds but the reader should be aware the tannins do render this glass mouth drying ! Brilliant wine nonetheless.

This is 25 years old wine and delivering as Pauillac Grand Cru. It has a brilliant reddish brick colour with long legs and some sediments. The nose shows complex layers of: plum, prune, leather, nutmeg, mushrooms, and cloves. The palate offers medium acidity and ripe plum flavours. At the start, it felt velvety, but softened quickly. There’s a light bitter aftertaste and medium-plus persistence. Note: paired with Peking Duck.

2000 Bordeaux. Dry, dusty and long almost sour finish. Got better after an hour or two in decanter. Very enjoyable, not alot of fruit flavour left in this but more earthy, tobacco and herbacious profile, almost like Dill and Rosemary.

Always hit and miss when opening wines of this age, but it's a lot better than expected. Fruit still present, although they have subsided almost completely. The tannins are still aggressive and doing their job. We are just tasting, but I'm sure this wine would show better in a meal. Very nice.

And for the main event the roast chicken...not turkey...nope...this beautiful Pauillac with a bit of age that sings. 
No time to elaborate again but suffice it to say that I love it! 
Thanks Alex for the recommendation 👍👏🍷
80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 17% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Franc, fruity bouquet of  cassis and blackberry, minty and decent lenght in the mouth. 89p
Tannin, berry. Need to keep more years to enjoy but after decanting we still enjoy the smooth taste.  Not bad but not that much for my taste.
Superb - smooth tannins, rich.

Well rounded Pauillac 
Only time I get to enjoy Bordeaux merlot
 oak leather earthy black fruit

Very good taste!
The liquid adheres to the toung.
Firm finish.
black fruit vanilla tobacco pepper
Very good Pauillac wine. Don't pair with spicy food.
oak leather blackberry tobacco earthy smoke cherry pepper minerals cheese
Exactly my type of big red

Strong oak and vanilla nose. Punchy tannin with dark fruit up front. Out of control kind of spiciness, with a hint of grass together with tiny bit of perfume hiding after. Long lasting light taste of blackcurrant. Bit too pricy for what I am getting here.

I'm disappointed 😤😳🤬🥵😡 It’s GCC 😣
It doesn't feel any aroma at first🈚️❌, and it tastes too watery, even like mixing wine with water.💧
After about two hours, I can smell a little aroma.⤴️
I don't know if it's a grape or a winery problem, but I think this wine needs to be fixed.🆘

Blend of 58% Cabernet Sauvignon and 42% Merlot.  Usually there is about 10% cab franc, but this year there is not.  The wine has a garnet color already, indeed the brownest of the 46 Bordeaux Wines I tasted.  A light nose of mud, burnt sugar and dark chocolate.  Light and quick maturing for a Fifth Growth.  I don’t know the property well, but maybe yields could be lowered, or a second wine created to increase concentration.

Fine sediments in liquid. Great body. Stainless, soy sauce / light vinegar, very dry oak, high acid. Supposed to taste newer. Cherry in mouth, slight hint of pepper on mouth. Turns into blood and enriched with truffle / smoke after waking in glass. Same region as La Tour, Laffe and Mouton.

BORDEAUX PAUILLAC 2013 REPORT #2

So far most appellations I have reported were disappointing, as Bordeaux 2013 wines lacked structure, complexity and tannins. Can only serve the wines for early drinking as there's no aging capability. 

I didn't get to taste a lot of Pauillac, of the 2 that I tasted, I was again disappointed. Extremely muted nose, took a while to sniff out light red fruits and woody oak. Palate was creamy (probably from the oak), light, cherry, very poorly made, quite hopeless.

4th vertical:

91. Smoke, lead pencil, walnuts and a little spicebox is all here. Way better than '92 and a clear surprise to see the performance, better than expected. Very pure and fine balance. A wine in it's autumn yet still drinking good.

Currently 4.1 but will develop over next 5-10 yrs into a very fine wine. Dark fruit colour & nose - blackberry & blackcurrant with earthy notes of leather, tobacco, cedar & smoke. Rich palate of dark fruit - more blackberry & blackcurrant, with early Bordeaux complexity & earthy leather oak tobacco. A good pepper  spice developing with hint licorice. Some red fruit notes. Good finish but will be so much better in years to come. KEEP 5-10 yrs (if you can!).

Splendide dark purple dress with ruby reflections. Very inviting bouquet loaded with aromas of blackberry, licorice, pepper, tobacco and notes of vanilla. Bountiful flavor intensity and elegant on the palate. Complex, Full bodied. Wondering and lingering finish. (4 points) Recommended

4.2 Dark ruby/ red colour, lighter on the edges. Black fruit, leather, cedar, wonderful bouquet, very full on the nose, it developed as the evening went on becoming sweeter. Quite full bodied, warming on the way down, quite smooth, some tannin, good length.

Very nice, if anything the promises from the nose weren’t delivered in the taste but nonetheless very good.

Need to breathe for awhile so decanted this for about 30mins before drinking. A decent wine that has oak and earthy flavours. It had a deep purple colour but was fairly easy to drink with some light snacks.

Initially disappointed with strong balsamic notes suggesting a hit of oxidisation but after 2 hours of airing it lifted to reveal lovely dark cherry notes, plentiful graphite and leather, fine rounded tannins.

4.2 so smooth, lovely balance, tannins in the 2010 vintage are peaking. Finish is good but I expected more, which I think is testament to the fact that this is a very good Pauillac. So close to a 4.5.

3,7 ⭐ This Château has only 26 ha and makes 70000 bottles a year. Therefor it's kind of small for a grand cru château. It's wine consists of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon 28% Merlot 6% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot. But this aged version didn't convince me. For its age I would have expected it to be more smooth. Flavours of blackberry, oak, tabacco and leather. Lots of tanine. Tasted on the big wine fair "Week-End des Grands Crus Bordeaux" in September 2021.

Tonight’s choice a pauillac my first for a while and I’m not disappointed. This has probably been plucked a little early in all honesty but has all the typical traits you might expect from this region. Lovely dark fruits, plenty of pepper, vanilla, cloves and tobacco just starting to appear. Nice mouth feel and satisfying finish. 4 stars for me!

A pleasant surprise after an average talbot second wine the night before...nose suggests a heavy classic pauliac, heavy tannins but the 2010 surprises with a classic red fruits a drink cassis mix with an undertone of vanilla, smooth finish which lingered
Still very fruity. Tannines well softened. Very pleasant wine.
Very good wine. 91
Austere, less fruit forward Pauillac, but good for early drinking
And again a friendly French red with little age
Smike, green pepper, red fruit. Leather. Body. Well balanced with good freshness
Menthol, strawberries in the nose. Nice harmony between nose and mouth. Silky tannins.
Earthy and leathery nose. Tight and loads of black fruit. Beautiful but tight pallet, needs time.
Very good
Old wine. Nice with smelly cheese
Excellent
bravo!!
blueberry
Again

vanilla and black berrys and black pepper and a small hint of oak and chocolate. I don’t think it will gain more complexity over the years. But still nice value for a 5. cru for € 40.
Point 92/100
Fifth class grand cru that is just as good as first or second, according to Jean George's sommelier. Good Bordeaux, classic blackberry and plum. Not a standout, but very respectable
Still very young, but lots of smooth tannins , iron, leather, pepper& red fruits  on the nose, very rich, but balanced in the mouth. Lovely with a lot of ageing potential!

Smooth but not impressive.
Cassis, blackberry, oak, leather, tobacco vanilla, black pepper, pencil lead...
Paired with fried fish dish in preserved black beans sauce.
Pretty good, but no exultation. V classic,  quite firm and cedary with a bit of cigar etc, good wine, ticks all the boxes yet leaves no real urge for more
Well balanced. Deep rust colour, may be hitting it's peak. Green herbaceous notes. Perfect to enjoy on Father's Day.
Dark purple color, still young, but ready to drink. Cassis, blackberry and a bit leather. Good structure .
Floral on the bouquet, good structure with dark berries on the palate. Tannins still firm and drinking well
Very mature and classic Bordeaux style. Still nice fruit and acidity, but only few tannins left. Very elegant
Dark purple red, opaque plum, moccasin with sweet notes. Medium body, black fruit, long powerful finish

Excellent! I enjoyed this wine more the second time! 
Earthy mushroom, cassis, tobacco and black fruits.
Good value pauillac but lacks a little of the finess you come to expect from this region to give it better than 4 stars
Should wait another 2-3 years. 2017 bottle was a bit young to enjoy now. Has potential - a full bodied Bordeaux
Excellent Pauillac, strength, complexity secondary aromas, length. A very well balanced wine as well
The bouquet is beautiful with dark rosey color. Structure is good with smooth acidity however lack a bit of body.
Very nice, well balanced strong wine
Very dark colour. Still fruity, almost jammy. Dark fruit. Very soft tannins. Acidity is present but not overdone.
Initial scents of forest leaves and earth. Medium acidity and medium long finish. Took some time to open up. Happy Birthday!
Black color. Medium length. Typical Paulliac tar and black fruit. Not very individual but all in all good value.
Pauillac
good

This Pauillac made of 62 % Cabernet Sauvignon, 28 % Merlot, 6 % Petit Verdot and 4 % Cabernet franc, has barrel ageing for 12 months in new barrels for 50-55%.

Medium body, light tannin, blackberry driven with hint of tobacco. Lack of silkiness, purity and not smooth as expected. Earth on finish, but not that long enough finish for indulgence. 

It might be because of my bad mood and troubles I had, or it was not that good by itself, I could not conclude.
Just not for me...

PATIENCE

21 years old Pauillac!
First of all and very important: you will have to beat/swirl this wine back to life!
At first the nose is moldy and moisty. But be patient. It slowly (very slowly) opens up with some mature dark fruit like plum and cherries and warm spice. Same with the palate which has the same notes and also has a good acidity and a long spicy finish.

ALL YOU NEED IS JUST A LITTLE PATIENCE

Pauillac is, undoubtedly, one of the best appellations in 2017, with virtually no frost 
damage and superbly ripe Cabernet Sauvignon when picked. The Grand Vin, with 65% 
Cabernet Sauvignon and 35% Merlot, has lovely fruit and freshness on the nose. A super 
depth of flavour, with ripe tannins, to a long, elegant finish with great finesse.

The wine is medium garnet. The nose is developing, with medium (+) intensity and aromas of cedar, tobacco, leather, blackcurrants, blueberry. The palate is dry, with medium (+) acidity, high tannin, medium alcohol, full body and a long finish. The quality is very good. Drink now, potential for further aging.

The 2003 Croizet-Bages carries austere aromas of violet, black tea, pepper and blueberry.
Silky texture and low acidity, medium in body on the palate displaying sweet tobacco, black fruits and violet hinting of smoky accent.
Finish is long with residual violet.
With 2003 being very hot, acidity tends to be low under this climates.
Still, this medium bodied Pauillac shows elegance in the glass.

Ch.Croizet-Bages located in Pauillac is the  Château which has been graded as Cinquièmes Crus (Fifth growth Bordeaux) in Bordeaux. It is said 2003 was good vintage year forPauillac wine according to the vintage chart (95T by eRobert Perker). I started to drank this wine 30-40 minutes after decantage.

It was 'The classical Bordeaux taste'. The nose was intense and it was mixed of dark berries, spices, oak barrel and slightly earthy. Tannins were very moderate and it gave me very comfortable aftertaste.

1982 vintage - fortunate to have tried. This was amazing. Still plenty of fruit and vitality after all these years. Perfect balance and integration. Only 12% alcohol but still moderate- tannins! 

Nose: stewed and then dried black cassis and other dark fruits combine with a gentle yet faded leather/musk scent, more musk. Faint cedar. 

Finish: black stewed fruit with musk, ceder and faint sweet tobacco. Traces of black earth, graphite, bloody aged iron.

Like a lot of older wines in the depths of my cave I have no idea where this came from.  It arrived in long before the record keeping system of Vivino🙂 and well before I knew any of the people I shared it with. Enough rambling 😉.  Pale tawny and light brick 🧱 in colour.  Quite translucent with voluminous and distinctive legs.  Scents of cedar, rosemary, leather, smoke with a hint of raspberry and other red fruit.  Quite acidic on the pallet and also quite tannic, a bit surprising for such an aged wine.

Happy Bordeaux Sunday 🍷

Far better than expected. Feel I enjoyed at its zenith.

Pauillac 🇫🇷 Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc 🍇 Vintage 2005 and delivering on its best now or maybe on its way down 🍷 blackberries, black currants, green bell pepper, menthol, asphalt, chalk, oak, cedar and cigar box. Medium plus body, tannins and acidity 🍷🍷

this was quite enjoyable.. wet zoo floor, blackberries, savory nuts, eucalyptus, leather and sweet cassis make this matured Bordeaux very enjoyable with a ribeye.. lacks weight on the mid palate and harmony but more than makes it up with elegance and soft tannins.. decent 15sec finish..

Really struggled with guessing this one. Surprisingly a bit lightweight particularly given the very hot 2003 year. Some primary notes still left but this is certainly nearing the end of its life with cooked blackcurrant, tobacco, cooked blackberry, some thyme, pepper. Finish quite long.

Intense green nose of peppers and grass/herbs. Nice fruit and quite lively acids. A wine more towards the elegant side than the powerful, but still there is a kick from the acids which lead me to think that it will last yet another couple of years.

Good wine after 15 years, has kept freshness and acidity. Aromas of tobacco, dark chocolate and cedar box, on the palate light and fresh, notes of ripe blackberries. Medium bodied and finish, low alcohol perception.

Another grand cru, old vintage wine (3rd of the night)..... Medium ruby colour. The nose is over-ripe black fruits, mushroom, sweaty feet and leather.

Full body. Medium+ acidity. Medium+ tannins. Medium alcohol. The palate cassis, oak, cherry.

Not bad..... it isn’t spectacular but it is ok.

A rising tide raises all boats, even when the tide is the 2000 vintage and Croizet-Bages is a boat (a pretty lousy boat most of the time). But seriously, this oozes Pauillac with rich leather, cocoa and mocha, sousbois and black berries. Quite developed and should be drunk now,  but really in a sweet spot at the moment. Tight tannins.

A little surprised that this wine was slightly underwhelming. Good amount of dark fruit, but for me missing a little of the tannic structure and complexity of a Pauillac. Strangely felt like a younger wine than a 2006.

Despite the fact that there are soo many great wines in the world I always feel like i have come home when i taste a good Bordeaux and this is just an average one

Classic Paulliac nose, pencil shavings and some smoked meat. Little fruit, mainly dark and austere with some plums. Coffee and leather. 
Feels quite weak for a classified '05 though. I guessed 2006 - either 5th or just outside of classification. Little fruit driven charm and also limited length, body and complexity. My good friend Thor loves to hate this chateau - I'm becoming more and more aligned with him. Drink now.

A bit rough, but still with nice depth and complexity. Not in the highest end of paulliac, but decent and good value for money now that we are in bordeaux with soft tannins, but theyre still present. Nice dark fruit and good balance.

Third Grand Cru of the night! Very fruity on the nose with blackcurrant and raspberry nose with herbal notes, liquorice, and tobacco, cassis sweet bitterness coming through . Quite smoky! Cranberry palate with certain cured meats on the finish.

I must say it might have been impacted by the cork disintegrating whilst trying to open it.

Surprisingly evoluted for a 2006, it is already dominated by tertiary perfumes and Lost his fruity and woody notes. On the other Hand, it has nice musky notes and a tabacco smell. An interesting wine, but do not keep it for too long.

I preferred this over a Carruades de Lafite, which we had on the same night. Although i was not impressed with this, it outshined the Lafite 2nd wine. Believe you can find more interesting Chateaus in Pauliac than this.

This Cinquieme grand cru class is reasonable for a 2005 at this price. Dark muddy purple. Strong fragrant berries and cedar on the nose with a hint of citrus ending. Light bodied filled with young tannins and a long aftertaste. Strong alcohol burn even though Nose overpowers the taste, but it's a great compliment with lamb.

This was immediately after decanting (!) but after >1-2h, the zombie gets up from his grave, turns into a pensioner in the wheelchair who eventually walks with sticks...rich, vegetal fruit notes…RIP

Negociant bottling, Robbers & van den Hoogen, Arnhem, Holland. High shoulder. Led capsule. Thanks to my Durand opener I get the cork out intact. No decant since 67 is a fragile vintage. Transparent purple, faintly brick colored rim. Autumn in a glass. Wet forest floor, decaying leaves, bark, mushrooms, chestnuts. Dried black olives, cold breakfast tea, still some red fruit. Surprisingly satisfying wine. Most would agree this should have been drunk by the mid-eighties. I like these old blokes. Drying tannins

Red colour with slightly trouble purple and orange accents. The nose is full of liquorice wood with a hint of tobacco and spice. The attack is very dry, with liquorice and dead leaves aromas. Clean clear wine with a deep Ruby red almost purple core. Feint watery rim with medium+ viscosity. Nose of black fruit and chocolate, a heady aromatic mix that draws you in. Palate is dry with medium acidity and medium+ tannins. The tannins are a little overwhelming and distort the balance slightly but overall the length is supreme and the finish is great. I like tannic reds but the reader should be aware the tannins do render this glass mouth drying ! Brilliant wine nonetheless.

Ch.Croizet-Bages located in Pauillac is the  Château which has been graded as Cinquièmes Crus (Fifth growth Bordeaux) in Bordeaux. It is said 2003 was good vintage year forPauillac wine according to the vintage chart (95T by eRobert Perker). I started to drank this wine 30-40 minutes after decantage.

It was 'The classical Bordeaux taste'. The nose was intense and it was mixed of dark berries, spices, oak barrel and slightly earthy. Tannins were very moderate and it gave me very comfortable aftertaste.
Emirates house Red !!

Wow! What a surprise! This Croizet-Bages 2010 outperformed Chateau Pontet-Canet 04 & Duhart-Milon 04 in a blind tasting. Why / how? 

It's just such pleasure to drink this smooth, but dense wine which is for me also a perfect example of a classic Pauillac. 

Nose: Cassis, black berries, herbs, pencil shavings and a tasty sweetness at the end. 

Palate: The palate shows minerality, nice grip, smooth tannins, sweetness, dark choc.

For me 95 points. Don't know if this gets better as it already shows so well.

The 2003 Croizet-Bages carries austere aromas of violet, black tea, pepper and blueberry.
Silky texture and low acidity, medium in body on the palate displaying sweet tobacco, black fruits and violet hinting of smoky accent.
Finish is long with residual violet.
With 2003 being very hot, acidity tends to be low under this climates.
Still, this medium bodied Pauillac shows elegance in the glass.

Deep red with slightly Brown rim. Blackberries and ripe red fruit party hidden beneath wooden notes and Minerals. Powerfull wine with mature fruit but dominated by earthy and wooden taste.

Blackberry, cassis, oak, cedar, leather, tobacco, pepper, and violet. Beautiful floral and smoky aromas for a Pauillac at this price point. The 2013 vintage was extremely disappointing, but you shouldn’t shy away from later vintages like this one!

Brown and burgundy colour, red fruit scents such as pinot-noir, too light compare to other Pauillac Grand cru classe wine. But oak, cedar, leather, blackberry tastes, Medium to long length finish for the first 2 hours after uncorked were made me pleasant. appropriate sweetness, slightly high acidity. Price is 42-45 US dollars (57,900 Korean won).

I drank it over two days. It became more strong tannins, less scents. chocolate and cedar tastes were so nice on second day.

Deep purple in colour with some garnet along rim. Blackcurrant, blackberry, cedar, oak, pencil shaving are on the nose with some pepper notes. Palate is dry and acidic. Get matured over the time, then velvety touch appears once stabilized.

4.0-4.1, stays substantive rather than nominal. Garnet with tawny hues in color, minimal sediment. Absolutely needs decanting + 30 min to breathe. At room temperature, it then emerges as a mature yet classy Bordeaux: plum & cherry, hints of raspberry, cinnamon, pepper, traces of forest floor and cedar on the aroma. Black fruit & cherry, just a bit of nutmeg, lots of wet leather on the palate. Long and somewhat spicy finish. A great choice for a formal dinner built around wagyu roast beef. Recommended👍

Muscular, luxurious and full bodied. First impression comes across and savory, cassis, earthy, tobacco, oak , orange peel in that order. Give it a swirl and the black fruits make their appearance. Hints of vanilla, cocoa, cigar box, pepper and forest floor adds layers of complexity and pleasure. Structure is backboned by grippy rounded tannins and medium acidity. Finish is long and smoky. Absolutely ready for drinking!

Masterclass Medoc wines: evolution in wines between 2 vintages in 5 chateaux! 
Pauillac time with 2016 an 2011 of this great Croizet-Bages. In this region more CS is used in the blend (2016: 70%). The Pauillac wines are really my cup of tea.

The nose starts great with top finesse! In taste a very full body with ripe fruits (black fruits), integrated wood, liquorice, tannins and all very nicely balanced yet! A great wine already with upward potential! 
Rate 3,9⭐️

This is 25 years old wine and delivering as Pauillac Grand Cru. It has a brilliant reddish brick colour with long legs and some sediments. The nose shows complex layers of: plum, prune, leather, nutmeg, mushrooms, and cloves. The palate offers medium acidity and ripe plum flavours. At the start, it felt velvety, but softened quickly. There’s a light bitter aftertaste and medium-plus persistence. Note: paired with Peking Duck.

Beauty quality wine, good scores on all fronts! Vintage matters so much! On the nose, clear black current, signature cassis, cedar and very refined mineral notes. I was expecting powerful tannic taste — it didn’t disappoint, but at the same time, the fruit is very obvious too! Elegant and balance. High tannin but I can drink a whole bottle without food by myself. Long long finish with minerals. And it’s getting better and better with air. Got residuals but no impact to the taste.

At 9 years old it looks a bit tired already. But drinking all well.
👀: Deep garnet
👃🏻: Pronounced intensity of complex aromas: leather, earthy, cedar, tobacco, coffee beans, cassis. Fully developed.
👅: High acidity and tannin. Medium alcohol and body. Pronounced intensity of flavours: cedar, smoke, coffee beans, black fruits. Long finish.
Ages quickly from a rather rainy year. Drink now before it's too late.

After two-three hours in decanter it showet off. Brick red color with brown-orange rim.  oak cedar blackberry cassis on the nose. Palate follows up. Fully matured. Integrated and silky tannins. Light acidity with a dry finish.

Amazing taste. Chateau Croizet Bages Pauillac Bordeaux Grand Cru Classic. 2016

13.5% Alcohol.

Juicy, medium body, graphite, tobacco, a hint of oak and dried herbs 🌿, fruity flavours of black cherries 🍒, blueberries 🫐 and cassis, licorice, chocolate 🍫, spicy, pleasant acidity, grippy tannins, med.(+) finish.

4,15⭐️
2011 Chateau Croizet-Bages, Pauillac.
Aromas of blackberries, cherrystones, velvet plums, licorice, leather, iron and tobacco.
Medium plus body, medium (+) acidity, medium plus and very allright tannins, 13% alcohol and a long, masculine, black fruited and velvet aftertaste.
Im a fan!

Happy Bordeaux Sunday! A little bird🐦told me Pauillac & I just happen to have one😁. Purchased for $17 on an EOB sale, makes it taste even betta😋. 10 min 🌀& he's singing🎶. Deep ruby robe, mainly herbaceous👃of violets, eucalyptus🍃, bay leaf & mint🌱mixing w/restrained, austere red & black fruit w/a licorice🎶. Dry, full body💪, med acidity & dry, tongue👅coating tannins;🏋. Fairly expressive👅of black currant, black cherry🍒& cassis w/a smooth, sexy mid👅of bikini👙leather, anise; persistent pepper 🏁.

Lovely classic Pauillac. Still plenty of dark berries and floral petals after more than 10 years. Literally bursting in the mouth with hint of pepper and liquorice. Dry medium finish with good structured tannins and acidity. Great with steak or cheese snack.

Colour was ruby garnet.
Intensity of the nose was pronounced. Took like 1.5-2hrs to decant. Abit too young for drinking now. Consist of black fruits, (blueberry, blackberry and plum), strong mint and eucalyptus with abit of leathery, smoke, slight vanilla & chocolate touches to it. Overall high tannin, medium alcohol, full body and long finish. There is complexity but not powerful enough as it’s abit too young now.

Paired with cheese and Shepard pie. Not sure if it’s me but coming from 2014 vintage, it’s not a bad wine. The liquid combined with the cheese and beef cut away the oiliness of the food making it very delish

@ Union des Grands Crus de Bordeaux in Amsterdam. Just not as good as the 2016. Not as ripe and a bit unbalanced.

(3.8) Dusty cassis nose, baking spices, medium almost plus acidity, cassis fruit, dry, firm rough and peppery tanines. Very drying and peppery finish.

I have exactly the same opinion of the others Vivino users: 3,9 stars for this rare Cinquième Grand Cru Classé en 1855 from Pauillac!
Quite serious and classic Pauillac that shows its better face in the aftertaste. We feel the smell and taste of the second used French oak barrels in a pronounced way. And then, dark plums, black currants and earthy notes (gravels). The tannins are quite wild yet. Full bodied but  with a pleasant mouthfeel. Long, savory and elegant aftertaste.

Dark garnet-red color in the glass! On the nose with strong aromas of blackcurrants, blackberries, blueberries and slightly cheeky tobacco leaves! On the palate medium to full-bodied with austere, elegant tannins and a long finish! Cheers!

Proper Pauillac but unfortunately should have waited, just not ready for us yet. Nice dark red bold wine, nose of fresh blackberry, cassis, blackcurrant, and plum, half integrated tannins (that is why I said I should have waited), cedar, oak, earthy, mushroom or leather, a bit vanilla and hints of smoke, pepper and dark chocola. Great finish. Fine wine, but wait 4 more years?

4.0 Tasting this fifth growth for the first time and what a nose! Really remarkable nose but a bit weaker in the mouth. Cedar, coffee, leather, black currants, cassis and tobacco. Still harsh tannins but a wine that needs to rest for some years in the cellar. Despite its youth, enjoyed it a lot. Big decanting needed if you open this now.

Masterclass Conseil des vins du Medoc. #7
Appearance: ruby red, medium intens, clear. 
Nose: developing, clean condition, medium intens. Aromas of red fruit, chalky and salty minerality. 
Palate: dry, medium body, medium (+) finish, medium (+) wellicht integrated  tannins.
Assessment: very good wine. Potential for aging.

Dark ruby red fading to brick, brick rim. Moderately intense nose dominated by cedar, wood, sweet spice with some cassis, bramble, and fig. Full bodied, dry, high acidity,  medium plus well grained tannin. Plenty of primary fruit on the palate - blackcurrant, black cherry, bramble - with raisin, date and fig. Woody notes, tobacco and cedar and some vanillin spice. Intensely flavoured and well balanced. Long finish of luscious black cherry and cassis with black pepper. Excellent and a good 5-10 yrs to go.

A sweeter aroma and tastes that match with cherry, raspberry and strawberry sugary notes. Mild tannins. A decent wine, but over priced. Tasted at the Union des Grand Cru de Bordeaux in Chicago. 91 points.  (How my star rating works... 5 STARS = 100-96 points, 4.5 = 95-93, 4 = 92-90, 3.5 = 89-87, 3 = 86-84 etc)

Always hit and miss when opening wines of this age, but it's a lot better than expected. Fruit still present, although they have subsided almost completely. The tannins are still aggressive and doing their job. We are just tasting, but I'm sure this wine would show better in a meal. Very nice.

👁 Med ruby. 👃 Blackberry, blackcurrant, plum, mushroom 🍄 leather, tobacco, graphite & vanilla. Dry, high acidity, med tannin, med alcohol (12.5%), full body, pronounced flavours of blackberry, blackcurrant, plum, mushroom 🍄 & vanilla & a lovely long finish. Outstanding & drinking at it’s peak, not suitable for further ageing. A classic Pauillac from a great vintage. Came 2nd in our side by side tasting with Peter Michael Les Pavots 2007.

It has deep ruby red colour with very long wine legs. Nose is filled with eucalyptus, barnyard & sour cherry. It’s a full bodied wine with med + acidity & strong tannins. Tasted red cherry, lots of licorice & have a long & dry finish.

Still ruby color wine with medium intensity aromas of red fruit, black fruit, eucalyptus, white pepper, oak and tobacco. Medium plus tannins and medium acidity. Flavors of oak , blackcurrant, black cherry, raspberries, leather, coffee and tobacco. Medium plus aftertaste.

Saw in 2021 with a couple of bottles of this over a couple of days. Initially very bright with lots of blackberries and black currant but then opened out with tobacco, cedar and a lot of minerals. Beautifully structured and will age further. Groovalisimo

3.7 tried it in the morning and it had mid tannin and acidity. The body was also not as high thus thought it would have more merlot than usual blend. The structure is a not that complex with short finish. 

Tried again later today and it was much more smooth than earlier. However, it did lost some more complexity. 

There seems to be shortage in some parts and this maybe characteristics of off vintage.
To young for my blood. Need min. 2 more  years before servering. Maybe a year can do it. Need decantation and The right temperatur.
Tasty blue and black fruits

A bit rough, but still with nice depth and complexity. Not in the highest end of paulliac, but decent and good value for money now that we are in bordeaux with soft tannins, but theyre still present. Nice dark fruit and good balance.

Pauillac 🇫🇷 Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc 🍇 Vintage 2005 and delivering on its best now or maybe on its way down 🍷 blackberries, black currants, green bell pepper, menthol, asphalt, chalk, oak, cedar and cigar box. Medium plus body, tannins and acidity 🍷🍷

Really struggled with guessing this one. Surprisingly a bit lightweight particularly given the very hot 2003 year. Some primary notes still left but this is certainly nearing the end of its life with cooked blackcurrant, tobacco, cooked blackberry, some thyme, pepper. Finish quite long.

I preferred this over a Carruades de Lafite, which we had on the same night. Although i was not impressed with this, it outshined the Lafite 2nd wine. Believe you can find more interesting Chateaus in Pauliac than this.

Classic Paulliac nose, pencil shavings and some smoked meat. Little fruit, mainly dark and austere with some plums. Coffee and leather. 
Feels quite weak for a classified '05 though. I guessed 2006 - either 5th or just outside of classification. Little fruit driven charm and also limited length, body and complexity. My good friend Thor loves to hate this chateau - I'm becoming more and more aligned with him. Drink now.

Despite the fact that there are soo many great wines in the world I always feel like i have come home when i taste a good Bordeaux and this is just an average one 
Good fruit and wit the right amount of oak leaves a pleasant but not long or powerful taste
Great red wine

This Cinquieme grand cru class is reasonable for a 2005 at this price. Dark muddy purple. Strong fragrant berries and cedar on the nose with a hint of citrus ending. Light bodied filled with young tannins and a long aftertaste. Strong alcohol burn even though Nose overpowers the taste, but it's a great compliment with lamb.

3.9 A decent not great Paulliac. An ok red. Definitely oak, cedar, blackberry cassis. A bit too woody for me.

Fully-integrated and smoky. A bit of dark berry still left, cedar plank, tobacco leaf etc. Fun to try a Bdx of this age.
Red-brown body, heavy nose. Medium-to-high acidity with medium tannins. Hints of dark cherry, cedar, and black currant.
Awesome bordeaux, heavy-lifting, vanilla hints from oak raised years.

A classic example of why whatever you try (and enjoy) will always return to Bordeaux. 10 years old now totally ready to enjoy or keep for 4-5 years more. Dark fruits, hints of leather and tobacco. Medium to long finish. Superbly enjoyable and a good value.

Absolutely still fresh. Tannins are Nice and soft but colour as if it was only 5 years old. Corck also in perfect condition. 

Scent of lavender, black pepper and almonds. Superbly balanced taste with fruityness and an earthy tone.
Went perfect with braised venison  with chanterelles.

Surprisingly evoluted for a 2006, it is already dominated by tertiary perfumes and Lost his fruity and woody notes. On the other Hand, it has nice musky notes and a tabacco smell. An interesting wine, but do not keep it for too long.

A little surprised that this wine was slightly underwhelming. Good amount of dark fruit, but for me missing a little of the tannic structure and complexity of a Pauillac. Strangely felt like a younger wine than a 2006.

Bordeaux 96 #1: croiset bages was still in a difficult pass in 96. Nevertheless the 21 years have rounded its edges and it drinks ok. Very (very) Cabernet Sauvignon with probably a hint of under ripeness. Smooth tannins and medium length. Let's say it holds on its legs.

PATIENCE

21 years old Pauillac!
First of all and very important: you will have to beat/swirl this wine back to life!
At first the nose is moldy and moisty. But be patient. It slowly (very slowly) opens up with some mature dark fruit like plum and cherries and warm spice. Same with the palate which has the same notes and also has a good acidity and a long spicy finish.

ALL YOU NEED IS JUST A LITTLE PATIENCE

Pauillac remains a slightly disappointing region overall in 2015. Not the juiciest fruits for long term cellaring. The perfumed oak smoke stands out, smokey, vanilla, with some elegant fruits of black fruits and cassis in the background. Suggest avoid weaker Pauillac wines from 2015.

Need to breathe for awhile so decanted this for about 30mins before drinking. A decent wine that has oak and earthy flavours. It had a deep purple colour but was fairly easy to drink with some light snacks.

3,7 ⭐ This Château has only 26 ha and makes 70000 bottles a year. Therefor it's kind of small for a grand cru château. It's wine consists of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon 28% Merlot 6% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot. But this aged version didn't convince me. For its age I would have expected it to be more smooth. Flavours of blackberry, oak, tabacco and leather. Lots of tanine. Tasted on the big wine fair "Week-End des Grands Crus Bordeaux" in September 2021.

Wise man told me that in a great year even a poor chateau/winemaker can make a great wine. I didn’t check the reputation of this chateau  but this wine is great and ready to drink (after opening pour a glass and let the wine open up). Develops further in the glass. Complex nose with black current, figs, medicine, bay leaf. Full bodied with long lasting aftertaste.

4.2 so smooth, lovely balance, tannins in the 2010 vintage are peaking. Finish is good but I expected more, which I think is testament to the fact that this is a very good Pauillac. So close to a 4.5.

medium density brick brown w clear rim.
Fruit tobacco wood cedar; MOS and some off tones. 
Tobacco tones med + acidity alcohol nicely in check. Loads of tertiary notes tobacco cedar Christmas pudding earthy. Fruit towards blacks. compote caramelized blackcurrant and vanilla tart. Rich savoury middle, animaux.
V tasty drop. 
Had w a great Angus rib, buttery carrots roast Maris Piper. Simply teriffic.

Initially disappointed with strong balsamic notes suggesting a hit of oxidisation but after 2 hours of airing it lifted to reveal lovely dark cherry notes, plentiful graphite and leather, fine rounded tannins.

UGCB 2017 tasting, Los Angeles, 01/23/20. As I said, I'm not a Bordeaux expert, so at this event, for me, pretty much everything was at least 4 points.

I just work too much, guys, so I will not have the time to write my reviews about all these wines. 
They were all wonderful. Please read other's reviews. @Aaron Blazer & @Howard Yang's are spot on! :-)
I just can't go into details. I was like a kid in a candy store. :-) I now love Bordeauxs. :-)

A pleasant surprise after an average talbot second wine the night before...nose suggests a heavy classic pauliac, heavy tannins but the 2010 surprises with a classic red fruits a drink cassis mix with an undertone of vanilla, smooth finish which lingered

Currently 4.1 but will develop over next 5-10 yrs into a very fine wine. Dark fruit colour & nose - blackberry & blackcurrant with earthy notes of leather, tobacco, cedar & smoke. Rich palate of dark fruit - more blackberry & blackcurrant, with early Bordeaux complexity & earthy leather oak tobacco. A good pepper  spice developing with hint licorice. Some red fruit notes. Good finish but will be so much better in years to come. KEEP 5-10 yrs (if you can!).

90 pts - When I first opened this, I thought "oh oh.... dead". Fast forward 4 hours and this has opened into a fantastic wine, slightly acidic but it suits the palette that's offered. Sour cherry in abundance with a little woody finish, another glass please!

4.2 Dark ruby/ red colour, lighter on the edges. Black fruit, leather, cedar, wonderful bouquet, very full on the nose, it developed as the evening went on becoming sweeter. Quite full bodied, warming on the way down, quite smooth, some tannin, good length.

Very nice, if anything the promises from the nose weren’t delivered in the taste but nonetheless very good.

Tonight’s choice a pauillac my first for a while and I’m not disappointed. This has probably been plucked a little early in all honesty but has all the typical traits you might expect from this region. Lovely dark fruits, plenty of pepper, vanilla, cloves and tobacco just starting to appear. Nice mouth feel and satisfying finish. 4 stars for me!

Next up on Bdx Sunday (N. Medoc edition) is a totally new chateau on me. Decanted for 3 hours (and a further 4 to the end), and emitting hallmark notes is cassis and cedar, although I’m not getting tobacco 😏 
Fairly bold and concentrated with a decent mouthfeel. This may be too young for many, but this is drinking pretty well IMO. A slight step up on the last, good, but not otherworldly. 4⭐️

22yrs old Pauillac. Had to get out of the storage this lady! 

Pronounced nose of leather immediately. Then ripe black fruit, mainly plum, black currant marmalade and black cherry sauce, game, forrest floor, scents of blood, hints of violet. 
Med- acid play. Smooth aged tannins, lightfooted on alcohol, full body. Med finish of ripe dark fruit. 

Great concentration, great balance, smooth and round. Past it’s apogee for around 2-5 years but it has an exceptional amount of fruit there. Very enjoyable
4.3

Aging beauty, light cedar on the nose, and some subtle prune. Wide palate with strong minerals, plum, green tea, blackberries, juniper, and much more. Just a perfectly aged Bordeaux. Our age, thanks Jonathan Siah

Pauillac is, undoubtedly, one of the best appellations in 2017, with virtually no frost 
damage and superbly ripe Cabernet Sauvignon when picked. The Grand Vin, with 65% 
Cabernet Sauvignon and 35% Merlot, has lovely fruit and freshness on the nose. A super 
depth of flavour, with ripe tannins, to a long, elegant finish with great finesse.

1982 vintage - fortunate to have tried. This was amazing. Still plenty of fruit and vitality after all these years. Perfect balance and integration. Only 12% alcohol but still moderate- tannins! 

Nose: stewed and then dried black cassis and other dark fruits combine with a gentle yet faded leather/musk scent, more musk. Faint cedar. 

Finish: black stewed fruit with musk, ceder and faint sweet tobacco. Traces of black earth, graphite, bloody aged iron.

Like a lot of older wines in the depths of my cave I have no idea where this came from.  It arrived in long before the record keeping system of Vivino🙂 and well before I knew any of the people I shared it with. Enough rambling 😉.  Pale tawny and light brick 🧱 in colour.  Quite translucent with voluminous and distinctive legs.  Scents of cedar, rosemary, leather, smoke with a hint of raspberry and other red fruit.  Quite acidic on the pallet and also quite tannic, a bit surprising for such an aged wine.

Splendide dark purple dress with ruby reflections. Very inviting bouquet loaded with aromas of blackberry, licorice, pepper, tobacco and notes of vanilla. Bountiful flavor intensity and elegant on the palate. Complex, Full bodied. Wondering and lingering finish. (4 points) Recommended

BEEFY

Pauillac produced top quality wine for 1982, despite the fact that this was a fifth classified growth, quality was still above expectations. 

Typical smoky nose blend with menthol / eucalyptus plants. Palette was with totally integrated tannins, pleasant and chunky, or rather beefy style. The wine had a lot of weight, I felt that it was heavier in terms of true weight compared to other wines. Lacked some definitive character and a bit flat was the weakness. Superb quality and value for money.

A superb and complex wine that probably doesn’t get the recognition it deserves. Deep garnet coloured. Interesting aromas of cigar box, oak, cured meat and blackcurrant. Full bodied, medium acidity, and medium silky tannins with cassis, leather and forest floor notes.
Earthy, leather truffle on the nose. Brick red in colour. Oak and spice on the nose after long decant.
Black color. Medium length. Typical Paulliac tar and black fruit. Not very individual but all in all good value.
Very dark colour. Still fruity, almost jammy. Dark fruit. Very soft tannins. Acidity is present but not overdone.
Initial scents of forest leaves and earth. Medium acidity and medium long finish. Took some time to open up. Happy Birthday!

Tasted in a blind Horizontal with other 2014 Gcc and was voted the least likely to be the Paulliac - so much for bold and powerful, this wine was medium bodied and missed all regional pointers. Black fruit and watered down cassis with a a crushed red berry hue, cedar notes and a bit of graphite and spices.. but really a little disappointed.

A dry, medium bodied Pauillac wine from left bank of Bordeaux. Deep ruby colour with rich fruity aroma of blackberries, black currants and scent of oak and spices. Well balance palate of red fruits flavour, rich oak, nice spiciness, medium acidity, medium tannins and medium alcohol. The finishing is long, spicy and oaky. There is subtle bitterness aftertaste. Quite a good wine from a 5th growth.

Medoc 5th Growth. The color is bright red-violet, and its nose is leather with oak but not too strong. Scent of fruits is not much, but the attack has nuance of red berries and cassis. Smooth, soft tannins, and it is already enjoyable bottle even though it is still young. Slightly spicy with hint of mint on the finish. Purchased at Aeon de Wine.

Farmyard, Cherry, Plum, Coconut (no idea why), Wet leaves, Blueberry
High acid and tannin, Med. alcohol, Med. + body, Med. flavour intensity, Med. + finish
Good quality, Can drink now but is suitable for aging

Fine sediments in liquid. Great body. Stainless, soy sauce / light vinegar, very dry oak, high acid. Supposed to taste newer. Cherry in mouth, slight hint of pepper on mouth. Turns into blood and enriched with truffle / smoke after waking in glass. Same region as La Tour, Laffe and Mouton.

A lot of earthy, leathery, tobacco, notes up front. Quite dry and quite tannic which makes it not everyone’s wine. I enjoyed it but it’s very bold and 9 years in a lot of the fruit has fallen off. Some dark berry fruit remains.

Dark ruby color. very closed aroma of forest berries, oak, leather and spices. Fresh and chewy tannins, nice balanced acidity. Long finish with note of chokeberry. 
Extremely young wine with huge potential.

Needs time to open. Fine and elegant on the nose, notes of forrest berries, smoked bacon, tobacco. Full and complex on the palate, blackberries, plum, sweet tobacco leaf, leather. Still quite gripping tannins, so the finish is slightly overshadowed. Tannins M+, Alcohol M

Deep purple, inky colour. Noses of blackberries, blackcurrant, plum. Aeration reveals graphite, minerals, coffee. Medium to full body, closed. Low acidic. Moderated length of plum. Ready, aeration a must.

Drink in my very boring day...

This Pauillac made of 62 % Cabernet Sauvignon, 28 % Merlot, 6 % Petit Verdot and 4 % Cabernet franc, has barrel ageing for 12 months in new barrels for 50-55%.

Medium body, light tannin, blackberry driven with hint of tobacco. Lack of silkiness, purity and not smooth as expected. Earth on finish, but not that long enough finish for indulgence. 

It might be because of my bad mood and troubles I had, or it was not that good by itself, I could not conclude.
Just not for me...

Nose: secondary and tertiary, earthy, spices, minerals, oaky, black currant, marinated vegetables. 

Taste: fruity, medium acidity, medium intensity, long finishing, strong tanning at the beginning and left strong bitter taste after 1.5hr. Secondary to tertiary taste. 

Quality: good wine.

I'm disappointed 😤😳🤬🥵😡 It’s GCC 😣
It doesn't feel any aroma at first🈚️❌, and it tastes too watery, even like mixing wine with water.💧
After about two hours, I can smell a little aroma.⤴️
I don't know if it's a grape or a winery problem, but I think this wine needs to be fixed.🆘

Very mineral driver nose but the Palate feel very thin upon opening it was not until the second day with massive amount of air it then decide to wake up and show its quintessential pauillac charm of blackcurrant and all so well balanced acidity.

Chateau Croizet-Bages 2012
Dense plummy currants on the bouquet, underpinning a graphite and iron core, tapering to a grippy saccharine note. Supple entry, peaking to an austere core ripe chalky tannins, leaving a lingering sweet grippy note

Austere and herbal, lots of green pepper, unripe red cherries, unripe blackcurrant, plums, leather, dust, bark, tobacco leaves, cedar.
Very herbal, green, stemmy on the palate, with red cherries and cranberries.
Was a huge mistake tasting it after the St Estephe.
~2/3 Cab Sauv, ~1/3 Merlot.

Another grand cru, old vintage wine (3rd of the night)..... Medium ruby colour. The nose is over-ripe black fruits, mushroom, sweaty feet and leather.

Full body. Medium+ acidity. Medium+ tannins. Medium alcohol. The palate cassis, oak, cherry.

Not bad..... it isn’t spectacular but it is ok.

Strong oak and vanilla nose. Punchy tannin with dark fruit up front. Out of control kind of spiciness, with a hint of grass together with tiny bit of perfume hiding after. Long lasting light taste of blackcurrant. Bit too pricy for what I am getting here.

Clear deep purple color. Medium aromatic intensity, leather, black fruit, vanilla and earthy. Balanced, dry, Medium+ bodied, high acidity, medium tannin and finishing with sweet spices. Good pairing with aged cheese, beef and lamb.

Third Grand Cru of the night! Very fruity on the nose with blackcurrant and raspberry nose with herbal notes, liquorice, and tobacco, cassis sweet bitterness coming through . Quite smoky! Cranberry palate with certain cured meats on the finish.

I must say it might have been impacted by the cork disintegrating whilst trying to open it.

Pushing a 3.5, it's for me disappointing from a pauillac. It has the promise of a good Bordeaux and what you'd expect to the nose, oaky yet with depth, which then just doesn't transpire to the taste. Lackluster when you're looking at the price bracket I'd expect a lot more complexity and depth to the palate. I'll leave it overnight and see if the rest opens up, though it's not at all unpleasant, it really isn't, it just isn't anything I'd write home about and isn't worth the price.

Blend of 58% Cabernet Sauvignon and 42% Merlot.  Usually there is about 10% cab franc, but this year there is not.  The wine has a garnet color already, indeed the brownest of the 46 Bordeaux Wines I tasted.  A light nose of mud, burnt sugar and dark chocolate.  Light and quick maturing for a Fifth Growth.  I don’t know the property well, but maybe yields could be lowered, or a second wine created to increase concentration.

Second bottle from this batch. Limpid garnet. Ripe berries on the nose, vegetal notes, no oxidisation. Sadly, palate doesn't keep up with first impression - pronounced acidity, fruit compost rather fruit compote, flat tannins, earth and leather, mellow with hardly any life left, medium jammy finish. This was immediately after decanting (!) but after >1-2h, the zombie gets up from his grave, turns into a pensioner in the wheelchair who eventually walks with sticks...rich, vegetal fruit notes…RIP

Negociant bottling, Robbers & van den Hoogen, Arnhem, Holland. High shoulder. Led capsule. Thanks to my Durand opener I get the cork out intact. No decant since 67 is a fragile vintage. Transparent purple, faintly brick colored rim. Autumn in a glass. Wet forest floor, decaying leaves, bark, mushrooms, chestnuts. Dried black olives, cold breakfast tea, still some red fruit. Surprisingly satisfying wine. Most would agree this should have been drunk by the mid-eighties. I like these old blokes. Drying tannins

Not only do Meo-Camuzet owns some of the finest vineyards, they also had the legendary winemaker Henri Jayer work for them as a winemaker for a few years and as consultant for a few more years.

By 1988, Meo-Camuzet regained more vineyards that was contracted out.

This wine was really potable enjoyed. It has a pleasant blackcurrant and cassis bouquet ? light and airy. The palate is crisp on the entry with a citric line of acidity, pinched blackberry and blueberry fruit toward the finish. Not bad for a Village Cru. Good value from a great producer.

Light ruby in color, red fruits, floral notes, and oak. Medium body with smooth finish. Good value for money red burgundy!

L&W 2018 En Primeur. 1y4m. Rough notes.
C: Med ruby.
N: Ripe strawberry, cherry, some green herbs, oak, damp earthy forest floor. Intense aroma, med clarity but simple and quite ripe smelling.
P: Sweet red fruit, strawberry, green herbs -> exotic spices and cherry till the end. Short finish, med- conc, light bod, med+ acid, light grippy tannins. This is a simple and linear wine, easy drinking, bit off balance. Questionable value. Now to 2023. 84p.

Overall a good wine for me. In the nose as well as on the palate rather restrained aromas of black cherries, eucalyptus, tomato herb, vanilla, wet leaves, tobacco, cooked blackberries, ... Alcohol and acidity rather powerful for the medium weight body. Personally, I would drink it now and not store it.

Berries on the nose, such as raspberries and strawberries. A lot of freshness, with an herbaceous wild side.
In the mouth, it’s dry and the acidity is very high. Wild berries, young and powerful are totally present. 
Woody notes, with spicy hints.
Amazing.

Barrel sample. Purplish ruby. Candied red fruits in the nose. Spicy, juicy, quite complex for a village, very long finish

4.4/5 Wonderful Pinot from the land of kings, Burgundy. This is a stunning, bright ruby red wine with a refreshing nose filled with red fruits, cherries, minerals, earth, violets, oak, and vanilla. Medium, soft tannins illuminate the palate while holding the hand of a vibrant acidity. The taste is driven by red berries, cranberries, earth, minerals, oak, and a bit of spice leading into a satisfying finish. Great wine! Cheers

Incredible Burgundy, available to me specifically in half bottles which I need to get more of! Bright, clear ruby red in color with heavy, thin tears. The magnificent nose consists of earth, herbs, floral bouquet, red berries, cherry, and dusty oak. The palate showcases flavors of cranberry, ripe red fruits, earth, tobacco, mineral, and spice. Medium-bodied with vibrant acidity and light tannins, this wine finishes with notes of pine and soil with medium (+) length. Amazing!

The nose was bursting with red and black fruits, while in the background an understated oak provides a hint of vanilla creaminess and spicyness.  Firm but ripe tannic structure backed by exuberant fruits and racy acidity, although it definitely could use some more aging to smooth out the rough edges.  Showing very fine energy throughout.

A good example of an entry level Bourgogne.  Good showing of a Marsannay, but not at the level of its famous southern neighbor Gevrey-Chambertin.

After wine tasting. No notes taken. 
Love the fresh and juicy elegantiers that Meo Camuzet produces. And this Marsannay is no exception. Well balanced and very elegant in it's expression. Quite light in it's fruit with a rather high, albeit well integrated acidity.
Light on the aroma with fragrance of berries, body entails with a light earthy licorice spice along with a much desired soft finish.
On the lighter side. Raspberries and strawberries. Understand why some would say it was watered down but after a few sips it’s okay.

MARSANNAY: Burdundy village AOC since 1987. Less than 50 producers on around 240 ha (76% red, 17% white and 7% rosé).
Great to discover wines and styles from the Marsannay appellation 💙🤍❤️ at a great workshop in „Tasting Room” in Poznań.

Very good mature red Burgundy,

The palate shows decent concentration for a village Marsannay, fresh acidity and firm tannins. The finish is simple and straightforward like the wine.
Correct but nothing special, probably wouldn't buy another bottle.

I have had approximately 8 vintages of this Caymus Zin & they are usually pretty consistent. A powerhouse Zin, well balanced with 15.2% ABV. Med to full bodied, just off dry & fairly smooth. 
Aromatic nose of dark fruit, vanilla & spice. The flavours blend dark fruit & red cherry with chocolate, spice, herbs, vanilla, oak & smoke. Very flavourful with a lovely long finish. Almost half the price of their cab but delivers a similar favourable experience. Paired this with filet mignon & frites. Wonderful 🍷🇺🇸🍷👍
On the nose, chocolate, oak, dark plums, leather . On palate, plums, black cherries, chocolate, leather, pepper. Yummy!
Very good Zin ! Buy again. Cherry and strawberry on the front end. Creamy in the middle soft tannins on the end.

A big, bold and rich Zinfandel from the famous Caymus family. Jammy blueberry, cherry, fruit forward with vanilla and some smoke on the noise. Very approachable on its own; but will pair well with a rich red meat dish. We had it with chilli and the sweetness balanced out the spice quite nicely. There are other Zinfandels out there that are comparable for less.
Tastes or blackberry, cherry, chocolate, and plum. You get some vanilla from the French oak but not overpowering. Great color and finish. Well balanced.
Simply put, the best Zin I have ever had.

I'm not a huge zinfandel fan.  Too often they are just jammy alcohol bombs. While this one is high on the alcohol content, too high imo at 15.2%, it doesn't blow out the palette.  Still has that red and black fruit jamminess though.  At the price there are better ones like Draconis or Lucas out of Lodi.
Immediate, strong hit of oak. Similar in body and fruit-forward like a Cali Cabernet Sauvignon.
