Winery Tasting and always fun. Table of 6 favorite and we also really enjoyed Emmolo Sauvignon Blanc, the Mer Soleil Pinot Noir. this being fuller & richer. 

#RegularWineGuy Sean J. Brady of #TotalWinos rating: 4.5 stars buy 6+ maybe even make it a regular house wine.  

Sean’s additional practical scale ratings:   
3 stars = I’d drink it again, but not buy it again.  
3.5 stars = I’d buy it again.  
4 stars = Buy at least 3 more bottles.  

5 stars = Buy as much as possible!

4.3 - 100% Zinfandel. Well, I was prepared for an extracted jammy fruit bomb, but what a pleasant surprise! Intense deep purple color with flavors of raspberries, blackberries, vanilla, some oak and a touch of cocoa. On the palate full-bodied, subtle notes of vanilla, laced perfectly with the fruit, reflecting this wine’s balanced oak quality. Tannins are smooth and silky. Well, that was actually my first bottle of Caymus Zinfandel but certainly not my last one. Very delicious and elegant.

Fantastic dark Ruby color. When the wine opens up, nose is plum, blackberry, vanilla. But given high alcohol content (14.8%) the alcohol does hit the nose at the beginning. 

Mouth is complex, acidic, not tannic. Lots of plum,  black cherry. Fruity finish. @

This 2018 was just perfect! Smooth but deep and complex flavors! On the nose a beautiful bouquet (vanilla and blackberries). It went really well with a perfect New Zealand French Rack of Lamb! Just a wonderful combination! Ideally recommend!

Very nice treat this Zin from Caymus, Napa
Dark purple in the glass
Nose is chocolate, black fruit, dark spices, and earthy aroma
Off-Dry, medium acidity, ripe medium tannins, high alcohol, big body and bold flavour.  Exquisite balance and structure, bold intensity, long finish.
Notes of pepper, licorice, black cherry, black currant, cherry, raspberry, anise, leather, rhubarb, nutty

Not surprisingly, Caymus knows what they’re doing.  The nose bursts with blueberries. Rich round and smooth in the mouth. The initial tastes are raisins but with some air this evolves into fresh berries.  Delicious.

I’ve reviewed this before but for some reason cannot find the past rating (Vivino UI redesign?). Bought 6 bottles of this zin in Napa this May; no other method of acquiring as they don’t sell outside of the vineyard. This is as good of a zin as a Caymus cab, is a cab. Deep bodied and bountiful fruit, wonderful mouthfeel with vanilla, oak, blackberry, cherry, blueberry, jam. This is one to let decant for 45 minutes, BTW.

Had this wine two times now. Absolutely love this one. This wine is something special what not many wines have. It has a sweet smell and taste of chocolate, vanilla and licorice. But it is not too sweet. It is very smooth. An absolute beauty. If you want to try something special, invest in this. If you want to serve something nice with a dinner with friends serve this. It'll blow their minds for sure. 4.7/5
Bouquet of Red fruit, complex layers of blackberry and strawberries with vanilla and a hint of oak. Beautiful long finish, this is my favourite Zinfandel.!
Bouquet produces leather, licorice, current and anise. Smooth chocolate, raise and slightly flowery taste. Unique for a sin. Black cherry, clove and vanilla finish.
vanilla tobacco and a lot of plum , another sweet caymus, easy to drink, little less longer and dense than the cabernet but high end. As always excellent!
Oak driven, fine tannins, a big of cedar, very big and rich. Long finish, with some nice woody, earthy and blackberry character. Fantastic but atypical.
Deep rich color, beautiful legs, plum and oak in nose, and long-lasting dark fruit in palate with soft tannins at the end.
Delicious and smooth with dark fruit flavors with a hint of pepper and a nice, velvety finish. Hard to find but well worth it once you do
Tremendous balance. Young bright fruit on the nose. Soft caramel tannins, plum and cherry, balanced acid. Caramel plum finish.
Wow! Made by Chuck Wagner himself in honor of his late father who had this wine as his favorite. Only available at the winery.
Not usually a fan of Zinfandel but this is very nice. Fruity without being overwhelming and heavy. Good thing I started experimenting a little.
A big chewy wine. Bold flavors of dark cherries and dark chocolate. Not overly tannic. Great wine. Happy New Year everyone! 🍷🍷
Caymus has done a great job with this Zin.  A bold, smooth, oaky wine wine loaded with taste of pepper and vanilla.  Very nice!
Great crowd pleaser. Big Jammy Zin. Slightly sweet. Great was steak or prime rib. Ready to drink right away.
Nose of freshly crushed over-ripe raspberries. Black currant; vanilla, cloves; baking spice. Bright fruit, medium acidity and soft tannin; high alcohol. Medium-plus finish. Enjoyable now.
Great producer and this Zin is just amazing.
Yum! A very robust wine. Big mouthfeel, sometimes zinfandels are too jammy but I like this one a lot. Nice oak, vanilla flavors, a touch of pepper for warmth. Nice dark fruit flavor too.
Just an amazing Zinfandel, that full succulent flavor, extracted from grapes left to fully ripen in that long summer sun.
November rain outside calls for the strong counter measures. This round and elegant blueberry bomb in fine velvet has been cast and polished to warm and cheer up. 4.3
Full
Pepper  vanilla oak blackberry
Just an amazing well balanced experience. Loved it
Great Zinfandel ... very smooth
Very nice and full body
Still solid.  Slipped from the 5 status, but still excellent 👍
Vanilla and oak, with caramel notes on the tongue..lots of body, nice Zinfandel!
Delightfully deep in color and taste. Bought with Michael in Napa.
one of my best wine
Simply the best Zinfandel I have every had.
4.3. Juice bomb ft. Oak. Blackberries and bursting blueberries. Touch of chocolate. Very fun.
Oak and blackberry, a wonderful bottle, I took two home.
Fruity up front and bold
Clear notes of blackberry subtle chocolate on the tongue. Got this special ordered from Napa. If I could buy in stores I would buy more. .
Pepper, plum and blackberry. Round tannins. Very bold while somehow still easy drinking.
Very nice Zinfandel. Great pair with todays lunch osso buco.
Pure cherry juice - by the way a great companion to Bison

Excellent
Big, fruit forward zin with lot of chocolate 
Black cherry
Tobacco 
Not overly tannic
Love this Zinfandel!
Very nice zin. Not too jammy.
My fav zin
Plum, cassis a little smoke and spice.  Paired with pork ribs and the spice really came out.  Let it breathe at least an hour in a decanter
Everything you’d want in a Zin! Big, juicy and silky smooth. Purchase this at Caymus when visiting back in 2019. A little pricey but would buy again. No brainer

Wine aged for 17 months in a combination of French and American oak, 75% new and 25% seasoned barrels. Dark, dense purple-red color medium-bodied wine with intense aromas of sweet, ripe blackberry and fig. Notes of blackcurrant, cranberry, black cherry and dark chocolate. Persistent berry flavors with light acidity.

Wow, this is great Zinfandel. Let this decant for 2 hours and it was smooth, dense black fruit that goes on forever. Tannins and acidity were muted and perfectly balanced. Enjoyed this with a great brisket.

Outstanding Zinfandel. Oak, vanilla and lots of fresh fruit on the nose. Dense and thick on the palate and very fruit driven. Harmonious notes of cranberry, blueberry and dark chocolate. Integrated acidity with smooth tannins. Long, sweet finish. Great structure. Like chocolate melting in your mouth.

Delicious bouquet of the most delicious ripe black currants, nuts, forest soil and wet wood. Deep dark purple color and extreme bold curtains. A nice "fat" taste where there are shades of ripe black currants, prunes, sweet tobacco and oak. Good strong wine with lovely tannins and a gentle aftertaste.

Fantastic wine with those distinctive Caymus flavors that I love in the Cabernet Sauvignon.  First time I’ve tried the Zinfandel and it was pretty spectacular with a delightful aroma of chocolate, raspberry, dark berries, oak but less pencil lead than the Cab.  This is now my favorite Zin!  Yum.

4.3 Happy Zinfandel day! Is there a producer easier to identify than Caymus? This is as expected - bold, smooth, extracted and delicious. Decanted 90 minutes.

Robust nose of vanilla(!), milk chocolate, fig, ripe plum, sweet blackberry and spandex leather. Some smoke and pepper add complexity.

A big wine with medium tannins, high acidity and hot alcohol. 

Flavours are quite sweet and oaky, really dominated by vanilla and sweet black plum with chocolate, tobacco and spicy black pepper. 

Better in 2 years?

A real Napa Zinfandel from a great vineyard! In my opinion there not many Zin's in that quality range. Love it!

A deep purple and many slow long legs in the glass.

On the nose we found intense aromas of jammy blackberries, wild berries, black cherries, stewed plums, cinnamon, slightly tar, forest floor and oak.

A medium and juicy acidity, velvety and well integrated tannins.
Full bodied with 15.4% ABV.
Pronounced flavours of blackberries, wild berries, fresh plums, cassis, cherries, sweets spices,
~~~~>>

Half point extra because the zinfandel is not easy to raise to such a level. Has the trademark Wagner notes. Full bodied, lots of dark fruit, tobacco and earth. Lots of Syrah like spice and liquorice. Great balance. No overripe stuff, no flabbiness, 15 .4 alco that has just a slight tingle. Long finish. 4.3.

Another delicious bottle to celebrate the new place. This bottle is well enjoyed with @[1|34591568|Sam Russell] and our ladies. 

I love Zins and this must be the absolute Cadillac of them all. On the nose it’s got blackberry and coconut, with a touch of spice. 

Body is smooth as should be expected from Caymus. Beautiful soft tannins run the show with lots of acidity to manage sweet black fruit and vanilla notes. 

Really damn great! 4.6 ⭐️!

94 Points, drink now until 2025. Deep purple with dense black aspects, no rims. Profound nose of black berries and cherry, bitter almond and chocolate brownies, plums and tobacco leaves, champignon and floral combinations. Extremely concentrated on the palate, this complex and perfectly balanced Zin is just great and has it all! Finishing long and fresh, well done, Caymus!

Medium-bodied Zin that has excellent flavor of dark fruits, oak with a very mild peppery and dry finish. A bottle to break out for any occasion and might I add a tremendous vineyard to visit if you’re in Napa.

4,5 ⭐️

Astonishing Zinfandel from marvelous estate Caymus (their Cabernet Sauvignon - special selection has been voted best wine in the world twice, by Wine Spectator). 

Beautifully full bodied and bold. Flavors like  blackberry, vanilla, oak, plum, pepper, chocolate and leather. 

+ 60 s finish

Explodes with flavor. Excellent. Heavy, dark, fruit forward. Very good California wine if that is the style you like. Does not have the sophisticated flavor profile that would put this in the top echelon of wines but it’s close!!

Not a lot of experience with the Zinfandel....(I love the Prisoner, so I thought it would try this). This was really unique and enjoyable. Started out peppery (almost like a Shiraz) but finished with a very pleasant plum-like taste. Had with some rib eye, and it paired very well. I will do that again!
Wine with pleasant aromas of black fruits and chocolate. In mouth it is balanced, with pleasing tannins with a mineral touch. The finish is fine, delicate and persistent.

This wine surprised me by it’s lighter style yet full bodied flavour. 
Black raspberry, boysenberry, black cherries
Sweetness from the red fruits, cherry compote with black pepper. Delicious.
Medium to deep purple color, ripe blackberry, blueberry, long aftertaste with tobacco, vanilla and spice notes. Well integrated tannins, perfect structure. Best Zinfandel (Primitivo) until now.
Absolute whopper! 3rd or 4th bottle of it now and every bottle has been awesome! Leather, blueberries, vanilla. Smoother than silk, beautiful finish. Almost no acidity. Up there with the cab!
Soft on the nose. Full berry taste, low tannins, slight vanilla oak taste. Smooth and not overbearing. Good drank with meats or on its own.
It's an excellent zin. Jammy, black cherry and vanilla. It really is good. For this price... I don't know I'll drink it much more, there are other great zins for cheaper, but this is among the best
Blackberry, fig, brown spices, and roasted almond. Black cherry and so smooth on the finish. This is an amazing wine and so special if you can get it.
Tasty Cali zin from an iconic producer. Consistent to the 2017 vintage, smooth, easy drinking, and incredible value at $55/bottle.
Coronavirus bottle #7...nice balance bottle...very fruit forward.  Tons of red fruit.  Nice wine.  Wife really liked it.
Chocolate, lush, rich and smooth . Super rich. Very close to port style..worked extremely well with cheesecake.
Good
A classy Zinfandel.
4,4 excellent 🇺🇸

Regardless of vintage, perhaps my favorite booty-call-in-a-bottle. (Shout out to The Keg for having a criminally bottomless supply to facilitate said booty excursions) Also, while not "cheap", still outstanding value for the price, especially considering its double-the-price-yet-controvertially-inferior Cab sibling. Silky all the way through with exceptional opening balance for a Zin. Black fruit + red fruit + subtle vanilla along the bottom. I say drink solo or with lighter dishes to let it own the frame.

Caymus Zinfandel. My go-to bottle in the cellar! 2 hour decant. Although the winery is known for their signature Cabernets, this is one you want to stash. It’s said that this varietal was the favorite of their founder Mr Charlie. Robust and full bodied with 14.8% ABV. Blackberry syrup, crushed black pepper and dark chocolate laced with cherry notes. Subtle hints of oak, lush tannins and a lingering finish. Trust me, give this Zin a try if you’re fortunate to get your hands on this small produced wine..

A delicious Zinfandel. Opaque ruby color, ruby rim. Oak, sweet cherries, milk chocolate on nose. Medium body, medium–high tannins. Mocha, cherries, pepper on palate. Dark chocolate on finish. Long aftertaste.
Best zin I have had to date
Very fruity and easy to drink. Excellent body.
Fantastic wine, fruity and soft
Rich dark fruits, deep ruby color, blackberry, blueberry, light licorice, clove, vanilla. Pleasant surprise fr a consistently enjoyable winemaker.
😲 this is fantastic. I could spend the night just enjoying the nose. Perfect balance in the mouth. Delicious long finish. Steal it from your friends
Deep red color with strong legs in the glass. Dark cherry, long tanin finish, notes of leather, pepper, berries and some minerals.
90 pts. Dark violet red. Opulent ripe black fruits figs and prunes a bit of vanilla. Full body with lots of silky tannins and long finish.
I love this wine. Fill a bathtub for me with it :)
Wow - just wow! Smooth, jammy and delicious.  Love it!!
Great finish. Notes of  vanilla pepper and  plum

Big, bold Cali wine. 
Dark fruit, plum, jammy, oak, vanilla. Big wine that needs big food
I do not like Zin’s... this is the exception 👌
A little spicy this time around
Not just juice
Another great wine I’ve been holding. Not a negative comment. Drinkable x  10 .
Excellent also with fish!
Beautiful Zinfandel from Caymus. Lovely taste of vanilla,oak and Chocolate. 👍🍷🍷🍷🍷🍷
Jammy, heavy, fruity full bodied zin. Excellent!
Medium bodied, not an inky zin. Pepper and strawberry nose, hints of tobacco and leather
Such an amazing wine!! Loaded Zinfandel! A must try!
Great finish for a zin, little jam taste.
Big an rich, similar to the 2016. Dark fruit and oak. Amazing Zin, can’t go wrong with a Caymus.
Blackberry, spice, fig, and a touch of vanilla. Lovely.
So tasty. If I could only drink one wine, this would be it. Dark fruit forward, smooth, jammy. Perfectly drink alone or with meal. No breathing necessary.

Full body, intense flavored of cherry along with coffee and pepper notes. 
Incredible suppleness. Best Zin out there

Very jammy fruit forward Zinfandel.  Very boozy on the nose and in the mouth with lots of baking spices.  I can’t imagine sitting down and drinking a bottle because it takes a lot of effort to drink, but one glass is great.
Fruit, bold, berry, not sweet but very smooth.
Full bodied, fruity and tannine rich, but retains an excellent balance and a subtle sweetness which perfectly matches the tannine. Very good with medium to heavy meals.
Wow... A little pricey for a Zin, but man what a wine. Super smooth and heavy. Someone could mistake it for Napa Cab very easily. And at $38? Hells yes...
Dark squid pink color!  Heavy berry and leather .  Soft finish    I opened. It’s delicious and made me think should I have  held longer?!  Lol.  It’s the last one.
Full body, strong oak notes, nice tannins, medium acidity, spicy end. Perfect pairing to an ossobuco at sous vide!

This is so good I don’t even need to put on a description. You need to buy this and put it into your collection and drink it because it’s that good. Full bodied, with a little spice, nice tannin balance and I could go on. This is the best zin on the market, bar none.

A total gangster. This is just so good and this bottle, approaching perfect. Wonderful rich red fruit jam with 20s and more finish. Tokens of cherry and nutty vanilla bean and marzipan without cloying because of the fresh paprika. 45’ decant time made it just rock. Just a top drawer Cali Zin expression. 4.7/5
Every bottle of this wine over the past 5-6 years has been outstanding.  Great fruit, almost jammy but in a subtle way and so silky smooth.  My favorite Zin by a mile.

Super floral. Honey notes. Jamminess, fruit and berries steeped in tea - bergamont flavours. 
Palate: super delish and smooth. Milk choc. Soft cured meats. 
Delish.
Awesome wine - subtle leather notes
Hearty and bold. Not as sweet as most zins. Cab drinkers would like this one. Smooth with a bit of tannins. Definite spice and bite on the end that lingers a bit.
The first Zin I really liked. Big beautiful bouquet on the nose. Fruit forward with plum, blueberry and strawberry. Smelt like bubblegum and cotton candy. So good
Nice Zinfandel from Napa Valleyin California, USA. Very strong smell of blackberries. The taste is full of ripe dark berries. Medium long aftertaste.
Great Zinfandel nicely made full bodied,heavey long after tast... lots of black berry, vanilla, oak, and some.dark bitter chocolate...very nice one...deswrves it

4.5
Best Zin I’ve ever had, maybe 1 year past its peak but really great.

ABV - 14.8%
good flavor and body
Haven't met a Caymus I don't like! This one didn't disappoint. Tannins strong to start but then when mixed with the meal of pork ribs everything got better. Would drink this every night.
Dry rub baby back ribs and Caymus Zinfandel is an amazing pairing!
Vanilla, fruit forward. Very good
Full bodied. Lots of oak to trim the sweetness of the Zinfandel. Outstanding. (Magnum version)
Perfect finish on the zin.  As the winemaker told us when we visited the winery the family drinks the zin and sells the cab. I agree!!
Incredible zinfandel. Juicy, full of flavor and delicious. Nice sweetness to it, can't wait to drink again.
Dark fruit and leather. Very nice again Caymus. Full body
A lot of flavor, smooth and lush.
Very nice aroma.  Medium to full bodied.  A bit of oak, licquorice and chocolate.  Complex tastes.
Nice dark red. Bouquet of dark fruit. Taste is very well balanced. Nice dark fruit with oak. Finish had exceptional balance with the fruit and oak lingering beautifully.
Outstanding Zin. Montreal steak spice and saddle leather on the nose. Beef pepperoni sticks. Black currant and blackberry with liquorice on the palate. Ripe, fine tannins.
Amazing as usual.  Full fruit and jam
Deep flavors with a smooth finish
Cherry, oak, tobacco and blackberry. Great balanced and complex wine. Long and medium bodied. Great Napa valley wine.
We are fortunate to have this wine available to us. Quite the privilege actually.

Another excellent Zinfandel from the U.S. West Coast. Very smooth and like velvet. Balanced and not too strong and with moderate tannins.

Zinfandel remains my favorite grape for sure.
This is a fantastic Zin - only available at the winery I believe. I posted some tasting notes previously- lots of blueberry, super smooth. Not cheap, but really well done
Through the roof! But the cab was a even better.
Excellent wine. Full body with hints of dark berries. Definitely a must try.
Great Zin! Only available at the Caymus winery!
plum vanilla blackberry oak
This Zin pairs so we’ll with all kinds of Mexican Food!
Fabulously smooth with delightful black fruits and a hint of vanilla. Wonderful value relative to Caymus Cabs and just as wonderful to enjoy
Delicious 🍷 Cheers
So good
Huh huh huh

Lovely tannins on this thinner bodied Zin. The signature caymus fruit forward nose and tongue pairs so nicely with the tannins. As it sits in the tongue it loses a bit of the complex flavors but a better taste hits at the end.

Excellent 
Very hot which I like
This bomb comes in over 15%
One of the best zins out there 
I ordered a case
Special treat at recent Caymus tasting. Limited production Zin originally planted for Chuck Sr. Jammy fruit, not as peppery as in past years but still a beautiful Zinfandel.
This one was so tasty!  Another one thanks to Dan!
Deep, dark and dense. There are a lot of flavours happening here. Sweet blackberry, cherry and cranberry with just the right tone of spices, and it’s velvety smooth. Truly an amazing wine!
Powerful nose that jumps out the glass. Lots of oak, cola. Black cherry, plum on the palate, very smooth and almost buttery on the mid palate, fine tannins with some black pepper on the finish
vanilla oak pepper chocolate the best wine I have ever had.
Well done Caymus great wine with a steak... or just by the fire.... thoroughly enjoyed everything about this wine... that must be why it’s my favourite.
Superb Napa Valley zinfandel. Silky smooth, fruit forward with nice tannins. Goes down way too easy. Drinking this while it's snowing outside here in N.C.

Wow, pleasantly surprised, beautiful color extraction, rich creamy ripe fruit nose, smooth mouth filling, extreme yet balanced palate, trailing off seamlessly into a minute plus finish where some spice kicks in, this bottle exceeded my expectations, another well made wine from the Wagner family.

One of my favourite wines of all times. Very hard to find outside of Napa and, for some reason, Alberta, Canada. Big, jammy, full bodied Zin. Lots of red and black fruit on the tongue and lingering tannins to finish. This wine needs to be tried. Most restaurants sell it at $75-$80 but you can find it at the Keg for $67!

Deep ruby red. Medium+ viscosity with staining and slight rim variation.  Medium + intensity of aromas, which include pepper, cassis, black raspberries, a bit of wet dirt, oak, and cigar box. Full bodied with 3.6 ph and 15.4 % alcohol. Med+ finish

Super lekkere wijn. Amazing zinfandel. Zinfandel and Primitivo are for sure some of our favourite grapes but this one is exceptionnaly good. After 9 years still full of fruit, smooth long lasting taste and well balanced. Also not to sweet as some zinfandel and Primitivo wines can be. If it was not for the price the score would have been even closer to the 5 ⭐️.

A brooding deep Zinfandel with dark berry, black tea, pepper and clove aromas with some sweet vanilla oak. This wine was incredibly balanced with refined mid palate and tannin yet still has the varietal fleshyness that zin is known for. A top cab producer does a nice zin too.

I would say that a good shoe is exactly like a good wine. These shoes are going to stay and last for a long time. - Christian Louboutin -     
 
Caymus is a well-known Cabernet Sauvignon specialist owned by the Wagner family who are behind two of my favorite PNs, Belle Glos and Meiomi. My first Caymus Zin, the highlight of the night in Cabo San Lucas is the kind of wine that would stay and last, exactly like a good shoe: enjoyable, memorable, outstanding.  (TN cont in comments)

Never had the Wagner family's take on Zinfandel before, but it's a nice one.  As you might expect, it's a full and lush presentation of Zinfandel with baked cherry, stewed plum and dark chocolate notes.  Full and bold but pulls back before it becomes a fruit bomb.

Thick, viscous with a deep purple colour that lingers on the glass. Spicy, candy, fruit on the nose. Powerful dark red fruits, oak, vanilla on the tongue with good amount of oak and mild acidity. Layered experience with a full body and long, tannin finish. 4.4

TGIF! 

Bouquet is rich with dark currant and cherry. Flowery finish. 

Medium to full body.  Medium acidity.  Medium alcohol content. 

Dark cherry.  Rich fruit. Low bitterness.  Smooth to the finish. 

Bad Ass Wine

Deep ruby in color. Ripe currant, cherries, spice and just a hint of smoke on the nose.

Rich, juicy Zin that delivers a complete, bold yet velvety mouthfeel.  Finish is fruit complimented by a whisper of spice and smoke.  Tannins deliver clear structure and offer a superbly balanced mouthfeel.  

Time and time again Caymus shows that they grow and select gorgeous, opulent fruit.  Very satisfying Zinfandel.

"...why the bizarre, stupid grin?  Oh ...I see!"

Aug 2016 - 94 points.

Tried a previous version and this 2011 confirms the consistent Quality you get from this producer, always meets or exceeds the expectations, that said ...and while looking at the slow tears dropping down the glass, it opens up with an inviting nose of dark berries, spices and a hint of oak, the palate is generous, consistent with the nose, offering loads of black berries, licorice, some dark chocolate undertones and spices, resolved tannins leaving a candied and fairly long aftertaste.

4.3! A fantastic zinfandel from caymus, which is in the perfect age to drink! A deep purple color with many long legs in the glass. On the nose are intense aromas of wildberries, cherries , plums, marmelade, cinnamon, slightly tar, oak and forestfloor. 
A medium and juicy acidity with velvety tannins. Full bodied, 15.4 ABV!On the palate are pronounced flavours of wildberries, plums, black currant , cherries, sweet spices, slightly leather and oak. Long finish! Cheers🍷🍷🍷

Sunday afternoon at home. Before the next business trip, I opened this excellent Zinf, from the famous Caymus, with my wife.
👁 Deep purplish color, with purple edges
👃🏻 Dark Currants, blackberries, chocolate, coffee, floral and earthy notes.
👄 Full bodied, high alcohol, medium- acidity, full of rounded tannins, delivering a mouth filling texture. Raspberries, plums, red fruits jelly, sweet tobacco and cedar notes. Typical, pleasant and non-exaggerated sweetness in the palate. Oh yeah! What a wine! 4.5⭐️

Zinfandel is usually quite approachable in character making it the  mainstream  wine of choice.  This one is not it is niched . It was pretty refined in the direction of tar, plum, cinnamon and nutmeg. The spectrum of flavors makes it rather unique and surprising.

Jammy ruby red in color. Vibrant electric pink with blood red for the rim. Legs are thick but dismantle quickly after traveling a little.

Strong aromas of blackcurrant, licorice, cassis, chocolate, wood, honey, brown sugar and wet sweet earth.

Smooth and silky slime to the palate. Small notes of leather and a bold sulfuric saliva after taste. Strong flavors of dark ripe berries. Very jammy, just like its appearance. 

Tannins are soft. The wine is dry, very full in body and medium to high in acidity.

Definitely some plum and raspberry in terms of fruit. Lots of oak with vanilla, clove and a nice peppery finish. Think this one will mellow out and be even better in a few years. High acidity, tannins and medium finish.

94pts...this is smooth, silky with big dark fruit  and a long finish. For almost 16% alcohol, it is balanced beautifully. A tad sweet, but I expect that from a Zin. Dark purple in the glass and a gorgeous smell that had my nose stuck in the glass all night long. This a big and bold wine and a must buy for the next time you flame up the grill!  Paired wonderfully well with homemade BBQ 🍔. At 5 years old, probably right at its peak. Cheers!

Have been watching big inky legs drip down my glass for going on 3 minutes now. It defies logic. I imagine there maybe several more minutes left in the show, but I can't wait that long for my next sip. I honestly had no idea zin's were this big. This wine is a massive 15.4 %.  Biggest wine I have had sans food and enjoying every second of it.  Dense dark purple-red.  Black cherries and dark chocolate.  Think I need to spend some more time discovering Zinfandel? Or is just because it's Caymus?
Smoked meat and hints of tobacco on the nose black berries and cherries on the pallet. Medium body medium acidity and medium plus tannins.
Not at all what to expect from a zin. Like a strawberry jam and nothing else. No pepper, no spice, not deep. Really disappointing
Fruit forward with some delightful tannin on the finish.  Luscious dark fruit throughout.
As good as a Zin gets!
So good. A little spice, fig, good alcohol. I love this.
Incredibly smooth, plum, jammy but a “soft” Cab
What a great Zin wish I could get more
Dark berries, smooth and just plain delicious. Definetly the winner of wine night.
Bold. Fruit forward, smooth
One of my favorite Zinfandels!  Lighter and less night than traditional Zins.

plum blackberry vanilla
Enjoyed at Momma in San Miguel, MX
Great wine from our summer tour
Love it!  I buy it by the case....
Smooth cherry earthy oakey
Fullbodied balanced powerhouse. Amazing wine!
Best Zin to date
The perfect ZIN🤗🍷🍷🍷🍷🍷👍❤️
Caymus’ masterpiece. Way better than their Cabernet Sauvignon
Fantastic.  Carlson brought it.  3rd wine aster steak Florentina

Caymus, I am not a big fan of these big brands that cost a fortune! However, Caymus you have earned your reputation like others. Hats off! Beautiful blended Zinfandel, quite oaky and full of cherry and plum almost Cabernet like. Impressive. Enjoy and this one can age easily another 5-10 years! Well done Caymus 👍🏻

CAYMUS ZINFANDEL! A birthday gift to myself. 

Beautiful deep, dark purple with a crimson red rim. 

The nose is slightly aromatic with dark fruits like blackberries, and plum, vanilla, toasted oak, with hints of smoke, cigar box, and gravel. 

The palate is fresh and jammy with red & black fruits like black cherries, cranberries, pomegranate, espresso, and fig, dusty tannins and small notes of pepper in the background. WOW! 

Body: Medium; Acidity: Low(+)
Long dusty finish. 93/100

What. A. Treat.

Opaque black plum colour with nose of blackberry vanilla dark chocolate with notes of vanilla oak and hints of tobacco. Unusual from a zin profile... very little to no pepper... smooth kings finish with a candied end

Initially funky scent similar to petrol and horseradish, blueberry, red cherry, chocolate to the nose.  Prune, blueberry initial palate and developing more mid palate with greater fruitiness, chocolate and slight pepper.  Very soft with light tannins.  Quite fruity, very easy drinking and not very complex, medium body.  $49 Superstore.
Funkiness scent went away after about 2 hrs.
3rd day intense dark fruit, coffee and cola addition to palate.

This Caymus zinfandel is nice and fruity, but not my favorite among them. It has very strong dark fruit and jam notes like plum and blackberry, black cherry and blueberry, as well as cherry, cranberry, strawberry, fig, and raisins. I also taste dark chocolate, oak, and vanilla. The overall flavor however is a little off sweet and strange, and it just doesn’t quite hit my palate right.

Compared to past vintages this already seems ready to go. More jammy and sweet than usual, lacking freshness. Still miles better than a lot of other Zins but this vintage seems a bit too one dimensional in its fruit forward style.

A pleasant surprise here. This super young Caymus Zin was decanted for three hours. Deep ruby colour. Bold and smooth, oozing red fruit jam, not overly sweet, plums, berries, light slices and a long lovely finish. 

Cali wines have never been my cup of tea but got to give it to this wine, it’s outstanding 👏🏻 🍷

Very tasty Zin from the fellas out at Caymus. Despite all the smack talk I heard about Caymus from the employees of competitive vineyards in Napa Valley, I still really do enjoy the sweet, sugary start with a finish of black currant and pepper. 4.2

Caymus, a giant of California and Napa Valley known mostly for their exquisite Cabernet Sauvignon. However, this Zinfandel really does stand out. 

Complex, tannic, remarkable balance for its youthfulness, starts tight, opens up after decanting (1 hour), and really brightens up.

Dark red, opaque right to the rim.

The nose is fragrant, with notes of  blackberry, vanilla, and hints of leather. The palate is adventurous, with notes of  chocolate, plum, raspberry, and a bit of pepper notes.

Hold. 4⭐️

Beautiful dark purple color with a dark red rim! 
The nose is cherry, plum, alcohol, chocolate! 
The taste is BlackBerry all the way! Bold! 
The finish isn’t super long but has a great sweet finish. 
Great way to bring in 2020 🎊🍷

powerful nose, cassis, blueberry, spicy, somewhat heavy oak, vanilla, milk-chocolate, cherry & somewhat vegetal.
juicy, round & rich, lots of extract, fairly smooth, vertical acidity, spicy.
blueberry all the way, chocolate, earth, smooth oak influence.
quite round but with great structure, vertical w/ good length & concentration. high class Zin in a Cab-Sauv-Style.

4.8 What a stunner. The best Californian Zinfandel I have ever tried. On the nose - oak, vanilla, blackberry jam, ripe plum, blueberry jam. On the palate - vanilla, jammy dark fruits - ripe plum, blackberry, black currant, chocolate, oak, tobacco, spices. Superbly smooth on the tongue with silky long finish with long and pleasant aftertaste. Dense, thick, bold and elegant wine. Complex and rich in flavor. Getting softer and silkier with decanting.

First time having this Caymus Zinfandel,  it definitely won’t be the last time.  Thank you @[1|31951250|Andrew Lum] for bringing this over!  Rich dark red in the glass, on the nose  plum, blackberry and chocolate.  Medium+ acidity, high alcohol (just under 15%), smooth tannins and a long finish.
Toasted spices, oak, plum, black cherries, and a smoky finish.  I typically don’t drink zin, but this is great.  It paired perfectly with lamb chops.

Top class wine...
Deep dark zinfandel in a pretty way
Notes of raspberry, blackberry and blackcurrant
Heavy dude for a zinfandel....🍷🍷🍷🍷👍
Very good
Complex zinfandel. Powerful. Maybe  too expensive
Love it - no notes.
Vanilla, chocolate, oak, cherry, blackberry, jam, plum
Toll
My first Zinfandel... great one  plum vanilla raspberry
Lovely. Full of depth, smooth, can taste some blackcurrant but alot more to it  than that...
Fruity and dry. And amazingly light and delicious Zin. G loves
Not as spicy as most. Used to be house wine for the family.
Tobacco with wood and dark red beers. Middle stark tannins with long plum aftertaste.  4.4
Amazing Zin from the Wagner Family. Full bodied, exceptional berry flavors, long legs, tannins and ripe - ready to drink. Light peppery finish unlike any other Zin. Buy by the case!!
Dry redcurrant. Great long legs
An incredible Zin. Not like drinking black pepper as so many Napa Zins are. Rich and flavorful while remaining smooth and lingering on the palate. Glad I have a few bottles to lay down for a bit.
Dark purple, Super jammy nose, raspberry and strawberry. Aroma is also red fruit, but with a bit of spice and leather. Goes well with steak and risotto!!!

Of course full body. I think you can only get this at the winery. At least that’s what they told us. Great flavor at a great price. 
Zero on the dryness scale.
Dark dark red. Bright red fruits and violet on the palette. Soft tannins and lovely balance, nice very smooth finish. Beautiful wine!
Very good wine for the price, well balance between oak and spice. Red berries in the body with long and smooth finish.
Creamy with a hint of Strawberry on the palate. This is always one fine wine. Even for an 'off' year.

Maybe one of the best Zinfandel I have tasted. Silky and smooth in a great way.
Very good structure, my new Zin fauvorite!
Zinfandel like no other. Dark crimson - Spicy, concentrated and full of fruit. God damn amazing. 95 points.
Delicious dark berries and a full body to go along. Lovely uncomplex but offers all the benefits of a great Zin
Another excellent selection from Caymus. Silky smooth mouth feel. Oak and dark berries present. Great finish.
More can than zin.   Yet it's a zin.   Big flavors, big wine, chewy and stands on its own or pairs with red meats.
Oh my, this is Zin dialled up to 11! So intense, blackberry, blueberry fruit, tobacco & sweet spice. Lovely.
One of the best Zinfandels available. Perfect blend of spice and fruit. Deep bold color and flavor.
Absolutely an exquisite zinfandel! Caymus never fails.  Full bodied, and a long spicy finish. Only available direct from Caymus Vineyards.
Nutty, dark amber chocolates, cloves, raisins, vanilla, plums, and dark cherries. Not too dry, not too fruity, well balanced with medium tannins, and black peppercorns.
We loved this wine. Very fruit forward with blackberry notes and smooth/balanced throughout. This is a must try for Zin lovers.
Fruity and jammy.  You can taste the richness in the Zinfandel grape.   Excellent zin for a 2016. Will get better with time.  4.2
Medium bodied fruit forward Zin.  Works with food or without. Strawberry and pepper on the nose.  Nice tannins on the palate.
Great black fruit & spice in this Zin.  Moderate oak with vanilla notes & a smooth finish.  Not as good as the 2013 but still solid.
Bold, smooth, black fruits, easy drinking, blackberry, plum, currants. It’s an outstanding Zinfandel. I ordered it online from Caymus.

We had some big reds this holiday as well....

Zin continues to grow on me every time I open this bottle.
There’s some light red berries, coffee and cardamom. Moderate acidity, med/high tannins with a long delicious finish.
Great Zin, on e of the better ones for sure from this are but if you want the best from Caymus you must goto the Cabs.
Let it breathe. Great wine, would buy again. 4.2 for me
Really outstanding . Really rich and flavorful without too many tannins. Tabasco and flavor mouthful. No acidity. Amazing !
This is an amazing wine!  Loved loved loved it!  Spice is nice.  Black fruits and earth.  Deep color.  Gorgeous!!

Beautiful medium body California Zin.  A delicious, delightful treat of cherries and BlackBerrys.  This wine is in short supplying in Canada, otherwise, it would be in my weekly rotation.  The Wagner family wines just never disappoint. cherry blackberry
Awesome

Wow!!! Gimme more!  Call me crazy but the nose on this wine reminds me of my childhood in the Fall.

Dry but not like a salt lick dry.  But dry non the less.  Black cherry, plum and anise are predominant followed by cedar and a fine mineral finish.

Serve this with a medium rare porterhouse with garlic fries.

You’re welcome!!

Sometimes you just find a wine like this.
Took me a couple of days to finally keep my initial rating. 4.8☆
Reason: the wine is great, I love Zinfandel qnd it made me travel in time to my first, and amazing, zinfandel experience. 
Full bodied and lots of fruit wine. Just almost perfect.

Mellow, big but balanced and well-behaved, a little dust, some black pepper and nice black cherries balanced with tannins. A real palate pleaser. Tasted today at the Allied Grape Growers annual meeting lunch in Santa Rose. $38 suggested retail.
Love the taste, has a slight smokey taste...richer tasting than the Girard Zinfandel, but both very good.  This a great alternative to the Caymus Cab at half the price.
Outstanding Zin, blackberry, raspberry.... and more berries..... I can almost smell Chambord liqueur. Very smooth, fruity and another outstanding wine from Wagner family.
Amazing!!
Smooth vanilla, hints of earth, long finish. What more could you want in a great Zin?
Well balanced, full bodied, flavorful and excellent with or without food. Delicious!
Dark purple, fruity nose, spicy and plum, full bodied, long finish
Full bodied wine, pretty good!
BlackBerry, oak, red fruit, still fruity but tastes somewhat more like a cab
I love zinfandel and this epitomizes the grape
Excellent Napa Jinfandel. Tons of fruit the a solid finish that seems to never end.
Awesome wine. Great depth and flavour.
Zinfandel on Caymus wines is a guarantee of quality at great prices.
Simply lovely , had after a 5 star napa valley Cabernet Sauvignon and I did not miss it too much
fruity, smooth, oaky, vanilla, great wine

Well balanced Zinfandel wine.
One of the.most Zinfansel one in Napa as well as US.
Nutmeg, thanksgiving spices.
Lovely fruit forward Zin with a luscious finish
Thick and Caymus creamy. Still young and bright. Good fruit and a big spice and pepper ending.
Leather and stewed fruit on the nose. Jammy taste with fruit and raisins. Really good Zin.
Obvious why this is rated as one of the top rated Zins. So well balanced. Could drink everyday.
Fruity and powerful with classic dark currant overtones. Subtle tannins that create complexity. Opened up nicely as we enjoyed this wonderful wine!
Smoke on the nose. Vanilla and cream soda. Nice finish and a great value!
Oak, dark chocolate and baking spice. Dark and rich.
Big, juicy, boisterous Zin.
Very nice.  Try some of their other grape varieties.
Smooth, dry, superb finish, smoky. Bodega Bay Mar2022
Great full body Zin.
Such a great wine. Vanilla and ripe berry
All seem to be good years from this winery
Everything you would expect from Caymus. An outstanding full bodied Zin! A must try.
Vanilla, oak and chocolate . Luscious wine
Awesome. Seems this wine needs 8 years to impress.
Floral bouquet,  on the nose, hint of spice on the back of the tongue,  dry finish.
Good big wine fruit forward
A full-bodied Zinfandel. Fruity, jammy and aromatic with a lingering aftertaste.
Jammy red fruit, deep
Wonderful Zinfandel. Typical Caymus spin to it. A little on the pricey side
Famous caymus zin is rather thin but smells good with cocoa taste with blackberry smell.
Fruitful. Figs, oak and smoke. Unreal on the palate.
Excellent, deep purple, with blackberries
What a lovely zin
Spicy with black currant along with the dark juicy fruits
Absolutely delicious wine from a great producer
Big, big wine! If you like big Cali's, you'll love this!

Very impressed 
Great fruit flavors
Caymus is known for quality, it’s a Cadillac in a sea of Toyota.
One of the best zins I've ever had
Opened up for nearly 2 hours. A very full bodied zinfandel, dark ruby in colour, plum on the nose, easy drinking but layered and complex with a long finish.

Bright raspberry and blackberry on the nose.  
Deep deep ruby color. Medium acidity.  Medium plus tannins. 
Baked dark fruit on the mouth. Long tannic finish.

Very nice, if I had it blind I would guessed a cabernet for sure. Very lush lovely red/black berries nose. Very drinkable !!
Less complex than the cabernet sisters
Second bottle with @[1|27770870|Douglas Jarvis]. An explosion of flavour. This bottle will blow your socks off
Blackberry , nice structure , liked it better than the cab 😟
Pretty good but caymus can is better
Solid Zinfandel that isn’t distributed.
3.75 - known as the Wagner table wine. Lightly sweet and ready to drink right away.
A very nice Zin. I will pour any night. But I have had better.
4.1. Raspberry jam, oak, plum and blackberry.
Amazing as always.  4.25
Nice! Exclusive to the winery, worth a try
Good taste like blend
Fruit blast and sweet cherry deep red wine. Good for red meat and balance the texture well.
Solid, but maybe over priced.
3.9.  Juice, balsamic, chocolate. Very social start flattens out quickly
4.2 lunch with friends at Glowbal. Missing a little complexity compared to previous vintages
Bold! Great with dinner

Needs some time.
Sweeter than other vintages, not the bite I like. Yet
The flavors were wonderful. A little heavy, but it would make a great winter wine.
Great flavor but lighter then most zins, not strong alcohol flavor
Good again, I like this vintage as much as the 2017, smooth and kind of a litter Zin.
Getting a case!
Young, fruity, medium body, great wine for just drinking.

Sssooo delish 
Smooth and different 
Oaky on the finish 
Caymus never disappoints 🍷
Sweet, excellent and well balanced!
Rich, viscous, weighty, blackberry and black cherry, vanilla, oak. One to savour
Chocolate, vanilla, lighter side for zin
Zinfandel is in! Great taste. 😊🇺🇸
Nice friends shared!

Oh my God...sooooo good!
Plum, chocolate & marzipan!
I'm loving this wine!!
oak plum dark fruit cherry black cherry raisin plum vanilla
Absolute zin perfection. Really showcases the potential of this usually badly treated grape.
Dark cherry, amazing!!!!!
Very good
Dark fruits, chocolate, leathery tannins, vanilla on the end!  Very well balanced, very rich tasting.
Bold, smooth, velvety finish, lip smacking goodness. An exceptional zin.

So much jam, black fruit, red fruit compote and Cherry 
Under the mask was some dark chocolate and mocha with the usual oak, leather and ash mixed
Hints of vanilla also
Too sweet for my palate, although very good

Notably dark & wafting with the aromatic essences of blueberry reduction & cloves. Impressively built, it comes with medium-plus body, lifted acidity & a pleasing concentration of fruit. Its plate punches with a core of mulled blueberries, blackcurrants & clove spice as flavors of smoke, cola, pepper, saline, charcoal & sandalwood show. It’s all complimented with a structure of lightly-chalky tannins & a medium length finish. This 100% Zinfandel, ged 17 mo. in French & American oak; 14.8% ABV. Bx92

As Caymus thought I am pretty sure... an A for this wine...

Everybody at the table congratulated me for the selection.  Like I knew!!!!

Well balanced, not powerful but with personality.  Light in the nose and in the colour..  A bit runny to me but very elegant.

In the mouth long and mild.  Berries and wood in the aftertaste.

The big bold Caymus Zin!! Sweet palate comprised of Jam, plum, smoke, vanilla, and cedar spice. This Caymus Zin has a long finish and is a solid bottle, but let’s be clear that it’s not going to blow your mind in any extravagant way.

Floral notes of blackberries and jam.  An inviting smell to this well balanced zin.  The front is lush and full of dark fruit and berries.  I get a touch of oak and leather.  Maybe a touch of tobacco?  The finish is superb.  Makes me want more.  I will be ordering some more Caymus now.

Again this is a big Zin.🍷 Not my usual style, but once in a while this can be very pleasant. It’s only 4 years old, but this is made to be drunk young. 
Prominent hints of black currants, slight stem-aroma, vanilla and roasted coffee beans. Very nice nose. This is not a jammy zin! Of course full bodied palate, long lasting, quite well rounded and soft. Perfectly paired with 🥩🥩

Caymus is always a way to go when you look for incredible wine.
First time trying the Zinfandel and I will try again, beautiful colour, on the tongue all what you can find in a new world wine  plum oak black cherry.
Cheers!

Usually I don’t like Zinfandel as I find it too jammy and sweet but this one is definitely an exception! A quite green/ steamy glass with integrated ripe dark fruit and a nice palate. Not at all too sweet but actually a little tannic which works well and makes it a classy zin!

Aromas of deep concentrated black, red and green fruit. Very lush and layered aromas.
Palate is smooth, full and supple. Notes of jammy red and black fruit, slight vanilla. 

Very good if not slightly over stated Zinfandel from the legendary Camus family.

Deep purple.
Baking spices, blueberry/blackberry jam, generous vanilla, and smoke. Classic Caymus nose. Palate similar. Has a fig-like sweetness and peppery spiciness to it to the finish. Juicy acidity. Medium+ tannins. Smooth, but not velvety.

No surprises, but delivers what one would expect for a big bold Cali Zinfandel. Paired great with ox tail stew. 4.2⭐️.

Caymus is first and foremost a top Napa Cab Sav producer, but their founder Chuck Wagner was quite fond of Zin, and began  producing it in 1975. I imagine this was a favorite table red in the Wagner family and it’s a must try if you’re a Caymus fan. A high octane 14.8% fruit bomb with dominant notes of rum oak, vanilla, and black cherry cola. Built to enjoy and feel, more than to mull over, it’s tons of fun and a party favorite that will go with just about anything on the smoker. 92 points

This small production Zinfandel from the Wagner family is tasty and can only be found at the winery.

This wine has a dense ruby color with great depth. Effusive aromas of black cherry, plum, cocoa and blackberry stand out. 

This full bodied wine has good acidity and great balance. The palate is warm and inviting that demonstrates vivid flavors of dark berry, pepper spice, black cherry and licorice.

The creamy texture of this wine is enhanced by soft tannins and a warm toasty cedar finish. Try it. Enjoy!

One more wine from the epic lunch with the Spanish boys. 27/05/2017. 
This varietal has a very limited distribution as it is sold at the winery, UK, Canada and Mexico. This bottle was a gift from the importer and I gladly shared it with the boys. 
What a beautiful color, deep, almost purple, ripe black fruit, fig, plum, shy fig hints and mineral nuances. Structured, powerful, yet pleasant, integrated, smooth, solid finish. Surely this will evolve nicely in the bottle over the next 5-10 years.

A beautiful wine, Caymus delivers again. Concentrated and full bodied, yet nuanced and elegant. Intense flavours of raspberry jam, dark cherry, and vanilla dance around palate gracefully. Very nicely balanced; definitely not a Cali Zin alcohol bomb. 

Note: While this is a solid value for the price, the Rodney Strong Knotty Vines Zin is half the price and stands almost as tall! I'd like to try them side by side. Both have me hooked on Cali Zins as of late.

"Pretty" Zinfandel from a quality producer. Not too "over extracted" and not "just fruit and nothing else". Good balance and good "representative" of zinfandel what it's "right". Actually bought 6 btls (although a bit too expensive".

3,9🌟
Definitely one of the best Zinfandel that I have tasted for a long time!
Nose is intense with aromas of dark berries, plums, viol, spice, a splash of liquorice and vanilla.
Palate is highly concentrated and shows very good structure. Attack is intense and powerful and packed with notes of ripe strawberries, raspberries, spices, mocha and cedar. Bold and intensely fruity without being jammy.
Well balanced with nice acidity (for a Zinfandel) and a nice long intense finish.

Quite joyful, fruitful, and rather bold. The wine is deep colored, intense, aromatic and balanced. It does have a mild sweet note, ripe fruit comes to mind very little spices, and well structured tannins.

It was battle of the Big Cali Reds - tried both this Caymus Zin and the Orin Swift Papillon (a Bordeaux blend). First up - the Caymus. This is a smooth operator with very well integrated oak - delicious mocha, vanilla playing nicely with the ripe red fruit flavours. Mild tannins make this a great match with spicy food (we paired it with Jambalaya). Great weight and a long finish had me toying with bumping up to a 4.5. This is a re-buy for me.

Another jumy wine, a bid sweet but once a while very pleasant and easy drinking. A silky and fine, black cherries, raspberries, soft wood and soli loaded wine. Medium to full bodied, long and a fine structure .... Cheers buddies!

Wine #4 OK Vivino meet. 

Probably one of the nicer Cali Zin's I've tried. 

Deep ruby appearance. Bramble, black ground pepper, cherries and a hint of savoury delight. 

Dry, big plump tannin, bold body, high acid, med+ alcohol. This is a heater. Full and jammy, with salt, pepper and vanilla on the finish. 

Still super young and showing lots of signs it could go long.
Thank you Kasey
Great fruity flavor with v deep, rich color. Would buy again. Slaps
Unbelievable!!  First time I tried this wine and it was fantastic. Full body wine with notes of mocha, chocolat, vanilla. It was the king of the meal.
Delicious!!! I love the finish on this. Full bodied and smooth vanilla taste.
A full bodied yummy zin!
Extra bitter , lighter
Awesome wine for the price - big, juicy dark plums and jammy blackberries with notes of tar and earth. Rich and sensuous with velvety tannins and a long finish.

95p. 
Beautiful nose. Fruity and very aromatic. 
Sweet, balance, low acid, and mature fruits. One of the best Zinfandel/primo bottles I’ve ever had.
I haven’t had this for a couple years and it has aged nicely. Very smooth and rounded edges with great dark fruit flavor. The finish lingers for a long time too
What a surprise! I was so sure that this is Italy - and then it‘s Zin from the US. Fruitforward wine with a sweet note, but probably one of the better examples out there
We tried this at their winery, we cannot get it where we live. It was very good with nice dark berries and leather on the nose, good fruit and we'll balanced on the palate.
Best Zinfandel I have ever tasted. Powerful teddy bear of a wine with cherry, vanilla and oak - but now overly sweet. Really nice - would love to try again. Still young in the impression.
Black pepper and licorice, but sharp, almost inky. This could use a couple years I think. I'll have to go back to Caymus and get more! 👍

Medium-+ ruby color, raisins, dried plum on the nose. On the palate, plum, raisins, dried fruits, toasty, with medium body and medium+ tannin. Although it has 15.4% abv but you don't feel it at all. Very nicely made and balanced Zin!

So on zin night I thought I’d bring out the big guns. The Caymus zin is opulent and intense, but properly layered. On the nose this displays its prowess, but the palate is complex and interesting; the finish long, despite its undoubted power & concentration.
This is clearly a cut above your common or garden zin, but at £37 it’s not cheap. It has more flavour, but is not quite as good as a seghsio for me. Nevertheless this is a solid 4⭐️: I defy anyone to identify this as a zin blind! An experience for sure.

It's a really excellent wine. And even in a Zin format it's pure Caymus. Unmistakable.

It's dry (not too much)
It's a strong nose and strong first taste. You can taste the minerality and fruit.
Good acidity on the palate 

Way better value for money than their Cab at this price point. Ordered a case online from Caymus vineyard. Approx $40 a bottle including shipping. Can't complain about that

Everything is intense about this wine, colour, aromas and flavours. Deep purple coloured. A nose exuberant in aromas of black fruit, predominantly currants and plums but also blackberries and cherries. On the palate, a very distinctive fusion of black currant and pepper followed by cranberry, jammy prunes and notes of liquorice, vanilla, dark chocolate and sweet spices. The tannins are there and so  is the alcohol (15.4% ABV) but well hidden by the boldness of this wine. A long and persistent finish.

Wine tasting at Caymus and our host indicated this was mostly Zinfandel with some Petite Sirah. 

Black berries, plums, and oak on the nose.  This full bodied red has flavors of black fruit compote, raisins, vanilla, and black pepper.  Finish was peppery and extended, probably from the Petite Sirah chaser. 

For the price, this was our favorite red at the Caymus tasting.
Deep purple, red fruits, good structure, pairs great with spicy foods

Amazing!

Was very good. We have another bottle, and will get more
Big, heavy, concentrated syrup style zin.  Tons of fruit and sweetness.  Just needs more balance.
Super easy drinking. Almost too “plain” a Zinfandel. Leave it open well in advance to provoke some additional tannins
Silky, bold yet smooth, not acidic. Excellent with red meat. Cherry and vanilla undertones. Highly recommended.

I really like this Zinfandel 
Pretty bold a lot of hints of blackberry jam and plum.  A little on the sweeter side but a great wine for the price.
A sin not to try this zin!
This is my favourite Napa wine of all time. It is so smooth and fruit forward. Ripe red fruit flavours with a hint of vanilla

Fantastic wine. Hard to find in Calgary right now. If anybody sees this, please let me know.
Really smooth—not too sweet—excellent finish
Not a big zin fan going in - and then I had this. Beautiful.

Super fruity: black berries, current, etc on the noise. 

Smooth, fuller bodied. Very nice.
Fruit forward, long lasting, well balanced
Every sip gets better! Love how fruity the wine is.

Spices and earth front notes.
vanilla pepper blackberry
Very fruity, some oak, very smooth
Fruity, creamy, delicious.

My favorite zin. Smooth and delicious.
Bold and fruity!  Enjoyed with a nice thick rib eye after decanting for an hour.  Fabulous!
Incredibly smooth. Had it with steak and it paired perfectly. Love this wine.
fruity, dry but little too sweet
Very good, Wagner Zin.
Dark fruit, light spice, very smooth and delicious
Exceptional flavors without the pepper on the back end. Amazingly good!
One of my favorites from Napa Valley. 2007 vintage, drinking well now. Deep tones of blackberries, plum and other jammy notes. I look forward to owning the next bottle in a year's time.
Great!!!!!

Not bad.

Caymus Zin was my introduction to fine wine, back in 1992. Loved it then with rack of lamb, and it’s been my go-to Zin ever since. Only comes available periodically in Canada, which means I savour it every chance I get. You won’t be disappointed!

Black pepper, dark ripe fruits.  Everything that a zin should be and perfect for a weeknight.  The fact that you can only buy it from the vineyard (and that Chick Wagner started making it just because he wanted to drink it) makes it feel extra special.
So much hype around this wine. Not my preferred taste profile. Jammy and on the sweeter side with 8 g/s.

The Caymus Zinfandel is rich and bold. It’s almost the opposite of its more famous Cabernet Sauvignon cousin. But it is also highly enjoyable. Dark and deep red on the colour, and bursting of blackberry and plum and much dark fruit. Palate is happy. Have with a heavy meal. Was a great birthday wine :)

Been open for 24 hours. Nose is big dark big cherries and sweet blackberry, earl grey, soy sauce.  Taste follows nose. Nice acid cuts the sweetness from getting cloying. I thought this would be a sugar bomb but it’s not.

The colour is deep ruby and the nose shows hints of sweet/concentrated fruits like boysenberry and dark cherries. The body is medium to medium+ with a very round and smoot mouthfeel. For me a classic Zinfandel but with a little more finesse than usual.
I was impressed! This wine was really good. Fruit forward and jammy. Easy to drink. Paired with homemade pizza.

Very jammy - blackberry, plum, cherry. Juice bomb is an accurate description. Didn’t taste like a typical Zinfandel. 
$45
Just the best Zinfandel ever produced.
Good
Dark maroon, loooong legs. Big blackberries on the nose. Medium to heavy body. Big dark berries, medium and balanced tannins.
The first nose it resembles zweigelt. It's dry and the tannin fills up my whole mouth. I could taste dry plum and spice finish.

3.4🎄

Caymus Vineyards Zinandel '14 is not quite my type, but has a very interesting strong and fruity structure, kind of chewy with fresh fruits on it...
Jammy on the nose with dark fruits especially blackcurrants. Very dark garnet color and wonderful mouthfeel with light to moderate tannins.
This was surprisingly good. It was tough being compared to the rest of the tasting menu at the estate but came out as my second favourite.

Wonderful: Spice, dark berries, and vanilla. The Wagner’s make great wine.
The Caymus Cabernet Sauvignon is not worth 4 Conundrums; however, the Caymus Zinfandel is definitely worth 2 Conundrums.

Dark, rich purple, nose is rich with the scent of game and dried mission fig, luscious and enticing smell, so much sugar, overall balance with tannin and sugar is good with sugar outweighing a bit, full bodied. There is a coffee or mocha taste. The aftertaste intensifies the coffee or mocha taste.i love it
Don’t like Zinfandel usually but this one was very smooth and yet had a typical Zinfandel kick to it. Apparently the owners of Caymus winery love this one in particular.
An amazing sting to the end of the taste (spice). Would flavor well with a strong smoke (cigar) or cheese. A medium taste of wood, and a hint of natures bottom aromas

Again and again, brings us this opaque purpurene nectar highest drinking pleasure (TN 28/11/2015).

After an extensive meal with very illustrious wines, my older son suggested to end the evening with Caymus Zinfandel. Even the sweet dessert could not hurt him. He sat over everything and set furthermore accents. We all enjoyed it.

Beautiful dark, purple color...with legs that hang long to the glass. To the nose you can feel an explosion of prunes... For me... the best Zinfandel... but you have to bear with me... I am not an expert... :)

When we were in Napa, we had the good fortune to experience a Caymus private tasting with the wine maker himself. It was a sublime wine celebration as everything we tasted was more delicious than the last. One wine which really stood out was the 2007 Zin I am rating here today. We described it as a fruitsplosion then and even now, five years later, the wine still hasn't lost its power and fruitiness. It's delightfully fruit-forward, with a scrumptious touch of sweetness, and a palate-load of spice to match!
Absolutely incredible!  So much to say...just get it!!!
Very nice Zin. Lots of fruit not very spicy and extremely smooth as all Caymus wines are.

Amazing.  I forgot I had this for quite a few years.  This was like finding a $100 bill in your jacket a couple of years later.  A full bodied Zin — a blend from five different Zin vineyards, plus 21% Petite Syrah!  The Petite Syrah gives it that dark full inky feel, color and flavor.  Otherwise, a mild opening that evolves to cherry and pepper notes, then a mild tannin that leaves you wanting more.  I love Caymus!

Bro. Bro. If you like fresh, spicy vanilla, black cherry, cinnamon, nutmeg, and fresh rain smells all up in your nose, then you gotta try the Caymus Zinfandel, man. I'm gettin' some serious umami on the palette if you know what I'm sayin'. Full bodied, pungent vanilla, medium tannins, long ass finish up in here. DEE. RISH. USS. DRINK DIS!
Rich and rolling on  and on.

An amazing wine and one of the best values in Napa. Bursting with fruit, cherries, berries, a hint of tobacco and minerals.
4.25 Dark like the night. Blueberries, vanilla and spice. Grippy tannins and super fruity. Loooong.

Dark and powerful. Excellent wine, even though not quite as good as the Cabernet Sauvignon. Well worth the money and definitely a great wine.

A versatile Zinfandel with abundant fruit and good balance & long finish. I missed a bit more complexity and tannins. Enjoyed it with a medium rare top sirloin.
90. Very smooth, great color and very easy on the palate. This is a great Zin at a great price. Not distributed much, but can be purchased directly from Caymus.
Best wine for the price in Napa.  We've found it hard to get anywhere but the vineyard.  Drink any time with any food!  A touch syrupy but still outstanding.
Caymus is known as the Cadillac of Napa Cabs and I don't think their Zin's get enough attention. The 2008 is the best vintage they have produced thus far.
Deep violet colour. Red small fruits,  leather, chocolate.Very smooth texture. Medium body and high alcohol 15,5%. Seems like a soft Port or an Amarone.

Rich, velvety and reminiscent of grandma’s plum jam. Cedar cigar box and warm earthy notes on the palate with those wonderful black fruit notes rounding it out. Balanced, smooth and bold all at the same time! One of my faves vintage after vintage 😊

Very smooth and delicate 🍷🍷
Fruity, yet quite elegant.
Loads of sunblessed ripe black and dark berries; cherries and blackcurrant.
Vanilla, chocolate and black/dark fruits.
Very pleasant and drinkable 👏🙂🍷🍷

👍 ES90. Mostly Zinfandel with a touch of Petit Sirah from old vines, St Helena, Napa Valley. 17m French and US oak (75% new). As expected some sweetness at the end. 14.8% alcohol. Clube Mistral 1/2021. Cheers🍷🇺🇸!!!

This is a ripe, jammy jam jam fruit bomb made in the style of their iconic Cabernets. It’s great crowd pleaser at a party - not their best IMO, and certainly not my fav. One note and overly sweet. Go get a Zin from Ridge or J Dusi
Been buying the Caymus Zin since 2016. Order by the case and treasure each bottle. We are currently in  Napa and picked up the Zin and Cab! Big, bold and goes well with steaks. One of my favorites!
For the price point, this wine is as good as it gets. Full bodied, fruit forward, hints of vanilla. Packed with flavor but so smooth. Would be great paired with a big meaty dinner!

Rich bold flavours.  Very Good.

Bold, fruity, pure Caymus awesomeness. Unfortunately, this wine isnt really distributed. You would have to get it at the winery.
Full bodied, medium texture, great aftertaste, go nicely with cheese

Amazing Zin! From the start, this wine hits your tastebuds with rich blackberry tart and black-pepper spices. Yet, it ends with smooth flavors of vanilla and caramel. Medium body. Medium tannins. Would definitely buy if I found it again!

Delicious, very fruity and well rounded.

Smooth as silk! Aromas were a little on the soft side, yielding some red fruits and florals. Palate showed lots of red fruits and some hints of spice. Maybe a little past its peak, did not have the presence I come to expect of a Caymus Zin. Certainly did not drink as nice as the 13' Cab we had to follow it. Still a beautiful wine.

No WSET discription: Deep purple-black in color, the 2015 Zinfandel springs from the glass with lifted crème de cassis, violets and chocolate box notes plus hints of lilacs, raspberry leaves, anise and cardamom. The perfumed black fruit preserves and chocolate-laced notes completely pack the full-bodied palate, with soft, velvety tannins and just enough freshness, finishing very long and very spicy. Definitely one for hedonists seeking immediate gratification. Cheers my dear Vivino Friends! 🍷🍷🍷🍷

Accidentally purchased a second tasting of this today. Found it to be a touch more minty/herbal as the last time I rated this wine and more 'artificial' is flavour. However, STILL VERY NICE. 89 pts, though

Visual: dark plum, consistent, thin legs grace the edge of the glass

Nose: mashed berry fruit, blackberry and blueberry, cocoa, chocolate powder, with nuances of oak.

Palate: Nice blend of berry fruit and spice and soft acidity and silky tannins. Some hint if chocolate.  

Overall: this wine still drinks nicely.  Everything is blended and the palate follows the nose.  Moderate finish.  Very solid all the way around.  Enjoyed with grill fajitas on a 90 degree day in Indy. Cheers!

wife (who loves zin) is half a star or maybe a full star above me here.   dark, dark burgundy color followed by dark, dark fruit. (i’m not even sure what fruit that is but it’s deep and ripe and pretty sweet.)  some mocha, vanilla and chocolate next with graphite finish.  pretty pronounced alcohol throughout.  good stuff.  just not my speed.

The epitome of zinfandels. I do not think I need to have a single more in my entire life. This was it my friends. Au Revoir Zinfandel. And I mean it with the best grace and most sincere of Regards. 🙋🏻‍♂️

Gushes with rich and powerful fruit. Offers aromas of wild berry, jammy macerated cranberries, nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla.  Thick, juicy, concentrated and powerful, but doesn't​ feel too hot, despite the potency.

Lovely...what can I say - it's caymus. Although not easily found, we bumped into it at a Costco in Cabo San Lucas Mexico, so we bought it. It continues evolving over a 2 hour period ultimately displaying the bright fruit the Wagners do so well. Delicious.

Red cherry and strawberry jam. Vanilla, new oak, baking spices. This is a wine that is much more balanced than the 2011 and the 2012, which had 15.8% alcohol. This is a much more reasonable 14.6% and it shows.

Great zin but depends on the year you drink it.  This year the wine mellowed on tannins and gave great pepper and spice notes.  In last 2 years it was way off with huge tannins and not much else.  Wonderful example of an evolving wine since we bought a case in 2010 and had 1 bottle/yr

4.2🌟 Finally had a chance to try this tonight with my beau at our Valentine's dinner. 
vanilla blackberry plum pepper cherry raspberry dark fruit.

This smelt like wet dog big time! Mind you there was no decant time with this, so that could be why.  It went away and had more of a jammy scent...grape jam.

Big fruity flavours, a hint of oak, and big tannins.  Mouth feel was heavy and the finish was long.  I think this still needs time to develop those complex flavours and with the current structure I feel like it can handle a other 5 years.

A bit over the top in my view; too much fruit and sweetness. Very dark purple red color is evident. Bombastic red fruits on the nose, some forest scents and licorice. Sweet in the mouth, smooth tannins. Can easily be enjoyed alone, otherwise to be paired with heavy meat dishes.

Went to the Caymus Vineyard for some Cabernet, left with some Zinfandel. Unbelievably good wine for $40. I could drink bottle after bottle. I’ll have to update this review with tasting notes when I pop the next cork, but I’ll leave you with this: Chuck W himself used to say, “Sell the Cabernet, drink the Zinfandel”. Exceptional value at $44 dollars a bottle. I truly hope this review doesn’t go viral because honestly, I want it all to myself.

Definite dark fruit, almost stewed. Luscious, full mouth feel. Jammy, oak and raisins. 1/2 the price of the Caymus Cab but 75% as delicious. Fabulous value for a bold, tamed tannin, with velvet like texture and a Californian label of Caymus stature. Go for it, you can’t go wrong.

A very tasty zin. All the zin flavor without the heat of most zins... especially zins this young. I drank this alongside the Caymus Cabernet (Napa... not Special Selection). Very similar flavor profile with soft tannins and vanilla but at half the price. One of my favorite zins (alongside Brown Estate Chaos Theory and many Ridge offerings).

Aromas of ripe, baked fruit, mocha and subtle sweet spice leap from the glass after about an hour in the decanter. The rich dark red/purple hue is a foreshadowing for the smooth, full viscosity on the black currant, chocolate covered bing cherry palate. Brilliantly integrated tannins make this a perfect pairing for a salt crusted tenderloin smothered in mushrooms or just a really big glass:).
