96RP/ An intense Nebbiolo aged for 36m in French & Slovanian oak shows a fine bouquet and delicate notes of violets and balsamic with hints of coffee and peppercorn.
2015 vintage. Decanted for a while. Nose has leather earth and oak. Bold but a bit lighter than you would expect. Black dark cherry, tannic, dry some floral notes.

Perfume nose with lots of red fruit. Typical Barolo scent.

Palate less tannic than usual young Barolo and quite light to be honest. Need 2 hours+ in a decanter to open.
Perfumed nose with floral aroma,  balanced tastes of cherry, leather, truffles,  and acacia, with subtle notes of balsamic and tar, long aftertaste, elegant finish, went well with lamb chop
Sweet

Quite full on… a firm but pliant core of sweet melting asphalt scented violet like black fruits with a noble elegance and refinement. Lots of sweet, light cherry. Has a high acidic kick. Youthful, fragrant and generous.

A great young barolo with a lot of potential to become fantastic with some more years in the cellar. Even when its very enjoyable to drink now as a young barolo it really deserve some more years (4-8) to fully bloom, develope and soften the tannins.

On the nose young red fruit, raspberries, oak and truffles.

On the palate an classic barolo with prime notes of raspberries, cassis, cherry and subtile tones of leather and licorice.

A really good Barolo overall! Decanter well ahead before serving! Cheers! 🍷

Classic Barolo (100% Nebbiolo) from Piedmont, Italy. Spontaneous fermentation in steel for 12-15 days. Aging 36 months in French oak barrels and Slavonian, then 6 months in bottle. Notes of violet, cassis, cherry, raspberry, toasted almond, balsamic and a little menthol. Good tannins, bright acidity. Good to drink now, but it will be better in a few years

Barolo from vinyards from Verdunno (MGA´s Compasso, Pisapola, Riva Rocca, Boscatto, Rocche del´Olmo) and in Monforte (MGA Gramolere)
Appearance: ruby red, medium intens/pale  clear.
Nose: developing, medium intens. Aromas of sour cherry, roses, tar, violet, liquorice. 
Palate: dry, medium intens, medium (+) acidity, medium body, medium tannins, medium finish. Aromas of undergrowth and peppery touch.
Assesment: very good wine.  Too young to drink.

It is showing fantastic character but probably still needs time. After opening for 2 hours it made sense to invite to dinner. Getting garnet in the glass, cola and tobacco, seems like a sauce that could reduce a little more. This will be awesome awesome later on

4+ A nice Barolo from a great vintage, not some white Burgundy that Vivino mismatched in many of the others’ ratings. My second vintage from this producer.

Medium garnet color. Moderate floral and earthy nose. Dry, medium-bodied, a bit tannic and acidic. Flavor of red fruit, chocolate and licorice.

Drank over a few days. Good length. Decent balance, complexity and intensity. Good but not as great as highly rated by critics. Could improve over time though.
Very dry, sucks the moisture right out your mouth and leaves it like a finger that’s been in water too long. Peppery on the nose, dry oak after taste.
Slightly rusty appearance. Lifted, spicy nose of bark and… spearmint? It is nearly as interesting in the mouth. Good structure: acid, length and not a little alcohol.
Another Barolo to end the weekend with Italian friends. Again very young and still closed but with solid potential. Twigs, tannins, menthol, young red fruit,  leather & cedar
Great and good
Took some time to open up. Probably could age more.

3.7

Pale garnet in color. 

High aroma intensity w/ black cherry, rose petal, leather, blackberry, licorice, oak & some dried herbs including white pepper.

Simple & fruit-forward nose wasn't impressive but its jammy but refreshing characters made enjoyable & harmonious nose feel.

M+ bodied & dry on the palate showing jammy black & blue fruits w/ some dried herbs. 
Little artificial sweetness at the aftertaste.
M+ tannin in sticking texture & M+ refreshing acidity. 
Alcohol was not properly controlled.

So young but the accessibility is completely fine as is. Strong cherry notes, almost like a candied cherry syrup, ripe strawberry mushroom, hazelnut, and tar, a fresh rose petal almost like a rose petal syrup, nutmeg, licorice,

Parsons Green, dinner

Berry Bros - work wine tasting

Looks light like a Pinot Noir.

Cherry, red fruit.

High acidity, high tannins although slightly slower.
Fruits quite muted so not full, rounded mouth-feel.

The style I like but it is not really like Barolo more like Barbaresco 

Dry, medium to light body, elegance lingering tannin, medium acidic 

Elegance  red fruit nose with  licorice vanilla. On the palate  earthy red fruit vanilla black cherry

A Barolo made with blend of six vineyards, aged for three years in oak, medium burgundy in color with nose of incense, smoke, bing cherry, cranberry, raspberry, pomegranate, and mineral, it is very tannic now and rather closed, definitely needs more time to soften up, medium body with high acidity, tastes of hibiscus, maraschino cherry, cranberry, clove, anise, and black tea, finishes with quite a bit is warm spices, cinnamon, nutmeg and white pepper.

Oh, this was the 5th wine in last night's wine dinner. I can see it's quite elegant but surely it's the wrong time to open a Barolo. Pure and clear cherry beginning that exudes oaky and vanilla elements.

A very good barolo. As always a bit expensive. I was surprised with the bad rating and I see a lot of bad reviews for this wine but I checked carefully and most of the people have scanned some whites from burgundy that they didn’t like. It’s a pity for the winemaker. Be careful which wine you rate.

Densely packed and tight on the 1st day and more mellow on the second day after plenty of air and that’s when the bright cherry and blackcurrant favours shine and strut itself. This would need another 3 years if you can’t wait 2 days to drink it. Either way is gonna be so good.
Awesome. My first time having this particular Barolo and loved it. Cherries, earth, vanilla, dry, and balanced tannins. Very tasty wine.
Great Barolo. Thyme, semi sun dried tomatoes and newly clipped grass. Medium bodied. Semilong finish. Dry with nice acidity and tannins.
I really like this entry level Barolo. Easy drinking and not too heavy. I will hunt out more vintages. Paired equally well with Roast Chicken and spaghetti Bolognese last week.
Great light all round everyday wine for most occasions. Usually a Tuscany fan but this was a refreshimg experience.
Gorgeous ruby red color. A lot of cherry and both white and black pepper come through before a big hit of smokey oak tannins. Very dry in the mouth.

Nose: Red fruit, vanilla, and leather.
Palate: Raspberry.
Att: Velvet tannin, red fruit, and tobacco.

Straight after opening, the aromas are dominated by earth dust and chalk with red cherry and red plum notes on the background. The palate reveals black pepper, clove, touches of leather, tar and a lingering espresso note.
After a while, the fruit starts taking more prominence with violet notes also coming through. It is nice to experience how it evolves. The tannins are still firm, but not overpowering. Dry, high acidity, high alcohol, full body pronounced intensity, med+ finish.
Very good Barolo!

Amazing Brunello at All’Amarone in Venice! Tastes as part of a tasting of Tuscan wines then bought a bottle. It could use a little more age, but it is ready to drink now. Nose of leather, earth, and a little blackberry. Nice and dry and excellent paired with fatty meats and strong cheese. Great long finish, starting with notes of blackberry, vanilla, and oak, then drying out significantly with plenty of earth and spice.

Aroma of cherry and cassis with mushroom and more red fruits on the palate. Decanted for 2hrs, and the wine has softened but tannins is still grippy, although not harsh. This still hv plenty of life left despite being a entry-level barolo. I enjoyed it very much.

We really liked this Barolo. 4 1/2 hour decant

👁 Light to medium ruby

👃 Black cherry, red cherry, leather, tar, rose hip  and licorice

👅 Black cherry followed sour cherry then rose hip, licorice and leather with a tannic tar and black tea 

🥘 Game hen in a mushroom sauce with mushroom and Gorgonzola risotto
Fruity, powerful, intense, very heavy taste, dark ruby color. Time to drink this one, don't wait too long. Doesn't need to air a lot.
Abit of a playfull barolo. Classic barolo notes but ends with a smooth flavour. Pour in a caraffel and let it open up for atleast and hour.
Needed a Nebbi, so turned to old faithful, Barolo.. a lot of walnut in this banger! Cherry and walnards for the win! Recommended
Enjoyed this Barolo very much.. complex with strong notes of pears and berries.. paired well with truffle pasta and strong cheese for dessert
Fifth pairing at Frasca. Rich cherry, licorice, and mushroom nose. Clear ruby color. Dried cherry, earth, and well integrated tannins that disappear when paired with the right food. (2018)
Tasted at the Monvigliero, Verduno -tasting.
(3.9) Speed tasting. No further comments, sorry!
earthy leather cherry red fruit
With beef tenderloin and sweet potato
Gotta love Barolo. Wonderful perfume on nose, it's dream like. Blackcurrants, red fruit, little leather. Have a bottle why not!
Light hearted aromatics and a deadly serious palate of merciless acidity and tannin. Has decades in the tank. Drink now to 2040. 4.3/5.
My wife would go mad for this! Really elegant, great balance, quite a lot of tannins, but a cracker.

Excellent Barolo by giovanni rosso got this from BBR with their own label a nice lighter one very soft on the nose loads of floral and spice  notes with herbs too the tannins here were still sharp earlier and did soften up later the lenght is a perfect medium 👌 my kind of barolo 😋 Bravo giovanni 👏

Fratelli Alessandria Barolo 2016
Far too early to drink - was totally committing infanticide! A nose of floral, rose, herbs and mint - quite floral. On the palate, it’s got black cherries, allspice, mint, clove, spice, white pepper, orange. It’s elegant with good concentration of flavour, with a sweet round finish. However it’s not a intense and dark flavour bomb but a more elegant and light style. 93/100 for now with some upside. Can’t wait to try it tomorrow (have some left).

Solid Barolo with a very classic profile. The tannins are very tight still, and it’s dominated by tart red fruit acidity with very nice notes of pine, underripe raspberry, violet, and pomegranate juice. Needs some time in the cellar, but this is very nice. 93 points

This is great stuff, elegant and rough at the same time but also tightly knit. Day 2 it opens up and show elegant fruit, forest strawberries, red cherries, raspberries, almonds some orange zest and roses. Great nose!! Palate still somewhat weaker but great anyway; fruit driven with wonderfully rough tannins giving texture, structure and length. And working beautifully with fruit and tannins, the acidity! I think this will be a real beauty in ten years.
Really enjoyed this port. Apparently it's a special blend that Berry Bros create with Symington. Less sweet and less smokey jammy for a port. Very quaffable.
Welcoming aroma. The first mouthful was initially a bit thinner than I expected, but it grew in the mouth. Rounded, fruity and smooth. Great lingering aftertaste.
Approachable in youth.  Thoroughly delicious, structured, fresh and savoury at the same time.  No blockbuster but drinking well right now.

Medium Ruby coloured.

On the nose currants, liquorice, tobacco and leather.

On the palate full bodied with silky tannins, great complexity and a long elegant finish.
Dark dark red. Scent of spring flowers ,violets, jasmine and cherry. Licorice and spice with a woody pithy flavour. Dry tannins. Very good with more to come!

Medium ruby color with a little brick color included from almost 7 year old of 2013 vintage.

Intense and rich aromas of leather, cassis and berries. Clear layered flavors with astringency well.

Bought at BBR retail shop for £33.75 with original price of £45.

Good value Barolo. On initial pour this has zero nose, clearly needs quite a few more years in the cellar. Oak came out after a couple of hours. Clear light red colour. Dried cherries, earthy, dry, with a moderate tannic finish. The tannins intensified after swallow. Really good with the meal.

A good entry level Barolo. It has a darker than usual color. The nose is classic tar and roses but the mouth feel is a little watery and the tannins are not as prominent as I like. It benefits from decanting. As it opens the tannins come forward. Leather and tobacco are forward with raisin and spice close behind. I would be happy to pay $40 for this; I was a bit disappointed with the high mark up at the restaurant.

Smell of peaches, caramel and bit of oak along with flowery spring aroma   Tannine yet smooth alcoholic taste.  Pleasent satisfying body and good aftertaste.   Will add again to cellar definately quite soon.
It’s got some great aromas and fruit but the tannins are hard. It might have needed more air, but I doubt it. I think it needed more time in the bottle.
Big tannins, red fruit with black pepper
You’ve gotta love it.
Ripe cherries, sweet tar. Some sweetness. Tannins less than the other two tasted. Has some red candy notes to it. Easier to drink than most barolos.
Dark, dry, and beautiful
Yep! Light oak and delicious.
cassis, a bit of leather and very elegant, driven by the high acidity
Fruity and light Barolo following a tortiglioni rigati con salsicha. Loved the Italian restaurant more then the wine.
From seven different plots but mainly from Verduno. Very elegant but a bit closed, I think it will have to rest some more in the cellar. More dark fruit then red. 3.7⭐️ Drink 2022-2032

Pretty classic barolo. 

Liked it on the nose, with rose and violets, some dark chocolate and ripe cherries and blackcurrants. Shrubs. 

Palate: cherries, finish a bit short, tannins are a bit raw.

A very distinctive vintage for Barolo, very floral and delicate with supple tannins and marked acidity. Aromas of rose, red cherries, tobacco and earth. A bit closed needed to decant longer than just 30min. I would really like to taste this again with 5 more years in the bottle.

A great experience, my first Barolo, strong red fruit black currant , ripe black cherries on the nose, also a musty earthy mushroom like but pleasant aroma that follows through on the mouth, strong tannins and crisp acidity. Definitely decant at least 40 minutes.

Wonderful leathery nose, ripe fruits, cassis, plums, white pepper, a hint of wild mushrooms, depending on the glass (I personally would use a cab glass). Quite full bodied, with a wonderful blend of cassis, plums, liquorice, dark berries, cloves, herbs, leather, Mediterranean towards Middle Eastern perfume (if you haven't gotten to this stage yet, you're drinking it too fast). The length is so enticing, like a rough brute, yet undefinably subtle in a way, and refined in another...

I read Thor's TN of this Barolo and it was like something that will perfectly fit for tonight's evening. Great bottle indeed. Passed it many times while shopping, and finally tried it. What a beautiful sample of wine craft - have no idea it is new or old style, pardon mine lack of experience in Barolo (I bet on old), its captiving warm smell, balance and sensual taste delivers so much pleasure. Color: Ruby, with a slight tinge of brick

Smell: tar, black cherry, violet, black cranberry, tobacco, black pepper, black raspberry

Taste: tar, black cherry, violet, tobacco, black pepper, woody, leather, tobacco

Stats: dry, medium plus acidity, high tannins (not yet round), medium plus ABV, medium body, medium plus intensity, medium plus finish

Very good, needs to age
Lighter than traditional borolo

This is a fabulous Barolo in the making. The structure is a little rough at this point but I like that once in a while - why should everything be so polished?The young fruit is mixed with savory notes to give a quite complex wine with classic nebbiolo attributes: Cherries, rose perfume, violets, leather, camphor, orange zest, and sage. The palate is bright and shining, intense, and impeccably balanced. I love the style of Fratelli Alessandria. Drink or hold - you will enjoy it either way!

A good start in the eye: rubi-garnet color that unfolds into wild berries, cherries over floral layers and notes of cedar and licorice for a complex nose. Balanced in mouth, assertive tannins that lead to a spicey palate and a hint of tobacco over the fair finish.

This is really great. Light with a slight brickish tinge. Intense nose of spiced fruit and leather. Grainy tannins that are a bit overpowering at first but mellow nicely in the glass to leave an impressive structure and a long sweet finish

Traditional red with residue in the glass. Ripe Raspberry and blackberry on the nose.  The taste is balanced with a tart cherry and earthiness

Well balanced, tannic and bold! Berries and apples - plus a hint of wood, tabacco  and vanilla. Pair with a good cut of red meat or strong cheese.

Strong tobacco e some spices. Short finish. The color is nice, red brick, even if only 5 years old.

4.35/5.00. Friday nite ‘Rona wine. I’ve been trying to learn more about Nebbiolo recently, so this was the 1st bottle that I tried from a recent half-case that I bought. C: Medium(-) Garnet. N: Notes of rose petal, cherry, leather and herbs. P: Palate is reflective of the nose along with licorice and a hint of vanilla (back palate). Medium(+) bodied with high acidity and elegant tannins. Decanted for ~5 hours and paired nicely with pizza. Seems to be a classic Barolo (from what I understand)!

A generous gift of a generous wine which will have more to give over the next 5-10 years. Floral on the nose with liquorice and cassis on the palate; well structured with chewy tannins and medium acidity, this wine is made to last.

Needs time. Youthful muscle + over-keen character. People talk about over-bearing tannin in young Barolo/Barbaresco. For me it’s more about lack of layering + generosity. They don’t unfold in youth.

3.5+ 100% Nebbiolo grapes. Traditional winemaking in steel tanks with maceration fo 12-15 days. Maturation for 36 months in large Slavonian oak barrels (20 - 40 hl) and for two in steel tanks before bottling. Further 6 months in the bottle before the release. Deep ruby red color. Nose of rose, violet, little red fruits and herbs hints. In the mouth it has a medium concentration with an elegant texture. Not so tannic and balanced enough. Persistent final. Obviously with further cellar it should improve.

Bought this at the winery in 2010. Old style Barolo making here. Big Slovenian botte. This is the base Barolo of the winery. Already I nice specimen. Typical aroma of flowers  and vanilla accompanied by fresh cherry fruit. Taste is very round. Acids are still very present making it lively. Tannines are soft making it at perfect drinking status at the moment. You could leave it for some additional years to get more secondary and tertiary flavours. But I like it like it is. Looking forward to open the Cru Bar

95% Syrah/5% Viognier. Deep garnet colour, purple rim. Powerful aromas of violet, thyme, cocoa, candied red and dark fruits, light prune & almond. New wood. Meaty aromas and "masculine" character. Less spices than expected. Strong and impressive concentration and tannins.

L&W Rhone Tasting. 1y6.
C: Med+ purple
N: Med+ intense cassis, plum, violet, cream, oak, pepper & smoke. Med complex, med+ clarity.
P: Cassis, cream, vanilla -> violet, graphite, herbs, exotic spices -> blueberry, plum & oak. Med+ length & acid, med conc, bod & subtle soft tannins. Surprisingly good, very soft texture, typical perfumed floral cote rotie nose, good length & acidity. Good QPR for cote rotie at £30. Very approachable. Best 2023-2028. 90p.
A wine that is perfectly French and exemplifies the cote rotie style of depth and finesse. Light at 12.5% yet bursting with flavours and musty old world tones
100 % Syrah (I miss the floral lift that the Viogner can provide). Not Jammy but really elegant. Red and black bramble fruit with hints spice. Pre Christmas treat
Lush and complex it's a great easy going French Syrah aged in oak for 15 months it's needs a little time to breathe but opens up fantastically after 20-40 minutes
Excellent bouquet of black berries associated with soft tannins nice minerality and long finish. Still super young and should decant 30min at least.
1999 Côte-Rôtie 20 years on tasting at Rijsel Restaurant, Amsterdam. What a start. Fresh tobacco, cigar even, cool graphite, as in pencil shavings. Hint of spice. Fresh as a daisy
Opaque dark garnet colour. Gorgeous perfumed evolved nose of tapenade, violets and saddle leather.  Spicy, dark fruit with pronounced tannin kept in check by high acidity.  Lovely, complex wine!
Extremerly mellow and round wine. Highly reccomended.
Excellent !

Very young still but, great CR for its age. Lots of dark fruit and deep earth and leather notes. Balance in acidity and tannins. Will probably develop into a fantastic mature wine given s few more years at least.

À Côte Rôtie of my taste. Drinking this wine after a good aging process will reveal the uniqueness of wines that are made of strong humours and very delicate bodies. If you like classic example of this appellation, the style of this producer is for you. The kind of style that makes the winemaker's name disappear in favor of a well balanced wine when ready. The nostalgia of drinking wines instead of names is invading me today 🍷🍷🍷

Dark fruit on the nose, along with that lovely smoky character that is typical of the appellation. Ripe and pleasant tannins in the mouth, along with a pleasing and gentle acidity. Being subtle in the mouth, it’s one to enjoy with food or just by itself. Subtle earthy notes in the mouth too.

Blind tasting fun at Morrell Wine-Jura + Zach guessed Cab Franc-apparently they think I am evil at bringing difficult wines 😀 Double decanted 1hr, this revealed balsamic notes, dried tart cherries, dried plums, hints of old leather, smoke + cooked raspberries. There was some debate as to the alc content-Nat guessed about 14%, no one else thought it was that high. No notes of pepper/much typicity suggests this is on decline but still very enjoyable due to complexity. 

1 bottle left Andy- hope u can visit!!

My first Cote Rotie. Higher acid and lighter bodied than the California and Washington Syrah’s I’m used to drinking. Pepper nose, but with Blackberry and Leather flavors. The finish is nice and pronounced. Great wine!

still definitely a baby but very integrated, elegant, with nose of typical smell of vines, raspberry, black pepper. 
mouth is integrated, smooth over the palate. the power comes after but not to strong. beautiful acidity tells you to wait for 2-4 more years. very good stuff !!!
I am not sure that the wine was in a good shape due to conditions of storage. there was no wow effect, but quality is on a level
Wonderful and with dark plums and blackberries

Bernard is a traditionalist; fermentation & malo takes place in foudres before 18m in barriques (20% new). 100% Syrah. A more expressive ripe & fragrant nose than the 13 with ample upfront black (blackberry) & red (cherry) fruit. Med+ aroma intensity with slight floral/herbal notes (violet/thyme). Dry. Really rich with dense med+ tannins & complex rich black fruits (cassis, blackberry). Good integration of med. acidity. Fine balance & med+ finish. IMHO, the packaging doesn't do justice to this v. good wine.

Young wine in my head, but good.  Fruit forward medium bodied medium acidity soft tannins.  Blackberries, cherries, the usual suspects with syahs.  A little smokey with soft floral notes in a long lengthy finish.

Leather odor hits you first. After aerization, spices enchance black cherry aromas. Gradually, subtle floral & herbal notes of oregano & lavender revealed. Strong acidity, rich yet velvety tannins, full body. Typical syrah palate; pepperish, spicy, meaty, not missing the fruit. So fresh & young, with great potential.

Quite barolo like initially. Changed a lot and benefited from a long decant. Quite familiar taste of rich black fruits. But this clearly very good, and very well "made" wine. Great balance and length, and a leathery savoury quality along with some pepper. Not 'wild' like I'd read about some cote Rotie. Elegant

First brush with Cote rôtie in 2016. Brief note from memory. Inviting nose with ripe blackberries and lovely floral violet tones. Suave medium bodied palate, really fresh and nice balance. Went down a treat!

After a mini hiatus wine was required tonight (medicinal purposes). 
I have to say I’m a little disappointed by this. Decanted for 90 mins; overtly acidic for the next, which upset the balance & got off to a poor start. Note to self: lots of air required!
After eventually settling, this became more pleasant, with some dark fruit showing, but still a slightly tart palate & finish not particularly memorable. 
I’m not sure if this needs time or just doesn’t quite suit my tastes.

For once I am with the program, Rhône Tuesday is it? A value producer with no budget for graphic designer, this 09 (one of the best vintage from last decade) delivers! Deep burgundy color, initial floral notes of dried rose petal, germanium, violet, followed by stewed spicy plum, nutmeg, soft new leather, damped forest floor, roasted chestnut, charcuterie, black cherry, currant, cassis, hibiscus, red vine licorice, dried cranberry and quince paste, white pepper & tart black cherry finish, long and elegant.

4.5 A superb aged Cote-Rotie from small producer Bernard Burgaud.  Bernard made his first vintage in 1982 and makes 1,000 cases from 22 acres from the Les Moutonnes and Cote Blonde vineyards.  Massive nose of pure barnyard, tar, iodine, smoked meat, leather, dark chocolate.  Love the intensity and concentration of the nose.  The finish is great, very light acidity with a consistent mid palate and light tannins.

More WSET3 notes.

Medium+ intensity of black cherry, blackberry, eucalyptus, pepper, wet leaves and vanilla.

It is dry, medium acidety, and Bang! high intensity exploding in the mouth, fully curved body, and adding leather, game and tobacco in the mix.

Fully developed.

Can drink now, suitable for ageing.

Traditional style Cote Rotie. A very well integrated rhone with all the gritty earthy funky meaty layers the terroir has to offer, but kept under control by well-balanced tannins and acidity, resulting in a complex quaff with lots of finesse. Can’t wait to see what this wine shows over the coming years.

One of my New Year’s Eve wines was somewhat disappointing. Definitely too early to drink, but still somewhat unimpressive. Promises on the nose with blackberry, mint, smoke, meat, tar, tobacco. Full body, high alcohol, high tannins and high acidity. Muted fruit and aromas in the finish, with mostly herbal tones coming out. Lacks the seductive aromas of other Cote Roties.

This is tastes a very young Cote Rotie! Seems higher alcohol than on the label, which fades once decanted for a decent amount of time. 
Deep ruby, medium bodied, high acid, dry, med- tannins, med+ finish, med intensity. 
Black fruit, granite, slate, black pepper, stalk, mint, savoury notes, meat and leather. I didn’t get a lot of oak coming through contrary to other reviews.

Simple one. Pepper, blackcurrant and violet (probably stems) in aroma, quite flat. Taste is better balanced with additional chocolate and allspice notes. High acidity, medium tannins and medium finish.

17 months ago Andy Barker reviewed the '12 & so much of what he wrote applies to this. Obviously this is more mature & '06 is not as good a vintage so there are some differences: this has a slight metallic tang on the mid-palate &, unsurprisingly, I get less fruit on the nose & more of the white pepper so typical of the appellation; there's also aniseed. The dominant tastes are of blueberries & brambles with med acidity & med tannins. I think this is at or just past its peak. AB's right about the labelling!

I was surprised at how underwhelming this wine was to me. Lacked the power and aroma expected from a Côte‑Rôtie but considering Côte‑Rôtie is generally expensive and requires years of bottle age to be ready for drinking, I think it has potential. The wine did evolve slowly over a few hours in the glass, opening up to a bouquet of dark fruits and light spice but I had to work to get the aroma to my nose and generally one would expect a Côte‑Rôtie to jump out at you. Worth a try once.
Won this at an auction. Box of 12 ! Just an amazing example of cote roti! The boys wine group voted this number 1. Truly majestic ✨
Oak and some white pepper on the nose. Heavy on the palate but with some acidity on the tongue that doesn't match the feel to me.
pepper leather blackberry earthy black fruit
Black fruit, complex nose, spicy. White pepper and nutmeg. Chocolate, cedar wood. Well balanced, elegant. Smooth tannines.
A perfect Côté Rotie. Still young for its age, with intense black fruits flavor, spicy and with some earthy notes. Long finish, good balance, a wine to enjoy quietly.
Well made wine, very balanced. Doesn't bring anything special thought, especially when taking the price into account.
Classic Cote Rotie. With some time in n the decanter this wine opened up and was singing. Lifted aromatics and spicy fruit.

Not really a good year, but a good producer. Ruby red, maybe a touch of terra-cotta at the edges, sediments. Open, with scents of blackberry, mushrooms, cedar three and a touch of smoke. Opened six hours before dinner. Much more typical than the Chapoutier, almost everyone got to northern Rhone on this. Such a staunchly traditionalist wine to the point of being agricultural, old school winemaking that someone quite accurately described as straight from soil to glass. Fading fruit, best to drink up.

This elegant and aromatic expression of Syrah from the northern Rhône is an excellent example of a Côte Rôtie. Tons of ripe black fruit, bursting with a balance of crisp acidity and round tannins. While 1998 was not the best year for wines from this region, this particular example is quite the exception. With some air and a proper decanting, this wine will soften its “Bretty” nature and reveal the aforementioned fruit. Pairs classically with duck, or other mild game birds. Avoid with seafood or acidy dishes

A great value wine!  The nose is very open and expressive, with notes of black olives, smoke and smouldering embers in the fire, violet flower petals and black truffle. The palate is very nicely held together.  It shows acidity and structure, extract and grip. It has a lean disposition, compounded by a tart apple-skin note, but this does not dominate the texture and substance of the wine. It has a very well defined finish.
Light but fruity. Elegant.
Strong barnyard/savory herbs/charred meat- perfect Rhône style. A little blunt but showing no age at 17yrs.

Fontanafredda vertical tasting with Wine Exchange Asia. WOTN for me.

A very elegant wine that pulls off an incredible juggling act, with everything in perfect balance. Wild strawberry, dried fig, wet leaves and brown cap mushroom, black tea, new aromas from every angle. Quite light-bodied on the palate at first blush but you then get hit with a freight train of tar, kirsch, cinnamon and anise on the long finish. Still plenty of acidity, long lingering finish. Great wine.
In the middle of a number of very tasty Barolos among many other fine Italian wines
What a treat !!❤️

Medium body, slightly fuller body than the other vintages. More complex on the nose with clear notes of mushrooms. Somewhat strong acidity on the palate. Long finish. Best vintage in a 10-year vertical, even compared to 2016, maybe because of the age

What it lacks in nose it makes up for in smoothness. Light and fruity but not robust enough to hold its own with a heavy meal. Earthy and light, expensive and while not an outstanding value never a disappointment.

Great wine and that still after 20 years. Smoky notes from the oak wooden casks dominate over the fruitiness of the wine. Little touch of spiced black fruit. Nice acidity. Slight touch of leather. I think that after 20 years it still stands tall.

Brick coloured wine. A little hard to release flavours in the Glass. But an amazing wine in the mouth. This is a good example of what a Barolo Can be after 10  years! Great wine with very long aftertaste.

Plenty of fruit remaining in this bottle on both the nose and palate. Hints of rose petals and spice in the bouquet. Nicely integrated at this point, with flavors of dusty red fruit, lavender, potpourri and warm spices. Finishes very well. A very pretty wine at this stage.

Tasted Blind. Time to go back to school. Geez. Cooked plum, blackberry, blueberry. Smoke, herbs/pepper. Reasonably dark, concentrated. I know it, Aussie Shiraz. Lol. At least it wasn't just me who went that way.....
Rich, heavy cinnamon with a deep earthy aftertaste. Good wine.
Wish I tasted it younger. Silk finish.
Not as good as 1996 or 2001 but with the wines we had that night for me this is the winner.

Wonderful Barolo with some age, viusally it appeared a little more mature that its actually was with the amount of bricking in the colour. Generous fruits on the redder spectrum, riper style that showed a little glimpse of the telltale signs violets, petals and tar. The tannins and structure have almost completely dissipated, drink now.

3.75/5* Very classy and concentrated aroma of flowers, sweet cherries, blackberries, eucalyptus and camphor oil . The palate is the weaker link. It does not hold up to expectation; lean and fruit-deficient.

Ready after a long aging, this Barolo still shows a slightly dark color. The nose is complex with hints of withered rose, along with spicy and "goudron" given by the evolution. The mouth is long, ample and persistent, with velvety tannins and fresh acidity. Still a bit of evolution ahead.
Soft and mature. Nice but going downhill and almost over mature
Extraordinary Barolo in large format form. A big elegant wine that needs the appropriate occasion! A do not miss experience.
beautiful plum nose, tannins have softened, some liquorice on the palate, nice finish

Strong, fruity, nice balance!

Ripe red fruit. Red cherry and red currants. Soft dried fruit notes of fig. Floral notes of dried roses and violet. Elegant tar and leather notes. Soft mushroom notes and soft notes of truffles. Light toast, cedar and oak from barrel. Good concentration, acidity and intensity. Ripe tannins, moderate grip. Long finish.

Beautiful Barolo, worth your penny.

Outstanding wine. 
Pronaunced on nose and palate. Oak, clove, forest floor, chocolate, coffee, dried red fruit, cherry, licorice, leather, earthy. Tannins and acidity lowered by age, more elegant and still present. Long finish

Garnet. Aromatic. Ripe red berries. Cherry. Strawberry. Dried citrus. Earth. Tar. Dried flowers. Menthol. Good complexity and length. This wine continues to evolve in the glass. Starting to show secondary development, but it still has time ahead. Beautiful Nebbiolo.

Medium ruby-garnet. A little cloudy. Moss, leather, currant, black truffle, iron, and black plum. The finish is very long and very apricot. Tannins are velvety. Still nice acidity.
Initial smell of old leather shoe laces. After giving it an hour to open up, we discovered a flowery bouquet of deep, rich flavors. The ‘98 lived up to its billing as a premiere vintage.
Mellow down fruits and mostly mushroom and earthy flavors and some leathery notes. Medium finishing and slightly spicy on the finish.

Perfectly aged Serralunga Barolo.  Tertiary notes of black tea, olives, over stewed cherry, black fruit and hint if roses and tar. Just beautiful!

A bit after his quality peak, but still alive, and the balanced Barolo structure is still enjoyable. Smokey,   wild cherry aromas. Long finish. It was a great wine and still is it.

Very earthy, leather and tar. Great acidity. Was looking for a bit more fruit. Since wine spectator suggest to hold on Barolo 2010. It wasn’t there.
Dry cherry notes, some chalky notes, dry, well balanced. Has some acidity at the end, but is a beautiful expression of this grape — wow!
It is an excellent Barolo. Bold tannins, dark color, great acidity. A little short on the pallate. Good wine for $59 from WTSO.
Dark red plums, dark red cherries, black cherries, sweet spices, licorice, dusty earth, slight leather. Grainy tannins. Brooding. Serralunga terroir.
So full, decadent, smooth.. Unlike what you'd expect a Nebbiolo to be. Everyone guessed it was a jammy super Tuscan. What a find
Stunning fabulous on the nose. Layers of taste and long. Lasts 5+ years. But why wait.

Cherry color with dark edge. Fragrant musty wet  day, dry flowers, roses. Rich tannins in long finish. Excellent pairing with Pecorino cheese. Would be great with savory food, roast beef and truffles and saffron.
Barolo is always my favourite wine, “king of wines, wine of kings”. Nice ruby aged red wine, leather hints followed by tobacco spice. Nice cherry finish in the palate.
Single vinyard wow. Drinkable and enjoyable standalone. Leather and tobacco, but edges rounded by oak maturation. The 2016 vintage was exceptional
17/20. Dry berries, vanilla, toast, leather, earthy notes, paint, dry wood. Tannins are still high, but already elegant. Acidity is medium plus. Berry taste.

So excited to pick this up for only $60. Deep brick color turning caramel brownish-orange at the rim. Dried roses, graphite, potpourri, tobacco, clove, dry leaves on the nose. High, tart acidity. Rich, grippy tannin (should have decanted longer) and a full body. Subtle caramel  flavors mingle with the stronger damp earth, apricot and truffle components. The finish hits on dark cherry and fades slowly and gracefully.

Amazing nose!
Medium+ nose, tobacco, tar, wet leafs and sweet licorice fudge!
Medium+ body, beautiful integration of dark fruit, floral with both rose pebbles and violas, tobacco and leather in a long ending with plenty of amazing tannins (in a 23 year old wine)!

Decanted for 3 hours on the last Saturday of September. Perfect wine on a cool autumn evening while watching Ohio State. Lots of earthy dark red fruit (black cherry / plum / raspberry) with hints of tobacco, tar and cola. Tannins are smooth as silk. Beautiful old style Barolo.

Wow this was a beautiful wine. I read a lot of reviews so I decanted it for 2.5 hours before tasting. Right out of the bottle the nose was very dried roses and green olive. Once we were ready to taste it the nose opens up to strawberry jam and leather and permanent marker. The palate was very earthy with Leather, peppered meat, and dried berries.

Winner in a blind Barolo tasting we had. Color and smell was delightful. Smooth from beginning to end .
If you own some, drink now. Really good balance and i think that this barolo does not go better any more. Really good with duck confit :)
Cherries and berries on the nose developing into spices and liquorice on the palate. Tobacco emerges too. Complex and multilayered, aged very well with a very good tannic structure.

Tasty but disappointing for the price I paid.... 

Changed my mind after 1 hour of opening. This wine changes with a bit of air. Lovely!

What a wine! Lots of dried cherry off the bat with a chalky/dirt finish. As it opened up a bit, some petrol notes snuck in. 

Those flavours sound terrible, but it worked spectacularly.
4,6 A favorite from this famous vine-maker. Typical Nebbiolo senses, violet, licorice, raspberries and red fruit. You will also sense oak, bark and some cinnamon if you look out.
Clear, medium ruby. Clean, medium intensity aroma of cherry, leather, tar. Dry, high acidity, medium tannins, medium body and medium finish. Palate confirms the nose. Very nice.
4.3 stars. Pretty good aroma of dried flower and prune. Dry, high acidity, medium plus body, high silky tannin. Tastes better after adequate aeration. Might be better after further ageing.
Wonderful Barolo. Rose petal and bramble on the nose, tannins still very firm, but softened by the oak which brings out toasty cedar notes. Earthy, leather and forest floor on the finish.

So happy to get this experience! A well aged barolo has been on my list for a while.

A beautiful rust colour in the glass, this was a little austere at first and needed some time to wake up.

Medium+ bodied on the palate, a plush balance of tannin and acidity keep the wine together and fresh at its ripe age.

The nose still holds dried rose pedals and the darkest of cherry. The palate continues with cherry along with red plum, beautiful balsamic, mushroom and forest floor notes.

Loved this, such a treat!
Doing some backlog digging while quarantined. This one was never rated. Can't find any notes. Only star rating.
single vineyard barolo from fontanafredda s monopole La Rosa. a beauty of a wine from a great vintage.
Full body masculine wine with long lasting characteristic aroma in mouth
Very enjoyable wine, well balanced with hints of mushrooms and dark chocolate in the nose.  Medium tannins and acidity balance out the experience in the mouth.

Tar, sweet, Port like, hint of menthol, earthy, really ripe and juicy. Not much fruit left, but dark cherry and hint of liquorice. Super zingy on the gums, almost like bonjela! Great balance and power. A big wine, now nicely rounded. Still some tannins evident after all these years.

Surprisingly open and approachable for an '08. Very complex and multi-layered. Firm tannins and medium to full bodied. Dark fruit, leather, gravel, graphite, raw meat, root veg, and tons of oak. Thin legs. Great barolo.

Medium garnet colour. Medium and developing nose with strawberry, black pepper, liquorice, leather, wet leaves and forest floor. Pronounced taste of strawberry, black pepper, liquorice, leather, wet leaves and forest floor. Medium long and dry finish. High acidity. High tannins. Full body. A very good Barolo that is still too young. Drink in five to ten years time. Goes well with beef or lamb.

Expensive. Over chf 80 at Mövenpick. Impressive nose with (suprisingly) an obvious Marmite/bovril/promite aroma of warm toasted yeast. The palate was the real surprise. Soft interesting and restrained. One to pay attention to. A meditation wine perhaps.

Deepish, but transparent ruby colour. Strong flavors of red berries in the nose. Palate: Beautiful intense strawberry and cherry.  Maybe some raspberry. Some oaky notes with cinnamon maybe with cardamom  and other warm spices.  Nice mouth watering leathery dryiness and delicate acids keeps the taste lasting long ....long. Fabulous wine for high end experience.😋

And so I ran out.
Last night I had some alone time with this beauty.
It was the last bottle.. 
Still very fresh with delicate tannins.
In the nose fruity and earthy at the same time.
On the palate forrest floor, leather, tobacco, dark cherries, cherry stone, a little dark and bitter chokolate.

Could still develope over the next 3-5 years I think.

Classy, sleek. Vigna La Rosa is the icon of the estate coming from single vineyard within Fontanafredda. Juicy and upfront nose with overtones of withered flowers, tobacco and spices. Smooth and almost velvety start of tannins explode on the palate with fruit. A symphony of pleasure. The name of the wine has a beautiful romantic story

Starts with plum in the nose. Leather, cinnamon, vanilla and some dark red fruits on the palate. All subtle, all well balanced. Nice and dry, long finish. Lots of flavors coming out at the different stages. Got a little softer after 2h and went well with tenderloin and baked potatoes (no surprise).

Summer memories /6: I am in love with the colour of the nebbiolo grapes...ruby red with garnet. Clear hints of dried rose, violet, tobacco, spices and vanilla. Soft tannins and the fruits give a good sensation in mouth, very fresh. The finish is very long...almost a meditation wine!

Ruby with garnet colored.

Raspberry, mushroom, earthy, oak, tobacco, violet, licorice.

Dry, medium+ acidity, high tannin, medium+ body.

4.2 / 5

Beautiful single-vineyard Barolo from Fontanafredda. The La Rosa vineyard is located in Serralunga d’Alba and is famous for producing richly perfumed and intensely tannic wines.

Dried roses, violets, tobacco, leather and tar on the nose. On the palate, the wine is incredible dense and structured, with rich dark berry, plum and spices. Notes of iron and clay. Complex and delicious.

Paired perfectly with homemade Parmesan risotto and filet mignon in a balsamic and goat cheese sauce. Fantastic wine.

Too many bottles tonight, only recording the notes that stuck to my mind. 

This bottle is outstanding, probably because I haven't drunk a barolo this old. Sour cherries, tobacco. Lack of tar prompted me to guess new world pinot. Wrong wrong wrong.

The tannins should have given it away. High grippy tannins without the harshness of a young barolo. Age is really important.

Really nice young single vineyard Barolo that shows well now but is built to last of course. Nice inviting complex spicy, earthy, dark nose. On the palate nice juicy fresh fruit, nice firm structure that is well-balanced with wlegant fruit and acidity, spicy, savoury, earthy, leather, tobacco, woody notes giving it character. Not bad!

This Barolo was a random pick with friends to pair with charcuterie, & it blew our minds. It was very approachable from the get go and continued to develop over time. Beautiful notes of black fruits, licorice, earth, vanilla, & slight spice. It was full bodied, with smooth tannins. This 100% Nebbiolo is truly in the perfect drinking age right now, but I bet it could go another couple years.

Single-Vineyard Barolo. Med garnet in color. Pronounced aromas of black cherry, black plum, dried rose, perfume, dried herbs, tobacco, leather, tar, & earthy minerality. Med (+) tannins still show at its age; combined with its med (+) acid & palate this wine makes a very versatile & complex food pairing wine. Beautiful Barolo that pairs excellent w lamb.

Leather, oak, cherry: black and red, plump and a touch of vanilla.
Let the wine roam free in your glass for a while and it will give you a sensation of flavours.
Nice tannins and acidity, long peppery finish and an urge to refill your glass before it’s empty makes this one of the better barolos I’ve tasted so far.

Damn good wine! Dad opened this for Jenna’s birthday/Christmas. 

High acidity popping off my tongue. Strong, gripping tannins linger long.

Cherry, tar, and eucalyptus on the nose.

A complex palate with, most prominently, cherry, licorice, and clove.

Great wine, and great pairing with a duck pot pie dad made for j’s bday.

Medium garnet with a brownish orange edge. Dried cherry, leather and hints of cinnamon on the nose. Chewy, rich and viscous palate with great depth and intensity leading to a pleasing, iron tinged earthy/bitter finish.

Garnet red, slightly lightened edge. Typical Barolo bouquet with lots of red fruit, balsamic notes and dried rose petals. Red fruits, spices, dried black style, still nice acidity an tannins, dry.

Dark ruby in color, darker than most Barolo. Faint nose of plums, licorice, tar, and a hint of dried petals. Fruits characters gone missing after a while in glass. Alcoholic mid palate and tannic finish. Prolly passed its peak? 3.7/5

We Are Young (Fun. ft. Janelle Monáe) A young, modern and approachable ruby-red Barolo. The nose is delicate with dried roses, violets and spices. The palate is dense and rich, based on already smoothened tannins, red fruit and a refreshing acidity. I was really surprised by the readiness, the great balance and persistence throughout the flavorful finish of this youngster.

Paired grilled lamb last night with a 2008 Barolo. The Nebbi opens with a classic nose of tar and roses as well as cocktail cherry and clove. A cherry and berry core in the mouth with tertiary notes of mushroom, brambles, and meat.
Firm but silky tannins. Somewhat of a lighter Barolo, almost like a Barbie. Vivino price is too high, I got it for $68.
A nice choice for a bbq, Pikachu agreed that it was a good selection to pair with the lamb.

What a beuty.  My wife's birthday, so this had to nail it.  The wine still had acidity and in my amateur guess it could have another 5 years in the bottle.  There is off courese the hints of leather, tobaco and chockolate. But none of them exceeds the other.  A nice balanced mix.  A bit touch of menthol on the nose, but it does not lower my grading of this wine. Perfecto, life is good.

Mature barolo. Nice fruit with evolved earth tones.

24 years old and could go another 10

Aroma:  mushroom and earth. 
Flavor:  quite dry with nice finish.
Smokey, dusty, straw, licorice, pine, blueberry, baking spice
Truffles, roses, tobacco, strawberries, tar, balsamico. Long, dry finish. Elegant!
1997 vintage, and a little past it’s prime. Dark copper coloured to the point of almost brown. Dried strawberry based flavour, layered with tar, tobacco, smoke and an aftertaste of minerals.

Great taste, keep it open after two hours 
We taste Chocolate and raisins, blackberry, blueberry 
Love it!

Dark ruby colored. Great tannin,  cheesey and  oaky in nose, crystal  plum in taste, within minutes, it turned into  black cherry,  leather, and licorice in taste. Great lingering, great Nebbiolo wine.
Very impressed with this Barolo. Dark fruit 🍇 laced with an earthy and leather bouquet. Tannins and acidity elegantly balanced. Would certainly look 👀 to find again.
Very oaky aroma, dry finish, light tannins, slight dark berry flavor.  Robust and smooth flavor - not sharp in any aspect.
92/100. Very good, complex, lots of different aromas of garden flowers, vinegar, mushrooms, red berries
Sweet cherry and berry, rich, dense and at its peak, beautiful bouquet and rose petal on the nose, spice filled aftertaste.
It’s a robust, strong forward defence, with a proud Wristy offence; think Michael Bevan in overs 45 - 50.
It's best time has passed already. And now it is fading away gracefully. Still lot of acidity and tannins but that is all what there is
Fantastic barolo!
Good value

Exhibits a saturated purple/garnet color in addition to a stunning bouquet of underbrush, kirsch liqueur, lead pencil, licorice, and toasty new oak. Full-bodied and exotic (but not over the top), this is a structured, muscular, concentrated Barolo.

Hard to believe but it was a bit young...even at 11 years old. The futures on 2010 Barolo says to hold...I should have listened. 

Past that it was a good wine, simply a bit young. Still very bold, as most Barolos are.

The best barolo I've had in this trip. This barolo from 1997 is just about at it's prime I suppose. Ruby red with orange rim which shows its age. When first opened there's a powerful nose of mushrooms, cinnamon, nutmeg, licorice and other dried herbs. Cured meat savory. The complexity is balanced perfectly with the red cherries acidity and deliciously structured soft tannins. Medium finish. Pairs well with hard cheese.

Cherry, leather, vanilla, and as it opens a small pucker at the end. Definitely improves as it opens. There is a slight burn to your throat but not in an uninviting way. Filet prepared medium to medium rare with grilled sweet peppers made for an exceptional pairing. Only wished We had purchased more than 2 bottles. We are on our typical Thursday night date at home together doing nothing but eating great food and drinking impeccable wine. 👄😈
Earthy bouquet with some hints of raspberry  and peat. Smooth as glass mouth feel. ...perhaps to the point of being a little understated. Overall a nice medium bodied wine but nothing that special.
Viva Barolo!!!  More and more I am learning to appreciate the beauty of fine Italian wines.  Paired with grilled sliders.  More later.
Nose of blackcurrant and cherry. Dry and smooth tannin. Ends with leather earthy flavor. A very good bottle and gets better after some airing

light garnet color
cherry earthy oak with nose
full body with good tannin & acidity
good finish

20201231
A 4.0 on the nose. 4.5 on the palate.  cherry black fruit dried rose orange. Finish long.
Very balanced and deep Barolo.
Ready to drink!
Very complex, Intensity Aromas of leather, bread, mushroom, forest floor, black chocolate.
Full of aroma after 2 hours. Power of Barolo!
Red and hints of black cherries with tobacco and cedar. Rich and spicy. Just a bit of astringent and relatively short for the price.
leather cherry tobacco earthy
James suckling great wines of Italy event!
94 pts by WS and part of the Grand Tasting , red fruit overtones, spice undertones
Black cherry, prune, earthy, dried violet. Tannins still well present and decent length.
Cherry with good dose of oak on the palate. The nose is lovely with lots of red fruits perfume.
Great balance already.
Sweet cooked fruit, perfume and leather nose. Feminine style with dark fruit, sour cherry, sour but persistence finish. At peak.
A limpid and delicate Barolo. Very good acidity and a color that is already becoming old red
4.30 - Still a young 2011 single vineyard Barolo, but getting better with time, hold...
Excellent tobacco, red fruit and pepper, lingering aroma.

Nice, sweet cherry and floral notes.
Super tight. We almost thought it corked.

Smells like a Ferrari garage in the sixtees. Sexy and potent. One of my favorite Barolos!
Unbelievably well-rounded and can be consumed now, but will be even better with more age.
Leather, earthy, red cherry, tobacco, white pepper, .. smooth, balanced, great barolo
Blackberry with a hint of sour cherry, smoke, licorice and oak..nice structure and balance.
Berries, dark fruits, vanilla, dark violet hues, at 1015 Stamford
Light fruity wine. Notes of chocolate and sweet fruits and cherries.
Love this Barolo. Soft tannins and amazing fruit.
Top notch barolo. Very smooth. Tannic. leather cherry tobacco earthy
Still red cherry roses nose wise followed by a soft juicy cherry palate covered in tar tobacco... look at my latest review for further
A very heady smell! Dark fruit and a hint of blackberry in the taste. Very nice taste!

Dry year, small, strong berries. 
Brick colour. At begining light one, then growes up tanins. Cherry bones, tobacco leaves, sweetness in taste.
Great wine with beautiful warm berry flavor. Has hints of tobacco and leather. Very tasty. Aroma is light. Will I purchase again? Yes
Tobacco, cherry and licorice in balanced harmony provide the backbone to this fresh barolo. Very deep and persistent finish with smooth tannins.
What an amazing wine and such a treat to experience let her breathe
Cherry and tar. Drinking beautifully now.
Leather, smooth tannin. Time to drink now. A good Barolo.
Easy and so Nice
Great barolo. Will buy again. Def taste the difference after 10+ yr of cellaring
Uncorked and decanted about 40 min before drinking. Very tasty, tannins really mellow. Really enjoyed and savored this Barolo. Would definitely buy this one again.
Bright fruity nose.
Garnet in colour. Floral and parfumed. Ripe fruits. Smooth palate. Bold charachter.
Leathery hint of fruits like cherry and high acidity
Wow!  Perfect!  Aged just right.

good lingering finish of sweet lychees! restraint and more intense than the lazarito but lacks depth and complexity.. silky elegance with still some tannins going.. forest floor, cherries, funky barnyard with roses and oak coming through in the mid palate, ending with a hint of coffee.

4.25
Very Cloudy medium garnet, 
Front of the nose presents dominant notes of earth, hay, moss leaning into deep black current with metallics and minerals. Modest cooked red fruit starts to come through as it opens. 
Beautiful mouth feel, fuzzy apricot, green pepper, copper and iron on the mid-pallet. 
Very round, velvety, balanced Sangiovese. Amazing reference point for what this grape can do over 22 years.

3.8/5 pts. Barolo from Vinga La Rosa.

Appearance (A): deposit; medium tawny

Nose (N): medium+ intensity; aromas of liquorice, dry red fruit, rose hip, tar; fully developed

Palate (P): dry; medium+acidity; medium dry tannin; medium alcohol; medium body; medium+ flavour intensity; flavours of red fruit, rose hip; medium finish

La Rose is a single vineyard wine with 50 yrs old vines which Fontanafreddo manage to obtain fresh tones like violet flower tones and cherry cassis fruit structure. The vineyard is just outside their lovely gardens which is nice to visit. Some balsamic tones adding to the complexity. 15 months botti - 15 months barrique - 15 months in the bottle prior to release. Still a bit closed, yet tannins are ripe given this fine vintage for Barolo. Nice length and balance. Abv 14%. Tasted a la cantina.

Scent: Low aroma intensity. Dried leaves (like the leaves on the ground emerging in spring as the snow melts😆) sour cherry, licorice, sawdust, and seaweed. Restrained and muted. Lacks both intensity and complexity in my opinion. (2/5)

Looks: Pale rusty brown/red.

Mouthfeel: Dry. ABV is 14,5%. Medium acidity. High tannin level. Very enjoyable concentration on the palate. (4/5)

Grape variety: 100% Nebbiolo.

(3,6)
Amazing nose. Unbelievably complex
Blood Orange, dried rose petal, and of course cherry. The orange note really comes out on this one. This is like high end Grand Marnier. Nice job by the producer.
Man oh man, this guy loves Barolo! Dry red Italian wonderfulness wrapped in tumbled tannins, sexy cedar, brambles and vanilla undertones, tha shit ain't bad!

My first 20+ year old Barolo and 5 stars it is. Almost brown in colour with so much depth that it's foggy yet exquisite. Heavy, peppery, cola, red licorice with oak. Tannins are ultra soft and feels like drinking liquid velvet. Don't want this bottle to end.
Beautiful dark black cherry color with dry soft tannin finish.  The '97 is somewhat brick colored around edge.  Fruit is subtle but nice, very old world.  Glad I didn't wait any longer.
leather tobacco

At the the grand tasting. They are going to come fast and furious so hold on to your hats, kids!
Well over the top, but still very nice.

leather cherry earthy oak mushroom tobacco sous bois

ready to be drink and drunk
Still young but well balanced. Fruity full body with long lasting finish but not too jammy. Well matched with a big chunk of a porterhouse steak!!!

Beautiful red fruit - tart.  Light on tannins.
2001.  Avery good Barolo.

Tasted at the vineyard with 15+ different wines from Fontanafredda. This was the  Wine of the Day....more modern style but still keeps the subtleness of the Nebbiolo grape.  Superb!
Light cherry on the nose. Palate was fried orange peels, cedar and well integrated tannins.  Ranked (tied with two other) 2/8 at Toronto Vintner’s Club Barolo-Barbaresco tasting (Oct 2021).
ruby red color with garnet reflections. nose is broad, gentle but intense: died rose, violet, tobacco, berries, spices and vanilla. dense tannins balanced by fresh acidity

Went into the sink!

Bought it recently from a local wine pusher. No more aged wines from this pusher!! 😡
Simultaneously jammy and dry, tart cherry cola and overly tannic. This style could be passed for a burg in my book.
Full bodied and full flavored, lots of dark fruit, dry finish. Still looking for the Italian wines for me, but this one is not bad.
Elegant with a nose of strawberry jam, dried flowers and olives. In mouth is elegant with a strong tannin and a strong acidity
Deep ruby color, with raspberries, orange rind, and milk chocolate on the nose.  Dry, with dark cherries, raspberries, and firm tannins on the palate.  Long legs.  Long finish.  Fantastic!
94 points
Perfectly balanced with black cherries and licorice on the nose. Dry with a subtle hint of cherries on the palettes, medium acid, medium tannin, high alcohol.

Cherry. Oak. Red fruit. Some earthy notes beginning to appear. This wine has years left in it to develop it's full potential but is showing well despite some strong acidity. A keeper if you can get more.

Wonderful bold, dark concentration with sweet spice tones of almond paste and vanilla cream backed by sharply focused aromas of red berry, cassis, plum, mocha, licorice, spice and tobacco flavors. In the mouth, this beautiful Nebbiolo boasts a linear but long-lasting finish !!

This wine was so structured. Firm ripe tannins, high acidity, high alcohol and long finish. Still very youthful with the fruit characteristics, blueberry, blackberry, cherry, rose petal, tar and dried herbs. Easily could have laid down for another decade.

Very elegant and complex Barolo. The start was a bit disappointing, but after some air its complexity develops very nicely. The flavors are changing all the time starting with rip cherries followed by hints of roses, then moving to wood, cedar and finally I noticed hints of menthol. Very silky tannins but still a fresh acidity. This must be the Barolo experience!

Amazing wine! We had the pleasure and luck to get this wine included in the wine tasting at Fontanafredda today since it was opened for a journalist earlier already. It's full bodied, thick with dark fruits, rounded and velvety tanines and the taste remains extremely long, even after eating some grissini!

#3 of 6...Single Vineyard
A 4.0...💐
The nose on this was a phenomenal floral...beautiful!!  Not much of a finish, though. But that was ok....because it was paired with a tasty Pasta- sedani rigati, crumbled sausage, peppers, onions, chilis, bread crumbs & toped of course with Parma Reggiano!!! Dee-Licious!!!

Chocolate, oak, cacao, dried fruit, anise and nutty aroma is fully filled, full body, dry, delicate but also elegant tannin, very smooth and aromatic, blueberry and vanilla touch inside, clean finish with fruity acidity and bit of leather feeling. Few days later, it becomes mushroom, dusty, raisin, prune, dried cherry aroma. Very well-made Barolo. Very complex, very well-ripen. Great.

Tasted 2 vintages at Guido Ristorante: 2011 and 2013. 2013 delicious. On the nose roses tar cherries, on the palate has punch and softness. 2011 still very rough tannins and acidity. Can ypu ever over age a Barolo, but the 2013 is smooth, approachable and delicious

Very nice Barolo from Fontanafredda. Grassy and spicy nose. Full-bodies and round on the palate with red fruits and vanilla flavours. Then it becomes hot and spicy. Long finish with tobacco and chocolate. Can be aged until 2025.

Traditional ruby red color and lovely thin legs. Red cassis dominated nose with a French oak fade. Opening of red fruit with chalk, caramel and vanilla. Above average acidity and complex tannins emerge quickly and linger long.

Coming from a one cru 4,7ha vineyard, this young Barolo delivers aromas of rose petals, red berries and tobacco. Grippy taste with high acidity, high and pleasant tannins, mineral chalkiness, some red berries and long tingling aftertaste.

Red ruby color of medium high concentration with amber rim variation. Smokey, cigar, tobacco earthy rose floral perfum-y notes and medium intensity nose. On the palate this wine is dry, medium light body, medium high acidity, dilky tannins, long finish. Pairs well with whipped ricotta , truffle, honey.

From the top shelf yesterday, celebrating with friends, we pulled this pre dinner, a Fontanafredda Wines  2011 Vigna La Rosa Barolo. Positively sublime, earthy notes, raspberries, strawberries and tart cherry on the palate. Mid tannins, went great with cheese and crackers.

A month off its 10th birthday. Now starting to brick a little in colour, it’s floral and deep red cherry personality opening up - with mouthfuls of round tannin which while very present, don’t impart bitterness, and only add to the enjoyment. It’ll last for years but it’s a great wine now.

Vigna La Rosa, comes from a single vineyard within the Fontanafredda property, a monopole in a sense for lacking of a better word, what an appropriate name for this vineyard, the wine is fragrant and elegant, garnet ruby in color with delicate notes of dried rose petal, red flower potpourri, sandalwood, raspberry, cranberry, hibiscus, incense, clove, cinnamon and white pepper, some leather and charcuterie undertone that blows away after 15 minutes, medium body, with balanced acidity and soft velvety tannin.

(3,9/5) Barolo pleasure at home in the rain. Med garnet color. Sharp menthol, lavender, sweet tobacco, tobacco leaf, dried apricot and prune notes on nose. It has powerful palate. Black tea, clove, dark chocolate and carob notes on palate. Balanced and structured palate. Long finish. Salute...

Pale to medium garnet in color. Rustic on the nose with leather, clay pot, tobacco, rose, and cherry. Elegantly structured with a lovely mix of fruit and earth on the palate. Tightly wound, yet smooth tannins with juicy acidity and a long finish. 93 points.   🍷Cheers!🍷

Excellent, well structured Barolo with all the classic elements one would want.
Dark cherry and cherry liquor overlay rose petal, tar, raisin, menthol, coffee, and ink.
Smooth and long lasting on the palate with good acidity, silky long tannins, and full rounded weight.
Drinking great now.

3.8. Clear garnet color. Orange hue. Long legs in the glass. Moderate intensity of aromas. On nose there are notes of ripe red fruits, plum, fig, oak, smoke. Structure is dry, medium+ tannin, medium+ alcohol, nice medium acidity that helps with the balance. Medium body and finish with oak notes. Would pair great with a grilled rib eye.

A good surprise on this night! The Fontanafredda Barolo La Rosa begins with ruby-red with garnet highlights in the glass. On the nose, the wine has delicate, though intense nose is complex, with clear-cut overtones of withered roses, violets, tobacco, underbrush, spices, and a slight touch of vanilla.On the palate, Dense, closely-woven tannins start out smooth, almost velvety, and then explode in the palate with fruit and nicely balanced freshness. Long flavorful finish.

Violet, more of a purple colour. Direct bouquet of tobacco, dried fruit and raisins. Dark chocolate, dark ripe cherries and some peppermint on the tongue. Rich and round, some sweetness soon adds up to the quite peppery body. Elegantly smooth aftertaste.

A jewel of Surralunga with iron fist velvet glove.  Just  a sublime amount of earthy leather and autumn leaves. Tannins are strong amongst  a bountiful  of cherry and raspberry tart. I love the winter taste of cloves and spice.

Drinks like a dream in 2019. Wonderful notes of grand old dignified oak in both the nose and the taste, accompanied by smooth and gradual black fruit that’s just a total delight for the taste buds. Combined perfectly with a plate of cheese and some sensible bread.

I love Fontanafredda’s high-end offerings. Still looking out for the next Galarej.

Sophisticated barolo but lacks a bit of the distinctive punch that would take it over 4 stars. Rusty red in the glass, this one has subtle flavors and nose. Some red fruit, earth, and leather. Palate mimics this as well. Nothing sweet - just soft red fruit, well matured, and an earthy yummy finish. I wish it had a bit more depth or tannin structure - for this price I’d have expected it. Very good - not spectacular.

Magnum, decanted 2 hours. Single-vineyard from an MGA in Serralunga. Med garnet. Pronounced aromas of red cherry, black plum, dried rose, violets, dried herbs, tobacco, leather, tar, and earth. Aged 3 yrs in large Slavonian and French oak casks, and 1 more year in bottle before release. Dry but with generous fruit. Med+ acidity, med+ but polished tannins and med+ alcohol (13.5%). Full-bodied, with pronounced flavor intensity and length but still quite lively, with several years left. (WS 95 back in 2013).

4.2 – Aged at least two years in large casks of oak and then twelve months in the bottle. Black fruit flavours with hints of tar and leather on the nose. The palate is particularly fruity, red berries, cherry, plum with notes of liquorice, mineral nuances and a touch of wood. Good balance of fruit, tannins and acidity. A very pleasant Barolo with a fruity, peppery and smoky finish.

My favorite. Just an outstanding wine   Classic Barolo I let air about 3 hours. Beef Wellington asparagus wrapped in philo and topped with Asiago.  Mashed potatoes.  Great Christmas dinner with family.   I hope all Vivino friends had a special holiday

Dark red with a very slight touch of mahogany. Deep and dense nose of black cherries, roses, wet forest floor and animal-like notes too. Really quite heavy. On the palate it is rich as well but nicely balanced by good acidity and very firm tannins. Really good now, but I suspect it will be even better in 5 years. 92-94p.

Due bicchieri from the Gambero Rosso - a color of dark deep red like blood - the bouquet totally pleasant whispering from plum, raspberry and cherry, al adding up on spices and licorice - on the palate a voluptuous body, polished velvet tannins and a sustainable finish - what a feminine Barolo so easy to handle and drink ... No then it's perhaps more like your best mate ;-)
Smells older than it tastes. Still tastes quite a lot of fruit in it while the nose is a bit jammy. Sweet spice.

Classic Barolo at full maturity. Many say this vineyard expresses the grace of Barolo. The nose was smoky, earthy and saturated with dense, dark plum fruit. As my guest said: you can just breathe this wine'. A great birthday wine. 
On the palate the depth and finish were amazing. Lots of integrated oak and spice with layers of lingering dark fruit. Hints of chocolate, leather, mushroom and earthiness completed the picture. Perfect with wild mushroom risotto. 
A true tre Bicchierri. Glorious.
Tastes good

A little less impressive than at first thought. 

Absolutely fine Barolo but nothing extra. Somewhat harsh tannins and weak aroma. Not bad but yet not inspiring

Currants blueberry wood smoke.  Opens up to the faintest hint of butterscotch, still smokynnMineral taste, almost of limestone finish. Very old world. A good food wine. Thinking French or hearty Italian foods.

Amazing wine with a lot of potential give it 2 more years. Darkness with a hint of roses.
Different, fun barolo - Sweet cranberry, pomegranate... dirt and grass, bark and wood... cinnamon spice... tingle... lovely
Very acidic Nebbiolo with plum and leather notes. Heavy and lots of thick tannin but very balanced.

The reason you buy Barolo is for experiences  like this. Amazing nose, complex body and the finish is softening with age.
Really youthful and delicious. Candied fruit and cola on the nose. Ripe red fruit on the palate. Nice tannin.

Fantastic, aged Barolo. A good value even at this price point.

The delightful 2010 Barolo Fontanafredda Vigna La Rosa shows enormous promise but needs more time to integrate. This wine was first produced in 1964 and recently “Fontanafredda” was established as a vineyard cru. This means that the Fontanafredda estate would be the only company in Barolo to produce a wine with a personalized single vineyard namesake. Dark fruit and spice is folded within the tight tannic structure of the wine. Drink: 2017-2032.

C: Med+ ruby
N: Med intense strawberry, kirsch, ripe black fruits, dried herbs, earthy cedar & oak. Med complex & clarity. Lacking some definition here. Oak overpowers a bit.

This 100year old vine produces some of the most concentrated Grenache. Aged in used oak barrel. Pronounced ripe black fruits. Black cherries, strawberries. Jam and cooked fruits. Some spice and liquorice. A meaty savoury side. Pepper on the nose. Complex. Developing nicely. 

Almost deep garnet colour. Dry, medium acidity, medium plus tannins. High alcohol, full bodied. Pronounced fresh and cooked/dried fruits on the palate. Long concentrated fruity finish.

Can drink now, but has potential for ageing.

Undoubtedly one of my favorite Chateauneuf producer - Julien and his sister really revamped the estate and still the father is working with them - some of the best Grenache grapes and just a "warm up" before the unique and delicious  Pure cuvée which is worth over 5 stars

This 2016 is really drinking well already, deep purple burgundy color with nose smells of smoke, eucalyptus, cacao, black plum, black cherry, blackberry, hibiscus, Asian spices, clove, black pepper, hazelnut and walnut, full body with robust mouthfeel, firm and tasty tannin and balsamic like acidity, powerful in a restrained fashion, tastes of black cherry preserve, black plum, black currant, dark chocolate, blueberry, India ink, graphite, mineral, mint and garrique, long life ahead with at least a decade.

Nice aromatic nose with raspberries, blue berries, some spice, lavender, floral notes, nice ripe fruit concentration on the palate, with dried herbs, black tea, good freshness, well balanced, good finsh with fine tannin and spice 92 DSP

Dry, med+ body and acidity, silky med tannins. Bramble, boysenberry, raspberry, plum with garrigue, dried herbs, marjoram and oak. Takes time to open up. Enjoyable lengthy finish.

An excellent Chateauneuf du Pape
62% Grenache, 18% Mourvèdre, 12% Syrah, 6% Cinsault
65 yo vines
On the nose, black fruits, cherry, cocoa powder, violets
Mediterranean herbs, leather, cedar, warm spices
Complex palate with fruit flavours of blackberry, cassis, dark plum, black cherry
Liquorice, dark chocolate 
Savoury black olives and bacon fat
Lots of garrigue - rosemary, thyme and tarragon
Long intense finish with spicy notes of nutmeg, star anise and black pepper
Tannins well integrated, medium acidity

RHONE CLASS 3/6

The last of our southern Rhone lineup, I'm always a sucker for a good CdP. Grown from alluvial river rock, there are 13 different possible varietals you could find in a bottle. This is an example of an amazing bottle that is not in it's most flattering point of development, and yet showcases everything you want.

Notes of lavender, black fruits, tobacco & cedar are highlighted by small bits of spice & leather. This will integrate nicely in a few years, easily improving. 91 pts
Drink now with a little air and you’ll be a happy camper.  Goes with red meat or tapas— can’t go wrong with this one!

Elegance with great depth. Love the fruit weight and flavour. Whack some away and wow I think.

Wow!  Really complex CDP.  Licorice and earthy tones with medium tannins.

Outstanding quality of wine. 4.2 stars.

High alcohol, tannin, and full body wine with mostly clay, gravel, strawberry & blackberry notes. Was searching for those herbs de Provence notes in a CdP but no sign of them. Still good though blackberry plum

Cherry, blackberry, red licorice, cranberry, and earthy plum nose. Medium high acidity. Medium high tannins. Medium full body. Earthy, cherry, raspberry, cranberry, and strawberry. This is a silky wine with fine and rich tannins, traditional earthy notes, and delicious flavors. 4.1⭐️

Lots of spicy dark fruits wrapped in a velvety soft layer of dark chocolate, tobacco leaf, oak and leather. The nose is menthol, plum, blackberry and tobacco. Flavours are the same dark fruits, Christmas spice, dark chocolate, tobacco leaf, with medium acids and slightly drying tannins. Drinking really well now but should be a beaut down the track 🍷
Wow! Almost opaque in color and equally delicate on the nose. However, despite being very subtle, the wine has character and a very rounded finish. Impressive wine!

5th in a Sommselect blind six. Color is deep garnet with a touch of ruby. On the nose it imparts intense aromas of dark fruit and game. The palate is rich, complex and gripping with flavors of stewed black cherry, blackberry, plum and a touch of game. Acid and tannin are medium. alcohol is high, body is full and finish is medium + at least. Very good wine. Highly recommended for those seeking a powerful imposing taste.

So happy I picked this bottle at Straub’s today! Big and bold with hints of pepper, black cherry 🍒, and tannins that have your tongue smacking against the roof of your mouth like a trampoline! No doubt this CDP is in the top tier from the region 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼 #Cheers 🍷 #MoriartyParty

A lovely, silky structured wine. Well balanced, soft and rounded tannins gives a silky touch. Toasted fruits, blackberry jam are main smells with plum, liqueric and a bit of spicy aromas on the palate. Strong peppery finish. You will never regret to choose this Southern Rhone valley wine.
Dry at first but opens up to be fruitier. I kept waiting for it to get deeper in taste but it never got there. Disappointed given the price.

Big grained tannins, earth, dry herbs, ground tobacco, cola & complex spice finish

C9dP tasting #6: 62% GN, 18% Mou, 13% Sy, 5% Cin & 2% Vaccarèse. GN, Mou & Sy 18 months on barrel.
More ripe and sweet fruit as flavours now, besides chocolate, coffee, graphite and anise. A fine acidity and good noble tannins. Aftertaste ends with a burned impression. A rich and complex wine but not so refined as wine 5.

It's so delicious. This wine smells like raspberries, cherries, and flowers. It has delicate yet strong body. And minerality and tannin give it a sense of structure. 
The acidity doesn't strong, but it doesn't bother you.

Fantastic CdP -blend of GSM & Cinsault

Deep ruby appearance, pronounced nose of red & black cherry, black plums, nutmeg, black pepper, liquorice, vanilla, prunes and tar

Lovely mixture of black and red fruits in the mouth, sweet spices, liquorice, vanilla and prunes. Medium to high acidity, high tannins, full bodied and a long finish

Complex, still developing  but drinking so well already

A very good one! The smell of the pope’s apotheke is unmistakeble, the taste ofcourse is the same, with ripe red fruit and blackberries. Nice red browncolour and very long aftertaste make this unique.

Marvellously well balanced blend of (predominantly) black and red fruits, subtly melted spices and overall a silky mouth. Vegetal notes 🌿 as well. 

Excellent pairing with lamb and a sauce with garlic, honey, parsley and mint. 

Could have a more prominent structure, but still a great Chateauneuf - one of the best value 😁 for money 💰 I personally know in this superb appellation. 

Cheers all 🍇🍇🍇🍷🍷🍷 !

Sommelier at bourbon steak restaurant inside hw Marriott Turnberry hotel curated an amazing  wine pairing experience with two blind selections for my wife and per dish. Really made our night   Great knowledge. Extensive wine list
91. Well made and balanced Neuf. Way to young and green at the moment. After 3 hours it starts to show some of its potential. Keep.
An excellent example of this wonderful region.
Tasted veryyyy fruity and flavorful. Strong tannins but elegant. Would be amazing in 5 years.
leather pepper blackberry plum licorice tobacco black fruit cherry dark fruit black cherry
