Black fruits. 
Licorice 
Bigger than most from the area. Apparently winemaker doesn't use oak
Sophie’s leaving dinner!
Young. Very deep, licorice, mint and black fruits. Needs another 7-10 years cellartime.
Love this wine!!

blackberry pepper oak balanced and deep profile, full body, bold and dry.

Ok value at 66$. 4.2

The direct black currant and fig paste notes are underscored with tobacco, tar and roasted alder hints, revealing an echo of Black Forest cake. The finish rumbles along, leaving a dark, slightly muscular feel.

3.9 Blend of 6 grapes, dominance is by Grenache ~60-65%,18M in used1/2/3 fill 600L barrels. Avarage age of wines 70 years.
Deep garnet with orange edges, F body. 
Black cherry, black raspberry, blackcurrant, jammy fruits, peppers, anise, garrigue,smoke, cloves, oregano, tobacco, basil, cinnamon,leather, loamy&asphalt minerality, floral notes, hint of wood. 
Taste with stewed dark&red berries, black cherry, peppers, leather, stone minerality. 
M+aftertaste with very fine M+ alco and mouth covering tannins.

As we did not try any great north Rhone we had to go for a great southern, from the always great chateauneuf du pape!

A: clear medium garnet color
N: clean mid+ intensity nose with red fruit, sweet spices cinnamon, oak, coffee and jam, great complexity and still developing nose
P: dry attack, mid acidity, full body from tannins and alcohol but all integrated. Pronounced and frank flavors. Great!
C: very good wine, still with potential but already delivering a great juice! Wow!!! Drink now and ever ;)

Deep garnet.

Pronounced aromas of raspberry, black cherry, red cherry, black pepper, bramble, vanilla, cloves, cooked fruit.

Dry, medium (+) acidity, medium (+) tannins, full body. Pronounced flavours of strawberry, black cherries, toast, vanilla, char/smoke, dry cherry, earth, meatiness. Long finish.

Outstanding wine, as you would hope at this price 🍷

Aromas of plum, blackberry with layers of leather, vanilla and licorice. On the palate, bold, medium in tannins and acidity - Medium + length in finish. Overall, very approachable and engaging wine with decent amount of complexities.

83/100 - No complaints on this and that this should continue to improve with finesse overtime

04052023 - luncheon with the bros. Bottle from bro Pm!Plenty of candied fruits, plum, bubblegum?, licorice, newly tanned leather, mix of star anise & cinnamon. Lovely density on the palate, fleshy& chewy tannins with plenty of complexity.

04052022 - blind tastings luncheon brief notes: Candy notes on the nose. Tasted cherry, cherry liquer with more feminine and elegant style of Cdp. Lovely as our final bottle of the day. Thanks for sharing brother PM & Tom!

4.1 med+ intensity of raspberry blueberry, balckberry, blackcurrant, wet stone. Very ripe fruits. Nutmeg, chocolate, leather and game. Powerful wine full bodied, high tannins and med+ acidity. Very pronounced flavours on the palate and long finish

4.2 🌟

1st time on this producer. An entry CDP but well make & gd value (USD 50) vs the quality.

No decant but Drink from glass over 2.5hrs. Immediately approachable with pronounced aromas of fresh & frangrance red fruit; red cherry, raspberries, red plum later gives black fruit; blackberry with touch of blueberries. Secondary aromas developed soon after with hints of tobacco, coffee and fresh herbs & Florals notes. Love the nose. Palate is rounded & savory with long sweet citrus ends. 👍

Gd structure ag

Bold..  Very bold and muscular from the on-set out of the bottle, a great introduction to Grenache 🍇 and CdP, there's so much to learn about Frenchies!! Plum, blackberry and some vanilla on the palate, this is a fruit forward wine with an intoxicating nose which developed to a more rounded finish after an hour in the glass.. The best of 3 bottles on an impromptu happy hour on eve of Christmas eve at my home, thanks @[1|9482449|Mika Tyson Teau] for the bottle.. 👋 KN and WH too!
91pts. Great basic CdP! Quite sexy texture, fruity but not jammy, chocolate, herbs, subtle pepper aromas.  Nicely balanced with medium long finish
Tobacco and tannin notes.  You can feel the weighty tannins.  Chocolate and BlackBerry.   Very nice, but deserves a rich meal.
Greet smooth tannins. Miss perhaps a little length. Light red.
Dry, berries and an excellent wine
leather blackberry pepper tobacco oak on the nose not strong bouquet  black fruit leather pepper tobacco smoke on the palate medium finish
Silky smooth. Lighter on tannins than the usual CNdP, but still with a nice body, red fruits, plum, dark chocoloate, touch of pepper and nicely rounded bouquet.
Outstanding. Black fruits, rumble, black pepper, chocolate, cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon, leather, smoke, tobacco, dried fruit. High alcohol with 15 ABV, high tannin, full body with pronounced flavour.
Salon - this domain produces seriously tannic CdP‘s. The 2015 is nicely fruity, but needs at least 5 years of cellaring to smoothen and get together. 35€ i find also too expensive.
Blackberries, cherries, herbs, delicate licorice. Medium plus body, concentrated but still elegant. Very good vintage in CdP, good wine, but there are a lot better reds in South Rhône.3.8
More acidic than expected
Very complex good balanced wine with many different notes (oak, vanilla, licorice, dark fruits, smoke etc.).
Full body, medium tannins and acidity with savoury notes and blueberry, cherry and plum fruit flavours.
Bold blackberry and plum palate with hint of green herbs and ash,  very nice, full bodied... Delicious
Wonderful deep berry flavor on the front of the palate. Sustained full red fruit on the mid pallet and a decent finish. At €27 this ha a great QPR. Highly recommended.

Medium ruby, almost purple. Blackberry, black fruit, bramble fruit. Garrigue, smooth spice, smooth black pepper. Leathery. More fruity than spicy. Tannins are strong but not overpowering. Tart alcohol. Leathery mouthfeel is smoothed out. Medium-plus body. Medium-plus tannins. Medium-plus acid. Medium-plus alcohol. Really good, well-balanced CdP.

Garnet color 
blackberry,black cherry aroma   vanilla note
light body 
medium + tannin 
low acidity 
rich fruit flavor & smooth 
oak flavor 
good wine
A very good and attractive Châteauneuf-du-Pape from a difficult vintage.  Somewhat closed initially, it gradually evolves into a juicy and fruity red.
Alcohol is a little out of balance, but overall carries the strong Grenache notes of ripe red berries (strawberries, cherries) along with tobacco.
Bought in Avignon. Earthy, spice and some balanced tannins. In other words: more M than G! 2-3 more years would benefit this wine
Wonderful clove. Huge bold wine. Soft tannins. Lovely finish. Could use a little more in the front.
Decent cdp. Had it at a wine tasting. Good fruit, bit rough around The edges..perhaps too young. 3.9*
Superb

30.1.19.  There was not much of a bouquet initially, but after about 30 min there were hints of dark, Woody berries.  Good intense mouth feel with somewhat acceptable tannins Ang notes of chocolate, dry herbs, laced with tine of earthiness and under lying dark fruits giving a good finish. Further cellaring would realise the full potential of this CdP

So tasty.  Warm and cozy Chayeauneuf, lots of  cherry and fig, mild spice, just what you need with garlic beef 🐂. Needs at least 20 miutes in the glass to soften up. I'm sure I had it before and it keeps on giving. Just ordered 3 more bottles.
Fruity and long finish

Christmas gift from my son, selected by the staff at Gary’s wine shop in Madison NJ.  Opened at 6 years and decanted for 2 hrs. Delicious!  Some wonderful raisin / date notes that paired nicely with the spice rub on our steak.

The dark color is mesmerizing. Nose is vibrant and full of fruit. Once in the mouth this is full-on blackberry.  Flavor are unmistakable. Very chewy. Think dry straw. Finish is full of berries but on the dry side. A very solid CND!

Requires a bit of air time before drinking, but only a minimal decant allows it to shed a hint of barnyard and what might be an incredibly small quantity of cork taint. With that gone, this is an excellent CdP, fruity with rough tannins that make the finish endless. Fruit is all dark, oxidized but the acid eliminates the caramelized flavors. The acid and tannins provide leather and smoke to increase the wine’s complexity. Oh so CdP...and complicated.
dry, elegant, cocoa, spice, pepper, earth. first time having a large format pour from aldo sohm, idk why chateauneuf-du-pape seems to be the hot shit of the month but yea pretty nice glass
red cherry black cherry clove leather earth
Spicy, for eating, complex, alcohol
BlackBerry dark fruit cherry and light oak. Bold wine medium tannin smooth finish.
Magnum

I thought it was a great wine 
At frenchys
Soft background cherry.  Smooth and mellow. Some fruit but not overpowering
Great CDP. Full bodied wine expressing lots of earthiness in balance with the fine tannins make it a fantastic match with the lamb rump lunch
Served from a magnum and I loved it. More comments in few hours.
Lovely bold and smooth wine with a lingering dark berry aftertaste.
Classic pepper and liquorice CNDP, drinking very very well
Full-bodied, rich yet structured.
Deep and earthly. Value for money
Spicy, peppery nose, very elegant, full body. Enjoyable tannin and acidity with long finish. Slight chocolate and vanilla on the palate.
Beautiful. An elegant yet fruity CDP. Barroche is a superb yet surprisingly priced CDP. Bravo.
Very good Chateauneuf-du-Pape. Spicy due to a higher percentage of Syrah, nice bigger tannins.
Evening is going interesting, great wine balsamic back pepper and fruity  complex long finish,
lovely, well structured, smooth tannin, ripe dark fruit develop to even fuller, richer dark cherry and ripe plum in the glass.
Terrific wine. Very smooth and fresh . Gull flavored with taste of plum and berry. Mild oak.
Probably needs some more time to really develop.
At Wein&design tasting.
Very approachable, doesn't need to decant.  Clear plum and red fruit showing along with tobacco.
Big dark berry nose and a little hot (alcohol). Nice balance. Very long finish. Very, very good.
Deep, dark fruit on the nose, with blackberry, tar, oak, peppercorn. Full body, round and balanced, polished full force fruit, with strawberry, blueberry, smoke, oak, tar on the long legs.
Stick to my first rating.
Very good. Not that complex, but good paired with short ribs. A bit pricey so I didn't buy it.
Fruit driven aromas of  crunched blueberry and cassis
Tightly wound ball of liquorice coated chocolate ball with a plum centre
Licorice, more subtle than the others in our tasting, but very balanced and impressive
A very peaty wine. Typical French style with a very leathery scent. Bold with a medium red colour.
Súper sweet. Licorice is strong,  leather and pepper finish!
Deep ruby red. Mineral-ly nose. Full bodied, not too asidic but slightly bitter after taste
Barnyard and fruit nose; GMS+C++; good fruit in mouth; medium tannin; ma femme adore le nez.

leather pepper blackberry plum

Easy to drink, but it's flat
Quite heavily oaked. Rounded with dark berries. Very drinkable CdP.
Nose is cherry and strawberries. Needs 5 more years to be named elegant, but will be..
Smooth as silk. Crisp and bright. Delicious!
Great balance of fruit and terroir. 4.2
Very solid Châteauneuf-du-Pape with mint and dark fruit.
A very solid 4, but not quite 4.5. Very typical of the style. Pleasant with BBQ pork ribs!
Tobacco, dark chocolate and blackberry!

Drink now, can age
Dark fruit, black berry, cloves, leather, dark chocolate, herbaceous. Complexity, balanced, intensity.

Somehow the only CdP we’ve had - third vintage for us. Definitely on the fruitier side. Lots of ripe red and black fruits. Currants. Pretty herbaceous. Bordering on raisin like sweetness as well. Just not my style of wine.
Tasting through Domaine Barroche. 2013 is very approachable. Lovely fruit. Higher percentage of Mourvèdre. Tough vintage for Grenache.

I like the nose of this wine:kirsch, berries, a delicate oak, maybe a slight touch of acetic too in mouth confirms the berries, and the  kirsch, maybe too much alcohol, but well cover by the fruit, and leather flavours, medium gentle astringency, alive wine, nice long  after taste of nuts and medlar.

Day 2 in Champagne. Finally the last wine of the day and it was not a Champagne. Now a juicy CDP to pair with a sirloin steak. 👃🏻 Ripe blackberries, floral hints, leather, black pepper, earthy notes and iron. 👅 Full bodied, dense, with high tannins and medium acidity. Dark fruit, like blackcurrants, blueberries, followed by spicy and herbal hints. 4.2⭐️

Checked out one of the top (tourist) wine bars in Paris, O Chateau.  A friendly place with a nice menu.  Got a bottle of Barroche CdP.  A nice daily-drinking CDP.  A nice warm nose of all spice, mint, wet earth and cedar.  A juicy finish with some light acidity up front and a long and savory finish.  Not as enjoyable or complex as an older Vieux Telegraphe or Beaucastel, but a great young CDP.  Lovers of WA cabs (like myself) will like this one.

👀 opaque garnet with aged gray rim

👃🏻 ripe raspberry licorice pepper leather tobacco white flowers 
👄 mid bodied, firm and tight tannin(at least 1hrs required), mid + acidity, tough mouthfeel and short aftertaste with booming wild flowers
it’s like new kind of sauce or seasoning. so beautiful pairing with korean style sausage made of pig intestine(a.k.a. 순대).

Aromas of blackberry, cherry, licorice, pepper, lavender, leather, earthy and little oak.

Deep ruby colored.


Combination of black cherry, earthy and licorice is great on the palate. 
It has wonderful density, silky and sweet tannin,   fresh tannin. 
The finish is delicate and deep. 

65% Grenache, 20% Mourverdo and the rest Syrah, Vaccarese and Cinsault.

Overally, elegant and drinkable CDP in this difficult vintantage.

4.1 / 5

Nice Southern Rhône that introduces itself as smooth then picks up tannin and astringency in the mouth developing into a very balanced red wine that pairs well with Comte cheese and a chicken, kale and celery root pot pie.
Refreshing, light
Elegant for a 2009
Great CdP.
Not the most powerful chateneuf du Pape region wine. Heals when allowed to breathe. Deep red color. On the palate blackcurrant, vanilla, oak, even a little blossom.

Very, very broad in the shoulders. I like the sun dried fruit character here, but I would like a little more on the herbal. A kiss of VA or Brett here wouldn't hurt either. Doesn't feel sterile, but it's a little button down. Possibly just one of the massive 2010s going closed.
Prowein 2019 Backlog rating. Just score for most, some notes.
First time I tried this ... wow!
Juicy jammy raspberry notes. Very warming and drinkable but high alcohol at 15%. Good value CNdP
concentrated and delicious.
A smooth, balanced wine with Pepper and tobacco notes.
Not overpowering like a US style Bordeaux. Perfect example of old world wine.
Very nice, drank 2022, Fred’s Paddington
Smooth. Complex. Fruity.
Fruity example of a CdP.  Really pleasant, approachable.
If you want top French wines, join Benom Paso and go tasting.
Drank the 2017. Pepper, mushrooms on the nose. Balanced, good mouth feel.
3.8 - Super nice wine. There is a lot of alcohol dominance on the nose and palate. The nose has tobacco, licorice and violet. The palate adds cooked dark fruit, plum and blackberry.
Sweet blue berry's flint and leather noise. Solid rich red color with a hint of maturing brown color. Solid tannins with blue berry on the palette. Good length but the tannins persist.
Pepper and spices on the nose. And plums. And dried figs. Velvety smooth plum explosion on the palate with hints of dill. Tannins are softening up. Never ending finish with more pepper.

Nose of blackberries, plum, licorice, chocolate and pepper.
Good body structure with soft tannins, ripe dark berries and lots of pepper spice.
A pleasant CDP of a poor vintage!
Very good. Black fruits. Peppar. Long aftertaste. Some tannins and some alcohol.  Nice wine. Took a long time before ut opened up in the glass. Worth it! Getting better and better!!
A great, fresh CdP. Lots of berry flavor, with the spiciness expected of CdP and additional cocoa and vanilla. Round, but structured. Quality fruit was used for this wine
4.1 Bottle decanted for 2 hr. Fantastic CDP with orthodox traits of dried herbs, licorice, pepper along with oak and earthy notes. Full bold CDP with a pleasant finish and a nice tingle
Dusty tannin.mellow nose. Fragrant. Very round. Feels light and interesting. Heaps of structure. Very interesting wine. Half way through the bottle and settling in comfortably well. Stand out wine
Exceptionally good Southern Rhone. Ripe fruits, intense spices, lots of layers. Very entertaining and very good to drink while retaining its character and complexity. 17/20
Chocolat, tobacco, oak, leather, spices... Robust wine, rather dry. My 1st glass was  great, 2nd glass was less easy to drink (but still enjoyable 😅). So I believe this wine is not for everyone...
Very fruity
So tasty
Nice Grenache
pepper plum
Braised SRs

Excellent value. Light and silky on first taste with ripe cherry / berries and xmas spices immediately noticeable. As you finish you get the dark chocolate coating and aftertaste - almost a bit dry when first out of the bottle. Great for midweek and to have handy at all times!

Medium ruby colour
Pronounced aromas of black fruit (black cherry), red fruit (raspberry and strawberry), baked/stewed fruit, black pepper, smoke, clove, nutmeg, cedar, leather, prune, earthy
Dry, medium + acidity
High tannins and alcohol
Pronounced flavours of licorice, spice, black pepper, earthy, forest floor
Full body, long finish

Very good wine.
Middle (+) intensive nose with notes of meat, black pepper, leather, strawberry, red cherry and marmelade.
Intensive on the palate. Dry, low in acidity, low tannins, high in alcohol, full body. Notes of cooked red cherry, nuts and caramell. Long finish

23.12.2017 - Perfumed red fruit nose with floral midpalate  ..medium bodied with soft acidity and tannins .. easy drinking but had expected more having heard exciting things about the makers

Treat fr W @ spontaneous pre-Christmas gathering @ TongWoh
Very high ratings yet my bottle was just average....storage problem? My tastes not sophisticated enough?
Bought at Straubs. Very smooth.
Dryness of the wine hits almost immediately, creating a menthol sensation.    Bitterness gives way to a slightly fruitier taste
Nice and fairly simple CNDP. Red and dark fruits with some telltale spiciness. Not overly powerful and paired well with beef
Liquorice, some volatile acidity, ripe dark fruit, confiture. Some sweetness at the start, balanced by the medium+ acidity. Good length.
Had a scent of cork but out of 7 people I was the only one to think so, so maybe it's just me. Either way, not a special moment.
Fully mature CdP with Tobacco , sandlewood and dried plums with a hint Of green herbs towards the end. Great with BBQ tonight.

Deep ruby going to garnet. Pronounced aromas of blackberry, plums, bramble, cherry, baked fruits, baked red plums, smoke, cloves, cinnamon, tobacco, liquorice, chocolate, coffee. Dry, medium plus acidity, high tannin, high alcohol, full body, pronounced intensity. Developing. Confirms on the palate all black fruits aromas, blackberry, plum, cooked fruits, spices, cloves, cinnamon, tobacco. Outstanding. Drink now, it has potential to age for long.

Second vintage in a row for this classic example of Chateau Neuf du Pape. Plums and cherries give way to soft cigar, vanilla and sweet spices, some dried fruit and cooked red plums. The palate is big and full and smoky and oaky. Bit of bitterness lets it down a wee bit.

Deep ruby colour.
Lovely complexity on the nose with pronounced notes of ripe black plums, red cherries, black cherries, also toast and smoke. The palate offers layers of aromas, mostly dried fruits, prunes, figs, dried cherries, savoury notes. An outstanding Chateauneuf du Pape with further ageing potential. Very enjoyable indeed.

Developing. Pronounced red and black cherry/plum, baked/preserved fruit, black pepper, medicinal. Clove, smoke, cedar, toast, chocolate. Cooked/dried cherry/plum, savoury, leather, tobacco, earth. High acid/tannin/alcohol. Full bodied. Long finish.

Solid wine that made me melt. Cranberry, strawberry and blackberry. Licorice, leather and dark chocolate. Juniper and rosemary. Dark but not heavy. Mod acidity with mild tannins. Finish that had you reaching back for the next sip.

Fantastic! Tasted blind on WSET L3, December 2016. Medium ruby colour. Ripe plums, cherries, cooked strawberry, bramble, jam. Cloves, toast, licorice, earth, prune. High alc, full bodied, med + tannins and acid, long finish. Developing nicely and will get more of those earthy, savoury flavours with time.

Picked up two bottles of this for €70, worth every cent. 

Noticeably dark in the glass. Rich and full bodied yet soft and gentle on the palate. Beautifully balanced and wonderfully complex. Super earthy with savoury notes, red & dark fruit and even hints of smoke and pepper. The most notable thing though is a long herbaceous aftertaste that lingers after each sip.

Paired perfectly with a vegetarian lentil bolognese (which was already drowned in a bottle of red!).

This bottle gave the most satisfying notes of red nibs, aka raspberry licorice, for those who don’t know nibs. As it opens up the darker stewed fruit of black cherry reveals itself along with earthy notes & bits of tobacco & clove.

Medium garnet in color, not clear, some sediment mixed in. This is definitely not filtered. Spiked cherries on the nose, like Luxardo cherries with some burbon on them. Garrigue and cassis on the nose. You can feel the alcohol. You can feel it on the palate too. A bit spicy. Some kirsch. Feels ripe but not over-ripe. It's just a big wine. Acidity is medium plus, tannins are resolved, mouthfeel is velvety. A bit of herbs and garrigue on the palate. It's not totally balanced. There's some heat on the finish.

Medium ruby. Pronounced aromas of stewed, ripe red and black fruit, olives, cedar, clove, developing prunes, liquorice and leather.

Dry, med+ acidity, med+ aft, ripe tannins, high+hot alc, full bodied, pronounced flavours of cooked fruits, liquorice and spice. Long finish.

Very nice indeed, prob needs a few more years to hit the peaks. High extraction, spends 4 weeks on skins, vines up to 70 yrs old.

Blend of 62% Grenache, 18% Mourvedre, 13% Syrah, 5% Cinsault and 2% Vaccarèse. Ruby red appearence. Aromas of cherries, ripe black fruit, prunes, Cassis, jammy touch; after swirling more aromas of leather, spices, wood, orange peel, silex and anise. On the palate, full ripe start, full bodied, where fruit and herbs meet in the sun, firm tannins (not yet completely melted), fruity acidity, orange peel touch in the long aftertaste. Finesse will come in a few years. Wine with potential! 4.2*

C9dP with 62% Grenache with as remaining grapes, Mouvèdre, Syrah, Cinsault and Vaccarèse, aged on foudres for 18 months. 
In my glas I note a Ruby-red dress. 
It spread pronounced sweet dark fruit, nicely impressions of cassis, chocolate, coffee and a whiff of anise and almond oil. 
The pallet gives a very ripe and sweet impression with a lot of depth. Again dark fruit, and chocolate but also roasted notes of coffee, a herbal touch and a tight minerality. Tannins are rather out of balance... ➡️comment

Finally back to CdP Saturday 😇!

My 1st Barroche! Domaine founded 1703 by Alexandre Barrot (from which domaine’s name derived). Still operated by Barrot family, it’s now just under 15 ha. Blend of 62 Grenache (some is >100 y-o & from beside château Rayas 😮), 18 Mourvèdre, 13 Syrah, 5 Cinsault, 1 Vaccarèse, 1 8 other CdP varietals.  Exquisite 👃of dark 🍒, plum, 💨, cassis, hint of anise. 👅is med+ acidity, tannins still kicking, long length, 💨, sour 🍒, anise flavours. Still 💪for 11! 4.2🌟!

Complex nose with plum, blackberry, leather, licorice, tobacco, cigar, pepper, minerals, earthy, slightly tart palate with good helping of tannins at the end, big and bold like one expects from Chateauneuf. Benefits from a long decanting.

Medium ruby. Pronounced flavours of stewed strawberry, prunes, cherry, plum, vanilla, toast, cloves, cedar, cooked fruit, earth and leather on the nose and palate. Dry, full bodied, with medium+ acid, tannins and high alcohol. Complex and still developing.

Bouquet of potpourri, earth, ripe cherry, focused ripe fruits with nice minerality and fine grained tannin. The finish is long and smooth, with interesting sweet cinnamon spice. Four hours later, however, the richness faded quite a bit. RP's 95 points score seems unjustified. It's at a good drinking window now. 92 points. March 15, 2018

WSET tasting on Saturday - Southern Rhône 🇫🇷

Medium ruby. Pronounced aroma intensity, black pepper, blackberry, red and black cherry, plum, vanilla, smoke, fig, prune, olives, leather, game and toffee. Developing.

Dry, medium(+) acidity, high tannins, high alcohol, full body. Pronounced flavours of fig, prune, black pepper, smoke, leather, chocolate, long finish.

Outstanding Q, enough acidity to balance the fruits, concentrated, good length & complexity. Ready to drink & potential for further ageing. 4.2

Nice balance! Easy to drink! I should get boxes of this wine. On the nose it is quite rough, alcohol and berries, and some tabacco. However on the palate its much smoother! Sweetness and jam. Dry finish. Enjoyable!

The rim of orange color on the edge. It means ’nice time to drink’. Cherry, ripe red fruit, prune, chestnut, toast aromas with pepper, herbs, spices backgrounds. Smooth and little rough tannins on the mid-palate then nice finish with milk chocolate, fresh grass nuance. Paired perfectly well with ’ang-butter’(baguette with red bean paste and butter). So fulfilling. 92pts(94pts with food).

Easy on the berry notes well structured and with recognizable terroir. Drinkable now but potential for several years in the cellar. 
Edit March 2020: structure still good but is getting a little blurry in the back of the mouth. Will most likely not gain from further cellaring.

Clear bright deep ruby, with tears. Clean, primary fruit: black fruit (bramble, black currant), red fruit (sour cherry), dried fruit (fig), secondary: sweet spice (clove), pungent spice (liquorice), tertiary animal (leather), pronounced intensity, developing. Dry, med+ acidity, high alcohol, full body, firm ripe tannin, high tannin, pronounced intensity with long finish, additional mint eucalyptus on palate. Outstanding, potential for ageing

Aromas of cherry, spice, licorice, blueberry and black pepper. Flavors of baked plum, black pepper and oak, with a high acidity and medium astringency. Full body with a smooth soft blueberry pie finish. Took this wine a couple hours to open up. Expected more.

93pts
Inky purple red with a little orange color of rim. The nose unveils fresh, vibrant aromas of blackberry, pepper, licorice and mint with oak aging. With a concentrated structure, blueberry, prune, coffee taste with medium to high acidity followed by a little bitter taste finish. Paired well with durian peanut. Good and balanced cdp.

At the end of the evening of specialties, just some solid common ground. Laroche is one of the coming CdP wineries and although young shows great potential. 

Incredible complex nose of berries, gravy, blood, graphite, black olives and Provincial herbs. On the palate light red fruit, like strawberry and raspberry. Spices, like white pepper, and again Provincial herbs, lavendel, very clearly licorice, metallic and sticky tannines. Definitively potential for 4.5* over a couple of years. Unexpectingly good!

Decanted for 90 minutes. Drink up now. At its peak. 

Appearance: dark garnet color. Huge legs. This is a big wine. 

Nose:  forest floor, berries

Taste: soft, supple. Even though Grenache is a small percentage, it comes through. Medium bodied, medium finish.

Boom! Rich. Mature oak. Full bodied. Ripe berries. Pepper on finish. Apparently a bad year in CDP but this one kind of kills it. Surprise. Lovely. Elegant. Definatly way above average but not the best CDP.

Barnyard, brambles, wet leaves and forest floor. Dark purple in colour. So far so good...but, intense and too alcohol rich to drink with a main course. Would have been better with a salty cheese. Sweet dark fruit and unsmoked cigar although a touch too much oak. Thinking about it the day after there were intense and massive flavours, just didn’t come across as well balanced, and again too much alcohol

Maybe 4.5 but I didn’t decant this time w/ robisty. Still getting pepper and jerky and that long lovely finish. It was a bit tight and should have been decanted for sure but still lovely out of the bottle
Huge soft alcoholic and fruity. A bit too much of all
leather plum pepper
Step up and desided to open my wallet and I am pleased I did, this wine should have been drunk first and not last. But as I just love red, I can say this wine is a red that is easy to enjoy
This was a wonderfully smooth. Raisins, fig notes with bursts of black cherry throughout.  Beautiful mid-palette finish.
Always a winner - great balance, lovely drop
Good wine...so elegant

Found it disappointing.  One dimensional and lacking in flavour.  Shame.
Lot of different overripe berries - plums, cherries, cowberries, blueberries - all put together in a jar of marmalade. Hints of spices in the aftertaste.

2016 was by all accounts one of the better vintages for La Barroche.  I have struggled though with most Chateauneuf de pape.  Very dark colour.  Opaque purple.  There is more depth in the fruit too.  A touch jammy which is unusual.  Raspberry, anise.  The palate shows more depth.  Here the true savoury flavours come through.  It’s meaty, Smokey, cinnamon.  More earthy experiences.  Rated 3.7.  It didn’t quite balance in the end but was certainly ok.  At $90 though I could not justify a case.

Pronounced nose with quite a bit going on - black cherry main fruit, with some vanilla and sweet and Smokey spices. Full bodied and sharp alcohol with black pepper coming through on the palate and long finish. Didn’t love it though
A lovely surprise.
One of the most concentrated wines from Ch d Pape I ever smelled and tried. Julien Barrrot states that this is the best vintage since 1985. Just buy and store for the future.
Had the 2011 in CNP.  This time the 2013 in Chicago at RPM Steak.  Same great, peppery nose and taste.  Lovely color.  Nice finish.  Just a great wine
Not enough aroma but pleasant. A little thinner than most CDP. Les Nomades March 25,2017. Smooth finish and no tannins

A well made Chateauneuf with purity and freshness. However, I find it a bit lacking in the complexity and mélange of flavors I found so compelling in many other fellow CdP's. The smokiness and tar were prevalent and smoothed out a bit with time in the glass allowing for more taste of the fruits. Enjoyable, but my gut tells me you can find better at this price point. We shall see!

Zoom wine exchange tasting #29
05.07.20
Theme: Rhone wines

WMK's TB. Quite floral initially, with red berries, sour cherry, raspberry, hint of brown chocolate. With more airtime, mouthfeel firmed up, but still tasted a little thin on the palate, smooth sl smoky tannins, but not exciting or structured enough. Medium finish.

3.5☆ felt this a weak vintage/expression of a CDP. RP states these awesome wines are made by the young, incredibly talented, Julien Barrot. From sandy rather than pebbly gravel soil.

typical of the vintage, it is showing forward and fleshy with not too too much depth. a nice effort for 2011. boysenberry, blackberry, kirschwasser, black pepper, sage, thyme. very primary. i don't think this will be an ageing CdP so enjoy now-5 years and with a great lamb burger.

Dark cherry red, opaque. Brooding mulberry, ripe cherry, Cornus mas, dried figs, raisins. Potent acidity, ample but not overbearing body with light tannins. Cherry, mulberry, dried figs on the palate. Finish a tad short. Good with lamb.

3.4
Here we have notes as leather, liquorice, red cherry, plum compote, cinnamon, tar, jammy notes and dark chocolate. A medium- acidity, medium- tannins, high acidity, a full body, a medium+ intensity and long finish. I miss the fruit notes in this animalic wine.

Together with chili con carne we drink this C9P which is unfortunately over it’s top. Dark red coloured and petrol thick. The nose is flat, a signal that the taste will be “a surprise”. Still lots of blue and black berries, licorice, earth, pepper,wood; however, its fruit from “yesterday”. It fits well with the chili, but P/Q isn’t anymore what it used to be. My mistake, I kept it too long in my cellar. So, if you got some stored somewhere.... drink now ...and enjoy🍷

Still solid, need time to breeding. It is typical CDP, medium to full bodied, quite thick and soft tannins, really weak dark fruit scent. But think of its value, too expensive, so I can not give stars over 4.

Excellent Châteauneuf-du-Pape made mainly of Grenache (90%) with addition of Syrah (10%). Amazingly complex on the nose with fruity aromas (blackberry, plum, cherry, raspberry) and additional notes of oak, chocolate, tobacco, leather, smoke, pepper and licorice. Deep purple with garnet hue, full bodied, velvety mouthfeel, round and persistent tannins, medium acidity, alc 14.5%. Lingering spicy finish with aftertaste of chocolate and cinnamon.

Red wine from Cotes du Rhone. Lots of red fruit, plum, violet in the sniff. Complex taste with the same aromas and very full bodied and round. Lovely CNDP but quite pricy

Nice dinner table CdP, fruity and licoricey of a typical Grenache. Color is also typical translucent ruby of Grenache, not deep garnet as the Vivivo ad claims! Some peppery notes from the Syrah too. However it doesn’t contain Mourvèdre nor the other CdP grapes.  The wine lacks structure due to low acidity. I doubt the bottle would improve with age. The finish was also not as great as some commenters suggested. The Ogier CdP has definitely more bangs for the bucks!
Blackberry and blueberry aromas. Med-full bodied, already quite smooth for 2018

30032022 - private dinner with Chef W. Paired with Roasted Local Duck breast with Orange sauce. Young & bright ruby red pour. Candied berries with green bell pepper notes. Palate however is disjointed and tannins is dull. Once popped, decant for 30mins and drink immediately. Do not leave in the glass for too long. Drink this in its youth now.

At first, bell pepper notes accompanied by harsh SO2 had dominated. Then after a couple of hours breathing, it has unleashed the potentials of beautiful flavour of peppery Rhone Syrha. Surely, a little lack of abilities and patience to enjoy the elegance from the terrior of Rhone. But I like a vino that tells me more than I have. Personally, I can't assess it more higher than its reputation.

30032022 - Private fine dining with Delas wines. Paired with aged duck breast l'orange. Bright ruby red colour with candy & slight vegetals on the nose. Medium bodied with mild acidity & slightly disjointed tannins. Red fruit predominantly with red currant & red cherry. Not to my likings maybe it’s too young or just not my style. Served by decanter.

CNY reunion dinner at Grand Imperial in Bangsar 🍊 🐅 🐯 🧨 Its been 2 long years, glad we could eat out together again 🇲🇾 

Bold with very fruit forward blackberry and raspberry notes, and after about 30 mins in the glass.. Vanilla and some cherry came through. Mild perfume nose and short to medium finish was kind of dissapointing, even for a sub USD40 CdP.

Still so much to learn about CdPs, make mine a Bordeaux for now .. Happy Year of the Tiger 🐅 🐯

The palate adds blackberry and black cherry, and more obvious oak. Rich, spicy and satisfying. Will improve. Excellent Châteauneuf. Colorful berries, vanilla and oak on the aroma. Ripe plum, black currant on the palate. Medium acidity, medium to high tannins. Medium finish with spice and some bitterness.
All the classic richness is here. Plum, blackberry, blueberry and chocolate cake. Tannin is minimal with alcohol that sneaks up on you. Needs time.

Decanted for an hour, showing pure red fruits, nice focus and energy, tannins approachable, with more air Grenache typicity came more prominent. Nice, restrained SdP that I quite like, especially in the first half, where it was more vivid and bright. 91p

Ripe fruits black cherry and raspberry aromas with hints of leather, clove and cinnamon . It's full bodied wine &  has silky refined tannin, a fruit forward wine. Ready to drink now & has the potential to keep 5-7 years more in the bottle.

Fine CdP. Opaque ruby with ruby-orange rim. Slow legs. Oak, mushrooms, sweet cherries. High tannins, medium-high body. Dry herbs, dark chocolate, mocha. Attractive bitterness. Sweet finish and aftertaste.

Deep ruby color.
On the nose with pronounced intesity, animal smell of leather and funky barnyard at first, cherry, blueberry, pepper, chocolate, cloves, still developing.
On palate acidity medium+, body medium+, tannins medium+, alcohol high, leather, cherry, earthy, pepper with medium intesity and long finish.
Very good CdP that you can drink or age more.

Long time since CnP tasted last time. Like meeting old friend for a long time.👍

Intense Garnet purple colour. High viscocity.  Strong forest, dark fruit, red fruit on nose. Rich palate.  Blackberry, plum, oak, vanilla, raspberry, seducing Floral notes. Full bodied, fruity but dry. Softened, but still strong acidity drives long delicious aftertaste.

Not the best vintage, but wine is powerful, decent typical product. Now at peak, but drinkable still for many years.👍🍷

A 4.2 by any standard, great perfumed nose, warm palate, enjoyable tannins , nice warm finish a tad fruity but very elegant
Another stand out from CDP

Great Châteauneuf-du-Pape, black cherry and raspberry, leather and cinnamon are present. Robust wine, persistent, elegant-grained tannins and long finish.
Grenache 90%, Syrah 10%. Deep garnet color, strong spicy nose with ripe cherry and licorice aromas, silky palate, chewy tannins, vibrant acidity, lingering finish.

Smells Smokey and oakey maybe a touch of plum as well, big and juicy ripe cherry flavors with an earthy tone, mild tannins and lie acidity with a nice finish.

Continuing with the 2007 vintage, dug out this Delas CdP under a few boxes and the labor paid off! I actually picked this up at a very attractive price (sticker still on the bottle), this wines packs muscle under its silk robe, deep burgundy garnet color with some bricking, nose exhibits violet, dried lavender, clove, pot roast, asphalts, charcoal, black cherry, licorice and cacao, full body with silky tannin and balanced acidity, tastes of blackcurrant, hazelnut cream, almond, dark chocolate & licorice.

Deep ruby red colour with garnet rim. Intense fruity and smoky aromas of blackberries, plums, vanilla and spicy oak. Medium bodied wine opens up with dark slightly jammy berries, licorice, balanced acidity, grippy tannins and finishes with bitter chocolate aftertaste. Nice on its own or along red meat and vegetable stews, roasted red meat with mushrooms, hard cheese.

Incredibly expressive wine! Sour Strawberries, ripe raspberries, rose petals, black pepper, bacon like richness, dry medicinal notes reminiscent of bandaids and iodine; Dramatic flavors brilliantly integrated in the glass. The tannins are tight on the gums and the body has a pleasant weightiness. A classic.

On the nose some lovely chocolate and oak. There are hints of cigar box and the autumn leaf brown tinges hover around the edges. The wine is smooth. The tannins tamed over the last almost decade. I loved the blackberry pie and spiced finish. There is a cooked dark fruit finish along with a rewarding cassis ending.

Eye: clear, mid intensity, ruby color.
Nose: clean, mid intensity, flowers, fruits, green vegetables, a hint of wood, complex.
Taste: dry, mid acids, high tannins, mid body, green vegetables, pepper, hint of oak, continues well from the nose impression into taste, long aftertaste.
Conclusion: Excellent, harmonic, elegant red wine from Châteauneuf-du-Pape!

Perfectly matured Chateauneuf-du-Pape, nose of candied dark fruits, prunes, leather, cured meat, cinnamon and dried herbs. Flavors of sherry jam, blackberries, chocolate, laurel and black pepper. Delicious.

Intriguing Chateneuf du Pape that is not overwhelmed by a too strong alcohol content (it can happen with this AOC). Red fruits smell. Spicy, fruity and tannins still young in mouth for a long lasting experience.

Very earthy but framed in a beautiful setting with lush blackberry and cocoa clearly showing through.  This is a baby of a wine, just beginning to show itself.  Let it age but it is such a beauty now!
In a full day of tasting northern Rhone,  this wine reminded me of the appeal of the South.  Well structure,  perfumed and good wine.
leather oak pepper blackberry

Maybe too young. Very alcoholic. Oak and chocolate when open. Takes more than an hour for chocolate to bloom. Half a day in the fridge, returns with more tannin and plum, strawberry, cherry. Still alcoholic.

It has multi-layers of ripe black and red fruits, herbs, spices with a long length. But it feels light relatively. 2021 is the right time to drink. Fulfilling and attractive. It paired well with steak and grilled vegetables. 92+pts.

It seems still young, but not bad to drink and easy. Fresh cherry, prune, blackberry and woody oak. Quite sweet, weak characteristics of CDP, slightly bitters end of the palate. Not recommend to long term maturing, after 1~2yrs, good drinkdate.

Captivating perfumed nose & a transparent clear appearance with deep pinkish rims, this 2017 Ch du pappe is a crowd pleaser. If ever a wine spelt fruit in every aspect, this one is it. Nicely balanced wine with a nice bit of intense licorice in the finish that adds another dimension to this otherwise fruit centric experience. The wine surely deserves a revisit in a few more years. This seemed to be a fully mature Medoc. A treat!

An 8y old Médoc sampled by @[1|2962158|Ruud Berlie]! Opening sensual & earthy with blueberries, crushed black currants, ripe brambles, plums & cassis kiss wrapped in brushwood & forest floor followed by pencil shavings, leather, dried herbs, coffee & fruitcake. Earthy palate balanced by dark fruit notes enhanced by morello acids while ending medium with some drying tannins. Feels a bit more melted than a year ago, giving an uplift here!

Sample exchange with @[1|2962158|Ruud Berlie] #8 - 🇫🇷 Ah, one of Ruud's personal favourites, the Bas-Médoc from Château La Tour de By in Bégadan, Gironde. After the '09 already tasted, this '15 is again a great year!👍

🍇 60% CS, 35% Merlot & 5% Pt Verdot from an average of 40 years old vines planted on gravel grounds near the Gironde, aged 12m in oak from Alliers (1/3 new).

📝Juicy & ripe fruit (cassis, cherry) on the👃with floral lift & nice gravelly warmth; Fresh & appetising palate👄 with ⤵️⤵️

An old acquaintance .......
Have drunkmore than 20 vintages of this wine and we visited them twice, but in recent years a little lost sight.
The ‘’15 is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot,
Decanted for 2 hours, on the nose ripe red cherries, blue berries, bramble, pencil, tabacco, spice, cedar, medium bodied palate with the same fruit flavors, fine ripe tannin, toast, good acidity, already nice but a bit closed, wil bennefit more cellering, It was a nice renewed acquaintance..

Such a good and reliable Château from the very North of the medoc. 
Firm structure with cassis, muted tertiaries at first.  Drying tannins , slightly .. but after an hour developing umami , mushroom and wet earth. Drink up

Clear, medium, red with purple tones.

Nose: Mature, dark fruit. Cassis, blackcurrants, blackberry and black cherry. Earthy tones of forrest floor, cedar from barrel. Hint of green herbs and mint.

Palate: Juicy, dense and rich. Nose jonins palate, especially the cassis dominated fruit intensity. Silky tannins, structured with moderate grip and good acidity.

Long finish.

A great Médoc, real value for your penny. I just picked up the book 'Inside Bordeaux', this was great company with the outstanding read.

88 Points, drink now until 2023. Medium deep ruby colored with visible rims, spicy nose with lactic hues, rosemary and pepper, black current and vegetables, rather austere and rustic, somehow ancient but in a positive way. Good complexity and balance, medium bodied and a decent medium finish. Good value! Our local Kaufland wanted to get rid of this at just €9.99... I've got two strong arms, let me help!

Saturday again; an old  wine! A Tour de By this time from 2000. And it still has hard tannins!! Now in decanter, lets see how it develops in the next 2 hours.. Well it did make the dinner this reputable cru bourgeois. Nice nose of cedarwood and black currants as highlights. On the palate a balanced and nicely softened wine, but it still has a forceful impression. Amazing really. It sure has an ageing ability. Reputation confirmed!

A good companion to grilled bavette steak tonight. Always a reliable producer Tour de By is a good bordeaux bourgeois with a great pricepoint. 65% cabernet saivignon. This domaine ages well I have had great 82s a couple of years ago, no problem to age well.
Very enjoyable indeed. Still in excellent shape, very much alive and kicking. Elegant  Bordeaux that I'm happy to recommend.
Great with a steak!
Today I got right impression from this wine - bold and rich one, structure as blood. Blackberry and tobacco as main drivers, leather as supporters
Always a pleasure to drink over aged wines ! This 1995 vintage from chateau la Tour de By is ending is life in some deep aromas of mature red fruit.
Fully developed, gamy, mushrooms, moka cover black fruits. Mellow tannins. Excellent (see vintage comparison with 2005 and 2009)
Don't wait and open it now. Yet pleasant nose of leather and dust. Palate with plums and delicate finish with nice and light bitterness.

A brilliant medoc. 
Nice oil on the nose and perhaps a bit of herbs. 
Taste is dry and hints of some burnt tones of maturation. 
Yes, brilliant.
Lots more fruit than '08. Classic Bordeaux. Red berries. Nice tannins actually. Good value too. Tobacco, leather. Great nose and taste.
dark red, spicy cherries on the nose, leather plum and black berries on the palate and a most wonderful long and wide finish
Typical Medoc dominated by cabernet sauvignon, elegant, dry, balanced, with some red fruity merlot notes. Good value for the money
Besides the blueberry there is a floral feeling. Not a very rich wine but enjoyable. Medium body medium tannin. Ready to drink now.

4⭐️ for a nice Cab Sauvignon with smell of basement and leather 
Taste of black currant, violet, and oak 
A heavy but we’ll balanced wine 🍷
Could still have aged more but what a great Medoc this is. Perfectly balanced, hints of black currents, prune and nut meg spices.
Some orange in the color; nicely matured. Powerful, yet very soft. Hints of leather and chocolate also some spice. Good wine.
Sweet berries, plums, leather and wood on the nose. Fresh and darker fruit with nice balance in the mouth. Softer tannins and long mouth feeling.
Huge fruit, dominated by cherries at first. Ready to drink now. Decent finish - generally a great inexpensive 2010 Bordeaux!.
(3,8) Pleasant and with great price-quality. Blueberries, mocca, cassis, chocolate, tobacco, subtle green touch to it. @UGCB tasting, Amsterdam
Good potential, very much like the 2008. This one also a bit to young. Powerfull tannins, dark berries, fruity. Full bodied, long finish.
Vanilla/wooden nose black fruits cassis blackberry taste long finish soft tannins. Open one hour before drink it. True nice medoc style wine.
It's a great wine, with almost brown color on the edge, 'cause of its age, ruby transparent, exuding French mineral terroir and candied berries.
A great value and really hit the spot for the mid-week wine. Very well made Medoc. Blackberry, cassis, menthol, leather.  Bottle didn’t last long.
Flavourful, decent length, a typically enjoyable Medoc. Could do with more complexity but approachability is also a virtue. 3.9

On the nose: blackcurrant and cherry. Taste: blackberry, blackcurrant, cherry, plum, oak, leather 🇫🇷

Mye taninier, en god 3,8
On the 👃 alcohol presents strongly. Plumbs and chocolate. Deep ripe black cherries and 80% dark chocolate. A hint of gooseberry. Lovely.
Deep ruby colour. Medium intensity blackcurrant, pepper, herb on the nose. Dry with high acidity. Medium tannins. Medium body. Medium alcohol. Medium finish.
Typical claret, ruby red full of cherry fruit high acidity dry but well balanced some more years to brake it in. Plum, a little hay and straw white pepper in aftertaste
An elegant blend of CS, Merlot and Petit Verdot. This 2011 showed good balance of tannins and aromas of blueberry, dark cherries and chocolate. Very good cost-benefit

Kept not so bad. Maybe was too old for “his best” but still wonderful color. Ruby red (almost transparent).

Black fruit, some spiciness  at this age.

Well balanced!!!

very nice medoc, seems to have reached its potential (10y). excellent nose with caramel and fruit. smooth palate with light nice and elegant tannins. decent length.

Exceptionnel. 1996 was a great year in Bordeaux.
This bottle has a strong and intense think dark fruits and oak. And in same time it is silky and round.
2010 a good year, good fresh acidity and roundend tannins, with black current, and more of spices tobacco, leather in a long finish. Lovely to have in a celler also.

Oak. Tobacco. Cedar. Red cherry. Vanilla. Black currant leaves. 
Classic Bordeaux. 
Easy to like and drink. 
Perfect with read meat. Cheeses. And as it is.
Very nice wine to drink while cooking the food. Will work with food as well. Typical Bordeaux, some hints is plum and cedar as well as oak. Smooth but still not weak.
Typical Bordeaux red with strong notes of oak, leather, dried figs and cherry on the nose, red currant, pepper, oak, cedar, dried fig, and chocolate on the palate.
Dark berries, oak, plum and leather on the nose. Taste hits you early with the oak, and the plum. A mild wine that is low on acidity, a bit dry, but not overwhelmingly.

Dark and powerful. Roasted and rich. Polished tannins and lush texture. 

blueberry blackberry oak leather tobacco blackcurrant cedar cherry plum earthy chocolate smoke
One of the first classy wines I tasted when started to work in the wine store when I was 17. Still a fantastic memory. Great wine during a lot of years.
Cabernet Sauvignon 60%, Merlot 35% and Petit Verdot 5%. A cru bourgeois with blackcurrant, leather and tobacco on the nose. Surprisingly light body. Showing age nicely.

Jammy red fruits, plum, forrest floor. Palate is complex all tertiary aromas, mushroom, hay, leather. Deliciously rounded tannins. This is The kind of wines my parents used to buy by the case in the 80's and 90's. This one surprisingly survived to our drinking pleasure! Buy another case? Oh yes!!! If cellaring conditions were optimal... :-)

Outstanding Médoc; the excellent 1982 vintage is at its peak: garnet red color with brownish reflections, beautiful nose of mature Bordeaux, ripe undergrowth fruit aromas, earthy notes, elegant on the palate, surprisingly youthful & fresh, good acidity, round tannins, nice length, great value for money
Yes that’s a good one☝️, needs a bit oxygen and time but afterwards you will get a wide and tasteful drop, good for food and by him self with a ( or more) piece chocolate! Very recommended!
Probably at its best now. Soft, round and well treated tannins. It needs air for sure and when it does, it opens up to a world of mint and earthy like aromas. Yes please.
Dark fruit, black currant, blueberries, sour cherry and some tobacco.Medium full body. The acidity is a bit much sometimes but in some moments it feels like it lifts and carries all fruitiness

3.9 ⭐️

Dark berry fruits upfront, with good underlying minerality. Medium-full bodied, medium tannins and long finish

Quality Bordeaux 🍷 off winelist paired with grilled lamb loin and duck confit
Fantastic wine. Ash nose with a refined fruit driven mouth that stays with you. Great for spicy food, game, rich pasta's or tenderloin
This 2004 is still drinking beautifully - but it may be beginning to fade! I think it's time to drink up! But it's one of my favourite clarets - the blend is 80%CS, 15% Merlot & 5
A lovely Bordeaux from a perfect year. Not the most well known chateau but with 2005s it doesn’t matter too much. Just really drinkable and no doubt drinking perfectly now.
Eye: standard ruby. Nose: wild strawberry and wet earth, with light aroma of plum and lightest shade if cedar. Palate: medium-to full body, enough balanced and mild. Not bad at all 3.8/5.0
Stinas of lavendel, black currants, vanilla, oak, blackberries. Flavor of black currants, leather, blackberries and oak. Muscular mouth filling with longlived aftertaste.
This was medium to full bodied, lovely savoury blackcurrant fruit with dusty chocolate, good depth and very smooth. Still quite primary for a 15 year old Cru Bourgeois. Long finish.
Vertical to understand he development. Tertiary notes of earthiness, coffee, and leather are much more prominent. Tannin. Is ripe and great concentration of flavours (WSET Diploma Day12- Bordeaux)

Surpresingly high acidity in an eleven years old Bordeaux. 
Cedar tree, newly cut grass, blackberry and blackcurrant on the nose. Medium tannins and black fruits on the palete.
Opened a magnum of the 2012. Very easy drinking. Light leather and earth in the nose. Smooth, dark cherry and blackberries with a medium dryness and a hint of alcohol on the finish.

Complex nose. Wet leather and tannins. Ripe grapes. 

Leather continues on the palate. Powdery soft tannins. Dusty hay to conclude all of these hints towards horses.

Nicely balanced. Good drink.

Strawberry sweetness and animal notes on the nose, lovely crimson robe. Medium bodied with notes of oak, blackcurrant and red fruit.
The perfect wine for a steak-frites sauce au poivre :)
Medium to full body wine, nice pairing with meat, preferably beef or light meat. Not a complex wine, easy to drink and enjoy the flavors of black/red fruits with balanced tannins
Intense bouquet, wooden aromas, dark berries, faint spices. Dominant tannins complemented by moderate acidity. A very enjoyable red wine.
A wonderful Bordeaux without being too aggressive. Restrained tannins, dark fruit and some familiar oak. Very “wet” and juicy on the aroma, and a classically French wine overall!
All you want from a wine, really. A nice, drinkable, dry, dark Bordeaux with enough juicy tannins to wanting to come back for more. 92 points WE, 91 points James Suckling.

Bargain! 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot.

Oak, Tobacco and cedar. Blackberry and black plum. Good acidity and length. Definitely a wine to try again!
Pencilshavings, cassis and milk chocolate. Lovely structure and extration of fruit. Although the expression is rather simple today, it will bee stunning in ten years time.

Strawberry, cherry, pepper and wood. Chocolate and meat.
Very smooth and firm mouthfeel. Fresh fruitiness. This is a busy bistro with lots of people talking and enjoying the evening.

Eye: Pale Garnet. 

Nose: Light intensity. 

Mouth: Dry. High tannins, medium acidity and high alcohol. Medium- flavor intensity and a bit short finish.

Quite good balance.
Two more of these went down the hatch yesterday. See TN from earlier this year. Hasn't reached its peak. 6 left. I'll save those for some years. Served with Boeuf Bourguignon.

Deep red colour with brick red hints. On the nose dark fruit. On the palate blackcurrant and plum. Well aged at the current time. I decanted it to get rid of the sediment, and there are some light tannins, but it doesn’t need much air. Smooth and definitely has the flavour of a Merlot dominant aged claret.

4,1 ⭐ Typical Medoc from the Château de Tour de By 2017 from the magnum bottle. Deep red. Blackfruit nose. Flavours of blackberry, vanilla and oak. This one is already good but would gain by some years in thr cellar. Tasted at Jacques’ Wein-Depot Germany.

Very accessable 2010 Medoc, Open nose, red fruit, etheric freshness, laurel and ham. Crunchy palate, fruity and charming. Seems to be more like a charming 2009 than an earthy and tannic 2010. surprising! And good!

Medium garnet color. Strawberry, leather, forest floor, vanilla and rose flower on the nose. Strawberry, black cherry, dark chocolate and vanilla on the palette. Long and nice finish. I really like this one!

Medium intensity with orange along the edges. Blackberries and ceder wood on the nose. Lots of bellpepper, leather and tobacco on the palate. Tannins are perfect, but fruit is a little weak. Long finish.

Oakier woodier nose than the last with sweet tobacco, dried raisins / sultanas and a little blueberry. 
In the mouth the tannins are better integrated and smoother, there’s a little less fruit but more oak, cedar and leather. 
Needed decanting for a few hours.

Dark, relatively clear, red crimson color. Typical Bordeaux bouquet of dark fruit, black currant, blackberry, blueberries, plum, cherry, oak, cedar, pencil shavings, earth, anise, maybe some eucalyptus and iron. Full fruity body with medium tannins and balanced acidity. Long fruity and licorice aftertaste. Some time in the glass kept improving it. An excellent value. A half bottle with quality steak for two.

Medium ruby colour. Nose: Medium intensity of black currant, plum, chocolate and tobacco. Palate: Dry, with high acidity and tannin, medium alcohol, body and flavour intensity of black currant, plum, chocolate and tobacco. Medium finish. Very good quality.

A well valued Medoc. A blend of 60% cab Sauvignon, 35% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot. A nose of ripe red cherries, black currant and tobacco. The palette follows with a rich blend of dark fruit, cherry, and cassis instilled with oak, chocolate and leather. Full and dense with well balanced ripe tannins that leave an acidic, long lasting finish. A very good valued wine!

Best Tour de  By I have had ~ too young in sure but duck confit and lentils needed something.. took an age to open to a gorgeous richness .
I bought a couple of cases a year ago at the Bordeaux tasting.. affordable and attractive too .
Happy Christmas 🎄🍷

👀 Pours medium purple. 
👃 Raspberries, tobbac pipe, notes of vanilla 
👄Raspberry seeds, coffee, ash aka. powdered stone, booze a bit. 
🤔 Heavy-bodied with long finish, multi-dimensional, the vintage peaking now and upcoming 2-3 years. A slight hint of spirit odour/taste is the only drawback man can stick to at this prrice range. Value for money here in Norway. 
[4.2]

The 2010 outperforms all the other years I have tasted so far of this red. Possibly the 2015 vintage will be better but the 12 bottles ordered will only arrive next year. This bottle delivers all the Bordeaux goodies you are looking for. Superb taste and incredible PQ.

I drank so many bottles of médoc, especially Tour de By the past two years or so. I love that typical médoc style. First impression with every vintage is clay. 
2005 adds blue fruit but actually I don’t care so much. With Médoc I want to drink clay. And when in ripe vintages some blue fruit appears too I love it. So, in my synesthesia style: a blend of Saturday and Friday noon

Very dry with high tannins and plenty of French oak. Majority Cab Sauv with Merlot and Petit Verdot - undoubtedly a left bank Bordeaux. Oaky, earthy, mushroom.  Not a lot of fruit, perhaps just a little sour cherry and black currant.

Medium ruby red. Medium+ intensity. Developing nose. 
Aromas: red cherry, nutmeg, clove, cassis, oak, cooked red berries. 
Palate: dry, med alc, med+ acidity, med+ tannins, med+ body, med finish. Plum, cherry, a little creamy, wet floor. 
Very good wine. Can drink now, but better hold for a couple years

(Decanted for one hour)
Deep red colour with a brick red hue. Maturing nose showing dried fennel and anis, leather and blood in a broad and wide way. Softening tannins on the palate combined with an intense drying fruitiness on the mid before the lengthy finish showing some iron notes. 
🍷Best 2014-2029

The appearance is Ruby red, hint of purple. 

The aromas are cedar, cassis, black currant and spices. 

The taste is oaky, dark fruit, touch of laurel, juicy, long finish and nice acidity. 

Pair it with it with beef, grilled meat, red meats, hard cheeses, lamb, red meets, stews And game. 13%. Leon Colaris.

Medium intensity Garnet red color. Pronounced intensity on the nose packed full of blackcurrant, mint, pepper and ceded. Low sweetness, medium acidity, high tannins and medium alcohol. Full body with a lot of blackcurrant, mint, pepper and ceder on the palate. Medium finish and overall very good quality! Excellent wine!

Dark ruby red. Plum, blackberry, cassis. Oak coming through with a smooth mouthfeel and cedar, vanilla and tobacco. Leather, earthy and smoke showed too with a hint of red cherry. Slight sharpness and a pretty dry mid palate. Tasted alongside Tour de By ‘10 and the ‘11 was definitely more approachable and expressive.

Deep ruby, on the nose blackberries  red blum mint tobacco with a green herbaceous note. In the mouth its
Full bodied medium + acidity medium + grippy tannins.
Dark fruits with maybe rhubarb🤨 medium alcohol smoke and clove from wood
The wine is developing.Very good for 100 kr

Who says drinking Good French wine is not affordable? Chateau La Tour de By is one of the oldest in the Medoc area. Best recent vintages: 2005, 2009, 2010, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2019. Its vines are 40 years old. The grapes are machine harvested. The wine is aged in 30% new oak barrels. Their second wine is La Roque de By. I enjoyed this wine’s fruit forward aromas and also its medium tannins and acids.

Fruity medoc. As it matures it smoothens out which makes it really pleasant (loosing the acidity of the younger years). We tried to develop it even further by opening the bottle some hours in advance, but 8 years after the vintage that was a risky mistake (however the first glasses were Excellent).

Lovely dark ruby hue. Strong aromas of burnt oak with lots of blackberries and blueberries. Unctuous fruit and smokiness on the palate. Tight tannins give a long and luxurious finish. Pair with a homemade steak and ale pie

Dinner wine. I stated at the beginning of this year that I was going to drink more Bordeaux from now on,  but I somehow forgot.. well this is an example of why I should. Good value wines with that particular Bordeaux character also at a lower price point. Double-decanted and getting air before dinner. Classic nose, bell pepper, pencil shavings, licorice, garrigue. On the palate nice texture, clean and pure, spicy and savoury, dry and dark, nice tannins and will also improve I guess.

Nose of tar,slight charcoal,smoked dark berries and animal notes,black currant leaf,vanilla,violet. Tatse is dry and light,with pleasant dry tannins,black and red currant leaves,cedar and mint,not sweet fig jam,non sweet chockeberry. Very gastronomic-goes with rye bread,roasted chicken and Asian chicken liver stomach

Very affordable and solid Bordeaux from magnum bottle… fruit forward with cassis, cherry, dark berries. Chocolate, leather, light green bell pepper note. Black pepper. Fruity acidity, pleasant tannin supporting medium bodied well defined but still quite young structure. Medium finish. Lots of life, can certainly age further, developing more of smoothness, harmony, and balsamic notes. No need to rush. Have 2013 in the cellar and don’t think it’s anywhere near the end yet… 😉

Very intense and thick dark ruby red in colour. Good cassis / black current nose and equally fruity palate. Nice smooth and intense tannins give it a lovely finish. A wonderful high/class every day wine. (Mar 2017).

Dark bluered colour.                                                

Aromas of toasted oakbarrels, raisins, cured meat and chocolate.                                       

Spicy taste of toasted oakbarrels, raisins, blueberries, coffee and chocolate.                      

Fullbodied, high acidity, nice tannins and a long finish. Great with spicy pasta.                    

"Wine is bottled poetry"

3.8
A nice cru bourgeois, this medoc wine is made with 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot.
In the glass, it shows as a deep almandine red garnet color with hints of jarositic pigmentation.
A nose with aromas of blueberries, flowers and eucalyptus. 
The palate had smooth tannins well aligned with the moderate acidity. The flavors of berries with dirt are pleasant. 
Needed air and it delivered a nice juice. Another one generously provided by Peter.

Dark red colour with purple tints. Nose of pepper and blackberry. Subtle hints of toast and licorice.
Full bodied. Acidic with present tannins. Cedar on the palate along with dark berries, herbs and other wooden notes. Complex and elegant, delicious!

Drinking a nice small bottle of red wine 🍷 from Boudreaux left bank Médoc Boudreaux France 🇫🇷 

Vintage 2016 

13,5 % alcohol 🍷 

Grapes 🍇 are 60 % Cabernet Sauvignon 35% Merlot 5% Petit Verdot

Really dark red colour 

A very lovely real cork 

Aged one year on oak barrels 

Chateau is very old from 1500s 

 oak blackcurrant  tobacco  cedar plum chocolate 🍫  blueberry 🫐 

Have too try more red wine 🍷 from France 🇫🇷 I really like this one ☝️ it’s elegant in a pleasant way!

Price209 SEK 22 dollars 💵 20 euro 💶

4.0 ⭐️
Deep ruby, non-transparent in glass. The nose is rich and robust with hints of milk, cassis, cherries, plums, wet moss, mushrooms. After short decanting, black berry notes open up nicely. Moderate acidity, dry, medium bodied, flannel structure. The taste is full of black berries with hints of cassis, chokeberry, blueberry, black tea, quite high alcohol and a shift to higher acidity. Aftertaste is gentle but long. Serious and a nice one.

Great find find from around the corner. Pepper, lavender and blackberry on the nose. A subtle smoke on the tounge with strong middle taste of blackberry that finishes in tannic complexity and dry oak.

W.i.p. For day two, awaiting for it to open up some more. Dark red fruit aromas. Still quite firm tannins on the palate. Fresh acidity. Expect it to age even further if only I could leave the rest of the bottles rest for a while.

Strong Medoc from la Tour de By, France. In Magnum, still harsh tannines but with a lot of depth. Yummie with a lot of cherries, brambles, cassis and a bit tobacco. If only I had some patience, this could lay for a while.

Thick dark Ruby color and relatively intense flavor. Need to air for a while to fully enjoy the flavor. Hint of oak with usually stronger tannins as you sip. Long length and definitely taste much better once it breath for awhile. Worth a try.

Dark fruit, forest floor, leather, cedar and notes of dried fruit on the nose. Deep, soft and fruity. Well structured and integrated tannins. Balanced acidity. Maybe a slight error with the bottle? Excessive touch of wood or forest floor on the nose. Still well drinkable.

Blackcurrant, grass, Mint, pepper, smoke, leather, menthol. Oak and clove showing up after 15min decanting
Some Banana and grass on the nose after 1h decanting 

Medium body, high tannins, high acidity, long finish

Deep bouquet. Raisin, vanilla, wood, and tobacco. Great legs in the glass. First sip mellow and very creamy and velvety. Only slightly tart. Full, dense, balanced body leading into a long lasting finish that sports plum, vanilla, oak, tobacco, and cacao. Very good wine!

Sample #1.8 v/ @[1|2962158|Ruud Berlie]

Ending this great series in style with this ‘14 Médoc 😎
Garnet colour with a small brown hue.

Smells mainly towards ripe fruits. Cassis, plum & brambles are lying above an elegant chocolate & vanilla whiff, wet earth, licorice, leather & pencil shavings.
Dry on the palet with nicely integrated tannins around a good amount of refined black fruit concentration. 
Pretty good aftertaste with thin but elegant acids, again those fine, refined black fruits ending dry ⤵️

This Médoc wine is produced by Château La Tour de By and it’s a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot. It’s aged 12 months in French oak barrels (30% are new ones).

It presents a red-ruby color with aromas of red fruit and wood.

In the palate it presents some acidity with round tannins and some complexity. Taste of  oak,  leather and blackberry.

My real rate is 3.8.

3.9⭐️ to this great Bordeaux-blend (CS 60%, Merlot 35%, PV 5%) from Left Bank, Médoc, 🇫🇷. Wellbalanced, complex, delicate and welldefined flavours. Long finish. Quality good! Recommended!🍷

Appearance clear, deep intensity ruby, tears. 

Nose clean, m intensity, black currant, oak, vanilla. Developing. 

Palate with m(+) acid and tannins, dry, ABV m, m body(+), flavours intensity m(+). Flavours as on the nose and black currant leaf, blueberry, cedar, forrest floor. 🍷

Cassis, black berries and a hint of tobacco on the nose. Lovely dark fruit with bdx profile. Nice tannins and hints of ceder and a personal favorite of a balanced bitterness. Work wonders with OLW Grill chips

Ahalf bottle of good and reasonably priced Medoc from a good vintage (2014). 

Ripe dark berries, light notes of leather, tobacco and pencil shavings. 

Good consentration and good length. Fine balance and good focus.

Very good pqr.

Very approachable, solid bade on the palate and a powerful follow-through of black currant, oak is definitely present and an undertone of ink. 

Full bodied for sure but also smooth and gentle to the palate.

Dark ruby red in color. Om the nose Black berries, tobacco and licorice. 
Om the palate dry wood,  tobacco, dark fruits.
Some imbalanced acidity.
Good firm tannins.
Very good buy considered  the low pricing point (200NOK @vmp)
4,0 🌟

My rating is 3,8
Colour : dark red with brick hints
Nose : spicy aromas like hummus leather, black olives 
Palate: I think this drone is now at its peak. Nice aromas, long taste, and nice melted tannins. 
Very nice choice.

HVE certified winery in Medoc. 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot. 12 months ageing in French oak. Somewhat shy on the nose. Blackcurrant, cedar, quite herbaceous, green pepper. Showing some ageing, leather, tobacco, forest floor.

Nose: Dark fruit, blackberries, black cherry, cedar, oak, sweet tobacco, graphite. 
Palate: Blackberries, plum, oak, graphite. Firm tannins with a long finish. Needs more time.

Delicious Medoc still. Good value.

3.8. Red leaning towards a brick red. Medium intensity. Typical bordeaux with a very sweet oaky vanilla cedar, plum, blackberry, leather, hints of dried fruit. Missing some intensity for a really good Bordeaux. Mid/full body, medium/high tannins, dry with high acidity. Overall good and very pleasant.

3.9 Beautiful dark and deep red colour. In the nose it shows red plum, blueberry, black currant and dark chocolate with a slight vanilla tone in the background. In the mouth it has a nice intensity with a fine structure and a lot of fruit aromas despite its age. Medium long aftertaste. Unfortunately, it seems that taste disappears the longer that it is in the glass. However, bought it for 15 EUR so I think it's a very fair price for this bottle.

Gorgeous Bordeaux wine, 65% Cabernet Sauvignon and 35% Merlot. Dark fruits, primarily of blackberry greet the nose and palate. Rich oak coming through the palate with hints of leather and cedar. Tannins well integrated and needs some breathing room, but may not have many years left.

Stroud Wine Appreciation Black tie Xmas Dinner - wines #6,7&8. Vertical tasting to accompany an excellent cheeseboard. Dark aged red/brown in colour. Lovely nose of pencil box, leather, dark fruit & umami notes. Dry, medium acidity & body and fine tannins. Flavours of black cherry & blackberry with a medium+ dry & spicy finish. A much better bottle than the one we had 3 months ago. 3.8⭐Drink up though, it is on the downward curve compared with the 2005.

On the nose the tertiary notes are somewhat more apparent than the fruit notes. Sandalwood, leather, tobacco and forest floor are to the front. In terms of fruit, there is some bramble and red plum. In the mouth, the fruit is more forward. With juicy acidity, although tannins have faded a little.  This was very enjoyable.

Ruby color tending to brown at the edges, nose has hints of cassis  and blackberry. Strident tannins and medium acidity provide room for fruit and floral notes on midpalate, ripe cherry and edible flower petals as well as mild chocolate and tobacco notes not a typical Bordeaux,  but since its from the region, it counts

A fleshy Bordeaux of 60% CS, 35% CF and 5% PV. Med+ aroma intensity of black fruit, blackberry, blueberry, vanille, cedar, coffee, earthy. Med+ acidity, med+ body, good balance, med+ length, med+ intensity and good complexity.
Surprisingly good to drink now

Dark and brooding red in the glass
Nose of dark fruit and whiff of oak.
Full, almost smokey dark fruits, in the mouth, blackberry and blackcurrant dominant.  Earthy savoury notes, cigar box and a little oak.  Medium acidity very fine tannins.  
Plenty of life left in this beauty.

My first experience with a Bordeaux of this age and it felt appropriate to be my birth year. Alive and kicking for sure, maybe moreso than myself! Deep blackcurrant and plum before an almost tomato character leaping from the glass on top of very concentrated cedar and earthy notes. Big on that manure vibe but in a good way. On the palate this was stupidly smooth, definitely at it's peak. Tannins and acidity were so well balanced I was blown away. Still rich with deep blackcurrant but aging gracefully. 93

On the palate I found blackcurrant, blackberries, leather, dried fruit and cedar.

Quite pleasant tannins on the palate, decent acitity. Medium body.

Nose: Med intensity on the nose with notes of red fruit (red currant), dried black fruit (blackberry, black cherry), medicinal, tomato leaf, cedar, forest floor, leather and mushroom.

Acidity: med

Sweetness: dry

Very good wine. Well balanced and complex. Flavour and nose is a little subdued though.

👀Brilliant ruby red with light transparent, brick-red edge.

👃: Ripe plums, blue- and blackberry, hints of oriental spice, licorice, black pepper, cedarwood and fine tobacco. Very fragrant, delicate bouquet :-)

😛: Impressive fresh, sappy and fruity entry, very clean, elegant and smooth texture, medium++ body, balsamic touch, deep red and black fruit, pleasant, persistent and aromatic finale. Great Médoc for this price. :-)

Tour de By is a family owned estate and one of the famous names of the Medoc since the XVIth century. The wines owe the success of their reputation to the excellent gravel terroir and old vines cultivated with environmentally friendly methods. The style stands for balanced, finely scented wines with fruit and elegance, and an excellent aging ability! We visited the vineyards and also stayed in the hotel and it is indeed a visit more than worth!

4.2 - the ratings on this app clearly skew new world! This is an excellent Bordeaux for the price. Definitely decant for an hour and then it’s generous oak, tobacco, leather, blackberry, plum with a hint of raspberry. Smooth tannins. Easy drinking.

I’ve had a different vintage before and this one just confirms that this is a great Bordeaux!
Concentrated, intense, long lasting on the palate.
Dark robe, complex nose of dark fruit and some vanilla. Then the palate saturated with prune, vanilla, leather and a sniff of undergrowth.
Classy and elegant and a great value!

Classic medoc nose of dark fruits with a hint of leather, restrained yet big on the palate, black cherry and blackberrys, sandalwood, a hint of violet/lavender, chewy chalky tannins, but little to no acid makes it very smooth to go down. A wine of poise and class....

Mild oak. Black cherry. cedar. Acidic. Bold tannins. Leather. Plum and blackcurrant. Mild vanilla. Pepper. Very smooth after its been decanted to breathe for a few hours, but still bold. Fits the mold quite well of a Medoc. 60% cab sauv, 35% merlot, 5% petit verdot. 

Hint of tobacco and earthy, forest floor. A nice medoc 

3.8 🌟

A very enjoyable Bordeaux Médoc. Notes of oak, leather, tobacco and blackberry. Smell of tobacco, oak and dark fruit on the nose. Cleansing nosefeel. Juicy and fruity mouthfeel. Good acidity and good tannins. Pairs great with red meat. Aired it for 1 hour and 30 minutes. Used a catalyzer and a Bordeaux glass from Riedel. Very good value. Classic Bordeaux. A good choice. Dry and quenching finish.

Cassis, cedar, smoke and perfume on the nose. Cassis, leather, dried fruit, smoke and cedar on the palate. Medium+ acidity, high in tannins, a lot of dryness, yet nice mouthfeel.

I like this Bordeaux with it's complexity in flavours and first time I like a wine with high in tannins. Good balance. 4.0⭐

Excellent 2016 vintage. A fresh forward and spicy Medoc. This wine is well made with a tannic, red pit fruit in the center with dark-berry, chocolate and hazelnut character. Put it in the cellar or have fun to drink it early. Santé!

3.75-/5 ⭐️ Classical and mature half bottle 

🍷 Appearance: clear; medium ruby /garnet

👃🏻Nose: clean; medium+ intensity; aromas of mature black fruit,red fruit, cigarr box, some brett; fully developed?

👅 Palate: dry; medium+ acidity; medium+ tannin; medium+ alcohol (13.5%); medium body; medium flavour intensity; flavours of ripe black fruit, mineral, herbs, brett, some coffee; medium+ finish

Mature fruit, autumn leaves, cigar (lots), red apple peel(!), leather jacket. Still some unappealing notes of mold. 

Taste of plums. A little flat and earthy...

False alarm: clean notes of red plums and cigar. Redcurrants on its way... 

Mature wine, but still needs an hour of air.

Appearance: Red, Garnet, Light
Nose: Red cherry, Ripe strawberry
Palate (structure): Dry, High acidity, Low tannin, Medium alcohol, Light body
Palate (flavour): Raspberry, Ripe cherries, Oak, Wet autumn leaves

Part of a WSET education tasting.

Classic Medoc in a classic vintage.

Blackberry, black- and red currant in the mix with earthy nuances, gravel and cedar. 

The medium body feels sleek and has fine tannin and oak integration.  Only a subtle herbacious note is in there.

Compared to the 2016 I drank beside this shows less substance and feels very evolved. I see no reason to cellar this wine any longer.

Great value, solid performer 👍

Dark red color, almost blackish/blue. Leather, smoke and dark berries on the nose. Dry and bold wine. Hints of dark fruits. July 2017

This 2014 offering begins with full oak and hints at black currant in the nostrils.  After a 40-ninute decanting, you can immediately taste the black current, blackberry with hints of lingering plum.  Tight on the finish with strong tanens.  🥂

Latest vintage. Simple but quite ok Bordeaux. Easy drinking.
