Easy going and strait forward wine, with aromas of cherry, raspberry, strawberry some spice, tobacco, thyme. Medium bodied, neither complicated nor too simple. A decent match to any kind of meat dishes.

Initial notes of bright fruit on the nose followed by mild spice. Big, bold dry red on the palate.  A little tobacco spice, mostly neutral flavor. Great for the price as this bottle was picked up for $20 at a small shop in Ohio.  Probably needs to open a bit more and I may bump to 4 stars.

Clean and developing nose showing aromas of black currant,cedar, blackberry, quality  cigar tobacco,toasted bread and a whiff of vintage leather.
On the palate , dry and with a medium- intensity of acidity  and well integrated , soft tannins.

A wine most def worth its price. Some airing might be needed, but smooth yet quite powerfull drinking of blackcurrant, cherries, plum and tobacco. Drank a juicy light natural red wine besides this, might have affected How powerfull it felt.. Tried the 37,5 cl bottle.

Great value is this 2012 Médoc from Château La Tour de By. Blend is 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot. Highly enjoyable now with good acid and smooth tannins. Tobacco and black currant main flavour characteristics. Pairs well with Venison weird Hirsch salad and charred Broccoli. 3.6⭐️

This is enjoyable, but not unique. Still quite some fruitiness left and probably a bit further ageing will be possible. A bit dissapointed on the middle part of the wine, bouquet and aftertaste is more solid.

Lots of plum and oak on the nose. Very , very smooth, which is surprising, nevertheless revealing the brilliant 2016 vintage. Tasted straight out of bottle but suspect will be even better with some air.

Clear, deep, ruby. Clean nose. Pronounced aroma intensity. Aroma characteristics of blackcurrant,  liquorice,  toast. Developing. Dry. Medium (+) acidity.  Medium tannins. Medium alcohol. Medium (+) body.  Medium (+) flavour intensity. Toast, cedar, liquorice, blackcurrant, plum, pepper. Medium finish. Very good. Precarious balance of structure. I would prefer to drink now.
Good , easy drinking wine. Aromas of black fruits, herbs (green belly pepper) earthy, cedar tobacco.  Has some complexity and a medimum finish.

Clean clear with an inky red Ruby core and a feint red rim with a watery edge. Medium+ viscosity. On the nose there is an immediacy of leather, a savoury soft cheese with an undertone of stewed black fruit. The nose stands out as very strong almost authoritarian. On the palate the wine is dry, with medium+ acidity. Black fruit and lead pencil shavings. Medium + length and a medium+ finish. Excellent wine.

Lovely and perfect to drink now, smooth and elegant.

Deep garnet, blueberry, blackberry, oak, leather on the nose

Really liked this wine

Solid wine with a fairly powerful aroma with tobacco, nutty, and oak scents. Pretty strong tannins as well. 

Flavors of dark berries, cassis, and a bit of tobacco and earthy flavors. A bit of salt and coffee at the end as well.

Good bottle of claret. Not from classified growth but definitely  quality cru bourgeouis !

Tasty and fruity with a very young taste, despite some age in half bottle (faster aging - in theory). 

👀 Medium garnet. 

👃 Cherry, red currant, black cherry, raspberry, dark chocolate, tobacco, smoke, medium intensity - very pleasant and with some development. 

👅 Juicy - young feel, very tasty and good with charcuteries, blackberry and toast, medium acidity, medium- tannin, medium length and body. 

Should age well and could use some development on the palate especially.

Inexpensive Bordeaux, pale brick color, mainly red fruits, soft tannins, with medium body. Does not blow the mind off, feels thin, especially finish, but it only gets better and better with aeration & it is so fairly priced. Well balanced, so it's a pleasure to drink it, no heavy oak nor jammy notes, doze of light menthol and acidity feels refreshing. I would rate it 86-87pts. Never tried serious left banker so hard to place it into line - but it's really good wine.

A very nice effort, with just a bit too much alcohol. Nose of cassis and licorice followed by a medium-full bodied matter with cassis, plums, licorice. As mentioned, I miss a bit of refreshment in the mid and back palate to really fall in love with it.

Deep blood red in color. Aroma of tobacco, leather, blackcurrant and hints of spices and raspberry or strawberry. On the palate, earth, leather, oak pepper and hints of spices and maybe a tad of smoke. A bit diffrent than mainstream reds in this price range. A 3.5 is a fair rating, not very complex but an interesting taste that pairs well with simple dishes. A bit below what you would expect at this price.

On the nose: dark fruit, oak, leather. 
Medium bodied, medium tannins, high acidity. 88pts

A very nice young cab sauv dominant Bordeaux. Paired well with steak (duh) at dinner at our place with Ty and Yard. Everyone really enjoyed the wine. A bit tannic at first, but softened a bit with 2 hours of decanting.

Deep Ruby with a red pink rim good tearing.  Scents of black currant, toasted almonds, herbs, dark flowers, blackberry, black cherry, fresh cut hay, herbs, cinnamon plus a lot more.  Flavors of black currant, blackberry, black cherry, cinnamon, , herbs, toasted almonds, anise, leather, a little vanilla, so much more, acid medium +, tannins medium, full body, well balanced.  Finish long, all the primary fruits, cinnamon, clove, anise, violet, and so much more.  Outstanding.

Very discreet introduction to the nose with light scents of oak and leather. With time aromas of blackcurrant, blueberry, cedar and coffee start to reveal with black pepper accent. The wine is in touch of tannic tension and chewy palate is dominated by ripe black fruit with dense and grainy texture. It finishes with black olive flavor loaded with peppery accent.

Quite a traditional Medoc with clear cherries, forward tannins and a little earth. Unfortunately no one cleaned the ground first though before it went into the cask, as there is also lots of stalkiness offering a twinge of bitterness that detracts from a potentially fine wine.
Ladies, I guess it's like the perfect guy who farts in his sleep. It's not a deal breaker, but a regular reminder that nobody's perfect...

Young for Bordeaux, you get alcohol on nose and on palate out of bottle. Let in breath 30-60m.  20m in ... couldn’t wait any longer 😂 ... opened up some, presenting nice fruity reds, with mild tobacco, vanilla, and spice.  Lighter than most Medoc’s I’ve had, means more Pinot / Merlot lovers will enjoy this over other Medoc’s (heavier in my experience).  Cheers everyone!

Med intensity scent of dark berries and plums but after some aeration red fruit protrudes. 
Bouquets tobaccos, cedar, chocolate. Earthy with smoke and a hint of licorice. 

High acid, high tannin, heat and spice in the mouth. Good long aftertaste with vanilla, herbs like fresh thyme picked in scorching sun. The chocolate and cherry shines through 

Recommended 👏

This wine is a clear deep garnet colour.

The nose is clean with medium intensity. Aromas of blackcurrant, blackberry, cherry, vanilla, clove & mint.

The palate is dry with medium acid & alcohol. The tannins are medium + and ripe. The intensity is medium + and follows the nose. The body is medium as is gone finish.

Good wine. It is fruity and has nice oak character. But it lacks concentration and body. Drinking now not suitable for further ageing.

Medium+ dark red color. Pencil, blackcurrant, blackberry, plum, hints of leather and spice at the nose. Fairly velvethy mouthfull of dark fruit like black currant. Medium+ fill and nice length. A lot nicer than the last time.

The balance and finish raise the overall profile. The flavor won’t knock you out, but there is little doubt as to its quality. The trademark ruby color is on full display, with dramatic cherry tones. Would revisit, but likely not for the price.

Soft medoc with typical smells of wet dirt, wet caves, some
Leather and a slight hint of tobacco. On the palate ripe berries and a well balanced acidity. Not something i would buy since i'm not a huge fan of bordeaux but still a very nice complex medoc!

No depot. Red fruit jam nose, strong wood scent. Medium dry, elegant red berry. Nicely balanced wood finish and medium acidity. Next to no tannins. Very easily approachable, easy to drink Bordeaux red. 
Lacks quite a bit in complexity and depth 
Nice introduction into Bordeaux wines. Solid price- value.

On the nose there is dark berrirs, some cedar wood and a tinge of autumn leaf. In the mouth the wine has clear acidity, but the tannins are not very clear. The wine has some structure, balance is okay 15,5/20

Bordeaux indeed: somewhat closed but elegant nose with notes of black currant and ceder, a touch of tobacco and a spicy finish. Tighter and more stringent on the palate, with round and balancing tannins and a decent body, there is young but evolving fruit (black current and violets). A bit shallow on the midpalate, but with decent length. Good now, and will hold up for at least five years. A food wine!

First up today is this really inviting Medoc! Fabulous Ruby red in the glass! Nose is offering up light pencil shavings, blackberries and some vanilla. It has a lovely mouthfeel and has produced super glass on glass development! Great grip, with a pretty long finish of dark fruit and leather. Would love to see where this goes. A really strong 3.75 now but I could see it nipping up a bit higher! Lovely stuff!

 Color: deep red or rather black 
Nose : medium intense very classic medoc with light and pleasant notes of black currant, green pepper, cedar, and coffee.
Taste: medium body excellent balanced tannin structure and same notes in taste as in nose. Soft and smooth a short after taste.

Dark ruby color with black fruit notes like black cherries, black cherries,  violets aromas with dry spices and black pepper, moderate minerality and high acidity and soft tannins... this wine and needs to develop much more... the finish it's just Ok.

Agreeable. Smooth, rich, tannins in the background now. A slight farmyard nose, but on the palate earthiness to the fore, fruits taking a secondary place. Deep fruits: cherry, plum, but balanced by more earthy notes.

Unimpressive acidic nose with hints of blackberries.

Palate is deep with big, clean flavours of  plum and dark cherry. Opens up to cascade of secondary flavours - butter, leather 

Finish has strong hints of smoke and butter.

Deep ruby just a hint of garnet. Med+ intensity black fruit (blackberries, blackcurrant, black plum), blackcurrant leaf, cedar, clove, tobacco, leather. Pretty complex and promising. Dry, med+ acidity, med+ (ripe, soft) tannins, med alc, med+ body, med intensity flavours of fading black fruit, soggy tobacco, forest floor, med finish. To me this felt like it had turned a corner and fruit was fading (excess tobacco), palate somewhat disappointing.

Nose: A lot of spice is the first thing I get. A lot of dark berries of blackcurrant as the primary. Secondary notes of leather, dust, wet wood, oak and forest floor.

Palate: High acidity and medium-high tannins. Good longevity. But still way too young. Shows a good potential.

This nice red was the first of 3 wines served blind to our "Book and wine" club in January. Guests guess. 

Hint: all wines are from the same area and one grape in blend increases in dominance. 

Having lost my notes 😱 I can only describe how wrong this blind went for me: 

I felt that I recogniced the scent - but not as a Bordeaux from Medoc... but as a Valpolicella Classico. And when tasting the other two wines, I simply pursuaded myself to fit them into my picture 😱😅

Anyway a solid 3.5⭐️ Bordeaux 😄

Not a 3.8 definitely a 4+ classic right bank cassis blackcurrant inky cedar leather with mellow tannins. I bought this en primeur in 2010 for 9 quid a pop, I can’t think of a better wine that has matured like that for this price,

3,5⭐ Vintage 2016

Dark burgundy slightly towards purple. 

Dry nose with ripe plums, dried cherries, leather and black pepper. 

Dry, medium+ body, medium acidity. Thick tannins. 

Dark and deep on the palate with various dark fruirs and berries. Damp cellar, tobacco, bell pepper. The tannic structure is almost inteefering with the taste - instead resulting in dry leather and licorice. I think this one requires a lot more air than I have it. Maybe then it would have balanced itself out a little bit better.

3,1. Blackcurrant, tobacco and oak on the nose. Dry. Blackberry, cherry and plum on the palate. Low acidety. Firm tannins. Alcohol that feels unintegrated. Layers that feels separated. Long exit with a hint of cherry.

When first opened, nose was vibrant with vanilla, wood box, raspberry, blackcurrant.  After a couple of hours it's taken on a musty note.

TBH I'm not enjoying this as much as I hoped. Too astringent with bitter notes on the finish.

Edit: after 3 hours it's opening up. Partnering cheese much better than the dish of beef, aubergine and peppers that fought with it.

Edit: next day (vacuvinned) it had opened up even more. Astringency gone. Fillet steak helped. I didn't finish a halfie, is that bad, or good?

Dark red fruit and savoury forest aromas on the nose. Rich, with big tannins, blackberry, oak, floral, oak, licorice - did I say oak! Way too early to drink now but obvious that another 10 years will smooth and temper this wine.

Nose of blackcurrant and fallen leaves. Taste of blackcurrant, slight mint and slight iodine. There is a rich and strong taste to this wine which has a slight savoury bitter edge. It is a little unbalanced, but is a decent claret and is showing no signs of fading yet. However, looking at my previous notes on the same wine some bottle variation is evident.

A drinkable Bourdeaux, but not much more. Deep red, as it should be. Red fruit and leather, perhaps some plum to the nose. Some structure but less than expected, semi-dry (almost sweet but not quite). Nothing wrong, quality and very drinkable but I expect more from a Médoc.

The nose was unspectacular and lacking character . However it is lovely on the palate with well balanced acidity tannin results… dark cocoa plum bubblegum liquorice spice notes

We drank this over 2 days. The cork burst in 1000 pieces, so we needed a caraffe. After 2 hours the wine opened up , but remained not very expressive. Good fruit (blackcurrant), but relatively mono dimensional. Limited nose. On the dry side. This will keep on this level for a long time, but I have my doubts, if it will improve from here.

Upon first pour it presented like a young wine, but after an hour in the decanter it showed its true colors. It was ruby, with some bricking towrd the edges. Aromas of currants, coffee, black truffle, cigar and black cherry. The tannins are developed and velvety, medium acid. The finish was long and evolved nicely as it played out...cherry, truffles, chocolate.  Yum.

Good aromas of blackcurrant, licorice, cinnamon, smoky and a little toffee. Rich in mouth, moderate tannins, smooth and delicate, with a little smoky mushroom. Let it breathe an hour, you will realize its potential, haha... 😘
Oak, earthy attractive blackberry and blueberry.  Light vanilla on the nose.  Medium bodied and chewy tannins.
Yum. Smooth and tasty. Went down way too easily. Plum plum baby. Bold and beautiful.
Delicious! Very earthy and deep dark cherry flavors. Would buy it again!
Rich and fruity - with deep ness typical of the region. Very enjoyable.

Lovely nose, ash and a touch of balanced oak. 
Palate a little short, lacking the balance to back the nose. 
Enjoyable wine. Certainly some quality.
Perfect companion to reindeer filet! Lots of berrys and an elegant finish. Love the cab franc part?
Opens with dark fruit and modest tannins. At four hours lovely smooth with butterscotch of Merlot prominent

As St Emilion goes this is positively understated. Takes a while to get that wood chippy goodness and soft tannins to come out but it’s worth the wait. A teeny bit mellow for me but nice and spicy, with a pinch of berries down the road. Can’t be that bad: we dribbled down the damn bottle.
Cassis, blueberry, chocolate and expresso blended with smoke, leather, mint, herb and scents of truffle. Drinking well after 3 ~hours of opening.  But it's still youthful and energetic.
Jury is still out there, I had a fantastic bottle, matured great smoothnesss; however second bottle corked; third bottle was not ready to drink, could have matured for another 5 years
Smells of cherries n chocolate, light taste of strawberry peach, smooth but too discrete and delicate. Feels like this wine could make a burst out if it's own very delicate character.
oak tobacco leather
Dark red hue. Nose of berries and cinnamon. Mouth soft tannins, grape and plum.
Nice ! Complex Smooth ! Nice tanin but feel like velvet ... Very pleasant !
Week 2 quarantine. Good way to end it
Top
Nice
22/12 Boat Khunying
Amazing! The second best red I have tasted. Dry, but with an afterstate of abselute amazing complexity
Perfect match with red tender grilled meat!
good wine good value.
Dry and delicious
I would like to rate this as 3.5 stars. Fruity taste of  plum but of wild taste and smoothness. A 2008 old world wine but an affordable pei e

2005 drinking superbly. Deep in flavour with a smooth and soft complexion. The fruits of the merlot come through subtly and leave a pleasant aftertaste. You can taste the age, but that’s the beauty of it.
Smooth, have layers, good noise
Closed. Only opened up when paired with tomatoes stuffed with cepes.
Had it for New Year’s dinner and what a surprise! Grand bouquet and absolute great value for money!
Really good balance of red fruitiness and leathery dryness. Amplitude 2.7 score 8/10
Smooth red. Very robust with deep fruity tones very nice
Nice but definitely needed to air first. I paid €25 so cheaper than average price. Worth the €25 but not more if I'm honest

It’s time to drink this one now. In perfect balance. It has aged well. 
Very pleasant Saint Èmilion
Nice oak. Plum. Vanilla.
Pretty disappointing, possibly faulty but not obviously so. Classic aged claret flavours but muted and not especially harmonious. Probably better a couple of years earlier
Fruity with sweet aroma
Aroma plum, blackberry, medium body, balanced tannin
Fruity,  dry not bad value
Analysis is fair!

Developed nose with prunes, integrated oak, a touch of red berries
Soft tannins, licorice, cassis, herbs, integrates oak, a bit wit finish but overall nice. I would not recommend to keep it longer..
Tasty, as others have said - first couple seconds are lacking and then It comes at you. Let it breathe.

Bordécember wine #8, another 2009 vintage and my final entry (late posting!). Chateau Berliquet comprises a 10-hectare square of St Emilion vineyard, surrounded on three sides by Chateau Canon’s vines. Its long history dates back to the 1740s, making it one of the appellation’s oldest vineyards. It is a Grand Cru Classé. This vintage was a blend of 70% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Franc & 5% Cabernet Sauvignon. Very dark, dense ruby with nose of black cherry, blackcurrant, plum, leather, pencil box & spice (cont)

Pretty much Same as last review  a year and a half ago , if a little more refined  . Decanted first, some sediment . A blend of Merlot 🍇 and Cabernet Franc. Limestone terroir evident. Beautifully put together with finesse and compassion . Oak and black / dark fruit , red Berries, leather ,tobacco and a hint of pencil shavings . Elegant long silky smooth finish and still loaded tannins.good for a while yet.  4.6⭐️

4/5. Very nice Saint Emillion Bordeaux with intial maturity.

Appearance (A): clear; deep ruby

Nose (N): medium intensity; aromas of raspberry, plum, rassins, cedar; developed

Palate (P): dry; high- acidity; high- tannin; high- alcohol; high- body; high and quite complex  flavour intensity; flavours of cassis, oak and mineral; long finish

Paired this Saint Emillion right bank Bordeaux with a wonderful sirloin. Ruby color with red and black fruit and some earthy mineral undertones. Opened and poured at my local steakhouse so next time a good decant will help.

If I may be a tad fanciful for a moment (but just a tad), this smells like an old leather tome ... or mossy old rocks, a pockmarked well-worn drafting table, a ‘50s bomb-shelter turned into a root cellar ... you get the drift. A handful of dried blackberries and cranberries linger on against a backdrop of deeply cured tobacco leaves, Shiitake mushroom, singed thyme, cedar planks, and dank riverbed. Tannins remain robust but silky smooth and somehow the acid is still at a sturdy medium level. Enjoy now.

Lovely nose: I get the distinctive sweet smell of over ripe bananas and a hint of vanilla from the oak. In the palate it is incredibly fresh and full of life for a 10 year old wine, with medium high acidity and an elegant though lightish body for Bordeaux, which I guess is a sign of a difficult vintage in terms of ripeness. Tastes of cassis, nutmeg and if left sitting for a while it will develop moccha and rubber accents. A nice treat! I suggest openning the bottle at least half an hour before drinking.

Med+ intensity ruby red wtih red base. Large rim variation. 
Med+ viscosity. Some small fragments of the cork in the glas. 
Scent: Medium+ intensity with dark berries and oak. Vanilla and undervegitation and herbs. 
Palette: Medium body, nuanced, fruity with high tanning and medium acid. 

Ok merlot dominated Bourdeaux. I did not guess Bordeaux on this, the oak hinted om tempranillo and the green of cab. franc. 

(@Tvåbetygprov mars 2018)

A good value £36 St Em in a top year that delivers good QPR drinking good already 😄 but nothing too complex

🍇 70% Merlot, 25% Cab F & 5% Cab S

🍷Blackened ruby red

👃 Soft oak through spiced plum with touch of liquorice, cherry & minerals

👄 Medium body of smooth mocha mineralised plum with dry tannin

🎯 Medium+ mocha plum dry finish
Fruity. Medium bodied, very good
Delicious , very enjoyable
Matured St Emillion. Ripe forest fruits, black currant jam, dried herbs, balsamic, tobacco and earthy. Medium body, acidity and tannins. Coffee nuances at the finish.
Chocolate, mint, raspberry, dried leaf on nose. Medium body, dry with racy acidity, quite fruity, racy tannin, very smooth one.
Easy to drink, has aged well but drink now. Some cherry and of course blackcurrant. Notes of Coffee. Nice typical bordeaux
Very good St Emilion. Would leave it to age a few years more though. It'll be an amazing wine in a few years.
I would rate this wine as a 4.2. Very rich aroma of Merlot and dark berries. Very vwry smooth om the palette and great finish. Awesome wine and really value for money..Veey fine and elegant wine.
Zermatt, Restaurant 1818, 25. Dez 2019
Nice with hints of chocolate and although on the edge, still some tannins and acidity.
Smooth very smooth
Figs, plums, vine leaves. Woody. This is a heady wine indeed.
Another excellent Bordeaux. Visited the vineyard. Had lunch.
Open 2 bottle, one defect  with soft and broken cork,  low value for the money
Challenged in blind tasting where I misstook this merlot bases bordeaux for cab sav.
Amazing soft tannins but the fruit has faded a little with age.
Smooth with soft tannins
Oak and plum. Touch of smoke. Quite opaque in colour, garnet red in colour.
A bit over the top but full taste. Still some tannins. Hints of banana and cherries on the nose.

Incredible power on the nose with deep deep ripe plum and cherry. The palate is equal in intensity with dark fruit. The tannins are remarkably well integrated with the classic velvet merlot carrying the profile. This right bank GCC is capable of going the distance for another 10 to 15 years.

A really, really nice smooth St Emillion. This is excellent. A deep purple colour. The nose rather enticing with blackcurrant, plum, cassis, raspberry, mushroom and coffee. My wife even appears to be flirting with it!

Full body. Very fruity. Medium+ acidity. Medium tannins. High alcohol. This is so smoooooth, it is like the Sean Connery version of James Bond on the palate.... which I guess reflects the 70% merlot in it. The palate has lots of black cherry, some spices and caramel. This is really good.

Excellent, a fruity heaven for Madame Karpova! Very intense deep purple colour with medium acidity, medium tannins, full body and high alcohol but feels quite smooth. That’s your smooth operator full of blackcurrant from the bush, fresh raspberry, plum, saucy liquorice, a touch of mushroom and coffee on the nose. Palate is dominated by dark cherry, caramel and a touch of cassis. Another Grand Cru Classe, another Yum! 😋
Leather, tar and tobacco which are nicely interwoven with dark fruits of plum and pomegranate.  Merlot and Cab Franc are great in this one
Rich fruity smell, moderate taste, enriches a little bit after a while, but do not develop anymore (apparently on its peak). I like it very much, price is moderate, but overall quality is good
Very very good right bank Bordeaux. Great balance, body and flavor. Soft tannins balanced with fruit and wonderful complexity. Especially good at this price.
Shared with Cyrille Thienpont, very '09 in term of style, deep, long, ripe tannins, intense bouquet, was sublime with our Côte de Boeuf, perfect and easy pairing.
The thing that struck me most about this was it's finish. In fact it struck me over and over again it was that long. Soft mouthfeel and a tobacco tinge.
Berry and light mineral aromas and flavors follow through to a medium body, with refined tannins and a clean, fresh finish. Not hugely structured, but a pretty wine.
4.3 smooth great st e drinking. Drank like 5 bottles super smoothly. Lacks the additional necessary complexity though.
Blissfully balanced

Plums Plums and Plums! Unbelievably young and fresh for a 2005! Clean middle bodied long finish. Dark berries. A real treat! Nose for once poorer than the palate which is welcome as pretty rare. I would dare to say this wine can sleep another couple of years in order to get the real old long and soft taste, only bordeaux can offer. Impressive. QPR outrageous!👍😉 94/100

Had a big crowd over for BBQ and this I decided to open a case of the Berliquet 05. What was striking was the bottle variation despite the fact that all bottles were purchased en Primeur and stored in the same cellar. Some bottles were fully open and performing at 92/100 then others being completely backward at 88/100. Interesting but difficult to understand...still, the best bottles were top and classy Merlots in a wonderful drinking window.

Classic Saint Emilion red with cedar & cured meat aromas, dark plum & black currant flavors, beautiful balance between medium tannins, bright acid and earthy dark fruit and long finish. Ahh Saint Emilion…

Clear deep runy with garnet rim, mid+ nose intensity with plum, overripe blackberry, lanolin, oak, leather, underwood. Dry, mid acidity, full body, smooth well structured tannins, intense palate with blackberry, dried plum, mint, dry herbs, tobacco, ripe blue figues, long lasting finish

Elegant and terroir-driven nose offering aromas with leather, smoke, mushroom and graphite, and whisper of blackberry and cherry. Dark plum and blackberry flavors have a rustic edge and earthy with pepper to provide the palate with savory accent. Tannins are ripe and beginning to mellow a little in effort for the texture more smoothly. 4.1
A good St Emilion from a good year. Started showing age, opened at its peek. Balance between fruit, oak and earthy mineral notes. Good length.
Full of aroma and velvet. Going strong at 8 years which has potential for further aging.

Chateau Berliquet. Saint Emilion Grand Cru. 2009 vintage. SGD120 from Enoteca. 

Color: Medium Ruby 

Nose: Medium + intensity. Developing.  oak leather red fruit raspberry black cherry

Palate: Dry. High tannins. Medium acidity. High alcohol. Full bodied with medium + finish. Flavour intensity is medium +.  tobacco raspberry red plum

Quality is Very Good 

Drink now. Potential for aging.

For a right bank claret (not my usual choice) this deserves huge praise. It’s perfectly balanced, medium tannin, medium acidity, garnet hue; with notes of red cherry, plum, and aged wonderfully well to smooth it out. French oak maturation gives it toast and vanilla nuances.

Deep burgundy color without any bricking showing, it is drinking very well now, 09 is a warmer vintage, lots of ripe fruits and the tannin is round and supple, nose smells of roasted chestnut, incense, dried rose petal, cacao, pot roast, mint, blackberry, dried cranberry, black plum and espresso, full body with balanced acidity, velvety mouthfeel drinking like silk, tastes of raspberry dark chocolate truffle, blueberry pie, cedar, caramel, fig, prune, dried jujube & toffee, long finish!
From the right bank this Bordeaux is a very fine , potent  dry, with soft tannins a little a acidic wine . Not distasteful on the contrary very tasty and aromatic.
Loved this. Still very young. Will be a joy to revisit in 5, 10, 15 years. Did great work on second shift with brisket and ribs. 78% merlot 22% Cabernet franc.

Nose: intense leather 
Mouth: licorice and coffee aftertaste. Well balanced, elegant, opulent taste, good tannins, complex. Air and decant at least 3 hours before.
Very nice balance of oak, red fruit, vanilla and coffee flavors. Good structure, mild tannins, long finishing
Drinking beautifully at 22 yrs old. Red fruit, tobacco, earthy,  mushrooms. Soft tannins, balanced, but will stand at its peak for 5 years or more. No reason to wait, though. Cheers!
Simple and basic saint emillion. Not worth 40 euro just beacause french told you this is grandcru. Simple good wine with blackberries, vanilla oak notes. Pleasant but it could be cost 15 euro.
Needs a minimum of 2 hours to breath, great fruity slightly acidic and works perfectly with chocolate based desserts

90 pts fig, plum. Soft and velvet. Toast berries. Medium bodied.
Enough lenght and power to stay interesting
2017 vintage. Decanted for 2 hours. Dark fruit and leather and a hint of sweetness on the nose. Very smooth and a long enjoyable finish. Enjoyed with a cheese plate on New Years.

Sometimes you do not have to say much. A great afternoon with a friend in the sauna and a bottle of very good mature Saint Emilion. What more do you want? Oh yes, the rating! ! !
94/100
Delightful
Post Covid catch up notes. Taste returning but still a little awry. Leaning on previous scores and v average.
Decent right bank Bordeaux, with Merlot calling the shots. Earthy, minty, and a bit floral, with noticeable but still pretty balanced oak. You won’t find me lining up to buy the latest vintage.
Merlot in its most wonderful form. Ripe plums and chocolate with full balance and tremendous flavor. I'm happy to be on the right bank right now but the left bank came correct tonight.
Actually much better than last time. Now we aired it for two hours and all the taste was exposed, length, not facility’s but very good. A lot of dark berries maybe coffee and leather. 93
B++.  Mute on the nose.  Slight black pepper & nutmeg aromas.   Incredible start of fresh  berries.   Darker fruit then clean spice finish. Rich & full bodied.   Aging wonderfully.  Worth the price.

Solid 2015 year for Berliquet! On the nose deep aromas of floral,  vanilla, spices. On the palate plums, cherries, licorice, hint of cacao, and a beautiful finish. Silky!  This definitely opened up nicely so I suggest decant for at least an hour.  Very giddy about this shipment. Another one that will drink oh so well in few years.

Evening event at my company, after 4 sparkling and 4 white it's now red time. You can't say no to a Saint-Émilion, Merlot is after all one of my fav since I have explored out of Italy comfort zone. Nose can find chocolate and tobacco, but also the more gentle plum and blackberry, underlined but a nice vanilla aroma. Tannins are well balanced and certainly a good wine, but I had way better Gran Cru Classé than this so it's good but wouldn't say great! Nice glass anyway! 🍇🇫🇷🍷

Another excellent Saint Emilion discovered in a local wine shop. A little young, of course, tannins are still going strong. Plum, some smoke and spice on the palate, really needs few more years to reach full potential, but very enjoyable now too.

Colour: Deep garnet
Nose: High intensity flavours of leather, chocolate, blackberry jam, oak.
Palate: Dry, with medium acidity, medium tannins, medium alcohol, full body and (very) long length.
Drink now, no potential for futher ageing.
Value for money : 4/5

Deep ruby appearance. Medium+ nose & pronounced flavor intensity - blackberry, black cherry, plum, cassis, cigar, oak and chocolate.  Dry, medium+ acidity, medium+ tannin, full body with long grippy finish.

This one grew on me, and like many Cabernet Franc forward wines, it's grippy tannins reveal themselves after a bit of airtime. 

Lushly fragrant, a beautiful medium garnet color reflects violet highlights. The body is light until the tannins kicked in. Excellent with cheese and figs, it's probably not one for long-term aging.

Even if I opened the bottle 12 hours before serving, this wines needed 24 hours to express itself. After 15 years, this wine is still young with a beautiful expression of red fruits, very mature, perfect equilibrium
Creamy, juicy on the nose. Velety, juicy and bright on the palate.  A really balanced wine.
Raspberry jam and chocolate. Dry, very smooth, pleasant.
Nice Bordeaux with Merlot and Cabernet-Franc, dark berries, 1️⃣7️⃣ points
Drinking exceptionally well. Great balance. Classic St. Emilion.

C : murry red. A lot of colour ledt
N: choclate, offe, cedar, dark beriies, some molten lesfs
T: medium high acisty, roundend tannins, nice structure. A little fruit ledt presominatly svarta vinbär. 
Nice, standard bordeuax. Drink now.

Good Bordeaux but not the greatness expected... it is still a good quality wine with a good nose and a strong tannins taste.
The 2006 year is usually not the greatest but not the worst neither - so I was expecting more - probably too much!
Nevertheless solid wine for cheese and enjoy a nice diner with friend.
To open a couple of hours before - did not devant in carafe (given the age) I probably should have done it!

4.0* Well balanced GCC in St-Émillion.	

Deep ruby.	

M+ intensity of red plum, red cherry, blacurrant, blue berry, black berry, mint, ceder, vanilla, cloves, coffee, licorice, tobacco, and leather.

Dry, m+ acidity, m+ plush tannins, m alcohol(14%), m+ body, m+ flavour intensiy, and l finish.	

Outstanding. It still has potential for aging.

Happy New Year 🥳🎇🎉🎆🙌! 

Was happy to see that I’m palatebros with @[1|14868566|Steve Standbridge] as he drank the 09 tonight. With 10, these are 2 stellar vintages. Grand Cru classé & Same owners as Rauzan-Segla & Canon. Blend of Merlot/CF/CS of 75/23/2. 👃of blackberry, 🫐, cocoa, anise. 👅is med+ acidity, almost friendly tannins, long length, blackberry, dark 🍫, graphite, blood oranges. 4.2🌟.  My last bottle of this and soon my last bottle before a dry January ! Tomorrow should last drinking day of January!

Damn, this 2006 right bank is in peak condition. Can't think of any reason not to buy and drink this when you get the chance. I mean, you could save up for a nice watch to keep track of time. Or you get this bottle and lose track of time while you taste prunes, pencil shavings and fresh fruits

Nose is full of perfume and red fruit. Plum, strawberry, raspberry and very mouthdrying with a lot of texture. Merlot really comes through. A lot of structure from the Cab Franc. Light for a Saint Emilion given the blend and %, but very interesting and good.
Happy birthday to me, albeit a day late.

Plum
Dark fruits 
Leather
Tobacco
Opened up better with the cheese
Amazing and ready to drink!!!
Plum, leather, cedar. Tasty
Nice red fruits and minerality. Good balance, extracted, good finish.
Fruity
Found a half-bottle of this - definitely the way to go. First notes I got were baked black cherries, followed by leather and sweat (but not unpleasant!). Strong but smooth tannins.
Very decent. Reminded me of a cheval  blanc or as close as it can be. Enjoyed it. Lots of cranberry and other fruit.

2002: to drink by 2015 according to Parker but still very nice now.
Typical Bordeaux, fine tannins and very elegant
Ripe dark fruits, blackberry with crushed wild thyme, river rocks, forest floor, mushroom stems, slightly acidic, some tannin, needs a couple more years to soften. Excellent value
Smooth, velvety and packed with flavour. A gem!!
Red color. Developed aroma of plums, currant, raisins, cedar and oak. Developed and complex taste. Quite ok balanced.
Solid tannins, awesome color. Needs airing. Complex flavor
Pretty nice in nose. Lots of currants, berries, sweet spice and minerals. Good wine with good value though still very young to drink.
Very rich fruity aromas, quite full-bodied. I would say it was a good time to open this wine as it has aged nicely. Good tannin structure.
Reasonably good value. Very firm M+ tannins, Black plum, blackberry, and blueberry, and earthy. Drinking well now.
It starts out with a robust bouquet and a weak flavor.  After 30 minutes, this wine rose to the occasion.

2005 vintage proves the ability of Saint Emilion to age for many years. Ready to drink now bit would be able to age more.

🐽 Medium plus on the nose, aromas of red and black plum, cherry, blackberry, vanilla, clove, fig and forest floor. 

👄 Dry with medium alcohol, tannins are medium plus bit very smooth and well integrated by aging. Acidity is medium plus, body is full and finish is long.

Outstabding wine! 👌🏼 And amazing pairing with venison Wellington.

120m+ breathing. 16y7m.
C: Deep ruby, garnet rim
N: Plum, blackberry, chocolate, tobacco, pepper & earthy smoke. Med complex, med+ clarity.
P: Blackberry, violet -> tobacco, chocolate, spice -> pepper & plum. Med+ conc & length, med bod, high acid, low silky smooth tannins. Good balance, some tertiary but not the most complex or deep. However, still v handsome, quite masculine for right bank. In window & exceptional QPR for £26 duty paid. Structure & fruit still robust. By 2027. 92p.

Nice and lively in colour. Still intense red, but with some brick hints going into ochra. Sediments.
Elegant aromas of cherry, cherry jam, blackcurrant and blackberry. Some game notes, cinnamon, leather and tobacco, light chocolate. Quite intense.
First impression of taninic, acidity is still active,  but well integrated. Along with body.
Good meditation in the aftertaste. Nice!

What an excellent Bordeaux from the right bank! Juicy, well-balanced, no component sticking out, and overall a great value for what you get! Notes of ripe red fruits, leather, milk chocolate, and some brett, which adds a little funk. The nose is enticing and attractive, while the round tannic structure and lively acidity dance on the palate, making you want more! 2005 was an excellent vintage and some wines are hit or miss; this is a hit! Drink it now with lean meats, mushrooms, and truffles, all in season.
Exceptional
Very  nice.. Ready  almost at peak.. Tk you cris for the present..
Good balance, not strong tannin. Easy to drink without any food.
Lovely French blend - perfect for a sunny BBQ lunch
Ronin Points: 93
Black cherry and blackberry currants with wonderful aromas.  High tannins, medium plus alcohol, dry and wonderful earthy mineralarz
Excellent Bordeaux- merlot and cabernet franc, smooth, tannic, long aftertaste, good balance and complexity. Just about my favourite wine of the last year.
Wonderful French wine
Great nose, filled w expectations that falls a bit flat.
Lacking a little fruit
Great Grand Cru....
Good st E. classic. Slightly sharp finish to start but eased up
Not the greatest vintage but a reasonable wine
Elegant, good fruit
Dry, with Smokey aftertaste. Notes of cherry, raspberry. Pairs well with wild game.
Amazing blend of Merlot and Cabernet franc providing delicacy and finesse to a magnificent wine
Heady bouquet, dry, medium bodied.
Dark fruit, lengthy finish.
Excellent balanced young and nice on second day
Lovely St. Emilion. Finesse and elegance ripe cherry and raspberries, some toast and liquorice.
Lovely vintage and great value
Full body, cherry, tobacco
Powerful wine with heady aroma and big oaky body against the background of ripe juicy dark fruit and berry. 90/100.
Really very special. Fragrant on the nose. Silly on the tongue. Round in the pallets. Bursting with flavour and satisfaction. Wonderful quaffing. Perfect for sooxant neuf.

Disappointing for the price. Nice enough Bordeaux, might have a couple more years in it. Unsurprisingly well balanced, but really hoping for fab fruit or deep complexity for this amount of money, and my palate could detect neither.

Falls flat overall, definitely in its “prime,” since the wine lacks any structure on which to build.  The thing is, it’s not bad. The flavor profile is both aggressively acidic and acrid; and flabby and antiseptic simultaneously.  Fruit is marred by strong bitter herbs on the back, like tarragon and sage. A blackberry cordial gives it a booziness. However, the wine is dominated by a decaying wood flavor throughout.
It’s ok. Heavy on the nose, intense cherry. Deep dark, and very characteristically merlot. A bit much for us. Might use a few more years before hitting its optimum.
Tannin, full body and dry, medium finish. I had this with New York strip and they go along well. I wish I had more time to decant the bottle. It takes a while for the wine to opens up.
On the dry side, but with a bit of sweetness and allot of heft. Very much a wine that needs to breathe for a little bit, 30 minutes and your good. Drink now but should age well

What a wonderful wine this is! Deep ruby in colour, flavours in abundance: black plum, cook fruits, black cherry, blackberry, blackcurrant, vanilla, cigar box, wood smoke, some herbaceous notes (30% Cab Franc). It is very tannic and still very young, I fully expect it to keep improving in the next 5 years or so. Interesting fact, the chateau has been acquired by the Chanel group in 2017, will be interesting to see what this means for the wine they produce.

⭐️ 3.9
📝 decent and well aged St.Emilion. Acidity a bit high
🖥 chateau-berliquet.com
🏡 Est. 1768, bought by Chanel Group in 2017. 10ha, 30yo wines, soil: limestone, clay
🗺 Berliquet, 1km SW St.Emilion
🍾 5% CS, 70% Mrl, 25% CabFr, 18mo in wood
👁 deep garnet, shades of ruby
👃🏻 pencil lead, cassis, blackberry, old books, underbrush, pepper, black cherry, vanilla, oak, leather
🍷 body ↗️, acidity ↗️, dry, velvet texture
👅 black cherry, vanilla, blackberry, cassis, tomato leaf, cranberry
🔚 tannins: power ↘️, length ↘️

Aromas of blackberry, black cherry, black plum, tobacco, earth, and blueberry compote. Medium acidity. Medium+ body. Flavours of blackberry, black cherry, bitter minerality, tobacco, and earthy flavour.

Fresh, scented, creamy fruit on the nose and a soft open palate of lush berry and plum fruit. A mid-weight wine with good intensity. Nothing harsh here, just well-focused, pure stone-fruit flavours and a gentle, vanillin edge from new oak barrels. Smooth and sensuous with delicious ripeness and harmony. A lovely st-émilion with plenty of charm.

2012 right bank Bordeaux primarily featuring Merlot. The wine takes a bit of time to open up but when it does it has full expressive aromas of dark fruits such as blueberry and blackberry. The body is full, tannic, highly acidic with tart blackberry with an earthy finish that ends with a nice bitter terroir taste.
Very good
Beautiful claret!
Red Berries in the nose, very smooth on the palate, surprisingly still relatively young, would profit from some decanting, drink now or during the next 10 years.
Pretty good, some bitterness to it along with the mellow oak and fruitiness. Dry with light tannins on the finish. Was well received among those at the party.

3.9 - Happy Bordeaux Sunday friends! Tonight we have a young and rather closed St. Emilion that is quality nonetheless. Deep ruby in glass with notes of rich black plum, black cherry, cedar, dark chocolate, vanilla, leather, crushed limestone. Medium+ mouthfeel with moderate acidity and some seriously grippy tannins. Sipping this slowly as we watch that new Netflix show, Away. Hope you all have a good week!

Full body, soft tannin and medium high acidity.
Oak, plum and blackcherry, some cassis and cool herbs. Very pleasant nose. Good fruit concentration. Some minerality. 
A velvety textured wine. Tannin still holds firm backbone. Outstanding quality.

This is another example of a wine I was happy to try but definitely is worthy of aging. Palate has lots of cocoa, nutmeg and black fruit. Palate has high acid and tannin with the same cocoa ,nutmeg and mushroom tastes. A very good wine that I would love to age.

On the palate the wine has medium + tannins and acidity and alcohol so everything in balance with great fruit concentration too. Nice length to the finish. Will only get better from here.

Deep ruby with medium intensity, developing aromas of black plus, cassis, blueberry, leather, vanilla, toast, blackberry, mint and chocolate. Dry, medium acidity, medium (+) tannins, high alcohol. Full bodied with medium flavors of black cherry, vanilla, red cherry and red plum. Long finish and very good quality. Drink now but has potential for further aging. A bit chunky but still appealing

4.25 points. And compared to 2010 only because it's still young. Great potential of aging with sensual feminine floral aromas, forest and wet floor lingering in the glass. Very dark black-purple center with a red-purple bright rim. Aromas of plum, chocolate, blackberry, mint, toffee, and chalk. Palate was powerful yet soft. Nicely balanced with lots of acid and tannin. I noticed a lot of coffee flavors on the palate. More fruit-driven than many BDX wines, can drink now or hold onto it for many years to come - should only improve!

Gasconne 10yrs old cow dry aged cote de boeuf - slow oven braised at 50C in garlic oil (www.koopeenkoe.nl) combined with a fine glass of Margaux - classic bordeaux feel well balanced cassis tones with some pencil led and licorice. James Suckling awarded this wine 93 points, I agree.
Ruby red medium  intensity with aromas of blackcurrant. Smooth light mouth feel with a buttery feel from the oak. Cedar, blackcurrant and chocolate. Well balanced acid and tanins. Medium length.
Bought this for £14.99 in Lidl, outstanding value wine with great decent layers. Earth and fruit combined with a nicely writhed acidity. Would definitely re but at this price!
da says: well rounded; Rosie says: smells raspberries; paul says: sharp. Julie (in absentia) says: a nice everyday drinking wine; April says: wish I could drink it - Lidl £30

Appearance:deep crimson red with purple hues
Nose:very attractive bouquet ( red and dark fruits, oak, blood, meat)
Palate:silky smooth tannins, moderate acidity, structured wine showing notes of red berries, black berries, plums, game, leather, clove and liquorice 
Length:persistent length

Very good Margaux with a dark purple color in the aroma and taste, mainly dark fruit in the background red fruit palpable dried fig prune raisins notes of oak vanilla chocolate coffee tobacco cedar caramel cocoa earthy leather smoke graphite mushrooms forest floor pepper licorice savory cinnamon.  Margaux is perfectly balanced with high acidity, delicate velvety tannin, long fruity finish, a great solo wine.  🍇🍷👍🏻😃👌🏻⭐️

Almost opaque ruby colour, with lightly clear border. Elegant nose, showing sous bois notes, gravels, blackberries, flower scent. Medium bodied, delicate and depth on the palate although its drying tannins. Long, elegant and floral aftertaste. A genuine Margaux. Great Quatrième Grand Cru Classé en 1855.

Enjoying this typical Margaux in (you guessed it) Margaux itself. Fantastic accompaniment with a pigeon an foie gras. Maybe even the best prepared pigeon ever. I can recommend "Le Savoie" excellent restaurant in Margaux centre.

I hate french wine and don’t understand most of the hype. But this was well made few years aging and fine balance light but voluminous body and long finish. Nice but not near the value of the price tag suggested by Vivino users

Very nice Margaux! Needs to decant for a while. Well balanced and velvety smooth with flavors of blackberry, plum, oak, butter, minerals, and a distinct earthy element. Velvety smooth tannins. Great QPR wine 🇫🇷

Keeps evolving well. Wonderful sequence of perfumes : plums, green apple, mint, marzippan, tobacco, violets, T-bone steak with pepper sauce, mushrooms, reseda, and from time to time a sniff of farmyard.  
The taste is of great purity and harmony. This wine is a beauty, and we just finished the last bottle of 2008. I am lucky : still some bottles of 2010 left.
Certified by Berini & Bridy wine tester Choex (Switzerland) a bit too young but a good potential
Felt young but with every sign of potential. Decanting releases the beauty but the innocence is gone. Earthy and floral.
Elegant and strong nose, smoky, dark fruit, nice. Full body but delicate, long lasting balanced tannins, silky, buttery. Great value
Just about rewarded opening at this early stage. Still quite grippy, yet balanced wine, was enjoyed at out tasting this afternoon
Very serious stuff. A bit of leather and tobacco, lots of blackberries, together filling the mouth like tubular bells. Starting to understand why some wines are more expensive than others.
Deep purple. Pronounced intensity of blackberry black currant smoke clove coffee cigar box dark chocolate. Dry high acidity m+ coating fine tannin full body. Long length. Very elegant.

4.2
Delightful. Dark black fruits, leather, forest floor, vanilla spice, with leather and oak notes.
No formal notes. Served at business function (maybe a tad too chilled). Excellent wine and performance despite temperature.
88 Aroma had dark fruit,  oak,  leather,  vanilla and pepper. Over the palate came dark cherries, black currant, oak, cocoa, leather and vanilla.  Medium-plus acidity, medium-plus tannins and dry.

The 1994 Bordeaux vintage got off to a good start, although April was cool and wet.  The summer was warm, sunny and dry. Starting September 7, rain fell and never stopped until the end of the month... 
Medium plus color ruby to brownish, intensity still there in the nose, aromas of Blackcurrant, tobacco and a hint of licorice, flavours of backed blackberries and amazingly soft tannins, long to very long finish with an amazing acidity!

This 10 is showing Margaux typicity with deep purple core and garnet rims

Crystal ruby color with ruby-pink rims. Fast legs. Interesting nose full of oak, Provence herbs. Medium body and tannins. Dry herbs, black cherries and cranberries, pepper. Hot finish. Long sweet aftertaste. Well balanced.

Taste at the vineyard.

High tannin

Blackberry and cassis notes. Black truffle and a hint of peppercorn. Rounded oak, toast with chestnut and vanilla notes. Hint of nutmeg.

Let the weekend begin with this perfectly aged Bordeaux from Margaux!
Leathery/animal aromas pair with wood, blueberries, cherries, roasted herbs and orange zest.
Juicy, dry and really elegant - incredible balance here!
Perfectly integrated tannins, a well fitting sour cherry acidity and some oaky/smokey flavours create a great mouthfeel.
Elegance is the keyword here - the finish is just great: Complex, pure and herbal with a persistent & slightly earthy aftertaste.
Wow! Drink now or never - On its peak!!!

Can't get much better than this.
Maybe (some?) Margaux wines should be declared the standard of perfection.
Nose ,palate .......the joy is what remains.Very difficult to imagine that it will get better ,although it might.

Extremely viscous and tannic right after uncorking, but regally so. Requires a ton of time to breathe before mellowing out and gathering all that Cabernet cassis fruit, but still too young to be opened so early.

Oh Bonsoir le Margaux! :-)
I am more than impressed by this frenchie :-) 
I love this bouquet with tertiary notes of smoked ham and sandalwood with fruity hints of blackberries and cranberry. Delicious notes of thyme and eucalyptus, black pepper and bitter chocolate. What a nose!
At the palate you tase pretty young acidity with a finish of sour cherry, sandalwood and black pepper. Very intense and complex young palate that adds to the delicious bouquet! Big love for this Margaux! Cheers!

My first Grand Cry Classé from Margaux! Medium red in color. Complex old world nose of blackberry, blueberry, leather, violet, menthol, oak, tobacco and vanilla. Palate is smooth, tannins are rounded, long finish. Still not in it’s full potential but getting there.
Taste of cherry and maybe a hint of tobacco. Complex structure. All in all a really nice wine. Perhaps a little too much much oak at the end.
Start with nice strength, full body, blackberries, cassis, blueberries, plum, cherries, cigar, oak. Still young, and I am looking forward to it in 5-10more year when I’ll open my jeroboam…
This grand cru classé has very defined and present aromas. Red fruit aromas combined with tobacco, leather and oak. The tannins are quite present, full round taste ending with sweetness
(4.3/5) Lovely plum and subtle oaky notes on the nose. Sweet aromas. Med-high acidity and firm tannins on the palette. Plum with slight earthy and oaky hints. Great drink
A beautifully approachable wine already at 6 years old. The 2015 vintage was a good one. Very fresh, blackcurrant and some black pepper and cloves. A good tannic structure

The 10 was good but the 13 is lackluster at best.

The other of the laughably discounted 2013 Margaux's I was talking about. Glad to report this considerably better than the Dauzac

Short on complexity. But what's there is pleasant, and is not marred by a lousy dampness. 

Bramble fruit, lead, tobacco, marmite twiglets. 

Not bad.... for a 2013. Doesn't have the Margaux beauty I love. And not enough power or structure to age. But it's good for drinking now.

Good Margaux, in a classic and elegant style. Lovely aroma, rose, cedar, blackcurrant and plum. The palate adds some bramble and spice, earth, herbs, just a touch of richness from the oak. Overall feel is lighter than most 2010s at this level, I'd say medium/full body. More than compensated for in my opinion by the perfume, vibrancy, and red berry freshness.  The tannins are still rather dense, and I'd expect this to continue to improve.

This is notably a full step up in quality. Very appealing nose with licorice, cassis, vanilla and a hint of anise.

Med tannic and acids. Mild spicy, layered flavors yet retains a light feel. Nice licorice in the finale. 13,5% abv. Very good. 16 pts

92 Points, drink from 2020 until 2035. Very dense deep purple coloured, no rim, nose of black berries with noble oak and loads of fruit, spices and oak. On the tongue a dancing acidity that makes you feel this wine less alcoholic, very well balanced and loads of tannins. Feels a bit made, but nevertheless it's a great effort and I can't think of anything like this before from this estate. Finishing long.
The wine shows aromas of black currant and chocolate. Medium-full body. Very good structure. Juicy, balanced, very ripe palate.  Slightly one-dimensional. Finishes well.
One of the ten Fourth Growths in the historic 1855 classification. 2009 is a bit young but enjoyable with medium to full bodied, tick chewy tannins, intense black fruits.

Deep ruby red.
Earthy, florest floor, leather, tobacco and juicy fruit. Powerful yet balanced, full-bodied, moderate acid, long finish with silky tannins. 
ABV 13% (4.2)
Focused, with dusty tannins carrying the core of dark cherry, damson plum and black currant coulis flavors. Light black tea and warm stone accents show on the finish.
Fabulous at 11 years. Barnyard, violet, earthy, floral nose. Fabulous palate - smooth tannin, added black fruit. Loved it.
Surprised at this little wonder sat on the shelf in Lidl Cognac. A well spent 40€ .. delicious with Sunday roast in April
Very nice Margaux! Lots of forest fruits, nice tannines, complex nose. Perfect for Christmas dinner 🎄
Oaky
Just lovely.

I loved this wine. Beautiful nose and full bodied, it was great with lamb chops and brussels sprouts. The food really complemented the wine or was it the wine complementing the food. Overall a fantastic  Bordeaux.

Deep ruby in color with aromas of dark fruit, ripe red fruit, raisin, leather. Dry, medium acidity, smooth medium tannins, medium alcohol, medium body with flavours of blackberry, black currant, chocolate, tobacco, earthy. Medium finish. Very good.

Opaque, black. Heavy tears.

Enormous fruity nose: blackcurrant, leather, cedar, pencil shavings, liquorice. Dark chocolate. Black pepper. Very complex.

Fullbodied, puissance. Very tannic. Perfect acidity and balance. A new gear sets the wine in accelerating motion in the finish. A lot is happening in the very long aftertaste.

Two years ago I found this wine not yet ready. Two years in the cellar have made wonders. Will still improve for a few more years.

4.2-4.3

Deep Ruby Purple.

Blackcurrant,Blackberry,Riped Blackcherry,Vanila,Cedar,Bloodorange,Violet,Spices.

Med fo Full.Fine grained tannin,concentrated and high pitched Margaux of GV.Bit less acidity...Modern and muscular .This vintage somehow reminds me Pauillac.And some intermixed scents of Blood Orange and mineral is like Sardinian Blend.

If I can go out,I definitely pair this with Robuchon's steak and " Black Forest".

Keep 5 years or more must be better.However as like JS mentioned ,enjoyable now.

Magnificent Margaux with a low profile nose of dark Cabernet fruit, black olive tapenade, wood, and earth. Still extremely young in my opinion. Palate is vigorous and chewy but with very fine acidity and elegance. Drink now to 2040. 13.5%. Cork.

2015 Chateau Marquis de Terme, Margaux 4 Grand Cru Classe, juicy, elegant, silky, well structured and complex. Black currants, pencil and flint stone, drink now or hold for many years, I really like this wine, 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot, 7% Petit Verdot, 94/100

Color: deep, dark ruby. Nose: delicate, subtle, intense, a little sweet, complex, fruity: black currant, blackberry, ripe cherry, vanilla and liquorice, pepper and flowers. Taste: black fruits, good acidity, rich, strong tannins, a little nervy (could wait a few years), well-concentrated, full-bodied wine. Good structure and long, smooth finish. Very pleasant and very good wine.

4,4 ⭐ This Château has 39 ha and makes 130000 bottles a year. It was given it's name by the Marquis de Terme in 1762. Today owned by the family Sénéclauze. 60% Cabernet Sauvignon 35% Merlot 5% Petit Verdot. Flavours of blackfruit, oak and vanilla. Fruity with some tanine. Very deep red in colour. Already good with still a lot of potential. Tasted on the big wine fair "Week-End des Grands Crus Bordeaux" in September 2021.

Fourth Growth chateau. Showing really well. Fragrant bouquet of sweet strawberry with dark fruit and woody notes. Very elegant and balanced. Medium body with a smooth, silky palate. Acidity and tannins are structured but well integrated. Long, graceful finish.

Classic Margaux in peak form. Intense nose and palate of violets, cassis, blackberries, raspberries, red and black plums, with a well integrated layer of sweet tobacco, vanilla, licorice, smoke and leather. Squelches on the palate, grips and glides in equal measure. Flavours and aromas converge towards the finish. Extremely well priced for a few moments of travel to the cellars of le Médoc.
Easy on the Palate, good rounded flavours of fruits, earthy notes, a hint of vanilla and crushed floral notes. Elegant and still young. Maybe give it 3 years more.
Dark ruby with crimson rim.  Black cherry, cassis, earthy aromas.  Medium plus alcohol, high acidity, high tannins and full bodied.  60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% merlot, % petite Verdot.
Excellent Margaux. Dark fruits, cassis, licorice, dried herbs, ground pepper, earthy, cedar and tobacco. Medium body, medium + acidity and tannins. Rounded and tasteful.
Jamm, cacao, molasis, vanilla, baked vegetables. Tannic and fresh. Very fruity flavors and long finish. Cherry garnet color matches with overripe aromas and enhanced fruitiness..
Beautifulwine. No brown edges, so lots of life left. The dark fruits are solid; neither too strong or weak. There are some musty notes. The mouthfeel is great. The finish it clean.
Absolute beauty. Still lots of fruit but developing wonderful secondary aromas. Rich but not opulent. Was wonderful with beef wellington.
Very complex, well aged Margaux wine.  Rich and smooth structure, medium tannin, somewhat fruity.  Well worth the price.  Enjoyed a lot!
Wow, this is spectacular! Wonderful notes of wet leather, forestberries and a tad of Tobacco. Went perfectely with confi de canard.
Cherry jam, black currant, blackberry. Well-balanced, light yet charismatic. Can be both gastronomic and independent at the same time. Great!

Wine with charm, gentle, friendly from one side, aristocratic from other. 
Ripe cherry, plum notes in quite high tanninic taste.

Given time will be a great QPR buy. Today pours a ruby red giving off a typical 09 sweet cedar blackberry smoke oak chocolate nose that is still mildly green with floral berries so will benefit from age. Super silky smooth light palette of dark red plummy fruits showing slight green youth & sweet tea notes. Finish med+ and very dry but still balanced. OK to drink now but I'd hold and try in 2-5 years. Needs time for earthy Margaux to develop through youthful sweet lively berries & show itself. Buy n store.
Tasting at the chateau. Small production (4K bottles) done differently in concrete eggs with q blend containing more Merlot than Carbenet Sauvignon. More fruity and texture. Nice to drink now
Nice Bordeaux, in nose blackberry earthy and oak. Hints of black current/Cassis in taste as well as tobacco. Clear that it is a young wine. I look forward to follow the developement🍇🍷
Really delightful Margaux. All the best flavours and tannins of the left bank. Needs  air. Immediately strong and softens once opened.

8,5/10
At first not very Marguax on the nose - more Paulliac, but with air the forest floor appears, the animalistic notes are more clear. Medium bodied with and probably too young.
Very nice!
Looking forward to the aged version

Excellent, rich,  fruity nose. Amazing length. Wonderful.
Fruit compote and chocolate - like a Black Forest Gateau in a glass

Enjoyed at the winery.
Black plum, blackberries, leather. Smooth but with a bit of punch in the middle.
Fruit alive, tannin softening
Good Bourdeaux with some potential. Nice aroma, solid tannins and beautiful garnet red. Intresring to hold few bottles and see how it ages.
blackberry, strawberry, black cherry and slight notes of plum. Great elegance and nice albeit not so long finish. A la tienne
Tamed tannins, chocolate, ripe fruits, cherries, licorice, floral and some hints of pepper. Lovely.
Dried fruit and spices on the nose, acidity present ... violet and cigar box, very balanced and light-medium weight

Deep garnet in color, features notions of minted blackcurrants, new leather and Black Forest cake with nuances of sautéed herbs, tar, underbrush and wild fungi plus a waft of cedar. Full-bodied, the palate has a rock-solid structure of firm, grainy tannins and bold freshness supporting the taut, muscular fruit, finishing long and earthy.

I'm having to kill some more time before flying home. Time to try another Marquis de Terme. 2013, visually still young.rather tight on the nose. Opening tasting light oak, earth & graphite. Looks like I'll be adding this to my collection.
B (well balanced, dark cherry, earthy, good acidity)
1981 Chateau Marquis de Terme. Margaux. Still alive and kicking. Wet tree trunk, mushrooms, brown leafs, blackberries, cherry, dried figs, leather, tobacco.
4.3 🇫🇷 Great Bordeaux with “the mouse just leaving the house”  blackcurrant blackberry cherry oak leather tobacco vanilla earthy smoke licorice prune forest floor
Really enjoyed this.  Allowed to open up for an hour,  this was dark,  medium bodied with blackberry and currant palate with limestone and leather in the background.
Drank too soon, that much is clear, but still a cracking left bank! Tannins are mellow and long lasting, fruit an spice is very well balanced, more on fruit due to youth... Lay down for 10 more years

Back in style,1 from 2 best of my week.Good nose of ripe fruit,red cherry,tobacco and a bit of oak.on palate is ripe with slightly oak.dry upfront with hint of sweetness at end.med body with a proper acid give it more complex and joy....short to med finish...overall is lovely frenchy wine.

Decant & breathe 2h. Rich dark fruits aroma with hints of chocolate. Smooth complex subtle integrated tastes including dark fruits, chocolate, vanilla, hints of spices, pepper. Very good finish. £25 from Aldi.

It took me some time to understand if I liked this wine. It smelled of a beutiful Cabernet, but had a somewhat sharp ending. It opened after a while and the dark berries lasted longer. Very powerful taste of tobacco. Nice tannins

Very enjoyable bottle. Not cheap, but fairly priced for a classified growth. 

Full bodied and earthy but still super smooth and beautifully balanced.  
Rich dark fruit notes, hints of oak and leather. 

My first encounter with this Chateau, very well made wine.

4.3/5 ⭐️ incredible wine! Powerful and elegant. One of those wines to keep in the cellar for 20+ years. Young but drinkable. Madera, tabaco, vainilla, blackcurrant, blackcurrant, Pepper and licorice. De cuerpo media y taninos elegantes. Un vinazo!

Appearance: clear deep ruby red.
Nose: developing, clean condition, medium+ intens. Aromas of raspberry, liquorice, smokey touch, cedar, rose petals.
Palate: dry, medium+ body, medium+ finish, nicely balanced.
Assessment: outstanding wine. Potential for aging.

A true good margaux. Definitely needs to be decantered. Wait 10-15 mins before drinking. Honestly the smell while drinking is less spectacular but this is a very decent and reasonably priced left bank Bordeaux.

Nice Margaux by Chateau Marquis de Terma , red fruit, cherry, red currant, spicy, herb, savory, pepper, mint, medium plus acidity and high tannins, full-bodied,

Dark ruby color. Blackberry and dark fruits on the nose.  Height tannins and acidity that will mellow over time. Long spicy finish.  Very nice wine that will age gracefully!!
Deep, beautiful colour. Smooth and velvety, dark fruit and a little bit of tobacco. Already very enjoyable but can be aged too.
Bold fruit, medium+ tannin and acidity. Quality buy for the price

Oh this was so good, very balanced and well blended, big and smooth with balanced mid acidity and tannins. Flavours of cherry, clove, chocolate, oak, smoke, leather and plum

Very very good!

2015 tasted at the Chateau. Well-structured and showing great longevity. A surprising amount of red fruit.
This fourth growth blend has strong notes of oak, leather, black currant, and tobacco. Also low in tannins.
Deep purple color. Blueberry and blackberry smell. Taste is dry without oak. With earthiness. No tar. Maybe chlorine. Smooth.
😇👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼  oak tobacco leather
Black cherry tastes. Subtle tannin.
Most excellent — I had this at the proper temp in the high 60s. Deep violet. Soft tannins, lush red fruit, licorice, hints of saffron

4.3 - This wine is so Margaux! I love the delicate balance between fruit ( black cherry, black currant ) tannin and earthy minerality .
