Incredibly deep almost black in colour. Taste notes of black currant, chocolate, cherry and oak. Pretty fruity, acidic and dry. Enjoyed this delicious Margaux at Chateau Marquis de Terme in Bordeaux.

Classic Bodeaux, dark fruits, black currant and ripe cherry. 
65% cabernet and 25% merlot
Outstanding!
What’s not to like. This costs £14.99 at Lidl for a Cru Classé Bordeaux that coats £30+ normally. Classic dark fruit, smoky and tannic. Still young but outstanding value. Get it while you can.

Complex and structured
Cassis, cedar, subtle earthy notes of forest floor and leather.
Need some time to soften the tannins. Beautiful favour with good structure. 
All rounded indeed
Classic Margaux, cherry and blueberry, cedarwood, pencil shavings, ripe blue fruit flavors on the palate, verry smooth, well integrated, silky tannins a point now !!! 91 DSP
Cherry, oak, berry jam on the aroma. Light to medium body. Red fruit on the palate. Low acidity, strong tannins. Medium to long finish. One of the lightest Bordeaux body-wise I have ever tried.
An elegent wine in the Margaux appeallation. Pronounced flavours of blackcurrants, blackberry, licorice and hint of oaky smoke. Definitely better after 5-10 more years of maturation.

Huge vintage 2015. Very very smooth and silky  while still fresh with strong fruit presence. Tannic but somehow extremely well balanced. I would give the winemaker a perfect score for this blend. Don't think he could have done a better job. Still young for my taste so will come back after a few years. This really has the potential for a 5star rating.

A fine dark red Bordeaux with softened but strong tannins, moderate acid.  Subtle dark fruit, cherry but dominated by mineral notes, leather and graphite.  Can be collared a bit more, but very good now.  So, don't drink.  Enjoy with red meats and fatty foods.

Surprisingly good wine this winery in a magnificent year!
Vanilla smell, oaks, floral at last Dark fruits , juicy , Comfortable tannins and nice acidity. Long lasting enjoyment. Great aging potential. A modern Margaux ?
Vintage 2001 in a friend gathering. Decanted for 1 hour. Dark ruby  oak blackberry blackcurrant. Classic and well balanced. Another fantastic Margaux!
Full bouquet of inviting dark berries packed well in perfect body and just right finish. A LB grand cru classé bottle filled with RB charm. Simply delicious!
Great Cabernet Sauvignon from Margaux.   Deep ruby purple color.   Dry with strong tannins.   Oak and vanilla on the nose. Strong earthy and black fruit flavor.
Beautiful oak on the nose. Subtle berries and somewhat sweet lingering taste. Perfect Cab characteristics that you’d expect from such a wonderlik Margaux. Love it!

Cassis vanilla pencil shavings oak on the nose classic bouquet smooth balance soft tannins but still strong grip and nice structure oak dark fruit vanilla licorice pencil shavings on the palate long finish

Cher ry and cedar on the nose, quite bold. This is a very well developed wine now, smooth, balanced with struckture. A palete of dark cherries, casiss, leather, some black currant, and oak. Somewhat complex, long dry finish. Good with entrecote.

A mature GCC Margaux showing class and balance. 13% abv. composed of 60/33/7 CS/M/PV contributed by @[1|51941787|Martin Stolz]. Cheers to old Margaux's!

Cloudy deep garnet red colour.

Smoke, tobacco & cigar box upfront, follower by cassis & blackberry. Lovely tertiary notes of balsamic & red bell pepper on top.

Very similar on the palate with dark fruit, tobacco, smoke, oak & red bell pepper.

Elegant m(+) body with still grippy m+ tannins and a balanced acidity. Balsamic m+ finish.

Pure elegance here! That bouquet is a real highlight. So much of roasted notes, leather and spice with green pepper. Outstanding in intensity!

Palate itself showed no tannines, very low density and a very fresh and intense acidity - very old fashioned, no fruit bomb or anything here. Dominated by its elegance.

Finish is medium with some aroma
Feedback, but not as impressive as the bouquet.

A wine you could smell for hours at! Drink now, 91 pts.

My very last 2007 from this great GCC.

What a lovely wine by now, still peaking this bottle. How nice to see that such wines also from a lesser vintage still shine! It was good to re-taste this great one only a pity that it was my last bottle.

A concentrated ruby red colour with lot’s of black fruits, leather and spices on the nose. After decanting this wine became top balanced with a great palate of blackberry, black cherry, currant, fine spices, leather, pepper, oak, liquorice & great tannins.
Rate 4,1⭐️

Medium ruby red color. Medium plus bodied with medium plus tannins and medium plus acidity. Years in cellar will help becoming better and better. Palate shows blackberry, blackcurrant, leather, earthy and oak.
At Chateau Marquis de Terme on Medoc wine tour.

My last bottle of this. Medium to deep ruby colour. On the nose, lovely fragrance of cassis, oak and some Margaux hints of violet. In the mouth, medium bodied with lovely balanced layers of dark fruit and vanilla notes. Good acidity and nicely integrated tannins, and a lengthy finish. 4.3.

Drank this marvelous wine with friends during NYE dinner, had it decanted for 1,5 hours. 
After opening it evolved into heavy dark fruit, cedarwood and earthiness to it. A full body, tanins slightly off balance with the acidity. Long aftertaste, all in all a marvelous wine with a nice complexity to it.

New-Year Eve (4/6)
Lovely nose, elegant, which gradually reveals scents of cedar, cigar box, cocoa, leather, ripe fruits (blackberries, black cherries, blackcurrants), pencil lead & spices. Velvety mouth, all in finesse & delicacy, with silky tannins.

Such a joy to smell this wine and the first sip is a confirmation your nose was right. Great stuff and after a short round tour drinking USA wine, very happy to be back to the basics where live is great and wine is perfect.

Classic Bordeaux Margeaux with all the attributes of this style. The time for the 2007 is clearly now ( 2018). In the glass: Very Dark Red. Nose: Morello cherry, a hint of vanilla and tabacco: Taste: Far stronger then the 12.5% Alc. would make you think. Dominant peatiness and strong wood; rich on tannins. Finish: Only in the finish I was able to make out the cherry and dark fruits from the nose; very slight hints of vanilla sweetness ( needed more than one glass to detect those ;-) ).
Moorishly good, however dissatisfying. It is not Perfection that builds robust character, but the discrepancies. This bottle had neither.

4.3. Dark ruby with purple tones in the glass, very little sediment. Opens up quickly: forest floor, black pepper, vanilla, plenty of black currant, rose petals, cherry on the aroma. Complex yet very well balanced and super elegant. Cherry, dark chocolate, blueberry, notes of raspberry, and oak on the palate. Mellow and mighty enjoyable. Medium finish. Served at room temperature. Roast (Kobe) beef, roasted salmon both pair ideally with this wine. Another 10 years or so of cellar life appear quite possible👍👍

⭐: 4.2
🇫🇷: France
🏕: Margaux
🍇: Cabernet sauvignon
🍷: Dry 
🥴: ? 
👃: Oak, tobacco, cherries, raspberries, black Berry, black currant, horse stable, smoke and pepper
👅: Stable, blackberries, black currant, cherries, leather, Oak, and vanilla
🧠: Very complex cabernet sauvignon. This one was a good experience.

🇫🇷 Another superb and well kept wine from the vintage post the great vintage but a Margaux from 1983 - yes please.

👁 Mid ruby only slight browning at the rim.

👃 Sweet, cherry and shrub, underbrush and leaves - really towards herb with lavender, sage and spice. Complex and intensely aromatic - aged claret as it should be.

👄 Silky smooth and integrated tannins, some fruit in the form of black fruits but a lot of cedar - a well woven wine at or just past its peak. Great length.

A medium bodied Margaux.
One of ten 4ème crus.
And - most importantly, you can now order a case of 6 (obvs not the '89 vintage) at Marks & Spencer! This is how sexy (or unsexy) it is. 
Tasted in 06/05, this has good fruit concentration, it is round & soft with quite a bit of oak on the finish. 
Being an '89 vintage, the year propably helped a fair bit to propell this into something delicious-tasting.
In other years, this is a solid, excellent value, reliably well-performing chateau. Just don't think of M&S!

Had the chance to taste this 1995 vintage. On the nose, blackfruits, desiccated floral notes, and black truffle. On the palate, dried raspberries, cassis, ripe blueberries, black truffle, and wet forest floor. Tannins are smooth. Medium acidity. Would recommend this wine to celebrate if you enjoy aged left bank Bordeaux!

deep cooked  fruit. bit of vegetal.  The nose is mind blowing.  Round. Long.  utterly delightful. Amazingly,  no need to decant. As my dad said, it's one of those rare wines that explodes worn flavor while remaining balanced.

Wine is clear, brightness is bright, pale red ruby color, edge is deep garnet, no gas, sediment, viscosity is moderate.
Aroma is clean, dried red current, dried red cherry, dried raspberry, dried rose, violet, leaf, smooth cigar, mushroom, aroma.
Dry, medium body, medium + acidity, medium soft tannin, medium alcohol, medium + finish, completely is moderate +.

Nice bouquet of deep raspberries showing a lot of life is left in this wine.  The wine is clear and still deep red like it was just bottled.  The taste is well balanced and deep with a Great finish, soft leather with a nice finish.  This wine still have lots of time left.

Opened from the cellar. Just what you would want in a 30 year-old Bordeaux. Powerful nose of horse stable, earthy mushrooms in a spring forest, damp pine needles, cinnamon, and strawberry. Punches hard up front with acid, strawberry fruit, and earthy mushrooms. Old worn horse saddle. Exquisite.

Such a charmer! At a perfect drinking window with smooth maturity and freshness. Aromas dominant of dark berries especially black currant and prunes with some leather and tobacco. Very silky taste with high acidity, juicy body balanced on mineral texture and medium tannins. Great!

21 years ago the violinist would laugh and talk about Cortazar. She was tall, tall and thin, always carrying that cage with the music paused, as if she was also trapped, or we both were, as those strings waiting to be played, while she would endlessly, nervously, talk about Cortazar, and how she felt like a cronopio and she would laugh, just looking at me, letting her glance dance and sink deep inside my only thought of what never happened.

Union des Grand Cru de Bordeaux (UGCB) - Chicago June 28th. Featuring the soon to be released 2019 vintage. My 7th place of 13 Margaux. (A 1855 4th Growth classification) 

Quick notes: Blueberry and black currant to start, earthy. A really solid finish. Varietal: 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot.

Estimated 93-95 points (JS 94, D 94) Rating these for potential peak. (Too tannic this young in my opinion).

Don’t be fooled by this vintages dark color, she’s lighter than you think. Great notes of oak, black currant, and licorice. Hints of pepper and mint round it out. A delightful vintage all around. Easy to drink, easy to savor.

A stunning young appearance for a 31 years old wine.

The color is more red with a brownish tone. Nose is fruitless and almost neutral.
On the palate the wine is elegant medium bodied with smooth tannins and a nice acid structure which fits perfectly to the more red than dark fruit flavor of the wine. 
The finish is long with oak and condiments...

A ruby red Margaux with garnet reflections.
A pleasant mix of red and black fruit. Black berries, black cherries and very ripe prunes in the front. The fruit is ripe but not stewed... cigarbox and a leather (delvaux) purse.
Round and soft on the palate, great feed. Tannins are still present and are the backbone for the round and pleasant acidity that is generating some panache. 1994 and this goes crescendo towards the finish!!
Great wine, well aged.
Thanks @[1|1465927|Tom Segers - Winenotes.be]

Bordeaux Quatrièmes Cru classe vintage 2003
60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot, 7% Petit Verdot
Primary aromas of blackcurrant, blackberry, dark cherries and prunes. Tertiaries of cedar, liquorice, leather and roses.
Medium body. Medium-minus acidity, medium fine grained tannins. Medium fruit sweetness of ripe black fruits. Elegant balance. Ok complexity. Pleasant level of alcohol. 
Medium+ length finish.
Due to the suboptimal vintage 2003 the wine is already fading. Drink now!

I couldn't not share this wine on Vivino.
Despite its 24 years of age, and 14 years in my cellar, travelling between London and lebanon, this wine is still impressive. Extremely young, well balanced and very refined.

19/10/18  4.1 red purple slightly transparant. 18 years old but not that many signs of aging. Spicy oak, liquorice, soft ripe cherry and forest fruit. On the palate round with a nice grip, well integrated acidity and tannines. Nice freshness and with 12,5% low alcohol. A classic Bordeaux wine from the excellent 2000 vintage. A pleasure to match with steak and pommes frites.
Cherry, black cherry, cassis, smoke, cedar blackberry nose. Very smoky palate, tanins still alive , quite acidic, more blackberry but I ripe, cedar.
Ruby red with tannins, present dark berries with smokey notes. It's a nice red, not too heavy, not too complex. Matches well with dark red meat.
Good balance of woody notes, gentle fungus, violet and gentle brambles.
2015: Beautiful, intense, smooth, harmonious, well balanced, a fine Margaux 👌😊
An elegant violet jumping out of the glass 🌺
Very nice Margaux!

Very deep colour. 
Aromas of blackcurrants. 
Young and light body. 
Not much flavours, but great potential. Quite high tannins that quickly dissipated. 
Some liquorice on the finish.

Surprisingly concentrate with pronounced nose of plums, blackcurrant and red berries, wood, vanilla, toast, pepper.
Concentrated palate with medium acidity, soft tannin, and medium + body. Medium + length.

Served from a magnum bottle decanted for 3 hours before drinking 
A weaker vintage 
More green notes with some cigar, and smoke on the nose 
More smoky on the palate 
Fruit a bit weak 
Tannin also on the green side and a bit angulated 
Otherwise dou ok

Clear tobacco, leather, herb medicine, vinegar / black currant; average acid and tannin, dry oak comes onto palette. 30 minutes enough to wake it up. Turns into ink / crab / soy sauce after waking up in the glass. 18 months in oak barrel

Lovely Margaux classic balanced elegant ready to drink, tempting nose of coffee, chocolate, earth, black currents, licorice, medium to full body with well rounded elegant tannins and a delicious finish. My score 89, drink to 2021

4.1⭐️ Classic and elegant Margaux that shows its glory at full maturity. 

Refined with vanilla, deft cedar, licorice, and subtle leather nuances. Forest fruit has beautifully matured to only the essence, giving full way to the mature elements, while remaining fresh with vivid acidities. Smooth tannins.

Best showing I have had!

12.5% abv 😳. We can only hope that these classic Bordeaux profiles return some day.

I like bordeaux, as long as it's old and stored properly. This ticks off both boxes. Although still youthful, it's just stepped into its drinking window. Cedar perfume, leather oil, tons of blackberry and blackcurrant as you'd expect, but also with a subtle edge of cherries and mint. After some time it becomes more and more tertiary with forest floor, wet moss and earth. Still slightly taut and rustic, but the edges and tannins have been rounded sufficiently. Drink now- 2045(+)

@[1|51941787|Martin Stolz] rocked up with a proper big name, not only that, it was also properly aged!! Thanks buddy!

Typical, smoky nose with sousbois, black cherry, cigar box, ripe prune and integrated oak followed by a palate with black pepper pepper, juicy red and black fruit, very in your face acidity and spicy, integrated tannins. 

Over its peak but that peak was so high probably that at this stage it still was very entertaining. 4.2

Smooth and bold and not showy about it. So good, in fact, that my husband opened his Vivino app to make a note and he never bothers. Elegant balance of fruity and punchy and set off Easter dinner perfectly.

This is a lovely treat for a wed night. I fancied Margaux and this did the trick. Still some improvement within but this 2010 is ready to go. Almost black in the glass, brooding and inviting. Tannins apparent but soft, great mouthfeel. This is blackcurrant blackberry and cherry with vanilla and nutmeg. Super stuff wish I had more. 4.25

Winery tour in Médoc, Margaux. It's like a dream come true! We were lucky enough to get a private tour at  Château Marquis de Terme. Known for being one of Thomas Jeffersons favourites. First of all, stunning scenery and what a great setup! Délphine  showed us around the vinyard and presented us this memorable Crand Cru Classé. 58% Cab.Sauv, 35% Merlot and 7% Petit Verdot. Lovely aromas of plums, graphite, chocolate and dark cherries. Feels like velvet when drinking. Smooth, rounded tanins with long spice

Our family’s Christmas wine for 2021. An elegant and balanced Margaux. The 2010 vintage has thrown up stunners that have been a pleasure to partake. Has all the character of what makes Margaux simply irresistible. Perfectly approachable today, but I suspect more bottle years will allow it to further excel. Notes of black fruit, cassis, raspberry, vanilla, toast, tobacco, cigar box, petroleum, mushroom, forest floor, violet and hints of plum. Lingering finish with a balanced and linear sip to swallow.

Summary: great wine; already drinkable but will improve even more I reckon. Great succulent and sweet tones of ripe fruit, wood, laurel and herbs. 

On the nose: hints of black fruits, laurel, rosemary, leather, tobacco, oak, ripe cherry, blackcurrant and ripe violet. 

On the palate: wonderfully elegant, sweet and succulent. Warm and embracing with layered complexity. Very nice finish. 

Points: 17

Bought bottle around two years ago in Carrefour. The wine looks younger than it is. Opens up with strong smell of raw meat and iron, combined with cherry and raspberry. After an hour of breathing, meat decayed and other aromas appeared - plum, cassis, cedar, dark chocolate, vanilla, spices, like anise and cloves. Palate is acidity driven with powerful, but softened tannins, plum, blueberry, cherry, chocolate, cedar and spices, long aftertaste. Wine evolved from 3.7⭐ to 4.2⭐, so I recommend to decant it.

Deep dark ruby. Sturdy legs. I love the aromas of cherry, red plums, cassis and some chalk. Chewy structure, well integrated tannins, lively acidity, with sour red berries, bitter herbs, notes of young leather and roasted, oily coffee beans. Medium body. Rather short, dry finish.

Happy Friday at work.

Color: ruby red going to garnet 

Nose: cassis, oak, vanilla 

Palate: cassis, black pepper, oak

Comments: strong tannins right now which requires a bit of time to mellow. Should be great in 3 years or so.

Very young and quite tannic at the moment but approachable. Signs of oak, tobacco and blackberries. Love the structure and the firmness of this 2010 Bordeaux. A good quality wine at this price point. Probably needs another 4-5 years to reach its prime.

(4.0) 'Traveling through the Medoc we passed this 1855 Margaux Grand Cru. It produces an aromatic  and happy Bordeaux with fruit and violets in the nose and a strong and fruity/tobacco/spicy taste that remains for a long time. Good although I expected a bit more.'

👀Donker Bordeaux rood, licht troebel
👃🏻Viooltjes, cassis en tabak
👅Zwarte bessen/bramen, pruimen, eucalyptus, laurier

🛠13.5% 60%CS/35%ML/5%PV
🛒Bar du Vin, 8€(glas)

Elegant lovely Margaux 4CC wine. Earth soil, wet forest, dark berries, chocolate and cacao elements  on nose. Quite strong acidity, athletic tannins with blackberries on palate. Medium plus bodied and medium but quite long smooth finish. Structured and balanced wine. Nicely feminine style and texture. Paired well with lasagne. Needs an hour decanding and surely benefits longer cellaring. Drincable anyway already.

Purple-red; medium legs. Aroma: manure, cherry, mint, cinnamon, robust aroma. Texture: velvet tannins, bone dry, mid-front mouth, front of hard palate, (moderate-)high acidity, fresh, not overly sour. Taste: black currant, plum, full-bodied. Finish: increasingly bone dry and acidic, spicy/cayenne, long.

Great Cabernet Sauvignon based wine. Solid red currant aromas and flavor, firm but smooth tannins adding good structure to the wine. Well balanced. Good acidity. Dark color. Long finish! Great steak wine. The kind I like!

Still too young.  On opening, fragrance of wood, subtle tabacco and dried tea leaf. Very tight and almost flat on the palate, with strong tannin.  After 2 hours decant, lively with subdued dryness, cherries, chocolate, coffee, crispy, long finish. Should have caught it at 1 hour.  Good value.

Probably the best wine I've had so far, or at least one of the best. No wonder French are the leaders in wine production. Aroma is out of this world, Smokey with a floral smell at the end. This bomb taste started with a solid strong oak accompanied by a bitter cheese flavor, or maybe tobacco sensation, and finish with sweet vanilla touch maybe fresh forest fruits. The potent oaky sensation shows definitely it's a Grand Cru. Recommended with a good thick stake.
OUTSTANDING
High acidity but good ageing potential. Lovely flavour profile: dark chocolate, cassis, pepper, leather, tobacco. But still tight.
A soft, medium-bodied wine, mild opening with strong raspberry and earthy notes coming in midway with a modest tannin through the finish.
Exceptional!! Amazing!!

Exquisite Bordeaux!
Excellent pairing with rare-mediumrare steak. Rounded, slightly fruity on the palate.
Highly recommendable!
Perfect in balans
Violet, fruity, tender and half-bodied. Lovely Bordeaux!
Love The salty liquorice In The nose. Super! Violet and blackcurrant. And tannins. Very good wine.

Small bottle

Still closed 

🍇 : Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petir Verdot

Notes TK
It’s the best I’ve ever had. I got lit, and it was dope.
Perfect
oak leather blackcurrant tobacco blackberry vanilla cedar black fruit
Nicely rounded fruits with cream
ok
Love it
Excellent wine
Excellent!
Excellent
91 points. Vintage 2016 opened in 2022. Tasted at the weekend des Grands Cru in Bordeaux.
Nice
Elegant Margaux with soft tanins and long finish. 2016 a year to be marked.
Ripe juicy black fruits, prune, chocolate and nice sandy tannins #primeurs2014
Excellent value at $50. BlackBerry, vanilla with bold color and flavor to match. The blend is outstanding and slightly tannic. The ‘09 drinks very well now (Dec ‘18) after an hour or so of decanting.
The 2015 is very good, though perhaps a little behind your average Margaux from the same vintage. oak leather. Blackcurrant, blackberry , tobacco and other tertiary aromas.
Excellent wine, good balance throughout with room to grow with age.  Drink 2016 to 2018.  Violets , green peppercorn, cedar, red and black fresh jam, slight smokiness and cocoa aftertaste
Really good Value Margaux. Elegant and well balanced.
Light black fruit aromas, on the palate more black currant, blackberry and cassis, with leather and earthy notes. Medium tannins with a well rounded mouthfeel. Medium finish. Very nice Margaux.
Dare garnet, a lot of legs. Fine nose of licorice, leather, earth, graphite, and dose of cherry juice. Medium to full body, tight and tense, full on tannin, fine and quite mellow. Good earthy finish.
Not a very typical Margaux. Predominantly oaky, Vanilla, licorice, pepper, mint. The typical violet and plum notes are more subtle. Full and powerful wine, long finish, tanin less refine.
Delicious, well balanced, tasty now, but room to grow
Nice and fruity, but a little closed, too young
Bright ruby in colour.  Red cherry, oak, black currant, subtle spice in the aroma. Flavour of red apple, cherry, oak, spice and herbs. Subtle leather. 87.
Impressive 2nd label, very tasty with food and can be drank any day!
Lovely wine, balanced, complex, berry fruit, drinking well now and for a few more years.  Great year 2000.  Sgd119.
Barn Yardy and floral, drinking very well. Full bodied and still very youthful. Elegant and structured. Very nice
4th growth and can't follow Segla's 2nd growth quality as a nearly 30 year old wine. A bit thin, but the taste is good
Perfect now, great value grand cru Margaux. Now a lot of depot in the bottle so I would suggest to filter it first.
Needed 10 minutes to open up. But then very nice. Well balanced with spicy food. Great minerality. Would prefer more complexity.
Complex with lots of red fruit, chocolate,  vanilla with a long aftertaste and a bit acidity. Very nice!
A humble fourth growth but it was third in the seven wines of our double blind. Classic Margaux nose.
Enjoyed very much at La Rochelle, in Gregory Coutanceau‘s Restaurant. Great wine menu
Full. Definite finish. Classic Grand cru. Pleasant appellations
Mega value from Aldi. £20! Bargain!

Absolutely amazing. Served between cellar to room temperature decanted.
Typical margaux, with bold fruity, and tanin notes. Very smooth

Very complex. Rich full bodied, long finish.
Hints of different herbs, vegetables, chocolate, cassis. This is a winner!
Stupid amazing! Incredible nose, complex, dark fruit, leather, but balanced and approachable. Phenomenal wine.
Medium bodied, finesse styled wine with a fresh, cherry component, toasty oak and sweet, but light, fruits in the finish.
Damp forest. Mildly tannic. Balanced of dark and red fruits. Tea leaves. Classic Margaux and long finish
Finally a nice balanced Bordeaux. Delicate nose of violet, strawberries and raspberries with wood on the palate.
4.25 Impressive volume and great structure with superb, luscious tanins. Huge aging potential on top of it
Ｇ
Superb
Good

Superb. This 2013 vintage was drunk late 2021 and it was amazing. Still lots of fruit, lovely soft tannins, glorious red fruits taste. A little blackberry but mainly wonderful Merlot red fruits. Highly recommended.

Decanted 45mins

Deep youthful purple 

Still pretty fruits (plum, currants) driven nose, along with some spices of anise.

Smooth, dark fruit, kumquat and mild pepper on the palate, gritty tannins, , medium-full  body. 

4 ⭐️ Margaux to end the work week 😊

4.2 with a bigger potential

Deep Dark garnet
Blend of 60% CS, 33% Merlot, 7% PV 🍇

Vinified in concrete vats then aged 16 to 18 months in oak barrels 🛢

Complex Nose 👃 of dark berries, ripe dark fruits, ripe red fruits, jam, black cherries 🍒, plums & chocolate 🍫 

On the palate juicy, lush & dense with silky tannins and a medium plus acidity

Sensational margaux, very young now, but surely a wine to cellar as it will sparkle in a decade

Happy Margaux Bordeaux sunday 🍷

With some patience and air, the wine is a great experience.
It must be decanted and it develops very well.
👁 intense dark red color
👃 ripe black fruits, blackberry,  blackcurrant, blackberry, oak and earthy notes
👅rich and complex, very fruity, with ripe black fruits but without a sweet sensation and this is very nice!
Also tobacco, dark chocolate,  forest floor, dried fruit and smoke notes in the aftertaste next with his great earthiness.Firm tannins, long finish
🙌 memorable! Very big aging potential

Round, woody and rich 4th growth Bordeaux next to famous Margaux village and Ch Margaux. CS dominance was obvious from the bouquet, with subtle and fresh oak. What I really liked was its concentrated minerality. Quite ready to enjoy, pleasant tannins. 4.2.

Medoc 4th Growth. Still young, but it was gradually opened up 2 hours after the decantage. Beautiful nose of plum, vanilla, leather and tobacco. Would need to wait for another 5 to 10 years, but it shows us the potential and quality already. Bought at Aeon de Wine.

Outstanding vintage from one of my favourite left bank Bordeaux. Intense fruit liquorice plums and cassis beautifully integrated with tannins, some spice, leather and chocolate   But the Calon Segur tasted from the same year alongside just pipped it. A great wine.

Dark, opaque purple colour.
Nose of herbs, black fruits, smoke, cassis, graphite, plum, red fruits and tar.
Medium body, dry with medium plus tannins.
Moderate acidity, a surprise given the wine age.
A decent finish lasting over 10s

Nice Margaux. Musty, earthy, forest greens, dark berries. Clear, medium body, but with great complexity and refined. Really pleasant and only the bitterness in the finish prevents it from being really great.

Deep ruby color. Med + nose intensity, black currant, black plum, prune, smoke, cedar, vanilla, some leather. Dry, med + acidity, ripe and black fruit dominated, some tertiary aromas. Med + body, med + finish.

Almost ready to drink. A rich and elegant nose of brambly fruits, blackcurrants, bit of minerality, violets and smoky oak. 
The palate is powerful, full-bodied. Even a bit robust. What I didn’t expect after 11 years. Also its tannins. They contribute to a very long but still solid finish. Excellent length. Don’t forget to decant! This wine has plenty of years ahead.

Imagine a well used premium cigar box, stuffed with sage, anise, the olds and ends of an old saddle. Add to the table ripe plum and dark cherries. That pretty much sums it up (oh, tannins were still firm and this needed decanting and time to breath). Overall: drinking well now, but will age another decade.
Balanced - both refined and velvety but also complex and bold. High tannins with aging potential, vanilla, dried fruit, cherries, herbs

Tobacco on the nose, cherry and wet rock. Smooth and absolutely lovely.  Well done, Ludovic! 
Also, Thomas Jefferson listed Marquis de Terme as one of his favorite wineries from his days in France.  What a fun trivia fact!
I once heard that the Dutchess of Raamspiss say that everybody sleeps a little better with a sausage in them.  This is a great wine to accompany that meal... mellow yet with multiple facets.
Nice Beekvliet
Ok
Awesome!!
Good
Bitter chocolate.

Truffle and mushrooms, powerful yet very well balanced. Graphite, interesting tannins.
17.5/20
M ruby brick on the rim, smoky, meaty, juicy red cherry, on the palate, violet, hint of sweetness from the ripeness of fruit, very silky, cafe
Aged beautiful. Both nose and taste pretty complex.
Nice mature wine. Stil tanine. But nice body.
Black fruits, wood, vanilla, caramel
Very nice aroma with good body and long finish.
Medoc wine PK...This is the best for me in this session
Very typical Margaux. Still beautiful structure! Perfect timing to drink it.
Lovely wine. Deep red in the glass, with fresh notes of lilacs, blueberries, and cherries. Medium tannins making for a smooth finish.
All the best of a Margaux
Medium bodied, rich in taste, smooth and light tannins. Very pleasant.
Really nice wine. Drinks very well right now.
Rich nose, dark fruit evolving on the palate into a delicate finish
A little lean but classic Bordeaux. Graphite and ripe berries on the nose. Sweet fruit at first but dies a little quickly with soft tannins.
Nice hints of blackcurrant, tobacco and a strong oaky nose even after all these years. Good timing.
93 pts. Really good!
Excellent complexity and length!
Great bottle! Tannins, dusty, and everything you want in a French bold wine
Beautiful wine. No notes.
blackberry leather blackcurrant tobacco graphite cassis. Very good structure and complexity
Sometimes it is good to meet Bordeaux again. Perfectly mature Margaux, with very fine tanins, still lot of fruit and flowers. Love it!
Really good. And still vibrant. Fantastic vintage. Has not peaked yet.
4,2 smooth with long finish
Last bottle. Excellent value.
Served blind, got the vintage correct but unsure about the exact wine. Great developed Bdx
Unbelievable value for money.  I only wish I could more
Superb equilibrium, heavy in taste and an intense nose.
Best bottle of the case to date!
Velvety mouthfeel, tobacco, cedar, coffee and concentrated black fruits. Low acidity, soft tannins. Fig, sage, cloves. Heartwarming.
Dark red color with smooth tannines.
Oak, leather and blackberry very present on the nose and also palate
Nice acidity. oak leather blackberry blackcurrant
Oldest wine I’ve ever had.

8.5/10
Nice complexity good vintage of margaux. Notes of oak and leather. Paired it with scottish beef of t-bone and matched great. Being not too muscular is another plus. Liked this red.
Terrible
well balanced, just a little fruity right now. slightly acidic straight from the bottles but should age nicely. good overall structure,  balanced tannins.
Simple but quite classy, elegant
red fruits intense,  quiet firm structure
Pencil box nose, dark cassis and plum. Tannic palate
Purple red in colour, with aromas of ripe fruit. Silky with a good finish
Power wine, with great structure, dry body, medium tannins and a medium-long finish.

A great year for Bordeaux and this Margaux is lovely, but was expecting more. This is a standard and typical Claret. Needed some gentle time to open up. For the price though there are better ones out there.

Med-faded red with brick & tawny hue at rim; quite sharp & concentrate aromas of earthy strawberry & port like caramel sweetness on nose & palate; rather unremarkable ripe plum with hints of earth, leather & burnt sugar leading to somewhat hollow mid-palate with a mild tannins finish; slightly decline at this point but still very enjoyable, particular the nose; drink up sooner than later.

A v interesting smoked bacon-y smell. Great fruit, drinking just right now. Juicy on the palate, tannins smooth. The sort of wine you keep going back to.
still had an impressive amount of fruit on the nose and palate. Excellent
For ten years or more in my cellar. Ones bought for less than 14 euro's at Albert Heijn. Great wine. Still some tannin's dark grountaste, complex but not too heavy
50 euros for the 1991 in Riga. Wow. All you ever want from Left Bank. What a find. Happy godddamn christmas people. All the fruit, all the notes, perfect.

Soft tannins, lovely palate with hint of black cherry leading into a medium finish. More of a prominent floral nose would have earned it a 4.5.

Margaux Grand Cru The highlight of the evening was medium overall! It Didn't impress! Part Cab Sav part Merlot ! Although it was poured an hour before to let it breath It is still very young !

The most popular red of the tasting in the night. I’m blaming the covid vaccine I had earlier on in the day of the tasting but this wasn’t for me. Tannins not integrated enough, a bit disjointed. Would definitely give the benefit of doubt on another day. Perhaps needs more time

Dark ruby with garnet rim,  with a lot of inky legs.  Elegance on nose,  black fruit,  cassis,  vanilla,  tobacco smoke, hint of oak and dried flower.  Med+ body,  balanced acidity,  sweet spice,  integrated fine tannin, earthy,  graphite,  mint.  Aftertaste is med,  riped fruit and earthy,  round and complex.  A nice 2009, drink now.

This Margaux has tight, grippy tannins and need quite a bit more aging to show its potential. Aromas of violets, black currants, spice, graphite, oak, and toast. I was a bit surprised to find coconut and dill, as well. This is a brambly, savory, earth-forward wine.

A beautiful crafted wine, fragrant nose of Merlot, plum, Asian sweet spices and some creamy character. The palate is smooth, balance and mouthful of sweet fruits flavour. Fine tanning and silky finish.
Lots of black fruits in this wine. Has a great potential, but wait on drinking. Would benfit  greatly of some cellaring

Purple, hign intensity of blueberry, black currant, mint and oak.

Lovely jammy ripe fruit flavours.
Classic Margaux with a firm structure, tannic on opening but mellowing nicely after breathing a bit. A good prospect for laying down for a few more years.
Great wine. Had it on 7.12.2019. Perfect age. Punches well above it’s price bracket. Intense core of blackberries and plum, with tannins that are not too grippy, but hard to miss.
black currant, hint of oak aroma with medium body, high acidity. There could be much better choices in this price range imho.
Dark ruby Color, hints of red fruit, mint and pepper on the nose.  Sour acidity, medium red fruit notes with oak leather and sour cherry notes. Medium finish  decent Margaux and good for the price
Wow. Just wow! An incredible red. We paired it with pizza. Recommended.
It’s Margaux! Very elegant and well balanced. Need 1-2 hour decant to open.
Unexpectedly good for its modest rating. Holding up with age with a maturity, sophistication and complexity one just doesn't find in younger reds. From bouquet to finish, no note is disappointing.

Similar to previous note, still in an excellent place. Old-school Bordeaux funk on the nose, some plum and cassis. Displayed the lightness of a Margaux but not qutie the elegance of the best producers. Still an excellent value.

This wine is great i kept it in my basement for at least 10 years! it’s still one of my favourites i sadly do not have any more of this....let’s go!!

👀 great deep ruby colour 

👃 on the nose it’s full pronounced blackcurrant 👏👏👏 Vanilla, oak 😘
👅 Dry, high acid, high tannins, medium alcohol, full bodies with fantastic intensity and long length 🤩 This wine is outstanding...❤️❤️❤️

A Quatriemes Cru that was once part of the Rauzan estate. This OG is holding up surprisingly well. Very delicate fruit aroma... blackberry leather oak earthy pepper plum cigar box... Unsure of varietal composition but likely Cabernet Sauvignon dominant but all in all great vintage and QpR.

Oak with a capital O! Acidic, dry with deep, powerful notes of blackcurrant, blueberry and a touch of vanilla. Lingering woody tannins. Fabulous margaux, particularly for those seeking a dry, acidic bordeaux...

1985. Shows some brownish color but still keeping the vibrance of bright ruby. Fruity aromas retired (versus the 1996 from same chateau tasted side by side), intense tree moss, grass, oak and trace of soy sauce dominating after slight airing. Medium body, low tannin and low acidity, round soothing and balanced on palate, medium+ length, hay/grass feedback. Aged quite well, thought cork showed black mold under the foil. Another luckier bottle could be way better!

This French red wine from the Bordeaux area is qualified as a 4rd grand clu classe and comes from Margaux. A blend of 55% Cab. Sauv.,35% Merlot, 7% Petit Verdot and 3% Cab. Franc. Although1999 was a wet and difficult year this was one of the better grand cru's from this vintage. Dark red color. Full bodied with good fruits (blackberries) and well balanced soft tannins

Decent Margaux, good as a GC, but not very special. Cool red and blueberryfruit, little red paprika, tobacco, good fruit intensity but lacks the complexity of a top cru. At first impression rather a Spanish wine ((Rioja, RdD), but in the end classic sweet red fruit character with good oak.

UGCB 2017 tasting, Los Angeles, 01/23/20. As I said, I'm not a Bordeaux expert, so at this event, for me, pretty much everything was at least 4 points.

I just work too much, guys, so I will not have the time to write my reviews about all these wines. 
They were all wonderful. Please read other's reviews. @Aaron Blazer & @Howard Yang's are spot on! :-)
I just can't go into details. I was like a kid in a candy store. :-) I now love Bordeauxs. :-)

Château Marquis de Terme Margaux Grand Cru 1998

🏆 Amazing wine, combo of refined maturity & velvety richness… complex & so smooth. Joy & a treat! 

🍇 Cab Sauv, Merlot, Pet Verdot

👁 Med ruby w garnet rim

👃 Bramble, blackberry, forest floor, tar, old leather, violet, hedge grow & hints of raspberry

👅 Dry, med body w med integrated tannin, med- alc at 12.5%, med acidity. Lovely, rich cherry, blackberry, pepper, licorice, prune, red currant, tobacco leaf, earthy boysenberry, dried rose, dried herbs. Superb!

I bought this wine 9 years ago, and was worried it would be past it. It wasn't! 

More subtle (with age) than when I tried the same vintage back in 2006. Delicate balance, with balanced tannins and acidity. The colour gave away the age of the wine, but with a platter of cold meats and strong cheeses this wine went down a treat. A subtle and enjoyable Margaux.
A well aged margaux wine that still has some aging potential.

A lesser known grand cru from the 1855 classification, solid showing with garnet burgundy color, nose of black plum, blackberry, leather, licorice, clove, nutmeg, hibiscus, anise and bing cherry, full body with balanced acidity and good tannin structure, tastes of hazelnut, cacao, hibiscus, licorice, blackberry, clove, star anise, and nutmeg, medium to long finish.

Medium ruby in color with medium plus intensity nose. Black raspberry, black cherry, cherry. Dry, medium plus acidity, medium plus tannins, medium plus body and alcohol. Medium plus intensity. Cherry, raspberry body. Long finish. Very good quality of wine. 4.1 stars

Its stood well for 20 years and it will continue to stand for another 5 nicely. I like this but I'm not in love with it, 96 wasn't exactly favourable towards Margaux so it would be interesting to see what they got up to in a better vintage. Its fruity, its slightly tannic, its got a slightly barnyard aroma. Drink until 2020.

Drinking at the Chateau after a tour, this 1855 Grand Cru blend has a lot of different jars used from concrete and wooden casks used for maceration to new oak barrels, ceramic, amfora and opaque glass. Dark ruby in the glass, black cherry and vanilla aroma, blueberry on the palate, tannic with long finish of white pepper. 2018 still not ready.

Tremendous effort in 05, and the Margaux character is still there in spite of the big body. Fragrant nose of creme de cassis, raspberry puree, blonde tobacco, wet earth and gravel. Still lots of tannins and acidity to balance the body and ensure long life. The best Marquis de Terme I've ever had.
Really nice oaky, dry and spicy from the 15% petit virdot grape. Yum

Medium bodied, slightly inky and easy drinkable wine with a bit of firmness and some acidity towards the finish. Flavours of jam, plum, prunes, a bit of blackberry in the nose. Light and long blackberry finish.

Last bottle of this Margaux. 
Takes an hour to open up. Then the nose is complex with dull cassis and blackberries and a bit of flinty spice. 
Palate is delicious with soft tannins and chocolate, cherries and pencil shavings. 
Quite long and lovely sitting in the sun with good company.

‘97 strikes again- this year is so underrated and everything I have drunk the past years is just so good. Bordeaux / Margaux classic taste and this is just good, a little herbs, chassis. If you like Bordeaux this is it and fully developed and at its best.

Very earthy on the palate with flavors of tar, cough syrup and a little bit of amarena cherry. This wine passed its best drinking period, but is still a pleasure for lovers of old wines who will enjoy the depth and complexity of its ripe personality.

Excellent colour. Nose exhibits good depth, with aromas of wood and dark berries. Medium-weight, showy, but palate lacks harmony. Finish is light, but has good length. Maybe, two more years in the cellar?

3.6  Still dark red but with a fringe of orange developing.  Very pure and refined nose of blackcurrant, mixed with black plum.  Very smooth entry, with blackcurrant and plums mixing with leather and mild tobacco leaf.  The tannins are smooth but make their presence felt on the finish.  Overall a refined wine showing well with 16 years of age - time to drink up though.

It's bordering in becoming past its peak. The fruit is retracting, and notes of leather, maggi, leaves and forest floor are taking over. It also seems a bit thinning in mouthfeel. The balance is still great though, as is the medium(+) finish.

TB. Closed still from beginning to end. Waited 3-4h. Nose subdued, ripe plum, redberries, vanilla. Mouthfeel was a trite harsh, stemmy gritty tannins that took time to unravel. Leather tobacco smoke at end palate. Medium finish. 2005 difficult year to taste despite vintage. 3.7☆

1000th Wine Rating! Time flies :) Nose of plums, tobacco, mushrooms, cedar and underbrush. Medium bodied, soft tannins, dry with medium acidity. Finishes short, slightly tart. A wine that passed its peak few years ago but still delivers some good notes.

The purported star of the night ended up being a bit of a disappointment to me, lacking the purity and elegance I expected.
The nose with cassis and dried flowers never really cleaned up, and lacked definition. The was all on tertiaries, with oxidative notes alongside the dark fruit (which is what I liked best, in its aristocratic poise). Perhaps I should have decanted it extensively, to let it clean up instead of letting it breathe at mid-shoulder for 2 hours.
Don't know what went wrong, but expected more.

bought this in Tokyo on 14/02/2010, 4 months before moving to London. And has been kept in the semi underground house storage room for 8 years then stored in the cellar. Deep ruby colour. Bit too late to enjoy true structure of this wine in 2019. The bottle depost is not so much than expected. Instead, this Margaux seems not to have potential power as such. Rounded tannin remains, but subtle elegance gone..

The rare occasion when hope meets expectation and actual drinking experience. Drinking excellently right now, dark berries, vanilla, oak some leather; a long-lasting taste with just enough tannns  to complete the experience of a complex wine, which checks all the marks for me. Very close to a five-star but I have to leave the possibility of further perfection and refinement with more ageing

Poured a deep purple with a brownish tinge at the meniscus. Probably a little over the hill. A touch of soy sauce and dead leaves on the nose along with pencil lead and cedar box. Noticeable black fruit on the palate without any tannins to speak of.

deep ruby in colour, restrained red fruit characther (needs time to be well decanted and it will develop), a bit of leather, juicy, zesty on the nose, dry, med+ grippy tannins, med alcohol, med red fruit characther on the palate, a bit earthy and jammy, med bodied, med+ acidity, med storyless finish... Silly to open it now, will develop in the next few years but I am not expecting it to be outstanding...

Such a typical Margaux that is subtle, less masculine, and elegantly agile. Amazing to see how the flavor develop over just a few hours. The first few glasses before decanting smell refreshing and appetizing, full of cherry and fresh black fruits, sweetened by the vanilla from the barrel. After spending a hour in the decanter, the tannins got softened, the plum flavor takes over and the aroma is round and warm. Less layered than thought but wonderful experience nonetheless!

1970 was not an easy vintage for Margaux. My expectations were quite low, but the bottle was in pristine condition with a high level of wine. Color not showing any sign of age, dark ruby. Margaux nose, nice cherries, licorice, some leather, hints of plum. No oxidative notes, some signs of age but not smelling like a 70. On the palate, nice tannins, softer than on the nose. Light finish and lacking some intensity, the only sign that this is a weak vintage and an old wine. Won't get any better from now.

Est 1762 Marquis de Terme = Lord Peguilhan. The fame of the Chateau dates back to Thomas Jefferson. In 1787 he visited Bordeaux & listed Marquis de Terme as one of the 16 best wines he had tasted!

Is this wine good in terms of price/quality? The answer is no- why? Because I expect more from a 40$ Left-Bank Bordeaux. A Margaux signature-wine will usually show earthiness, acidity and firm tannins in its youth; this doesn't. The 2016 displays tannins that are already weak and the from oak deriving aromas are overpowering all the rest. What is left, is a wine lacking on the mid-palate, with little aging potential, some elegant violet and chocolate notes, but nothing else to justify its price.

Dark ruby in color with a short purple rim. 

Fruity nose with black currants, blackberries, cherries, vanilla, earth, wood, spices, pencil lead and peppercorn.

Fruity on the palate with blackberries, black currants, sweet cherries, oak, vanilla, licorice, spices, tobacco leaf, light vegetables and peppercorn. 

Medium plus in finish with grippy tannins and tangy raspberries.

Color: deep ruby with medium viscocity

Nose: wine has medium plus intensity of youthful aromas including black plum, barnyard, vanilla, red plum, and a slight herbaceous quality.

Palette: wine is dry with medium plus flavor intensity confirming the aromas. Wine has medium acid, medium plus body, medium silky tannin, and a medium finish.

Finish is medium to medium plus. Wine is very good and can be drunk now but would benefit from 5-10 years of age.

Pale ruby in color with medium intensity nose. Cherry, raspberry, earth, hints of black cherry, violets, blueberries. Very fruit filled nose. Dry, medium acidity, medium plus tannins, medium alcohol and body. Medium intensity of rich black and red fruit. Long finish. Very good quality of wine.

Purple red with intense aroma of plum, riped black currants, liquorice, cedar, tobacco, a bit smoky.

Blackberries, cherries, spices, dark chocolate & mineral on the palate. Consistent with the nose. Full bodied & silky tannins. Good finished & nice 2nd wine.

Very good Barolo at an affordable price with a dark purple color in the aroma and taste dark fruit in the background strongly marked red fruit notes vanilla chocolate coffee tobacco oak cinnamon tar leather earthy mushrooms well balanced high acidity delicate tannin great wine solo.  🍇🍷👍🏻😃👌🏻
Tobacco. Earthy leather and deep dark cherry and plum goodness. Oak. Super grippy long finish. High acidity. Still young. Wonderful Barolo.

Since release I've felt 2014, despite shortcomings, is a good restaurant vintage. Not for an anniversary night out, but if you find yourself in Ymeletrob in Cervinia on a Monday night eating lamb chops after a day skiing in a blizzard, then it totally hits the spot. Immediately open and fruity, cherry and raspberry, with rose, orange peel and spice. The tannins and acidity are firm without dominating, there is subtle leather and tobacco evolution and Piedmontese minerality. Easy. Great with the lamb.
Drank from half bottle, very ready. Strawberry and vanilla, some oak and very dry. Funky and nice scent in a good way.

Excellent, complex, an explosion of flavors all in balance. Full body, elegant rather than powerful.
Garnet color.

Integrated tannins, smooth texture.
In the palate cherry, blackberry, dominant beautiful hazelnut,  truffle, licorice, forest floor, hint of coffee.
Long finish on spices and oaky notes.
Just amazing.

light to medium deep red color. Red fruit, raspberry, blackberry, oak, chocolate and light hints of forest ground. Well balanced with well integrated tannines. Young.

Barolo “normale”.... fresh, salivating and rather sweet fruit, low tannic bite. Really Nice and easy-going Barolo, but Maybe not the Best PQR. Bought at 40 euro in Italy 👍. In DK vintage ‘13 Can be found around 53 euro.
Juicy red berries and warm spices, cigar wrapper. Integrated soft tannins. Good structure and richness. Aged for 48 months in oak. Just 900 cases made.

A very modern style barolo which has been aged in barrique and cement eggs before bottling. This Barolo is a blend from Rocche Dei Manzoni’s different vineyards in Monforte.
On the nose you can feel strawberry, oak and caramel. On the tongue there are notes of strawberries, licorice, truffle, dark chocolate, spirit, leather, oak, caramel, eucalyptus and earth. Elegant and well balanced straight from the bottle. Great value if you like modern styled barolos, but stay away if you are a strict traditionalist.

We could detect flavors of blackberries and vanilla along with clear scents of leather and tobacco. The fact that it had been produced in egg-shaped cement casks for several months gave it a refined and rather earthy taste of minerals.

Tasted at Cafe Victor, Copenhagen, September 2022. Somewhat darker red robe than is often the case for barolos. Vanilla and dark berries on the nose. On the palate a wonderful sensation of raspberries hits you and then finishes with hints of vanilla. One of the best barolos I have had at any price point.
Transparent red in color. Weak nose with some hints of oak.  Round medium light body. On palate  some oak with little fruit.  Tasty but not an expected Barolo.

#3 at the end of degustation we tasted a good Nebbiolo wine, ops no, it is not correct, sorry my fault, I mean Barolo wine... Vivid ruby red color and nose of red fruits, vanilla and spicy hints. In the mouth is light with not much concentration, simple with an easy drinkability. Good acidity and freshness. Soft tannins with french oak too much in evidence and boring. The final is persistent enough, a little bit tannic with a comeback of licorice and vanilla hints. Considering the price I can not rate 3.5
Love this wine, although the 2013 vintage had even more unique flavours.

This bottle must breathe for at least 45 minutes to an hour. Initially a nose of pungent earthworms on an asphalt driveway after a warm summer rain… But dissipating soon into a very nice bouquet of roasted dark cherry fruits, pain grille (toasted bread), fennel, red currant, and vanilla. A little thin yet smooth on mouth feel. Somewhat alcohol-forward (14.5%). Semi-opaque ruby in the glass. Light pink cork suggesting a well-filtered wine. Very nice. Buy and hold 5-10 years.
