This Red wine opens with a nose of Cherry, Cedar and Clove. It is dry with medium Tannins and Oak. Flavors of Cherry, Clove, Cedar, Oak, Leather, Mushroom, Earth and Smoke. A lot of complex flavors going on here. All good. Recommend you try a bottle. Let breathe a while for Best enjoyment. Have a Great Weekend and Cheers to all my wine friends. 🍷🍷🍷

Medium Ruby in color. Pronounced nose of cherry, black berry, cedar, herbs, forest floor, dried mushroom, tobacco, licorice, pepper, cloves. Dry, medium plus acidity, medium tannins, high alcohol, full bodied with medium intensity flavors. Earth, mushroom, forest floor, black cherry, and cedar body. Outstanding quality of wine. 4.3 stars.

Great vintage and super wine to have. I opened it for 2 hours and then decanted it for 90 mins before she started singing. It holds its structure and has a great balance of red fruit, spice and robust minerality. Tannins take time to mellow but once they do, the wine comes out beautifully with a long finish. Definitely a rich food wine but would be ideal to keep it for a few years before drinking. If you are tempted like me, please do the 2 hr decanting or maybe even a double decant. Cheers

This was a suggestion from a new source that panned out!! Seamless balance and crispness that is pure. I’d like to open this CNP for any wine snob and never look back. For the love of the wine god’s get you some, you will thank me later. Cheers 🍷

Grenache 50%, Syrah 10%, Mourvèdre 15%, Cinsault 7%, Clairette 3%, other varietal 15%. Deep purple color, nose of raspberry, cherry and bramble, earthy nuances like chesnut, hint of sage, opulent palate, full body, velvety tannins, soft acidity, grippy finish.

4.2+/5.0
Deep ruby color. 
Med.+ aroma intensity. blackberry, blackcurrant, black plum, fig, pepper, clove, leather, oak, but not too overt, vanilla, pencil shaving, black tea. 
Dry, med. acidity, high coarse tannins, high. alcohol (15,5%), full body. Med.+ finish.  
Resume: very good, the wine suitable for further aging. 
D3 exam training with Andreas Wickhoff MW, Rust, Austria, 04.2021

Medium ruby

Nose: light/medium/pronounced aromas of: strawberry, plum, pepper, vanilla

Palate: dry with high acidity, high tannin, high alcohol, full bodied with notes of: plum, pepper, vanilla, leather 

Long finish

Conclusion: outstanding !!!

Silky smooth, texture can’t be understated enough. Sour and sweet red berries, cherries strawberries raspberries blend in sweet and sourness. Then there is the bouquet of vanilla oak dark bitter chocolate and it permeates the nose. 
Saint Cosme do so many wines well but their flagship Chateauneuf du pape is truly a gem.

Complex, ripe and intriguing.
Starts with a subtle oak aroma, on top of which a coconut aroma it is built, then licorice, raspberry, red cherry and tobacco aromas are popping up. Cherry, oak and tobacco are present also in the taste.
Excellent structure: dry , full body, high tannins, medium(+) acidity, promised intensity and long aftertaste.
Medium garnet colour.
⭐4.4

Reaffirmed rating. The nose was very expressive this time. This doesn't need much of a decant, if anything 30 minutes. Lovely limestone earthiness, integrated tannins, the oaking has worked producing a balanced expression.
A smooth, complex and delicious CNDP. Dark plums and cherries are followed by ginger and earthy tones with soft, balanced tannins.

Lovely dark fruits with a peppery finish. 
We had it with Confit Duck and it paired perfectly. The wine rewards a bit of air before drinking.
Earth. Good acid. Strong tannin. Black pepper. Leather. Dirt. Bold yet drinkable. Smells like its from a place. Pungent. Quality finish.
Candy sweet smell after letting it sit for 30mins, long long comfy finish even though a bit strong on acidity side to start.
Excellent wine of this region. Light but still fruity and with a long peppery finish. Excellent value for money when bought at Schwander.
Really complicated and typical chateauneuf du Pape, enjoyed it!!! leather cherry pepper licorice plum chocolate raspberry 4.3
Great CdP. Notes of cherry, blackberry, tobacco, and bright tannins. There are also subtle floral notes. Paired with a nice ribeye.
Fantastic. At Walloon with steak.  RJ brought this beautiful wine.
Goes great with steak!
Spicy, fruity, earthy.
Elegant and reminds me of reds from northern Italy. Well rounded, good level of red fruit with elegant tannin, decent finish
Very enjoyable, paired particularly well with fried rice balls, calamari, and pizza. Yeah.... just a great wine

Happy côtes-du-Rhône Tuesday! (Didn’t have a northern Rhône bottle @[1|14447379|JP Ju-Taï])
I was going to keep that one for another few years, but my bro and sister-in-law just moved into their new house 3 minutes from us, so I had to give them something decent. And this CdP did not disappoint!
It’s a young one but it’s already showing some really beautiful aromas and the green traits like garrigue is really tasty.
What a great producer!
Santé y’all 🍷🎊🍷

leather cherry pepper red fruit licorice
my first CDP
smooth mouth feel and a little bit of spicy
moderate tannis with very nice finish
showed quality and potential but there are many other options for $85 price range.

Medium ruby appearance. Aromas of red cherry and lavender. Dry, full-bodied, low-medium tannins and medium acidity. Very fruity on the open with pronounced flavors of red cherry and cassis and a bit of vanilla and pepper, then closes out with a burst of lavender. Long finish, excellent quality and incredible complexity.
Quite tertiary on the nose, very umami, soy sauce.   Palate is fresher and fruity, but finishes savory. Has held up really well for a 51 year old.  ;-)
Strawberry, raspberry, blueberry with fine almost powdery tannins, just tart enough. Really excellent wine. Worked with with a beef roast and pumpkin pie as well!

Delicious! Young and vibrant! Dark ripe fruits, blackberries, Cherry's, plum, leather, earth, smoke, all the good qualities! Will drink again in a few years though. Tasting out of the bottle and wasn't stellar, gave a good 30 in the decanter and was incredible!

Deep purple burgundy color, savory nose of charcuterie, smoke, new leather, cranberry, raspberry, licorice, star anise and clove, bold body with nice and firm tannin, balanced acidity, tastes of pot roast, star anise, garrique, licorice, black cherry, tar, blackberry, dried orange peel, and toasted hazelnut, bold and long finish, needs some patience, should last for a good decade and more, smooth and refined.

Happy long time no CdP Saturday 🤤🥰!

☝️ of my Favourite producer, ☝️of my favourite appellations, life is good! St-Cosme doesn’t have vineyards in CdP but dictates their ways to trusted producers.
Unusual blend of Grenache, Mourvèdre, Syrah, Cinsault, Clairette. 👃of 💨, blackberry, 🥩, pepper, garrigue. 👅is high acidity, 😡tannins, huge warm length, pepper, 💨 🥩, bitter 🍫, some 🍒. Good now but will be better in2-3 years & lucky me has a bottle left 😇: 4.3🌟!
Beautiful and balanced wine. Acid / tannins / body were in the same page. Promises a lot in the nose red & black fruit, some spices and a smoky after taste.
Bright red fruit up front,  a bit chalky finish with serious grip.  Awesome for greasy pizza!
leather earthy allspice, moderate oaky.
A delicious balance of juicy red fruit, dark berries, spice, herb...rich and opulent!
96 points by Robert Parker!!! What should i say? EVRIKA!! Cheers! 🍷
Leathery earthiness on the nose with maraschino cherries. Early signs of bricking. Full dark fruits in a warm rounded palate. Everything in perfect balance. This is why I love CNP.
Deeply fruity. Very well balanced. Classic middle aged Chateauneuf du Pape with everything you would expect. Very likable now, but with potential to even more with more age.
Forest floor, Plum, cherry, smoke, chocolate, incense
On the nose is notes of raspberry & BlackBerry preserves, smoke, oak, and a touch of  smoked meat.  This vintage benefited from 60 minutes of decanting.   Paired well with holiday pork pie.
I get an unusual, but very pleasant cherry cola flavor from this wine. More herbal (sage) notes in the nose, but the fruit dominates in the drinking. Long finish. It still has many good years left.
Very pure and elegant. Deep and rich. Blackcurrant, pepper, great and long finish. Perfect wine.
Fantastic red, great value for money
cherry raspberry oak chocolate
Spicy, earthy, has substance although it is not super concentrated.
Thanks to Nicole L for breaking out this great CDP. Spiced nose of dark cherries and berries with coffee. Well integrated alcohol, it presented very well after a decant softening up the tannins.
Supercomplexity, detailness, and balance. 15,5% is so perfectly integrated that you could fall in love with ChateaunefduPape instantly. No need to keep it.
Pretty good.  Juicy, but not jammy.  Cherry, Blackberry, leather and licorice.  Undertones of forest floor and clove.  High in acidity with decent complexity.
Ruby red color, full bodied with firm acid.  Not at all shy but still smooth  Dark red fruit with earthy undertones.  Had for Christmas dinner with rib roast.

Strawberry color hint of rust. Same on the nose.  Great mouthfeel.  Drink now. 

11/21 Smooth ruby color. Raspberry and plum vibrant nose. Great balanced mixed dark fruit on the palate with a nice hint of tannin.

Deep ruby - garnet in colour, earthy, meaty aromas of dark fruits and liquorice, full bodied, well integrated tannins, good structure, complex flavours of blackberry, blueberry, dark cherry, earth & spice, forest floor, game, smoke, medium + finish, should age well for another 5-10 yrs, solid CDP.

Held up well. Cork *just* survived the pulling (this alleged recorking must have been a while back). Great flavours - sweet smoky acidity at first, developed into a dry, charcoal, smoky dusty florals, dull licorice, dried herbs, barnyard funkiness ... hints of a Fullers Vintage Ale! Loved it, thanks WS.

Deep garnet. Medium intensity with barnyard, leather, strawberry, rosemary, mint, pepper, toffee and balsamic reduction. Dry, low-medium acid, medium tannins and full body. Balanced with a long finish.

Bananas and saddle leather on the nose. Citrus as it hits the palate. Followed by dried fruit, tobacco and velvet. Tannins are still there; but showing signs of age. Very long finish. Perfect with red meat on a cold day.

The kind of plush red that I like; leathery, barnyard, fennel, and at the same time, balanced with a good amount of red fruit and acidity. No...I don't think it's that kind of unbearable wet socks or dog or cardboard stuff. Rhone Blind #4/5, and as it turned out, a CDP, 50:30:10:7:3 Grenache:Mourvèdre:Syrah:Cinsault:Clairette. WOTN

Dark ruby and plenty of garnet, ink depth too. Nose is full, old leather, cedar, plum, lavender and rosemary herb onto darker pepper and tar notes. Palate doesn't quite match, the nose. A smooth ripe plum and fennel entry, then a pepper spice, tannin grip and a typical CdP spirity alcohol finish. 4 stars is mean, though 4.5 stars is marginally generous. Will easily cellar another 5 years.

Top notch CdP. Sweet herbs, fresh fig and forest floor nose. There’s also oak and it comes out as Dr Pepper and Amaretto. Medium everything (body, tannins, acid) and just a crazy balanced wine. Fresh green herbs and cherry and strawberry are the flavors. In 3-5 years this will be mind bending.

Deep rich color. Let it breathe a while. Dark fruit aromas backed by mild earth, leather and hints of cocoa. Easy entry bursting into a full palate that is nicely balanced and fades into a long finish that lasts and lasts.

Nice CdP with a beautiful colour and a youthful nose. Would probably do well in the celler at least a fee more years, but already shows some nice character. Plummy, juicy body with some prunes and almost chocolately aftertaste.

4 of 5 for me. How I grade; 5 If only I could stock up cellar. 4,5 Stock up my cellar! 3-4 Yes please, any time. 2,5 I'll have one glass. 2 Thanks for offering, but I'll go for something else. 1 Faulty wine

Brick color. Very tertiary on the nose. Leather, balsamic, savoury, dried black fruit, barn yard, manure.
Still fresh on palate. High acidity combined with enough fruit concentration that have evolved on the stewed side. Good structure. Probably at it’s peak.
leather pepper earthy cherry oak raspberry chocolate plum licorice
Nice balance. Too astringent for Emily

It is almost of the density of a port, except for the sweetness.  This wine is full of fruit, spice (green pepper) and tartness.  Tannin actually rounds it up. Lingering on the palate for along time. Very nice!!!

medium garnet
A: medium+ intensity prune, wet leaves, dried rose petals, incense, jam, vanilla, smoke, cloves, pepper, dried mint, blackberry, raspberry, sawdust
P: dry, medium acid, medium+ fine grained tannins, medium+ body, high alcohol , medium+ intensity and long finish 
Very good, oak is a bit distracting

A classic CdP from a good vintage and producer. Decanted for about an hour. Aromas of fruitcake, licorice, spices, underbrush. Savoury texture with good balance of ripe Grenache spiced cherry and berry fruits, bright acidity and fine, svelte tannins. This is ready for business but will age for another decade. Good QPR. Thanks Nicole for sharing this gem!

4.1. Backlog of a bunch of wines consumed at my sibling reunion last weekend in Surrey, BC. A Gigondas CdP, really well made. The 14th generation of wine making for this family at this site. Rich berry and plum fruits, spices, tar and leather.

4.2⭐️ friends dropped off 3 plates like this full of delicious ribs 🐖 + corn 🌽 + rosemary 🌿 potatoes 🥔 so I had to crack this beautiful CdP 🇫🇷😍🍷

Paired wonderfully. The smoky/meaty elements of the ribs & the wine are dancing 🕺 together like Travolta & Uma in Pulp Fiction 

This CdP is barely entering its drinking window so decant 3 hrs at least. I’ll save my others for a few years (we’ll see 😆👍🏻). Lush red fruit, lavender, smoke, garrigue 🌿, pepper

🎶: Girl, You’ll Be a Woman Soon - Urge Overkill 👌🏻👌🏻

Rhone Thursday last night in paradise 
Always nice to find a Saint Cosme with 6 yrs of age CdP.  The rabbit 🐇 just to reminds me how fun trips  be with kiddies ( including a 3 month old sweetie smiley girl)
Team adult enjoyed this singing CdP
Aromatically gourgeous with high tone red fruit with lavender follows with a darker fruit palate loaded with spice.  Amazing finish.  Just starting to hit its wheelhouse.  Yum

Stunning young CnDP!

Still young and will definitely be better in 5-10 years but it is drinkable now.

Nose is bliss with heavy floral, white/black pepper and cherry with mysterious fruits and spice.  Palate is elegant after you get over the tannins, but there is depth and breadth here for sure.
Deep garnet color. Bold leather and tobacco notes upfront, then a saline and pepper finish. Best to let breathe before drinking.
Decant for a looooong time. Very tight for the first hour. Eventually opens to leather, earthy, oak, and just a hint of raisin.
Delicious. Had an old feel to it.
Dry, tannins, smooth
No finish but a good CDP
Oak,tobacco
Cherr cherry oak full of flavor. Long finish
Silky smooth medley of ripe red and black fruits, spices, toasty oak. Well rounded and lovely!
Perfect!
Saint cosme is an elegant and complex wine with taste of red berries, leather, earth and chocolate. A bold wine that is nicely balanced on acidity and tannins. An excellent wine.
Deep ruby color. Red ripped fruit spices vanilla intense on the nose. Dry medium tannins, high acidity with hogh alcohol level. Full bodie withan outstanding long finish.

Features a core of ripen fruits, dark berry, plum, tobacco, smokey. Somehow I feel there’s some sour pickle on nose 😅. 
Delicious and smooth fruits in mouth, vitality acidity and tannins.
Plum jam, cherry jam, vanilla, oak on the aroma. Black currant jam, raspberry jam, spices on the palate. Good balance. High acidity, soft tannins. Long fruity and spicy finish.
Salty licorice, maraschino cherry and oak on the nose. Medium pluss tannins. Lacking a good mouth feel, but full flavour of dark forest fruit, cherry and a dry oak finish. Feels a bit young (2020)
Tannic but subtle, long finish with a great jammy flavor. Slightly oaked but balanced. Points off for not being fruit forward enough and it’s missing some spice. Oak is very French but muddled
Cherry, red plum, fennel, vanilla, cloves. Nice structure with high acidity and present tannins, decent finish. Quite enjoyable but could have used some more time in the cellar.
Nose of garrigue, jammy dark fruit, red meat, vanilla and ripe cherry. Taste of ripe cherry, blackberry, leather, with hints of tobacco and black pepper. A tannic CdP with medium acidity.
92/100. Nice CDP with red and black fruit. Some herb and terroir complexity. Drinking now. Not as brooding and dank as some can be, though I prefer that style. Doesn’t need food.

Let it breathe to allow alchohol to integrate.
Decant
Spicy and earthy with a hint of dark fruits
Will try to save and try in a couple of years
Promising wine
densely packed,with chocolate,expresso,bay leaf,licorice root,black currant and fig.It needs long cellaring,great wine.
Intense, complex, fruits like black currant, dark cherry explode on your palate, able to age, perfect match with steak.
All of the typical CdP smoke in the nose.  A cured meat taste on the palette with a long lingering aftertaste.

Cherry, raspberry, blackberry , pepper, oak, tobacco, leather.
Very typical CDP. Complexity, balance, full body.
My last bottle of the 2012. Ganache and tobacco with some blackberry flavors. Very long finish. St. Cosme always delivers!

Good producer, good brand. 
Right tipicity in this Chateauneuf, rich and well balanced. Firm tannins, great development with air, and long finish.
Year helps a lot!
Sweet fruit. Dark cherry, vanilla, oak, and a tannic finish. Not particularly complex, but a nice wine. 4.2
Best

Deep ruby color. Complex wine, nose taste and finish. dark chocolate  blackberry dominate, but also Earthy, stone and a little barnyard. Full body, medium tannins. Silky. lots to discover, taste and finish becomes intense , lots of flavor, take your time!
leather raspberry pepper earthy

#WSET3training Appearance: Medium ruby. Nose: Medium+ intensity. Blackcurrant, bramble, blueberry, cloves, cedar. Developing. Palate: Dry with high acidity and high tannins. Red to dark fruit; baked plum, prune, strawberries, smoke, clove. High alcohol and full body. A very good wine that still might improve by ageing.

Visit to Saint-Cosme
We ended the range of their French wines with this magnificent CNdP. Ripe jammy black fruits, garrigue, tapenade with a palette of herbs, tar and violet. A full bodied wine with a long finish.

medium+ ruby colour and medium nose with dried spice, pepper, dark cherry, cedar, cassis. Dry, Full body, medium+ intensity, tannins, alcohol and length. Medium- acidity. Dark cherry, dried spice, cassis, cedar salted liquorice, hints of fig, tobacco and chocolate. Excellent wine with a lot of complexity, structure and grip. Suggest to wait a couple of years to drink it or decant it. Will develop for a decade or more.

More photos:and wine reviews: https://www.instagram.com/grapesandrice/

Beautiful and ripe (despite rather young age)  Rhone GSM. Vivino indicates it is pure Grenache while actually it is only 50% with whole bench of different varieties on top of it; and they do play in your mouth. 4.24

Wow wow wow just WOW
HUGE nose with blackberry, ripe blueberry, black pepper, wet leather, fresh tobacco, black cherry, dark raspberry, super clean.
Great balance of dark fruit, jammy, and great acid and tannin. 
Long finish. Hard to believe the ABV until you've had a few glasses

Medium garnet colour. Pronounced and developing nose with baked plum, blackberry, leather, smoke and clove. Pronounced taste of baked plum, clove, smoke, leather and blackberry. Long and dry finish. High acidity. High tannins. Full body. A very good Chateauneuf-du-Pape. Part of my WSET3 exam prep. Drink now or over the next five years. Goes well with beef og lamb.

Saint Cosme CdP

What about the difference between Gigondas and CdP. Well not that much but the terroirs of CdP are really well suited for wines close to the Rhone and well oriented, that is probably why wine is made there for ages now. Also gigondas benefits from the same but closer to some mountains (dentelles). 

This wine is really to be kept to fully benefit the potential, 2016 promising as vintage. Ripe black fruits, garrigue, spices, violet, tapenade. Very elegant wine and top finish.
Rate 4,1⭐️

An impromptu Syrah/Shiraz comparo with my buddy Grant. 
St Cosme was young but showed well. 
Tons of red fruit up front on the 👃 cherry 🍒, raspberry, pomegranate, red currant, with hints of sweet tobacco, cedar and black pepper. 
Solid structure and balance. 
👅 raspberry coulis, cherry, red currant, black cherry and a bittersweet bite of tobacco on the finish. Very good but has the potential to be great with some age. 
4.2⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Beautiful du Pape, concentrated prunes and plums that carries through to the palate. Full bodied with smooth velvety tannins with a kick 15, 5 percent alcohol, still in balance with a lingering finish

Deep purple red color with violet rim reflections. Notes of ripe black fruit, blueberry, blackberry, black currant, black cherry, vanilla tobacco, cigar box and spices. Well structured with firm tannins, full bodied, balanced, good acidity and long finish
Saw on ALF
Needs a good hour to breath or decant. Solid fat ass Rhône fruit with a rounded finish better with some stew than a steak....
Stewed fruit and savoury flavour like a bacon joint it has a huge depth and such a cool colour

Raspberry nose, the taste starts understated,  but finished with a nice black cherry.
Great with the Rabbit and pastry, BUT there are better values
My first Chateauneuf-du-pape - loved it
really nice i seldom rate 4
smooth, medium bodies, leather and earthiness..just the way I like it
Nice dark cherry, plum and pepper notes.  Lot of character.  Found it at $29.99.  Heading back tomorrow to buy the rest of their stock.
Medium Ruby, tannic, herby, red cherry, medium acidity. Some hints of pepper. Complex, definitely needs some decanting - improved with aeration.
Great CdP. Prominent Syrah. Spices. Bittersweetness.
Excellent CdP, balanced, dry finish, nice fruit, good structure.
Lite oak and cherry, black raspberry and licorice notes, rich, complex and dry.
The last bottle and it is a good one! Very refined and drinking well.

Herbaceous, chalky, blueberry, rosemary. 

Medium tannin and acidity and a medium finish
Amazing wine! Beautiful balance. Rich deep flavours
At first the smell was not pleasant at all, but after some aerating this aromas developed into earthy notes, wet earth, black truffles and plum.
Great wine. Earth, musty, with tobacco and cigar flavors. Mushrooms, and earthy funk, great wine!
A solid CdP with all the goodies u expect at a good price point. Will improve with cellaring
Very good wine! Rich, meaty, complex, long finish and full body.

Dark cherries and forest floor evolve into rich tobacco, chocolate and espresso, and finally exotic spices and eucalyptus. 
Phenomenal stuff
No one expected this to be 50 years old
I loved it.

Magnum 

Another good CDP, beautiful fusion of cherries, cinnamon, vanilla, bitter chocolate and oak. Great complexity and long finish.
At first it was okay.. Then it opened up and boom
Spicy value proposition that is still developing nicely.
Fabulous celebration wine for a new job opportunity for my husband!
Lovely bouquet, strawberries, black cherries, tobacco.
Black ripe cherries. Deep smooth balanced effort. Would buy again. Excellent with Cheetos.
Rich dark fruit chalky my last bottle.
Very good quality. One of the better options for the price range.
Lush bramble, figs, raspberries on the nose.  Palate of herbs dates, cherries,  heat of finish.  Hedonistic delight, worth the ten year wait.
Dry, herbal. Nose was disappointing. Fruit was mild on the tongue, mild tannins. Finish was short. I’ve had better vintages from St. Cosme.
Cinnamon, ripe red fruit.
Currant and raisin
Smooth with an abundant fruit-blackberry and licorice flavors.
Beautiful, dry, amazing finish…
Truly world class. As good or better than CDP’s that cost much more.
Classic CNDP, vastly improved after 2 hours in decanter, then tasted like something 10 years older, with glorious finish.
Initial aroma is cherry,  after  that black fruits  and dust come up. Quite strong but smooth tannin and acidity. Good
4.2 w mike hueneke at Santo

Oak tobacco and leather on the nose, slowly developing to more of a dark cherry with blackberry undertones. Chocolate covered cherry on the palate with subtle tobacco. Good acidity and mouth feel, slightly agressive tannins with a long finish.

Had this well balanced bottle with a ribeye steak a Boones Restaurant in Portland Maine. Opened with a Pinot and moved into this one. Great transition. 
Earthy, oaky, well done. Not super heavy like some Napa cabs.

91pts.

This may need more than the 20 minutes that I gave it in the decanter to open and grow. However Terry Hsiao really liked it the way it was so...we were also 5 bottles deep by this time. It felt closed to me but I felt there was more potential. Chocolate, blueberries, cherry and lavender. Medium to full body, medium tannins. Will revisit again soon.

Van Vino Halloween Tasting 2016 Wine #7
Presented by Nicole.

A medium ruby wine in appearance with a medium intensity on the nose. Nice minerality with blueberry on the aromas.

On the palate the wine is dry with medium+ acidity, medium+ tannin, high alcohol, full body and a medium+ finish.

Flavour notes include eucalyptus, blueberry, dried cherry and cocoa. There were some spicy hints coming through as well.
Good flavor. First taste was gingerbread. Paired with tomato soup and grown up grilled cheese. The wine really tamed down the acid and richness of the soup.
This wine is simply lovely! Wonderful smell, somewhat barnyardy. Tastes fantastic with a good bit of fruit (cherry) but very smooth! Buy it more often you lout!
Decanted and opened 1 hour before. Spiced dark juicy CDP. Well structured and will get better with age. It had that dark roasted meats, dark ash with asphalt.
Elegant and bold, perfumed and rustic.  Baked red plum, Earth undertones, leather.  Has a slight beef jerky component with white pepper and savory spice finish.
A spicy evergreen forest reminiscent of wild game and boisterous knights. Clings well to the palate but in need of food stuffs. Great for thanksgiving or Christmas.
Peppery with some cherry undertones finishing with a hint of mint  and leather

The color is a clear, deep ruby.  The nose is an interesting and delicious mix of tart cherries and raspberries along with notes of garrigue and flint.  The flavors on the palate commence with a delicious mix of tart cherries and raspberries and open further with notes of tobacco and flint and finish with orange zest.  The structure is a bold body which is dry with high tannins and medium acid.  The alcohol is 14.5%.  This is a delicious wine for a reasonable price.  Buy again.

Opened for a Mother’s Day lunch (T-bone steak baked potato and salad) it paired wonderfully with the meal. On the nose heavy with red fruit licorice star anise and minerals. On the tongue a medium long finish cherry smoke black pepper and leather. We will have to purchase another and let it set, but truly enjoyed the flavors of this vintage. Enjoy!!🍷🍷🍷

Mother’s Day gift from my Son! Gorgeous crystalline garnet. Beautiful fast moving waterfalls on this full bodied, dry, complex wine. Nose is tart cherry, chocolate, dried strawberries, truffle & violet. Taste opens with boysenberry, candied cherry, roasted meat,& crushed gravel minerality. Moves into black currant, sage & leather then finishes long with a soft acidic orange peel, rosemary, black olive & sweet tobacco. Paired nicely with grilled t-bone! Happy Mother’s Day! Cheers!

Already showing well at age three,  this CDP is medium in body with notes of black cherries, iron and pepper. Opened up nicely throughout our appetizer portion (ceviche, mussels, tartare) and had a savory, medium-length finish. Very nice bottle from the Southern Rhône.

Barnol Family wine since 1570, origin 200 AD.  50% grenache, 15% sirah, fermented in cement vats, aged 24 mo in old oak.  Inky black, berry nose, great legs, tannins on teeth, lasts on gums.
Wine for special occasions!

This is one for the cellar. Hold it a few more years. Even after seven (!) hours of air, with extensive decanting and Riedel Performance glasses, it is still disjointed, starting with an undistiguished and very oaky plummy mess. It slowly shows many elements you expect from a CdP, but not in a harmonious way. Should be very good in a few years.
Nice
Good
Excellent berry
Nice notes of leather, cherry, pepper, oak ,earthy, ash  and finish of black pepper.  No acidity and mild tannins
Dark berries, lush full mouthfeel.
More mellowvery smooth
Very nice. No too jammy. Taste of vanilla and cherry.
Medium ruby in colour.  Aromas of  ripe red cherry, raspberry, clove and vanilla.   A great CndP!
A very enjoyable Rhône with flavors of cherry pepper leather raspberry smoke
Opened after 2 h..  needs some air and some aging

vg overall

maybe too much spice for me
Great wine, a wine that must be served at least once
leather pepper cherry
Ripe red fruit on the nose vanilla and oak. Med  body, bright, smooth, lingering finish.
Strawberries, leather, and tobacco. Excellent balance. This wine will age well.
Great chateauneuf du pape from a great producer

4.2

Good CdP already, should be given some more years to develop.
Leather, chocolate and blueberry.
Better after an hour of air. Very tasty, but not for $60.
Earthy fresh nose- rain and black pepper. Supple and balanced, seems tight on the front end, but minerals and black licorice wake up and carry a lingering finish. Needs a lot more time.
Everything you would expect.
Nice bouquet with earthy sage aromas, sweet cacao, and a hint of sharp cheddar.  The flavor boasts roast coffee beans and pine sawdust, and leaves with a long tannin finish.
A beauty of a CDp.  This had it all going on.  Tannins, body and intensity all medium + to full, would cellar for a long time.  Flavours of vanilla, oak, tar, blackberry, and cedar.
Expresso melts with chocolate with a hint of licorice and black currant preserve and fig. Old school. Best from 2017 on. WS 96
Dark color, full body. Smoky and high tannin, a lot of tobacco. Medium to low acidity, with the taste of plum.
Very very smooth... Another excellent CDP. Outstanding finish. Good nose. Just drink less comment.. Bye
Equilibrium
Deep purple, mineral dark fruit nose, dark fruits, pretty good tannins and acid, and earthy tobacco, forest floor, mushroom and metal. Interesting.
Nice GSM with a simple, straightforward fruit presentation - raspberry and blueberry with herbal notes.  Agreeable but there are better values.
Rhone spice in nose (with some vanilla) and on the palate, medium intensity, partially diluted but present tannins, solid and long finish
92/93pts, nice wine !! A bit leathery , figs and almonds,  a bit dried  on the finish but smooth tannins and a very nice ripe fruit. Lovely
My first du Pape, or as Mikey calls them, CdP’s. Popped my cherry and it was not hugely more memorable than the first time that happened
Mary & David love it!!

Re-corked. ‘New’ cork broke while opening. Leather, mushroom, slight smoke and some plum on the nose. Muted dried fruit / red fruit / dried herbs on the palate. Dry, low (but surprisingly present) tannins. Same for the acidity. Yes, past it’s prime but still holding its own. Interesting and pleasant-I liked!

The trip down the memory lane continues, this time all the way to the popes backyard.

Dark ruby, spot on classic CdP characteristics, hint of dirt, lots of fruity, juicy strawberry, rasberry with dark cherry jam and blackfruit, lingering along some oak, licorice and touch of spicy pepper from mourvedre. Feels like home.

Starting to be good drinking time for this -13 vintage. Bold, med tannins, med long finnish.

Matched it with reindeer filet and mushroom purée. Cannot complain.

Dark cherry skin color. Tiny amount of aging on edgeS Criss cross spidery legs. Earthy, leather, graphite, dried fruit on nose. Full mouthfeel, acid/tannin. Med finish. Slight almond cherry, dark chocolate  touch on finish. Decanted for 4 hours. Still off gassing. Very old world but still full and satisfying.

Stop. 
Don’t drink this wine. 
Yet. 
Quick, go get a block of Belgium Chocolate to go with it. 

Actually, open the wine and let it breath then go get the chocolate. 

It starts sharp, softens, raspberries vanilla, peach and tannins come out. Bit of leather and tobacco too. 

This wine is 10 years old, but has another 10 in the bottle ahead. If you can resist, at least for 5, you will be rewarded.

Excellent. I feel the timing on this 2008 is perfect. Lighter in color and bodied than I expected, but powerful and complex on the balance. Spicy, wel moderated fruit with hints of cassis and a long finish. Enjoyed this.

4.2 - Smoky, earthy wine with flavors of black cherries, raspberries, pronounced textured tannins, cedar and tobacco. Full midpallet of earth, dark fruit and toasted oak. Nose of black fruit and earth. Dark red color and good acidity. Many years of life ahead of this savory CDP.

A birthday gathering to remember!
Simple notes.
The birth-year wine!
Close to perfection. Would have been perfect 5-6 years ago perhaps as it was lacking a little bit of fruit but all else was just great. Body, integration and length. Drink now!
Typical wine from the region

🇫🇷 50% Grenache, 30% Mourvedre, 10% Syrah, 7% Cinsault e 3% Clairette. 23 months at oak barrels. Bright ruby color with brick tons 👁. Ripe plum and cherries in a complex environment with spice notes at 👃. Dense body with great structure and persistence with excellent tannins at 👄. 90 P

M+ to deep crimson.  Earthy nose of mushroom, moist soil, wet leaves, cherry and mouldy raspberry.  M to M+ acidity, medium smooth tannin, medium-bodied.  Medium finish, more mouldy and earthy notes, with underlying red fruit flavours of cherry and red plum, plus black raisin and raspberry jam.  A well balanced and smooth CdP.  Enjoyable now, can age further.  Marginal 4 stars.  20 December 2019.

A rich dark ruby with a heady nose of candied cherry and wet dirt. Quite forward at this age showing a softer side of a young CdP than some, particularly in 2009. Plenty of weight to see it through and a long pleasing finish. Cherry, plum, ginger, tea, and moss. I agree with the view that it seems Grenache dominated. 96pts

At first, just felt weak aroma of berry, so thought 3 or 3 and half star.....later...found out its potential. Full of violet and licorice backed by enough oak bouquet. Very smooth palete at first, but stronger tanin afterward proved itself a long lived wine. It's too early to drink ^^.

Medium ruby. Moderate aromas of dark and red fruits, some oak influence, and a bit of rose petals. Palate has both dark and red fruits, as well as spices, wood characters, refined and round, lacking some complexities but enjoyable nonetheless, long finish

Clear, med garnet.

Clean nose with med + intensity. Aromas balsamic, leather, earthy, stewed red fruit, smoke & mushroom.

The palate is dry with med + acidity and med + alcohol. The tannin is med - that are very smooth. It has a med body and a med + finish. The intensity is med + but much fresher than the nose. 

Very good quality wine. This should be drunk sooner rather than later as it is very mature but frankly it is lovely. Drinking now, not suitable for ageing.

WOW!! Older than I am (just) and every bit as fruity. Surprisingly given the age it still has a firm backbone of mellows tannin. Powerful nose of prune and smoke and chocolate. Plum and thyme and dark cherry with that aforementioned tannin. Good grief this is amazing!!

Super interesting to drink this. The wine had a pale garnet colour and a nose on the tertiary aromas. In mouth this is obviously not as vivacious as a young wine but provides pleasure in its own way by being delicate and very long in mouth. Leather, light spices and dried fruit.

Intrigued to try this 50 year old cndp.  Needs 30 minutes or so for the VA to blow off. Zero primary flavours.  It’s all tertiary. Leather coffee earth meat bacon.  Definitely past its best but one for the experimental book.

Great body! As I sit staring at that hair. long, luscious, draped over her shoulders. Suspect of some sort of arachnid-esque braided surprise, lurking, waiting, to attack, immobilize, and drain. Bedazzled Acrylic cuticles demands ocular attraction towards her centre. busty, buckled, contraptions of protruding notches of cashmere strangled mammaries. And the use of "like", beaten like a Russian serf. Best served with patience, leopard pants, and a complimentary turquoise purse.

4-! Nose is very elegant with red fruit, slightly smoke, anise, nuts. Palate has med acid and med astringent tannins. Med body. Nice flavours of pungent white pepper. Very good balance. Long and intense. Nice complexity. Very good quality

Nose consisting of ripe dark berries, an almost floral note and also some light earth (opened up a lot after decanting!)
Dry, high acidity, strong astringend, yet not unpleasent tannins. Dark cherries, leather and earth.
Long complex finish.
High quality, complex win. Benefits greatly from being opened / decanted in advance. Must be paired with robust food or else simply overpowers it.

Not sure how much better this could get? The tannins were perfect, managed to nail the temperature and the fruit was still surprisingly there for all to taste. This could easily live for even longer than its current 51 years!

1971 vintage Parent’s Ruby Wedding Anniversary- have 2 bottles of this and have been saving for a special occasion.

N: cigar box, tobacco, cedar, fruitcake, cherry and plum

T: dark fruit, tobacco, smoke, cherry and forest floor. Mushrooms and cedar. 

Long finish with medium acidity but rich and sumptuous. 

Excellent, worth the wait.

Very rich, full body. When I opened it tasted a little oxidated. but after it breathed it was outstanding! But reality was that, as much as it wasawesome it didnt taste as a chateuneuf...this is not necessarily bad. But it was interesting. I believe it has a lot of potential to grow in the nextyears. Unfortunatel this was my last bottle...

Too young to drink. Wine is powerful and still punchy after 3 hours of decanting. Strong flavours of dark fruit and a mix of spices such as star anise and black pepper. Still tannic, would probably age well over time.
This was softer than I thought it would be so I think it would pair well with a wide variety of foods. A solid bet to bring to a dinner party if you don't know what's being served.

Not yet rated. Stay tuned (this is the only way to share your cellar through the app). We know Louis Barruol's Gigondas masterpiece and the wonders he's wrought with his adventures in the Finger Lakes in America (Forge Cellars), so we eagerly anticipate his expression of this old-world classic.

Wow this was great! The berries are really lovely at initial taste. This wine is bold, robust but not jarring, it’s smooth, leaving just the right about of tart for the back end of the taste.  We will buy again for sure.  A nice fall wine. This wine would make a nice gift.

Barruol converted to biodynamics in 2010, no fining nor filtration, and I think it shows in its blackberry fruit freshness. It is mixed with an herbal garrigue and spice depth and nose that calls for rich food and aged cheeses, such as an aged crumbly Gouda will bring the liqueur fruit to the fore. Of course this wine could use more aging but with the right food who cares? Delicious.
Wonderfully balanced medium to full body, lighter color, approachable without much decant, ripe cherries, booze and nice well developed tannin.
Dry, full bodied w/ tones of berries
A true masterpiece .

89/100. Horizontal tasting of Chateau de Saint Cosme tasting. Chateau de Saint-Cosme is the oldest family owned wine house in Gigondas. 14 generations since 1490 and today driven by Luis Barruol. 15ha  wine yards and focus on purity, terroir and personality in their wines give great results.

Ruby red, layered red and black fruits, medium high acidity with fine tannin. Structure is there though lacking tertiary flavours and complexity. Finishes with fruits though short. Not bad despite such weak vintage.

50 years old, so obviously quite musty and ancient. A bit of acidity at first that needed half an hour to calm down. I suspect this bottle is past it’s peak - it lacked distinct personality - but there was still a delightful old wine here: leather, prune, smoke, sulphur. Enjoyed tasting something so old but there are probably better ways to part with £72

Well done. Savory with substantial tertiary notes. Smooth mouthfill with a lengthy finish and a gentle balance. Spicy and earthy on the nose. Red fruit, mushroom, herb and leather on the palate. Lacking some freshness but still quite enjoyable. One whole bottle down the belly on my own. Cheers!

Profoundly delightful nose of raisin, licorice, anise. Toasty oak and dark chocolate on the palate. Drink now.
In line with the great standard set by Belle Gross. A bit more acidic than other Belle Gross Pinots but lovely fruit content. Lovely wine
Bold, acidic, dry, full bodied Pinot; notes of cola, cherry, vanilla, and strawberry; lingering finish that does let hit immediately
It’s hard not to like this Pinot. Full bodied 15.1% ABV. Very elegant with dense fruit and licorice. Cherry and vanilla on the palate. 95/100 Cheers 🍷
Fantastic!!  Another home run from Joe Wagner!  We’ve loved the Clark and Telephone but I think this may even be better.  Great nose, big full fruit and a soft finish.
Great color, deep garnet and young at the edge. Great nose, and great texture. Surprisingly heavy taste, more like a well developed merlot. Mild and soft tannins. At home, March 2022. 4.5/5.0.

This may very well be my favorite Belle Glos Pinot I’ve tasted. 

Prominent oak notes; caramel, cedar, light fudge, and vanilla… all uplift and compliment boisterous dark fruit; black plum, grape jam, blueberry, blackberry tart… and exciting red fruit; strawberry cream, cherry, and raspberry preserves.

Glimmers of earthy herbs peek through on the back end of the palate, with light sage, dried mint leaves and mushroom.

Just amazing juice all around.

Deep red; full-bodied; bold for a Pinot noir; smooth. Not a typical Pinot noir in color or taste. Benefited from decanting, even though it was only three years old. Almost as good as Clark and Telephone. 
Jan 2022
Light cherry, cranberry, oak, baking spice. Aroma of freshly tanned leather and mushroom. Perfectly balanced pinot
A bold dark Pinot w a great nose of raisin. A bit of red fruit and chocolate.

Beautiful bouquet of black cherry, chocolate, toffee, and mocha. This leans more towards the sweet end of the spectrum, but if your familiar Wagner wines this is no surprise. Lots of ripe black fruit, vanilla, chocolate, and mocha on the palate with a velvety mouthfeel.
Dark fruit on the nose. Smooth on the palette with hints of red fruit.
Moderate aroma. Medium body; more acidic and dry. Notes of red fruit, plum, bubblegum, stone, and mushroom. Not bad but I prefer their dairyman ones better.
I’m a hater. Not a Pinot. It’s yummy, but not what I want from a Pinot. Big jammy fruit. Some wet tobacco but still no elegance and complexity that I want.
This stuff is always so rich and surprising to me. If I’d ever blind taste it, I’d never guess it’s a Pinot Noir. Lots of black fruit, with prominent blackberry jam and eucalyptus.

Solid, complex, contemplative, in a pretty sexy package. Cassis, oak, blackberry, anise, chocolate, vanilla, great spiciness, satisfying acidity, wonderful dry finish.

Amazing wine. Deep, rich chocolate black fruit. Almost boysenberry pie like. Juicy ripe blueberries. Very slight finish, almost earthy but not quite. Easy to drink and enjoy.
94 points. Bigger bolder Pinot compared to the Paul lato. Very consistent BG Pinot, it delivers. More structure; more punch, more fruit. Still seductive but more in your face.

Dark fruit jammy red. It’s a medium-full body Pinot noir with a ruby medium coloque. Lots of plum, black cherry, blackberry.

I’d call it 4.3. Fresh blackberry, black currant, and lavender up front. Then, Smoky cedar and mineral with firm medium body. Like a spicy combination of licorice and leather mid-palate, has an edge. Just a hint of cured meet. Pleasant dry maple syrup finish. Dark ruby color bordering on purple. Some translucence, more in the Cabernet territory than Pinot Noir. Still a little young, suspect that age will soften and complexify.

Ruby red with aromas of black cherry and juicy blackberry with hints of cocoa. Rich and opulent offering flavors of baking chocolate, blackberry, cola and sweet pipe tobacco. Well rounded with supple, refined tannins and a mouthwatering, long finish.

Evening with close friends! Fifth wine with this delicate beast! Belle Glos, here with the Napa Valley specific Pinot Noir! I’d take a bit less residual sugar but the hot Californian climate does not help!

Plum, nutmeg, vanilla, cinnamon, blackberry and strawberry on the nose. Medjool date, oak, black cherry, chocolate and tobacco on the palate. Long finish. Very good.

Deeper purple in the glass then you would expect from their Pinot. Nose is c’est Pinot of strawberry and dried floral notes. Ripe and fruity palate as experienced in the other Belle Glos wines I have had. Buy a case. Super good. Fresh, fruity, delicious!

Med purple,unusually full bodied, bouquet of toffee dark chocolate caramel plum vanilla ,dry, flavors of cherry chocolate and lavender, structured yet plush tannins and long finish. We had this with the works : prime cowboy steaks,grilled lobsters and neapolitan sausages

Chocolate, cola, vanilla. 4.25 is accurate but rounded it up to a 4.5. High ABV at 15.3% and has a little alcoholic burn but still smooth. Definitely a Pinot but very much California heavy Pinot and not burgundy.

Minerals, dark cherry and fruits. So smooth. Appropriately decanting wine has changed my wine game significantly. I disliked the underling offering Clark & Telephone from Belle Glos. This wine however is a smoke show!

Not a fan of Belle Glos generally. Of late, it is often more expensive than good. Tried this because I’d not seen it locally. Not decanted, (too late at night), poured from aerator. 

Initial funky nose requires decant. Deep ruby color with nose of raspberry, chocolate, cracked pine, cloves & cardamom. In the mouth: soft raspberry, medium+ acid & mild tannins. Long, slightly chewy finish of  fruit. 

ABV hot @ 15.3%. Ferment in SS. 9 mos in French oak (60% new). Requires a decant - rec 1-2 hr. 4.3⭐️ from me.

Amazing, but far from a fruity Pinot.   Heavy wood (cedar?) flavors with dark fruit overtones.  Solid wine, but not your usual Pinot.  Pair it with your regular Cabernet faire and you will be pleased.  (Gave a little taste with dark chocolate and it blended too well!)
Light, dry, fruity
A rich, deep, dark purple bold PN. A nice menthol and cedar aroma, pronounced cherry-berry explosion.  Smooth throughout with a long lingering finish.
Dark berries, licorice, caramel, wet slate and raw tobacco. Absolutely stunning. Happy December with Caity! ❤️
Black currants. Touch of vanilla. No tannins. A very drinkable wine. I would definitely do this one again.
Smooth and elegant. Dry to the palate. Dark fruit notes. Can stand on its own, or paired with a medium-rare ribeye. Truly enjoyable.
Med intense purple. Beautiful nose. Lots of chocolate, vanilla, tobacco, strawberry, red cherry, pepper. Light-med bodied, med low tannin, med high acidity, molasses, med long finish. Good wine. 4.3.
Surprising deep purple colour on this Pinot. Strawberry, oak, mildly floral nose. Tart cherry and bright acidity on the palate. Mild tannins lend to a clean, short finish. Loved it!
Outstanding PN medium plus body medium acidity and tannins. Wonderful flavors of plum boysenberry blueberry a touch of raspberry nicely Oaked to include leather and some light cocoa.

Delicious wine!
AIS-95
To be paired with a Puros de Hostos Comendador Boxed Pressed 20-20 Robusto or Toro. 
Fantastically harmonious and superbly balanced. 
¡Enjoy and Salud!
Deep blackberry and oak, cigar box on nose.  Rich blackberry jam, dark cherry, vanilla, tea, and light spice on silky finish.  Nicely balanced with velvety lasting tannins.  Excellent.

4.3, solid wine. Darker, riper, fruits than others in the Belle Glos portfolio. Deep rich burgundy color, hints of Tyrian purple, big legs, low acidity, medium tannins, whiffs of cedar, mint, strawberry, dark fruits on the mid-palate, black currants, blackberry, clove, licorice, cocoa nibs, white truffle, petrichor, padron peppers, spice on the finish.

GREAT! purchased a bottle that was on sale at the local grocery store for my wife’s birthday. Great structure. Chewy and dark. Deep Pinot flavor that you can tell would hold up to age. I would buy two cases that way you keep your hands off of what you are tying to age!  It’s a real beaut Clark!
A marginal 2nd place to the Clark and telephone today. This is a different vintage (2015 vs 2018) and is smooth but is missing the spice of the Clark and telephone.
Cab like in a very delicious way
Powerful Pinot which tastes like a Zin and has high alcohol volume so sweet aftertaste.
Black cherry, strawberry, raspberry, cola
Christmas spice with black fruit berry jam nose. Black fruit mash palate with an acidic compliment
Superb. Not a normal pinot noir by any means. Plenty of body and depth. Bit of tannin.

Very cab like — though not as much as Belle Glos Balade. Excellent flavor

Wine Store $35
Cherry and blackberry. Vanilla spices and tobacco
Highly recommend this bottle at a 60$ price point at the SAQ it is phenomenal!!
cherry strawberry vanilla, more acidic than dairyman but still a similar profile.
Deep rich color. Dark fruit, blackberry, bing cherry, cedar on the nose and pallet. Very nice.
Love this stuff. Hold Napa Pinot.
Very smooth. Tylical BG pinot. Great wine. Olivia
This wine never fails.

Bold taste, but light bodied. 
Fruit forward with dry finish. Delicious dark fruit.
blackberry, cherry, lingering chocolate and dark fruit.  Very nice Pinot!
Gorgeous. Perfect Pinot.  Big blueberry big red fruit.  Cherry!!
Very smooth and well structured Pinot. Proper level of red fruits, medium acidity.

This is a real treat. The best pure pinot I’ve had. Relatively light but really well structured. There’s a subtle floral note on the nose and in the mouth. I think it might be lilac or lavender. Vanilla throughout, oak, and a little bit of brown sugar. Cherry and strawberry.

4.4 for this one.  It's another "modern style" PN from the Wagner Family.  A fun, crowd pleasing wine that probably has some Petite Sitah in the mix.  Deep Purple in the glass with viscous legs.  Intense nose of  Cherry, Blackberry, Raspberry, Jam, Vanilla and Oak.  Similar taste profile as the nose, but also detected some Eucalyptus on the pallate.  Dry and Medium Body.  Tannins are Medium and smooth.  Acidity is High.  Alcohol is Medium+.  ABV is 15.1% and nicely integrated.  Balanced and lingering finish

Fantastic Belle Glos, and one I hadn’t seen before — we enjoyed it on date night at Morton’s.  Outstanding bouquet with cherry, raspberry, black currant, and chocolate aromas.  Smooth and silky taste with the dark fruit giving it a nice accent.  Long (-) finish with oak, brown sugar, cinnamon, and clove; plush tannins.  15.1% abv.

We enjoyed this with a filet, roasted asparagus, and mashed potatoes.  2.20.21

Terrific pinot, on par with the rest of the family offerings. Personally, I would say that I prefer Los Alturas and Dairyman, but it is a fine line and beauty is in the eye of the beholder. Subtle nose of blackberries. Very smooth, almost too smooth. Lasting jam flavour. Great with chicken.

Deep ruby with a purple hue in color with moderate intensity. Cedar, smoke, cherry, black currant, red currant, strawberry violet, and black raspberry. High acid, medium plus tannins, medium body and moderate finish length. 90/100
fantastic wine... Nosing just superb... strawberry jam tast mixed with wild berries and hints of vanilla and milk chocolate... this Pinot Noir is a winner!!!!
Very smooth taste doesn’t need to decant long. Soft velvety and oak notes. Tastes really good with red meat
Very nice
Fantastic
Dark ruby red great fruity nose; full body strong tannin dry and balanced acid; red cherry and strawberry and cranberry very warm and lasting finish. Never had a Pinot this good

Have you ever had a Pinot noir slap you in the face and tell you who is daddy!?  Well this one will. 15+% ALC. wow!!!! Boom baby! Cinnamon spice and everything nice. The mouth feel is smooth and sexy. I’ll drink this on any sexy night with the wife and guarantee action! ;)

One of my absolute favourite Pinot Noirs from California! Glad that I have a couple bottles of this. Such a complex wine for the price! Nose is fantastic. Tons of vanilla. Fruit throughout. Blackberry, plum, cherry, strawberry, and raspberry. Lots of oak on the nose. Palate is rich and velvety. Completely fills the mouth. Great tannins. More fruit and vanilla with a touch of baking spice. Dark chocolate. Finish is very long and lingering. A terrific wine!

Horizontal tasting of 5 Belle Glos Pinot Noir wines at the same time. All were very good, but each has a distinct character. All were opaque garnet in the glass. This one is different from the rest. Aromas are more typical of a Cabernet Sauvignon with black cherry and vanilla. Mouthfeel is bolder than your typical Pinot noir with black cherry and spice. I agree with many other reviewers who said this tasted more like a Cabernet Sauvignon then a Pinot Noir. This might be why it was my favorite of the batch.

Rich, velvety wine that is more reminiscent of a Napa Cab than a pinot noir. On the nose, strong oak and rich dark fruit. Blackberry, black cherry, raspberry, strawberry, vanilla, cola, cigar box, grass, chocolate. Hint of earthiness on the palate. Solid tannins for a pinot. Delicious
Dried/black fruit/raisin/prune, blackberry, black cherry, chocolate...mmmmmmmm
Incredible Pinot! Beautiful aromas of red fruit, mostly strawberry and red cherry. Notes of oak, blackberry, and vanilla, with some chocolate hints and an earthy finish. Fantastic. 🍷
The final act for our wine dinner. Pairing with a dark chocolate cherry brownie, cherry Eulenoch coulis, vanilla ice cream, and almond bark.  I've died and gone to heaven!
90 Aroma had black cherries, black currants, oak, vanilla and raisins. Over the palate came black currants, black cherries, dried dark fruits, vanilla and oak. Medium acidity, medium tannins and dry.
Lots of oak, berries, chocolate and spice. Smooth drinker and nice finish. Fruity sweet nose. A tad on the sweet side for me.
Smooth, light and berries
Earthy, cherry, tobacco on the nose. Dark cherry and tobacco/smoke on the palate and finish.  Great acidity and long smooth finish.
VERY smooth wine, goes down easily pairs well with rich meats yum! Super fun bottle aswell
Medium to full Pinot with smooth dark fruit and tones
Tried at Veritas restaurant for $39/btl.  Great restaurant price and enjoyed the wine. I like BG Las Alturas a little better.
Bold blackberry. Lana loved as always
Velvet and smooth wine experience. Thank you HD guys!!
A comfortable Pinot!  Easy drinking balanced hitting all the right notes. Something you can drink everyday and never be upset.
Nice surprise.  Tried as I picked it up at a deep discount.  Well worth it.  Bold with the fruit, hint of oak, touch vanilla, and lovely finish.
Every day and twice on Sunday. Pinot? No. Delicious? Yes. Sweet oak, ripe cherries and pure as can be.
Wow! Great Pinot! Needs time to decant. Went well with country fried pork chops. I mean really good Pinot!

This is a 5 star PN for me. This is perfection: strong aromas of fresh red fruit: mainly raspberry and cherry, with just a *peek* into the wild jungle that awaits. A sip of the wine brings immediate sour cherry, which gently opens the velvet curtains into a world beyond: forest floor, juicy raspberry, sun-ripened blackberry, with tobacco and mint leaves scattered throughout. A long finish that is hard to forget. Definitely recommend letting this air for 20 min if you can. Perfection.

Nose of cherry, cranberry sauce, eucalyptus, hints of chocolate. 

Palate shows sour cherry, blackberry, raspberry, chocolate, tobacco, cedar. Feels a little richer than the last time I tried about a year and a half ago. Medium bodied, mostly dry, medium to medium plus acidity, medium minus tannins. I think I like it a little more this time around even. 92/100 points.

Drinking our last bottle of Eulenloch, time to make a wine run to a Alberta me thinks 🤔.
15.3% ABV with medium plus acidity and silky smooth tannins. This is such a well structured wine you would never guess the alcohol content is this high. 
Flavours of cherries, blackberries, vanilla and a hint of chocolate. Great mouthfeel and lingering finish, Joseph Wagner sure knows how to make great Pinot Noirs! 🍷🍷👍

Power and ripeness like no other Cali Pinot. Dark and deep ruby, opaque in the glass. Nose is packed with ripe mix of red and black fruits - cherries, forest strawberries, blackberries, smoke, chocolate and vanilla. Palate is full-bodied, extremely rich and round, taste as per above with addition of smoke. Truly juicy, vivid acidity, backbone tannic structure. Long, alco-dry and spicy finish. Not my style but interesting and well made for those preferring this style of PN. 

Nørres januarikalender #4.

Medium ruby with a pale rim

Cranberry, cherry after swirling

Interestingly there are aromas of plum and black cherry

After 30 minutes, anise, chocolate and cola showed up

High acidity, dry, medium tannin

My tongue is tingling. I guess it’s maybe because of the high volume of alcohol

Some floating particles in this bottle. Looks like twigs

Not exactly what I expected because it’s simpler than other valuable Cali wines. But the ALC and cola aroma make you think it is the wine from there.

2019 Eulenloch
Rich aromas of cherries and blackberries that ties in nicely with the flavors of blackberries. Slight cocoa secondary developing. Super smooth, not overly fruit-forward, and with no astringency. Compared to Las Alturas, this one has more black fruit, and is very slightly less of a fruit bomb. (Though we enjoyed the Las Alturas more)
Strawberry and blackberry notes. Very smooth for such a big Pinot (2017). The bottle was gifted to me. It is more than worthy of a purchase! It stood its own paired with a grilled ribeye!

Extravagance in a bottle! This isn’t your grandmas Pinot. Full bodied, jam packed with flavor and opulent to the core. Aromas of blackberry and cherry 🍒, you know this is going  to taste great with just one whiff. Dark and rich, your taste buds are greeted with flavors of black currants, black cherry, vanilla and sugar cookies 🍪. Definitely taste like a much more expensive wine. Grab a bottle and enjoy 😉
Try again
Notes on the nose of subtle cedar vanilla and milk chocolate with some blueberry. Medium to light body and acidity with very smooth tannins. Very good.

FUUUUCKKKK. I like potent bold wines with power. 16.3% alcohol for a PN fruit driven monster wine is insane. Some (Burgundy fans) would not like this. Just look at the wax top....love it. This juice is utterly extravagant almost out of category. Single vineyard wine from Carneros, Napa Valley. 
👀 dark ruby red
👃blackberry, cherry and spices
👅 complex, layered, rich, bold and fruit forward. Velvet and smooth with low acidity and tannins. 9 months on French oak. Notes of dark berries, vanilla  and love ❤
BIG Napa Pinot Noir with strong hints of oak and blackberry.  It followed a bottle of Alpha Omega Cab and held its own well.  A bold and rich bottle that makes you want more.
Fruity soft but also big in flavor. Just a perfect glass for just about any food pairing. Dark fruit.
How is this not a cab?
With Seags- great night with a California Pinot.
Solid. Belle glos delivers.
Amazing the best belle gloss ever, super well balance, ready to drink and will hold, 10 more years,
Please see my last review. Great Pinot.
Great Pinot Noir from Bella gloss. Good heavy feel in the mouth. Lots of dark fruit. Will cellar.
If you like Belle Glos Pinots, this is a noticeable cut above.  Worth $20??  Not really, but definitely better.  Smooth velvety fruit.  Great nose.
Dry, excellent nose and finish. Very acidic. D says connected with dark fruits.

94+. Amazing Pinot. Much bigger body than expected. Lots of fruit forward notes without being overly sweet (only on the nose). Must revisit to catch all notes. Highly recommended. Drinks like a $75-100+ bottle.

If you love Oregon Pinot, none of the Belle Glos Pinot’s are for you.  They are all more robust and more character than the usual Oregon Pinot.  This one in particular is smooth with good acidity, little dry, lots of dark berry jam (think cherry pie), cedar, followed by some spice (not as spicy as C&T), a little tangy hints like pomegranate.  Nice after taste of ripe red apples.  Lots of character to this Pinot.
Wow, thick fruit and bold finish. Love the approach to this Pinot Noir. Heavy grape driven with an elegant body

Smell has cocked berries. Taste is a little more rewarding with cherries and red berries. 
In general an ok red. But not a good PN representative and certainly not worth the money.
The nose presents notes of cherry and a lite amount of oak. The palette presents more dominant oak, baking spice, with red fruit in the background, with strong anise on the finish.

Chocolate on the nose and 
Notes of red fruit with a round balanced mouth feel. Long finish.  Very nice wine. This one stands out amongst all of the Belle Gloss family
Light fruity Pinot...gives your pallet a nice tickle and smooth finish. Certainly a wonderful choice for surf & turf!
BIG PN. Blueberry, blackberry. Very good, but much prefer dairyman and clark & telephone. More minerality and softness there.
Medium body with slightly warm and sweet fruit, medium - tannin and a medium acidity. Notes of sweet cherry, red strawberry, vanilla and earth.
Lovely wine and so enjoyable
Mellow, balanced.  Paired with Japanese meats and if went well.
Just wonderful. Smooth and silky.
My favorite Pinot Noir!!!
Very cherry. Lots of fruit and delicious with BBQ pork loin. Will buy again.
Rich nose, dark cherry, tasty heavy pinot
This Pinot noir does not disappoint. A heavy Pinot boasting of jam. Wonderful as always
Typical great Belle Glos 😋 Clarke and Telephone is better in my opinion though.
Smooth cherry vanilla notes, tannins fade the longer it breathes
Bold pinot with deep cherry notes and hints of oak.
Doesn’t get much better than this!
This is GREAT Pinot . Very smooth, full flavored.
Dark black fruit with a lovely, full mouthfeel
Perfect for me , it's real
My favorite of the Belle Glos line. Seems more flavorful than the others in the family. My new daily Pinot.

Oak and vanilla. Higher level of acidity than the other Belle Glos Pinots. Fruits are light on the palate. Quote enjoyable, not my favorite Belle Glos, however likely a better example of a pinot noir than many of the others in the lineup.

The 2017 Eulenloch is a deep ruby red with aromas of ripe cherry, blueberry, and juicy blackberry layered with hints of cocoa and forest floor. A rich and opulent wine, it offers flavors of baker’s chocolate, blackberry, and sweet pipe tobacco. This wine is well rounded with supple, refined tannins and a mouthwatering, long finish.
Excellent California Pinot, intense but smooth. Great value

As with all the Belle Gloss PN’s they drink more like a red blend or even CS. This is really good juice. Lots of cherry, raspberry, strawberry and red licorice.
Some tomato and vanilla as well. Much different than my beloved Oregon PN’s.

As others have noted this is an over developed fruit forward wine labeled as a PN. Sure highly drinkable and enjoyable. Would prefer some spice and earthy qualities. On the nose candied fruit and on tje palette full blown cherry and black jam flavors with pronounced notes of vanilla. Decent finish and high acidity. Easy to like wine but for my taste not a "real" pinot.

4.3
A delicious Pinot, medium leaning to full body, dry but with a hint of sweet. Oak, vanilla, a nice blend of dark and red fruit with a very slight amount of cigar. Smooth and I like the colour as well.

Much softer than other offerings from this producer. vanilla over soft berry flavors. Rich cherry, soft strawberry, blackcurrant in there too. Yummy stuff, pair with creamy sharp cheddar for a big win.
Great
Show!!!

Very great Pinot. Smooth and easy to sip on with or without dinner. Highly recommend. Not sure about these other reviews saying it’s “not worth” the $20-$25? Kind of throws me off. This is a full bodied, wonderful Pinot. Really it is a Cabernet Sauvignon masquerading as a Pinot Noir. THIS IS EXCELLENCE IN PINOT. Great backbone. Soft yet elegant dark fruit. Smooth finish. Just buy this wine one time and you’ll come back for more.

Dark, dense Cali PN that delivers big punches like CS - 15.3% abv, packed with concentrated black fruits, well integrated tanins, medium+ crunchy acidity, mellow oak, and savory dark chocolate...still quite tight-wound, needs breathing. Satisfying long finish. Should have waited a couple more years.

Billed as their high-end Belle Glos, but actually seemed pretty similar to the others. Concentrated cherry, dark cherry and blackberry  intertwine harmoniously with vanilla, light chocolate, spice and light mineral notes on the palate. Smooth and rich. Medium to full body, moderate sweet tannins, good acidity and great balance. Good thick mouthfeel and texture.  I tend to sip this by itself or with lighter cheeses and bread.  4.2 stars. Fair QPR at $55.

How can Belle Glos (any Vinyard) not be your go to wine? This Napa Pinot is slightly more complex than it’s cousins, a bit more on the cab side than Las Alturas and C&T. However the fundamentals of this delicious wine are maintained throughout the range. Fruit dominates. Dark Red fruit, Cherry, Plum, Blood Orange, (perhaps less V a n i l l a than in the other Belle Glos). After the fruit, oak,  chocolate, leather. For the price, as a Saturday night or get together bottle this CANNOT BE BEAT.

This is a near perfect Pinot for me. Light to medium body with a floral vanilla nose. While a lighter body wine it has incredible tannin structure. After the Selosse we opened this surprising Alto Adige PN. Quite darker in color than usual and impressive 15% alcohol 😲 for the rest: 👃🏻 Dark plum, ink, cinnamon, chocolate, dried herbs, floral and earthy notes. 👅 Wow! What a powerful PN. I’ve never thought I’d say full bodied PN, but it is. Medium+ tannins and high acidity. Blackberries, blueberries, fruit jelly, vanilla, herbal and spicy notes. 4.5⭐️

Full-bodied Pinot Noir, with a distinct aroma of ripe fruits, cherry, plum, then flowers. But above all sweet spices, vanilla, cinnamon, clove and a good toasted note. I think too oaked.
It's intense at the palate as well, maintains its good acidity but has also a subtle bitter vein. Recover in the decisive and fruity finish.
But I find it too structured.
Clean fresh fruits , cherry & plum delicious fruit , nice balanced tannins direct and focused long finish !

Translucent light red colour. Dry, medium bodied with very soft tannins. Lightly peppery. On the nose it has a lot of aroma of chocolate, coffee, liquorice and tobacco acquired through ageing in oak barrels. It is full of fruit flavour like raspberries, cherry, strawberries. Overall one of the best young Pinot noirs we have had. An absolute stunner of a wine.

A masculine PN; 25% whole cluster gives spicy stem. The wine has seen Barrique; clove + mocha. The soil brings graphite while the fruit pushes through to show red currant + strawberry but slightly earthy. A masculine palate with lots of weight and intensity. Fuller in body. Not elegant but flavour is enjoyed. Raspberry + red plum with oak integration. Some vanilla. 75% destemmed keeps wine smooth. Medium acid. Apparently scored high for Italian Pinot in 2019!

🌟🌟🌟🌟 Tasted at a small wine shop in St Emilion. Aerated in the glass. Garnet red in color with medium viscosity. On the nose 👃aromas of black fruit, cherry, oak . We have a real soft spot for st emilion. Nice drop herr from a nice vintage. A bottle we picked up while touring the appellation last year. Still young but already accessible. Garnet and opaque, nose is black cherry, black currant, and bolognese sauce. Go figure. Medium plus body and same acidity. Palate is a bit less concentrated than I expected, and more red vs black cherry. Rather dry. Some menthol on the finish which is medium. Overall very nice. 4.1

Decent Saint-Emilion Grand Cru Classé, more easy drinking and easily enjoyable than many of its colleagues. Completely merlot dominated and it shows also on the nose and on the palate, a lot of dense fruit, in particular blackberries, coupled with somewhat more herbal, tea-like flavours. Well-structured, well-balanced, finale is medium. Lacking the complexity, velvet and depth of other SEGCC, but it's definitely a good wine and it's price-quality ratio is OK.

2011 was nice for the Bordeaux region. And so this reflects in the glass…
A deep ruby red colour wine, packed up with fruits like cherries and cranberries.

anyway, good balance and complexity, light but pleasant body. 
A very good wine, period!

Today’s final airport wine, and the wine by which I can maintain a comfortable distance ahead of @[1|55690978|𝓙𝓾𝓼𝓽 𝓽𝓱𝓲𝓼 𝓰𝓲𝓻𝓵‍] (just), this is a surprising ans excellent find. Oaky, deliciously matured and fruity on the nose, this promises to be exactly what one hopes from a good Bordeaux. Rich, meaningful and deeply complex on the palate, this is absolutely lovely. The finish is a tad weak, with the fruit- age balance descending into acidity, but it remains very good indeed, and a superb example of the type

Out of bottle - Alcohol (young) and dark cherry on the nose.  Palate:  nice mouth feel, smooth, balanced fruits, mild cherries, lt. spice (green and mild cayenne peppers), hint of oak / vanilla, and medium tannins.  Nice finish. Will pair with my favorite, mildly spicy dishes.  This will age, certainly smoother in 3 - 5 years!  Cheers everyone!   Recommendation in Bordeaux:  Les Trois Pinardiers wine store and bar, a local favorite (not for high end but highly supports small growers). Very nice owners!

3.8. Nice modern style Bordeaux , and not expensive. Too young, but could be consumed, thanks to ripe tannins and modern approach. Dark , black fruits, chocolate, earthiness, mocha. Rich ,well balanced and easy to understand.
Intense hints of fresh butter with coffee notes. Balanced mouth with light structure and soft tanins.
Lovely Bordeaux! Tried it at BA lounge in Heathrow. Oak, tobacco and vanilla followed by dark fruit.
Great
91/100 Excellent
An incredible nose! Lovely wine.
Wat my friend give me a surprise

Just a casual Wednesday evening with a good Pessac. Deep ruby / red color, very velvety texture. Good length with notes of vanilla and oak.  Not much to say on this wine, it's a classic Bordeaux style wine, very well done but a bit overpriced, according to me.
Smooth, rich, full bodied with fruits and spices. Wonderful wine
Solid Claret
Higher acidity, very Bordeaux style, has more potential than 2015; complex taste, but leaves dry after taste
Excellent
Seriously good. Heathrow Terminal 5B. Wonderfully rich
Lovely and smooth, not challenging yet has class, a slight tannin impact on back of the tongue
Very good but should still age a little bit

Deep garnet color. Nose of plum, earth, mushroom, and white pepper. Secondary aromas of Lee’s/yeast, vanilla, oak, charred wood. Dry low acid full body wine with plum, white pepper and truffle. Long finish. Very good Bordeaux.
Well balanced. Not too fruit forward. Light to no tannins. oak blackcurrant vanilla balsamic cheese apples apricot
Unusual
Dead
Fantastic value for money.
Great wine full body and good nose

Balanced, 
oaked: vanilla, 
medium acidity, 
full body, 
dried fruit,
Good stuff, big flavor
Top

2010 is drinking really well now(2021) it has an expressive nose with aromas of leather , oak and cedar, ripe black cherries , black currant , cassis, earth Tabacco. Full bodied on the palate , dry with rounded tannins and good acidity. Classic notes of leather tobacco , cedar , pencil shavings and dark fruits on the palate

An intense and dark Pessac-Léognan red, not so much in colour as in aroma profile, made by a Grand Cru Classé de Graves château, owned by the Irish-born Quinn family. Coffee, dark berries, plums and bitter chocolate lead the way to savoury layers of bay leaf, pepper and wild game stew. There's a whiff of alcohol on the nose, but on the palate it's well integrated, and in spite of its youth, it's already very drinkable (decant for a few hours, though). Lively, complex, interesting and a refined food partner!
Very good
Bold dry red
Excellent
Good
Top
Excellant
