Excellent vin
Nice
09 friuty and 10  more balance between friuts and secondary notes very complex depth layered and nice finish very gentle and elegant yummy texture.
A fine Bordeaux white with nose of citrus, ginger and honey and palate of tangerine, peach and butter with an energetic finish.
A very tasty full bodied Bordeaux with a complex taste. Blackberry, ripe fruit, leather and oak. Nice on tannins. Good and lasting aftertaste

Almost black. Earthy spicy nose, Asian spices, elderberry, blackberry and much dark chocolate with blackcurrant, plum, tobacco. In the mouth very straight forward, again black currant and blackberry, dark chocolate, beautiful harmony, good power. Rich velvety tannins. In reverberation strawberry and plum, racy freshness and much force and pressure, yet a harmonious and defined wine. Exceptional wine. Wonderful!

Tasted blind at my WSET Diploma class. Its deep gold hues, star-fruit, sherry-like aromas and oxidative notes suggested a bit of age. Dry, high acidity with pronounced flavours of guava, lime custard with herbaceous notes along its waxy texture. Lengthy finish. I guessed 10 yr old Semillon. I was only half right as it's a 50-50 SauvBlanc-Semillon from Bordeaux that's  surprisingly drinking way more mature than a 2013 should. Excellent...but drink up as this is close to its peak.

93 Points, drink now until 2030. Deep purple with still violet aspects. Seductive sweet nose of black berries and cherry, bitter almond and chocolate, vanilla and oak, black current and fresh leather, tobacco leaves and noisette. Very complex and elegant, still rich and full bodied but not on the fat side at all. Great balance and approaching slowly it's plateau in 2 to 3 years, this gorgeous Pessac is a steel for what it is! Finishing long and spicy, great with the roasted game tonight.
Very expressive when decanted, lots of red berries and sweet on tongue. Quite alcoholic but the sweet aftertaste remains for a while. A wine that makes you happy ☺

Leather, cacao, tobacco, mint, dried black berries. Very spicy and old-school nose.

Vivid, with nice acidity, solid tannins and long spicy and smoky finish.

Nice. 92/100
Nice
What for a surprise, pencil, black berry, soy sauce, smoked. Med bodied, perfect structure, smooth and long, could be longer...
Excellent Bordeaux, bright red, well-structured acidity and tannins, dark, juicy berries, persistent on the palate in the aftertaste
Aromatic, dark rich plums, tobacco, cigar box, earthy, oak, ripe berries, Smoke, dry, star anise, smooth tannings, Pavie like, elegant

This a voluptuous perfectly balanced Fietzek, the warm Semillon characteristics blended well with a young roasted  🦃 
Elevated in “ pleine campagne “

Totally impressed with this relatively affordable left bank Bordeaux. Def a function of its vintage: brimming with blackcurrants, cassis, redcurrants, dark chocolate, toasted oak and some burgeoning conger box notes. Smooth, fine tannins disguise the bold, concentrated fruit. Super youthful and structured to go another decade. Really great drinking pleasure-thanks no doubt to a big dollop of plummy merlot. Seriously drinkable. 🍷💪🏼👊🏻

I have huge expectation from this winey, and it really shows perfect performance! Full bodied, black plum, cherry. Earthy, animal skin, forest floor. Round and smooth mouthful with M+ tannin. Fruit cover all over my palate, really awesome! Still young, age 3+ years. Drink or hold

Black fruit like cassis, oak and tabacco. Very vibrant still for 10 years old. I am leaving the other one I have for another 3 to 4 years. Acidity is good and also enough tannins and fruit to improve over time.

Super concentrated and balanced wine , nose of ripe fruits , black currant and leather, full bodied and complex on taste, tannins still there but adding to wine , aftertaste that really adds to pleasure goes on and on . This vineyard had changed to biodynamic so wine is really going to improve.

Clear, dark opaque core, fades to bright ruby rim, appears very youthful. Clean, intense aromas of tobacco, smoke, toasted oak, dark fruit especially cassis, with leather and bitter chocolate. Dry, bright savoury acidity, firm smooth tannins. Intense dark fruits cherry/cassis, noticeable barrel notes, full bodied, well integrated alcohol, long finish. Well made, quality wine with pedigree, cellar for another 5+ years for best results. Very good, well made Graves!

@[1|15397767|Aaron Blazer] reminded me it was the turn of lower left bank Bordeaux Sunday as this month has five Sundays 
Who am I to argue 
Another excuse to enjoy this super delicious Fieuzal that’s just stating to deliver in its early drinking window
Beautiful cigar box, pencil shavings, cassis, blackberry and dark cherry 
Breakfast cocoa, milk chocolate with fine grained tannins and cedar
A joy🙌🏿👍🏿😍 🍷

Refined, elegant, sensual, delicious. The best characteristics of a red Grand Cru Classé de Graves in 1959. Blueberries, blackberries, sweet spices, vanilla, lead pencil. Extremelly well balanced and harmonic on the palate. Long and elegant aftertaste. Highly recommended.

Chateau De Fieuzal! A lovely, classic and modern Pessac-Leognan that really tickled my fancy. 
Nose: Leathery, earthy, wet leaves, spice and game meat. 
Palate: Fruity base and creamy tannin revealing notes of blackberry, prune, vanilla, forest, oak and tobacco. 
Very opulent, medium-bodied with beautiful roundness to the textures. Long, subtle and elegant oak finish. Drinking beautifully now! 94 Points!

It could only be Bordeaux to kick off the beautiful wines so generously provided by @[1|16425004|Vita in Vinum] for @[1|16864830|David 85] and Natasha’s #MWW day. This one was a magnum! 
I loved the depth of the fruit, the fine chocolate and cedar. Here is where my memory starts to go a bit hazy.

Ch. de Fieuzal is owned by an Irish man. An usual tasting history for me with this wine; previously I had the 98 and 67, the latter was vibrant and seemly everlasting. 
A very good Graves,  a region I don’t taste much but I think I will change that. 
 
Deep ruby. 
Pronounced nose of cedar, lead pencil, smoky graphite, dark black fruit. Less fruit evident than the 67 which might be an interesting comment on style changes but I don’t know the area well enough. 
4.1 91 pts

💥 Mega Bargain QPR Pessac from great year @ £27 that will improve over 10 yrs 👍 excellent value right here 😍

🍇45% Cab S, 40% Merlot, 10% Cab Fr & 5% Petit V

🍷Opaque ruby

👃 Flint, lead & minerals through smokey oak, blackcurrant, mashed plum, cocoa, farmyard & sweet red currants - yum!

👄 Smooth Med body of intense earthy spiced black fruits with a flinty mineral backbone all well balanced in fine tannins w/ mocha/liquorish darkness

🎯 Med+ dirty earthy mocha mineral dark berry slight dry finesse

Superb aromas of cedar, blond tobacco, smoke, leather, some herbal liquor aromas, red fruit jam. Nice complexity! 
Body elegant, a bit thin, slightly bitterish final.

Modern style (tuned a bit to American palate?) 

Purplish red colored. Top nose with nice cured meat tones and a whiff of sweet fruit. 

Med+ acidity and tannins, spicy and concentrated. Succulent, full and rich. Notable RS. Modern style. Very nice. 17 pts

Retasting Fieuzal 2015 as part of our cellar treasure tasting - wine was slightly on the warm side - full bodied, perfumed and rich palate of cassis, bramble. Good length. Oak lining and modern toasting but not too much oak. Abv 14%. Hogh share of CS - also PV, CF amd Merlot
I think this has the potential to be a stunner in 5-10 years. Starting to taste like the Bordeaux I wanted when I bought it.
Intense colour. Liqorice, vanilla, bitter cherry in the nose and palate. Fresh with good acidity. Full body, long aftertaste
Oh so delicious.  It started with more vanilla, once it opened some tar, funk, Brett and mushroom. On the palate, stewed dried fruit. Just fantastic
Tastes like blackberry cheesecake. Very delicately balanced, clear acids and a sincere friend of red meat dishes. Drink again, hopefully... 🙃
Soft tannins medium acid blackcurrant blackberry plum prune chocolate still has lots of dark cherry fruit & sweetness coming thru. Very easy to drink.
Sweet cherry, black plum, black berries, garden flowers, light farmyard, develop to perfume. High tannins, high acidity. Good wine.
Robust cassis and black currant with licorice and earthy notes. Still feels early to drink as so generous so would cellar a few more years.
Beautiful deep ruby to black, blackberries, prunes, vanilla & oak. Full bodied, cherries and mineral notes, gently peppery, long fruity finish. WS92
Dark ruby red color with tint of purple, leather and violets in nose, blackberries and oak notes in taste, medium tannins and longer finish.
Dark berries,peppery,intense fragrance,bold with silky tannins,finesse,long finish
Tasty. Good rounded, fruity tones, full bodied with a nice long finish. Nose didn't grab me, bit woody and heavy on liquorice.

Horisontal 2010 Bordeaux tasting. 
92p
4.2 Medium-deep purple. Oak vanilla cedar spices. Medium acidity, full body, high smooth tannin, heavy, long finish. Powerful
Really nice wine; elegant, smoothy and simple at the same time. Congrats for the wine.
Powerful Claret showing well!  Will improve but drinking well now.
Cherry, cassis, dried plum, juniper, cigar, hint of cinnamon, fig, slightly sweet on the palate, not very tannic compared to 2009.
Elegant notes of sweet plum, fig , tobacco leaf and black and red currants. Medium-bodied, elegant, rich and persistent on the palate.
Opened up beautifully. Not my preferred style, the wet leaves nose, but can’t deny this is a good wine. Good value for money too.

Yeast, butter, bread toast, vanilla, gooseberries. Lovely creamy texture yeast and butter, very burgundian. Long length.
@ Zurich UGCB Tasting
Exceptional value for money, rounded with multiple layers of dark fruits.
Deep Ruby color, full bodied. Dark fruits, smoked, herbs. Coffee, well balanced and better then expected. Decant over an hour. Good value
Big, bold. Needs to open up. Some tannins that soften. Cinnamon, wood. This big boy has a long life ahead. Drink now or keep for another 10.

Everything a Bordeaux should be, from a great vintage.  Luckily, this bottle survived storage at a run-down local wine store.  While the label was badly damaged, the cork was in perfect shape , and the wine was fresh and full of flavor.   Intense cherry and earth, followed by licorice and tobacco.  A great wine and high quality per value.

This relatively modest PL aged beautifully!
Perfectly ripe, the cab sauv is screaming of joy, cedar, blond tobacco, smokiness, a hint of licorice and dried leaves.... Creamy tannins and very fresh, with still a fruity base.
A lovely evening sip, despite the heat wave...

Nose of undergrowth and ditch. Fresh mint and spice with layers of bright dark fruit, tea leaves, and balanced minerality. Elegant and clean, this wine could age well for another decade easily. 93 points. July 2021

🇫🇷 Good bargain Bordeaux with another fab Pessac from 2009. This will evolve on for another two decades.

👁 Deep purple

👃 Beautiful. Knitted and complex with sweet ripe black fruits including blackcurrant, plum and cassis as well as loads of tertiary with earth, mushroom, leather and smoke with a chocolate oak note. Complex and seductive.

👄 Full bodied, high alcohol, medium plus acidity and tannins. Flavourful and round, smooth and sumptuous. This is classic. Regal mouth feel - lengthy finish.

Pale yellow-green. Little chemicals, floral, honey, herbs. Elegant & vibrant, dense & dry. Classic SauvBlanc-Semillon 50/50 blend. Château de Fieuzal grand vin blanc is aged ⅓ in new, ⅓ in older French oak barrels &⅓ in stainless steel vats. Blended cuvée spends few mo in concrete vats before bottling. Ageing potential is >10 yrs. Château is Grand Cru Classé since 1959. In 2006 famed Bordeaux winemaker Hubert de Bouärd of Château Angelus came as a consultant & helped to open new winery in 2011
Rating 3,8/5
Intense and elegant. Cedar, smoke, olives, blackcurrant, prunes, slight vanilla and glycerin hints on its rich aromas and flavors. Full bodied, well balanced, and still young. Can age for many years.

Unmistakably French wine. In every sense quiet, keeping both aromas & flavours low but still highly refined. Clean deep crimson color with even after 3 hours decant subdued aromas of red fruits with spices & even more hidden vanilla hints. On the palate medium-bodied with good acidity & very discreet tannins. Everything works here in a hidden & subtle manner. Flavours of currants & ripe black cherries with delicate notes of spices, pepper & vanilla. Long finish with subtle tannic cherry-peppery aftertaste.

So young! I'll definitely keep a bottle at least for half a decade!
We drank all the bottle almost w/o decanting but it was still so approachable.
Bright red fruits, balanced oak, showing 3er as well but not overwhelming.
Of course great pairing w 🥩 
 Fantastic wine!

3.75
Chateau de Fieuzal
2013
Grand Vin de Bordeaux

this Left Bank red cuvee from Pessac Leognan 2013 had already some years of bottle ageing and some complexity

medium ruby colour

nose med plus intensity of cassis, black cherry, tobacco,  vanilla leather

palate acidity med minus, alcohol high, tannins med plus, body full. flavour intensity med plus of blackberry, cassis, tobacco, vanilla, leather

good to drink now , but suitable for further ageing.

cheers🍷

(3.85)
Dominance of CS, with Marlot and little CF.
Great intense, rich, slightly savoury and meaty nose revealing aromas of ripe black fruits, licorice, leaather and eucalyptus.
Full bodied, less complex and concentrated than expected, almost elegant, slightly grippy tannins, bit greenish, flavors of blackcurrant, plums, green bell paper, some earthness.
Finish is well lasting and tannic.
Well made, but vintage without typical GC structure and not to long cellaring. No good QPR.

Wonderful nose, full of farmyard notes. On the palate, there is plenty of flavour, yet it is subtle. Dark fruits and bramble. You can taste every 21 years of this vintage. Great length , it lasts and lasts... enjoy.

Dark ruby hue. Dark fruit dominate the nose & palate. Dark plum, blackberry, violet, touch of leather and earthy undertone. Medium bodied. Tannins relaxing. Beautiful clean lasting strong finish. 
20 years old & only starting to bloom. Will continue to evolve & develop. Absolutely lovely.
91 pts full bodied wine with all you wish for this vintage of a Medic; smokey and full of dark forest fruit, pencil shavings, cedar, black currant, blackberry tobacco. Well balanced and great lenght.

This a lovely Pessac from a great chateau, the 1996 is at its prime and though have a few more years to go, it is just the way I like it. Deep red color with orange reams, a tempting nose of black current, coffee, tobacco in a leather box, wet soil and hint of black cherries and cedar wood. Full body, well balanced with well integrated tannins and fine acidity, luxurious long elegant finish. If you have one enjoy it or keep it for a bit longer. My score 90, drink to 2018

Unexpectedly good! I was waiting for average, maybe a bit more... it’s really nice, straight, lean. Dark robe, wild berries on the nose. On the palate lots of red fruit, some oak, a bit of leather. There is also some good, subtle acidity.

Decanted gently a good few hours ahead of drinking. This well structured Graves drank really well and is probably good for a few more years yet. 
Soft tannins. Blackcurrant and vanilla with notes of plum.

Blind I guessed a mature Rhône with notes of unripen pear, some citrus and minerals.  In actuality this is a Semilion/ Sav Blanc BDX blend from Graves.  Reevaluating there is quite a lot of grapefruit, lemon, lime here.  The best element however was standout stoniness that comes through this twelve year old wine.  This is a quality aged white that is light on its feet but with dimension.  I wish I could imbibe this white with more frequently, but alas my $50+ budget skews towards reds.
Dark ruby colour with orange rim. Cassis, oak, pencil and leather nose. Intense and well balanced palate following the nose. Very good.
Not my taste but excellent quality. Aromas of apple, wood, nutmeg, toast and bread in the nose. High acidity and very intense on the palate.
Best shape now no need to wait - silky tannins, cassis, blackberry, blueberry, oak, jam, leather, forest floor, smoke 91/100 Tasted in 2021
For me the winner of the whites we tasted. But not by a lot and in terms of value for money is a bit challenging at this price point.

An ex-cellar bottle enjoyed in De Fieuzal guest house. Do wine taste better in their own Chateaux? This might be a tough question to answer, but I certainly find De Fieuzal beginning to produce some great value wines, especially from 2009.

2012 needed decanting. Quite rich and seductive nose, lovely oak smoke and spices, cassis, enchanting spices no-one would be expecting from a £25 bottle claret. Cinnamon, vanilla, good acidity and medium+ bodied with some fine tannins and lengthy end.

Drink now - 2026.
Lovely smell of vanilla and red fruits. Leather, cherry and vanilla on the palate. Delicious but could be a tad longer and smoother on the finish. 🐺 score 7.5/10.

Earthy and a classy Bordeaux.
It’s fruity on first tasting but decant this one. It opens up to an earthy, prune red. Ripe and gripping tannins and well balanced.
2015: A really nice Pessac Leognan Cru Classé signed by a sweet'n'spicy long finish 😋 I recognize a different style from the 2014, which was less expressive !

Perfectly balanced for my taste right now, good tannins and lots of fruit, red fruit, dark fruit like black currant. A little mushroom and a touch of licorice, very lightly. Perfect with our entrecôte and oven baked aubergine.
Well balance, feel of earth stone and a bit of wild berry. Some senses of very little spice with blending of chocolate
In good shape after 16 years, I think can reach also the 20. A lot of pleasent secondary and tertiary notes. 8,9 PM
Violets chocolate
21 Club, NYC
Black berry
So good

As poured from bottle to glass... Clean deep ruby red.. fruit takes the driver seat on the nose (blackcurrant, red plum) nuances of balsamic, mushroom, cedar, green bell pepper, forest floor, pencil shavings, cigar box and a vanilla and chocolate undertone. Really inviting.
Great structure. Dry, med+ acidity (nice freshness), med+ tannins (softened, with a pleasant hint of green), med alcohol, med+ body, med+ intensity of flavours and long lingering finish (dark choc, licorice) Aged so well. Outstanding

Still a great reference even if not an exceptional year. Double decantation and two hours in a decant bottle and still powerful and heavy tanin.
Light liquorice and strong blackcurrant smell. Best with barbecue and tomahawk beef. Exceptional with an old hard paste cheese, blue or strong goat cheese

Soirée Bordelaise II. 12 years aged Pessac Leognan with 60% Cab Sauv, 33% Merlot, Cab Franc. Intense nose of dried plums, dried cherry, raisins; green bell pepper. Earth, mushrooms, cedar, toast. High, fine grained and well integrated tannin, med plus acidity, med plus alcohol 13.5%. Elegant, silky, full of intense tertiary flavors, med plus length and great balance of med acidity and med body. Wow. Big like!
Excellent white Pessac Leognan, balanced, complex, great with a seafood stew. Will be even better in a year.
Beautiful!!! Still has some nice tannins to age another 5-10 years but already wonderful to drink. Lots of freshness. Leather, tobacco, red fruits like raspberries and strawberries. Loved it!
Still Smelled very oaky, vanilla cream. Agitated gave wax and honey from the semillon. Rich taste but bone dry wine. Fresh acidity. Lingering. Mid palate length. Hmmm loved that one. !
I thought this was a great young white. It was a little bit sweeter than I like due to its high percentage of Semillon. I liked this one better than the 10 &’07 I had the same night.

4.0⭐️
100% Cabernet Sauvignon. 13.5%.
Leather, vanilla, oak, earthy. Mid body. A bit sharp ending. 

Yesterday in famous Stackallen House in Ireland. YPO European Regional Conference
Dry, fruty to almost perfection
Balanced and relatively long. Ready to drink and still in good shape, but a bit less complex than I would have expected. Dominance of woody notes with some leather nuances.
Lovely wine. Balanced and highly enjoyable. Just a little acidity toured around the smooth tanning and lingering dark fruit finish. This was lovely!
Very nice, gorgeous nose of dark fruit - blackcurrant, oak, leather, fresh fruit. Balance, forward fruit. Medium to long finish. Elegant tannins.
Slightly ash try and smokey. Very ripe melon and perfectly aged roundness. Very mineral very long finish and very fine indeed!
very nice white Bordeaux. honey, pear, citrus, minerals on nose. pale golden color. same on taste with some pineapple, cream, and lemon zest.

Pale ruby color with medium minus intensity and  vanilla leather tobacco earthy smoke dark fruit 
On the palate medium acidity and pass it speak
I thought long and hard and found nothing bad to say about this wine. I’d have more Mondays like this any week. Ready to drink.
(4.0) Nose: Blackcurrant and stable. Left bank all the way. Palate: Easy to drink and it both smells and tastes younger than it is. Effortless good.
cedar dark fruit vanilla forest floor on the nose balance medium body dry but complex oak leather earthy dark fruit on the palate long finish
Very soft, a bit sweet (very ripe plums?) but lacks the complexity that I seek in a well-aged Bordeaux, especially left-bank.

Pleasant wine, well developed and still with potential.
Few hours of air will help a lot!
Smoth and elegant with long finish.
Plum and smoke on the nose. Full bodied, dark fruit especially plum. Black cherry on finish. Vanilla and spice notes. Very good. Highly recommended.

Dark brooding

Dark berries, plum and boysenberry

Dried black currant, fig,  plum, tobacco, coffee, cocoa, 

Less fruit and more leather and earth on the palate. Very soft but persistent tannins. Elegant and tasting really well right now.
Very fruity PL from a lovely vintage
Fruity with dark intense notes. Good length. Well balanced with rounded tannins
ripe cherries, tobacco, chocolate. full bodied, silky, with a fresh acidity and nice tannins. I would like to have a longer finish.
Delicious. Medium bodied, open and accessible.
Camphor, pepper, red fruits at nose. Aroma very intense. In mouth marasca cherry and a green tannin wit a hint of liquorice. Good body!
Getting into its stride beautifully now.
Very nice wine. Light. Not much tannins. Leafy notes. Very very nice.

Stunning white, hint of oak, balanced acidity.
A beautiful bottle, yes it's expensive but worth it
Great wine! Paired with steak. Still powerful.
Nice Pessac. Fruity, spicy, rounded tannins, herbs and cedar in the background. Good choice.
good but expensive
One of my favourites 🍷😎🎖 oak leather tobacco blackcurrant
Pronounced intensivity with overwhelming leathery, wet stones and tobbacco aroma + strong black currant notes. Long finish and medium tanins2
Nice Graves wine. Body, flavor, finish. Well done!!
Medium-bodied. Quite austere at this stage. Very little fruit compared to the Les Carmes Haut-Brion (also from Pessac-Leognan).
Rich white peach and elegant pineapple on nose, great full texture.
pure fruit and black pepper, enjoyable
amazing. great depth. medium deep body. dark raspberry. medium low black pepper. light smell. but if left long will be bloody.
Lovely at dinner w despomar.
Leather, blackcurrant and oak
Really earthy with forest floor on both the nose and the palate. Not so oaky. Medium viscosity.
Solid, reasonably-priced Left Bank Bordeaux. Very earthy and needs some time to open. Was better after about 30 min in the decanter.
Wild cherry and blueberry, tobacco and a bit of smoke. The wine has high rates from experts.
It's outstanding. Baked dark fruits, plums, cloves, spice, leather and farmyard. Everything you could want from a top-end Pessac Léognan.
Dark ruby colour. Cassias and sweet berries on nose. Its too early to drink and needs 2 hours to bring out the fruits, sweetness and balance.
Lemon, minerals, citrus,
Steak night at friends place can be sweet… had this on my first lockdown day 1997 vintage. My summary: great stuff never gets boring.
Like it. Some plum on the nose. Medium body

A very nice wine. For me a very balanced wine. Fruity with minerality 
$60 for a Grand Cru Classé, unreal pice. I would / will snatch any future bottles I find.
Great one. Soft and full mouth in same time time, would be perfect with pork on BBC. Notes of red fruit leather

Very interesting to have this wine a few years later. Smooth, balance with a light structure.  blackcurrant plum dark fruit are present in the nose and the open but very quickly taken over by matured aromas like oak vanilla leather and a bit of  cedar in a nice finish. This wine has now probably reached its peak. Great value and level of complexity for the money

A good wine from an awesome vintage that has managed to locate the fine balance between tannins, acidity and fruit. There’re distinct notes of black fruit, cassis, blackberries, traces of red fruit, pepper, oak, vanilla, toast, cigar box, smoke, flint and cocoa. Fleeting tertiary flavors of mushroom, and forest floor are present. Full bodied with medium plus tannins, acidity and finish. Most Pessac Leognan wines are age worthy and this will have many years ahead of it.

Nose is abit unappealing as it’s smells like rotten cherry with musky old cellars. A very full bodied wine with intense ruby red colour with low acidity & med - tannins. Palate is brimming with very well rippen plum, dried raisins & mocha (less the roasted coffee taste like). Paired with jamon iberico de cebu as I slowly wait the wine to have more airtime and develop throughout the nite. 😌

Deep red with wood tones give this Pessac-Leognan a very attractive look. The nose is very elegant with a wide range of fruits, warm spices and a tad smokiness. Tremendous tannins, good balance, lots of complexity and extra long finish on a mineral note. Great mariage to a cassoulet franc!

Deep red with oak, smoke and spice on the nose. Soft tannins give way to blackberries and damsons. Great length and a finish of more smoke. A nicely rounded medium bodied wine that woul pair brilliantly with lamb.

My second tasting, impressive indeed. 

Rich plum aromas, hints of smoke and cedar at mid palate. Almost creme de cassis, this time very open and luscious, the mouthfeel was dense but velvety smooth tannins, ending in a longish robust cigar leather finish. 

Still held its own structure after 1h... good QPR! 4.0☆

@Vintry invitation tasting/sales at Stoked Medan Damansara, KL, with MV 30.12.2018

Excellent Graves Grand Cru Classe vintage. Classic tobacco and plum nose. Big aging potential with high acid and strong biting tannins. The Petite Verdot shines through the plums and stewed fruit with chalky granite flavours that dominate the finish.

Ruby color medium to deep intensity. Attractive and elegant! Notes of sweet fruits, tobacco, smoke and mineral. Medium body, rich and persistent on the palate.  So far I can feel the strong tannin in several wines of this horizontal 2010 tasting, potential and keep in the cellar.

Floral nose. Dark berries, plum with chocolate. Very nice and concentrated wine. Excellent value. Perhaps it will even get better over the years to come. But don't wait too long. I give it a 4.1 for now.

1 of 13 classified wines of P-L with a history going back to the 1st days of wine making in Bordeaux. The name Fieuzal comes from the family who ran the property in the 1600s up until 1859. Since then & through the 20th century the estate changed hands many times. Bought in 2001 and still owned by an Irish family.

Guarded on opening. +24hrs it’s opened but is straight forward. A ripe, black fruited wine, to keep a few more years as tertiary notes emerge.  

🍇 CS 70% | Mrl 20% | CF 5% | PV 5%

1989. Completely tertiary nose. Leather, shoe polish and dried dates. 

Sour plum and cranberry concentrate in the mouth, albeit with much less development / body from there on. Decent acidity though.

A bit over the peak at this stage but a nice try.
Paired with Korean beef bbq

Enjoyed this wine when we checked into Baur Au Lac .  It is not our normal style but have enjoyed it several times in Zurich. Fruit forward but not fruity and finishes quick. A bit dry but easily drinkable.

4.0 ⭐️ Delicate left bank Bordeaux.
Dark ruby in glass. The nose is classic and noble with hints of  blackcurrant, tobacco, vanilla, old foliants, underbrush,  leather, blackberry. Full body, dry, velvet texture, moderate acidity. The taste is also classic with hints of cassis, blackberry, vanilla, tobacco, oak, earl grey tea. Tannins are medium intense and short. Overall, decent and nicely aged Bordeaux.

Opaque reddish purple, showing no age

Nose of cassis, black cherry, oak, vanilla, subtle smoke, soggy earthy truffle, leather, and a hint of pepper.

Big well structured and fine tannins.  Lots of acidity.  This decade old wine is well balanced but has lots more to give.  Still a lot of fruit so a long decant is recommended.  This is rich, bold and delicious.

Flavors similar to the nose with  blackberry, black currant, chocolate, licorice, minerals and cedar. 

Rating: 92+

This is a great wine without the traditional French fuss. I'm not a French wine lover and I have said that many time here because I think that in order for you to get anything worth it's price vis a vis its quality you need to go up to the €300. + and I'm not about to buy wines like that every day. So I. Prejudiced and I might be wrong !
Fieuzal is this, nice and supple , full of taste but not overly fleshy about that like they French like , has equilibrium , which I dislike because I like being surprised.

Bottle #9 of Manchester Wine Warren. 
I'd hoped my BLANKbottle magnum might be a nice party piece as the first magnum at a MWW... but I was usurped by @[1|16425004|Vita in Vinum] who treated us to this Fieuzal. Perfect after we'd had my Fieuzal white earlier that day (coincidence!). 😅
I found this quite fruit forward with plenty of blackcurrant and blackberries and a good weighty mouthfeel. Pencil case and graphite too. 
Very nice accompaniment to our beef wellington.

#MWW gathering! A stunning Bordeaux brought by Bordeaux man @[1|16425004|Vita in Vinum]! AND it was in magnum bottle! How cool is that?! 

70%CS, 15%M, 15% PV blend. Deep ruby. Nose is pronounced with that melow black plum, blackcurrant, violet, black cherry, cinnamon, cedar. It is so soft and mild. (I think my notes started to deteriorate from this point onwards 😂 Quite difficult to understand the Scribbles I’ve left in the notebook - one word combo I can recognise -> smooth operator)

#MWW continued with a wonderful magnum of this Pessac Leognan provided by @[1|16425004|Vita in Vinum].

👁 deep ruby. 👃 pronounced, black plum, blackcurrant, black cherry, blueberry, violet, cedar, tobacco.

Dry. Full body. High alcohol. High acidity. Bold tannins. 👅 pronounced, loads of black fruit, cedar and dark chocolate. Bold and smooth, going beautifully with beef Wellington.

Dark brick colour. Smoke, dried meat mixed with black berries, cherries on the nose. Well balanced - tannins, acidity and integrated body. Cherries, sweet black berries - blackberries and chokeberries. Well aftertaste!

2010 Ch. De Fieuzal

Appearance: deep ruby

Notes of earth, wet soils, blackberry, purple flower, vanilla, coffee, black pepper, smoke.

Body: medium
Acidity: medium+
Tannin: delicate and moderate
Finish: moderate+

Classic, round, subtle, silky, with tone of blackberry on the palate. Well-balanced. Moderate details with . Finish of peppery e.g. pepper and spices.

90-91 pts.

Voluptuous. This is a beautifully balanced wine, cassis, leather and oak yeah but so what. This is about the engineering.  Deep in the background there is a hint of caramel, not in a sweet or acrid way but just in a way that helps pull everything g together.  This is a grand stage of a wine,  broad in the character it presents but with precision still.  Half tempted to lick the inside of the bottle, that kind of good.  Still god plenty of ageing potential too but that youthful exuberance worth it still.

Wonderful tart fruit in the nose, though you have to work a little to get it. Subtle cherry on the front end, earthy with great tannins follow, with a lingering finish. Dry, medium bodied and acidic throughout.

Excellent Pessac-Léognan with great class and finesse. Dominated by forest floor, cedar, wood, wet leaves, and quite some tobacco combined with blackberries and black currant. Very well-structured and elegant with an enduring finale. First tasted in 2019, second time in 2022. Now (2022) at its peak with the last fruit disappearing and the earthy forest floor tones dominating on the nose and on the palate. Recommended.
Bordeaux wines are definitely growing on me. This is a fantastic wine plenty of flavour including cherry and leather with a good smell of wood and earth.

4.2


Flavours 👄 👃 


Food Suggestion 🍝 🥩 🐟 🧀

Decant/Caraffe 🍶


Glass Suggestion 🍷 
- Riedel Sommelier Bordeaux 
- Zalto Bordeaux
- Riedel Sommelier Tempranillo
Mediterranean perfume, truffles, game, blackcurrant, liquorice, nose. The palate is quite a lovely surprise, sweeter, of brown sugar, lead, red cherry, mocha,

Swishing this at the big wigs table. A magnum was proffered. No messin’. Lochlann given a few quid to keep off the bread line. 

Free booze too. Good free booze.
Drunk out of a magnum. Red fruits, forrest floor, scental wood notes. Palate is alredy smooth, tannins starting to round. A great deal at this price point.
Medium ruby color, medium intensity nose, aromas of dried red fruit, toffee, chestnut, earthy notes, medium acidity, jamny sour cherry flavours, past it's peak.

(17/20) Rich and savoury wine, good structure, beautiful tannins, quite mineral. Still feels young, almost a little bit nervous even, but the wine grows on me while sipping. Love the complex and mineral aftertaste.
Medium intense aromas of blackberry, blackcurrant, blueberry, red cherry, toast, vanilla, cigar leaves, wet leaves, roast beef, bay leaf, black pepper, tobacco, wet stone.
Dry wine, medium+ acidity, medium+ and fine-grained tannins, medium+ body, pronounced intensity, long finish.
Exchange Felix

Let it open up for 30 minutes.

I love its nose of relaxing herbs, tea leaves, wet forest floor.

Blackberry, blueberry, ending in long bitter earthy and licorice finish.

After a longer while, bitter orange dark chocolate abounds.

Amazing. It’s still very good on the next day. Darker chocolate and still easy smooth.

Love this wine. The reduction and minerality really show in this example, with flavors of earthy flavors of flint, gravel, and pepper balancing the blackberry and cassis fruit flavors. The warmer climate of graves and the higher percentage of Merlot gives this wine a little extra body compared to similar Medoc wines and a lot more of that blackberry fruit. Oak is subtle and well integrated despite the age - takes more of the form of cedar and smoke.

I'm not the biggest Bordeaux Blanc drinker but this was a great bottle: citrus flavours and taste, some sweetness at the start , probably from the Semillon immediatly backed up with lemon, acidity and chalky end. Drink now.

What a beautiful wine , decayed for a couple of hours. Smooth finish , notes of cherry and chocolate. Great accompaniment to steak , sweet potatoes and beets. A rounded sophisticated wine , balanced tannins make it most enjoyable .

Accidentally poured into a Burgundy glass, but it smells exquisite and the flavors are equally gorgeous. 
👁 Deep ruby purple amost opaque.
👃 Black plum, lavender and violets, black cherry 🍒 with vanilla, licorice and smoke 💨 . 
👅  Rich black and red plum, blackberry, red currant with fresh lavender and celery. Full bodied with velvety integrated tannins, dry, M+ acidity, beautiful complexity and freshness! 14.5% alcohol. 75% CS/10% M/10% CF/5% PV.

Viva la France Mövenpick winetasting #2. And now straight to the topic - Bordeaux 2015. This one we liked alot! On the nose lots of ripe fruits, berries, plums, blueberries, cherries, strawberries, vanilla, coffee, rose petals, meaty notes. On the palate good balance of tannins and acidity, fruits, chocolate, coffee aftertaste. Great wine, especially at this price, we could not resist and took a bottle. We will see how it will develop after a few years, but it is already quite approachable now.

One of my fav producers in Pe-Lé. Decanted for ~3 hours. Black currant, bramble, on the nose also with slightly herbal/medicinal notes, medium to full bodied, beautiful structure. Softening tannins. It’s drinking well but this can sit. I look forward to revisiting in a few years. Currently available at select LCBO for Bordeaux hunters. @[1|3036512|Cameron Landry] @[1|20010099|Davey Dee] @PK #awc

This chateau was once famous for filling the Vatican cellar of pope Leon XIII. Now working with Hubert de Bouard of chateau Angelus, the red wines are gaining as well. 

The 2013 has a nose of smoke rubbery blackberries and cherries with sour currants and Christmas cake spice 

Very soft and round on the palate with good fruit intensity and lacking interest. 

89 pts me
91 galloni
88 tanzer
89+/ An intense and elegant CS70 blend with Merlot20, CF5 & PV5 with aromas of blackberries, cassis and vanilla with hints of earth and black coffee ☕️ notes
Deep dark red color, cedar and spices on the nose.  A little heavy with the oak with burst of acid out of the gate and smooths out for a long finish.
Good shift from typical grave style with very good nose of oak and floral.slightly too much acid on palate.med body dry with a short-medium refreshing finish.

Intensif nose, with black berry, vanilla, mushroom flavor. On the palate, medium tannin balance the strong earthy flavor.
Still young, but already some punch

Clear deep ruby colour. Herbaceous wine with cedar, vanilla, blackcurrant, blueberry, cherry, and a bit of raisin aromas. These aromas are not overwhelming, making the nose very pleasant. High acidity. Medium tannins. Medium body. Grassy, black current flavours with a medium finish, which is a bit disappointing since the wine started beautifully. Still a good wine overall.
Strong powerful, intense flavours of  vanilla oak blackcurrant tobacco earthy cassis blackberry blackcurrant.
Excellent Bordeaux. Enjoyed it during our yearly week-end trip with the girls 9th birthday.
Steely mineral almost flinty white with lots complexity and lemon finish drinking superbly and up against greats
Incredible nose, possibly the nicest wine I've ever smelt! Palate not so developed, dry and lacking body but good with meat, guessing will improve. Worth buying just to sniff!
Red ruby color. Very aromatic with oakiness and age. Quite dry and rounded. Hints of strawberry and red berries. Quite tart and has acid. Medium bodied. Strong tannins. A long lasting taste
Interesting and complex nose. Cherry and oak notes. Soft tannins. High acidity.
Pale yellow, mature yellow plums some peach and dairy notes. Understandable with 50% new oak used. Delicious now but I would drink this 2019-2024.
Fantastic! Concentrated Forrest fruit, berries, black currant, oak, structured tannins. Long earthy sweet aftertaste.
Full and rich with tremendous concentration, weight and power. The structure and ripe fruit balances the dense finish very well.
Very bold with high tannins. Bit of oak on the nose. Has loads of plum and blackberries on the palate

Very nice wine...
As I remembered it from two weeks ago
Very nice. Add to your collection.
A fantastic wine, although still some tannin and think will go further. Coffee grind notes and just got better with drinking. Smell is great, taste nearly as good. 4.0-4.25.
Great wine, perfect now and for the next 5 years. Subtle, yet well structured and long on palate. Very pleasant. Notes of cedar, truffle, tobacco and raspberry. Will try to buy more.

Pale yellow gold colour.

On the nose lemons, apples, thyme, honey, baking spices and minerals.

On the palate medium plus bodied with medium acidity and a long citrus finish.
Still amazing after all these years. But will not go until 2030. Soft tannins, ripe dark red fruit, oak (of course) and tobacco. Leather and a hint of berry’s. Drink now!
Great, needs a few more years though. More complex and subtle than the 2009. Met the winemaker - he’s the man.
Subtle nose, but very rich and dense on the palate. Beautiful balance and tightness.
Hazy appearance deep garnet colour with brown rim. Notes of green bell pepper, tobacco and cedar wood. Palate of medium tannins, medium+ acidity, medium body and medium finish.

Rich nose with butter, tropical fruits, flowers. 
Eucalyptus, butter, tropical fruits, green tones, high acidity.
Exactly what you’d expect from this region .... deep flavours and intense. Dark chocolate, plummy and noticeable minerality... a very nice wine
Wine in excellent condition, just right to drink. Light texture with soft tannins, perfect acidity balance. Flavours on the lighter side, some oak, tobacco, jam in the nose. Long and velvety finish.

4.25 WOTN for the first tasting in a looong time. 

Aging greatly showing with old leather and tobacco/cigar. 

Good fruit still, no hurry to pop open but in a great age to drink.
Dark color. Lovely aromas and smooth and well balanced on the palate. Long finish makes this a very nice wine
M Garnet, M- acidity, M tannins, dried Cherry, blackberry, raisin, walnut, baking spice, vanilla, cedar. Nearing the end of its time but this bad boy still has some life to it.
Good balanced Pesac, light oaky and berry nose, and balanced tannins on the palate.  Very drinkable.
Delightful Pessac Leognan red. This 2008 offers exemplary value for a grand cru classe de graves.
Nice getting mellow
Oak and a hint of tabaco this is very well balanced coming to it's peak
Classical red, nose with blackberries, liquorice and tar, body well developped, round tannins (although present), very nice Bordeaux.
Upon opening, nose mainly of cherry, but evolves to oak and tobacco. Dark fruit taste and quite tannic. Strong with a long aftertaste.
Found this gem in the Auchan in Paris for a very sweet price. Well-balanced wine: chocolate, caramel, blackberry, plum, oak, sweet tobacco.
Great vintage
Top
Top!!
Smooth
Ripe juicy fruit reflects the generous vibtage. Dark fruits, violets and spice. High alcohol and sadly, disjointed oak. Over the top oak and short finish. 3.5
Better than I rememeber. Beautifully pork pairing. Thanks @[1|508481|Ben CY]. Cheers @[1|20010099|Davey Dee]
Oak, tobacco, cedar, bell pepper and plum. Still a bit too young. Full flavor about 30 mins later. Great value for money.
Wonderful. Just as I remembered. Needs a lenghty decant. Drink or hold for much longer. Dark fruit and oak shine
Dark purplish red, sweet licorice with oak, dark berries with vanilla. Medium-full on the palate with acids, dark fruits, burnt spice, sweet plums & oak with firm tannins but medium finish.
B (dark fruit w/ a hint of red fruit, well balanced)
Fruity, cherry, oaky but with a lovely long finish.
Leather and tobacco at its best! and smoked speck of course :-) I love wines that show these signs of ageing... Good finish and very good acidity for this age! smooth tannins! 12,5 abv!!!

Bit darker red. Oak led.  Beautiful aroma and on the taste. Balanced. Lovely.
Edit: Drink again in 2019. More balance. Classic Pessac. Sweet Minerals. Ample tannin and balance acidity.
Hints of pine tree, lovely full red color, silky attack on red fruit, perfectly balanced with some extra developent potential for amateurs of tertiary aromas, if ever it will develop them
Delicious on good cheese and great company! Bordeaux whites especially from Pessac Leognan are just so amazing, round in the mouth, rotten fruits and long lasting on the palais ... wow!
Wow, still very dark and youthful colour. Lovely nose of lucious black fruit (blueberry, black currants), incense, oriental spices and underwood. Gentle and fruity, soft tannins. Lovely

Dark ruby in color with a reddish rim.

Earthy nose of blueberries, light cherries, black tea, wood, earth, green vegetables, graphite, spices, bitter herbs, bell pepper, peppercorn, forest floor and tobacco leaf.

Medium bodied with medium acidity and nice legs.

Dry on the palate with currants, plums, blueberries, earth, forest floor, green vegetables, graphite, spice box, mushrooms, black tea, bitter herbs and black pepper.

Nice finish with soft tannins and tangy cranberries.


    More >>>
evolving in taste and aroma:dominant underwood that stays all way long,light mixed berries notes at the beginning evolve to leather,earth,rye bread and plum
M, ruby. M+, rose petal, violet, red cherry, leather, game, pepper. Dry, m+ acid, m+ body, m+ tannin, m+ intensity with black cherry,  aniseed, savoury, m finish.

2001 magnum, oak black currant, earth and leather however tannins weren’t quite as expected so it’s clear this vintage is starting to pass its peak. However still a lovely bottle to enjoy once decanted for an hour. I’m glad I opened it now.

Had the opportunity to compare the 1996 and 2005. Absolutely torn between the 2 vintages. Lovely jammy nose with hints of minerals and still rich on the palate for the 1996 with many more years to last.

Cleaning out the archives. Smells very much like tiramisu with coffee and vanilla notes. Very interesting. Coffee notes continue in the taste with a medium acidity. Finish is creamy, vanilla, honey, and citrus. Fun and different. And old.

does this epic vintage starts to sing #20

👃 herbs, oak, black fruit 

👄 powerful, tomboyish, densely woven, dry on vibrant acidity, furry tannins, medium to full bodied 
cassis, blackberries, sour cherries, black chocolate, pepper, cloves, dried herbs, graphite & autumn leaves 

🎯 somewhat bitter finish of medium length, very spicy and astringent 

📝 a impressive vintage for Fieuzal in its first drinking maturity with potential for another two decades

Happy Bordeaux Sunday part 1/2 dear friends, cheers 🍷🇫🇷

drinking beautifully out of the bottle! i'm scared of older bottles that come out tasting insipid - this one is good to go. dark red colour, no sign of age. nose of wood and dried fruit, some tobacco. full palate, completely integrated tannins, tobacco and earth. such a beautiful find and good price. first of six bottles. will keep but don't think they will improve unless you like them brick-old. (re-tasted 28/7/19: same notes, beautiful mid-palate, happy to drink this over and over again)

(Bottle breathed for 3 hours)Ruby with brown hint. Soya sauce, cassis, violet, black pepper, cedar wood, tobacco, and mint. Medium bodied with lots of black fruits, plum and spices. Structure is holding up well with mellow tannin. Finish is superb and long with rich vanilla. Drink now.

Wonderful wine. Despite its age, still strong black and red fruit aroma and taste. Also notes of dirt, leather, chocolate and tobacco. Still good tannins, and long after taste. A wine for a good meal.

Chateau de Fieuzal. Pessac Leognan. Grand Cru. 1982 vintage. SGD149 from Cornerstone. 

Color: Pale Ruby 

Nose: Medium intensity. Developing.  oak leather earthy graphite plum

Palate: Dry. Medium tannins. Medium + acidity and medium alcohol. Medium bodied with medium + finish. Flavour intensity is medium.  licorice black cherry coffee

Quality is Good 

Drink now. Potential for aging.

Delicious fully mature still jammy- fruity pessac, no tertiary notes yet, energetic and jummy at the same time, subtle, full of nuances. Moreover this is still affordable. Pessac Leognan is the thing, and this domain in particular !

Wow!!!
Beautiful yellow gold
Nose - sweetness - apricot, peach, vanilla, butter, coconut - so complicated 
Taste - not less complicated - dried fruit, vanilla, brioche 
Dry, bold, viscosity, long-long finish, medium bodied 
Wonderful adult vine!!!

31 year old baby which is still showing a good amount of exotic fruit.  Initially was getting some longan, lychee and forest floor.  Slowly started showing some blackberry and other berries which made it absolutely delicious.  Served blind and no one knew it was beyond 20 years.  Still having good acid but doubt it’s gonna go on for long.  Had good tertiary mushrooms, wood, and grass.

Took some time to open up. The nose evolved from earthy/ moisture to roasted coffee and finally a lot more fruity. Spicy. Really great wine. Fieuzal used to lead the pack in Pessac. Now underrated for sure.

2004 Vintage. Consumed 2020-09-21. Decanted for an hour prior to first impressions. 

Dark garnet in color. Initial scents of oak and pine cone, smoked meats, maybe some fading black fruit (and later unripened red fruit). 

On the palate, medium tannins that are mature but not as defined as I would have liked.  Medium+ body.  A spiciness develops on the palate as it opens.  Nice, soft finish that does not linger. The flavor was a bit amorphous or less defined than I had hoped. Good wine but no showstopper.

Medium lemon.  Perfumed with wild spring flowers and cat piss.  Well structured, almost perfectly balanced, with its acidity, fruitiness and flavours well mingled together.  Mixed fruits of pear, grapefruit, pineapple, even mango.  This has matured so nicely, years of life to go.  Beautiful!  An ambassador of Pessac- Leognan white.  17 December 2017.

Nice red - brick colour. Full body dry, high tannins with high acidity also. Aromas of blackcurrant, blackberry, plum, cassis, with hints of cherry, oak, tobacco, leather, vanilla, earthy, licorice. Long mouthful aftertaste.

Pessac Leognan 2006 (1/2) - Fieuzal
👁️: Deep Ruby
👃: Medium(+) intensity flavours of blackberry, leather, tobacco, ceddar. 
👄: Dry with high acidity, medium (+) tannins, medium alcohol, full body and long length.
⏳: Can drink now and in the next 5-7 years
💲: Value for money, 3.5/5 (30 CHF)

What a find, buried at the back of a cupboard, no idea how long we've had it or where we got. Cork split a little on opening but smelled great. Had to decant, quite a bit of sediment. Nose shows bottle age (leather, animal) but still good fruit (ripe plums, blackcurrant). Great acidity - wine retains real freshness. Soft tannins. Great length. Black cherry sherbert, black fruits. Could go another few years in the bottle, especially considering we weren't storing it properly! Lovely wine.

Very fruity, the color shows beginning maturity but still dense and deep crimson.
On the palate dark fruit, some mineralic tannins and grafite.
Untipical for a Pessac-Leognan but nice to drink. Long afterijhzhjkjgh

Close to wine of the night this one. Classic cedar/tobacco box nose. Lots of primary fruit still and little browning if at all. Blackcurrant and leather, tannins beautifully integrated, touch of licorice, everything just falling in to place perfectly. Great!

Dark ruby red with a dense core. A light, refreshing nose with direct, primary red berries. Lovely balance and texture from the fine velvety tannins; sweet, round blackcurrant fruit and smoky notes at the back of the palate.

Blackcurrant, leather, slight green leaf, slight forest floor, and slight orange on the nose. In addition, blackcurrant, blackberry, slight cedar, and slight mint on the palate. Fresh despite 15 years old, with firm tannins still evident.

4.25* rounded up. A very interesting wine really unique flavour

👁 pale gold. Clear ageing.
👃🏻 hit of roasted almond and nut with some lemon curd
👅 smooth medium body, very well balanced nut and lemon. Most intense nut flavour i have tasted to date.

Kicking off the Bordeaux pre 2000 tasting with the Spittoons... rest of notes to come over the weekend. Sauvignon + Semillon blend from Bordeaux. eye -gold. Intense nose of lemon zest, passion fruit, dried mango, apricot, honey. Palate less ripe w/ lemon zest + passion fruit. Vanilla oak develops w/ time in glass. Dry, high acid, body med + a punchy, waxy finish. A joy to drink, memorable + complex finish. 4.1*

Dark ruby ​​with an orange tinge on the edges.
Aromas of cigar, smoke, black truffle, soil, mushrooms, cedar and cassis. A complex scent.
Soft fruit overflows in the mouth and has a beautiful acidity. Moderately gentle tannins.

Deep ruby, oak, vanilla,  tobacco, caramel and cocoa but also some notes of leather and earthy. Finally underneath plum, black currant and fig. Nice balance, full bodied, quite low acidity and nice polished tannins. It aged very well.

vivino Leuven gathering: golden Oldies#2
This is an open invitation to Ed de Block (NL). We were knocked out by your accurate tasting note. Next time you’re invited to be our special guest of the evening, if you can’t make it, we’ll come over to visit your beach bistro!😃😃😃
Oxidative, fresh pressed walnut oil and a floral note. A little saline touch with soft acidity. Interesting but there’s a lack of “je ne sais quoi” to have more than one glass.
⬇️⬇️⬇️comments⬇️⬇️⬇️

Wine is slightly cloudy in the glass which reminded me of a 2003.  Nose of cherry, vanilla, anise and licorice.  Wine is dry but the tannins have smoothed over the years since my last tasting. Moderate finish.

Great old wine, has peaked though and on it return. Nose i vanilla, leather, plum. Taste is very balanced, leather earthy vanilla plum blackberry blackcurrant chocolate mushroom licorice. Long finish.

Memorable occasion serving two 2000 for two 2000 lovely people … this certainly came off better with a delicate balance of fruits and tannin … layers of blue berry, plum, cassis … supported by a backbone of soft vanilla and tannin…

Medium to full bodied. Rich ruby red color with that plummy edge that gives away an earthy palate.

It is powerful with plums, edged with spice, and has a soft earth flavour throughout. This evolves right to the finish, which is warm and brilliant. A great left bank for that special occasion!

20181230 - Burnt earth and coffee heralded the bouquet with some charred meat and ferric notes on the palate .. some clove discernible at the end ... medium bodied with good acidity and firm smooth tannins      

Was tossing between Pomerol or Pessac Leognan but picked the former for its complexity and smoothness  

Was pleasantly surprised when unveiled  ..  now I can look forward to enjoying the other de Fiezals in my fridges

WMK's @ his place for CJ's Birthday

If number three is this great, who knows what is on wait! Richly aromatic with red pepper, cranberries, cassis and blackberries, also leather, horse and wet leaves, bellpepperjam. Juicy and lots of sour sweets, soft backbone, tar, fruit and spices. A true golden oldie.

Didn't have too high expectation of this wine... but on contrary it is drinking well now, after 1 to 1.5 hours decanting ... Bouquet of graphite, cassis and plum... soft and integrated tannins with blackberry and leather palate and decent finishing

This is a classicly styled lovely mature red Graves, at it's peak or slightly past it. The nose combines mature tones with a pleasant greennes. Harldly any tannins left at all, nevertheless with good balance. I must admit I expected more from this wine,  but apart from that good drinking, with or without food. So no food wine, Jelle!

This is a good value for the price. Earthy on the nose when uncorked. Initial tannins smooth out.  Opens nicely to flavors of oak, vanilla, leather and dark fruit. Very balanced with a longer finish than expected. Definitely will try again.

there was a nice whiff of seashelly aromas from the glass that should have moved our minds to Bordeaux, but this quickly ceded way to almost Loire-like accents of white flowers, peach and lanolin, along with a very honeyed undertone. Really nice. With a bit of air, it developed even more, showing some chalky earth and a distinct waft of Buah Salak - the South-East Asian "snake-skin" palm-fruit. A really complex, interesting bouquet. I liked the palate too. It had a fresh juiciness that belied both its age a

Classic earthy Graves nose with lush memories of  Moroccan leather, sweet tobacco, slight notes of aged black currant and plum intermixed with a savory herbal undertone and a funky twist of barnyard or wet dog note.
On the palate overall very pleasant with very good balance, freshness and persistence.
Despite its age still in an excellent condition , at its peak of performance but with no signs of fading.
Finishes smoothly with lovely tertiary perfumed black- berried fruit and a herbal medium length

Deep ruby in color, faint evidence of sediment, with medium viscosity. On the nose, medium plus intensity, aromas of raspberry, black cherry, plum, cedar, and some new oak. Palate starts off with a softer attack than the aromas - dry, medium plus in body, acidity, and tannin, medium alcohol. Well structured and complex with underripe sour cherry, leather, and vanilla for a long smooth finish. Great example of an old world, warm climate and cooler vintage production.

83/100 very very good

[4.0] Golden oldie or not this 27y old Pessac-Leognan by @[1|5755096|Christian Ruyffelaert]? Let’s check it out! After a brief wakeup call the nose starts with ripe tones of plums followed by nuances of blackcurrants, graphite spot, nice cassis & black cherries whiff and herbal & green bell pepper tones all kept together with a tight leather belt and touch of cigar box. This 27y old one comes in quite fresh with still some black fruit, but is loosing it’s concentration and it’s acidity. Still: nice glass!

[Vivino Leuven Golden Oldies 3/15]
Great to be able to try a red Fieuzal of similar vintage as the white!
This one made many turns during the evening keeping us interested.
At first overwhelming bell pepper (green and red), graphite, cassis and prune followed by a palate with mixed pepper, black currant, black cherry, leather, licorice, pronounced acidity and molten tannines. 3.8
Thx Tom, super to have this opportunity!

Elegant, rich, lots of complexity with hints of plums, blackberries, venison & vanilla. Good balance between tannin and acidity should allow for a few more years of aging. The tannins give it just the right level of dryness to avoid it being overpowering. A great Bordeaux, worth its grand cry classification.

Opened from the cellar. 

Smells like delicious Bordeaux. Damp woods, cedar, hot chocolate, and blackberry pie. 

Full with precise and robust tannic structure. Blackberries reminiscent of Howell Mountain. Cedar underpinnings. One of the best vintages of this estate I’ve had.
The Semillon mix was mistaken for oak initially. The taste got better and better and eventually won me over. Very nice experience worth repeating.

A great example of a well balanced Bordeaux 2009, with typical characteristics. Initially a bit young but after 30min it becomes very nice. Preferably you should let it age for a bit longer for more complexity but drinks nicely now

still young... should have waited more time. nice complexity on the nose, coffee black currant. on the palate an interesting acidity, sort of Italian but without missing its French inheritance. a very lovely wine.

Popped this to enjoy with the wagyu ribeye whipped up by the missus.

Still looking youthful in the glass. 

Bouquet of dark fruit, leather and forest floor. 

Silky tannins, gentle acidity, hints of dark chocolate. 

Very enjoyable with steak or any red meat. Too bad this is the last bottle of the case.

Dark purple color in aroma and taste dominate dark fruits over red fruits in the background fig prune raisins notes of oak vanilla chocolate coffee tobacco cedar caramel leather earthy smoke graphite cocoa mushrooms forest floor tar iron cinnamon licorice pepper well-built high acidity delicate velvet tannin long finish good wine  solo.  🍇🍷👍🏻😃👌🏻

This 11 yrs old still carry lots of potential. Medium Garnet with development of brownish rim in color with medium intensity.

It's black fruits (berries, cherry, plum with hints of dried fruits). Secondary & tertiary aromas are still in development with touches & hints of cedar, earth, tobacco & forest floor. 

Palate carries gd fruits with its freshness is noticeable, the high acidity & medium tannin that's give gd savory & round palate. 

Long finished and I belive this still a 3-5 yrs of ageing.

Very good, well balanced and smooth wine. Very easy to drink and keeps its flavour up with cheese and a good steak. Though,because its so well crafted and balanced its almost boring if you are looking for a certain kick in your wine.

2009 is billed as an outstanding vintage for Bordeaux with rich wines across the region. That is reflected in this plush example. Nearly black-purple colour. Spicy wood, dark fruit and a vanilla note from oak. The first of three bottles I grabbed on release. An impressive value. The only drawback is if I were tasting this blind I'm not sure if I could tell you where it's from. It clearly can stand some more time in the cellar and that might allow some typical character to shine through.

Let’s start this #JdF 🇫🇷 on the right foot, with entry 1 on June 1.

Lovely Pessac from a great vintage, still showing some blueberry and plum on the nose, but mostly in tertiary aromas of cigar box, vanilla, dark chocolate and smoke.

The tannins are now very mellow, with flavours that show little fruit. WS recommends drinking by 2021. I think there are a few years left in this wine, but don’t wait too long.
Good. Earthy with some red fruit. Not super concentrated. Balanced structure but not something that will help this one last. Good to drink now

Dark ruby red, limpid, beautiful legs & tears. Nose - Dense jam of black berries, liquorice, violets, hints of cacao, aged leather & fine cigarbox woods. Crushed black pepper, red cherries and some plum. Softened tannins and a great acidity leads the way to a traditional savoury finish. All in all very nice, though no stand out wine.

Bordeaux Grands Crus Classés seminar and tasting with renowned Bordeaux wine expert Dewey Markham Jr., red wine from Pessac Leognan 75% CS, 10% Merlot, 5% PV, 10% CF. Deep opaque garnet red colour. Intense aroma of blackberries, black cherries, well integrated oaky notes, sweet spices, undergrowth, slightly smoky with scents of dried fruits. Full body, firm but delicate fine grained tannins, fruity flavours are layered with toasted oak, slight salinity, fresh acidity and smoky, leafy finish.

Points: 16

🎖 OVERALL:
Great wine with a nice structure with a brown-red color. However, I believe that the wine has reached its best drinking maturity with 5.

🌬 INTENSITY:
Pronounced nose, which literally jump out. Medium+ on the palate.

🎛 COMPLEXITY: 
Complex structure: cooked strawberries, blackberries, cherries and currants. Tobacco, smoke, caramel, oak, leather, dark chocolate aromas.

⚖️ BALANCE:
Velvety tannins which are perfectly integrated. Too much acidity, but could already be due to age.

⏱ FINISH: 
Long.

Still young , lot of potential . Ugly color as usual , but the taste is heaven. Bit of chocolate and tobacco , some forest fruit make this dry mix a masterpiece for the future . Well balanced with medium high acidity has a still discrete aftertaste due to youngness but I am confident for the next years

I bought a case of this and have been drinking it over the last few years. It’s drinking beautifully now but keeps on getting better with age. Cracking Bordeaux with plenty of power and a lingering aftertaste. Top stuff

Beautiful brick color indicating age. Incredibly strong notes of cherry on the nose with oak, vanilla, and blackberry on the palette. Bold in flavor, smooth and balanced in taste, overall a real treat of a glass

3.7 for this sauvignon blanc and semillon blend! ! Medium yellow color with thin long legs in the glass. On the nose are medium+ intense aromas of yellow apples, pineapples, marzipan, oak and vanilla. The bonedry white has a pretty high acidity which is refreshing, a bit sour and
 still not very well integrated. It has some soft tannins. On the palate are flavours of lemons, apples,vanilla, oak, bitteralmonds, camomile and a fine minerality. It has a long finish with lots of aging potential! Cheers 🍷🍷🍷

This wine was most confusing! Found it back shelf lying flat on its side! Bought it,opened and decantered it for 2 hrs"
Its a deep dark blood red,smelt like tractor fuel and diesel at first but mellowed out with time! Its still way to hot with a heavy dark berry,cherry touch and a dash of vanilla! Its has everything but a great finish!! Cellaring could help but my lips are still burning! Molten liquorice and smokey wood compliment  but doesnt help the overall style,topsy turvy still,rough,fleshy etc,enjoy🍷

Dark red colour, earthy notes on the bouquet with black fruit aroma on the nose, complex interplay of blackcurrant,  blackberries,  cassis, balsamic,  and smoke on the palate, with subtle notes of oak and leather, lengthy finish with a lasting aftertaste throughout the night

3.6pts. Gift from uncle Alfred. Leather, vanilla and black pepper on the nose. Dark fruits; blackcurrants. Smatterings of pepper and charred wood on the palate. Med+ weighty body that balances the tannins from making too much of an impression.  A little sweet in its rather short ending. IMO, a pleasant wine but lacks complexity and depth.
Black fruit but still a little light acid (love it), tobacco leather and almond Great wine Wonder when/where I bought it
Surprisingly superb wine. Gentle tannins and black currant. Prominent leather notes. Very elegant wine.
Soft on the nose, but bursting with flavor in the mouth. Dark chocolate, some vanilla, tobacco. Tannic, but not too heavy.

Tannins in the nose

Very rusty amber in colour after lengthy ageing. Stone fruit, bready notes, and a wonderfully soft finish. Lovely wine
Beautifully smooth wonderful aromas.  Cigars and leather on the nose. Firm structure. Definitely buy again.
A lovely, pretty, floral, and very enticing nose. Unfortunately a bit of a disappointment on the palate.
One of the best wines i drank recently. Perfectly balanced fruitenes.very smooth. Oak is veru subtle.   Dark green vegetables amd legumes with some earth notes.  Loved it.
Excellent

Rounded, red berries, soft and velvety tannins, seem rather mellow with medium length finish. Right time to drink now, shouldn't wait much longer.

Amazing that this wine is still that good in 2014. It's still full bodied, hasn't lost it's richness. Dry with hints of apricot.

Great experience with Ch de Fieuzal 03. After opening the wine was closed. At first the wine was bitter and flat. The oxygen injection was needed the bring this wine to live. It took 2 hours to let it grow. The nose was nice and getting better. Blackberry, plum and tobacco. Medium + body. After all we very content with this wine. The drinking window is probably 2017/18 instead of 2013.

Very nice well aged Bordeaux white. Golden,  deep yellow colour. Intense and complex aroma of smokiness, cooked peaches, shafran, raisins, dry plums, canded orange, hint of artichoke. The final layer covers all bucket with fresh cheese. It seems that aroma never stop changing! That's fantastic!
Full and complex in the mouth, mineral and low acidic, well structured. Medium finish with bitter and ripe fruits notes.
This is amazing!!!

This Pessac-Léognan from Chateau de Fieuzal is made from 5 different grapes (next to the known Bordeaux ones it is Petit Verdot and Malbec), but the character of the wine is still very much “Bordeaux” with dark berries notes, wet forest, leather, earthy smoke hints and a fine well balanced acidity. Good choice for a different, still classic Bordeaux wine.

Vivino Leuven #7 
Golden Oldies Pt3

After a white Fieuzal this red from the same vintage was presented by Tom (great choice by the way).

Yes indeed this wine is hitting my sweet spot and a great red to start with, wow what a nose with a lot of green paprika, the same in the palate but after a while also black ripe fruits (cassis, prunes) graphite, wood, leather, some tannins still (good tannins) and a fine full body. Also a wine with a great finish which is really top for such well aged wines!
Rate 3,9⭐️

Thanks to @[1|16864830|David 85] for this halfie! Mature but drinking nicely. Sun dried tomato, cigar box, pencil case, undercurrents of blackcurrants. Powdery, fine tannins and nice freshness. I’d have thought this was about 5 years younger than it is, and given its in a halfie it’s done well. Thanks D&N, enjoying this one on a Monday night.

Opaque ruby red color together with very nice blackcurrant, chocolate, light vanilla, floral boque, and cedar wood. Full-bodid with wonderful taste of blackcurrant, cherry, and bitter-sweet of dark chocolate on the palate. Very good balanced, very nice acidity, soft & smooth tannins, and long & sweet aftettaste. One of my favorite wine.

Getting better with the years! No hint of tapering of whatsoever. Great nose with dark fruit, black cherry, cassis & blackberry even some confit prunes. Absolutely fantastic on the palate - going wide, deep & long. A delight!

Oldy from Bordeaux tasting. Brown hue with med aroma intensity dominated by tertiary notes of aromat, wet sweet tobacco, dried currant and coffee. Or, as @[1|23361992|Erik Veen] describes it: "natte ontbijtkoek uit een directe Sinterklaas surprise"! 😁
Ripe red fruits, soft tannines.

Classic Graves!  Medium garnet with brown edges.  Nice oak on the nose, and Cassis and other ripe dark fruit, plums, leather on the mid palate, soft tannins but good structures throughout!  Beautiful lingering finish.

Review 1994 is Vintage 1994 #VintageCountdown 🎶🎶

A medium red color. Smooth nose of cranberry, leather, earth and spices. "Ahso" opener. Filtered and decanted.

Yummy blueberry, cranberry. On the juicier side, and stick on the finish. I'd say this is at end of its peak.  Varietal: Cabernet sauvignon. Varietal: Cab sauv, Merlot, Cab franc. abv: 11-13%

4.1⭐ 90points

Happy Bordeaux Sunday everyone. My first Pessac-Léognan and very pleased👍🏻. Dark purple in the glass, smoky earthy aromas of oak flowers tobacco chocolate minerals cigar box and black fruit. On the palate blackcurrant plum blackberry vanilla mushroom licorice graphite prune and minerals. Full bodied dense dry and very complex with strong tannins and bold acidity. 2+ hour decant, enjoyed throughout the afternoon and a great pairing with dinner prepared by @[1|10538791|Adele Rubin-Herzenberg]. 
Menu in comments ⬇️⬇️

Classic aged Pessac-Leognan with a great green touch. Cassis, cranberry, mint and gravel on the nose, followed by some tomato stem and green olives. Medium-bodied palate with hints of cherry, blackcurrant, cedar, pepper and liquorice.

👀 still deep purple, with brown rims

Beautiful tawny, ageing, clear. Elegant nose, subdued, resinous. Wet woodland tannins, greenness, harshness. Full body. Long finish. No sweetness. Damson tartness. Quite high acidity. A wine to be accompanied by red meat. Superb austere Graves, not a ripe grape wine. Will age well for another 5 years at least, maybe 10 or 20... €18.80 in Leclerc Caudéran. 13% vol. (No sediment)

6/19: what a fantastic wine! Bottle in perfect shape, filled neck, had it with a quality bbq. Tertiary notes, still some tannines, complex, etc...; all you want from such a wine. Good left bank red at its peak. Blackberries and blackcurrant, forest floor,tobacco, leather and vanilla oak on nose. Smooth acidity and rounded tannins on palate. Medium plus bodied and medium spicy finish. From cellar Nuikki at spring party with friends in Liljendahl.

Beautiful bouquet of dark fruits, black currants, liquorice. Powdery tannins integrated with fruit and acid leading to a persistence and long finish. Maybe not as textured and complex as I would have expected. Will cellar for many more years,

Gorgeous aromas of oaky, plummy blackcurrant with pencil lead and liquorice. Top stuff.

Medium palate which didn’t hold up to the aromas. Still fresh and has time left with blackcurrant, plum, smoky liquorice and mocha. 

Dry finish with medium length. Lingering earthy dark fruits, mocha and liquorice.

Very interesting to try such an aged white wine. The semillon allows it to hold the flavour quite strongly. There is a lot of oak on the palette. Also there is some tertiary: honey and caramel which dominate the primary flavours (that have weakened somewhat with age). Not ‘delicious’, but interesting and complex. 75/100

We’ll structured and balanced Pessac-Leognan with strong, long-lasting notes of black olives, truffle, mocha, blue berries and cassis. Nicely balanced with rounded tannins and medium acidity, a little bit of sweet bitterness on the aftertaste.

Noble Rot Bar w John & Shane 7 of 8

The oldest wine I've drunk didn't present itself w much maturity. Looked 30yrs old. Smelt 20yrs old. Tasted 10yrs old. Felt 5yrs young.

A real head scratcher - in particular the fruit prominence + muscular grip defy belief. Grand w power + poised firmness. Full of black fruit, pine wood, furniture polish, tobacco. Smokey, leady depth. 

After 2hrs in the glass it eventually softened. Wish we would have decanted - but who would have guessed it needed it!?

...when minerals and asceticism bring "joie de vivre". Interesting, intriguing wine. Deep but dry, lively but aged. A good start to a good dinner (especially if starters were left behind by Champagne...)

Decent left bank Bordeaux. 2005 was supposed to be an excellent vintage but even in 2018, this wine is slightly young. Needs decanting for an hour or so and will open up. Complex structure of intense tannins and acid, the fruit is there but not overt in the new world style. Undertones of earth and leather. I’d be interested in trying his again in a couple of years.

This wine is past it's peak. Nice tertiary tones of ceder and coffee in nose, but a rambling acidity no filling and the long aftertaste doesn't help to appreciate the wine due too the acidity lingering on.

This has a good age and drinks lovely after some aerating. Garnet. Oaked red fruits, forest notes. Tight in the beginning but then opens up nicely and displays flavours of blackberry, red plum, sour cherry, cedar, pine cones, med bodied with fine rather greenish tannins, medium length dry charcoal finish

An old and nice Graves with notes of spices, concentrated fruits. We had this one early in the Belgian Vivino tasting but I kept it in my glass till the end of the meeting. But yet after more than two and a half hours this old lady wasn't freed yet of some earthly slightly disturbing flavors.

Dried fruit and other tertiary nuances. Evokes smoky meat marinated in wine. Soft attack, medium bodied, developing a rounded and balanced structure. Soft tannins and good acidity leaving a good length finish of meat, dried fruit and tertiary flavors with a presence of old wood, leather and champignons. It feels a bit tired and declining.

8.3 points; gravel wine, medium bodied, cool refreshing alcohol, medium acidity. Good balance some complexity and length. Still nice to drink, but difficult to say if it will be better with age. 👍👍👌😎🐂🍷🍷

Don’t claim to be a Bordeaux expert, but this wine was a great one to savour both alone and with ribeye steak. 

Almost opaque in glass. Nose of leathery blackcurrant sand ripe plums with some very notable graphite elements too. Palate was not quite so exciting as nose promised but the fruit was still there and the overall structure holds nicely. 

Wonder whether this may be close to peak (although the Somm said this could age 5Y more).

Enjoyed with Mats KL and Alex Ram last night.

I reviewed a half bottle of this a week ago and expressed disappointment at the volatile acidity. I decided to open my second halfie sooner rather than later. This confirms that the other was off as it is very nice.  Intense dark fruit on the palate and  a long finish with well integrated tannins. Need to explore Pessac-Léognan further now.
Herbs, earth, red fruit and tobacco box.  Slightly mineral with a hint of smoke and medium finish.  A good Bordeaux but not great.
Banging
Rusty colour from the age. Wonderfully rich nose with autumn leaves and loam. Less exciting on the palate with dry fruit and prunes. Mild tannins.
Medical and cedar smells. Tastes slightly funky with warm alcohol. Good mouth feel
Nice and round Bordeaux, on the heavier side
Full body, aromatic, great wine

Dark, ruby red in colour. Slow legs. Aroma of vanilla, oak, prunes, black cherry. Acidity is medium. Tannins are balanced and sweet. It is a full-bodied wine. Complex palette with lots of dried and ripe black fruit to start developing into chocolate and prune. The finish is powerful and lasting. A really fantastic Amarone which we enjoyed on its own.

Full-bodied wine with spicy and nuanced taste with barrel character.
Tobacco, licorice, plum and leather on the nose.
Ingredients of raisins, dried cherries, chocolate, pine nuts, orange and vanilla.
Long and delicious aftertaste.

This is a fantastic Amarone and a great value for money in Sweden, where the state run monopoly liquor stores called System Beloget sell it for USD 20. Dark fruit on the nose, with a lot of blackberry and bing cherry on the tongue. The finish is long with a very pleasant hint of chocolate. Full bodied and bold, this wine is all you would want in an Amarone.

This is an excellent bottle, and is good value in my opinion. Dark cherry, light strawberry,black Forrest gateaux and oak on the nose. Smooth, light tannins and very full bodied. Oaky to the taste, mild vanilla and mild plum. It’s very good. I pared it with a pepper heavy dish but that didn’t compliment well at all, however paired with a prawn and tomatoe risotto and it worked a treat. 4.3/4.4

For the eye a ruby red colour with beautiful legs.

For the nose bold and smooth tones of dried black fruits, pepper and vanilla.

For the tongue raisin, chocolate, dried cherry and pine nut.

Stunning aquaintance..
I've tasted this Amarone a few times now and found it consistently good. It has everything you would expect from such s great wine.
Great stuff, bold with some fruit bursting through. Hint of acidity, could be the chilli from dinner,  but very enjoyable.  I like it.
I love amarones and this is very good for the price point. Rich, fruity and leathery. This is a wonderfully rich wine and goes perfect with venison
This wine has the wow-factor. And it opens up above 18 degrees. Tobacco and oak. But also chocolate and dried fruits. Food wine.
Very accessible right out of the bottle with a rich blend of dark fruit. A big wine that goes great with hearty pasta dishes and meat.
Lovely rich Amarone. Made for Liberty Wines and bizarrely their biggest selling bottle in the entire enormous range because of sales to Sweden.

Smooth and round. Orange essence, chocolate, vanilla, some light amphora pots and sandalwood. All blends in very well

Sweet cherries in the mouth, with tobacco and vanilla scents. Some plum skin and light iodine bitter complexities as well. Silky tannins.

Well rounded. Paired with stir fried pork

Spicy, nuanced taste with barrel character, hints of rum raisins, chocolate, dried cherries and vanilla. Served at about 18 ° C for aged hard cheese, or for tasty dishes of beef and game. Not the best Amarone but tastes good anyway.

Fantastic wine. Paired with a classic Italian Bistecca.

Really good Amarone, medium full but one can taste it all around the mouth. Goes with just about anything I can imagine; meat, pasta, cheese etc. One to try!
