This is a lovely juicy, full of flavor wine that I could happily drink every day! Wish I could. Goes especially well with lots of wood fired pizza and steak on a stone! Perfect

Well balanced, quite enjoyable but not the best one. Had it stored in an inconvenient place temperature-wise so it might have affected the rating. Nevertheless a very good and pleasant wine.
Stunning velvety smooth and soft wine. On the sweet side of neutral.
Amazing flavour, fruity but yet quite dry. Deep and full bodied. Packed with sweet sun-dried raisin vanilla wich is balanced of with oak and leather
Lovely dry wine with light tannins and a touch of sweetness with long finish. Nice fig and red fruit flavours.
Rich and complex nose with cherry, raisins, chocolate, prune, lovely balanced palate with a lot of smooth tannins at the end, lingers in the mouth for a ling time, great wine.
Absolute Belter this! Fruity smooth low acidity and nice long finish. Decanted for about 2 hours and enjoyed with lamb and beef dishes. Highly recommend!

Medium red brick color. Long legs. 
Lots of cherries and grapes on the nose. Hints of vanilla as well as tobacco plants. A bit tart, could do at least 5 more years. Still full bodied with a good balance and nice long aftertaste.

Ahh man, what a treat! This Amarone was matured in oak for 18 months before bottling. 70% Corvina Veronese, 25% Rondinella, and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this aromatic Amarone displays bold notes of black cherry, plum, and fruit cake on the nose. Full bodied and rich on to taste with pronounced flavors of cherry, chocolate, vanilla, and coffee lead to a lingering finish. Absolutely stunning, loved it.

One of the "safer Amarones". 4.5 stars. Does not require decanting and can almost be consumed on its own! Spicy flavours improve it as usual but is not a must. Not as complex as many other Amarones,  but at this price: who can complain.

Super find in a clearance bin by me.  Headed off to Sheffield to a BYOB Italian restaurant with friends and this wine went down very well.
2013 vintage so time is on its side but this has already softened.
Deep red, bold dark fruit, plum and blackberries but fresh not jammy, not a concentration overload. This is smooth tannin with a full body, and on this occasion at 15% doesn’t feel like a behemoth.
Drinking very well right now.

A great wine this, and all that is good about amarone. The nose is robust and oaky and hits at the potency of the wine, then as the liquid crosses the different taste buds you get a new sensation. The first flavour is jammy, then giving way to light smoke and vanilla. Tannins are firm but not overpowering making for a smooth, long finish. A really great drink this and one I would fully recommend.

Dark and velvety finish with a hint of armagnac.  Beautiful hints of black pepper, black berries and somewhat spicy palet.  Lingering aftertaste with subtile notes of autumn leaves.  Well accompanied with t-bone steak and parmigana de la melanzane.
Medium bodied with silky tannins. Notes of cherry, raisin, chocolate and vanilla. Not as powerful as I’d like an Amarone to be.
A bit too young perhaps, but full bodied and with lots of dried fruit, cherry, raisins, prune, plum and vanilla. Nice with 🧀
Very good for an Amarone at this price. Beats the competition.
4.0…. Enough said.
Nice Amarone, and good value. A lot of raisin. Had it with lasagne.
Dried plums,  minerals, oak nice amarone with good caracter and less jammy

Amarone has the potential, when the variables in producing it are in harmony, of being the most exquisite wine imaginable, by me at least.  I am a confirmed fan of the wine, and this is one of the finer examples I have tasted.  The only negative I can think of is that I have just two bottles left.

Amarone is Amarone. Just lush and fruity. Good balance of acidity and flavours. The wine lingers on in my mouth for a long time after a zip. Hugely enjoyable. Will purchase again. One of my favourites for now.

Outstanding amarone showing a beautiful perfumed nose; on the palate this wine is very expressive with concentrated notes of ripe black plums, blackberries, dried blueberry, black cherries and hints of chocolate

Ruby red colour. A lot of cherries, plums, oak and vanilla on the nose. Off dry sweetness, medium acidity, high tannins and High alcohol and full body. Pronounced palate with cherries, plums, vanilla and oak. Long lasting finish and overall very good quality!

A very nice Amarone. I'm still liking many Sforzato from Lombardia better because a better balance. However this Amarone has depth of fruit. Clearly lots of raisin, plums, vanilla. I'm adding some of the grade due to my wife's positive review.

3.8⭐ Dark ruby, on the nose dark plum, dark cherries, raisins, spices, some tobacco.

On the palate more of the above, a spicy sting, but quite rounded. The raisins and concentrated fruit stearing the ship of flavors. 

Full body, medium acidity and medium tannins.
Dark red, liquorice nose, good balance of acidity and sweetness/richness. Lovely woodiness and plum, aniseed again. Decent length.

Clear pale ruby colour. Medium intensity aromas of red fruit (cherry, red plum, raspberry). Notes of chocolate, oak, fig, dry fruit.

High alko, medium body, medium+ acidity, medium+ tannin. Underlying  flavours of red and black fruit, dry fruit, oak, chocolate, herbaceous notes also present. Wine is still developing and will improve in 3-5 years time. Decanting is essential!
So smooth with subtle raisins and dried figs
Blackberry & vanilla on the nose. Soft tannins. Dark fruits but not fruity, Cherry but not too much. Bold but not over the top. Goes well with Dianna Krall.
Not really a big fan of Amarone, but this was a pleasant surprise. Good fruit and balance. Even though the wine is young, tannins are not sharp nor unpleasant.

Outstanding

Primary notes of Dark fruits, Black Cherry, Black Plum, Blackberry. Secondary notes of Oak aging, Vanilla, Cedar, Clove, Toast. Tertiary notes of Leather, Earth, Mushroom, Game, Dried Fruit, tobacco. Extremely smooth elegant wine. Can drink now but suitable for further ageing.

Cassis, black cherry, strawberry, almonds, raisins. Hints of oak and vanilla. 

Nice balance and very bold to be so young. On the dry side of amarone and a super deal for the price point. I will buy this again!

Blackcurrant, fig, dried fig, raisin, leather, cigar box, jam, cigar smoke and dark chocolate and frangipani on the nose. Earthy wood, cedar, leather, dried fruit, dried fig, dried apricot, raisin, blackcurrant jam and rhubarb on the palate. 4.25

Really bold and powerful amarone with ripe dark berries, wet grass and horse butt on the nose. A lovely taste of  black cherries, chocolate, tobacco and a hint of brown sugar without being too sweet. Well integrated tannins summarizes this  great Amarone that might gain more over the years.

Tasty and elegant blend in this Amarone. Aroma filled with vanilla, prune and raisins. Full body with plum, dried fruit, oak and vanilla. Subtle touch of licorice at the end. Soft tannins.

Great value wine that works perfect to tasty cheese or the sunday stew.

Looking for a flavor overload? Here you go, everything you could ever expect from a classic Amarone in this price range. Particularly impressed with the herb notes that lingers nicely on top of the vanilla, plum and oak deepness.

(4,0⭐) Vintage 2016.

Amarone Friday! 🇮🇹

Dried fruit, tobacco and vanilla nose.

Rich and full bodied with dark fruits. 🍇
Quite a bit of raisins - typical Amarone.
Skin of dark grapes and sweet licorice.

Alpha Zeta started in 1999 as a cooperation between Liberty Wines and Matt Thompson. 🍇75% Corvina Veronese/Corvinone and 25% Rondinella from vineyards in the Valpantena Valley outside Verona. Aged 18 months in French oak. A medium ruby colour. Aromas of oak, plum, licorice, spices, dark 🍫, vanilla and cherry. On the palate chocolate, cherry 🍒, plum, spices, oak, licorice and smoke. A dry (6 g/l), fruity and spicy Amarone. A med++ body with med+ tannins. A med+ acidity and a med++ 🏁. Paired nice with 🍝.

Very nice Amarone, 4,25⭐️, blend of 70% corvina  veronese, 25% rondinella and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon. Matured 18 months in oak
Dark ruby red with blueish rims
On the nose intense aromas of dark fruit, herbal spiciness, licorice and dried fruit

In the mouth full body, well balanced, silky smooth tannins, 7gr/liter res. sugar but the taste and feel is very dry. Taste of dark fruit, dried cherry, hints of raisin, licorice and thyme

Very good! Excellent pairing with today’s BBQ chuck roll

Tack Felix & Fanny ❤️

Thick soupy mouthfeel with sweet licorice, stewed red fruit, strawberry, black plum, faint earthiness and coffee.
Full-mouth presence with high acids abd well-integrated tannins, some residual sugar in the long pulsating finish. Very good!

3,9. Nose of cherry, red berries and barque (?!). A bit of a punch of red fruits, vanilla, licorice, tobacco, chocolate and prune. Quite dry and some tannins. Could probably be drunk in a few years but still very much enjoyable.

This is still a yong wine with lots of oak. There is a floral note that is difficult to identify, along with dried cherries, prune, and baking spice. It’s slightly unbalanced as the alcohol is hot. Good now, but I think it will get much better as it ages. I would hold for another 10 years.....
Delicious, perfectly balanced fruit and acidity;)
This is a perfect Italian wine. Full of rip cherry’s, notes of dark chocolate, smooth, full bodied and sweet. Everything you want from amarone!

Better than the previous vintage I’ve had but still not on a level with other Amarone wines from traditional producers. 
It’s modern and very full with bags of big plush dark fruits, raisins, leather and sweet, spicy figgy pudding. Don’t get me wrong, this drinks very well but doesn’t have the panache of the options hanging a few rungs higher on the ladder. 
I imagine this would shine with a big roast dinner and lots of friends.

- a really nice Amarone!!!  Deliciously smooth, fruity, tobacco & leathery, vanilla.

Rich opulant devine, darlings.

Had the same wine, bought the same time stored along side each other, earlier this year but it had a hint of Port in both the nose and on the palate, so me thought better have this one before it goes completely. 

But wow, what a difference, this was wonderful like warm black forest cataux without cream, smooth as silk and lingered like Chanel.

Relatively light in colour, the nose gives a strong note of dried fig and raisin (unsurprisingly!). 

Quite hot and spicy on the palate with notes of clove. Good acidity and fine silky tannin at the front of the mouth. 

Certainly bittersweet!

My second amarone. Big fan of this style. Dark maroon, inky.  Nose initially showed vanilla bean and raisin. Savoury, mint, spices, chewy tannins, dark stewed fruit. a lot of power. Quite hot. Not the dance party of fruit like the first amarone I had the pleasure of tasting but an interesting drop

As you would expect from Amarone some raisiny, sweet notes on the nose, with loads of ripe dark fruit through the mid palate.  I typically enjoy a more tannic finish, but this has wonderful balance.  I wish I had had a proper meal with this to truly appreciate it, but even on its own it was quite delicious.

Deep ruby hue and  lovely clean nose of prunes with a hint of spicy vanilla underlying it .....incredibly smooth and well balanced for tannin  with blackberries, prunes and black pepper predominating in a slighly smokey lingering finish.

Deep and intense on the nose with perfumes of dried cherries and blueberries, with notes of spiced autumn fruit compote. On the palate it is powerful but modern, with a lovely balance of ripe tannins and spiced, concentrated savoury cherry fruit character. A touch of woodsmoke completes the long finish.

Decided to open a 2007 Amarone, being afraid it otherwise would become too late. It turned out to still be alive. Acidity medium to medium low. Mature, almost overripe, dark fruit, prunes, plums, and slightly raisins to the palate. A bit on the heavy side but nevertheless a nice drinking experience. My rating 88

Heavy spicy nose with plenty of nose tingling alcohol. Viola, oak & light vanilla. Soft held back fast with plenty of viola, oak and a hint of liquorice. Soft full body. Lingering raisin finish. Demanding but very nice.

UGC Bordeaux Tasting 2020

Graves are turning out nice wines in 2017, this one is no exception, deep burgundy color, nose smells of cassis, blackberry, plum, hibiscus, earth, clove, cacao, licorice, sandalwood and star anise, medium to full body with balanced acidity and refined tannin, tastes of blackberry, blackcurrant, rhubarb, tobacco, dark chocolate, licorice, cinnamon and mineral, elegant and smooth finish, short term cellaring will be extremely rewarding.

Deep ruby , nose of hibiscus, cassis and toasted cocoa, blackberry, cherry, clove, earthy minerals, tobacco, juicy acidity and dry still tight tannins. Long mineral bitter chocolate finish. 4⭐ I'd like to try a better vintage cause this was good, spicy more like a Rhône...Bordécembre #43 Couldn't find a Bordeaux Cremant in time for New Years cheers, blessings in 2022 to each and all !🙌

From the typical gravel soils of Leognan. A 13% blend of CS, CF & Me. Ruby red tending to garnet. Lots of black fruits come straight to the nose followed by a subtle and elegant complexity with hints of licorice, vanilla and graphite.
Dry, high but well balanced acidity, round tannins and medium bodied make it very easy to drink. Pleasant fruity finish.
I paired it with tapas

3.8
The 2017 has a little more Cabernet sauvignon due to the frost that affected the 2017 season. So this medium full bodied Pessac-Léognan is made with 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot, 3% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc.
In the glass, it had a deep almandine garnet red color and delivered aromas of blackberry, leather and tobacco. 
The palate had high tannins, medium high acidity with the berry flavors nicely lasting. 
I tasted it during the Union des Grands Crus de Bordeaux event held in Montréal.
blackcurrant cassis vanilla cherry pepper raspberry strawberry strawberry jam medium bodied soft smooth blend
Bold and dry. Attractive aroma of blackfruids and earth. Vote 3.8

OUTSTANDING. Powerful yet soft and refined.  Alot of pleasant vanilla on the nose with ripe jammy black fruits , plum and blackberry jam . Cinnamon , baking spices , a little nutmeg and liquorice. Smooth and round.  Delicious.

Although they lost 30-50% of their crop due to frost, the 2017 wine hast turned out to be one of the best red Graves shown at the En Primeurs. With 65% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Merlot in the Grand Vin, it received high marks from the critics. Lovely, concentrated nose, with great freshness. On the palate round and full, with great complexity. Ripe tannins, leading to a long finish.
Delicious fruit, light and lots of character.  Wife loves it

Bordeaux catch up notes. A Graves Cru Classé for both red & white, this blends 53/40/4/3 Cab Sauv/Merlot/Cab Franc/Petit Verdot & is aged in 80% new oak.

Deep purple. Pronounced aroma intensity, generous & fleshy w. rich blackcurrant, black cherry & creamy plum. Blueberry, violet, damson & toasty vanilla. Cocoa & liquorice. Youthful.

Dry. Rich, soft & plush w. black cherry, plum, blackcurrant & creamy vanilla oak. The m+ tannins are soft, high acid & m+ alc. Full bodied yet elegant w. a long finish. Yum.
BLIND: tangerine, mineral, candied orange, creme brûlé, buttered croissant. Mineral, sapid, salt. Tingly acidity. Med+ acidity. Very good!
Drank w Drew and Torey
Lemon and cinnamon flavours

93 Points, drink now until 2030. Deep ruby with purple aspects, no rims. Profound nose of black berries and cherry, bitter almond and chocolate, hazelnut and tobacco, spices and vanilla. Great balance, ripe and polished tannins, well integrated acidity. Of course not fully mature and on the way up, probably ideal to pull the cork between 2024 and 2028. Finishing medium plus.

Château Malartic-Lagravière is one of the only six classified growths both for its red and white in Bordeaux. A blend of 53% Cab Sauv, 35% Merlot, 7% Petit Verdot & 5% Cab Franc, aged 18 months in French oak, 80% new. Rich and dark with berry aromas, complex and enticing. On the palate perfectly ripe blackberry and cherry with earthy dried herbs, some cacao and toasty spice. Fine dusty tannins, well balanced with acidity building to a great finish. Very special.
Fruit bomb- black currant, cassis, blackberry, licorice, grippy tannin, full bodied, med alcohol. Nice to drink now but saving the rest for a few years
BM @Carl 10: still an infant but very promising. Asked some time to open up and the tannins still need to fuse, but the are we'll supported by fruit and matter.
Rich texture, fine tannins with notes of blackcurrant, black plum, licorice, graphite. Long and nice finish. 9,3 PM
Fantastic wine, so refined with perfect structure. The fruit notes took a bit of time to show, with a little more aging this could be a 5 star bottle. Oak, blackberry, smooth long finish.
Powerful and elegant Pessac. High complexity, opens up with a mouthful of fruit, blackberry and blueberry, and develops into a lasting oak and vanilla. Very well balanced.
Clear purple to deep red.  Aroma of stone, some fig - but not a lot of fruit.  Medium intensity, medium body, dry.  Flavors of black currant, cherry, fig.  Round tannins.
Bright glossy blood red transparent.  Elegant delicate florals on the nose. Elegant silky mouth feel delicate mixed black fruit.  Lovely vibrant acidity and freshness. 4.25 Stars
Fantastic Deep and balanced, nice notes of red fruit, leather and oak vanilla. Can ripe some more years. Intense and complex, balanced.

This 2016 Malartic Lagraviere from Passac-Leognon has beautiful purple color and is smooth and balanced.  Aromas include oak, vanilla, blackberry, cherry, leather, plum, licorice and blackcurrant.  Tannin, acidic, sweetness and alcohol content are just at right balance.  Dry, rich, elegant, medium to full bodied.  Opened on 8/26/2022 and enjoyed with my lovely wife.

Happy Bordeaux Sunday- Ma🛴artic 🛴agravière from Pessac-🛴eognan, one of my favorite AOCs! One of just 6 Bdx Chateau that are GC for white and red. Certified “Haute Valeur Environmental.” Warm vintage with wet spring but perfect fall- ripe tannins and good acidity. 
57% CS/36% M/4% PV/3%CF, 20 mos on fine lees in 70% NFO, Michel Rolland consulting enologist. 
Deep opaque ruby purple, magenta rim. 
👃 Cassis, black cherry 🍒 blueberry 🫐 charcoal, fine lamb leather, violets.

But this 2005 is an impeccable and elegant beauty to drink even now.
Rich and dense. Super rich in dark blackberries and cassis.  Medium body and moderate tannin.

Left bank Bordeaux. Deep purple with translucent, electric ruby edges. Elegant dark fruit bouquet opens up to floral aromas, wet leather, river stones, smoke and raisins. Round and silky in the mouth, with big blackberry, black cherry, cassis, licorice and violet notes. Nicely dry. After breathing it really shines.
Raclette does go with a heavy red and a faint heart
Really like this now. Is only going to get better with age. It’s more sav Blanc tasting than some white Bordeaux. I’m guessing more sav Blanc than semillon.
Wow.  Another great bottle.  Surprises each time.  Such value to quality ratio.  Red brandied cherries.  Left open, in bottle on counter overnight...even better now
Your classic Bordeaux wine. The bouquet is a cellar nose. Deep colors, dark fruit characteristics. Perfect acidity. What more can you say. A wonderful second growth

Clove, nutmeg mixed with dark berries

Deep dark red. Delicious aroma, a little sweetness, ripe fruit, forest floor and spicy notes. 
Velvet soft on the palate, dark berries, peppers with a long finish..

92 the smell is very promissing: complex, powerful etc. When we get to the taste, its good. WS 91, RP 92

At 7 years young this is already eminently drinkable. Amazing nose within minutes of uncorking. Intense red fruit with a distinct nuttiness and a hint of chocolate. The palate developed from intense blackberry, blackcurrant and plum thru cassis and then a palette of leather, chocolate, graphite even, and a light smokiness. Tannins are so smooth they’re not real at this age. The endless finish might also be an indication of how long this vintage will last. One to follow for the next 15-20 years?

Grapes: Marlot 45%+ Cabernet Sau. 45% + Cab Franc and Petit verdot
Barrique (75% new).
Excellent and complex at nose: red fruit, wax, plum, jam, blood, leather.
In mouth it is perfectly balanced, the acidity is in a perfect proportion with softness, silky tannins with an elegant texture, smokey notes, round with a long and fruity persistency.
Perfect for ageing.

Three hour double decant. Very deep garnet magenta color. Chalk, marshmallow, raspberry, persimmon, and graphite on the nose. Smooth, dry palate, with good acidity. Firm tannins on the longish finish.

No notes - just few words.
Bright cherry with dark/red berries and spices are in aroma. 
Strong tannins, too young taste with good color and bitterness.

This already shows a great structure, plenty of spices and some smoke. Lovely grippy tannins, good concentration, an impression of hidden layers. Anticipate at least 5 years before ready to drink.

90+/100

A slightly high-pitched style, with a mix of red currant and raspberry fruit laced with rooibos tea and blood orange notes. A good snap of licorice adds weight on the finish, showing a flash of tar. Has sneaky depth and should evolve well in the cellar. Drink from 2025.
Cherry and leather nose. High tannins but fine tannins. Medium-high acidity. Medium-full body. Tart cherry with a light leather and licorice. 3.8⭐️ fruity and juicy.
Paid 67. Big blackberry and cassis flavors with silky texture. Nice acidity, medium full body and long finish. Good structure. Very enjoyable. 93 points.
2005 in 2022. Nose: very little, closed, sweat. Palate: great acid, tertiary notes, a little thin. Had it at the Toronto Vintner’s Club Bordeaux event. It ranked 8/8
Blackberry, black cherry, blueberry, nuances of lavender and burnt basil, and a smokey savory finish with sticky umami and tannic characteristics. 92 Points.
Medium ruby. Nose with notes of plum, kumquat, clove and anise. Medium-low acidity with a light finish. Notes of blackberry, pepper and light leather.
High tannin high acid but smooth baby with black fruit, oak herbaceous notes, and some citrus fruit flavors. Great Grand Cru Classé!
Astonishing wine, black fruit, leather, earthy, mediu to full body, round tannins,  light spices and smoke. Great finish
Outstanding. Deep ruby color and full body. Fleshy and bold. blackberry, cassis, vanilla, licorice, herb. Need more aging.
91/92 point

Nice

Very complex and tasteful wine. Dry. Delicate, but not very strong nose. But the taste! A lot of it! Rather long aftertaste. Oak, spicy, black berries. Priceworthy...? Maybe not, but highly recommended!

Deep Bordeaux red with a subtle orange ring. Dry. Medium-bodied. Well integrated tannins. On the nose very light tobacco, black tea, bay leaf, licorice, coconut. The taste is full of berries, blackberry, blackcurrant, red currant, cherry. A very nice strong finish. Enjoyed it on its own.

Smooth as a baby's bum! It took a while to get going but once opened it was a really so smooth but while also griping you. The jam aspects from the Merlot and the vegetal Cab Sav really went well together and its clear this is made by real professionals as 2014 is supposedly an "off year".

(barrel sample tasted May 2021 – ****)
Good wine for its price level. Cherries, blackcurrant, blueberry, brambles, some plums. Creamy. Balanced. Good freshness. Earth and chocolate. Hazelnut and mocca.

4.3/5.0 
Wonderful the Left Bank Bordeaux. Ripe black berries, earthy, black cherry, blackcurrant, plum, tobacco leaf, oak. Rounded med. + tannins.

4.25 stars. Very elegant, well balanced wine. Very vibrant, with good acidity. Seems to have a mineralogy to it as well as. normal Bordeaux descriptors. I think it could have used another 2-4 years, but was still quite delicious.

Deep garnet. Blend of 45% cab sauv, 45% Merlot, 8% cab franc and 2% Petit verdot. Medium intensity in the nose. Black cherry, black raspberry, black currant, chocolate, meat forest floor. Dry, medium.acidity, medium tannins, medium alcohol, full bodied, pronounced flavor. Smokey, spicy, black cherry, and meat. Medium finish. Outstanding quality of wine. 

18 months in French oak.

It has been about two years since I last had this vintage from this great producer about two years ago and time has been nothing but kind to it. Garnet and opaque. Nose is a duel of cigar box, leather, cassis and dark flowers. Medium plus body with medium plus acidity. Palate is on the dry side, lots of leather, tobacco, mushroom with some black olive and black licorice at the edge. Not the greatest vintage but a great prodcuer always finds a way. Super now and will improve for 2-3 years. Splendid. 4.4

Very nice red brought by friends tonight, which we decanted given short opening time. Dark on the color and relatively bold, it would match meat the best (as @[1|38495370|fai C] reminds us).
It started with some degrees of greenish to the palate, that's why I was thinking raspberries at first. But then it was obviously blackberries, surrounded by vanilla almost chocolate, and spicy leather.
Medium length to a mid complex finish. Certainly value for money, given young age.

Fresh bouquet of earth, dark fruit and wood. Medium bodied. Smooth and easy palate. Notes of oak, leather and smoke with aromas of red fruit. Nice, integrated acidity. Well balanced elements. Soft finish with chewy tannins.

Purple color, perfumed aromas: cigar box upfront followed by plum, blackberry, fig, strawberry, white pepper. 

Rounded full bodied wine, already well balanced with supple tannins, very moderate acidity and bold ripe black fruits.
vanilla vanilla blackcurrant oak leather cassis smoke on the nose well balance firm tannins not strong  leather tobacco oak vanilla cassis toast on the palate medium+ finish
Good strong nose with cedar, leather, mushroom, black cherry, black pepper and smoke. Full bodied with high acidity and a good finish.
Leather and tobacco, musty and rustic tannins and very little fruit and sweetness remain, despite this it still achieves balance.
Powerful and fine nose with red fruits (strawberry) and plumb aspects. Touch of réglisse with strong and already smooth tannins. Awesome!
Intense enough yet very well balanced, beautiful nose, rounded palate with very pleasant tanin and long lasting aftertaste. I did enjoy it very much.

A refreshing wine of Semillon blend mainly composed of Sauvignon Blanc. It has a classical taste in a pleasant harmony of herbal and barrel scents.

After having tried 2011 and 2012 a few months ago, this 2014 confirms the consistent quality of this château. Complex aromas of ripe dark (and some red) fruit, plums, chicory, coffee, sweet spices, toasted oak, chocolate, vanilla, underwood and tobacco. Full bodied with medium(+) smooth tannins, balanced acidity and a lengthy finish.

Light and clear golden robe. The nose is fresh and generous, lime, gooseberries, grassy notes, tropical fruits (papaya, mango). When drinking, the wine is dominated by a nice starting acidity, complemented by the fruits and a rich minerality. Medium body, had it with hokkigai and.a.green peas preparation, very good match!

Super nice Bordeaux blend this one.  Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc & Petit Verdot. Deep ruby  garnet in color. Berry, cherry and currant fruits backed up by spices and a long finish with nice hints of  tobacco. The wood aging is really there, ads texture and richness.

Deep ruby color. Developing bouquet with dark fruit such as black currant along with damp earth, vanilla, toast and cedar. Dry, medium-plus acidity and full, smooth tannins. The flavor consists of black currant, licorice, black cherry and cinnamon. Full-bodied with a lingering finish.

Dense purple-red color in the glass! On the nose fine scent of blackberries and blackcurrants as well as some plum! On the palate quite full with round tannins and a very long and persistent finish! Cheers!

Château Malartic-Lagravière Pessac-Léognan 2016 is a youthfully complex red Bordeaux that needs more time in the bottle for full appreciation while it still offers good balance and intensity. Sniffing it brings out black currant, blackberry, vanilla, tobacco, cocoa, wet earth, and smoke, which comes through on the palate along with the high tannins. The wine pairs brilliantly with a medium rare ribeye served with a foie gras bordelaise sauce, as tannin and flavors complements the dish. Exquisite!

A gourmand Pessac, full-bodied and well structured. Generous red fruits, with notes of nicely oaked vanilla. Sugared spices. Persistent finish. A pure pleasure. 

Pricing doesn’t share too much value with the consumer though...

Black pepper nose with subtle fruit aromas after that. Pepper and spice throughout. Medium plus to full body with big, grippy tannins. The finish is long and very dry. Packed with nice aromas and big flavors. Paired well with hard cheeses. I’d go 4.1 or 4.2 on this one. Very good! Tried at a big Bordeaux tasting I attended. Cheers! 🥂 🍷

Very good consistent finesse

Polished offering, sweet aromas of flowers, plum, raspberry vanilla, tobacco and cedar. Lush mouthfeel of smooth tone tannins, offering a full lingering finale. Good value and style, elegant!

4.0☆ delicious, stylish luscious!

4.2 stars. Tasted this again and wow! Great balance. Light on entry but then packs a beautifully medium-bodied and structured melange of black and red currant fruits.

earthy minerals dark fruit toast nutty. Excellent deep red Grave. As others have mentioned, decant an hour or more before drinking. Perfect with strong red meats. One of the best wines I’ve had in the past several years.

The wine is open and approachable. Medium ruby in color, medium+ intensity, aroma of strawberry, red berries, herbaceous, with pencil lead. Medium bodied with grippy tannin. The finish is medium. The wine can be aged for another 5 years.

Considering the 2013 vintage is the lowest rated of the last 15 years this is still impressively delicious. The aromas of blackberry, oak and forest floor are richly layered and the flavours don't disappoint. I would advise waiting another year at least and open/decant 3 hours in advance if you can't wait. Beautifully balanced acidity with teeth gripping tannins, this wine will get better and better for decades to come.
High acidity and a lot of tannins and very fruity with long taste. It’s a compact wine with a lot of cassis and dark dry fruit also with coffe and chocolates.
Solid Pessac Leognan. Lots of dark fruit, blackcurrant and cassis. Some cranberry into almost fig. Vanilla from oak. Good, but not spectacular for the price point

Long finish.

Clear and brilliant 
Grassy nose in check here and not overpowering the flinty and fruity tones
Well balanced, brilliant acidity 
Fresh and delicious

First impression, dark unsweetened bakers, cherries, leather, chocolate, espresso, cranberries,  the nose is perfumey with cotton and baby powder and fresh baked bread.  Should open beautiful over the next 2 hours.
The holidays were tasty this year... Nice blend of old world earthy flavors with new world bold finish.
Finally a Bordeaux wine with style, the fame worthy. Varied flavours of fruit, herbs, ink, cacao, tobacco. Complex wine in perfect balance, nice and tasty. Cleverly made. Great wine.

I drank it on my 53 birthday celebration.
1989 vintage.
Very fresh,cellar,tertiary imponent flavor.
rich, intensive aromas of chocolate, blackberry and black cherry. Very dark color. Mouth on plum, silky, round. after taste very balanced with soft tannins. Very good length. Excellent bottle.
Happy new year!!! all the best for 2021. enjoying this great bottle of wine. notes of  oak blackberry leather
91 pts really good! Plum, tobacco, smoke, currant, and plum. Classic Pessac. Earthy mushrooms and vanilla. Pencil shavings.. Still very vibrant. Medium bodied, with bite and muscles.
A very floral and fruity wine. Great for drinking now. Definitely in its drinking window. Full of blackberry and cassis flavours. You can smell the tobacco and cedar in this wine.
Black currant and darker fruits with minerals. Really liked it after it opened for quite some time.   Paid $60 and definitely worth that price.
Favorite Bordeaux Red so far
Pretty nose of floral and nectar. Medium heavy body with silky smooth tannin.  A very fruity palate full sweetness. As I usually have St. Emilion, this Graves is distinctively different in style.
Purple to dark red color. Taste of black fruit. Young but still a very good wine.
1st growth, extremely tasty but not worth the $ in my opinion.   Smooth, tasty.   85% Sauvignon 35% semillion.  Aged in oak 12 months

🎯 90/100 pts  4.1 ⭐️ 

🇫🇷 Happy Bordeaux Sunday 🇫🇷 

🍷 From «Bordeauxmessen 2021» in Oslo last Friday. No time for tasting note.
Bold and Smooth with a complex oak and berry notes. Haven't tried though side by side with the 2018 and 19 but this 2016 deserves to be a classic.
Wonderful nose full of fruit and earth and oak. Extremely balanced mouth with rounded tannins and a nice balance of fruit and earth. One of the first Bordeaux of wines I have really loved
Dark ruby red color. Great pairing with meat. Not a lot of fruit smells. Aroma of earthy, leather, vanilla, oak and gravel.
Fantastico. Needs some age. Garden herbs and tart cherry. Great concentration and a finish that lasts and lasts

Smell: mouth watering sour candy
Taste: sour cherry, red currant, slightly woody, plum
Color: plum color
Dreamy Blackcurrant velvet. A beautiful wine with excellent tannic structure, silky smooth and heaps of festive spice. Very nice indeed. Chin chin!
Excellent Pessac. Cassis, forest fruits, eucalyptus, licorice, rosemary, pepper, earthy and tobacco. Medium + body, medium acidity and tannins. Rounded and tasteful. Lovely finish.
Lots of sediment.  Fruity aroma with hints of banana.  Complex flavor and aroma.  Smooth and sweet.  Tastes better than it smells.  Long, delicious finish.  Very good, but expensive.
Magnum bottle had at 2019-vintage-Bordeaux-Dinner in Oslo.

Magnum. Solid 🇫🇷 🍷 

🔴: ruby
😶: oak blackberry leather plum smoke
😋🍇🖊🍽💶: N/A
Strong, peppery taste. Delicious, better structure and complex. Excellent wine. Had this in dec 2014. A few more years will harness the taste as the alcohol dilutes further.
An intense aroma of violet forest floor clove and dark fruits of cassis and plums. Perfect balance on everything and what a bordaeux wine should be.
Very nice classic Bordeaux, full bodied with a medium finish. Dark fruit, vanilla and tobacco. Very nice sweet and round tannines

What a nice surprise! It was way above expectation. 

Dark ruby color. Seductive aroma of cedar, blackcurrant, smoke leather. Full bodied. SILKY tannin. Performed way beyond its price tag.
4.3 I could have given this another decade to mature, but still a beautifully structured wine.
Chocolate, plum, medium high tannins and acidity
Drank in 2022. Short drinking window, can't hold up. No complexity, left with the old oak and faint black fruit. Tannins are gone, acid is high, finish probably rate it as m-
This 2014 is even better with the years...
top
Not usually a huge fan of White Bordeaux, but this was splendid surprise. Funky and unique, a classic savory French wine.
Amazingly approachable for a 2015!
Very fruit forward on the nose rich berry characteristics, coffee and chocolate. Palate is a little short, tannins are a little too young and need time. Hold for a few years.
Big french cab based grape .. beautiful color. Soft tannins, fruit forward.. which isn’t my style, needs time or just more complex earthy tones , plum, light acidic, blackberry.
This is a rating of the kosher version.   Good Bordeaux, though nothing special.  Expensive for what it is, but still one of the best kosher wines.  A little young to open now.
Good wine. A little sharp. Bold. Oaky but something slightly not exactly lovable with this first taste. I think this bottle may be slightly off. Only a 3.5 and I’d expect it to be a 4.
Another very well made Pessac Leognan with bold fruit, black currant, cassis and ripe cherry, well made and on the palate earthy feel with good structure and long finish.
EP sample. Dark garnet. Fragrant nose of dark fruits and rose petals. Palate is confident and relaxed, unforced, dark and red fruits combination, perfumed, balanced, very long
Really 4.5 stars but only because I drank it too early so it’s not the wine’s fault. Even so, it’s nearly flawless. Complex, structured tannins, spicy, full-bodied, rhubarb, and blackberry.
The nose is butter and wildflowers and the tiniest hint of cinnamon. The taste is a lot like the nose but has this delicious leathery long finish. Can’t even wait to serve this to my daughter.
Dark red. Dark fruit, leather and oak on the nose. Blackcurrent, blue plums and mocca on the palate. Full body and powerful fruit. Dry tannins but quite well balanced. Complex with a lovely finish

Red and dark fruits, earthy, oaky, leather. Your typical Bordeaux style.

On the palate, a bit too acidic for my liking, which was more offensive than mouth watering. 

Price tag is steep for the quality in this bottle.
7/23/2022: Sunday family dinner of roasted pork tenderloin. This wine is so balanced. Long, lingering silky finish. Such a nice compliment to food. Worth the wait and want more.
Red currant red cherry oak vanilla pepper bell pepper chocolate hint of forrest floor. Dry medium+ acidity and length medium tannin body alcohol intensity
Excellent claret from an average year. Drinking nicely now but should continue to improve. Huge nose, medium wine with a decent finish. Priced sensibly
Light straw colour. Black currant leaves, yellow apple, wet stone, gooseberry and oak nose. Full bodied intense palate following the nose with a long acidic finish

Slight brick red rim, but still fairly young in appearance. Nose is of mint, cassis, black currant leaf and graphite. Palate is indestructible... belting acid, juicy tannins and abundant fruit. Black currant, black berries... predominant, but also some tertiary notes. Length is incredible. Great example of classy pessac-leognan, which should age at least another 15 years!

This wine is still a few years off showing it’s true flavours but it is definitely got blackberry undertones with a slight tobacco finish, I think the fruit will soften over time but not sure about that finish.
I still have 3 bottles left so let’s see what s further year will do.

very good with strong complexity with primary secondary and tertieraly notes and well balanced structure of acidiy and tannins offsetting the high alcohol. lack of tertiary vibrancy and high alcohol detracts from outstanding. can continue to develop in bottle.
med garnet. pronounced intensity black plum ripe black cherry ripe blackcurrant blueberry vanilla cedar liqouirce coffee tobacco coffee. dry m+ intensity m+ acidty m+ ripe fine grain tannins h alch f body long finish. ripe black fruit a little muted

Very deep purple. Elegant and intense nose with blackberry and licorice aromas. Medium-full body. Very good freshness. Lots of depth and concentration. Very fine, ripe tannins. This is velvety, stylish and finely balanced. Long and chocolatey finish.

Clear, medium ruby with garnet rim; clean nose, medium(+) intensity plum, leather, pencil, cedar; dry, medium(+) acidity, medium tannin, medium alcohol and body, medium(+) length with graphite finish.

The soil: well-drained gravels and clay gravels on shelly limestone and clay subsoil.
The grapes: M CS CF PV
The color: Dark blend of red pink n purple shade.
The taste: Strawberry raspberry powerful n long fruity spicy finish.
Quite outstanding!

Wine is clear, brightness is day bright, pale straw color, edge is water color, no gas, no sediment, viscosity is moderate +.
Aroma is clean, lemon jest, white fresh peach, lychee, stone fruit, white flower, acacia, mineral, smooth oak aroma.
Dry, medium + body, high acidity, medium alcohol, long finish, complexity is moderate +.

A noble well-made wine, still enjoyable despite its 34 years. Cork in perfect condition, not decanted. Small amounts of sediments. Tertiary aromas emerge from the glass: mushrooms, forest floor, old furniture and leather along with ripe red fruit. Dry, elegant, balanced and round. Medium bodied, medium plus acidity with well-integrated tannins. Smoky and toasty flavors over currant and cherry fruit, Supple and long lasting finish. 4.25/5

Nose has stewed tomato and rhubarb with a light whiff of sweet vanilla. Palate is very silky smooth and with super ripe tomato and red currant. This has plenty of life in it still and will easily go on for another 10yrs. 93/94

Beautiful dark and tick colour. Dark red. Nose a bit close but powerful and fresh. Balanced with a bit of tanin remaining in the mouth. Red fruits with a more matured finish. Could probably wait a couple of years in the cellar. Still young!! Amazing 2000 vintage!

Dark opaque purple on the look with barely any sign of aging.
Mixed of dark and red fruits with tiny hint of lead pencil typical of left bank on the nose.
Dark plums, cassis, chocolaty,earth spices with barely noticeable tannin. Medium to full bodied, this wine is, opulent and with sublime elegance and balance.The most noticeable trait of this wine is the silky smoothness , rich yet light on its feet character classical of Pessac Leognan-as per what Robert Parker has said.What a wine with amazing QPR!

Dry leather, tea leaves and strawberry essence at first, developing into a darker stew of confit and damp forest. Keeps evolving, but maybe a touch over the hill. Actually 4 stars but the extra half goes to the fact that you can find this landmark 82 at a pretty cheap deal these days.

4.3 - spectacular wine. Black fruit and oak on the nose. On the palate a lot of oak, smoke, tobacco, chocolate, red fruit, violet… very subtle wine, many layers, mellow tanins superbly integrated, lightly silky, perfect acidity, superbly balanced…. A gréât gréât Pessac…

What a great sensation to discover this Pesach-Léognan. This vintage was known by its hot summer. So one would-be expect low acidity. I was well surprises by the flavours and the taste of this old wine! Great sensation.

Cleaning the Bordeaux corner of my Wine cabinet. The blend is Cabernet, Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Merlot. Deep red color. On the nose ripe red fruits as blackberry and dark plum. On the palate: Almost full-bodied, soft and round. It melts on your tongue. A marvelous integration of tastes from the dark fruit, tannins, oak and vanilla. I have not recorded the price. But you can buy the 2013 vintage for 450 N.kr. at the state retail monopoly. An exceptional wine.

4.3 ⭐️ 

Cheers my friends

This equal blend of CS and merlot with some CF and PV (45/45/8/2) had a complex nose of blueberries, cassis, flowers, clay and oak. Medium+ bodied, dry, velvety, perfectly balance, it had primarily flavors of bell peppers with a long finish of black cherries and peppery notes.
Succulent.

From de Malartic (1803) through Mme Ricard-Ridoret-Marly to Laurent Perrier (1990) to Bonnie family since 1997; Michel Rolland-Thanos Fakorellis consultants. Gravity filled tanks. 

45M 45CB 8CF 2PV. 

Medium deep red color. Soft, elegant wine, rich and intense, with depth and complexity. Licorice, leather, black 🍒 liqueur,
and graphite. Silky tannins. 

A thoroughly enjoyable, easily drinkable wine, with many good vintages. 

Bordeaux Left Bank Blind Tasting 2:6. 

Recognized Graves, with some help!

RP95. Medium red with brown rim. Nose of red current, cherry, and black current. Initial attack is very sweet, followed by bitter dark chocolate, chalky grippy texture in the palate, layered with fruits, prune, crushed plum flavors in the finish. A very evolving and interesting wine to have.

Dried violet, cassis, dried plum, blackberry, black cherry, lots of tannic grip, but immense concentration. Tree bark, a hint of soy, burnt orange peel, cocoa powder, leather, forest floor. Power stay long into the finish, with a strong sense of minerality, as well.

Really nice balance to this Graves grand cru. Smooth, full bodied, ready to drink now but it’s acidity and light tannins will preserve it for another few years. The initial nose reveals the barrel aging with hints of vanilla and develop into dark fruit, plum and a little venison. Enjoy!

I have enjoyed each and every bottle of the case! Structured and concentrated. Deep ruby colour, Ripe black cherry, blackberry, cassis, oak, smoky and leathery, graphite smooth tannins, medium to full body. The wine is relatively firm with the black fruit, but also smooth and light. Beautiful vintage.

Bordeaux 10 year review number 18/50

Rich, very blackberry nose. Cassis, blackberries, black cherries, milk chocolate, malt, tar and oak with great roasted aromas on the creamy palate.
Very dense and round, medium to full bodied, fine-grained tannins and well integrated acidic structure. Herbal, very long lasting blackberry finish ending in a delicate bitter note. My rising star on Pessac sky! Absolutely recommendable since 2009. Same level as SHL or Haut Bailly for much less money (67 💰 en primeur) Great😍

In line previous tasting, wine is evolving well and may be in its peak drinking period.
👁️: Deep Garnet
👃: Medium(+) intensity flavours of blackberry, blueberry, smoke, blackberry jam, leather, ceddar. 
👄: Dry with high acidity, medium tannins, medium alcohol, full body and long length.
⏳: Can drink now and in the next 5 years
💲: Value for money, 3.5/5 (40 CHF

Italy-Spain-France Wine Tour (day 13) dinner in Paris. Last meal in France, took sommelier’s advice for this big Bordeaux to match with steak tartar and frites. Opened a bit dry, but evolved beautifully with touches of caramel, brown sugar infused fruit, tobacco, coconut, cherry, elegantly aged tannins

Delightful and robust, a wonderful Bordeaux. Cracked this open on my birthday, and right out of the bottle the nose was floral with a hint of black currant, and it was beautifully balanced on my palate and the finish was excellent too. Will be decanting this for 2 hours before I provide more notes 🇫🇷 Cheers!

Very good quality and price. Clear, inky ruby. Clean, highly aromatic with blackberry, plum, gravel, cocoa and leather. Dry, high acidity, high tannins, full body and long finish. Notes of violet. Well balanced, complex and outstanding quality. NYWE.

We have been cellaring this thinking it was a lower caliber of wine; however, we just did a double-take (gasp) when we realized this is not a regular Tuesday-kinda-wine! 
Wowza!
L bank Bordeaux, tasting fine at 11 years of age.
59% CS, 38% Merlot, 3% PV.
Nose and palate both show dark fruit, cassis, chocolate, cherry, beautiful oak and great acidity. 

A pretty pleasing wine. 

PS: We need to work on our cellaring system; Nonetheless, a happy surprise. 
Happy Days, Vivino Folks 🍷 🍷

Clear, medium, ruby. Clean, medium + aromas of black currant, dark chocolate, smoke, cedar, blackberry, hint of violet, meaty, pine, black currant leaf. Developing. On the palate, dry, high acid, medium + body, high alcohol, high tannin. Medium + intense flavors of green, herbaceous notes. Medium + finish. Quality of the wine is very good. Can drink now, but has potential for further ageing.

4.4 Clear, medium ruby with no bricking at rim.

Lovely aromas of sweet red cherry, red plum, kirsch, truffle, earth, pepper and meat.

Refined tannins -- present but smooth. Excellent acidity shows persistence through the mid-palate. Alcohol is well-integrated.

Flavours of cherries jubilee, vanilla, black truffle and spicy black pepper.

This is in a great spot. Drink now to 2027.

Not so elegant nose, a bit unfresh, not the blackcurrant and cedar wood type; improved with air. But in the mouth this one “exploded”. Very dense, very concentrated, lots of extract. Complexity, long and integrated tannins, great length.

2005 Bordeaux tasting. All wines tasted blind. 4.3 musty, dark fruit, cedar, old leather, tar and gravel for n the nose. Huge tannins on the palate that kept the fruit in the background for the duration of my sample. I wish I had a bottled of this to give a proper decant. Amazing acidity keeps everything moving nicely towards the dark, damp and spicy finish. Going very strong. Needs time to open up though.

Approachable refinement…

Nose: Classic and intense blackcurrant, blackberry and cassis blend well into earthy minerals, stone and dried leaves over new leather, tobacco and cedar.
Attack: Aforementioned is on point with a bit of ripe and fruity black plum and blueberry.
Mid Palate: Refined tannins come forward to announce cocoa and cinnamon over earthy forest floor 
Finish: Long but super smooth vanilla, coffee, cedar and oak.

Conclusion: Drinking well, but a few more years needed to reveal its full potential.

Dinner with Nilton M1ll1umm, Daisy Coacci and my wife @Flemmings yesterday.
Mouthwatering! Deep ruby color, red fruits and toast on mouth, velvety, full bodied, high acidity, mineral finish.
45% Merlot, 45 CS, 8 CF and 2 PV.
16-20 months in oak barrels.
Thanks Nilton!
Rate 4.4

A nice hot spring. Hot  and humid August.  2011 is apparently a good vintage. 55% cab sav, 37% merlot, 5% cab franc and 3% petit Verdot. Beautiful aromas of black fruit, clove and plum.  On the palate it is very fruit forward, lots of black fruit, lovely acidity and nice fine medium tannins. Long finish. If you like the 2010 vintage or like your cab sav flavours then you might not like this.   Tasted it alongside a 2009 pichon baron and this is probably a poor man's 2009 pichon baron

15082022 - this producer is beginning to become my fav pessac label. Dark ruby core with very minimal brick red at its rims. Nose; rich black fruit, cassis, mint, leather & dry gravels. Palate; medium bodied, robust mid + acidity, and well balanced crispy & chewy tannins. Astounding layerings and complexity with fruit forward finish. Would love to revisit this again in 5-10 years time.

Just had this wine tonight at a steakhouse and really feel this Bordeaux is hitting its prime drinking window. From the moment the sommelier pulled the cork, the fruit, earth, tannins and acidity were in complete harmony. Gravel, lead pencil, cedar, black fruits and currants were evident on the nose. The pallet was fresh, silky, and possessed excellent length. No hints of burning alcohol on the finish. A really good wine at a reasonable Bordeaux price. I’ll be shopping for more of the Malartic.

Deep and complex, while 2012 wasn't a great vintage in the Pessac-Lèognan, this is still an exceptional wine. Old world dirt, cassis and cedar on the nose. Opulent and plush in the pallet with layers of blueberry, tart cherry, crushed gravel and leather framed in silky tannins. This is a special wine.

91 points. Vintage 2002 in magnum bottle opened in 2022.
👀The color is medium ruby.
👃The nose is offering black currant, tobacco, cigar box and forest floor.
👅The palate is offering black currant, chocolate, mocha, cigar box, smoke and tobacco.
Medium plus tannins and medium plus acid.

What a wonderful wine here, with plenty of energy and loads of fresh and ripe , sweet , earthy and spicy dark raspberries and sensations of woodsmoke, cigar wrapper,dried thyme,wet earth, used leather and cedar.
Elegant, refined and polished with resolved tannin ,a notable long lasting length and a fabulous mentholated kick!!

Chateau Malartic Lagraviere. Pessac Leognan Grand Cru Classe. 2010 vintage. Drinks at my place with friend bringing this blinded. 

Color: Medium Ruby 

Nose: Pronounced intensity. Developing. tobacco oak smoke cherry blackcurrant

Palate: Dry. Medium + tannins. Medium acidity and high alcohol. Medium + bodied with medium + finish. Flavour intensity is medium +. cassis vanilla red fruit

Quality is Very Good 

Drink now. Potential for aging.

Complex and matured aroma of ripe cherry, plum, blueberry, cassis, eucalyptus, pencil, tobacco, leather and cigar box. The taste is delicous with good balance. Fruity and spicy tones with softly tannic structure. Nice matured wine, complex. After 3 days is in good condition. Vintage 2006 was  classic and warm vintage. 93+/100.
Too young of course (in Nov 2020). Strong tannins will make this much better in a few years. There are better for the price ($70).
Good but not great.  Mid palate flat and lacking acidity.  Somewhat elegant, but without a fine texture and mouthfeel.  90/100.
Lavender leather plum. Wild mixture of aged flavors and yumminess! Will drink again!
Rather nice. Blueberry, dark cherry, bay leaf and spice in the aftertaste.
Fruity but delicate- Nice lighter red from the region.

Tried on the primeur week in bordeaux. Only points.
93-94+/100
Best sovignone from bordeaux from total wine miami.  oak cedar tobacco
At the winery with James
Balanced grand cru classe from Graves, notes of blueberry, oak, tobacco and medium tannins
Excellent when cork was pulled.  Got even better

You like
CA Chardonnay you like
This

90/100
Very good balance 
Very good potential 
Can be consumed now and further in 5;10;15;20 years
Perfect balanced and bodied wine. Taste of black currant, blackberry
More Round. Very good
oak leather blackcurrant blackberry plum cherry
Still a baby. Needs more time to reach maturity.
tobacco cassis blackberry oak allspice
Very good wine. 91
Mid- intensive nose, earthy both nose and body. Mid bitterness. 3,9
Good, want more
Well balanced. Lovely 🥰

Beauty as it should be..
 blackberry 
 leather 
 oak
Lots of layers...oak, blackberry, leather, tobacco, cassis, blackcurrant, earthy notes on the palate

It’s up there but ... For 2016, paid $60, but have had $30-$40 wines with more character to go with the bold, full-body flavor. This one just lands and stays. Doesn’t express itself with a “oh wow” profile of flavors that I’d expected with $60. Holds up to many foods though. Just wouldn’t buy a case. Nor pay triple digits in a restaurant, I assume.

Dinner time with friends in town, something new and probably best on the wine list. A nice wine with a warming bouquet of blackberry and cherry, some leather. On the palate a very interesting wine, black fruit again dominating , tabacco, earthy tones, coffee. Nice round tannins. A wine, with more time and air, probably would show even more of his power. Now looking forward to go home and open another one, which i never had ...

The 2006 Malartic Lagraviere is delicious , rich, complex and generous. The nose if full of black fruits, cassis, plum, chocolate, cigar box and vanilla, the body is round smooth and full of flavor, tannins are still a bit firm yet with a short decant the wine is ready to sing. 
The finish is long, elegant and yummy . 
My score 91, drink to 2026

A classic and solid white from Pessac-Leognan. Succulent yellow and stone fruits on the nose and palate, well-balanced with focused minerals, crisp acidity and a buoyant, layered texture from start to finish. Drinkable now but this is age worthy and will develop more complexity and tertiary characteristics over time.

After the château's second wine 'La Réserve de Malartic' we proceeded to the 'grand vin', the 2011 Grand Cru Classé Malartic-Lagravière in red, a blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 37% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 3% Petit Verdot. It's virtually impossible not to like a wine of this caliber, yet there was a touch of overripeness here, with notes of sweet, ripe cassis, blueberry jam, menthol, mocha & campfire smoke. Fortunately it showed vibrant acidity as well, teamed up with grippy tannins to add structure.

A richly modern-classed growth consulted by Michel Rolland

46 hectares are planted w/45% Merlot, 45% Cab Sauv + rest of Cab Franc & Petit Verdot on gravel & clay limestone soils
Wines aged in 70% new oaks
13.5%AbV

Double decanted 2 hrs ahead; Rhône tumbler used; deep red hue; deeply ripe cassis w/camphorated spices + mineral flint & fine oak
Richly full w/plushy mouthfeel + liquorice mid palate & ripe-sweet tannins finish

Very 50/50 B’dx blend style
Youthfully dull for my taste but well-made

Sailing (Rod Stewart) This wine takes its name and sailing boat on the label from the Earl of Malartic, who defending some French island against the English. Luckily for us he later started a winery, producing excellent reds and whites. This superb red first impressed me with a great nose of red fruit, spices and toast before serving cassis, cherries, tobacco, a bit of wood and darker red fruit on the palate. Structured, round, fat and well balanced this 05 has everything to become a 5* wine in a decade.

Bordeaux 2019 Vintage - In Bottle Tasting.

Wish I could decipher my notes on this 🤣

I did think this was rather good though. Step up from 2014, which was already doing well. Suspect this will be even better if not tasted next to the likes of Las Cases.
His was a very nice bottle I generally prefer a little longer on the tongue and more tanning’s but it was very good with my steak.

3.9

Here we have notes as tabacco, plum, black pepper, liquorice, blackberry, blackcurrant and vanilla.

Sweetness: dry
Acidity: high
Tannins: high
Alcohol: high
Body: full
Intensity: high
Finish length: long
A fantastic wine with aging potential. Tasted blind with 2 other Pessac-Léognan 2015 bottles. This was my top pick. Very aromatic with hints of oak and vanilla. I would definitely keep a few bottles.

Far too young to fully appreciate yet; the very smooth and fine tannins indicate that this wine’s best years are in the far future. The oak and vanilla, with a touch of blackberry ice cream on the nose are delightful. The palate is beautifully balanced between the pleasant acidity and tannins, with a medium-long finish. Earthy tones and leather are more prominent on the palate. Great wine.

A complex, dry, full bodied Grand Cru. Rich with tannins, a soft lingering acidity and notes of summer flowers, cedar and green pepper. Multi-layered flavours of black currant, plum, tobacco and a chalk finish.

Opened and decanted a couple of hours before tasting. Lots of dark fruit on the nose. Blackberry, plum, blueberry, dark chocolate, a bit of vanilla and leather. I could smell this for days. Medium acidity. Good amount of tannins, but in really good balance. They feel silky. I’m drinking this wine as an aperitif, but it would fare better with a rich steak, IMO.
Gorgeous & elegant flavor and color! Love it!

Very nice structure for this Bordeaux white.
Fresh with citrus notes.
93 pts
black berries, blood orange
Good, maybe even close to very good. Also a great way to re-meet white Bordeaux
A very good drink to sail away with.
Great wine.
Delicious, fruity, smooth, dry, with a nice nose
Pretty, solid, incredible, really incredible value here. Classic Pessac notes, great balance, delicious. Highly recommended. Plum, cassis, autumn leaves, leather, cedar, roasted chestnuts, chocolate.
Fragrant with black fruits and smokiness at the foreground. Full body with balanced smooth tannin and minerality. Hint of leather and pencil shaving flavour lingering. Long.
Dark dark ruby red. Savory aromas. Savory palate of oak, leather, dark berry. Strong rounded tannin balanced with nice acidity.

Tasted in October 2019 - superb wine, nez puissant, vin qui a du corps, tannins présentent mais agréable. Should have bought more.

And in May 2020 - a confinement  wine if ever there was one - simply delicious!
Fresh black cherries and blackberries. Medium body, hints of pencil lead, menthol and tobacco. Nice cigar wine that may be a bit thin for steaks or red meat.
2009 doesn’t disappoint. Sweet, jammy notes are a little overpowering on the nose, but palate is perfectly balanced
Fantastic Pessac, at the pinnacle for his age. Never disappointed with with mid-high class Grand Vru Classé!
Plush, velvety and long but with nice dry finish. Some violets. Baked earth character. Elegant but also good depth.
Always a pleasure to drink it, very long on mouth and well balanced. Was ready to drink but could be easily kept longer, acidity would then be ideal.
Intense and integrated yet youthful blackcurrant,vanilla, leather, cassis, smoke, earthy and chocolate.Long and complex.
Lovely smooth and classic wine. Oaky and plenty of berries. Sits nicely on the tongue. Reasonably dry and excellent with creamy pasta.
A bomb of vanilla on opening. Exquisite blackberries the second day. Exquisite. Black and redberries evolve. SEK 270.
Dark fruits, red fruits, currants, tobacco, dried herbs, mushrooms. Classic Bordeaux and probably at peak.
Nose has a little funk to it almost a hint of dust and smoke. Big round fruits on the palate. Nice medium finish

All hands on deck... for this Rolland wine that is OK...

A blend of 56% cabS 38 merlot 4 CF 2PV. 70% new oak for at least 15 months 

Attractive nose of bell pepper, green blackcurrant, peppery, rubbery, and oak on red fruits 

Very Chilean like 

Medium plus body with uninteresting tannin and tobacco on the finish 

Good effort 
avoid 

89pts me

F*** what a beautiful wine. Dry, complex, deep blackberry, oak, hint of earthy notes, drinkable from the moment you open the bottle, this complex wine will continue to open and develop with air. Gorgeous !

👀 clear, deep ruby

👃 clean, medium + black cherry, smoked plum, licorice, vanilla, chocolate, leather, tobacco, wet leaves, savoury, developing

👅 dry, high tannins, high acidity, medium alcohol, full body, pronounced flavours of following the nose, long finish

👉 very good. Can drink now, but has potential for further ageing

Unique bottle from the same grapes as Malartic Lagraviere, but labeled as Grand Vin De Bordeaux instead of Vin de Graves like the others. Negotiant blend. Bold notes of black cherry, raspberry,  cranberry, and oak (not American or french) . Medium body, high acidity,  dry finish. Definitely still young, but approachable at the moment. Good pairings with ribeye or Turkish chicken (non-spicy). Love the chateau and the creativity put into this blend, definitely a diamond to seek out. Well worth the price.

Super-ripe red cherry and plum. Sweet floral and spice notes, along with ripe, silky tannins. A rich, powerful wine with soft contours and striking depth. 52 % Cabernet Sauvignon, 40 % Merlot, 5 % Cabernet Franc and 3 % Petit Verdot.

2014 - 90 pts. Deep ruby red. Intense color good clarity.  Plum, raisin, jammy fruit aromas with hints of spice and old books.  As one expects for a Grand Cru, structure is balanced with med acidity and firm tannin. Not a whole lot going on for me right now, seems a little disjointed. Hard to justify the cost of this over their second wine, which is a fantastic QPR at $20-$25.

gives off strong notes of blackberry, smashed strawberry enhanced by light spicy and mainly peppery notes. On the palate, this Pessac-Leognan is very pleasant on tannins and is full-bodied. The finish, slightly toasted, is vibrant. This is a sappy wine.

Château Malartic-Lagravière, Pessac-Léognan, Bordeaux.

She’s ready!  8/8/2020 yet she will only improve with age.  Such a beautiful, rich, cherry red color...  fresh, wet berries and graphite on the nose, good structure and acidity.  Perhaps a bit too much acidity for my taste but it is so well balanced and such a pleasurable, lingering finish that the bite is forgiven.

Concentrated and spicy, this is full of generous tannins and delicious black plum and vanilla. Spice goes with a toasty, wood aging flavours that enhance the opulent texture of this delicious, young wine. Needs time.

Lovely drop and 2009 vintage is great.

Deep garnet Colour clean wine with a slight deposit. 

Medium alcohol, medium (+) body, dry, medium (+) tannin and medium acidity.

Medium finish but lovely experience.

Blend of CS, Merlot, CF and PV (52/40/5/3) from Pessac-Léognan with 18m ageing in FO barrels (~65% new).

On the palate dry, high acidity, alcohol well integrated, med. body, med+ fine tannins, med. flavor intensity, med+ finish, sour cherry, charcoal, barrel and mineral taste.

Still youthful⤵️

Not an ideal vintage in Bordeaux with a disappointing summer and a hot fall resulting in pretty plump and ripe fruit characters. Lots of wine making influence on this one, presumably trying to create the house style. Lots of oak, licorice, nutmeg, vanilla bean. Fruit is mostly black cherry, blackberry, plum and some dried cassis. Tannins are elevated but reasonably fine. Aggressive acidity, potentially some acidification happened in the winery to make up for the longer hang time?

An underrated 2011 vintage, partially living in the shadows of the legendary '09 and '10 vintages.

55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 37% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc, 3% Petit Verdot, 20 months in oak, 60% new.

Appearance: deep ruby

Nose: blackcurrant, blackcurrant leaves, herbaceous notes, plum

Palate: tannins are still very chewy and gripping. Merlot is much needed to even it out but it makes the wine a bit too plummy. 

Very high acidity, medium [+] finish

Classic Bordeaux with still grip and a hint of acidity. Deep ruby color, viscosity, aromatic with black fruits, leather and tobacco. Round tannins, dry palate with medium to full body. Flavors of black fruits, smoke and oak. Long finish.

Will NOT buy again. Tart, high acidity and strong tannins interfered with the flavor of the wine.  They forgot to add some dark fruit flavors and instead the leather and tobacco just add to a wine that very few would like.  I can’t believe it’s so highly rated. Oh well.

Medium bodied. Garnet colour with nose of dark cherries, earth and light smoke. Super silky in the mouth with sweets notes of plums and cassis.Medium tannins and slightly higher acidity. A must have if you like wines on the slightly sweeter side.

🍇 Another lowly rated vintage that produced some outstanding wines great for drinking today. This producer is frequently a top buy for value in Pessac.

👁 Mid purple

👃 Glorious out the traps with lashings of ripe dark fruit almost jammy including plums, damson, cassis - some smokey leather bbq action and a dash of sweet cedar oak.

Good balance, high everything’s the full AATB. No one could possibly buy this and be anything but delighted. Délectable finish.

Nose of minerals and bitter citrus (litter box). Then white flowers. Somewhat reminiscent of a heavy Sancerre. Rather full and rich. Not very acidic but still somewhat sour.   Like an imaginary mix between a New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc and a Meursault? Certainly well made, but not my kind of white. 91-94p.

Deep crimson.  Mature nose of ripe berries, herbs, with hint of pinewood.  Cassis, floral bouquet, marshland.  I had this wine not too long ago and decided to open another bottle (actually my last one) because I believe it has peaked and will unlikely improve further.  Drinking very well now, smooth and well balanced.  A gentleman wine, just like what a traditional Bordeaux should be.  8 June 2016.

3,9 SUAVE. Another pessac-leognan blend. The wine has a very compelling and inviting nose of black fruit, cocoa and light smoke. The palate is soft round with a concentration and richness in ripe fruit as well as some savory notes. Very balanced in its acidity/tannins equilibrium. Overall worth is price tag. Once again... tasting a good year is the next step.

Good now and had potential to get so much better.  Cedar, prune, leather and chocolate nose.  Well integrated medium + tannins with vanilla, toast, black currant and chocolate flavours.  Long finish that leaves you wanting more.

Staying up way past beddy-byes to watch the US Open and I’ve been meaning to test drive this for a while.

Dry, grippy and ingratiating - oodles of Cabernet Franc je ne sais quoi complementing the merlot base. A jolly old affair indeed.

Of the 2015 Bordeaux’s I have had the pleasure of tasting already - almost straight out the cask - this is the most soft and ‘feminine’ of the lot. Still very intense and rich, but with softer tannin and a more refined fruit. As for all of the 2015 so far - very very good!

Dark cherries, blackcurrant, green notes (ripe capsicum), woody, cassis, baking spices, vanilla and hints of bay leaves

Medium body, medium-low acidity, fine tannins. Finishing with almond skin and apricot skin. Punchy yet lightweight.

Decant for about 45 mins

Pairs beautifully with char-grilled satay, including the peanut sauce and also quite decently with BBQ chicken wings

Ruby red with a nice concentration and very limiting evolution. Exciting nose of cassis, boysenberries and blackberries, a hint of vanilla and wood. Strong but elegant attack. Mouth filling and beautiful length.

Delish!  Clear deep ruby with a medium + nose of green peppers black currant, wet leaves, cedar, smoke, leather and secondary dark cherry and blackberry.  Medium intensity and slightly restrained on the palate with a medium plus finish.  Medium plus alcohol and finessed smooth tannins.  The tannins and alcohol are in perfect balance now.  Drink now, but can hold and develop for longer.

Decanted 1.5 hours before drinking, should have stood the bottle up the day before to get the sediment to the bottom but nothing too bad! Very smooth, medium tannins, slightly boozy as you’d expect. Delish

The last bottle from my suitcase I brought from France last year 😊 What a fantastic wine! Full plate of black fruits, spices and tobacco on nose. Excellently balanced with soft tannins, moderate acidity and harmonious flavors. The finish is changing from sweetness with the first sip to spicy notes at the bottom of the bottle. Still young and has a great potential for aging.

What fantastic wine. Prominent notes of cassis, dark fruits, smoke, and vanilla. With moderate acidity I think this wine is extremely representative of its terroir. I think this bottle will fare even better after another 3 years in the bottle.

Definitely edging towards a 4.5. Lovely rounded body. Full of Cab Franc, evident because Cab Franc smells like green beans to me! Harmoniously balanced acidity and aged in old oak to lend it a velvety softness that is subtle yet tangible. Long finish, fine tannins. Very enjoyable

2nd time this month and kicks ass AGAIN! Leather, smoke, earth, black truffle and DARK fruit on the nose (& perhaps a tiny mint thing). For me, this is ready to rock! It's got a perfect balance of concentration, polished, sweet tannins, dark fruit acidity and that beautiful dark matter of smoke, leather, earth, minerality with some black truffle thrown in for good measure. Well structured, plush & thick, this '05's best days could still be ahead, but I'm not waiting to find out! I'm drinking now - 2020!

🎅🏻Santa secret!!!!! 🎅🏻 my dears, was so glad to see this label! Ripe  mature pessac leognan, first a big thank! Complex nose, classic cold aromatic, cherry, grenade, blood orange, blond tobacco, smoked speck, dust, tea touch!!!! 
I’ve said , complex... med bodied, such a juice, first wave hits you and then, multilayered, fruits, tea, pollen, nuts, sweet tannins, endless. Merci for this experience! 😱🌹

Quite mature, already with tertiary flavours of animal farm and leather. Still with some fresh berries, cherries, and jam. Medium body, some acid and firm tannic texture. Long and dry finish with a touch of blackcurrant.
Smooth and delicious!

Needs a little time to open but once it’s there it’s a very well balanced delicate white Bordeaux Sauvignon Blanc-semillon blend: light, fresh, creamy, subtle fruits and balanced acidity. Doesn’t hold up too well to richer food pairings though.

4.0 deep red color, no real signs of aging. Aromas of ripe forest fruit, plum, chocolate, cassis. On the palate rich and concentrated, silky with lots of fruit and good freshness. Velvet type tannines. Complex wine, but in aftertaste a bit alcoholic. This 2009 I believe is still quite young, will be interesting to see how the wine will evolve. Opened 2 hours before drinking and decanted before serving.

9.0 points; after 3 hours decanting this wine changes in a very fine and elegant claret. Medium alcohol, medium soft an fine ripe tanins, medium length and medium boddied. Good balance and some  complexity. Very good to outstanding, can still have some years, but decanting is a must! 🍷🍷👍👍😘🙏🥈

Early entering its prime now in ‘19. WA-94 at the price of less than $50, a true value-for-money grand cru classe. According to a vineyard representative, it’s their market position to allow people to enjoy good wine at affordable price. Admirable!

Aromas of black fruits, spices, oak. On the palate, silky creamy kind of meaty blood felted, this is the first time I felt it like meaty.
I drank this half bottle for like 9 hours and stills good at the end 😁👍🥂
hkd 258 (0.375)

Drinking beautifully now. There is still a heady balance between fruit and structure, but the tannins are quite muted and allow the black fruits and charcoal of the Cabernet to play. The finish is gently herbal but not especially long. A lovely example of how an “approachable” vintage reaches an optimum point at which it should be approached. Perfect with rack of lamb and the cheeseboard.

Beautiful Bordeaux wine still young powerful but with a fantastic finesse 
Red fruit well mix it with blueberry and black fruits notes all the notes that come from a new barrique vanilla toast wood in the palate is powerful with a long finish very very good
Spot-on in a blind tasting 😅👍🏼🔝

This Pessac-Léognan surprises me again. On the nose, a bouquet of fine, sweet berry fruits. In the mouth, a wonderful taste sensation of fine, complex red fruit accentuated tertiary flavours. Still held at breath by its delicate palpable fruit acidity. A beautiful experience, unfortunately the last of its kind. At that time, together with friends, I had imported this wine directly from the Chateau via a transport company. The first delivery fell by the wayside due to a fire. An old interesting story.

Inky purple, cherry colour. Nose of floral, red fruits, graphite, tobacco, minerals.  Beautiful balance medium body wine with soft, subtle acidity. Tannins are mild, refine. Beautiful finish of charcoal, tar, minerals. Ready to drink although 1-1.5 hour of decanting would improve the wine.
Nice body and oak

Vancouver Session #4
Friday 13th Freestyle Wine #7

Bordeaux Blanc, can't say I've had too much of this. The words that were thrown around a lot that night was "buttered popcorn"! 

Unfortunately, I did not manage to stay till then end of the session when the Reds started flowing. It was a great way to end the night here and I thank all I've met and will remember Vancouver fondly.

As good as I remember! The 05’ has plenty of tannin and cellar time left (in 2017).

Bouquet of plum, chocolate, cedar, and spices. Lush palate - full bodied and still dry. Benefits from a bit from decanting, opening up nicely.

This is fantastic value from the left bank, don’t miss it!

Unarguably a very good pessac absolutely in the peak window I would say but the roteboeuf is a tough act to follow despite ‘obviously’ feeling more youthful and grippy. Good combination of black and red primary fruit, with nice tertiary notes vanilla and spice, medium acidity and tannin. Does everything really well but just doesn’t attempt to pull on the heart strings. A wine you could serve up and all would enjoy without too much comment. Solid.

Quite concentrated nose evokes hot year. On the palete drives back to classic blackcurrant, red currant, mint quality. Despite its age and signs of tertiary tobacco, leather, coffee hints, still not completely matured. Its proves also stone fruit freshness and grainy tannins through. Fine plum, cinnamon flavours along balanced and upright character. Even not so complex than 05 or 2000 vintages, long, savoury finish also on the second day. Drink now and through 2025. From tricky vint. really succes. 92+/100.

Medium intensity dark ruby robe

Liquorice, plum, cassis in the nose. Intense for 16 years old 

Medium acidity, balanced tannins. Vanilla, leather on top of licorice and jammy dark fruits. Well balanced, medium bodied, long finish. To drink now

5/19: another great Malertic Lagraviere! Tasted the 2009 not so long ago. The 09 clearly needs more time, this 2010 even more. 09 more fruit, 10 more freshness, hints of pepper. Not sure which one is better, 10 seems more structured and may become a greater wine in time. Drink young, 09 is easier.
1/22: PnP and drank over 6h. This is still hard to drink, lots of tannins. Although there was some development, it just did not really open. Not sure if it is just this bottle. Next try in 3 to 5 yrs.

Soft nose... Plumbs... Some cedar.  Taste- Good fruit,  barn wood..dry,  tannins well integrated.   Good balance with solid 15 second finish.. .. VERY well aged at nearly a decade.  Surprising.... Certainly peaked... Drink now or hold for 2 more years.  91 pts,  better nose would b 92.  $40-50 qpr.  One bottle left.

4.2. Hits on all the notes. Blackberry, cassis mixed with menthol and mint. Some green bell pepper. Dusty tannins with subtle grip mixed with a perfect amount of acidity. Well balanced wine. Perfect body and weight

My first but not last I hope. 
Needed a long time in the decanter before it opened up. 
But then it gave a way red berries, blueberry, plums and figs. 
The mouthfeel was pleasant with flavors from the nose and some spiced black fruits. Long aftertaste.

WSET Level 2, #8 afternoon session.  And on to the Cabernets!  Lovely deep ruby in the glass with so much nice dark fruit aromas on the nose along with leather and spices.  Full bodied, medium + acidity and nice balanced tannins.  Yum!
Dry, earth, plums, vanilla
Not my favorite.
Wait another 10+ years
Leather, plum, violet
Slightly flat with hints of vanilla and berries.
Strong nose of red fruit jam with a hint leather. Front notes of red berries, with a dark chocolate finish. A wee bit more tannic than other reds I've tried from the appellation.
Wow. Citrus and fruity by dry. Delicious
Vanilla, honey dew, slight oak.  White Bordeaux isn't my favorite but very enjoyable.
Still young but opened nicely. Good fruit, earthy, had with Duck in a French restaurant, nice pair with the duck.
Typical french white wine from Bordeaux, slightly to shallow for me but good for Isabel
One of the best whites I have ever had.  Crisp and clean with subtle hints of pear and lemon.
Simply Delicious
Terrific
4.3 tasted again, pear, peaches, good acidity and mineral. Supple delicious Bordeaux
Excellent.
Bones Sean Sarah
4.3 A complex wine👌🍷
