Excellent !
Really delicious. Crisp but not sharp. Minerality with a bit of peach. Perfectly dry.
Super
4.3 stars
Not worth the money. WSET group tasting 9/8/2021
Lots of red ripe fruit, full bodied.
Ripe but so easy to drink
Medium body, high acidity, buttery but a bit a short finish.
Dark fruit and earthiness on nose and palate. Nice acidity with a a bit of spice leading to a slightly bitter finish. Pair with Sausage Stuffed Mushrooms. 86 Points.
Full bodied, closed. Needs time. After a few days it gives notes of cocoa, ripe sweet cherries and cassis. Firm tannins, good consentration and length.
Need time... Harsh tannins on the palate. Nose of black cherry, blackberry, sandal wood, forrest floor. Let's pull the cork on another one of those in 5 years time.
Wholesome vanilla and yellow fruits greet the nose. Ample, round, and satisfying palate with prominent minerals. Nicely paired with seabass-stuffed canneloni.
Tasted alongside 19 Bordeaux 2011 vintage grand cru classe. Classic vintage that is suitable for early consumption.Soft but with depth. Drink now or hold. 88 points

Deep, dark, almost black. Medium viscosity.

Attractive, but small nose of dust, earth, soil, Merlot and Cabernet franc. 

Medium body, tannic. Identifiably Graves.

Very complex nose - Muscat, a little cinamon, anais and cloves (Clous de girofles). Some cassis aswell!
A little spicy in the moth but all in all very balanced with a medium plus finish. 
Absolutely love it!

Cassis, oak and red fruit on nose. Off dry (can feel mild sweetness on top of tongue), med+ youthful acidity slightly like Beaujolais, followed by coarse tannin with leather and charcoal. Overall impression is bold.
4.1 Nose of cherry.
This is an outstanding wine. Complex earthy flavours with crisp citrus and orchard fruit flavors. Very nicely balanced easy to enjoy.
Rating - 4.2
A highly underrated Bordeaux white. Peaches and vanilla get subtlety cut by the essence of lemon. Delicious
Nice caliber, full bodied wine. Very likeable wine. mushroom vibes.
very complex wine with beautiful mineral finish, 50% of new barrique notable

see: cherry purple. 
swirl:slow tears
smell:minty. citrus. blueberries 
sip: blueberries. tobacco. 
swallow: medium finish
Supple already, dark fruit, toast oak, quite full for a BDX. Fruit lasts and lasts. Lovely.

A half bottle 
Silky palate of cassis, plum, blackberry, cigar box, vanilla, clove, grilled bell pepper… 
Quite long finish

Bold white, ripe fruit, dry but refreshing, pleasing palette golden and viscous 

backroom solo - versus blanc de lynch bages
Big notes of fig, Cassis, and boysenberry. This was a pleasant surprise as it still had plenty of life left in it.
Excellent rich white Bordeaux
Nice aromas with some rose and perfume, and it's freshness and some vegetal notes are felt on the palate too. Nice tannins.
Rich, opulent, full bodied, smooth tannins, present wood but is doesn't disturb. A heavy weight 2009.
What a cracker, strong and robust.
Very good year. Not at the level of 2010 but good cellar wine. Drinkable from now until 2024 could be a right prediction
Lovely blackcurrant and cassis, a touch of oak on the finish. Another good example that 2011 wines can really shine
Very balanced, smooth tannins, complex fruit flavours
This Bordeaux Blanc isn't bad to go with Japanese omakase as a start. Though I'm not sure about its longevity.

Herbal, spices and mushroom. Strong aroma long aftertaste. Its own character. Would fit those of you who are not big fans if acidity
high tannins. very stony. but still very aromatic! excellent wine. (wine buff @ sing kee wanchai)
Beautiful white from pessac. Aromatic with a beautiful structure. Well done wine and new expression of bordeaux
Tried one of the 2013 bottles so I knew what I was getting into and it didn’t miss a beat. Solid recommend.
Damn 5 stars! Rich explosion of red fruit greets the nose, and while on palate evolves gently into fine earthy notes
Nice Bordeaux. Nose of black currant, cheese and some leather. Good structure in taste of tannins. Early in the window
Needs about 30 minutes to open up, but after that its initial tannic roughness dissolves into a blackcurrant nectar!
Simply fabulous: 10 years of waiting is well worth it. Bought it directly from the producer in Bordeaux 7 years ago.
This was an anniversary wine. Perfect for a special occasion!  Absolutely delicious.  Earthy taste, lasting finish. A+
Out of my comfort zone but excellent! Bigger than I expected, and excellent finish. Lots of mature, red fruit.
Black berries, leather, cedar, graphite, barnyard. Medium bodied, medium tannins, good balance. No excitement, but Good.
A bit disappointed.
Well balanced red wine.
Long finish, dark fruit, leather able to drink now but suitable for ageing
Dry, with a heavy black currant flavour and cigar smell.

Fresh... mineral... lemon... long lasting mouth...
Great vine , one of the best as I try
Wow. So wonderfully complex and jammy, but with a balanced Oakey afterbirth. Such a great wine.
tobacco oak leather cedar minerals earthy pepper savory yeast grapefruit lavender prune

Fruity, red fruits, vanilla. High tannins, high acidity.
Deep red colour, complex aroma of berries and cedar, velvety on the palate with richness in prune, tobacco, leather and wet forest floor,  long finish with an eloquent aftertaste
3.9⭐ Mid garnet in colour with a nose of oak vanilla and cigar box.  Medium bodied  dry with grippy tannins and high acidity. Flavours of raspberry and plum quite a short finish.

Well known for its approachable white wines, malartic-lagravière deserves its name gravière may be translated as sand quarry.
Nose is a bit shy, but palate denotes melted tannins and fine structure.
Dark crimson color. Warm inviting aromas and a dark fruit bouquet.  Ripe plum, cherry flavors with a hint of maduro cigar north eastern Esteli.  Very soft silky tannins, yet lots of body.
Dark, intense, less expressive and distanced. Blackberry and some bell pepper. Ready to drink now.
This one is packed with all the ingredients requested for a great Bordeaux curry.  Time will select the best pieces and take care of them. Big, young and generous wine. Not my cup of tea but nice.
Primeur tasting elderflower in nose high acidity strong oak
SMA Dinner. Expectations wise, this would be a somewhat less exceptional 1990 with the fruit seemingly less giving than the structure..... Is it a dumb phase or jus past it?
Love that Smellion nose, good Blanc and Smellion balance
Very full and rich body, complexity, smoke and woody notes, tobacco.
Very good currant flavor with hints of chocolate and tobacco. Good nose and good finish
Great

"Black(fruit) excellence, opulence, decadence. Tuxes next to the President". Regal wine, beautifully complex and balanced.

Elegant Pessac-Leognan wine. Sophisticated stylistically, delivered with simplicity, medium bodied. This wine offers notes of blackberries and black currants, layered with cherry. This wine is dry and oaky, vanilla tones, with round tannins, which provide noticeable and impressive length in each sip.
Surprising lighter side Bordeaux. Excellent balance and structure but expected a little more depth. Excellent quality for price. Drinking very well now.

Great value for money. Traditional Bordeaux style with subtle nose, dry opening and balanced finish. 

Great to find a well aged at a reasonable price.
Nothing special
nice structure..balanced with deep fruit
Tight, youthful, ripe

Well Balanced, complex! Good wine  oak cassis tobacco vanilla

Medium body. Earthy and nice. Smooth tannins and medium finish. It is ready for drink. (12-2016)
Medium nose when just open, medium body but a bit of lead after taste

The best of the soirée. Very long in mouth and rich and complex ....what an amazing wine

Elegant polished with mature fruit and soft tannins. Deep color and long finish. Fantastic bouquet

I think my first Pessac-Leogan and it’s ok. Looked the part, ruby red Bordeaux and had the earthy nose of berries and stewed dark fruits, prunes even! Tastes alright, but possibly a little too sour and acidic for my preferences. Will revert in an hour after it’s opened up a bit, however may have also had a martini by then. I’m back and it’s better. Interestingly I’m having spicy food and the acidity is working really well, food enhances this one I feel. Working well with the chillis....

Very funky nose  that smelled like a wet barn. Do you want to dive in a drink something that smells like a wet animal ? I try, try, try, to like these type of red bordeaux , but simply not my taste. I find supertuscans to be more enjoyable at this price range. Very earthy. Not for me.
Very good berry flavour. If you’re into dark, rich fruits with liquorice, this one is it. Great value and I trust this will taste even better with a little more time.
Great value for a 2015 left bank Bordeaux. Bold and dark fruit, with smoke/tobacco from the oak. Overall balanced body, good amount of tannin. Perfect for food pairing.

Blackcurrant, blueberries, cloves, smoke, tobacco leaf and a creamy, almost sweet perfumy scent. Medium(+) to high tannins, medium to medium(+) acidity and body, sweet-creamy dark fruit palate, cassis, licorice and a long, powdery finish.

Ruby garnet with a good rim. 

Smoke, leather, tobacco, sour plum, raspberry, grass, herbs

Spice, dry and fruity, full bodied, good acid, mid smooth tannin, and short length,.  Would expect longer.

Enjoyed the restraint of this.  Clearly old world in its approach with great balance.  Cassis and blackberry fruit.  Mint, minerals, smoke and vanilla.  Tannins are well integrated.  Acid is medium plus and the finish is long.  Very nice earthy cab.

Nice Pessac-Leognan quality wine. Dark berries, tobacco, liguorice and leather on nose. A bit grippy acidity and athletic mouthdrying tannins with blackberries on palate. Medium plus bodied and quite strong spicy complex finish. Too young even with two hours aeration to drink but benefits surely much longer cellaring. Today just 3,5 stars but possibility to much higher stars. Paired with roasted salmon and vegetables; maybe vinerys famous white would have been better paring.

20220401 - 2010 Malartic Lagraviere. Grand Cru Classe De Graves. France. 
2 hr aeration. Strong aroma with a hint of smoke n leather on nose. Bold. Some dark together with busting abundances of ripe fruits. V little tannin, slight acidic, not too sweet, good smooth. Balance, neat finish. 
👍👍👍👍

20220403 - With just 1 ish hr aeration n the right temperature 2nd bottle tasted even better. More structured, balanced n long finish. 👍👍👍👍😁

Quite enjoyable now. Dark color, light but intense perfume of red fruit (Raspberries). Nearly no spices like you would expect from such a Cru classé. Same appearance in the mouth. Not bad but definitely below expectations. Light aftertaste of red fruit. No spice at all… 🤷🏼‍♂️

A bit brownish with a medium body. It has passed it's peak, but still elegant. In nose, very herbal, tobacco, red cherry, spices and a little hawthorn. Good acidity, red cherries, tobacco, herbs and minerals on palate. Very soft tannin with a medium finish.

No decanting need. Dark fruits, black cherry, with cedar & tobacco on the
nose. Sweet ripe accessible fruit dominate the palate, making it super approachable to drink. However this is rather a simple wine, not much in structure or finish.
The fruits are fading quickly too. Drink up !

Compared to tasting in April 16 ‘20, this btl is more reticent but after an hour of opening came around with the telltale lemon curd and lime flavors that are endearing. I have a feeling the wine may have just started to turn for next stage of development because it has the acidity for staying power. Witness the long lingering finish with definite sour twang. Anyone else has tried this wine to compare notes? 90pts

Discreet nose. Evolved. Fig, walnut, griotte, light tobacco, chocolate, spice on the nose. Lacks power. A bit confit orange in the mouth, sour, and red fruits (strawberry, red cherry). On the decline probably after 26 years.

Dark berries, plum, and oak, along with notes of earth and licorice. Spicy start and dry start, but it turns into good fruitness. Full bodied and with good length, with quite sharp tannins. This wine is so closed, both on smell and taste. This could be a real pleasure, but not within the next 7-10 years at least, and it could easily be stored for 15 or more years.

The 2009 Malartic-Lagraviere is an outstanding and extremely enjoyable wine. Inky purple tinged colour release a delightful pronounced aroma of dry mint, anise and dark berries. Dry, mild acids and subtle tannins create a complex but well balanced structure to deliver a wonderful flavour of blackberries and cassis with a long finish that you wish never end.

This is an outstanding wine.
